In a second pie pan or shallow bowl beat egg white. Dip fish in egg white and then into flour mixture, coating well and shaking off excess. Heat oil in skillet over medium high heat. Saute fish for 3 minutes and then flip fish and saute for 5 minutes of other side or until fish is done. ; name: salad with lemonade honey dressing ; ingredients: frozen lemonade concentrate, honey, poppy seed, red seedless grapes, watermelon, nectarines, pears ; preparation:

name: irish carrot parsnip mash ; ingredients: carrots, sugar, parsnips, butter, salt, pepper, fresh parsley ; preparation:Boil the carrots in a little lightly salted water with a pinch of sugar in it, until soft and drain. Boil the parsnips separately in lightly salted water until soft and drain. Marsh or puree them together. Add the butter. Season and sprinkle with the parsley. Serve. ; name: durkee onion ring and mushroom canapes ; ingredients: mayonnaise, parmesan cheese, mushroom stems and pieces, french fried onion rings, miniature party rye rounds ; preparation:Toast party rye on both sides under broiler. In a bowl, stir together mayonnaise, parmesan, mushrooms, and onion rings. Spread on toasted party rye. Place on baking sheet on lowest rack in oven. Broil until browned and bubbly. ; name: roasted tomato and basil relish ; ingredients: plum tomato, fresh basil, parmesan cheese, olive oil, garlic, dry crushed red pepper ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350f. Combine all ingredients in 1-quart casserole. Bake until tomatoes are soft, about 30 minutes. Season to taste. Cool to room temperature before serving. ; name: william beaudot s sourdough biscuits ; ingredients: sourdough starter, flour, salt, baking soda, canola oil ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350. In bowl, combine all ingredients. Mix to fine consistency. Drop onto ungreased cookie sheets in heaping tablespoon-size dollops or larger, if desired. Bake 10 to 15 minutes, until tops are light golden. ; name: poached whole chicken crock pot ; ingredients: whole chickens, thyme, rosemary, sage, parsley, salt, carrots, onion, celery, dry white wine ; preparation:Rub herbs and salt into cavity of chicken. Put vegetables in slow cooker. Truss chicken compactly and place in slow cooker. Add wine. Cover and cook on low 6-8 hours or on high for 4 hours. Serve hot with noodles or chill and slice. ; name: coffee walnut pie ; ingredients: light brown sugar, butter, sugar, eggs, salt, heavy cream, strong coffee, walnuts, vanilla, unbaked pastry shells ; preparation:Cream brown sugar and butter until well blended. Add sugar and mix well. Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each. Add salt, cream and coffee and mix well. Cook over boiling water, stirring for 5 minutes. Remove from water and stir in 1 cup walnuts and vanilla. Pour into pastry shell. Bake at 350f for 1 hour. Scatter broken walnuts on top and bake 5 minutes more. Cool. ; name: rack of lamb with lemon ; ingredients: racks of lamb, garlic cloves, lemon zest, lemon juice, rosemary, fresh ground black pepper, olive oil ; preparation:Combine garlic rosemary lemon zest and juice and olive oil pour over the racks and marinate in the refrigerator for at lest one hrs. Place the lamb on the rack of a shallow roasting pan with bones facing up. Season with a few grindings of fresh pepper. Place into a 475f oven for 10mins. Reduce the heat to 400f turn the rack and continue cooking until meat is. ; name: triple choc cookies ; ingredients: plain flour, self raising flour, cocoa, brown sugar, dark chocolate, unsalted butter, eggs, milk chocolate chips, white chocolate chips ; preparation:

name: it s almost summer bbq chicken with salsa ; ingredients: chicken stock, cornflour, dijon mustard, chicken, onion, red capsicum, green capsicum, tomatoes ; preparation:In a saucepan mix chicken stock, cornflour and dijon mustard. Reduce over low heat. Cool the sauce and divide into two equal quantities. Reserve one for a dressing. With the other half of the sauce add chicken pieces and marinate overnight. Next day placed chicken on skewer sticks then discard left over marinate. Pre-heat barbecue and set aside chicken until you finished making the salsa. In a medium bowl add diced onions, diced capsicums and diced tomatoes, mix well with the reserved dressing. Bbq chicken until golden brown, then serve with salsa and enjoy. ; name: oregon blueberry pie ; ingredients: blueberries, sugar, cornstarch, lemon juice, butter, double crust pie crusts ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400 degrees fahrenheit. Drain the berries and reserve the syrup from one can. Stir the syrup in to the combined mixture of the cornstarch and half of the sugar. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly until thickened. Remove from heat. Gently stir in remaining sugar, blueberries, and lemon juice. Let stand while preparing pastry. Line a 9-inch pie pan with pastry and fill with the filling. Dot with butter or margarine. Adjust top crust on pie, cuttin slits for the steam to escape, and seal. I recommend adding some sugar over the top after sealing. Bake for 30 minutes or until filling is bubbly and crust is brown. ; name: honey kissed chocolate drops ; ingredients: honey, unsalted butter, all-purpose flour, unsweetened baking cocoa, baking soda, candy sprinkles, milk chocolate kisses ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350. Line cookie sheets with parchment paper or coat with nonstick spray. In a medium bowl, cream honey and butter until light and fluffy. In another bowl, combine flour, cocoa and baking soda. Beat dry ingredients into honey-butter mixture. Place non-pariels or jimmys in another bowl. Scoop dough and shape into 1-inch balls, then gently roll in candies to coat. Place balls on prepared cookie sheet and gently press one chocolate kiss into center of each cookie. Bake 10 minutes or until golden brown. Remove from cookie sheet and cool on rack. ; name: katrina s hot cocoa ; ingredients: hot chocolate powder, brown sugar, cinnamon, milk, boiling water, chocolate syrup ; preparation:Boil the water in a kettle. Put the other ingredients in a cup. Then pour the water into the cup. Then carefully add a decent amount of chocolate syrup. Stir thoroughly. ; name: italian scalloped potatoes ; ingredients: potatoes, onion, mozzarella cheese, parmesan cheese, cream of mushroom soup, milk, italian seasoning, garlic ; preparation:In greased cassarole arrange half the potatoes, onions, mozzerella and parmesean cheese. Repeat the layers. In a small bowl, combine soup, milk, seasoning and garlic. Pour over the layered potatoes and cheese. Cover and bake at 400 f or 200 c for 1 hour. Uncover and bake 10 more minutes or until potatoes are tender. ; name: chicken rice bake ; ingredients: long grain rice, condensed cream of celery soup, water, chicken pieces, scallion, longhorn cheese ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Sprinkle rice over bottom of a 13- x 9-inch baking dish. Combine soup and water. Pour carefully over the rice. Lay the chicken pieces over the rice without overlapping. Sprinkle the sliced scallions and grated cheese over the top. Cover dish with foil. Bake in preheated oven 45 minutes. Uncover and bake 15 minutes longer. ; name: sticky cucumber and peanut dipping sauce ; ingredients: rice vinegar, sugar, salt, cucumber, red onion, jalapeno pepper, garlic clove, roasted peanuts, fresh cilantro ; preparation:Place the vinegar, sugar, and salt in a medium saucepan and heat, stirring until the sugar has completely dissolved. Boil for around 6-7 minutes or until a thin syrup has formed. Squeeze the grated cucumber to remove most of the liquid. When the syrup has cooled, add the cucumber, red onion, jalepeno, garlic, peanuts and cilantro. Mix together thoroughly. Serve at room temperature with fried or boiled shrimp, coconut shrimp, egg rolls, meat sate etc. ; name: skinny fries ; ingredients: baking potatoes, oil, cajun seasoning, salt and pepper ; preparation:

name: cream of cauliflower and cheddar soup ; ingredients: butter, onion, cauliflower, condensed chicken broth, all-purpose flour, milk, cheddar cheese, pepper, parsley, crouton ; preparation:Melt butter in large saucepan, saute onion until tender. Stir in cauliflower and chicken broth. Cover, reduce heat and simmer 1215 minutes or until cauliflower is tender. Combine flour and milk. Add to saucepan. Cook and stir over medium heat until mixture boils and thickens. Remove from heat. Add cheese and stir until melted. Add pepper and parsley to taste. Serve with croutons. ; name: sweet potato and coriander mash ; ingredients: sweet potato, garlic clove, fresh coriander, creme fraiche, salt & freshly ground black pepper ; preparation:Bring a large pan of lightly salted water to the boil. Peel and cube the potatoes and add to the pan with the garlic. Return to the boil and simmer for 15-20 minutes until tender. Add the coriander and cook for 10 seconds. Drain well, then return to the pan. Set the pan over a gentle flame and stir with a wooden spoon for 1-2 minutes to evaporate any excess water, but be careful not to let the potatoes catch and burn on the bottom of the pan. Turn off the heat and mash well. Add the creme fraiche and some salt and pepper and mash together until smooth and creamy. Serve warm. ; name: ultimate fudgy brownies ; ingredients: bittersweet chocolate, unsweetened chocolate, unsalted butter, dutch-processed cocoa powder, sugar, eggs, vanilla extract, salt, all-purpose flour ; preparation:Adjust oven rack to middle position and heat oven to 350f line 8-inch square pan with foil. Coat lightly with vegetable oil spray. Melt the chocolates, butter, and cocoa in the microwave, stirring often 1 to 3 minutes. Let the mixture cool slightly. Whisk the sugar, eggs, vanilla and salt together in a large bowl until combined about 15 seconds. Whisk in the melted chocolate mixture until smooth. Stir in the flour until no streaks remain. Scrape the batter into the prepared pan and smooth the top. Bake until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out with just a few crumbs attached, 35 to 40 minutes. Let cool completely on a wire rack to room temperature, about 2 hours, before removing the brownies from the pan using the foil and cutting into squares. ; name: stuffed shell pierogies ; ingredients: potatoes, cheddar cheese, salt, pepper, onions, butter, jumbo pasta shells ; preparation:Cooks potatoes until soft, drain. Add cheese, salt & pepper and mash until smooth. Melt margarine or butter in large skillet. Add onions and cook 10 to 15 minutes until tender but not browned. Spread half the onions over the bottom of a 13x9 baking dish. Stuff each shell with heaping tablespoon of the potato mixture, close edges. Arrange in single layer over onions, spread remaining onions on top. Bake at 350 degrees uncovered 15 to 20 minutes or until heated through. ; name: corn muffins with sweet red peppers ; ingredients: all-purpose flour, yellow cornmeal, sugar, baking powder, salt, pepper, buttermilk, vegetable oil, egg, sweet red pepper ; preparation:In large bowl, combine flour, cornmeal, sugar, baking powder, salt and pepper. In small bowl, beat together buttermilk, oil and egg, stir into dry ingredients just until moistened. Stir in red pepper. Spoon batter into well greased or paper lined muffin cups, filling each two thirds full. Bake in 425f degree oven for 15 minutes or until tester inserted in centre comes out clean. Or bake in 8 inch square baking pan in 425f degree oven for 20 minutes or until firm to the touch. Cut into squares to serve. ; name: simple side dish with red skinned potatoes ; ingredients: red potatoes, butter, seasoning salt, pepper ; preparation:Clean and cube redskins into small cubes and put in microwave safe dish that can be covered. Dot with butter and then, cover and microwave on high for 5 minutes. Add seasoned salt and pepper and mix to blend. Cover and return to microwave for five minutes. Then let rest for 8-10 minutes, check to see that potatoes tender. If not then microwave for 2 more minutes and then rest for 5 minutes. This is such a easy and fast dish to cook while meat is cooking on the grill. I usually make this with a chicken that i marinade and cook on the grill. ; name: french mojito ; ingredients: vodka, fresh mint leaves, lime juice, sugar syrup, chambord raspberry liquor, raspberries, mint sprig ; preparation:Muddle mint with vodka in base of shaker. Add lime juice and sugar. Shake with ice and strain into an ice-filled glass. Top with soda and stir. Serve in a collins glass, garnished with raspberry and mint sprigs. ; name: parmesan artichoke stuffed chicken breasts ; ingredients: artichoke hearts, parmesan cheese, thyme leaves, boneless skinless chicken breasts, extra virgin olive oil, salt, pepper ; preparation:

name: strawberry cream cheese sandwich cookies ; ingredients: cream cheese, strawberry preserves, powdered sugar, vanilla extract, vanilla wafers ; preparation:In a medium bowl, smash cream cheese with a fork. Combine the rest of the ingredients together with the cream cheese. Mix well. Let chill in the refridgerator for at least 30 minutes. On the flat side of the wafer, spread 2 tsp of mixture. Then top with another wafer to make a sandwich. Sprinkle with powdered sugar. Serve immediately. ; name: easy christmas candies ; ingredients: baking cocoa, sweetened condensed milk, butter, nuts ; preparation:In a small heavy saucepan, combine cocoa, sweetened condensed milk and butter to a boil, stirring constantly. Reduce heat to low. Continue to cook and stir until thickened. Transfer to a small bowl. Cover and refrigerate until chilled. Roll into 1-inch balls. Then roll in nuts or sprinkles to coat. Store candies in refrigerator. ; name: nigerian rice water ; ingredients: white rice, whole milk, sugar, ground cinnamon, ground nutmeg, orange zest ; preparation:Place the rice into a pan with the milk and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 30 minutes. Strain through a cheesecloth or fine mesh sieve. Stir in the sugar, cinnamon, nutmeg, and peel. Chill in the refrigerator and serve. ; name: homemade italian salad dressing ; ingredients: salad oil, wine vinegar, salt, sugar, dried oregano leaves, dry mustard, paprika, garlic clove ; preparation:Combine all ingredients in a jar with a lid. Cover and shake to mix thoroughly. Let stand at least 2 hours to blend seasonings. Shake well before using. Wonderful on italian lettuce salad. ; name: hungarian cheese spread liptauer ; ingredients: cream cheese, cottage cheese, capers, caraway seed, dry mustard, paprika ; preparation:Cream together all ingredients. Place into a bowl or pretty mold covered with plastic wrap. Cover top of cheese with plastic wrap. Refrigerate for at least 2 hours overnight is best. Unmold on to a serving plate and surround with rye bread squares, fresh veggies, or crackers. ; name: my favorite rice pudding ; ingredients: eggs, milk, sugar, butter, vanilla, salt, cooked rice, raisins, cinnamon, nutmeg ; preparation:Beat eggs. Add milk, sugar, rice, eggs, butter, vanilla and salt to the eggs. Pour into buttered baking dish. Sprinkle with cinnamon and nutmeg. Bake at 350 degrees for 35 minutes or until set. ; name: palak raita spinach curd ; ingredients: spinach, onion, red chili powder, salt, black pepper, plain yogurt, oil ; preparation:Beat yogurt in a bowl and keep aside. Heat oil in a pan, add red chillies powder, salt, black pepper powder and wait for a second. Add onions and saut till tender. Now add spinach and saut for at least 5 minutes on medium heat. Allow the mixture to cool down a little and then add gently into the yogurt bowl. Mix, allow it to rest for a few minutes and enjoy with stuffed indian breads or spiced rice. ; name: springtime asparagus ; ingredients: sliced mushrooms, lemon juice, reduced-fat italian salad dressing, asparagus spear, sliced almonds ; preparation:

name: chicken marmalade ; ingredients: whole chicken, orange juice, soy sauce, orange marmalade, peach preserves, pepper, salt ; preparation:Cut up chicken. Mix orange juice, soy sauce, orange marmalade, peach preserves, pepper and salt together. Marinate chicken in mixture for 2 hours. Bake chicken in 375 degree fahrenheit oven for 45 minutes. Turn chicken. Bake 15 minutes more. ; name: country sausage peppers and potatoes ; ingredients: olive oil, smoked sausage, yukon gold potatoes, green bell pepper, red bell pepper, red onion, lipton recipe secrets onion soup mix, water ; preparation:In a 12 inch skillet, heat oil over medium-high heat. Brown sausage on all sides and remove. Cut sausage into 1-inch slices and set aside. Add peppers and onion to sausage drippings and saute, stirring frequently, approximately 2 minutes until tender. Blend onion soup mix with water, add to pan and add diced potatoes. Bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat to low and simmer, covered, 10 minutes. Return sausage to skillet and simmer, covered, an additional 10 minutes or until sausage is done and potatoes are fork tender. ; name: cornbread dressing salad ; ingredients: cornbread mix, mexican cornbread mix, milk, eggs, tomatoes, onion, bell pepper, celery, mayonnaise ; preparation:Mix both packages of the cornbread mixes with the milk and eggs and bake according to package directions. Cool and crumble. Chop the tomatoes, onion, bell pepper and celery. Add the chopped vegetables to the crumbled dressing along with the mayonnaise. Refrigerate. This recipe is better a day old as that gives all the flavors time to blend together better. ; name: new england flank grill ; ingredients: flank steaks, maple syrup, soy sauce, vinegar, garlic, fresh ground pepper ; preparation:Combine maple syrup, soy sauce, vinegar, garlic, and pepper in a bowl. Place flank steak in a plastic bag with marinade. Refrigerate for 2 hours or overnight. Strain marinade into a sauce pan and cook on low heat. Meanwhile, heat the grill to medium-high. Place steak on grill and cook 5 minutes per side. Cut into thin slices against the grain. Serve with the heated marinade. ; name: olive garden capellini pomodoro ; ingredients: pasta, garlic cloves, salt, pepper, romano cheese, olive oil, fresh tomatoes, fresh basil leaves ; preparation:Boil pasta in salted water and drain. You may process garlic, olive oil, basil leaves, salt and pepper whole in mini chopper or food processor and then stir into drained noodles. Or add garlic, olive oil, and basil. Stir well. Add salt, pepper, and tomatoes. Adjust seasonings to taste. Top with parmesan, romano, or asiago cheese. ; name: never fail fudge ; ingredients: sugar, evaporated milk, butter, marshmallow cream, salt, vanilla extract, walnuts, chocolate chips ; preparation:Butter one 13x9-inch pan or 2 9x9-inch pans. Combine sugar, evaporated milk, butter, marshmallow creme and salt in a 6-quart saucepan. Cook over medium heat. Boil slowly for 5 minutes, stirring constantly. Remove from heat and stir in vanilla extract, walnuts and chocolate chips. Pour into buttered pan. Makes about 5 pounds. ; name: shaker pumpkin muffins ; ingredients: brown sugar, molasses, butter, egg, pecans, pumpkin puree, baking soda, salt, all-purpose flour ; preparation:Cream sugar, molasses, and butter in a mixing bowl. Add pumpkin and egg and mix well. Mix the dry ingredients into the pumpkin batter and fold in nuts. Grease muffin tins and fill half full. Bake at 375 degrees for 20 minutes. ; name: daily harvest granola ; ingredients: butter, honey, cinnamon, rolled oats, pecans, walnuts, pumpkin seeds, sunflower seeds, raisins, dried cranberries ; preparation:

name: low fat southwestern layered salad ; ingredients: ranch salad dressing, salsa, romaine lettuce, carrots, black beans, whole kernel corn, red onion, chopped tomato, reduced-fat cheddar cheese, baked corn tortilla chips ; preparation:Combine ranch dressing and salsa. Set aside. In large bowl, layer the romaine. Mix carrots, black beans, corn, red onion, tomato and cheese. Top with crushed tortilla chips before serving. ; name: mini snack pizzas ; ingredients: refrigerated dinner rolls, pizza sauce, mozzarella cheese, pepperoni ; preparation:Preheat oven to 375. Place rolls on ungreased baking sheet try to flatten rolls so they resemble flat circles. Take a spoonful of sauce and spread ontop of each rolls. Then cut up cheese into small bits and garnish. Add meat ontop of cheese and then place remaining cheese ontop of meat. Cook for about 15 min of until rolls are golden. ; name: brussels sprouts with black pepper butter hazelnuts ; ingredients: black peppercorns, butter, brussels sprouts, olive oil, hazelnuts, vegetable stock, salt ; preparation:Crush the peppercorns in a mortor and pestle and then combine in a small bowl with the softened butter. Refrigerate until needed. Cut a small slice from the stalk end of each brussel sprout to help separate the leaves, pull off the outer leaves of the sprouts very carefully and finely slice the tight centres. Heat the oil in a large frying pan and add the hazelnuts and saut for 2 minutes until toasted. Add the brussel sprouts and stock and saut for a further 2 minutes then season with salt to taste. Remove from the heat and toss through the black pepper butter. Put into a serving bowl or on individual plates. ; name: cointreau melt in your mouth cake ; ingredients: yellow cake mix, vanilla instant pudding mix, eggs, vegetable oil, orange juice, cointreau liqueur, sugar, butter, fresh raspberries, orange rind ; preparation:In a large mixing bowl, combine cake mix, pudding mix, eggs, oil, orange juice and cointreau. Beat well for 10 minutes. Pour into lightly greased bundt pan. Bake at 350 for 45- 60 minutes until done. Let stand 10 minutes. Turn out of pan. While cake is baking, boil sugar, butter, orange juice and cointreau for roughly 5 minutes. Pour over cake while cake is still warm. To serve, top each slice with fresh raspberries and a sprinkle of orange peel. ; name: slow cooked beef in onion sauce crock pot ; ingredients: chuck roast, salt, black pepper, paprika, dried oregano, onions, garlic cloves, tomato paste, dry red wine, water ; preparation:Trim off any excess fat from the meat. Mix salt, pepper, paprika and oregano. Rub this mixture into the meat, on all surfaces. Put onions, garlic, tomato paste and about one-half of the liquid into the crock pot, or slow cooker and mix well. Add the remaining liquid and stir. Nestle the meat down into the liquid, cover and cook on the low setting 8-9 hours, or until the meat is tender. Taste for seasoning and make any adjustments. Serve with noodles, rice, or potatoes. ; name: crispy scalloped corn ; ingredients: eggs, milk, sugar, ground black pepper, bread, whole kernel corn, cream-style corn, butter, crisp rice cereal ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Combine the eggs and milk. Add the sugar, black pepper, cubed bread, both cans of corn amd mix well. Pour into large baking dish that has been coated with non-stick cooking spray. Combine the softened butter and cereal and mix until crumbly. Sprinkle over top of corn mixture and bake, uncovered, until light golden brown. ; name: mediterranean pasta ; ingredients: linguine, bacon, boneless chicken breast, salt, diced tomatoes with juice, dried rosemary, feta cheese, pitted black olives, artichoke hearts ; preparation:Bring large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Add linguine and cook for 8 to 10 minutes or until al dente. Drain. Season chicken with salt. Stir chicken with bacon in a large skillet or saucepan. Add tomatoe and rosemary, simmer 20 minutes. Stir in feta cheese, olives and artichoke hearts and cook until heated through. Toss with fresh cooked pasta and serve warm. Garnish with extra feta if desired. ; name: zesty edamame ; ingredients: lemons, edamame, cajun seasoning, cayenne ; preparation:

name: korean style grilled flank steak ; ingredients: soy sauce, rice vinegar, ginger, garlic clove, asian chili sauce, sugar, sesame oil, flank steak, scallions, toasted sesame seeds ; preparation:Stir together soy sauce, veinegar, ginger, garlic, sriracha, sugar and sesame oil. Prepare a gas grill for direct-heat cooking, and grill the steak, covered, turning over once for 6-8 minutes for medium-rare. Transfer steak to a cutting board and drizzle with 2 tablespoons sauce, then let stand, uncovered, 5 minutes. Thinly slice steak across the grain. Serve with remaining sauce, scallions, and sesame seeds. ; name: brown sugar fudge ; ingredients: butter, brown sugar, evaporated milk, vanilla, powdered sugar, nuts ; preparation:Butter an 8 inch square baking pan. Melt butter in heavy saucepan, add brown sugar. Cook over low heat for 2 minutes, stirring constantly. Add milk, cook, stirring until mixture comes to a boil. Continue to stir, allow to come to soft ball stage and remove form heat. Let cool slightly. Stir in the vanilla. Gradually beat in the powdered sugar with electric beaters until mixture reaches a fudge-like consistency, about 2 minutes. Stir in nuts. Pour into prepared pan. Allow to cool completely before cutting into pieces. ; name: best cream of tomato soup ; ingredients: tomato paste, tomatoes, potatoes, onions, beef broth, pepper, basil, flour, milk ; preparation:In a large pot cook the tomatoes, potatoes, onions, pepper, basil and tomato paste in the beef broth for 30 minutes or until very soft. Make the cream sauce while the vegetables are cooking. Over low heat add the flour to the milk and cook to thicken. Stir almost constantly. Working carefully and in small batches transfer the broth and vegetables to a blender and puree. This is hot do not burn yourself. Return to the pot and add the cream sauce. Stirring well. Adjust pepper and basil to taste. ; name: pastrami and pickle pan fried sandwich ; ingredients: mayonnaise, dijon mustard, rye bread, butter, swiss cheese, dill pickles, pastrami ; preparation:Place the mayonnaise and custard in a bowl and mix well to combine. Spread one side of each slice of bread with butter and the other side with the maonnaise mixture. Divide the cheese, pickle and pastrami between 4 slices of bread, ensuring the buttered side is on the outside, and sandwich with the remaining bread, once again ensuring buttered side is on the outside. Heat a large non stick frying pan over low heat. Cook the sandwiches, in batches for 3-4 minutes each side or until golden and cheese is melted. ; name: bacon pumpkin and pesto pasta ; ingredients: pumpkin, olive oil flavored cooking spray, salt and pepper, dry penne pasta, bacon, basil pesto, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Pre-heat oven to 200c. Line a baking tray with non-stick baking paper, and place the pumpkin in a single layer onto the prepared tray. Spray with olive oil spray and season with salt and pepper. Bake pumpkin in oven for around 25 minutes or until tender. Bring a large pan of lightly salted water to the boil, then cook pasta according to the packet directions, until al dente. Drain and return to the pan. Saute the bacon in a shallow non-stick frying pan over medium-high heat for 5 minutes, stirring often. Add pesto to pasta and toss until coated, then add pumpkin and bacon and toss again until well combined. Divide among serving bowls and sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Serve immediately. ; name: blue cheese and apple canapes ; ingredients: crescent roll dough, cream cheese, blue cheese, granny smith apple, lemon juice, fresh parsley ; preparation:Unroll crescent roll of puff pastry dough and cut into matching triangles. Bake on a greased cookie sheet for 10 minutes then allow to cool completely. In a small bowl, mix together cream cheese and crumbled blue cheese. Peel, core, and slice apple. Toss with lemon juice to prevent browning. At the last minute assemble each piece by spreading a triagle with a small amoutn of the cheese mixture and topping with 2-3 slices of apple. Sprinkle with parsley for garnish. ; name: chicken nuggets made with shredded wheat ; ingredients: shredded wheat cereal, parmesan cheese, seasoning salt, paprika, garlic powder, low-fat mayonnaise, honey, prepared mustard, chicken breast ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400f. In a bowl blend cereal, parmesan cheese, seasoned salt, paprika and garlic powder. In a different bowl mix mayo, honey and mustard. Stir chicken into wet mixture then roll in dry mixture to coat evenly. Place on rack in shallow backing pan. Bake 15-20 min or until slightly browned and done. ; name: quick cheap pate ; ingredients: braunschweiger sausage, cream cheese, garlic cloves, diced onions, fresh parsley, fresh chives, worcestershire sauce ; preparation:

name: sweet potato and spicy carrot soup ; ingredients: olive oil, onion, sweet potatoes, carrots, vegetable stock, chili oil ; preparation:Heat the olive oil in a large saucepan and gently fry the onion over a medium heat until softened but not browned. Add the sweet potato and carrots and cook, covered, for 10 minutes or so, until the vegetables are soft but still with some bite. Pour in the stock, bring to the boil and then simmer, covered, for 30 minutes until the vegetables are tender. Pour into a blender and whizz until smooth - do this in batches if you need to. Return to the pan and gently reheat. Season if desired and either stir in the chilli oil or serve garnished with a few drops of the oil. ; name: fruit or berry cobbler ; ingredients: oleo, berries, sugar, flour, baking powder, cinnamon, milk ; preparation:Melt 1 cup oleo in a 9x12-inch cake pan. Put 4 of the 6 cups of berries or fruit in the pan. Spread out evenly. Combine sugar, flour, baking powder and milk. Pour batter over berries or fruit. Sprinkle remaining berries or fruit over top of the batter. Sprinkle cinnamon over top. Bake at 375 for 40 minutes. ; name: low cal zucchini and mushroom frittata ; ingredients: zucchini, white mushrooms, garlic cloves, onions, egg whites, salt, pepper, chili powder, cayenne pepper, garlic powder ; preparation:Spray a non-stick skillet with fat-free, calorie free non-stick cooking spray. Saut onion and garlic for 3 minutes. Add zucchini and saut for 3 minutes. Add mushrooms and continue to saut all of the veggies until soft. In a large bowl, whisk eggs, salt, pepper, chili powder, cayenne pepper, and garlic powder until the eggs become slightly puffy. Drain vegetables and add to egg mixture. Fold veggies into egg whites and pour back into the skillet. Cook on medium for 8 minutes. Place a plate on top of the skillet and flip the frittata. Slide uncooked side down back onto skillet and cook for another 8 minutes. If you like the top to be crunchy, place the frittata under the broiler for an additional 10 minutes. ; name: loaded lemonade ; ingredients: fresh orange juice, prepared sweet-and-sour mix, tequila, triple sec, sprite ; preparation:Add first four ingredients to a pitcher or large bowl. Stir to combine. Chill for 2 hours. Right before ready to serve, add sprite. Stir to combine. Serve in ice-filled glasses. ; name: sausage quiche ; ingredients: sausage, 9-inch deep dish pie crust, eggs, heavy cream, cheddar cheese ; preparation:Brown sausage in skillet, drain well. Spoon into pie shell. Mix the eggs and cream in a bowl. Spoon over sausage. Top with cheese. Bake ar 350. For partially bake pie crust i bake it about 10 minutes to set the crust. ; name: greek eggplant aubergine and yogurt spread ; ingredients: eggplants, plain yogurt, fresh basil, kalamata olives, red onion, garlic cloves, lemon juice ; preparation:Preheat oven to 450f. Prick eggplant once with a knife. Place on a baking sheet and roast until the skin is wrinkled and eggplant has collapsed, about one hour. Remove and set aside until cool enough to handle. Slit eggplant open length wise and scrape pulp out and finely chop. Place into a large bowl and add the rest of the ingredients. Cover and chill for several hours. Serve with pita toasts. ; name: smudgy bars ; ingredients: margarine, marshmallows, vanilla extract, rice krispies, peanuts, raisins, chocolate chips ; preparation:In large saucepan over low heat, melt margarine. Add marshmallows. Stir until melted and well blended. Remove from heat. Stir in vanilla. Add cereal, peanuts and raisins, then chocolate chips, stirring until thoroughly coated. Using lightly-buttered spatula, press into buttered 3. 5 l pan. Cool. Cut into bars. ; name: tilapia in mustard cream sauce ; ingredients: tilapia fillets, fresh thyme, fresh ground black pepper, salt, cooking spray, chicken broth, portabella mushroom, whipping cream, dijon mustard ; preparation:

name: potato soup with ham and cheese ; ingredients: potatoes, water, ham, milk, cheddar cheese, salt, pepper, red pepper flakes, butter, flour ; preparation:Boil potatoes until tender enough to eat but not to soft. Drain potatoes and reserve the liquid. In a large pot melt butter. When the butter is melted add the flour and whisk to combine until smooth. Add the milk whisking to combine until smooth. Add 2 cups of the potato cooking water. Add the ham and cook for 5 minutes. Add the cheese and stir till melted. Add the potatoes, salt, pepper, and red pepper. Place on the lowest heat and let set for 5 to 10 minutes for the flavors to blend. Serve with crusty bread and maybe a salad. ; name: crustless apple butter pumpkin pie 2 ww points ; ingredients: canned pumpkin, egg beaters egg substitute, skim milk, salt, pumpkin pie spice, all-purpose flour, apple butter, cool whip free ; preparation:Beat all together until smooth. Pour into a pam sprayed pie pan. Bake at 400 for 15 minutes, then at 375 for 45 minutes, or until a knife inserted comes out clean. Top each slice with 1 t. Cool whip. ; name: asparagus with pine nuts ; ingredients: fresh asparagus, pine nuts, olive oil, fresh lemon juice, garlic, sugar, dried oregano, fresh basil, salt and pepper ; preparation:Trim tough ends off asparagus. Cook in small amount of boiling water until tender-crisp, approx 4 minutes. Drain and plunge into ice water for a few minutes. Drain well and cut into 2 inch lengths, set aside. Im small frypan, toast pine nuts until evenly browned, shaking pan frequently. Remove from pan and cool. Whisk together oil, lemon juice, garlic, sugar, oregano, basil, salt and pepper and pour over cool asparagus. Let stand about 30 minutes. Sprinkle with the pine nuts. ; name: chicken apple hash ; ingredients: baking potatoes, butter, onion, rosemary, poultry seasoning, chicken, red apple, pepper, parsley ; preparation:Heat butter in a large skillet over low heat. Add onion, rosemary and poultry seasioning and cook until onion is translucent, about 3 minutes. Stir in potatoes, chicken, apples, salt and pepper. Cook, stirring ad scraping up browned bits on botom with spatula until mixture is browned, 15-20 minutes. Sprinkle with parsley. ; name: easy spaghetti squash ; ingredients: spaghetti squash, onion, garlic, butter ; preparation:Boil a large pot of water enough to cover the spagetti squash. Cut the spaghetti squash into 4 pieces. Season with whatever you want, i used garlic salt and onion powder. Once boiling add the squash, onions, garlic and butter. Cook for 20 min covered. Remove and separate spaghetti from the skin. ; name: shrimp veggie alfredo ; ingredients: fettuccine pasta, snap peas, red pepper, carrots, garlic cloves, vegetable oil, medium shrimp, alfredo sauce ; preparation:Cook fettuccini according to package directions. Meanwhile, in a large skillet, saute the peas, red pepper, carrots, and garlic in 2 tablespoons of the oil until tender. Remove from skillet. Add remaining oil to skillet and saute shrimp until pink in color. Return vegetables to skillet. Mix well. Drain pasta. Place pasta on serving dishes, drizzle with aflredo sauce, and top with shrimp mixture. ; name: creamed chicken ; ingredients: boneless skinless chicken breast, vegetable oil, cream of chicken soup, water, salt, black pepper, sour cream, english muffins, cayenne pepper, paprika ; preparation:In a large skillet, saute the chicken in oil until no longer pink. Stir in the soup, water, salt and pepper. Bring to a boil. Remove from heat and stin in sour cream. Serve over toasted english muffins. Can also serve over cooked noodles. Sprinkle with cayenne pepper or paprika. ; name: barbecue spice cookies ; ingredients: butter, barbecue sauce, sugar, eggs, all-purpose flour, baking soda, ground ginger, ground cloves, cinnamon ; preparation:

name: one pot cheesy chicken and noodles ; ingredients: water, chicken bouillon granule, wide egg noodles, frozen peas and carrot, onion, cream of mushroom soup, cheddar cheese, milk, cooked chicken, ground black pepper ; preparation:Bring water and bouillon to a boil in a large saucepan. Stir in uncooked noodles, then cover and simmer for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add vegetables and onion, cover and simmer 5 minutes or until noodles are tender and most liquid is absorbed. Add soup, cheese and milk, mix well. Stir in chicken and pepper, heat through. ; name: mom s shoofly pie ; ingredients: boiling water, baking soda, molasses, flour, brown sugar, shortening, salt ; preparation:Pour boiling water over soda, in a bowl. Stir in molasses. Mix crumbs. Mix half of crumbs into filling and pour into pie shells. Sprinkle rest of crumbs over the two pies. Bake at 350f degrees for 30-40 minutes. ; name: moist vegan cornbread ; ingredients: maple syrup, canola oil, plain soymilk, whole wheat flour, cornmeal, baking powder, kosher salt ; preparation:Heat oven to 350 degrees. Stir first three ingredients together. In another bowl whisk together the flour, cornmeal, baking powder and salt. Regular salt will work as well. Mix wet and dry ingredients together and pour into a greased 9x9 square pan. Bake for 35 minutes at 350, until tester comes out clean. ; name: cinnamon puffy puffs ; ingredients: refrigerated dinner rolls, sugar, cinnamon, brown sugar, shortening ; preparation:Preheat oven to 375f. Take pillsbury roll and cut in fourths. Place fourths of roll in 8x8-inch pan that is covered in foil. Spread melted butter or shortening over rolls. Make a mixture of brown sugar, sugar and cinnamon. Sprinkle mixture over fourths. Place in preheated oven for about 5-8 minutes till cinnamon is nice and black or a darker brown. Or whenever the fourths are crisp. ; name: maple glazed chicken ; ingredients: paprika, salt, ground cinnamon, ground cumin, fresh coarse ground black pepper, boneless skinless chicken breast, maple syrup, butter, dijon mustard ; preparation:Combine the paprika, salt, ground cinnamon, cumin and pepper in a ziploc bag. Add chicken pieces and coat evenly. In a skillet over medium heat cook chicken until thoroughly done. About 10 minutes. Remove chicken after done and keep warm. Lower heat to low and add maple syrup, butter and dijon mustard. Combine well and add chicken pieces to coat evenly. Serves well with roasted vegetables. ; name: chocolate cream cheese low carb fudge ; ingredients: cream cheese, cocoa, heavy cream, peanut butter, splenda sugar substitute ; preparation:Melt cream cheese and peanut butter in microwave for 1-2 minutes at 30-second intervals. Stir in cocoa until creamy. Combine together in a mixing bowl and whisk in cream and sweetener. Spread on wax paper, cover with another sheet of wax paper. Freeze, then cut into pieces, and keep chilled. ; name: crockpot parmesan ranch mushrooms ; ingredients: fresh mushrooms, butter, ranch dressing mix, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Put the mushrooms in the crockpot. Melt butter in a bowl and add the hidden valley ranch dressing package. Mix well and pour over mushrooms in the crockpot. Sprinkle with about two teaspoons of parmesan cheese or more to your liking. Cook in crockpot at low for 4 hours. It gives a delicious side dishes or topping for a steak. ; name: almond champagne fondue ; ingredients: gruyere cheese, swiss cheese, cornstarch, brie cheese, champagne, almond extract, ground nutmeg, apple, french bread cubes, breadstick ; preparation:

name: quaker steak and lube s beer cheese dip ; ingredients: cream cheese, sharp cheddar cheese, garlic clove, worcestershire sauce, dry mustard, cayenne powder, beer ; preparation:Combine cream cheese and cheddar cheese in an electric mixer beat on medium until smooth. Add garlic and spices. Beat well. Gradually add beer, beating until blended. Chill 1 hour. Serve with potato chips, crusty bread or crackers. ; name: pork chops low cal carb ; ingredients: pork loin chops, dijon mustard, corn flakes, salt, pepper, basil, tarragon, garlic powder ; preparation:Preheat oven to broil. Coat pork chops with the mustard. In a shallow bowl, combine crushed corn flakes and the seasonings. Dredge pork chops in the crushed corn flakes mixture. Place pork chops on a wire rack and set rack on top of a sheet pan. Place under the broiler and cook on both sides until golden brown, about 5 minutes on each side. ; name: orange iced tea ; ingredients: oranges, boiling water, tea bags, ice cube, honey ; preparation:With a vegetable peeler, peel each orange in a continuous spiral, removing only the outer colored layer of peel. In a large pitcher, pour boiling water over the tea bags and orange peel. Cover and steep 5 minutes. Remove tea bags. Chill tea mixture with peel in a covered container. To serve, remove the peel and pour iced tea over ice cubes in tall glasses. Sweeten to taste with honey. Garnish with orange slices and fresh mint leaves, if desired. ; name: couscous with apples chives ; ingredients: apple juice, tart apple, green onion, fresh chives, curry powder, couscous, chicken broth, salt ; preparation:Heat apple juice in 2-quart saucepan over medium-high heat. Bring to boil. Stir in apples, green onions, chives and curry powder and cook 1 to 2 minutes, stirring. Add couscous and cook 1 minute. Add broth and bring to boil. Cover and remove from heat. Let stand 10 to 15 minutes or until liquid is absorbed. Fluff with fork. Season to taste with salt and pepper. ; name: white chocolate potato chip cookies ; ingredients: shortening, granulated sugar, brown sugar, eggs, vanilla, white chocolate chips, flour, baking soda, potato chips ; preparation:Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Cream shortening and sugars. Add eggs and vanilla. Beat well. Sift flour and baking soda and stir into creamed mixture. Add crushed potato chips and white chocolate chips. Stir to integrate fully. Drop by heaping spoonfuls onto greased cookie shhet. Bake for 10 to 12 minutes. ; name: nutty gourmet popcorn snack ; ingredients: popped corn, pecan halves, whole almond, sugar, margarine, vanilla, white corn syrup ; preparation:Combine sugar, margarine and corn syrup in suacepan. Bring to a boil, stirring constantly. Cook for 10-15 minutes until mixture turns a light caramel color. Remove from heat and stir in vanilla. Pour over popcorn and nuts. Store in airtight container. ; name: shoney s cabbage beef soup ; ingredients: tomatoes, ground beef, onion, beef broth, kidney beans, cabbage, tomato paste, salt and pepper ; preparation:Chop the tomatoes and reserve the juice. Brown the beef with the onions. Drain the fat. Add the beef broth, beans, tomatoes, and juice and tomatoe paste if desired. Add the cabbage, and simmer till tender. Add salt and pepper. ; name: tuna frittata ; ingredients: tuna in vegetable oil, cannellini beans, pecorino cheese, baby spinach leaves, dried oregano, eggs, olive oil, salt, fresh ground pepper ; preparation:

name: cheesy green chili rice ; ingredients: onion, butter, cooked long-grain rice, sour cream, small curd cottage cheese, salt, pepper, green chilies, cheddar cheese ; preparation:In a large skillet, cook onion in butter until tender. Remove from the heat. Stir in the rice, sour cream, cottage cheese, salt and pepper. Spoon half of the mixture into a greased 11-in. X 7-in x 2-in baking dish. Top with half of the chilies and cheese. Repeat layers. Bake, uncovered, at 375 for 20-25 minutes or until heated through and bubbly. ; name: cornbread low carb ; ingredients: almond flour, baking powder, eggs, cream, water, butter, splenda sugar substitute ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 combine the almond meal and baking powder. Add the cream, water, sweetener, and eggs, stir to combine. Add the melted butter, stir to combine. Spray pam into the muffin tin. Divide the batter amongst 5-6 muffins. Bake for 15-18 minutes until edges are slightly browned and the tops are firm to the touch. Really good with butter& sugar-free, low carb jam or honey. ; name: lower fat cream cheese and ricotta stuffed mushrooms ; ingredients: mushroom cap, low-fat cream cheese, part-skim ricotta cheese, garlic, cheese ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350. Mix cream cheese, ricotta and garlic. Spoon cheese mixture into mushroom caps. Sprinkle shredded cheese on top. Bake for 10 minutes, or until shredded cheese is well melted. I suggest putting aluminum foil on a cookie sheet for easy clean-up, since the cheese may ooze over a bit. ; name: penne a la vodka low fat ; ingredients: olive oil, garlic cloves, crushed red pepper flakes, evaporated skim milk, penne pasta, onion, diced tomatoes with juice, parsley, vodka ; preparation:In large nonstick saucepan, heat oil. Add onion and garlic. Cook, stirring as needed, until softened. Stir in red pepper flakes and tomatoes. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer, uncovered, until the sauce is slightly thickened. During this, you also want to start cooking the pasta. Stir in parsley, milk, and vodka cook until heated through, about 1 minute. Place cooked penne in large serving bowl, add tomato mixture and toss to coat. ; name: maple syrup pudding cake ; ingredients: maple syrup, pecans, butter, sugar, egg, milk, cake flour, baking powder, salt ; preparation:Bring 1 maple syrup almost to a boil. Cream together butter, sugar and egg. Combine and add milk, flour, baking powder and salt. Grease and flour one 8 inches cake pan. Add maple syrup. Drop in chopped pecans. Cover with cake batter and bake at 350 degrees for. 20-30 minutes. Turn upside down and serve with ice-cream. ; name: cucumbers with mint vinaigrette ; ingredients: cucumbers, olive oil, champagne vinegar, salt & freshly ground black pepper, of fresh mint ; preparation:Peel the cucumbers and slice them in half lengthwise. Scoop out the seeds with a spoon and discard. Cut the cucumbers into thin slices and combine in a bowl with the oil, vinegar, salt, and pepper. Marinate for at least 30 minutes in the refrigerator or at room temperature. Add the mint immediately before serving. ; name: crock pot scalloped potatoes ; ingredients: potatoes, cream of celery soup, nacho cheese soup, onion, cooked ham ; preparation:Grease crock pot. Mix the soups together. Put half potatoes in bottom of crock pot next half the onion, half the soup mixture and a little salt and pepper. Repeat layers again. Cook on high 4-5 hours. Check when potatoes are done as crock pot temperatures differ. ; name: open face grilled eggplant sandwiches ; ingredients: peasant bread, extra virgin olive oil, eggplants, salt & freshly ground black pepper, plum tomatoes, buffalo mozzarella, basil leaves, coarse sea salt ; preparation:

name: walnut pear spaghetti ; ingredients: spaghetti, baby spinach leaves, gorgonzola, pears, dried thyme, dried sage, walnuts, lemon juice, fresh ground black pepper ; preparation:Three quarters fill a large pot with water, bring to the boil, add the spaghetti and cook till al dente. Drain the spaghetti being careful to reserve some of the cooking water. Return the hot spaghetti to the pot and, over a low heat, add the baby spinach leaves and cheese and stir until the baby spinach leaves wilt and the cheese starts to melt. Add a little of the pasta water and continue to stir. Add the pear, walnuts, thyme and sage, stir well, and allow to warm through. Drizzle with lemon juice, season to taste with freshly ground black pepper and serve hot. ; name: bananacran bread ; ingredients: bananas, frozen cranberries, butter, sugar, eggs, flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt, cinnamon ; preparation:Beat together butter, sugar and eggs until creamy. Add bananas and cranberries. Combine the remaining dry ingredients in a separate bowl. Add to the wet ingredients and stir until well mixed. Pour into a large greased loaf pan and bake in a 350 oven for an hour. Remove and cool for 20 minutes in the pan before removing. ; name: mandarin orange coffee cake ; ingredients: orange cake mix, instant vanilla pudding, eggs, vegetable oil, mandarin oranges ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350. Grease and flour 10-inch bundt pan. Combine cake mix, pudding mix, eggs, oil, and one-cup juice. Beat at medium speed with electric mixer for 2 minutes. Add mandarin oranges in the last 30 seconds. Pour in pan. Bake 38 to 43 minutes or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool in pan 10 minutes. Invert onto plate. Dust with powdered sugar when completely cooled. ; name: mushroom n gorgonzola bundles ; ingredients: whole mushrooms, frozen puff pastry, gorgonzola, egg ; preparation:Heat oven to 400 degrees. Rinse and pat mushrooms dry. Twist off stems. Unfold puff pastry and cut into 36 squares. Fill each mushroom cap with a spoonful of gorgonzola cheese. Place 1 filled mushroom in the center of 1 puff pastry square. Draw all 4 corners up to form a bundle and pinch center together to form a knob. Repeat to bundle all the mushrooms. Brush each bundle lightly with egg. Bake until golden borwn-approx. 10-20 minutes. ; name: roasted florets ; ingredients: cauliflower, extra virgin olive oil, salt, crushed red pepper flakes, fresh ground pepper, lemon wedge ; preparation:Preheat oven to 450f. Place florets in a large bowl with oil, salt, pepper & pepper flakes and toss to coat. Spread out on a baking sheet. Roast the vegetables, stirring once, until tender-crisp and browned in spots, 15 to 25 minutes. Serve hot or warm with lemon wedges, if desired. Enjoy. ; name: skewered grilled red potatoes ; ingredients: red potatoes, water, miracle whip, chicken broth, dried oregano, garlic powder, onion powder ; preparation:Place potatoes and water in 2 quart casserole dish, cover, and microwave on high 12-15 minutes, or until tender, stirring halfway through. Drain. Mix remaining ingredients, stir in potatoes gently. Cover, refrigerate 1 hour. Drain, reserving salad dressing mixture. Arrange potatoes on skewers. Place on grill over hot coals. Grill, covered for 4 minutes. Turn skewers, brush with reserved mixture, grill 4 minutes longer uncovered to crisp outside, covered if soft outside is preferred. ; name: spinach dip pinwheels ; ingredients: frozen chopped spinach, knorr vegetable soup mix, sour cream, mayonnaise, water chestnuts, green onions, flour tortillas ; preparation:Stir together soup mix, sour cream, and mayo until well blended. Stir in spinach, water chestnuts and green onions. Spread tortillas with dip, not quite to the edges. Roll up tightly. Slice into 1 inch pieces. Arrange on serving platter and refrigerate until ready to serve. ; name: mandarin orange cheesecake pie ; ingredients: shortbread pie crust, cream cheese, sugar, frozen orange juice concentrate, eggs, mandarin oranges in juice, light brown sugar ; preparation:

name: three sister s mizithra native american greek fusion ; ingredients: spaghetti squash, navy beans, corn, red bell pepper, vegetable margarine, olive oil, mizithra cheese, fresh parsley, fresh basil leaves ; preparation:Preheat oven to 375. Pierce squash a few times with a knife, wrap in foil, and bake for 1 hour and 15 minutes. Remove from oven and set aside until cool enough to handle. In a medium sauce pan, combine beans and corn and heat just until hot. Cut squash in half lengthwise and remove seeds. Remove flesh by scraping against inside of shell with a fork to form pasta-like strands. Place in serving dish. Add beans, corn, and bell pepper, and toss to combine. In a small saucepan, melt margarine. Stir in olive oil, pour over squash, and toss. Sprinkle top with cheese, parsley, and basil. ; name: tko sangria punch non alcoholic ; ingredients: crystal light raspberry powdered drink mix, cranberry juice cocktail, orange juice, fresh lime juice, club soda, oranges, limes ; preparation:Empty drink mix into large pitcher. Add cranberry juice cocktail, orange juice and lime juice. Stir until drink mix is completely dissolved. Stir in club soda and fruit. Serve over ice cubes in tall glasses. ; name: old fashion peanut butter roll ; ingredients: sugar, water, corn syrup, vanilla, egg whites ; preparation:First beat 3 egg whites until stiff. Prepare the surface to roll out the candy. Cover the surface with wax paper and spread a thick layer of powdered sugar. Next mix all ingredients except vanilla in a large pot and boil. Stirring continously, until ball forms. The ball should be hard and have a soft crack. Add vanilla. Slowly pour the mixture over the egg whites while mixing with a blender the whole time. Continue to mix until the candy has cooled and resembles the texture of marshmallow cream. Pour onto powdered sugar and roll thin. Spread a thin layer of peanut butter. Roll up and cut. ; name: best of all macaroni cheese ; ingredients: macaroni, egg, small curd cottage cheese, sour cream, cheese, salt and pepper, basil ; preparation:Combine egg, cottage cheese, sour cream, cheese, salt, and pepper in a large bowl. Add cooked pasta and mix together. Place in any casserole dish. Cook at 350 degrees for a half an hour. Sprinkle with basil for extra flavor. ; name: ginger hot thighs ; ingredients: chicken thighs, olive oil, onion, garlic cloves, red wine, gingerroot, ground cumin, chili powder, fresh parsley ; preparation:In large, nonstick skillet over medium heat, heat oil. Add chicken. Cook 7 to 8 minutes on each side, or until browned. In small bowl, combine onion, garlic, wine, ginger, cumin and chili powder. Add mixture to skillet. Partially cover and reduce heat to medium low. Cook about 20 to 30 minutes, or until chicken is fork tender and liquid has been reduced to a glaze. To serve, sprinkle with parsley. ; name: abby s rice pudding ; ingredients: white rice, water, whole milk, sugar, cinnamon ; preparation:In a medium saucepan add rice and water. Cook until the rice in tender. Add milk and simmer 60 min or until the milk is almost cooked out. Remove from heat and add sugar and cinnamon to taste. Place in fridge for 4 hours. ; name: portuguese custard cupcakes ; ingredients: all-purpose flour, granulated sugar, eggs, butter, milk, lemon zest ; preparation:Preheat the oven to 300f grease cupcake tins with butter. Beat the eggs until lemon coloured. Add the sugar and butter and continue to beat until thick, then add the lemon rind. Pour warm milk into egg mixture while continuing to beat. Once blended, fold in the flour until well mixed. Fill the tins half way up and bake for approximately 1 hour, or until a tester inserted comes out clean. Cool in pans on a rack. Cupcakes will sink during the cooling process. ; name: carrot cake jam ; ingredients: carrots, pears, crushed pineapple, lemon juice, cinnamon, nutmeg, clove, sugar, liquid pectin ; preparation:

name: pineapple orange cream cake ; ingredients: yellow cake mix, mandarin oranges in juice, eggs, oil, instant vanilla pudding, crushed pineapple in juice, whipped topping ; preparation:Combine first 4 ingredients. Pour into 2-9 inch greased and floured layer cake pans. Bake at 350 degrees for 30-35 minutes. Cool. Combine instant pudding and crushed pineapple. Put in refrigerator for an hour. When ready to ice, fold in whipped topping. Frost layers and top and sides of cake. ; name: portabella and onion topping for hamburgers ; ingredients: portabella mushrooms, spanish onion, garlic, olive oil, american cheese, red wine ; preparation:Heat oil in a non stick skillet. Add garlic and saute for one minute. Add spanish onions and cook until almost translucent. Add sliced portobello mushrooms and saute until cooked and reduced, about 10 minutes on medium heat. Add optional red wine or cooking wine, mix well until reduced. Set aside once finished. When burgers are almost ready, top with portabello mushroom mixture and a slice of cheese, continue grilling or broiling until cheese is melted. ; name: goulash heart healthy version ; ingredients: ground turkey, whole wheat elbow macaroni, onion, light cheese whiz, garlic powder, diced tomatoes, salt and pepper ; preparation:Cook macaroni until al dente, drain and reserve. Brown ground turkey. Add onion and garlic powder, cook until onion is translucent. Add tin of tomatoes, with their juices. Return cooked macaroni to pot, heat through. Add cheez whiz, stir until melted. Season with salt and pepper, to taste. ; name: blue cheese pasta salad ; ingredients: penne pasta, plain nonfat yogurt, low-fat mayonnaise, blue cheese, salt, fresh ground pepper, olive oil, garlic, round steaks, cherry tomatoes ; preparation:Cook pasta according to package directions. Meanwhile, combine yogurt, mayonnaise, blue cheese, salt and pepper in large bowl. Heat large non-stick skillet, swirl in oil, then add garlic. Saute 30 seconds. Add beef in two batches, cook til just browned, about 2 minutes. Drain pasta, add to bowl with yogurt dressing. Add steak and tomatoes, toss to coat. Serve immediately. ; name: zaney s sesame chicken ; ingredients: boneless skinless chicken breast halves, red hot sauce, sesame oil, sugar, flour, salt, pepper, sesame seeds ; preparation:Marinate chicken breasts in sesame oil, redhot sauce and sugar. Let sit, covered, in the fridge 30 minutes. Add salt and pepper to flour in a shallow dish. Dredge chicken in flour. Spray baking dish with pam. Put the chicken in the baking dish and sprinkle with the sesame seeds if using. Bake at 350 for 30-40 minutes or until chicken juices run clear. ; name: cheese and chili pepper squares ; ingredients: cheddar cheese, monterey jack cheese, green chili peppers, eggs, milk ; preparation:Layer half of the cheeses in a greased 9x13 pan. Sprinkle on peppers, then other half of cheeses. Mix eggs and milk together. Drizzle over cheese. Bake at 350 for 30-35 minutes. Cool 15 minutes before cutting. ; name: strong hot chocolate ; ingredients: whole milk, heavy cream, vanilla bean, unsweetened cocoa powder, dark brown sugar, bittersweet chocolate, fleur de sel, marshmallows ; preparation:Off the heat, in a 1-quart saucepan, combine the milk and cream. Split the vanilla bean lengthwise and use the. Whisk the cocoa powder and brown sugar into the milk, then place the saucepan over medium heat and whisk for 5 to 7 minutes, or until frothy and simmering. Place the chocolate in a heatproof bowl. Remove and discard the vanilla pod from the milk mixture, then pour the mixture over the chocolate. Add the salt and whisk until the chocolate is smooth. Divide the hot chocolate among cups and top each with 2 marshmallows or a dollop of whipped cream. Can be cooled, tightly covered and refrigerated up to 3 days. ; name: mexican chicken bean casserole ; ingredients: lean ground chicken, kidney beans, tomato sauce, salsa, chili powder, cayenne pepper, garlic clove, cheese ; preparation:

name: chicken in coriander cilantro sauce ; ingredients: olive oil, skinless chicken thighs, onions, dry white wine, fresh cilantro, garlic cloves, salt, black pepper, lemons ; preparation:Heat the oil in a large non stick fry pan. When it is hot, add the thighs in one layer and saute them over medium to high heat for 4 minutes on each side or until nicely browned. Remove the chicken to a platter. Add the onions to the dripping in the pan. Saut for 1 minute. Stir in the garlic, wine and coriander stems only and saut for 1 minute longer. Return the chicken to the pan, add lemon salt and pepper. Bring the surrounding liquid to the boil. Cover the pan, reduce the heat and boil gently for 15 minutes. Stir in the coriander leaves and serve 2 thighs per person. Serve with rice or cous cous. ; name: potato carrot kugel ; ingredients: russet potatoes, carrots, onion, eggs, oil, matzo meal, salt, pepper ; preparation:Grate vegetables, place in large bowl. Preheat oven to 400. Beat eggs in small bowl, add with remaining ingredients. Grease a 13x9 baking dish, add ingredients. Bake aprox 1 hour until top is brown. ; name: curly kale with caramelized onions ; ingredients: olive oil, onion, garlic cloves, kale, balsamic vinegar, almonds ; preparation:Heat oil in large pot or dutch oven over medium heat. Add onion, and cook 10 to 15 minutes, or until soft and beginning to brown. Add garlic, and cook 1 minute, or until fragrant. Stir in kale and 2 cups water. Cover, and cook 30 minutes, or until kale is tender. Season with salt and pepper. If making ahead, cool, and store in airtight container. Just before serving, reheat kale mixture, then drizzle with vinegar, and sprinkle with almonds. ; name: easy broiled scallops ; ingredients: bay scallop, butter, olive oil, lemon pepper, garlic, garlic powder, seafood seasoning, lemon juice, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Preheat oven for broiling. Melt butter, add olive oil, lemon juice and seasonings. Add scallops, stir to coat. Place in broiler, i use a small cake pan. Broil for 3 to 4 minutes, stir and cook for 3 to 4 minutes more or until done. Depending on size of scallops, may take a little longer, mine were dime sized. You may sprinkle a little parmesan after you take out for a little different taste. Serve hot, maybe with some crusty bread for dipping. ; name: cranberry spread jam ; ingredients: cranberries, water, cinnamon, sugar, pectin ; preparation:Put cranberries into a colander, rinse with cold water. Throw away any berries that are dried out or mushy. Bring water to a boil and put cranberries into boiling water. Cook over medium heat until the berries pop. Ladle cranberries into food mill and sieve. Pour prepared fruit back into pot, add cinnamon and pectin. Bring to a boil, stirring constantly for 3-5 minutes. Add sugar and bring to jam stage stirring constantly to prevent scorching. Boil for 3 minutes more. Skim off any foam with a wooden spoon. Jar as usual. ; name: cocoa dreams ; ingredients: sugar, cocoa, butter, milk, quick oats, peanut butter, vanilla ; preparation:In large pan bring first 4 ingredients to a boil. Boil for 1 minute. Remove from heat. Add remaining ingredients and mix well. Drop by tablespoonfuls on waxed paper to set--they are not baked. ; name: broccoli n cheese puffle ; ingredients: bread, frozen chopped broccoli, margarine, swiss cheese, salt, tabasco sauce, instant minced onion, eggs, instant dry milk powder, hot water ; preparation:Heat oven to 375 degrees f. Line a greased 9x9 pan with bread. Combine broccoli with margarine, cheese, salt, tobasco, and onion. Spoon over bread. Beat eggs, add milk powder and water, mix well, pour over broccoli. Bake at for 20-25 minutes. ; name: raspberry kisses ; ingredients: butter, sugar, eggs, flour, cornstarch, baking powder, raspberry jam, salt ; preparation:

name: hamburger dips ; ingredients: hamburger, french rolls, onion, swiss cheese, bacon, fresh mushrooms, au jus sauce ; preparation:In a large fry pan place patties, bacon, onion, and mushrooms fry over medium heat until patties are done. Place cheese slices on patties. Taost french rolls. Heat au jus. Assemble sandwiches pour au jus into bowls and serve. ; name: curry cheese and broccoli soup ; ingredients: fresh broccoli, butter, curry powder, onion, chicken broth, potatoes, carrots, milk, sharp cheddar cheese ; preparation:Trim the flowerets from broccoli and cut into small pieces. Discard tough ends of stems. Peel remaining stems and slice thin in a 6 to 8 quart kettle, melt butter over medium heat. Add curry powder and onion and stir for 5 minutes. Add broth, potatoes, broccoli stems and carrots. Cover and simmer until potatoes mash easily, about 30 minutes. Whirl about half the broth and vegetables in a blender or food processor until pureed. Return to kettle. Heat soup to boiling and add broccoli flowerets and milk. Simmer, uncovered, until flowerets are tender when pierced. Stir in cheese a little at a time until melted. ; name: steamed lentils with saffron ; ingredients: brown lentils, olive oil, onion, prosciutto, dry white wine, saffron thread, vegetable stock, salt ; preparation:Rinse the lentils well. Heat the vegetable stock in a small pot. Meanwhile, in a different medium pot heat the olive oil. Add the onion and cook until translucent, 5 to 8 minutes, then add the prosciutto and cook for a few more minutes. Add the lentils, cook for another 2-3 minutes, and pour the white wine. Add the saffron and cook until the alcohol has evaporated, 4-5 minutes. Add the stock, salt to taste, and cook over low heat for 50 minutes to 1 hour, covered. Add water or more stock if necessary. ; name: dirty thumbprint cookies ; ingredients: margarine, sugar, vanilla, egg, flour, cocoa, baking powder, preserves ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350. Beat margerine and sugar until fluffy, add vanilla and egg. Stir in flour, cocoa and baking powder. Roll into balls and make an indentation in the middle of each cookie with thumb or end of a wooden spoon. Fill each cookies with about half a tsp of jelly, bake for 12 to 15 minutes. ; name: simple shrimp stir fry ; ingredients: angel hair pasta, cornstarch, oil, frozen shrimp, stir fry vegetables, gingerroot, italian dressing, hoisin sauce ; preparation:Cook pasta as directed on packaging & do not rinse. Meanwhile toss shrimp with cornstarch in large bowl & let stand 10mins. Place veggies in strainer. Rinse under hot water 30 sec. Or until thawed. Drain. Heat oil in large nonstick skillet & add shrimp and ginger. Stir fry 8 mins or until shrimp turns pink. Add vegetables, dressing & hoisin sauce. Cook 2 mins to heat through, stirring frequently. Add drained pasta and shrimp mixture to mixing bowl & mix lightly. ; name: hoisin grilled pork tenderloin low fat ; ingredients: hoisin sauce, lemon juice, dijon mustard, honey, sesame oil, soy sauce, gingerroot, garlic, lemon zest, pork tenderloin ; preparation:To make glaze, combine all glaze ingredients in a small bowl and mix well. Set aside. Preheat grill. Grill pork for about 16 minutes, turning occasionally. Pork should be slightly pink in the centre. Do not overcook. Brush pork generously with glaze during last 5 minutes of cooking time. Place pork on a cutting board, cover loosely with foil, and let stand for 5 minutes. Cut into thin slices and serve. ; name: low carb white castle casserole ; ingredients: ground beef, onion soup mix, eggs, mayonnaise, heavy cream, cheddar cheese, salt and pepper, dill pickle slices, mustard ; preparation:Brown the hamburger with half of the onion soup mix. Drain fat and season to taste with salt and pepper. Stir in the remaining soup mix and put meat in a greased 9-10 inch pie plate. Stir in half the cheese, then top with remaining cheese. Beat eggs, mayonnaise, cream, salt and pepper together then pour evenly over the meat. Bake at 350f for 30-35 minutes. Let stand 10 minutes before serving. ; name: roasted potatoes with rosemary and sea salt ; ingredients: red potatoes, extra virgin olive oil, sea salt, ground black pepper, garlic cloves, fresh rosemary ; preparation:

name: bbq peanuts ; ingredients: egg white, liquid smoke, salted peanuts, sugar, chili powder, ground cumin, garlic powder, cayenne pepper ; preparation:Pre-heat oven to 250f. Grease a 15x10x1 inch baking pan. In a bowl, whisk egg white until foamy. Add liquid smoke and peanutes. Toss to coat. Combine the remaining ingredients. Sprinkle over nuts. Toss to coat. Spread in a single layer in on to well greased baking pan. Bake at 250f for 1 hour, stirring once half way through. Spread on wasxed paper to cool. Store in an airtight container. ; name: sinful brownies ; ingredients: butter, dark chocolate, eggs, sugar, golden syrup, plain flour, cocoa, salt, nuts ; preparation:Pre heat oven 180c. Butter 20cm square cake tin. Melt butter and choc in saucepan over low heat. When melted ans smooth, set aside to cool. Beat eggs and sugar in large bowl till thick and creamy. Stir n cooled chocolate and golden syrup. Then add flour, cocoa, salt and nuts. Pour into tin, bake 30 minutes. Remove from oven, cool in tin then cut into squares. ; name: roasted rosemary skewered figs ; ingredients: fresh figs, fresh rosemary, maple syrup, apple cider vinegar, mustard powder ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Skewer 3 whole figs onto each sprig of rosemary. In a small bowl combine maple syrup, vinegar, and mustard. Place skewers into an oiled baking dish and roast for 30 min. Spoon maple syrup mixture over figs and continue roasting for 15 min basting occasionally. ; name: cherry o creamy cheesecake pie ; ingredients: graham cracker crust, cream cheese, sweetened condensed milk, bottled lemon juice, vanilla extract, cherry pie filling ; preparation:Whip cream cheese until fluffy. Gradually beat in sweetened condensed milk and blend. Blend in reallemon lemon juice and vanilla extract. Pour into pie crust and chill until firm. Top with chilled cherry pie filling and chill for at least 2 hours. ; name: lynne s cheesecake ; ingredients: cream cheese, marshmallow creme, eggs, flour, graham cracker crust ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 f degrees. Beat cream cheese, marshmallow creme, eggs, and flour until smooth. Pour into graham cracker pie shell. Bake for 45 minutes or until edges are brown. Turn oven off and let cheesecake cool in oven for 1 hour. Remove to wire rack to cool. Refrigerate for at least 4 hours before serving. ; name: asian pork and noodle soup ; ingredients: boneless pork sirloin, garlic cloves, gingerroot, chicken broth, water, soy sauce, fine egg noodles, carrot, red bell pepper, fresh spinach leaves ; preparation:Spray 3-quart saucepan with cooking spray. Heat over medium-high heat. Add pork, garlic and gingerroot. Stir-fry 3 to 5 minutes or until pork is brown. Stir in broth, water and soy sauce. Heat to boiling. Reduce heat. Simmer uncovered 5 minutes. Stir in noodles, carrot and bell pepper. Simmer uncovered about 10 minutes or until noodles are tender. Stir in spinach. Cook until heated through. ; name: simple baked chicken drumsticks ; ingredients: chicken drumsticks, garlic powder, pepper, salt, olive oil, rosemary, parsley ; preparation:Put some olive oil in the bottom of a 9x13 pan. Add drumsticks. Sprinkle generously with pepper and garlic powder. Sprinkle lightly with salt. Add rosemary to the chicken, if desired. Bake at 375 f for half an hour. Turn drumsticks over and add more garlic powder, pepper and salt. Top with the parsley. Bake another half an hour, or until cooked until 160f. ; name: pan fried brussels sprouts with sriracha honey and lime ; ingredients: brussels sprout, sriracha sauce, honey, lime juice, salt, olive oil ; preparation:

name: colby hash browns casserole ; ingredients: milk, beef broth, butter, salt, pepper, garlic powder, frozen hash brown potatoes, colby cheese ; preparation:In a large bowl, combine the milk, broth, 1 tablespoon butter, salt, pepper and garlic powder. Stir in hash browns. Heat remaining butter in a large nonstick skillet. Add hash brown mixture. Cook and stir over medium heat until potatoes are heated through. Stir in cheese. Transfer to a greased shallow 2 quart baking dish. Bake, uncovered, at 350 for 40-45 minutes or until potatoes are tender. ; name: easy dijon roasted potatoes ; ingredients: potatoes, olive oil, dijon mustard, dried oregano, salt and pepper ; preparation:Place potatoes in a large baking dish or roasting pan. Combine remaining ingredients. Drizzle over potatoes. Toss to coat. Bake at 424f for 30-40 minutes, stirring often, until potatoes are tender. ; name: tuscan avocado dip ; ingredients: avocado, fruit-fresh produce protector, plum tomatoes, white onion, feta cheese, italian dressing, crackers ; preparation:In a medium mixing bowl, combine avocado and procdue protector. Stir until avocadis is well coated. Add tomatoes, onion, feta cheese and salad dressing. Stir until combined. Serve with crackers or refrigerate until ready to serve. ; name: crustless apple cinnamon pie ; ingredients: apples, splenda brown sugar blend, cinnamon, salt, water, butter, cheddar cheese, cooking spray ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400f. Peel, core and slice apples into a bowl. Add brown sugar, cinnamon, water and salt. Mix well to coat apples. Place in two ramikins or small au gratin dishes, sprayed with cooking spray. Dot with butter and spread cheese over top. Bake for 20 to 30 minutes or until apples fall. ; name: bacon stuffed mushrooms ; ingredients: fresh mushrooms, onion, butter, breadcrumbs, cheddar cheese, bacon ; preparation:Clean mushrooms with cool water. Remove stems from mushrooms and chop. Cook onions and chopped mushroom stems in butter until tender. Add bread crumbs. Remove from heat. Stir in bacon and cheese. Mound filling into mushroom caps. Place in shallow baking pan. Bake at 400 degrees for 15 minutes, until cheese is melted. Serve warm. ; name: filipino shrimps sauteed ; ingredients: shrimp, onions, garlic cloves, soy sauce, mountain dew soda, sugar, cornstarch, water, tomatoes, oil ; preparation:Put oil in skillet. Add crushed cloves garlic and finely diced onion. Peel and devein shrimp leaving tails on. Add to pan fry. Add tomato diced fine. Add sugar. Add mountain dew or sprite. Cook 5 minutes. Add cornstarch and water. Cook until thick. ; name: warm artichoke and salsa dip ; ingredients: marinated artichoke hearts, green onion, green chili salsa, monterey jack cheese, sour cream, fresh cilantro ; preparation:Drain and discard marinade from artichokes. Coarsely chop artichokes, and combine with green onion and green salsa in saucepan. Stir frequently over medium heat until mixture is warmed throughout. Remove from heat before stirring in cheese, sour cream, and cilantro. Serve warm. ; name: anisbroetli aniseed biscuits ; ingredients: eggs, icing sugar, kirsch, anise seed, salt, plain flour ; preparation:

name: amazing and fast pressure cooker short ribs ; ingredients: beef short ribs, light olive oil, beef broth, red wine, sweet onion, garlic cloves, honey, brown sugar, coarse salt, black pepper ; preparation:Heat oil in heavy pan then brown short ribs in the oil. Put short ribs in pressure cooker. Put in pressure cooker red wine, beef broth, onion,. Garlic, honey, brown sugar, salt and pepper. Bring to high pressure. Cook at high pressure for one hour. Turn off and let steam come down naturally -- do not open cooker until steam is completely released. Serve. ; name: grilled zucchini with cumin ; ingredients: zucchini, olive oil, cumin, salt, pepper ; preparation:Cut zucchini in half lengthwise. Make criss-cross hatches into the cut side of the flesh. Season with salt and pepper. Drizzle with olive oil. Sprinkle with cumin. Grill on medium hot grill for about 5 minutes on each side, or until desired tenderness. ; name: beet greens with raisins and pine nuts ; ingredients: dark raisin, crusty bread, olive oil, pine nuts, beet leaves, allspice, garlic cloves, salt & freshly ground black pepper ; preparation:Place the raisins in a small heat proof bowl. Pour boiling water over the raisins and let soak for 10 minutes. Drain. Meanwhile, cut the bread slice up into small cubes. Heat up 2 tablespoons of the olive oil on medium heat and saute the bread cubes until golden. Drain. Heat the remaining olive oil in the pan and saute the pine nuts until they begin to turn golden color. Add the beet greens, allspice and garlic. Cook quickly and cook just until beet greens start to wilt. Stir in the drained raisins and season with salt and pepper to taste. Transfer the greens to a serving platter. Sprinkle with the croutons and serve hot. ; name: hedgehog cookies ; ingredients: walnuts, dates, brown sugar, flaked coconut, egg ; preparation:Combine the walnuts, dates and brown sugar in a large bowl. Add egg and half of the coconut, mix well. Shape into balls, roll in remaining coconut. Bake at 350 degrees for 12 to 14 minutes or until lightly browned. Remove to rack to cool. ; name: amalou almond honey butter ; ingredients: almonds, walnut oil, salt, honey ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Spread almonds onto a baking sheet in a single layer. Roast about 10 to 15 minutes, until slightly browned, tossing a couple of times for even browning. Let cool to touch. In a blender, mix or pulse the almonds with the walnut oil and salt. This can take about 10 minutes or so. Once smooth, spoon in honey and blend for 30 seconds to mix thoroughly. ; name: carrots and mushrooms saute ; ingredients: carrots, olive oil, garlic clove, fresh mushrooms, sugar, dried thyme, salt, black pepper ; preparation:Place carrots in a medium saucepan. Add water to cover by one inch. Bring to a boil. Partially cover and boil until tender crisp, about 5-8 minutes. Drain. Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium low heat. Add garlic and mushrooms and saute, stirring occasionally, until mushroom liquid evaporates, about 6 minutes. Add carrots, sugar, thyme, salt and pepper, cover and cook over low heat 15 minutes. Uncover, remove garlic. Discard. Increase heat to medium-high. Cook, stirring often, until carrots and mushrooms are very lightly browned, 2-5 minutes. ; name: pecan pie award winning ; ingredients: pie crusts, eggs, sugar, light corn syrup, dark corn syrup, butter, vanilla, pecans ; preparation:Defrost frozen pie crust. Combine eggs and next 5 ingredients. Stir in pecans. Pour into pie shell. Bake 350 degrees for 50 minutes. Cool on a rack. 1 frozen deep-dish pastry shell may be substituted. ; name: homemade corn syrup substitute simple syrup ; ingredients: white sugar, water, cream of tartar, salt ; preparation:

name: light creamed lemon spinach ; ingredients: unsalted butter, onion, garlic cloves, all-purpose flour, skim milk, frozen chopped spinach, fresh lemon juice, lemon zest, imitation bacon bits, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Melt butter in a heavy nonstick skillet over medium high heat. Saut onion and garlic about 6 minutes until tender. Add flour and cook 2 minutes, stirring frequently. Gradually whisk in milk. Increase heat to high and whisk 2-3 minutes, or until mixture boils and begins to thicken. Reduce heat to low and stir in remaining ingredients, except cheese. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Cook until heated through. Serve sprinkled with parmesan cheese. ; name: orange strawberry and kiwi salad ww ; ingredients: orange juice, honey, oranges, strawberries, grapes, kiwi fruits, mint leaves ; preparation:In a nonmetallic bowl, combine orange juice and honey. Add the fruits. Toss to coat. Refrigerate, covered, until chilled, at least 1 hour. Sprinkle with mint before serving. ; name: peanutty chocolate pudding ; ingredients: nonfat milk, sugar-free instant chocolate pudding mix, natural-style peanut butter, sugar-free whipped topping ; preparation:In a mixing bowl, combine milk and pudding mix. Beat on low speed for 2 minutes. Beat in peanut butter until smooth. Spoon into desert dishes. Top with whipped topping if desired. ; name: frosty caterpillar dessert ; ingredients: cream-filled chocolate sandwich cookies, sherbet, semi-sweet chocolate chips, red licorice, miniature marshmallows, red-hot candies, decorative candies, gummy worms ; preparation:Sprinkle cookie crumbs on serving platter. Arrange sherbert scoops in a zigzag pattern over crumbs, forming a caterpillar. For eyes, press chocolate chips into the first scoop. Using a toothpick, make two small holes above eyes. For antennae, insert the end of a licorice piece ino each marshmallow. Insert the other end of licorice in the holes. Add red hot for nose. Press dots onto the back of the caterpillar. Garnish with gummy worms.
