name: tuna pita ; ingredients: tuna in water, celery ribs, green onions, fresh dill, plain nonfat yogurt, dry mustard, celery salt, whole wheat pita bread, tomatoes, lettuce ; preparation:Drain and flake tuna with a fork. Combine with celery, green onion and dill. Blend together yogurt, mustard, and celery salt, then mix with tuna. Cut pita bread in half and line with lettuce and tomato slices. Add tuna and serve. ; name: frito corn salad ; ingredients: whole kernel corn, red pepper, yellow pepper, green pepper, green onion, mayonnaise, cheese, fritos corn chips ; preparation:Drain canned corn. Dice peppers and green onion. Put in a large bowl and add mayonaise, you could increase this to 1 cup and cheese. Just before serving add the fritos. The recipe calls for chili cheese fritos. ; name: cranberry mincemeat tarts ; ingredients: mincemeat, whole berry cranberry sauce, orange, orange liqueur, prepared tart shells ; preparation:In saucepan, combine mincemeat and cranberry sauce, stir constantly till almost boiling on medium heat. Remove from heat. Grate orange peel and chop orange segments. Add orange peel, chopped orange and liqueur. Spoon into tart shell and place on baking sheet. Bake in preheated 400f oven for about 20 minutes or until pastry is golden. ; name: open faced cordon bleu ; ingredients: eggs, italian seasoned breadcrumbs, boneless skinless chicken breast halves, vegetable oil, butter, diced tomatoes, oregano, salt, ham, monterey jack cheese ; preparation:Beat eggs in shallow dish. Place bread crumbs in another shallow dish. Dip chicken in egg, then crumbs. Heat oil and butter in lg skillet. Brown chicken on both sides. Put chicken in baking pan. Pour tomatoes over chicken. Sprinkle with oregano and salt. Top chicken pieces with ham and then cheese. Bake at 375 for 15 minutes, or until tomato juice is bubbly. ; name: scallop martinis ; ingredients: vodka, lime juice, jalapeno peppers, olive oil, fresh scallops, salt & freshly ground black pepper, red pepper, yellow pepper, green onions, coriander ; preparation:Combine vodka, lime juice and jalapeo pepper in bowl. Heat oil in a skillet over high heat. Season scallops with salt and pepper and place in skillet. Sear about 2 minutes per side or until scallops are browned on the outside but still raw in the centre. Place scallops on board and cut into quarters and add to vodka mixture. Let marinate for 4 hours in the refrigerator. Stir in peppers and green onions. Divide scallop mixture between 4 martini glasses adding some marinade. Garnish with coriander. Serve at once. ; name: krapt and sausage sauerkraut and smoked sausage ; ingredients: sausage, sauerkraut, onion, garlic, olive oil ; preparation:Slice sausage lengthwise and then cut the pieces into half moons as thick or as thin as you would like. Thinner slices create a meatier presentation and thicker slices create a meatier bite. In a large skillet or a medium pot heat oil and saut onion and garlic until onion is translucent. Add sausage and almost sear it. Add drained kraut, stir and heat throughout. ; name: pineapple orange wave shake ; ingredients: banana, crushed pineapple in juice, vanilla yogurt, orange juice, vodka, orange wedges ; preparation:Remove peel from banana and cut into chunks. Wrap chunks in plastic wrap and freeze banana for at least 2 hours. Add pineapple, frozen banana chunks, yogurt, orange juice and vodka to a blender. Cover and blend on high speed about 1 minute or until smooth. Pour into 4 glasses and decorate with orange wedges. ; name: maple custard ; ingredients: eggs, maple syrup, whole milk, salt, nutmeg ; preparation:

name: bloody mary style cabbage jambalaya ; ingredients: ground beef, coleslaw mix, onion, red bell pepper, green bell pepper, yellow bell pepper, rice, bloody mary mix ; preparation:Brown ground meat. When almost done browning, add bell peppers and onions. Brown until bell pepper is limp. Add bag of cole slaw mix and mix completely. Add enough bloody mary mix to cover entire mixture until it is about an inch above. Add uncooked rice and mix thoroughly. Stir occasionally until rice is fluffy and cooked. ; name: ila s delightful sugar cookies ; ingredients: butter, powdered sugar, granulated sugar, eggs, flour, baking soda, cream of tartar, vanilla ; preparation:Cream butter, sugars and eggs until fluffy and mixed well. Add flour, soda cream of tarter and vanilla. Blending thoroughly. Roll out onto lightly floured surface to - inch thickness. Cut with cookie cutters. Sprinkle with sugar if desired. Bake for 12-15 min at 325. ; name: champagne grape and shrimp salad sandwiches ; ingredients: baby shrimp, champagne grapes, chives, lemons, mayonnaise, extra virgin olive oil, roll ; preparation:Preheat oven to 300f. Rinse and drain the shrimp and grapes. In a bowl, combine mayonnaise and juice of 2 lemons. Add shrimp, grapes, chives. Combine and let flavors combine while you prepare the rolls. Open all the rolls and drizzle inside olive oil and remaining lemon. Put rolls in oven to toast. When rolls are golden, remove from oven. Place bottom of rolls on plates, top generously with shrimp mixture. Place top of rolls off center so shrimp salad is visible. Garnish with some chives and a lemon slice if desired. ; name: agua de valencia ; ingredients: orange juice, gin, vodka, sparkling wine, sugar, lemons, ice cube ; preparation:To a pitcher add orange juice, gin, vodka and cava or champagne. Add sugar, a pinch at a time. Stir and taste until desired sweetness is acheived. Refrigerate until chilled. Fill a glass with 2 or 3 ice cubes and fill. Garnish with lemon or lime wedges. ; name: shrimp veggie alfredo ; ingredients: fettuccine pasta, snap peas, red pepper, carrots, garlic cloves, vegetable oil, medium shrimp, alfredo sauce ; preparation:Cook fettuccini according to package directions. Meanwhile, in a large skillet, saute the peas, red pepper, carrots, and garlic in 2 tablespoons of the oil until tender. Remove from skillet. Add remaining oil to skillet and saute shrimp until pink in color. Return vegetables to skillet. Mix well. Drain pasta. Place pasta on serving dishes, drizzle with aflredo sauce, and top with shrimp mixture. ; name: honey garlic roasted chicken drumsticks ; ingredients: chicken legs, milk, cornstarch, soy sauce, liquid honey, rice vinegar, fresh garlic cloves, green onions, toasted sesame seeds, hot chili sauce ; preparation:Set oven to 425 degrees. Butter a 13x9-in baking pan. Place the chicken legs in baking dish. In a bowl, gradually whisk milk into cornstarch. Whisk in soy sauce, honey, vinegar and garlic. Pour over chicken. Toss to coat. Bake for 25 minutes, stirring twice, until chicken is cooked, and until sauce is bubbling, and starting to thicken. Stir the green onions into dish, and sprinkle with toasted sesame seeds. Bake 10 minutes longer, or until the chicken is cooked. ; name: cream filled strawberries ; ingredients: fresh strawberries, nonfat milk, sugar-free instant vanilla pudding mix, reduced-fat whipped topping, almond extract ; preparation:Remove stems from strawberries. Cut a deep x in the top of each berry. Spread berries apart. In a bowl, whisk milk and pudding mix for 2 minutes. Fold in whipping topping and almond extract. Pipe or spoon about 5 teaspoons into each berry. Chill until serving. ; name: stuffers ; ingredients: ground beef, onion, green pepper, mushrooms, ketchup, relish, cheese, prepared mustard, hot dog buns ; preparation:

name: festival and theme park turkey legs ; ingredients: turkey legs, carbonated lemon-lime beverage, sugar, hot sauce, crushed red pepper flakes, black pepper, sweet onion, honey, steak seasoning, ground black pepper ; preparation:Combine soda, sugar, hot sauce, red pepper flakes, black pepper and onion slices in a large pot. Bring to a low boil and add turkey legs. Boil over a medium heat for about 30 minutes or until the turkey legs register an internal temperature of 165 degrees f. Meanwhile, preheat grill. Place onion slices on the heated grill and put the turkey legs on top of the onion slices. Brush with honey and sprinkle with steak seasoning and pepper. Grill over a medium heat for about 15 minutes watching carefully to avoid burning. Turn as needed. The skin should be crispy brown when the turkey legs are done. ; name: creamy cabbage and potato soup ; ingredients: onion, garlic cloves, russet potatoes, water, cabbage, skim milk, flour, velveeta reduced fat cheese product, salt, fresh ground pepper ; preparation:Spray soup pot with cooking spray over medium-high heat. Add the garlic and onion and saute for 3-5 minutes. Add the potatoes and 3c water. Bring to a boil. Then reduce heat and simmer for for 15 minutes. Stirring occasionally. Add shredded cabbage and cook for 10-15 minutes or until cabbage is tender. Whisk the water, flour and skim milk together and add to to soup. Add cubed cheese and stir until cheese is melted and soup is heated through. Add salt and pepper to taste. ; name: killer kahlua ; ingredients: water, sugar, instant coffee, pure vanilla extract, monarch 151 rum ; preparation:Bring to boil water and sugar. Remove from heat and add instant. Coffee. Bring to boil again. Remove from heat and add vanilla extract. Cool before adding rum. Put in bottles and cork. Makes about 3 fifths. ; name: gretchen s swedish chocolate oatmeal cookies ; ingredients: butter, sugar, egg, flour, baking powder, cocoa, old fashioned oats ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400f. Beat butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Add egg and beat slightly to combine. In a separate bowl, sift together flour, baking powder, and cocoa. Add to batter gradually. Then stir in the oatmeal. Roll cookie dough into balls and then place on baking sheet. Using a buttered glass dipped into decorative sugars, press lightly to spread into more of a cookie shape. Bake in the middle of the oven for 8-10 minutes. ; name: mrs markovitz s sweet noodle kugel ; ingredients: medium noodles, eggs, pineapple tidbits, lemon juice, sugar, vanilla, margarine, salt, corn flake crumbs, dark brown sugar ; preparation:Boil and drain noodles. In a large bowl, mix all ingredients except the topping. Pour into greased rectangular pan. Mix topping and spread in an even layer over kugel. Bake at 350 for 1 hour. ; name: spiced lemonade ; ingredients: cloves, cinnamon stick, cranberry juice, water, sugar, frozen concentrated lemonade ; preparation:Mix spices, cranberry juice, and water in saucepan. Bring to a rolling boil. Cover, remove from heat, and let stand about 3 minutes. Strain and discard spices. Add sugar and stir until dissolved. Add lemonade. Mix well. Reheat, and serve hot. Garnish each serving with half an orange slice and a sprig of mint or a green cherry. ; name: granny s broccoli casserole ; ingredients: frozen chopped broccoli, cream of celery soup, cheddar cheese, eggs, milk, mayonnaise, horseradish, butter, cheese cracker crumbs ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350f drain broccoli well, do not cook. Combine soup, cheese, eggs, milk, mayonnaise and horseradish. Mix in broccoli. Spoon into a 2-quart well-buttered casserole dish. Combine melted butter and cracker crumbs, sprinkle over casserole. Bake for 45 minutes. ; name: fried pork dumplings ; ingredients: ground pork, green onions, hoisin sauce, low sodium soy sauce, water chestnuts, egg, wonton wrappers, oil ; preparation:

name: mary s swiss steak ; ingredients: margarine, onions, round steaks, flour, salt, pepper, paprika, water, sour cream ; preparation:Melt 4 tbsp margarine in a large skillet, then saut onions. Remove from the skillet. Coat the steak with the flour. Season with salt and pepper. Melt remaining margarine in the skillet and brown the meat well on both sides. Mix with steak the onions, water, sour cream until blended. Cover and cook over medium heat till meat is tender. Uncover and cook until the sauce thickens. Serve over hot cooked rice or noodles. ; name: leek cream soup ; ingredients: leeks, cauliflower, onion, vegetable bouillon granules, cream, salt and pepper, parsley ; preparation:Cut the leek in small pieces. Cut the center out of the cauliflower and separate the flowerets. Cook the leek, onion and cauliflower in the vegetable bouillon until soft. With the mixer, mix the soup until smooth. Heat again, stirring the cream in. Serve with the parsley sprinkled on top. ; name: loz almond sweetmeats ; ingredients: ground almonds, icing sugar, orange blossom water, pistachio nuts, caster sugar ; preparation:Combine the finely chopped pistachio nuts and caster sugar, and set aside. Combine the ground almonds and icing sugar with enough orange-blossom water to form a stiff paste. Knead until smooth and allow to rest for about 10 minutes. Shape the paste into small balls the size of a walnut, and using a teaspoon handle, make a small hole in each ball and fill it with the combined pistachio nuts and caster sugar. Close the hole over the filling and reshape to a round shape. Roll the balls in icing sugar and place in small paper cups or on a serving plate. Decorate the top of each ball with a peeled pistachio nut. Serve with coffee. ; name: caponata wraps ; ingredients: baby spinach leaves, low-carb flour tortillas, spreadable cheese with garlic and herbs, roasted bell pepper hummus, fresh mushrooms, caponata ; preparation:Stack spinach leaves, about 12 at a time, then cut crosswise into narrow strips and set aside. For each wrap, spread a fourth of the cheese to within half an inch of edge of each tortilla. Scattter spinach strips over the bottom two thirds of the tortilla and gently press onto the cheese. Mix hummus and mushrooms in a medium bowl, then spooon on top of spinach, spreading to cover. Top with a fourth of the caponata and roll up tightly from the bottom. To serve, cut each wrap diagonally. ; name: peanut butter hazelnut pudding trail mix ; ingredients: kix cereal, hazelnuts, golden raisin, banana chips, vanilla pudding mix, honey, peanut butter ; preparation:Combine the cereal, nuts, raisins and banana chips. In saucepan, combine vanilla pudding and honey. Bring to a boil and boil 30 seconds. Remove from heat. Stir in peanut butter. Mix well. Pour over the cereal mix and combine until coated. Put on cookie sheet to cool. ; name: alton brown s stove top mac n cheese ; ingredients: elbow macaroni, butter, eggs, evaporated milk, hot sauce, kosher salt, fresh black pepper, dry mustard, sharp cheddar cheese ; preparation:In a large pot of boiling, salted water cook the pasta to al dente and drain. Return to the pot and melt in the butter. Toss to coat. Whisk together the eggs, milk, hot sauce, salt, pepper, and mustard. Stir into the pasta and add the cheese. Over low heat continue to stir for 3 minutes or until creamy. ; name: savory gingered sweet potatoes ; ingredients: sweet potatoes, olive oil, dried red chili pepper, garlic cloves, fresh gingerroot, salt, balsamic vinegar ; preparation:Preheat oven to 375 degrees place scrubbed whole sweet potatoes in a baking dish and cook until tender. In a saucepan, heat oil and pepper over medium high heat until browned on all sides. Discard pepper, add garlic and ginger and cook until barely tender. Stir in salt and balsamic vinegar to taste and simmer over low heat until ready to serve. When tender, split each potato, drizzle with ginger sauce and serve hot. ; name: green chili chicken sandwiches ; ingredients: boneless skinless chicken breast halves, soy sauce, cider vinegar, sugar, vegetable oil, whole green chilies, monterey jack pepper cheese, kaiser rolls ; preparation:

name: salsa para tacos tucson s el charro ; ingredients: crushed tomatoes, tomato puree, water, white onion, garlic paste, oil, vinegar, dried oregano, salt, chilies ; preparation:Mix all ingredients in a saucepan. Bring to the boil and turn off the heat. Cool. Taste and adjust seasoning. Can be served cold or hot. Refrigerate up to 1 week. ; name: swiss melt with tomato and fresh basil ; ingredients: italian bread, reduced-fat swiss cheese, tomatoes, salt, fresh ground black pepper, fresh basil leaf, butter ; preparation:Spread outside of each piece of bread with 1 t butter. Layer 4 slices of bread with 2 pieces of cheese and 2 slices of tomato each. Salt and pepper, if desired. Top each sandwich evenly with the basil and 1 slice of bread. Heat a skillet over medium-high heat. Place 1 sandwich into skillet. Cook, turning once, until sandwich is golden brown, about 4-5 minutes. Repeat with remaining sandwiches. ; name: microwave acorn squash ; ingredients: acorn squash, brown sugar, butter, honey, salt, pepper ; preparation:Cut squash in half. Discard seeds. Place squash cut side down in a microwave-safe dish. Cover and microwave on high for 10-12 minutes or until tender. Turn squash cut side up. Fill centers with brown sugar, butter and honey. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Cover and microwave on high for 2-3 minutes or until heathed through. ; name: light creamed lemon spinach ; ingredients: unsalted butter, onion, garlic cloves, all-purpose flour, skim milk, frozen chopped spinach, fresh lemon juice, lemon zest, imitation bacon bits, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Melt butter in a heavy nonstick skillet over medium high heat. Saut onion and garlic about 6 minutes until tender. Add flour and cook 2 minutes, stirring frequently. Gradually whisk in milk. Increase heat to high and whisk 2-3 minutes, or until mixture boils and begins to thicken. Reduce heat to low and stir in remaining ingredients, except cheese. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Cook until heated through. Serve sprinkled with parmesan cheese. ; name: savory italian asparagus ; ingredients: fresh asparagus, tomatoes, green onions, dried oregano, dried whole thyme, pepper, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Snap off tough ends of asparagus. Remove scales with a knife or vegetable peeler, if desired. Cover and cook in small amount of boiling water 4 minutes or until crisp-tender. Drain. Arrange on serving platter and keep warm. Combine tomato and next 4 ingredients in a small bowl. Stir well. Spoon tomato mixture over asparagus. Sprinkle with cheese. Serve. ; name: orange witches brew punch ; ingredients: orange gelatin, sugar, boiling water, apricot nectar, pineapple juice, lemon juice, ginger ale ; preparation:In a large bowl, dissolve gelatin and sugar in water. Stir in the apricot nectar, pineapple juice and lemon juice. Freeze in two 2-qt. Freezer containers. Remove from the freezer 2-3 hours before serving. Place contents of one container in a punch bowl. Mash with potato masher. Stir in ginger ale just before serving. Repeat. ; name: southern sausage onion cornbread ; ingredients: sausage, onion, eggs, sugar, milk, vegetable oil, cream-style corn, cheddar cheese, self-rising cornmeal mix ; preparation:Brown sausage and onion. Drain well. In medium size bowl combine eggs, sugar, milk, oil, corn and cheese. Stir in cornmeal mix. Pour one-half of mixture into a greased 9 x 9 inch baking dish. Sprinkle sausage and onions over mixture. Pour remaining mixture over top. Bake in a 350 degree oven for 35 to 40 minutes. May sprinkle small amount of cheese over top during last 3-5 minutes of baking. ; name: penne with creamy garlic sauce ; ingredients: penne rigate, butter, garlic cloves, flour, chicken, milk, dried parsley flakes, salt and pepper, parmesan cheese ; preparation:

name: savory roast rub ; ingredients: ground marjoram, ground sage, ground thyme, ground black pepper, salt, garlic powder, msg ; preparation:Combine all ingredients in a bowl, and whisk together well. Can also be blended in the food processor. Coat all sides of roast well and rub inches. Allow to macerate for an hour or so. Roast meat as you normally would. Be prepared to fill the house with an aroma thick and delicious enough to eat. ; name: south pacific pork chops ; ingredients: center-cut pork chops, salt, pepper, sherry wine, soy sauce, vegetable oil, garlic clove, ground ginger, oregano, maple syrup ; preparation:Heat oven to 350 degrees. Slightly salt and pepper pork. Brown pork chops in cast iron skillet. Place chops in a baking dish. Put all other ingredients into a blender, cover & process until smooth. Pour over chops, cover & bake 1 hour or until tender. Turn once during baking to give both sides added browning. ; name: alamo tamale supper crock pot ; ingredients: beef tamales, onion, corn, tomato sauce, chili powder, cheddar cheese, olive ; preparation:Slice tamales in half crosswise and arrange in bottom of greased crock-pot. Sprinkle chopped onion over tamales. Add corn. Mix tomato sauce and chili powder. Pour into crock-pot. Top with shredded cheese and sprinkle with sliced ripe olives. Cover and cook on low setting for 5 to 7 hours or on high setting for 2 hours. Double recipe for 5-quart crock-pot. ; name: mussels in white wine and garlic ; ingredients: mussels, dry white wine, shallots, garlic cloves, salt, mixed fresh herbs, butter ; preparation:Rinse and scrub mussels under cold water. Using your fingers or paring knife, remove beards, and discard. In a large stockpot set over medium heat, combine wine, shallots, garlic, and salt. Simmer 5 minutes. Add mussels, cover, and increase heat to high. Cook until all mussels are open, about 5 minutes. Stir in herbs and butter. Remove from heat. Divide mussels and broth among four bowls. Serve immediately. ; name: almond sponge cake ; ingredients: egg whites, baking soda, salt, sugar, cornstarch, almond meal ; preparation:Whip the egg whites till very stiff with salt and baking soda. Add the sugar a little at a time while continuously beating. Mix cornstarch and almonds. Fold into meringue. Spread batter into two circles, roughly 21 cm in diameter, on baking paper. Bake in the middle of the oven at 150 degrees celcious for about an hour. Let cool on a grill. ; name: homemade italian salad dressing ; ingredients: salad oil, wine vinegar, salt, sugar, dried oregano leaves, dry mustard, paprika, garlic clove ; preparation:Combine all ingredients in a jar with a lid. Cover and shake to mix thoroughly. Let stand at least 2 hours to blend seasonings. Shake well before using. Wonderful on italian lettuce salad. ; name: artichoke garlic parmesan dip ; ingredients: artichoke hearts, parmesan cheese, mayonnaise, garlic, wheatables crackers ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350f. Drain artichoke hearts and puree them in your food processor. Mix pureed artichoke hearts, one cup of mayonnaise, one cup of parmesan cheese and garlic to taste in an oven safe bowl or small casserole dish. Bake in oven at 350f degrees for 25-35 minutes until light golden brown. Let cool for 10 minutes before serving with wheatables vegetable flavored crackers. ; name: oyster parmesan ; ingredients: onion, garlic cloves, olive oil, cayenne pepper, bacon, oyster, seasoned dry bread crumbs, parmesan cheese ; preparation:

name: white chocolate pudding cookies ; ingredients: unsalted butter, granulated sugar, light brown sugar, vanilla instant pudding mix, eggs, vanilla extract, all-purpose flour, baking soda, salt, white chocolate chips ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a large mixing bowl, cream together the butter and two sugars until well combined. Beat in vanilla pudding mix. Add eggs, one at a time, until well incorporated. Mix in vanilla extract. In another small bowl, mix together flour, baking soda, and salt. Add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients, mixing until just incorporated. Fold in m&ms and white chocolate chips. Drop tablespoon size cookie dough onto prepared cookie sheet. Bake for 10 minutes, or until just turning golden brown. Cool on cookie sheet for 5 minutes before removing to wire rack to cool completely. ; name: coarse black pepper cheese bread ; ingredients: flour, yeast, sugar, salt, fresh coarse ground black pepper, milk, shortening, water, egg, cheddar cheese ; preparation:In a large mixing bowl, combine 2 cups flour, yeast, sugar, salt and pepper. Mix well in a saucepan, heat milk, water and shortening until warm. Add to flour mixture add egg and beat at low speed until moistened. Beat 3 minutes at medium speed. By hand, add cheese and enough flour to make a firm dough. Knead well on a floured surface until smooth and elastic, about 10 minutes. Punch dough down, divide into 2 parts. Shape into 2 round loaves. Place on a greased baking sheet, cover and let rise in a warm oven until light and doubled, about 30 minutes. Bake at 375 degrees for 20-25 minutes, until golden brown. Cool on racks, makes 2 loaves. ; name: egg fried rice ; ingredients: frozen peas, eggs, sesame oil, peanut oil, cooked rice, salt, pepper, spring onions, fresh bean sprouts ; preparation:Thaw frozen peas. Drain in colander. Combine eggs and sesame oil in a small bowl and set aside. Heat a wok over high heat until hot. Add the oil and when it is hot and slightly smoking, turn the heat to medium and add the eggs. Stir fry the eggs for 2 minutes, then add the cooked rice and stir fry for 3 minutes, mixing well. Then add the peas, salt and pepper. Stir fry 5 minutes over high heat. Add spring onions and bean sprouts and stir fry for 2 minutes. Turn onto a platter and serve at once. ; name: hot mulled apple cider ; ingredients: brown sugar, whole allspice, whole cloves, salt, nutmeg, cinnamon sticks, apple cider, orange wedge ; preparation:Combine brown sugar, allspice, 1 teaspoon cloves, salt, nutmeg, cinnamon and apple cider in large saucepan. Bring to boiling. Cover and simmer for 20 minutes. Strain to remove spices. Serve in mugs with clove-studded orange wedges. ; name: mozzarella and basil pesto tramezzini ; ingredients: basil pesto, sandwich bread, fresh mozzarella cheese, salt, fresh ground pepper ; preparation:Spread a thin layer of basil pesto over each slice of white bread. Cover half the bread slices with the mozzarella slices. The layer of mozzarella should be about inch thick. Season with salt and pepper before covering with the remaining slices of bread. Before serving, use a serrated knife to remove the crusts and cut each sandwich into triangles. ; name: summer squash saute ; ingredients: butter, onion, garlic, fresh tarragon, crookneck yellow squash, zucchini ; preparation:Melt butter in large skillet over medium-high heat. Add onion, garlic and tarragon. Saute until onion is just tender, about 2 minutes. Add yellow squash and zucchini. Saute until crisp-tender, about 8 minutes or less. Season with salt and pepper and serve. ; name: italian wedding cakes ; ingredients: flour, shortening, sugar, vanilla extract, eggs, baking powder ; preparation:Combine flour and shortening as if for pie crust. Add baking powder and combine. In a separate bowl, beat eggs and then add sugar and vanilla. Add flour mixture to egg mixture. To shape cookies, you can simply roll them into 1-inch balls or you can roll them into logs and fold them into pretzel shapes. They will puff up some but will mostly retain whatever shape you form them into. Bake at 350 degrees for 12 to 14 minutes. They will not brown much. Cool and frost with your favorite glaze and add sprinkles. For convenience, you can melt store-bought frosting. ; name: new england onion soup ; ingredients: butter, onions, flour, milk, chicken broth, salt, pepper, mace, egg yolks, parsley ; preparation:

name: orange glazed carrots with mint ; ingredients: baby carrots, vegetable oil, ginger, garlic, shallot, honey, orange juice, soy sauce, water, of fresh mint ; preparation:Cut the carrots on the diagonal into 3-inch lengths. Cut thicker pieces in half lengthwise to make them uniform in size. Heat the oil in a 9-inch saute pan over moderate heat. Add the carrots and cook until lightly browned on all sides, about 3 minutes per side. Season with salt and pepper. Add the ginger, garlic, and shallots and cook over medium-low heat, stirring occasionally, until the shallots are softened, 5-7 minutes. Add the honey, orange juice, soy sauce and water. Cover with a round of waxed paper that fits snugly on the vegetables. Cook the carrots slowly on top of the stove, stirring occasionally, until the carrots are tender and the juices have formed a glaze, 30-40 minutes. Garnish with the mint. ; name: low fat low calorie chocolate fudge ; ingredients: sugar, light corn syrup, nonfat milk, cocoa powder, vanilla extract, light butter ; preparation:In a 3-quart saucepan, combine the sugar, milk, cocoa, and corn syrup. Heat on medium heat until the mixture reaches 240f stirring constantly. Take the mixture off the heat and add butter and vanilla. Let cool to 110f and then stir until mixture loses its gloss. Spoon into a foiled 9x13-inch pan and let harden. Cut into squares. ; name: hot for hummus ; ingredients: chickpeas, lemon juice, tahini, harissa, garlic cloves, fresh parsley leaves, salt, water ; preparation:Place the chickpeas and lemon juice in a food processor and process until smooth. Add the tahini, harissa, garlic, parsley, and salt. Drizzle water in while processing until the desired consistency is achieved. Process until smooth and well blended. Transfer to a tightly covered container and refrigerate for at least 1 hour before serving to allow the flavors to develop. Stored tightly covered in the refrigerator, hummus will keep for up to 3 days. Serve chilled or at room temperature. ; name: chocolate pudding cake low calorie ; ingredients: flour, sugar, unsweetened cocoa powder, baking powder, salt, nonfat milk, unsweetened applesauce, vanilla extract, boiling water, light brown sugar ; preparation:Spray a 13 x 9 x 2-inch baking pan with cooking spray and set aside. In a large bowl, whisk together flour, sugar, cocoa, baking powder, and salt. Whisk in remaining cake ingredients, blending thoroughly. Pour into baking pan, spreading evenly. In a large bowl, whisk together pudding ingredients until sugar and cocoa are dissolved. Pour carefully over batter. Pudding layer will be thin and runny. Bake for 35-40 minutes, or until top is firm to the touch. Let cake rest for 15 minutes before cutting. Cover and refrigerate leftovers for up to 7 days or wrap tightly and freeze for up to 2 months. ; name: buttered noodles with fresh sage ; ingredients: egg noodles, butter, onion, fresh sage leaves, salt, black pepper, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Cook noodles according to package directions. Drain. Melt butter in the empty pot. Simmer onion and sage leaves 5 minutes. Add salt and pepper. Toss with noodles. Top with parmesan cheese just before serving. ; name: green peppercorn chicken ; ingredients: chicken breast fillet, grainy mustard, green peppercorns, garlic cloves, lemon juice, fresh chives, olive oil, onion ; preparation:In a large bowl, cover chicken with mustard, peppercorns, garlic, lemon juice, chives and half of the oil. Let stand for 30 minutes or so. Heat remaining oil in pan. Add onion and cook until soft. Add chicken mixture to pan. Cook, stirring, until chicken is fully cooked. ; name: cider grilled salmon ; ingredients: apple cider, soy sauce, unsalted butter, garlic, salmon fillet ; preparation:Combine cider and soy in nonreactive pan. Bring to a boil, reduce to medium and cook for 3 minutes. Add butter and garlic. Cook until sauce is thick enough to coat the back of a spoon. Cool for 30 minutes brush marinade over salmon, let sit 30 minutes then cook on grill. ; name: cocktail orange pecans ; ingredients: butter, orange liqueur, orange rind, pecan halves, salt ; preparation:

name: maple tofu pudding ; ingredients: soft tofu, corn oil, maple syrup, salt, vanilla extract, walnuts ; preparation:Drain the tofu and cut it into small pieces. Place the pieces in a blender. Add the oil, maple syrup, salt and vanilla. Put the lid on the blender. Process the mixture for a minute or two, or until the pudding is quite smooth. If necessary, turn off the blender, and scrape down the sides of the blender jar. Then put the lid back on and process some more. When the mixture is smooth, turn it into 4 small, resealable, half-cup containers. Chill until serving time, or serve right away if desired. If you like, you can sprinkle a tablespoon of finely chopped walnuts on top of each serving of pudding. I prefer black walnuts, but any type will do. ; name: easy cheesy eggplant casserole ; ingredients: spaghetti sauce, lowfat mozzarella cheese, fat-free cottage cheese, parmesan cheese, eggplant ; preparation:Grill eggpland on grill for about 5-10 minute or until soft. Spray 8x8 baking pan with non stick spray. Put eggplant on bottom of pan. Spread spaghetti sauce over eggplant. Mix cottage cheese and mozzarella, spread over sauce. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Bake at 350 for 30-35 min and serve hot. ; name: chili de three amigos ; ingredients: onion, ground turkey, olive oil, black beans, kidney beans, garbanzo beans, diced tomatoes, cinnamon, cumin, tabasco sauce ; preparation:Saute onions in olive oil in very large pan or big pot until soft. Add turkey and chunk up and brown. Add everything else. Let simmer for 10 minutes, or up to a couple hours depending on how thick you want it. I like the taste better, but the convenience of the above recipe is great. ; name: filet mignon stack ; ingredients: filet mignon, portabella mushroom, sweet potato, white mushrooms, garlic, burgundy wine, heavy cream, cajun seasoning, butter, green onion ; preparation:Saute portabella mushroom and set aside. Grill filet mignon to desired temperature. In a separate skillet saute quartered mushrooms and roasted garlic for approximately one minute and add cajun seasoning. Add heavy cream and reduce. Stack filet on the portabella, top with the sauce and crown with the sweet potato hay. Garnish with green onions. ; name: spinach gorgonzola and lemon rice ; ingredients: olive oil, fresh mushrooms, gorgonzola, heavy cream, fresh lemon juice, salt, pepper, cooked rice, baby spinach leaves, lemon zest ; preparation:Heat oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add mushrooms and cook until soft. Add cheese & cook 3 minutes. Stir in cream, lemon juice, salt and pepper. Stir in rice and heat until hot, about 5 minutes. Stir in spinach just before serving. Sprinkle with lemon zest to serve. ; name: granny s coconut pie ; ingredients: frozen pie crusts, milk, flaked coconut, sugar, vanilla, eggs, butter ; preparation:Put coconut in a bowl. Pour milk over and set aside. Cream butter and sugar, add eggs one at a time till mixed well. Add vanilla. Stir in coconut and milk. Poke thawed crusts well with a fork. Pour batter evenly into the two crusts. Bake at 350 for 30 to 40 mins or till center is almost set and pie is golden brown. ; name: roasted garlic and tomato savoury custard ; ingredients: cherry tomatoes, bulb of garlic, olive oil, italian seasoning, salt, pepper, eggs, milk, flour, provolone cheese ; preparation:Arrange tomatoes single layer in 1. 5 litre casserole dish. Sprinkle on the garlic slices. Add oil, seasonings and toss to coat. Roast in 425f oven about 20 minutes or until tomato skins start to shrivel. Remove from oven and reduce oven temperature to 350f. In bowl, whisk together eggs, milk and flour. Pour over tomato mixture. Sprinkle with provolone cheese. Bake 40-45 minutes or until puffed and golden. ; name: cumin rubbed grilled pork chops ; ingredients: brown sugar, cider vinegar, ground cumin, ground red pepper, pork loin chops ; preparation:

name: apple cinnamon butter crunch ; ingredients: butter, brown sugar, flour, cinnamon, walnuts, apples, nutmeg ; preparation:Set oven to 375 degrees. Butter a 9 x 9-inch or an 11 x 7-inch baking pan. In a mixing bowl combine all the butter crunch. Mix well to combine with a wooden spoon. Sprinkle half of the mixture onto the bottom of the pan and press down light with back of a spoon. Bake for 15 minutes, or until lightly browned. In a mixing bowl combine the apple slices, brown sugar, flour, cinnamon, nutmeg and melted butter. Toss to combine. Spoon the mixture into the baked crust. Bake for about 30 minutes, or until apples are tender. Remove from oven and sprinkle the remaining butter crunch over the apples, then return to oven for about 10 minutes. Cool to room temperature. ; name: easy taco casserole ; ingredients: ground beef, salsa, taco seasoning, salad dressing, nacho cheese flavored tortilla chips, colby-monterey jack cheese, tomatoes, lettuce ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350f. Brown ground beef. Drain. Mix ground beef with salsa, taco seasoning, and salad dressing. Mix well. In a 2-quart baking dish, layer half of the meat mixture, 1 cup of cheese and 1 cup of the tortilla chips. Repeat the layers. Bake, covered, for 30-40 minutes or until heated through and bubbly. Take off cover the last 10 minutes of baking. Top with lettuce and tomato before serving. ; name: out of this world mai tai ; ingredients: light rum, lime juice, orange curacao, orgeat syrup, dark rum, maraschino cherry ; preparation:Pour all the ingredients except the dark rum into a shaker with ice cubes. Shake well. Strain into an old-fashioned glass half filled with ice. Top with the dark rum. Garnish with the cherry. ; name: caramel ring a round ; ingredients: dark brown sugar, butter, water, nuts, refrigerated biscuits ; preparation:Separate biscuits and cut into fourths. In a bundt pan, place water, sugar, and butter in 425 degree oven for a few minutes, then add nuts and biscuit pieces, and coat. Biscuits should form a ring. Bake 8 to 12 minutes in 425 degree oven. Turn out onto serving platter. ; name: rigatoni with chicken ragout ; ingredients: rigatoni pasta, chicken breasts, mixed herbs, heavy cream, onion, parmesan cheese, white wine, butter, salt, pepper ; preparation:In a saucepan with the butter, fry the onion. Add the chicken breasts, salt, pepper and brown. Pour the white wine, let evaporate and pour the cream, then continue cooking for 5 minutes. Add chopped herbs and mix. Cook the rigatoroni in salted water acording to package directions. When al dente drain and mix with the sauce and parmesan cheese. ; name: herb seasoned squash bake ; ingredients: summer squash, onion, reduced-fat cream of chicken soup, nonfat sour cream, herb seasoned stuffing mix, butter, sage, onion powder, cheddar cheese ; preparation:Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. In a saucepan over medium heat, boil the squash and onion in salted water for 5 minutes. Drain well. Combine the squash, chicken soup, and sour cream. Toss the stuffing mix with butter, sage, and onion powder. Butter a 2 quart casserole dish. Layer half the stuffing in the bottom. Sprinkle half the cheese over the stuffing. Spread the squash over the cheese and top with remaining cheese and then the remaining stuffing. Bake for 30-40 minutes. ; name: tomato salad with ginger garlic dressing ; ingredients: ginger, garlic, sugar, salt, vinegar, olive oil, tomatoes, onion, fresh coriander leaves ; preparation:Crush ginger using mortar and pestle to make fine paste. Add garlic. Crush with ginger. Remove to small bowl. Whisk in salt, sugar, vinegar and oil. In bowl, mix tomatoes, onion and coriander. Add salad dressing. Toss lightly to coat. ; name: grilled cheese with a twist ; ingredients: whole wheat bread, swiss cheese, tomatoes, yellow bell pepper, sliced ripe olives, margarine ; preparation:

name: hamburger tots green bean casserole ; ingredients: hamburger, cream of mushroom soup, green beans, frozen tater tots ; preparation:Brown hamburger. Mix hamburger, soup and green beans. Put this mixture in a buttered 9x13-inch cake pan. Layer the tater tots over the top. Bake at 350f for 45 minutes. ; name: hot bananas with rum and raisins ; ingredients: raisins, dark rum, unsalted butter, light brown sugar, bananas, nutmeg, ground cinnamon, slivered almonds ; preparation:Put the raisins in a bowl with the rum. Let them soak while you saute the bananas. Melt the butter in a frying pan, add the sugar and stir until dissolved. Add the bananas and cook for a few minutes, until tender. Sprinkle the spices over the bananas, then pour the rum and raisins on top. Sprinkle on the almonds and serve. Good with ice cream. ; name: stir fry mushrooms and bell peppers ; ingredients: olive oil, green onions, garlic cloves, bell peppers, champignon mushrooms, chinese rice wine, soy sauce, sesame oil ; preparation:Heat oil til really hot. Stir fry onions, then garlic. Then add peppers and mushrooms. Stir-fry until it becomes a bit soft,. Add the wine and soy sauce and continue to stir for 2 minutes. When done, remove from heat and add the sesame sauce mixing it all together, and serve. ; name: little cheesy meatloafs ; ingredients: egg, milk, mild cheddar cheese, quick oats, onion, salt, lean ground beef, ketchup, brown sugar, prepared mustard ; preparation:Beat egg and milk. Add cheese, oats, onion and salt. Add beef. Mix well. Shape into 8 loaves. Place in greased 13x9 baking pan. Mix ketchup, sugar, and mustard. Spoon over meat loaves. Bake, uncoveed, at 350 for 45 minutes, or until done. ; name: creamy cheesy scrambled eggs ; ingredients: eggs, cheddar cheese, butter, light spreadable cheese with garlic and herbs, salt and pepper ; preparation:Over medium to medium low heat, melt butter in frying pan. Add the wedges of laughing cow cheese and slowly melt. In mixing bowl, crack and whisk eggs until puffy. Add eggs to pan & turn with a spatula. When the eggs are pretty well set, add the shredded cheddar and take the pan off the heat. Mix the cheddar in by folding over the eggs until cheddar is melted. Serve immediately. ; name: roasted garlic mashed sweet potatoes ; ingredients: garlic, olive oil, sweet potatoes, butter, whipping cream, white pepper ; preparation:Cut the top off unpeeled garlic head. Drizzle with olive oil, place in baking pan & bake & 250 degrees for 30 - 40 minutes. Bake the potatoes at 400 degrees for 1 hour or until tender. Cut potatoes in half, scoop into saucepan and mash. Squeeze roasted garlic into the mashed potatoes. Add butter, mash while adding cream a little at a time. Add salt & pepper to taste. ; name: creamy cheddar potatoes ; ingredients: butter, potatoes, salt, fresh ground black pepper, milk, cheddar cheese, parsley ; preparation:In large, nonstick skillet, melt butter. Add potatoes and cook over medium heat until almost tender and lightly browned. Add salt, pepper, and milk, continuing to cook until milk is absorbed and potatoes are tender. Sprinkle with cheese, heating until melted. Stir well, sprinkle with chopped parsley and serve. ; name: swiss carrot casserole ; ingredients: carrots, butter, onions, flour, salt, dry mustard, fresh ground pepper, low-fat milk, swiss cheese, fresh breadcrumbs ; preparation:

name: easy caramel sorbet ; ingredients: sugar, water, salt, vanilla extract ; preparation:In dry heavy saucepan, cook sugar, alone, undisturbed. Over moderate heat until it begins to melt. Continue cooking, stirring with a fork, until it is melted completely& a deep caramel. Remove from heat& carefully add water down side of pan. Return to heat& cook caramel, stirring, until dissolved completely. Stir in salt& vanilla extract& chill until cold. Freeze sorbet in an ice-cream maker. ; name: chicken parmesan heroes ; ingredients: boneless skinless chicken breast halves, egg, italian seasoned breadcrumbs, pasta sauce, mozzarella cheese, italian rolls ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400. Dip chicken in egg, then bread crumbs, coating well. In 13 x 9-inch glass baking dish, arrange chicken. Bake uncovered 20 minutes. Pour pasta sauce over chicken, then top with cheese. Bake an additional 10 minutes or until chicken is thoroughly cooked. To serve, arrange chicken and sauce on rolls. ; name: baked green beans with mushrooms pine nuts ; ingredients: green beans, mushroom, pine nuts, butter, shallots, dried thyme, madeira wine, salt & pepper ; preparation:Saut the mushrooms & shallots in the oil for a minute or two, sprinkle in the thyme line a baking dish with foil. Pour the madeira into the bottom of the foil lined dish, add beans, top with mushroom mixture. Seal the foil. Bake in 375f oven for approx 30 minutes. Open foil and sprinkle with toasted pine nuts. ; name: garlic and parsley potatoes with red and black pepper rachael r ; ingredients: yukon gold potato, garlic cloves, extra virgin olive oil, red pepper flakes, flat leaf parsley, salt and pepper ; preparation:Preheat outdoor grill to high or oven to 500 degrees f. Rip 2 sheets of about 18in. Long foil and stack them together. Cut potatoes into wedges and pile them on the center of the foil. Combine the garlic with the potatoes and sprinkle the evoo, red pepper flakes, parsley, and lots of salt and pepper. Pull the ends of the foil together and fold them over, then close the opposite sides to form a packet. Cook for 20 min, turning once. If cooking on a grill, place packet to the side and not over the direct heat to prevent scorching. ; name: shortcut homemade cinnamon pecan rolls ; ingredients: brown sugar, pecans, butter, cinnamon, frozen bread dough, powdered sugar, milk ; preparation:Roll out thawed frozen bread dough into a 15 x 9 inch rectangle. Combine brown sugar, pecans, butter and cinnamon, and spread over bread dough. Roll up dough length wise and cut into 9 slices. Place slices in a greased 8-inch baking dish and bake at 375 degrees for 27 minutes. Mix powdered sugar with milk and use as glaze for cinnamon rolls. ; name: german pork and cabbage casserole ; ingredients: bacon, country-style pork ribs, salt, pepper, cabbage, onion, apple, carrot, apple cider, caraway seed ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350f. Cook bacon, crumble in bowl. Season ribs with salt and pepper, cook in bacon grease 3-4 minutes on high heat, turning once. Place in greased 9x13 baking dish, leave fat in skillet. Cook cabbage and onion until softened in grease. Remove from heat and mix in other unused ingredients. Spoon over top of pork, sprinkle with bacon. Cover with foil, bake 30-45 minute until center is 160f. ; name: peanut butter chews ; ingredients: rice krispies, sugar, corn syrup, peanut butter ; preparation:Pour cereal into large bowl. In saucepan combine sugar& corn syrup. Stir. Occasionally, bring to a boil over medium heat. And boil 1 minute. Remove from heat, stir in peanut butter until smooth. Pour over cereal, stir to coat well. Press evenly into 9 inch square pan coated. With shortening or cooking spray. Cool completely. Invert pan on cutting board. And cut into bars. ; name: grilled firecracker chicken ; ingredients: salt, garlic powder, pepper, roasting chickens, apricot preserves, sweet chili sauce, scallion, ginger, soy sauce ; preparation:

name: sausage potatoes and peas ; ingredients: italian sausages, sweet peas, potatoes, chicken bouillon cube, hot water, butter, parsley, oregano, salt and pepper ; preparation:Spread sausage links, potatoes and peas in 13 x 9 baking dish. In saucepan over medium heat mix rest of ingredients until boullion cube is dissolved. Pour over sausage, potatoes and peas. Cover tightly with aluminum foil. Bake in 350 degree oven 45 minutes to 1 hours. ; name: rotkrautsalat red cabbage salad ; ingredients: bacon, vegetable oil, sugar, salt, vinegar, pepper, red wine, caraway seed, red cabbage ; preparation:Fry bacon in medium-size fry pan until crisp. Remove and reserve bacon. Add sugar, vinegar, and wine to bacon fat. Stir and cook until sugar is dissolved. Pour this hot mixture over the cabbage. Toss with vegetable oil, salt, pepper, and caraway seeds. Sprinkle crumbled bacon over mixture. Serve at room temperature. ; name: quick easy tuna rice ; ingredients: starkist sweet and spicy tuna, cooked white rice, spinach, slivered almonds ; preparation:Cook rice and veggies. Top rice with layer of spinach or broccoli. Top that with tuna directly from the pouch. Add some almond slivers. Voila. ; name: hot apple cider spiked with calvados apple brandy ; ingredients: apple cider, apple brandy, whole allspice, whole cloves, cinnamon sticks, orange strips ; preparation:Bring cider to simmer over medium heat. Add mulling spice. Mull for 15 minutes over medium-low heat. Remove. Stir in brandy. Serve. ; name: easy corned beef and cabbage ; ingredients: cabbage, corned beef, russet potatoes, margarine, salt and pepper ; preparation:Peel and cube potatoes. Chop up cabbage into nice size chunks. Place potatoes and cabbage into a large pot, filling with water until cabbage is covered. Heat on high heat to a boil. Season with salt then lower to medium high, cooking until potatoes are tender. Drain and return to stove on medium low heat. Add butter and corned beef, stirring until both are incorporated and heated through. ; name: cream delight with whiskey irish recipe ; ingredients: oatmeal, almonds, whipping cream, honey, irish whiskey, lemon juice ; preparation:Using a baking tray with baking paper on it, toast the oatmeal and almonds at 300 fahrenheit for 5 to 10 minutes, mixing repeatedly, making sure not to let the mixture burn. Whip the cream but not overly so and stir in the honey. Next, mix in the whiskey, oats, almonds and lemon juice. Mix well and then pour the mixture into long serving glasses. Chill and serve cold. ; name: cheesy bacon ranch hash browns casserole ; ingredients: shredded hash brown potatoes, onion, cream of chicken soup, sour cream, bacon bits, cheddar cheese, dry ranch dressing mix ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a large bowl, mix cream of chicken soup, sour cream, bacon bits and ranch dressing mix. Add cheddar cheese, onions and hasbrowns. Place in greased 9x13 pan. Bake 35 minutes or until bubbly. ; name: easy baked meatballs ; ingredients: ground beef, lean pork sausage, fresh breadcrumb, basil, oregano, parmesan cheese, eggs, salt, cracked black pepper ; preparation:

name: squirrel pot pie ; ingredients: onion, celery, garlic clove, beef broth, fresh ground black pepper, squirrel, mexicorn, cornstarch, pastry for double-crust pie ; preparation:Combine the onion, celery, garlic, broth, pepper and squirrel in a large pot and bring to a boil. Simmer until meat is very tender and easily removed from bones. Debone the meat and set aside. Researve 1 cup cooking liquid. Fit the bottom crust into a pie pan. Combine the meat, vegetables reserved broth and cornstarch in a large bowl and mix well. Spoon the mixture into the pie shell. Top with the second crust, press the edges to seal and cut vents in the top for steam to escape. Bake at 350 degrees until crust is browned, about 1 hour. ; name: mushroom macaroni casserole ; ingredients: elbow macaroni, cream of mushroom soup, mayonnaise, sharp cheddar cheese, pimientos, ritz cracker, butter ; preparation:Cook macaroni according to directions on the bag. Combine cooked macaroni, soup and next 3 ingredients, stir. Add pimentos. Spoon into lightly greased 2 quart casserole. Combine cracker crumbs and melted butter and sprinkle evenly over macaroni mixture. Bake in 300 degree oven for 30 minutes. ; name: low fat guacamole with cottage cheese ; ingredients: avocado, low fat cottage cheese, fresh lime juice, green onion, jalapeno, garlic cloves, salt and pepper ; preparation:Slice the avocado in half and scoop out the flesh. In a food processor, combine the avocado, cottage cheese, lime juice, green onions, jalapeo and garlic. Pure until smooth. Add salt and pepper to taste. Serve immediately or chill. Serve with raw veggies or tortilla chips. ; name: roasted carrots with lemon dressing ; ingredients: carrots, olive oil, cayenne pepper, coarse salt, honey, lemon, juice and zest of ; preparation:Preheat oven to 450. In foil lined roasting pan, toss carrots with oil and cayenne and season with salt. Arrange in single layer, using two pans if needed. Roast tossing one halfway through for 30-40 minutes, or until tender. In a small bowl, whisk together honey, zest and lemon juice. Season with salt. Drizzled over carrots and toss to coat. ; name: santa fe style pumpkin seeds pepitas 2 ww points ; ingredients: pumpkin seeds, worcestershire sauce, liquid smoke, ground cumin, dried ancho chile powder, garlic powder, paprika, cinnamon, cayenne ; preparation:Preheat the oven to 325f line a large baking pan with parchment paper. Combine the pumpkin seeds, worcestershire sauce and liquid smoke in a large bowl. Toss to coat. Combine the remaining ingredients in a small bowl. Sprinkle over the pumpkin seeds. Stir vigorously with a wooden spoon to evenly coat. Spread the seeds out on the baking sheet. Bake, stirring twice, until dried and lightly browned, about 15 minutes. Let cool on the baking sheet on a rack about 30 minutes. Serve at once or store in a ziploc bag up to 1 month. ; name: asparagus parmesan pita rounds ; ingredients: asparagus, olive oil, garlic cloves, pita bread, plum tomatoes, dried basil, crushed red pepper flakes, salt, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Preheat oven to 450f. Steam asparagus, covered, 2 minutes or until crisp tender. Rinse with cold water. Drain. Combine oil and garlic. Brush over pitas. Arrange tomato slices and asparagus on pitas. Sprinkle with basil, pepper, and salt. Top evenly with parmesan cheese. Bake for 7 to 8 minutes or until edges are golden. ; name: steamed broccoli italian style ; ingredients: broccoli, fresh lemon, extra virgin olive oil, garlic clove, salt and pepper ; preparation:Rinse the broccoli and trim off the very bottom of the thick stem. You can either steam the entire head whole or cut it up into florets. Steam the broccoli. Lay out on a platter. Drizzle with lots of fresh lemon juice. Drizzle with extra virgin olive oil to taste. Add fresh minced garlic to taste. Add salt and pepper to taste. This can be served either hot or room temperature. ; name: honey roasted pheasant ; ingredients: pheasants, honey, salt, ground black pepper, garlic powder, tarragon, thyme, lemon juice ; preparation:

name: pink chum pagne ; ingredients: water, caster sugar, pineapple juice, orange juice, cranberry juice, lemonade ; preparation:Mix the water with the sugar in a jug. Stir until sugar is almost disolved. Add the orange and pineapple juice. Stir for 5 seconds. Add cranberry juice. Fill to brim with lemonade. ; name: chocolate raisin cookie bars ; ingredients: butter, graham crackers, raisins, flaked coconut, nuts, sweetened condensed milk ; preparation:Melt butter in 13x9-inch baking pan in preheated 350f oven. Remove from oven. Sprinkle graham crumbs in butter. Mix well. Press into bottom of pan. Sprinkle with chocolate-covered raisins, coconut and nuts. Press down firmly. Pour sweetened condensed milk over top. Bake for 25-30 minutes or ntil light golden brown. Cool completely in pan on wire rack. ; name: beets with onion cumin ; ingredients: canola oil, onion, garlic, cumin seeds, all-purpose flour, beets, tomatoes, water, salt ; preparation:Heat a medium saucepan over medium-high heat. Pour in oil and saute onion and garlic until translucent. Mix in cumin seed and saute an additional 2 minutes. Sprinkle in flour and saute 1 minute more. Stir in beets, tomatoes, water, and salt. Reduce heat to low, cover pan with lid, and allow to simmer 30 to 45 minutes, until beets are tender. ; name: as good as mashed potatoes but fat free ; ingredients: baking potatoes, water, garlic cloves, parsley, tabasco sauce, salt, yellow mustard, grainy mustard, prepared horseradish, nonfat sour cream ; preparation:Pare the potatoes or leave skin on, according to taste. Cut into 1 inch cubes, and place in heavy medium saucepan. Add water, garlic, parsley, tabasco and salt, bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Reduce heat, cover and let cook for about 20 minutes, stirring and breaking potatoes up with a fork. Add more hot water if potatoes seem too dry. Continue stirring and mashing potatoes for about 5 minutes until the water is absorbed and the potatoes are soft and lumpy. Remove from heat, stir in the mustards, horseradish and sour cream. As good as mashed potatoes uses a unique combination of garlic, tabasco, mustard and horseradish to spice up an american favorite. ; name: wato s chilli sauce ; ingredients: fresh chili peppers, white vinegar, white sugar, ginger, sultanas, salt, garlic ; preparation:Roughly chop chillies. Take out the seeds before chopping if you like a mild chilli sauce. Place the chopped chillies in a blender with a little bit of vinegar, blend on high speed for a minute. Then place all the ingredients, including the chillies, into a sauce pan and bring to the boil, reduce to a simmer. Simmer for approximately 30 minutes or until the chillies and sultanas are very soft. Let cool. Then in a clean blender blend the chilli sauce until smooth and creamy. You should end up with approximately 1. 5 litres of chilli sauce. Bottle into sterilised jars. ; name: crisp sage and parmesan pork ; ingredients: pork loin steaks, white bread, sage leaf, parmesan cheese, black pepper, egg, oil ; preparation:Lay the pork steaks between two sheets of cling film and bash them with a rolling pin until approximately 1 cm thick. Whiz the bread in a food processor to make bread crumbs. Add the sage leaves. Pulse a few times to roughly chop the leaves. Mix in the grated parmesan. Pour onto a large plate. Season with black pepper. One by one, dip the steaks into the beaten egg, allowing the excess to drip off. Press steaks into the bread crumb mixture on both sides. Heat the oil in a large non stick frying pan. Fry the steaks for 3 to 4 minutes on each side until cooked through. ; name: yogurt popsicles ; ingredients: plain low-fat yogurt, banana, vanilla, fruit juice ; preparation:Blend ingredients together and pour into small paper cups. Freeze. Place a plastic spoon or popsicle stick in each cup when yogurt mixture is half frozen. To serve, turn cup upside-down and run hot water over it until the popsicle slips out. Keep the cups to use as a holder. ; name: spring succotash ; ingredients: butter, olive oil, edamame, corn, red onion, sherry wine, fresh basil ; preparation:

name: mulled wine ; ingredients: merlot, orange juice, pineapple juice, lemon juice, sugar, whole cloves, cinnamon sticks, water ; preparation:In a large stainless steel stockpot, combine all ingredients. Place over medium heat and bring to a simmer. Reduce heat to very low and keep warm for about 30 minutes to let the flavours blend. Strain out the cloves and the cinnamon before serving. Ladle in to heatproof cups. ; name: boozy pumpkin pie ; ingredients: pie shells, canned pumpkin, eggs, white sugar, ground cinnamon, cornstarch, butter, half-and-half, canadian rye whisky ; preparation:Preheat oven to 375f. Place pumpkin in large bowl and add the white sugar, egg yolks and cinnamon. Beat well with mixer until thoroughly combined. Add the cream, melted butter and whisky and combine well. In another large bowl and with clean beaters, beat egg whites until stiff. Sprinkle cornstarch over beaten egg whites and fold this mixture into pumpkin mixture. Pour into pie plate lined with pie crust-- i use a 10-inch pyrex deep-dish glass pie plate and it fills it-- and carefully place in oven. Bake for 1 hour. Centre should be set at this time. ; name: cowboy casserole ; ingredients: ground beef, baked beans, barbecue sauce, bisquick baking mix, milk, butter, cheddar cheese ; preparation:Brown ground beef and drain, preheat oven to 425f. Stir baked beans and barbecue sauce into beans heat to boiling while stirring, pour into sprayed 2 quart casserole dish. Stir bisquick mix, milk, and butter until dough forms. Drop by spoonfuls onto beef mixture. Bake uncovered 20 minutes until topping is golden brown. Sprinkle with cheese and cook about 3 minutes more or until cheese is melted. ; name: amazing vegan chocolate chip cookies ; ingredients: whole wheat flour, baking soda, salt, margarine, brown sugar, vanilla extract, semisweet vegan chocolate chips ; preparation:Preheat the oven t 375. Mix all of the dry ingredients, excluding the chocolate chips. Stir in the wet ingredients. Add the chocolate chips. If the batter is too dry, add 1tbs of soymilk. Bake tablespoon-sized cookies on a greased cookie sheet for 7-10 minutes. Be sure to place the cookies about 2 apart, because they expand as they bake. ; name: italian vegetable pancakes ; ingredients: zucchini, onion, eggs, flour, parmesan cheese, salt & freshly ground black pepper, butter ; preparation:Grate vegetables by hand or with grating disk of a food processor. In a bowl, mix together all ingredients except the butter or oil. Mixture should be fairly loose but not liquid. Add a little more flour or bread crumbs if necessary. Put butter or oil in a large skillet and turn heat to medium-high. When pan is hot, put large spoonfuls of batter in pan. Cook, turning once, until nicely browned on both sides, 10 to 15 minutes total. Serve hot or at room temperature. ; name: french chicken thighs in cilantro sauce ; ingredients: corn oil, chicken thighs, onion, garlic, dry white wine, fresh cilantro, salt, fresh ground black pepper ; preparation:Heat oil on large nonstick frying pan. Add thighs in one layer and saute them over medium to high heat for 4 minutes on each side, until nicely browned. Remove the chicken to a platter. Add the onions to the drippings in the skillet. Saute for 1 minute. Stir in the garlic, wine, and cilantro stems and saute for 10 seconds longer. Return chicken to frying pan, add salt and pepper, and bring surrounding liquid to a boil. Cover the pan, reduce heat, and bring to a slow boil for 15 minutes. Stir in cilantro leaves. Serve 2 chicken thighs per person. ; name: greek spinach rice balls ; ingredients: fresh spinach, scallion, olive oil, cooked brown rice, dried dill, lemon juice, salt and pepper, plain breadcrumbs ; preparation:In a large pot, steam spinach. Chop and set aside. Preheat oven to 350. Saut the scallions in oil until just softened. In a large mixing bowl, combine spinach, scallions, rice, dill and lemon juice. Add salt and pepper to taste. Stir well, mashing the rice against the sides of the bowl until the mixture holds together. Spray a baking sheet with cooking spray. With dampened hands, pack a heaping cup of the rice mixture into a ball. Roll the ball in the bread crumbs and place on the baking sheet. Repeat the process until all of the rice mixture is used up. Bake for 20-25 minutes until the balls are heated through and crisp on the outside. ; name: gingery plum jam ; ingredients: plums, water, sugar, fresh lemon juice, fresh ginger, fresh lemon rind ; preparation:

name: beef and bean burrito filling ; ingredients: oil, onion, garlic, ground beef, chili powder, cumin, salt and pepper, tomato sauce, refried beans ; preparation:Saute the onion in the oil until tender. Add the beef and garlic and cook until meat is no longer pink. Add the chili powder, cumin and other seasonings. Stir in tomato sauce and simmer for five minutes. Add refried beans and cook and stir until well blended. ; name: costa rican chilaquiles tortilla meat ; ingredients: meat, tortillas, eggs, tomato sauce, feta, oil, salt & pepper, garlic cloves, jalapeno peppers ; preparation:Heat oven to 350f. Fill each tortilla with meat, fold in half. Dip the folded tortilla in the beaten egg and fry on a skillet in oil. Brown on both sides. Arrange the tortillas in an oven proof dish. Cover the tortillas with the tomato sauce, garlic, jalapenos and cheese. Season with salt & pepper. Bake for 15-20 minutes or until hot through. Serve with black beans and rice. ; name: salsa pronto ; ingredients: mexican-style stewed tomatoes, onion, fresh cilantro, lemon juice, garlic clove, hot pepper sauce, fresh jalapeno pepper ; preparation:Place tomatoes in a blender or food processor. Cover and blend on lowest speed 2 seconds to chop tomatoes. Combine tomatoes with onion, cilantro, lemon juice, garlic, hot pepper sauce, and jalapeno. Taste and adjust seasonings, if desired. Serve with tortilla chips. ; name: hambrosia sandwich ; ingredients: ham, provolone cheese, hamburger buns, crushed pineapple, mayonnaise, lettuce, tomatoes ; preparation:Heat a skillet over medium heat. Add the ham to the skillet and chop up into fine pieces while cooking. Add the pineapple to the skillet and heat through. Divide the ham and pineapple up over the four hamburger buns or hoagie rolls. Top the sandwiches with cheese. Place the sandwiches in an oven safe dish and heat under the broiler for just a couple minutes until the cheese melts. Top with mayo, lettuce, and tomato to taste. ; name: fooled you maple spread ; ingredients: brown sugar, all-purpose flour, milk, butter, maple extract ; preparation:In a saucpan, stir together brown sugar, flour, milk and butter. Turn heat to low and cook, stirring often, until mixture is lump-free and smooth. Remove from heat and stir in maple extract. Place in a bowl or jar and refrigerate until serving. After it is chilled you can bring it to room temperature if you wish, to make spreading easier. ; name: omelet with flowers ; ingredients: fresh edible flower, eggs, water, flour, salt, pepper, cheese, olive oil ; preparation:Beat eggs add water and flour and make a batter. Combine with cheese, flowers, salt and pepper. Heat olive oil in a pan. Poor the mixture in the pan or take spoonfuls of batter and drop into the oil. When the bottom side of the omelet is golden brown turn it over the cooked on the other side4. ; name: crock pot bbq beef ; ingredients: chuck roast, water, barbecue sauce, worcestershire sauce, mustard, onion, salt and pepper ; preparation:Place roast in crock pot. Combine remaining ingredients in saucepan and bring to boil. Cover roast with sauce mixture. Cook on low for 6-8 hours. Chop meat and stir. ; name: salted nut squares ; ingredients: salted peanuts, butter, peanut butter chips, sweetened condensed milk, mini marshmallows ; preparation:

name: super easy sausage peppers ; ingredients: sweet italian sausage links, olive oil, sweet onion, green bell peppers, tomato sauce ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400. Bake cut up sausages for about 20 minute while sausage is cooking put onion and oil in large skillet saute onion till translucent. When sausage is done add to skillet with the onions and add the tomato sauce. Cook for 20 minutes then add the peppers and cook 20 minutes more. Serve over rice. ; name: grilled pork cutlets with maple chipotle glaze ; ingredients: maple syrup, chicken stock, dried chipotle powder, fresh thyme, cornstarch, water, pork cutlets, salt, pepper, canola oil ; preparation:Preheat your grill. In a small saucepan, bring the first four glaze ingredients to a boil. In a small jar, mix together the cornstarch and water. Put the lid on and shake vigorously. Pour the cornstarch slurry into the boiling glaze mixture and reduce to a simmer. Cook about 2 minutes until it becomes clear and thickens. Season the cutlets with salt and pepper and brush with a little oil. Grill cutlets 3 to 5 minutes per side, brushing glaze on while cooking. ; name: tomato sauce ii ; ingredients: olive oil, onion, tomatoes, salt & pepper, herbs, sugar, garlic clove ; preparation:Heat some olive oil on medium-low heat. Add finely chopped onions until soft but not golden. Then add one can of tomatoes, or 4 or 5 peeled fresh tomatoes, diced. Season with salt, pepper, and herbs. Add one teaspoonful of sugar and add one or two cloves of garlic, finely chopped. Let it simmer for 5 to 10 minutes, covered, then blend it thoroughly, and let it simmer for at least 30 more minutes. ; name: broccoli with indian spiced yogurt ; ingredients: broccoli, extra virgin olive oil, cumin seeds, fennel seeds, cardamom pods, plain yogurt, lemon ; preparation:Wash the broccoli, and break it into its florets, and cook 4 to 5 minutes at the most in salted water. Drain. Heat oil in a skillet, and add the drained broccoli. Meanwhile, in a small skillet, toast the cumin, fennel and cardamom until fragrant, about 3 to 4 minutes, and then grind them in a mortar and pestle. Stir most of the spice mixture into the yogurt with the juice of the lemon. Drizzel the spiced yogurt over the broccoli, and garnish with remaining spice mixture and some zest of the lemon. ; name: cream cheese candy ; ingredients: pecans, butter, cream cheese, powdered sugar, vanilla ; preparation:Put pecans & butter in oven and toast about 15 minutes at 300f. Melt cream cheese over low heat until creamy. Add powdered sugar, vanilla and nuts. Mix very well. Put in fridge until set. ; name: hashbrown cassorole ; ingredients: cream of chicken soup, cheese, sour cream, onion, butter, cracker ; preparation:Heat oven to 350. F, spray 2 quart glass baking dish with nonstick spray. In large bowel combine all hash brown ingredients. Mix well. Spread evenly into dish. In small bowel stir together topping ingredients. Spread toppings evenly over hash browns. Bake 45min. Or until browns are tender. ; name: peanut butter breakfast sandwiches ; ingredients: reduced-fat peanut butter, french bread, honey, bananas, eggs, milk, ground cinnamon, butter, fruit preserves ; preparation:Spread peanut butter evenly onto one side of each slice of bread snd drizzle honey over the peanut butter. Cut each banana in half lengthwise and then cut in half crosswise. Arrange 2 banana pieces on 4 of the prepared bread slices. Top with remaining bread slices, peanut butter-sides down. In a shallow bowl combine eggs, milk, and cinnamon. Carefully dip sandwiches into egg mixture, coating both sides. Melt butter in a large skillet or on a large griddle over medium heat. Cook sandwiches in hot butter about 2 minutes on each side or until golden. Meanwhile, in a small saucepan heat fruit preserves over medium-low heat until melted, stirring frequently. To serve, cut warm sandwiches in half crosswise. Drizzle with warm fruit preserves. ; name: hot and spicy nuts ; ingredients: egg white, pecans, almonds, cashews, brown sugar, seasoning salt, curry powder, ground cinnamon, cumin seed, ground red pepper ; preparation:

name: strawberry cheesecake shake ; ingredients: fresh strawberries, cream cheese, skim milk, powdered sugar, strawberry ice cream ; preparation:In a blender container, combine all ingredients except ice cream. Blend well. Add ice cream. Blend until smooth. Serve immediately. ; name: arugula and goat cheese salad ; ingredients: fresh lemon juice, dijon mustard, virgin olive oil, salt & pepper, baby arugula, red seedless grapes, goat cheese, capers ; preparation:Whisk together the mustard, lemon juice & oil. Place arugula in a large bowl and toss with the dressing. Divide between 4 plates. Sprinkle grapes, cheese, cper & hemp heart over the arugula. Serve. ; name: yummy low fat french toast ; ingredients: egg beaters egg substitute, skim milk, ground cinnamon, vanilla extract, margarine, french bread, maple syrup ; preparation:In shallow bowl, combine egg beaters original, milk, cinnamon and vanilla. In nonstick skillet, over medium heat, melt 2 teaspoons margarine. Dip bread slices in egg mixture to coat. Transfer to skillet. Brown about 3 minutes on each side. Top with syrup if desired. ; name: millet porridge ; ingredients: millet, water, skim milk, ground cinnamon, vanilla, salt, raisins, maple syrup ; preparation:In a small saucepan, combine millet, water, milk, cinnamon, vanilla, salt and raisins. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low, cover and simmer for 25 minutes without stirring. If the liquid is not completely absorbed, cook for 3-5 minutes longer, partially covered. Remove from heat. Drizzle with maple syrup or honey. Serve. ; name: berry breakfast rolls ; ingredients: cinnamon roll dough, fresh blueberries, blueberry preserves, lemon peel, pecans, milk ; preparation:Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Grease 16 muffin cups. Cut each cinnamon roll in half crosswise to create 2 short round rolls. Press each half roll into one muffin cup, forming it into a cup shape. Mix together ther blueberries, preserves and lemon peel, and spoon some of the mixture into each muffin cup. Sprinkle each cup with pecans. Bake 12 minutes at 375 degrees until golden brown. Cool for 10 minutes in the muffin tin, then remove and place on wire rack. Drizzle icing over rolls. ; name: hamburger casserole ; ingredients: hamburger, green beans, onion, sharp cheddar cheese, egg, tomato soup, potatoes ; preparation:Cook and mash potatoes, add egg to potatoes while mashing. Set aside. Brown hamburger and onion, drain. Add beans and soup, stir well. Place in a greased casserole dish. Put mashed potatoes on top of meat mixture. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake 350 for 35-40 minutes. ; name: banana and peanut butter toast ; ingredients: bread, banana, creamy peanut butter, egg, milk, butter, salt, pancake syrup ; preparation:Spread bread slices with peanut butter. Arrange half of sliced banana on one slice of bread. Cover with another slice of bread. Heat a nonstick frying pan and grease with butter. Coat sandwich with egg and milk mixture and grill for 2 minutes on each side. Served garnished with remaining sliced banana and hot syrup. ; name: chicken with sour cream ; ingredients: chicken legs, onion, carrot, water, sour cream, milk, pepper ; preparation:

name: sonora scramble ; ingredients: onion, sweet green pepper, butter, tomatoes, eggs, monterey jack cheese, flour tortillas, salsa ; preparation:Cook the onion and pepper in a skillet in the butter until the onion is translucent. Add tomatoes. Simmer 5 minutes. Add the eggs. Cook like scrambled eggs. When cooked sprinkle the cheese over the eggs and allow it to melt. Serve warm with hot tortillas and salsa. ; name: the realtor s cream cheese corn ; ingredients: frozen corn kernels, butter, cream cheese, salt & freshly ground black pepper ; preparation:In medium saucepan cook corn according to package directions and drain liquid. If using canned corn, just heat it up. Put the butter and cream cheese in a microwave safe bowl and nuke it for about 1 minute. Add the butter and cream cheese to the corn. Cook, stirring occasionally, over moderately low heat until mixture is combined and heated through. Serve hot. ; name: creole celery cabbage ; ingredients: chinese cabbage, butter, onion, green bell pepper, tomatoes, salt, pepper ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350f and lightly grease a casserole dish. Cover chinese cabbage with boiling water and cook for about ten minutes or until tender. Drain very well. Melt butter. Add onions and peppers and cook slowly for about five minutes. Add tomatoes and heat to the boiling point. Add cabbage, salt and pepper. Pour into a baking dish, cover and bake in oven for 30 to 40 minutes. ; name: sweetened condensed milk coconut cookies candy ; ingredients: sweetened condensed milk, shredded coconut, vanilla extract, salt ; preparation:Heat oven to 375. Grease a baking sheet. Mix all ingredients. Drop by teaspoons, onto baking sheet. Bake for 15 minutes. While hot, remove from the sheet. ; name: crab and shrimp dips ; ingredients: cream cheese, mayonnaise, ketchup, worcestershire sauce, tabasco sauce, onion, crabmeat, baby shrimp ; preparation:In a mixing bowl, using an electric mixer, beat cream cheese and mayonnaise until well blended. Add ketchup, tabasco sauce, worcestershire sauce and beat again until well incorporated. Add onions and mix well using a fork. Adjust tabasco sauce to taste. Divide mixture equally into 2 serving bowls. Add crab to one bowl and mix well using a fork. Add shrimp to the other bowl and mix well using a fork. Serve with potato chips or vegetable crackers. Refrigerate any unused portions. ; name: old fashioned fresh peach pie ; ingredients: pastry for double-crust pie, sugar, flour, nutmeg, fresh peaches, butter ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Line 9-inch pie plate with pastry. Combine sugar, flour, spice and salt. Add to peaches and mix lightly. Fill pie shell with peach mixture. Dot with butter. Place top crust and crimp edges. Bake for 40-45 minutes or until done. ; name: grilled chicken with balsamic peach marinade ; ingredients: chicken breasts, fresh peach, balsamic vinegar, dijon mustard, honey, salt, ground black pepper, garlic, fresh thyme, olive oil ; preparation:Combine vinegar, mustard, honey, salt, pepper, garlic, and thyme. Whisk until well blended, then add olive oil and mix. Just before you are ready to marinate chicken, stir in peaches. Pour over chicken breasts. Allow to marinate for at least 2 hours and grill. ; name: cherry coconut cracker squares ; ingredients: egg, milk, crackers, brown sugar, baking powder, all-purpose flour, coconut, maraschino cherry ; preparation:

name: polvoron ; ingredients: all-purpose flour, sugar, powdered milk, iodized salt, margarine ; preparation:Toast all purpose flour until light brown. Add powdered milk, iodized salt, margarine and mix evenly. Add sugar into the flour mixture. Put into a flat container and mold by a polvoron molder. Wrap polvoron in cellophane. ; name: cape seed loaf ; ingredients: whole wheat bread flour, sunflower seeds, pumpkin seeds, poppy seeds, salt, yeast, sugar, sunflower oil, water, egg ; preparation:Mix all the dry ingredients in a bowl. Pour the water and oil and knead for about a minute. Place the dough in an oiled loaf pan brush with the egg and decorate with alternate lines of sesame and poppy seeds. Cover the dough with a tea towel and let it rise for about 30-60 minutes. Pre heat the oven to 180 degees c and bake for 45 to 50 minutes. Cool on rack. ; name: parmesan cauliflower ; ingredients: eggs, salt, pepper, frozen cauliflower, parmigiano-reggiano cheese, olive oil, fresh parsley ; preparation:Thaw and pat the cauliflower dry. Lightly beat the eggs with salt and pepper in a large bowl. Add the cauliflower and toss until well coated. Put the cheese into a large bowl. Lift cauliflower out of egg mixture with a slotted spoon and transfer to cheese, tossing to coat. Heat the oil in a 10 inch heavy skillet over moderate heat until hot. Pan fry the cauliflower in batches, turning occasionally, until golden on all sides, about 3 minutes per batch. Transfer with slotted spoon to paper towels to drain. Chop over some fresh parsley to serve. ; name: dijon mushroom potatoes ; ingredients: onion, carrot, mushrooms, vegetable stock, dark soy sauce, dijon mustard, cornstarch, fresh ground black pepper, potatoes ; preparation:Chop the onion, peel and grate the carrot and slice the mushrooms, halving them across the other way first if they are large. Saute the vegetables in the water or stock, in a large frying pan, until most of the liquid is gone and the vegetables are soft. Mix the remaining ingredients together in a bowl, adding a bit of water if you wish and add to the vegetables in the pan. Mix well and cook, stirring, over low heat for about a minute until thickened. Pour over hot, split baked potatoes. Serve with a crisp green salad on the side. ; name: pimento cream cheese spread ; ingredients: diced pimentos, cream cheese, walnuts, milk ; preparation:Let cream cheese soften slightly. Cream with the milk till smooth. Drain pimentos and add with nuts to cream cheese. Mix well. Add tiny bit more milk if necessary to make a spreadable consistency. Serve with rye bread, wheat crackers, triscuit, or melba toast. Store in fridge. ; name: brined grilled chicken ; ingredients: chicken breast halves, chicken thighs, water, kosher salt, brown sugar, olive oil ; preparation:Combine the water, salt, and sugar together in a large deep bowl or plastic tub. Stir until salt and sugar are dissolved. Add the chicken and fully submerge. Refrigerate for 2-4 hours to brine. Remove the chicken from the brine, rinse and pat dry. Grill chicken on direct heat for 5-7 min, turning once or twice until chicken is golden and well-marked from the grill.
