Move the chicken over to the side of the grill to indirect heat and continue to cook until juices run clear, about another 5-7 minute. ; name: pineapple cheese ball ii ; ingredients: cream cheese, pineapple, pecans, green pepper, onions, seasoning salt ; preparation:Beat cream cheese with fork until smooth. Gradually stir in pineapple, 1 cup pecans, green pepper, onion and salt. Chill. Shape into ball. Roll in remaining nuts. Refrigerate until well chilled. Garnish with pineapple slices, cherries and parsley. Makes about 40 appetizer servings. The green pepper gets liquid when you process it in the food processor. I have to blot it with a paper towel. When i made the ball with the low fat cream cheese i either did not drain the green pepper and pineapple well or it was the cream cheese. Ever since i have used full fat cream cheese and have not had a problem. ; name: fire roasted stuffed poblano peppers sp5 ; ingredients: poblano peppers, monterey jack cheese, enchilada sauce, simply potatoes diced potatoes with onion, chorizo sausage ; preparation:

name: mexican beer and cheese dip ; ingredients: unsalted butter, onion, garlic clove, flour, beer, canned tomato, green chilies, cheddar cheese, cream cheese, black beans ; preparation:Saute onion in butter. Add garlic and cook for 30 seconds. Add flour and blend well. Pour in beer and stir until smooth. Add tomatoes and chilies and cook until mixture thickens. Add both cheeses and cook until bubbly. Remove from heat and stir in beans before serving. ; name: baked flounder ; ingredients: flounder fillets, salt and pepper, lemon juice, dried tarragon, low-fat sour cream, chives, parsley ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Spray a large baking pan with cooking spray. Rub the fillets on both sides with lemon juice, then salt and pepper them to taste. Place the fillets in the baking disk and sprinkle evenly with tarragon. Cover evenly with sour cream. Bake for about 15 minutes until fish is done but not over cooked. Sprinkle with chives and parsley. ; name: white chocolate chunk muffins ; ingredients: all-purpose flour, brown sugar, unsweetened cocoa powder, baking soda, salt, buttermilk, butter, eggs, vanilla, white chocolate ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Grease 12 large muffin cups. Combine flour, sugar, cocoa, baking soda and salt in a large bowl. Combine buttermilk, butter, eggs and vanilla in small bowl until blended. Stir into flour mixture just until moistened. Fold in white chocolate. Spoon into prepeared muffin cups, filling half full. Bake 25-30 minutes or until wooden toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool in pan on wire rack for 5 minutes. Remove from pan. Cool on wire rack 10 minutes. Serve warm or completely cool. ; name: thai celery rice cooker rice ; ingredients: butter, garlic clove, celery, carrot, rice, water, dried chili ; preparation:Saute. Carrot. Add celery. Add garlic. Put into rice cooker. Add rice water and chili. Cook. ; name: banana apple bread ; ingredients: margarine, apple juice concentrate, eggs, flour, baking soda, salt, milk, bananas ; preparation:With an electric mixer beat margarine till smooth. Slowly add in apple juice concentrate while mixing on high speed. Beat in eggs one at a time. Sift in the dry ingrediants, then add milk. Finally stir in the mashed bananas. Pour into a greased 9 inch loaf pan and bake in a preheated 350 degree oven for one hour. Watch after 45 min of baking, if bread seems to be getting to brown place a foil tent over the top of it. ; name: upside down caramel rolls ; ingredients: refrigerated biscuits, brown sugar, pecans, cinnamon, butter, cooking spray ; preparation:Spray a muffin pan generoulsy with cooking spray. Combine sugar, butter, nuts and cinnamon. Divide sugar mixture evenly among 8 muffin cups. Place a biscuit in each cup over the sugar. Bake at 425 for about 10 minutes. Invert onto a platter immediately upon pulling these out of the oven. ; name: pineapple and macadamia cheese ; ingredients: macadamia nuts, camembert cheese, dried pineapple, cream cheese, of fresh mint, curry powder ; preparation:Chop nuts roughly and set 3 tablespoons aside for topping. Using a sharp knife, cut a thin top off the cheese and discard the rind. Using a teaspoon, scoop out the cheese and place in small bowl. Mix in the nuts, pineapple, cream cheese, herbs and curry powder. Stir until mixture is soft and creamy. Spoon the mixture into empty cheese shell. Sprinkle the reserved nuts on top. Serve at room temperature with crackers. ; name: white wine poached salmon with tarragon cream for one ; ingredients: unsalted butter, fresh mushrooms, salt & freshly ground black pepper, dry white wine, salmon fillet, heavy cream, fresh tarragon, fresh lemon ; preparation:

name: orzo fruit salad ; ingredients: orzo pasta, cheesecake flavor instant pudding and pie filling mix, sour cream, crushed pineapple, mandarin oranges, miniature marshmallows, peach, maraschino cherry, frozen whipped topping ; preparation:Cook orzo according to package directions. Drain and rinse in cold water. Set aside. In a large bowl, combine the pudding mix, sour cream and pineapple. Stir in pudding mixture. Stir in the oranges, marshmallows, peaches, cherries and orzo. Fold in whipped topping. Sprinkle with coconut. Cover and refrigerate for 2 hours or until chilled. ; name: touch of mint iced tea ; ingredients: boiling water, tea bags, of fresh mint, frozen lemonade concentrate, lemon slice, mint ; preparation:In a heat proof bowl or pitcher, pour boiling water over tea bags. Cool at least 15 minutes. Add mint and let tea bags steep for at least 5 minutes. Strain. Add lemonade concentrate. Stir well. Refrigerate. Serve with lemon slices and extra mint. ; name: philly cream cheese dip ; ingredients: cream cheese, mayonnaise, parmesan cheese, bacon, green onion, cracker ; preparation:Combine cream cheese and mayonnaise. Mix well. Add remaining ingredients. Mix well. Chill for at least 2 hours. Serve with crackers. ; name: eggplant aubergine roasted garlic spread ; ingredients: eggplant, olive oil, salt & freshly ground black pepper, roasted garlic, sherry wine vinegar, basil leaves ; preparation:Cut the eggplant into 1-inch slices, brush one side lightly with olive oil and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Roast in a preheated 400 degree oven until brown, approximately 20 minutes. When cool, scoop the flesh from the skin and process with remaining ingredients until smooth. Correct seasoning. Can be stored refrigerated for up to one week. ; name: mocha chocolate chip cheesecake bars ; ingredients: refrigerated chocolate chip cookie dough, cream cheese, sugar, egg, instant coffee crystals, vanilla, miniature semisweet chocolate chips ; preparation:Heat oven to 350. Crumble cookie dough into a 9x13 inch baking pan, press evenly onto bottom. Set aside. Combine cream cheese, sugar & egg in a medium sized mixing bowl, beat by hand until smooth. Stir together coffee crystals, vanilla, & 1 tsp water in a small bowl or custard cup until crystals are dissolved. Stir coffee mixture into cream cheese mixture. Spread evenly over dough, sprinkle with mini chocolate chips. Bake for 20 minutes or until completely set. Cool in pan on wire rack, cut into bars. ; name: granny s fudge ; ingredients: sugar, butter, evaporated milk, chocolate chips, miniature marshmallows, walnuts, vanilla extract ; preparation:Combine the sugar, butter and milk in large saucepan. Let boil stirring frequently at medium heat until soft ball stage. Add chocolate chips. Remove from heat. Stir until chips dissolve. Add marshmallows, walnuts and vanilla. Stir well. Pour into 9 x 13 pan. Put in refrigerator to cool. Cut when hard. ; name: roasted brussels sprouts with appelmoes ; ingredients: granny smith apples, sugar, water, lemon juice, egg, ground cinnamon, fresh brussels sprouts, olive oil, salt & freshly ground black pepper, butter ; preparation:1 to make the appelmoes, peel, core and roughly chop the apples. 2 put in a saucepan with the sugar, water and lemon juice. Let simmer for 10 minutes then either puree or pass through a sieve. 3 if using an egg to create a richer sauce, return the sauce to the pan, add a whisked egg and stir until the sauce has thickened slightly. Pour into a bowl and lightly sprinkle with ground cinnamon. 4 to cook the sprouts, preheat the oven to 200c toss the sprouts in olive oil and season generously. Add the butter and toss again before serving warm with the appelmoes. ; name: scalloped potatoes extraordinaire crock pot ; ingredients: potatoes, onions, healthy request cream of mushroom soup, evaporated skim milk, low-fat cheddar cheese, chopped pimiento, black pepper ; preparation:

name: mirj s not low carb crunchy chicken nuggets ; ingredients: boneless chicken breasts, egg, sweet paprika, corn chips, parsley, oil ; preparation:Cut the chicken breasts into two inch cubes. Mix the egg with the paprika in one bowl. Mix the corn chip crumbs with the parsley in another bowl. Dip the chicken cubes first into the egg mixture, then into the crumb mixture, coating well. Either shallow fry for about 7 minutes, turning once, until done, or place on a baking sheet, spray with oil and bake at 350 degrees f for about 25-30 minutes. ; name: popcorn drops ; ingredients: popped popcorn, egg whites, baking powder, salt, cream of tartar, sugar substitute ; preparation:Place popped corn in food processor or food grinder. Grind into kernel-size pieces. Beat egg whites until frothy and add baking powder, salt and cream of tartar. Beat into stiff peaks. Add sugar replacement, beating until well blended. Fold popcorn pieces into stiffly beaten egg whites. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto lightly greased cookie sheets. Bake at 350 f for 12 to 14 minutes or until lightly browned. Yield 36 cookies. ; name: tacos wrapidos ; ingredients: spanish rice, lean ground beef, fajita seasoning mix, flour tortillas, avocado, cheddar cheese, lettuce, diced tomato ; preparation:Prepare rice according to package directions. Toss ground beef with fajita seasoning. Cook in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat, stirring until beef crumbles and is no longer pink. Drain. Stir in cooked rice. Spread beef mixture evenly over 1 side of tortilla. Tope evenly with avocado slices, cheese, lettuce, and tomatoes. Roll up. ; name: amish oven crusted chicken ; ingredients: broiler-fryer chickens, butter, flour, salt, pepper, dried thyme, dried rosemary, dried marjoram, corn flakes cereal ; preparation:Preheat oven to 375f. Combine melted butter with flour, salt, pepper and herbs. Place cereal crumbs in a shallow bowl. Dip chicken pieces in the butter mixture then roll in crumbs. Place on a rack in a shallow baking pan. Bake 50-60 minutes or until golden brown. ; name: buttermilk squares ; ingredients: margarine, eggs, yellow cake mix, powdered sugar, cream cheese ; preparation:Melt margarine in 13 x 9 pan. Mix 2 eggs and cake mix until crumbly. Sprinkle over melted margarine. Mix 2 eggs, powdered sugar and cream cheese until smooth. Pour over cake mixture. Bake 35-45 min in 325 degree oven. ; name: cheesy sausage and potatoes ; ingredients: smoked sausage, frozen hash brown potatoes, green onion, garlic powder, cheddar cheese soup, milk, pepper ; preparation:Add the sausauge, potatoes, onions, garlic powder, and pepper to a lightly greased crock pot. Toss to combine. In another bowl stir together the soup and milk. Pour over sausage mixture. Cover and cook on low 7-8 hours. ; name: blackberry muffins ; ingredients: all-purpose flour, baking powder, salt, egg, brown sugar, sugar, fat free sour cream, buttermilk, butter, blackberries ; preparation:Preheat the oven to 350 degrees f and spray a muffin tin with nonstick spray or use paper liners. Rinse the frozen berries and let them drain in a sieve. In a mixing bowl, whisk the flour, baking powder, and salt to evenly distribute. In another bowl, beat the egg, then whisk in the sugar, and sour cream. Whisk until the mixture is throughly combined then add in the buttermilk and melted butter. Scatter the blackberries in the dry ingredients and then add the wet ingredients. Gently fold to combine, there should not be large pockets of flour but streaks of flour are okay. Do not overmix the batter. Divide the batter into your muffin tin with a large spoon or ice cream scoop and bake until a toothpick or skewer inserted into the center of the muffins comes out clean, about 20 - 25 minutes. Remove them from the pan and cool on a rack. ; name: mondlukaka icelandic almond cake dessert ; ingredients: butter, sugar, eggs, vanilla, almonds, flour, baking powder, strawberry jam, heavy cream ; preparation:

name: agua fresca de papaya ; ingredients: papayas, sugar, lime juice, water ; preparation:Choose very ripe fruit. Peel, seed, and coarsely chop. Smoothly puree measured fruit pulp and juice in blender with sugar and lime juice. Add flavored fruit mixture to water, then rub through a fine strainer into a large jar or pitcher and discard pulp. Pour the agua fresca over ice cubes into tall glasses. Slices or chunks of matching fruit may be added as garnish just before serving. ; name: creamy orzo with ham and peas ; ingredients: orzo pasta, olive oil, shallot, garlic clove, smoked ham, half-and-half, frozen peas, parmesan cheese, salt & freshly ground black pepper ; preparation:Bring a heavy large saucepan of salted water to a boil over high heat. Add the orzo and cook until tender, about 8 minutes. Drain, reserving 1 cup of the cooking liquid. Meanwhile, heat the oil in a heavy large frying pan over medium heat. Add the shallot and garlic, and saute until tender, about 2 minutes. Add the ham and cook until they are heated through, about 5 minutes. Stir in the half and half and peas. Add the orzo and toss to coat. Remove the skillet from the heat. Add the parmesan to the pasta mixture and toss to coat. Stir in some reserved cooking liquid until pasta is desired consistency. Season the orzo with salt and pepper, and serve. ; name: 15 minute vanilla rice pudding ; ingredients: milk, minute rice, raisins, vanilla instant pudding mix ; preparation:Bring 1 cup of milk to boil in medium sauce pan. Stir in rice and raisins. Cover pan. Remove from heat. Let stand for 5 minutes. Meanwhile prepare pudding. Beat pudding mix into remaining 2 cups of cold milk with whisk for 2 minutes. Add rice mixture to pudding and stir. Cover surface with plastic wrap. Cool 5 minutes. Stir. Serve warm or chilled. ; name: creamy orange gelatin ; ingredients: orange gelatin, boiling water, vanilla ice cream, orange juice, mandarin oranges ; preparation:In a large bowl, dissolve gelatin in boilingn water. Stir in ice cream and orange juice until blended. Chill until partially set. Fold in oranges. Pour into two 6 cup ring molds coated with cooking spray. Refrigerate overnight or until firm. Just before serving, unmold. ; name: curry currant hummus ; ingredients: chickpeas, olive oil, garlic cloves, curry powder, lemon juice, water, salt, dried currant ; preparation:Combine chick peas, olive oil, crushed garlic, curry powder, lemon juice and water in a food processor or blender. Puree until smooth. Add salt to taste. Transfer to a bowl and gently stir in currants by hand. Cover with plastic wrap and chill at least 4 hour for flavours to blend. ; name: lime salad ; ingredients: lime jell-o gelatin, boiling water, cream cheese, vanilla extract, mandarin oranges, crushed pineapple, carbonated lemon-lime beverage, pecans, cool whip ; preparation:Dissolve jello in water. In a mixing bowl, beat cream cheese until fluffy. Add jello mixture. Beat until smooth. Stir in vanilla, fruit, soda, and pecans. Chill until mixture mounds slightly when dropped from a spoon. Fold in three-fourths of the cool whip. Pour into a 13x9 inch pan. Chill for 4 hours or until firm. Cut into squares. Garnish with remaining cool whip. ; name: uncle dobos easy corn fritters recipe ; ingredients: creamed corn, egg, parmesan cheese, bisquick, salt, black pepper, milk, cooking oil ; preparation:In a bowl combine egg, parmesan, bisquick, salt, pepper, and milk with the can of creamed corn and stir well. Heat cooking oil in a frying pan and drop the fritter mixture by spoonfuls into the oil. Brown on each side. Goes well with seafood for dinner or served with syrup for breakfast. Makes 6-8 fritters. ; name: easy potatoes ; ingredients: potatoes, margarine, green pepper, onion, onion soup mix ; preparation:

name: roasted red pepper provolone panini ; ingredients: bread, prosciutto, roasted red pepper, provolone cheese, olive oil ; preparation:Place prosciutto, pepper, and cheese on bread. Heat grill pan and have something heavy near by to weigh down the lid. Lighty oil pan and add panini. Press down on top with another pan or heavy plate, cook untill ightly browned. Flip and cook other side. Enoy. Add whatever additions. ; name: mocha macaroons ; ingredients: egg whites, instant coffee granules, cream of tartar, salt, sugar, baking cocoa, flaked coconut ; preparation:Heat oven to 300 degrees. Lightly grease cookie sheets. Beat egg whites, coffee, cream of tartar, and salt in medium bowl on low speed until foamy. Beat in sugar, 1 tablespoon at a time on high speed until stiff. Do not underbeat. Stir in cocoa until smooth. Fold in coconut. Drop mixture by rounded teaspoonfuls 1 inch apart on cookie sheet. Bake 20 to 25 minutes or until set. Cool 10 minutes, then remove from cookie sheet. Sprinkle with cocoa or drizzle with melted chocolate. ; name: dee s spanish rice ; ingredients: cooked rice, onion, green pepper, bacon, tomato soup, chili powder, sugar, water ; preparation:Cook rice as usual. Fry bacon till crisp. It should be crisp, not soggy. Crumble bacon. In the bacon fat, fry the onion and green pepper till onion turns translucent. Combine cooked rice, onion, green pepper and crumbled bacon. Add a little salt and pepper and mix well. Add one can of tomato soup, chili powder and sugar. Add water to the consistency you like and cook till hot. Add extra tomato soup and water if needed. Can be a side dish or main meal. Tastes great reheated as well. ; name: english pub style pickled eggs ; ingredients: hard-boiled eggs, vinegar, allspice berries, bay leaves, whole black peppercorn ; preparation:Pack eggs into 1 quart widemouthed jar. Bring vinegar to boil in non aluminum saucepan and let boil about 10 minutes. Add remaining ingredients to jar and ladle hot vinegar over eggs. Cap tightly. Let cool, then refrigerate at least 3 days before serving. Can be refrigerated up to 2 weeks. ; name: mashed favas broad beans greens ; ingredients: fava beans, spinach, olive oil, garlic ; preparation:Shuck the fresh beans, put in boiling water for apprx 10 minutes, dash with cold and remove outer membrane from each bean. If using frozen check that they are already cooked, if not follow instructions. Canned are ready as is, drained. Coursely mash the fava beans. I used a fork, you do not want to puree them just mash a bit. If using collards for the greens pre boil for 20 minutes, squeeze when cooked to get as much moisture out as possible, coarsely chop. With other greens wash them and allow the water to cling to the leaves. Coarsely chop. Pour half the oil into a skillet using medium heat saute the chopped garlic, stir, cook until it starts to color, apprx 5 minutes. Add favas, stir& heat through. Add greens, cover, allow the greens to wilt 3 minutes, and serve. ; name: roasted napa cabbage ; ingredients: vegetable oil, garlic cloves, napa cabbage, salt, pepper ; preparation:Heat the oil in a skillet on low. Add the garlic cloves and cook very gently for 15 minutes. Discard the garlic and toss the cabbage with the oil, salt and pepper. Preheat your oven to 450. Place the cabbage on a baking sheet and bake for about 15 minutes or until the tops of the cabbage pieces are browned. Serve hot. ; name: zinggggggy chicken wings ; ingredients: chicken wings, plum jam, soy sauce, hot pepper sauce, prepared horseradish, dijon mustard ; preparation:Heat oven 425f. Place wings in a single layer on a baking sheet. Combine remaining ingredients and brush generously over the wings. Bake 15-20 minutes, baste frequently, until cooked and golden. Serve with chinese hot mustard. ; name: garden pea salad ; ingredients: peas, onion, eggs, mayonnaise, salt, pepper, pimiento ; preparation:

name: chicken in peanut curry ; ingredients: coconut milk, red curry paste, creamy peanut butter, sugar, fish sauce, chicken breasts, garlic, onion, cornstarch, salt ; preparation:In a medium sauce pan heat coconut milk, curry paste, peanut butter, sugar, and fish sauce until they come to a very small boil. Set aside and cool adding cornstarch to thicken. While the sauce is cooling, stir fry 1 chopped onion and 1 t minced garlic. Cut up chicken into small pieces and stir fry with the onion and garlic until chicken is cooked through. Combine the garlic, onion and chicken with the sauce and heat. Spoon the chicken peanut curry over rice and enjoy. ; name: penne con gorgonzola e pomodoro ; ingredients: extra virgin olive oil, onion, garlic cloves, italian plum tomatoes, fresh basil, butter, gorgonzola, penne pasta, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Heat olive oil in heavy large skillet over medium heat. Add chopped onion and garlic and saute until translucent, about 8 minutes. Stir in chopped tomatoes and basil. Cook until mixture thickens, stirring occasionally, about 20 minutes. Meanwhile, using spoon, beat butter with gorgonzola cheese until blended. Cook pasta in large pot of boiling salted water until just tender but still firm to bite, stirring occasionally. Drain well. Return pasta to pot. Whisk gorgonzola cheese mixture into tomato sauce. Add sauce to pasta and stir to coat. Season with salt and pepper. Sprinkle with romano cheese and serve. ; name: sour cream chive and olive burgers ; ingredients: ground beef, salt and pepper, swiss cheese, sour cream, black olives, green onions, onion rolls ; preparation:Season beef with salt and pepper. Form into four patties. Grill to your taste. Top with cheese to melt. Lightly toast rolls. Spread sour cream on rolls and top with olives and green onions. Place burger on this then place top bun. Enjoy. ; name: simple cumin basmati rice ; ingredients: basmati rice, water, peanut oil, cumin seeds, fresh coarse ground black pepper, salt, fresh cilantro ; preparation:In a medium bowl, soak the rice in the water about 30 minutes. Heat the oil in a large saucepan over med-high heat. Add in the cumin seeds and black pepper. They should sizzle upon contact with the hot oil. Quickly add in the rice with the water it was soaking in. Mix in the salt and bring to a boil over high heat. Decrease heat to the lowest setting, cover the pan, and cook until the rice is done, 10-15 minutes. Do not stir the rice while it cooks. Remove from heat and let the rice rest undisturbed about 5 minutes. Transfer to a serving platter, garnish with cilantro, and serve. ; name: brussels sprouts with cashews ; ingredients: brussels sprouts, margarine, fresh lemon juice, salted cashews, pepper ; preparation:Depending on the size of the sprouts steam them for 5-8 minutes. They should still be slightly crisp. Drain and pour into a fry pan where you have already melted the margarine. Add lemon juice and pepper. Cook until sprouts are heated through and glazed with the margarine. Sprinkle with the nuts and serve. ; name: melon in passionfruit ginger syrup ; ingredients: passion fruit, sugar, water, ginger in syrup, of fresh mint, cantaloupe, watermelon, honeydew melon ; preparation:Combine passionfruit, sugar, water and ginger in medium pan. Stir over low heat without boiling until sugar has dissolved. Bring to boil, reduce heat, simmer 10-15 minutes or until slightly thickened. Remove from heat. Add mint and allow to cool completely. Remove seeds from melons. Using a melon baler, scoop out balls from fruit. Arrange fruit attractively in large, cut-glass bowl or individual serving glasses. Pour syrup over. Chill for atleast 30 minutes before serving. May be served with freshly-whipped cream or ice cream. ; name: easy double chocolate nut clusters crock pot ; ingredients: chocolate almond bark, german chocolate, semi-sweet chocolate chips, dry roasted peanuts, roasted almonds, almond flavoring ; preparation:Turn crock pot on high and ad the first six ingredients. Cook for 45 minutes. Reduce heat and cook for one hour or until all chocolate is melted, stirring every 15 minute add almond flavoring and stir. Put by spoonfuls into mini muffin liners. Store in an airtight container. ; name: quick crab stew ; ingredients: butter, onion, condensed cream of potato soup, condensed cream of celery soup, milk, half-and-half, crabmeat, dry sherry, salt and pepper ; preparation:

name: grandma katies famous sausage rice ; ingredients: jimmy dean sausage, celery, onions, lipton soup secrets noodle soup mix, boiling water, long grain rice, soy sauce, salt, pepper ; preparation:Use a food processor to finely chop the onion and celery. Brown sausage, celery and onions in a large skillet, drain off fat. Place in large casserole dish. Mix dry soup mix with the 9 cups of boiling water and cook for 5 minutes. Mix all ingredients together and bake covered at 325f for 1-2 hours. ; name: cousin judys deviled eggs ; ingredients: hard-cooked eggs, mayonnaise, prepared mustard, worcestershire sauce, old bay seasoning, distilled white vinegar, black pepper, salt, paprika ; preparation:Combine the thoroughly mashed yolks with the mayonnaise and mustard. Add in worcestershire sauce, old bay, vinegar, and pepper. Stir to combine. Taste and if needed, add salt. Fill the whites evenly with the mixture and garnish each egg half with a sprinkle of paprika. ; name: beer batter coconut shrimp ; ingredients: beer, all-purpose flour, cream of wheat, salt, ground paprika, unsweetened dried shredded coconut, shrimp, peanut oil, chinese duck sauce ; preparation:Preheat oil in deep fryer or heavy sauce pan to 360f. Combine beer, flour, cream of wheat, salt and paprika in a medium bowl, stir in 1 cup coconut. Mix well and let stand 5 minutes. Place remaining coconut in a shallow bowl. Place shrimp in batter and stir to coat. Remove shrimp individually and dip into coconut, covering evenly. Fry shrimp in batches 4 minutes or until golden brown. Remove with slotted spoon and drain on paper towels. Serve with your favorite dipping sauce. ; name: rice fritta ; ingredients: rice, eggs, swiss chard, onion, parsley, rosemary, thyme, salt and pepper, parmesan cheese, olive oil ; preparation:Preheat oven 325f. Cook rice and saut onion. Combine cooked rice, onion, and chard. Add beaten eggs, parsley, rosemary, thyme, salt, pepper and parmesan cheese. Mix well. Put olive oil in glass pan. Pour mixture into pan. Bake 35 to 40 minutes or until firm. ; name: peppered almonds ; ingredients: almonds, vegetable oil, sugar, ground black pepper, salt ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400f. Stir all ingredients in small baking pan to coat almonds. Arrange in single layer. Bake until coating is crisp and almonds are toasted, stirring occasionally, about 12 minutes. Cool. ; name: velvet strawberries ; ingredients: strawberries, heavy whipping cream, sweet chocolate, powdered sugar, vanilla ; preparation:Hull berries and slice in half. Arrange in bowl. Whip heavy cream and powdered sugar until barely thick. Fold in grated sweet chocolate and vanilla. Serve as sauce over berries. ; name: chocolate chip crispers ; ingredients: butter, white sugar, egg, vanilla extract, all-purpose flour, baking soda, salt, rice krispies, chocolate chips ; preparation:In large bowl beat together butter and sugar. Beat in egg and vanilla. Sift together flour, soda and salt. Mix into wet ingredients. Stir in crispies, and chocolate chips. Drop by tablespoon full onto greased cookie sheet 1 inch apart. Bake at 350 for 10-12 minutes or until lightly browned. ; name: pomegranate with orange juice and strawberries ; ingredients: pomegranates, orange juice, sugar, lemon juice, oranges, strawberry, mint leaf ; preparation:

name: friggione a side dish of potatoes tomatoes peppers ; ingredients: olive oil, potatoes, onions, red peppers, tomatoes seasoned with basil garlic & oregano, salt, sugar, fresh ground black pepper, parsley ; preparation:Heat oil in large frypan. Non stick is best. Cut the potatoes into 1cm cubes and slice the onions and peppers. Add these to the hot oil and cover and cook over a low to moderate heat for about 20 minutes, stirring several times, until the vegetables are tender and lightly browned. Do not try to hurry this step by cooking on a high heat. Add the can of tomatoes and their juice. Cook uncovered for a further 15-30 minutes until the mixture darkens in colour and the liquid has reduced so that there is only a small amount left around the potatoes. Again do not use a high heat. Season to taste and sprinkle with the chopped parsley if using before serving. Serve hot or warm reheating if neccesary if your meat is not ready at the same time. ; name: fried eggs with kansas city style barbecue sauce for 1 ; ingredients: olive oil, arugula leaf, egg, barbecue sauce, sharp white cheddar cheese, fresh cilantro, cracked black pepper ; preparation:Heat up a skillet on medium heat then add the olive oil. Arrange the arugula leaves on a plate. Gently crack the egg and lightly fry for 3 minutes, or to your preference. Carefully arrange the fried egg on the arugula leaves. Spoon barbecue sauce on and around the egg and greens. Grate cheese on top followed by a garnish of fresh cilantro. Season with cracked black pepper. ; name: broccoli potato bake ; ingredients: butter, all-purpose flour, salt, milk, cream cheese, swiss cheese, frozen hash brown potatoes, frozen chopped broccoli, breadcrumbs ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a large saucepan, melt 2 tablespoons butter. Stir in flour and salt. Add milk and stir until bubbly. Add cheeses, and stir until all of the cheese is melted. Stir in potatoes and heat thoroughly. Pour half of the mixture into a 10x6 inch baking dish. Cook broccoli according to package instructions, drain well. Layer broccoli over the potatoes in the baking dish. Pour the remaining potato mixture over the broccoli. Sprinkle the bread crumbs and 1 tablespoon melted butter over the top of the casserole. Bake at 350 for 20 to 35 minutes, or until bubbly and browned lightly. ; name: low fat pesto sauce ; ingredients: chicken broth, garlic cloves, fresh basil, parmesan cheese, pine nuts ; preparation:Combine stock and garlic and heat in the microwave on high for 5 minutes. Allow to cool. Chop basil in food processor. Add cooled stock, parmesan cheese and pine nuts. Whirl until everything is finely chopped and blended. Meanwhile, cook pasta of your choice. Toss sauce with pasta. Serve with additional parmesan cheese if desired. Use as a topping for fish, chicken or potatoes also. Makes 4 servings. ; name: cube steaks au poivre ; ingredients: cube steaks, butter, fresh coarse ground black pepper, lemon juice, salt, water, worcestershire sauce ; preparation:Sprinkle steaks with salt and pepper to taste. In a large skillet, melt butter and cook steaks 2 at a time on medium-high heat until browned on both sides, about 4 minutes for each set of steaks. Reserve drippings in pan. Arrange steaks on a platter and keep warm. Into pan drippings, over medium high heat, add remaining ingredients. Stirring often to losen brown bits on bottom of skillet, heat until warm. Pour over steaks and serve. ; name: baloney bologna gravy ; ingredients: bologna, oil, flour, milk, water, salt and pepper ; preparation:Take your bologna and cut all 6-7 pieces at the same time, in about 1 inch squares. Put oil in pan and lightly brown bologna. Add flour to thicken the oil, it is really hard to say exactly how much flour, it is just like making any other gravy. I also add the pepper, we like alot of pepper in ours, it just depends on your taste. I take the milk and water in the same glass and slowly pour it into the pan, stirring constantly until you have gravy. Serve over bisquits, with a couple of fried eggs on the side, and you got yourself one good breakfast. ; name: sweet and sour chambord sauce ; ingredients: vegetable oil, scallions, garlic, chicken stock, chambord raspberry liquor, rice vinegar, soy sauce, honey, ground black pepper, cornstarch ; preparation:Heat oil in a saucepot. Add scallions, garlic and ginger, and cook for 20 seconds. Do not brown. Add chicken stock, chambord, vinegar, soy sauce, honey and pepper, and cook over low heat for two minutes. Stir in cornstarch to thicken and cook for an additional two minutes. Strain through fine mesh strainer if desired. ; name: ronague bay cocktail isle of man ; ingredients: whiskey, lime, juice of, sugar, ice, lime wedge ; preparation:

name: pasta arrabbiata ; ingredients: olive oil, garlic cloves, red pepper flakes, whole canned tomatoes, sugar, tomato sauce, dry white wine, oregano, basil, pasta ; preparation:Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Cook pasta in boiling water until just al dente. Meanwhile, heat olive oil in a large skillet. Add garlic and red pepper flakes. Cook until fragrant. Add remaining ingredients except pasta. Simmer about 10 minutes. Drain pasta. Add to sauce and cook, stirring, about 2 minutes. Season with salt and serve. ; name: strawberry spread ; ingredients: cream cheese, strawberry jam, orange peel, pecans ; preparation:In a medium bowl, combine cream cheese, jam, and orange peel. Stir in pecans. Cover and chill until firm. Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator. Serve with toast or muffins. ; name: tex mex salsa ; ingredients: fresh jalapenos, onion, garlic cloves, whole tomatoes, diced tomatoes, salt, vinegar, fresh cilantro ; preparation:In a food processor or blender add onion, garlic, cilantro, vinegar, and jalapenos. Pulse until thoroughly chopped. Add canned tomatoes and salt. Pulse until throughly combined. Store in refrigerator until ready to use. ; name: easy pepperoni pinwheels ; ingredients: prepared pizza crust, mozzarella cheese, parmesan cheese, pepperoni, spaghetti sauce ; preparation:Unroll pizza crust on a cutting board, and sprinkle with cheeses and pepperoni. Roll up, starting with long side. Moisten edge with water, and pinch seam to seal. Cut into 2-inch slices, and place 1 inch apart in a lightly greased 15- x 10-inch jellyroll pan. Flatten pinwheels slightly. Bake at 400 for 15 to 20 minutes. Serve with warm spaghetti sauce. ; name: pink salty dog cocktail ; ingredients: coarse salt, grapefruit, pink grapefruit juice, vodka, liqueur, ice cube ; preparation:Place salt in a saucer. Moisten the rim of a glass with a grapefruit slice. Dip rim in salt. Combine juice and vodka with campari or grenadine in the jar of a blender. Blend. With the motor running, add ice until fully incorporated and slushy. Pour into prepared glass. ; name: lettuce wedge with ranch dressing ; ingredients: head iceberg lettuce, cucumber, sour cream, plain yogurt, mayonnaise, garlic clove, white vinegar, chives, salt, pepper ; preparation:Trim the core even with the bottom of the lettuce and cut the lettuce into quarters through the core. If the quarters look too big for a single serving, either cut them in half or trim them to whatever size you feel is a good serving. Combine the sour cream, yogurt, mayonnaise, garlic, vinegar, and chives in a bowl until well mixed. Season with salt and pepper. Cover and refrigerate until ready to use. To serve, set the wedge of iceberg in the center of a salad plate, add cucumber, and spoon the dressing over and dash it with a good pinch of chives. ; name: skillet chicken with tomatoes ; ingredients: boneless skinless chicken breast halves, fat-free italian salad dressing, olive oil, italian-style stewed tomatoes ; preparation:In a resealable plastic bag, combine chicken and salad dressing. Set aside in refrigerator for 20 minutes. Remove chicken from marinade, reserving marinade. Warm oil in a medium skillet over med-high heat. Add chicken and cook 5 minutes, or until no longer pink, turning occasionally. Stir in reserved marinade and tomatoes with juice. Heat to boiling, reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer 15 minutes, or until a thermometer in thickest portion registers 160 degrees and juices run clear. ; name: fresh mint and rosemary sauce ; ingredients: fresh mint leaves, fresh rosemary, granulated sugar, balsamic vinegar ; preparation:

name: czech summer kohlrabi ; ingredients: onion, kohlrabi, butter, salt, fresh ground black pepper, flour, milk, fresh parsley ; preparation:In a heavy frying pan over medium heat, saut onions and 1 pound kohlrabi in butter until well coated with the butter. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Cover tightly and cook, stirring occasionally, until kohlrabi is tender, about 25 minutes. Sprinkle with flour and turn to mix. Gradually add milk and cook and gently stir mixture until milk thickens to a smooth sauce. Correct seasoning, adding salt and pepper generously. Stir in parsley. Makes 4 servings. Womans day home cooking around the world. ; name: zucchini italiano ; ingredients: vegetable oil, garlic clove, onion, zucchini, no-salt-added tomato sauce, italian seasoning, reduced-fat monterey jack cheese, lowfat swiss cheese ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Place oil and garlic in a skillet over medium-high heat. Saute until garlic is browned. Add onion and zucchini. Toss well with garlic oil, gently stirring. Stir in tomato sauce and seasonings. Turn into a 2-quart baking dish. Cover and bake for 20 minutes. Remove from oven and sprinkle on cheeses. Cover casserole and let sit for 2 minutes or until cheese melts- serve immediately. ; name: veggie ham and eggs ; ingredients: cooked ham, fresh mushrooms, sweet red pepper, green onion, butter, eggs, milk, salt, cheddar cheese ; preparation:In a skillet, saut the ham, mushrooms, pepper and onions in butter for 6 minutes or until veggies are tender. In a bowl, combine the eggs, milk and salt. Remove ham mixture from skillet. Keep warm. In same skillet, add egg mixture. Cook and stir til eggs are slightly set. Add ham mixture. Cook and stir until eggs are completely set. Sprinkle with cheese. ; name: tomato and garlic salad salat iz pomidorov s chesnokom ; ingredients: red wine vinegar, garlic cloves, tomatoes, red onion, extra virgin olive oil, salt and pepper, fresh basil ; preparation:In a small bowl, combine the vinegar and the garlic and let stand for 30 minutes. Place the tomatoes and onion in a salad bowl and sprinkle with the vinegar and garlic mixture. Toss with the olive oil and season with salt and pepper. Cover and refrigerate for 30 minutes. Sprinkle the salad with the basil and serve. ; name: honeydew lime frappe ; ingredients: honeydew melon, fresh lime juice, club soda, ice ; preparation:Remove seeds and pulp from melon. Peel. Chop melon into smaller pieces and place in blender with lime juice. Puree until smooth. Stir in club soda and gently mix. Pour into glasses, and add a little crushed ice. Garnish glass with a lime wedge if you desire. ; name: haupia hawaiian coconut pudding ; ingredients: coconut milk, water, sugar, cornstarch ; preparation:Combine all ingredients in saucepan. Stir over medium heat until thickened. Lower heat and cook for ten minutes, stirring constantly to avoid lumping or burning. Pour into 8x8 inch dish and chill until set. Cut haupia into squares. ; name: dirty thumbprint cookies ; ingredients: margarine, sugar, vanilla, egg, flour, cocoa, baking powder, preserves ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350. Beat margerine and sugar until fluffy, add vanilla and egg. Stir in flour, cocoa and baking powder. Roll into balls and make an indentation in the middle of each cookie with thumb or end of a wooden spoon. Fill each cookies with about half a tsp of jelly, bake for 12 to 15 minutes. ; name: white castle breakfast casserole ; ingredients: white castle hamburgers, mild cheddar cheese, eggs, skim milk, salt, pepper, mild green chilies ; preparation:

name: easy pennsylvania dutch cracker pudding ; ingredients: milk, saltine crackers, eggs, sugar, shredded coconut, vanilla ; preparation:Bring milk to a simmer in a medium pan. Mix crackers, sugar and coconut in a medium bowl. Stir cracker mixture into milk in the pan. Beat eggs in the medium bowl you just emptied. Stir a few spoonfuls of the hot pan mixture into the beaten egg. Now add egg mixture to pan and gently boil about 3 minutes, stirring constantly. Stir in vanilla. Chill and serve. ; name: blueberry rhubarb bluebarb jam ; ingredients: rhubarb, water, sugar, blueberry pie filling, red jell-o ; preparation:Boil water and rhubarb until tender, about 10-15 minutes. Stir occasionally. Add sugar, stir and bring to a boil again. Add pie filling, stir, boil 10 minutes. Turn off the heat. Stir in jello. Put in hot jars & seal. ; name: pumpkin soup ; ingredients: olive oil, leeks, carrots, garlic cloves, pumpkin flesh, water, chicken stock, cream, pepper ; preparation:Heat the oil in a pan add leeks and garlic and cook until soft. Add carrots, pumpkin, stock and water and cook covered until pumpkin is soft. Spoon 2 cups of liquid out, blend or process soup until smooth. Add pepper to your liking. Serve soup in bowls pour a about 1-2 tablespoons of cream over top and serve immediately. Makes about 6-8 servings great for lunches or as a starter. ; name: fantastic old fashioned ice cream soda ; ingredients: milk, chocolate syrup, vanilla ice cream, club soda, whipped cream ; preparation:Pour the milk into one tall 16-ounce glass. Stir in syrup. Add in ice cream and enough soda water or selzer to fill almost to top of glass. Top with whipped cream if desired. Serve with a long spoon and a big straw. ; name: black bean nachos with chipotle tabasco ; ingredients: black beans, ground cumin, tabasco brand chipotle pepper sauce, tortilla chips, red onion, tomatoes, shredded cheddar cheese, cilantro ; preparation:In a bowl, combine beans, cumin and tabasco brand chipotle pepper sauce and mix well. Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Spread tortilla chips in a single layer over large baking sheet with edges slightly overlapping. Spoon approximately one teaspoonful of black beans onto each corn chip and top with onion, tomato, and cheese. Bake in oven 6 to 8 minutes or until cheese melts and nachos are heated through. Sprinkle with the fresh cilantro. Serve hot. ; name: spinach and tortellini soup ; ingredients: olive oil, garlic cloves, onion, chicken broth, dried italian herb seasoning, tortellini, diced tomatoes with juice, fresh spinach, parmesan cheese ; preparation:In oil in a large pot over medium heat, cook onion and garlic about 10 minutes until lightly browned. Add broth and herbs, bring to boil. Stir in tortellini, reduce heat and simmer 10-15 minutes. Stir in tomatoes with juice and simmer 5 more minutes. Add chopped spinach and simmer 3-5 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Serve with a sprinkling of cheese on top. ; name: venison parmesan ; ingredients: steaks, parmesan cheese, breadcrumbs, eggs, salt and black pepper, olive oil, spaghetti sauce, mozzarella cheese ; preparation:Mix together 3 tbsp. Parmesan cheese with 1 cup bread crumbs. In bowl, beat 2 eggs, salt and pepper to taste. Dip venison in eggs, then bread crumbs. Heat 6 tbsp. Olive oil in skillet till hot. Fry venison 5 mins. Each side till brown. Then place venison on a cookie sheet, spoon spaghetti sauce over venison and bake in 325 degree oven till tender, i usually bake 15 or 20 mins. Then add mozzeralla cheese and bake till cheese melts. ; name: orange blondies ; ingredients: all-purpose flour, granulated sugar, salt, butter, eggs, orange extract, orange zest, powdered sugar, cream cheese, orange juice ; preparation:

name: millet vegetable soup ; ingredients: millet, stock, scallions, onion, garlic cloves, tomato paste, frozen vegetables, salt and pepper, parsley ; preparation:In a medium saucepan, heat 2 cups of stock to boiling over high heat. Add millet. Reduce heat to lo. Cook, covered, until millet is tender and most of the liquid is absorbed, 25-30 minutes. In a large saucepan, heat 1 tablespoon of stock. Add scallions, onion and garlic. Cook over medium heat until soft about 5 minutes. Add 3 cups stock and tomato paste. Add vegetables. Reduce heat to low and simmer, covered for 15 minutes. Add salt and pepper, cooked millet and parsley. Cook 5 minutes longer. ; name: easy cheesy broccoli soup ; ingredients: frozen cut broccoli in cheese sauce, margarine, onion, flour, parsley flakes, instant chicken bouillon, garlic powder, water, milk ; preparation:Place unopened broccoli pouch in vigorously boiling water in saucepan. Do not cover. Bring water to a second vigorous boil and heat for 16 minutes. Meanwhile, in medium saucepan, melt margarine. Saute onion in margarine until tender. Stir in flour, parsley flakes, bouillon and garlic powder until well blended. Add water and milk. Cook until thickened, stirring constantly. Stir in broccoli. ; name: garlic lemon green beans ; ingredients: green beans, olive oil, garlic, lemon juice, salt and pepper, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Steam green beans until tender, then drain. Heat olive oil in pan over medium heat and saute garlic 1 minute. Add beans and turn to coat with oil. Add lemon juice, salt& pepper and mix. Serve sprinkled with parmesan cheese. ; name: apple squares ; ingredients: rolled oats, flour, shortening, baking soda, brown sugar, sliced apples, butter, cinnamon, white sugar ; preparation:Mix rolled oats, flour, shortening, soda and brown sugar together and put half of mixture in bottom of baking pan. Mix together sliced apples, butter, cinnamon and white sugar. Spread over first layer of rolled oats. Cover with remaining rolled oat mixture. Bake in 350 degree oven 35- 40 minutes til done. ; name: lemon myrtle biscuits cookies ; ingredients: white sugar, butter, self raising flour, eggs, ground lemon myrtle ; preparation:Cream together sugar and butter. Add the eggs one at a time. Mix together the sifted flour and lemon myrtle. Once the eggs are combined stir in the flour and lemon myrtle mix until combined. Do not over mix the dough. Roll dough mixute into small balls about the size of a walnut. Place on to greased biscuit baking trays. With a floured fork, press each ball slightly. Bake in a moderate oven for 12 to 15 minutes or until golden brown. Cool on a tray. Store in an airtight container. ; name: crispy bananas with cinnamon chocolate sauce ; ingredients: bananas, flour, egg, half-and-half, panko breadcrumbs, semi-sweet chocolate chips, cinnamon, whipped cream, vegetable oil ; preparation:Add 1 cup half and half and chocolate chips to a small saucepan, and melt together over low heat. Add cinnamon, stir well. Cut bananas into quarters. Beat egg with 1 tbsp half and half. Dredge bananas in flour, egg, and then panko crumbs. Heat oil in a wide skillet over medium heat. Fry bananas just until crisp and lightly browned. Serve 1 banana in each dish, drizzled with chocolate sauce and topped with whipped cream. ; name: sweet sticky and spicy chicken ; ingredients: brown sugar, honey, soy sauce, fresh gingerroot, garlic, hot sauce, salt and pepper, chicken breast halves, vegetable oil ; preparation:Mix together brown sugar, honey, soy sauce, ginger, garlic and hot sauce in a small bowl. Lightly salt and pepper the chicken strips. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add chicken strips and brown on both sides, about 1 minute per side. Pour the sauce over the chicken. Simmer uncovered until the sauce thickens, 8 to 10 minutes. ; name: domatokeftedes greek tomato patties ; ingredients: tomatoes, onion, sugar, salt and pepper, self-raising flour, olive oil, mint ; preparation:

name: greek red snapper ; ingredients: red snapper, onion, green pepper, garlic cloves, whole tomatoes, white wine, parsley, basil, greek olives ; preparation:Saute onion, pepper, and garlic in hot oil. Add tomatoes. Simmer 15 minutes. Brush a shallow baking dish with olive oil and place fish in dish. Pour wine over top. Pour hot tomato mixture over fish. Dot with a little butter. Bake at 350f for 45 minutes to 1 hour. Combine parsley, basil and olives and sprinkle over fish. ; name: shrimp and chips ; ingredients: cooked shrimp, beer, flour, baking powder, salt, fresh ground black pepper ; preparation:Mix all ingredients except shrimp in a mixing bowl to make batter. Dust shrimp in flour. Dip shrimp into batter. Fry shrimp in deep fryer set at 375 degrees or in a skillet with 2 inches of vegetable oil, until golden brown. Drain shrimp on paper towels or on brown grocery bags from the market. Serve with french fries and cole slaw or creamy cucumber salad. Also serve with cocktail sauce and tartar sauce. ; name: sausage hamburger dip ; ingredients: bulk pork sausage, lean ground beef, hot salsa, cream of mushroom soup, tomatoes and green chilies, garlic powder, oregano, processed cheese ; preparation:In a large skillet, brown, cook sausage and ground beef for 15 minutes and drain. Place in a 4-5 quart slow cooker sprayed with vegetable cooking spray. Add salsa, mushroom soup, tomatoes, green chilies, garlic powder, and oregeno and stir well. Fold into cheese. Cover and cook on low for 1 hour or until cheese melts. Stir once during cooking. Serve from cooker. ; name: italian breakfast lemon loaf ; ingredients: eggs, sugar, vegetable oil, milk, lemon juice, lemon zest, flour, baking powder, salt ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350. Grease and flour a 9x5x3 loaf pan. Put the eggs in a mixing bowl and beat with an electric mixer until they are pale yellow and thickened. With the mixer running, gradually add the sugar and then the oil in a slow, steady stream. In a small bowl, stir milk, lemon juice, and lemon zest together and add to batter. Sift flour, baking powder, and salt together and blend into batter until thoroughly mixed. Pour batter into the prepared pan, which should be about two-thirds full. Place in oven and bake about 35 to 40 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted near the center of the loaf comes out clean. Place the pan on a cooling rack for 5 minutes. Loosen loaf and turn out onto the rack. Turn loaf upright and let cool completely. Sprinkle with powdered sugar or you can make a lemon glaze and drizzle over. ; name: kale chorizo soup ; ingredients: chorizo sausages, onion, olive oil, garlic, potato, kale, chicken stock, salt, pepper ; preparation:Dice the onion and finely chop the garlic. Wash the kale and remove the stems. Peel and dice the potatoes. Thickly slice the sausage. Heat the oil and cook the onion and sausage over a low heat for about 20 minutes until soft. Stir in the garlic and potatoes and cook for a further 10 minutes. Add the kale leaves and cover with the stock. Simmer for 30 minutes adding more stock to keep everything covered. Season to taste and serve with crusty bread. ; name: naturally sweetened banana bread ; ingredients: bananas, unsweetened applesauce, eggs, water, vanilla extract, whole wheat flour, baking soda, baking powder, cinnamon ; preparation:Preheat oven to 325 f. Mash the bananas until they are mostly lump-free. With a hand mixer, beat together the banana, applesauce, eggs, vanilla, and water until creamy. In a separate bowl, sift the flour, baking soda, baking powder, and spices. Gradually add the dry mixture to the wet ingredients, beating well. Pour the batter into a gently oiled and floured 95 inches loaf pan and spread evenly. Bake for 45 minutes or until a toothpick is inserted and comes out clean. Cool completely on wire rack before slicing. ; name: grilled broccoli ; ingredients: broccoli, olive oil, kosher salt, granulated sugar ; preparation:Cut up broccoli into spearlike pieces. Place in a pyrex dish. Coat broccoli pieces with olive oil. Sprinkle with salt and sugar. Cover dish with foil. Place dish on medium to low heat on grill. Heat for approximately 15 minutes. ; name: caribbean shrimp ; ingredients: shrimp, olive oil, garlic, dried rosemary, dried thyme, black pepper, cayenne pepper, salt, lime ; preparation:

name: tuna croquettes ; ingredients: canned tuna, wheat germ, eggs, tomato juice, fresh dill, black pepper, cooking oil ; preparation:In a large bowl, combine all the ingredients. Nix well. Shape the mixture into 4 equal size patties. Heat 1 to 2 tablespoons oil in heavy frying pan add the formed patties and fry on both sides until golden brown. Drain on paper towels to absorb excess oil. ; name: beef noodle bake ; ingredients: ground beef, onion, green pepper, tomato sauce, seasoning salt, pepper, cream-style cottage cheese, cream cheese, medium noodles ; preparation:Cook beef, onion and pepper in skillet until meat is browned and vegetables are tender. Drain. Stir in tomato sauce, seasoned salt, and pepper. Blend cottage cheese and cream cheese together until fluffy. Spoon noodles into grease 10x6x2 inch baking dish. Spread cheese mixture over noodles. Pour meat sauce on top. Bake uncovered at 350 for 30 to 40 minutes or until heated through. ; name: apple and brie toasts ; ingredients: baguette, brown sugar, walnuts, butter, brie cheese, granny smith apples ; preparation:Arrange bread slices on an ungreased baking sheet. Bake at 350 f until lightly toasted. Set aside. Mix together sugar, walnuts, and butter. Top each slice of bread with a cheese slice, an apple slice, and one teaspoon of the walnut mixture. Bake until cheese melts. ; name: seafood chicken ; ingredients: cooked chicken, tuna in vegetable oil, lemons, kalamata olive, hard-boiled eggs, artichoke hearts, lettuce leaf, mayonnaise, fresh parsley ; preparation:Place lettuce leaves on a serving platter and arrange the chicken pieces and chunks of tuna on top of the lettuce leaves. Add the lemon quarters to the platter. And the olives, boiled egg slices and artichoke hearts. Top with mayonnaise or serve the mayonnaise separately in a bowl or jug. Garnish with the chopped parsley. ; name: yaki mondoo pot stickers ; ingredients: ground beef, onion, green pepper, colby cheese, cheddar cheese, cooked rice, sweet and sour sauce, egg roll wraps, oil ; preparation:Cook ground beef with onion and pepper. Mix all ingredients together, except wraps and oil. Heat oil. Fill wraps with meat, cheese and rice mixture. Deep fry until golden brown. ; name: sweet pickled grapes ; ingredients: seedless grapes, wine vinegar, water, oranges, juice of, cinnamon stick, cloves, sugar ; preparation:Put the wine vinegar, water, orange juice, cinnamon, cloves and sugar into a sauce pan, bring to the boil then set aside to cool. Wash the grapes, take them off their stalks and make sure you remove any remaining bits of stalk from the grapes. When the vinegar mixture is cool, remove the cinnamon stick. Take a clean jar and pack in the grapes. Pour the vinegar mixture into the jar to cover the grapes, then seal the jar tightly. Leave the jar in a cool dark place for 2 days before eating - i keep mine in the fridge, because i am not sure how well they keep if not chilled. Eat within 2 weeks of making. ; name: banana lemon tea bread ; ingredients: butter, sugar, eggs, bananas, fresh lemon juice, all-purpose flour, baking soda, salt, fresh lemon zest ; preparation:Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. Butter a 9 x 5 x 3 inch loaf pan. Cream butter with sugar for 6 minutes, until light. Beat in eggs, one at a time. Blend in bananas and lemon juice. Sift together flour, baking soda and salt. Blend into banana mixture along with lemon zest. Turn into prepared pan. Bake for 1 hour or until tested done. Remove, cool for 15 minutes and turn out of pan. Cool completely. ; name: bourbon carrots ; ingredients: water, baby carrots, white sugar, salt, butter, brown sugar, bourbon, fresh parsley ; preparation:

name: hamburgers to freeze ; ingredients: lean beef, onions, sweet green pepper, egg, dry mustard, worcestershire sauce, pepper, hot pepper sauce ; preparation:In large bowl, combine beef, onions, green pepper, egg, mustard, worcestershire sauce, pepper and hot pepper sauce. Mix until just combined, using spoon or hands. Divide mixture into 20 portions, shaping each into a round patty. Place on baking sheets and freeze until solid. Stack with foil or paper plates between them and store in freezer bags and store up to 4 months in freezer. ; name: lemon cheese spritz cookies ; ingredients: butter, cream cheese, sugar, egg, lemon rind, lemon juice, flour, baking powder ; preparation:Cream butter, cheese, and sugar until fluffy. Blend in remaining ingredients. Cover and chill. Press out cookies on un-greased baking sheet. Sprinkle with colored sugars. Bake at 375 f 7-8 minutes. ; name: dijon caper chicken and pasta sauce ; ingredients: butter, chicken breasts, flour, chicken broth, half-and-half, dijon mustard, tomatoes, fresh parsley, frozen peas, capers ; preparation:Melt butter or olive oil in a large skillet. Add chicken breasts and cook until done and lightly browned, about 20 minutes. Remove chicken to a warm serving platter. Stir flour into pan drippings in skillet, cook for 1 minute. Add the chicken broth, half and half. Stir and cook until the sauce thickens and bubbbles, add in mustard, capers and frozen peas. Return chicken to skillet, cover and heat for 10 minutes. Garnish with tomatoes and sprinkle with parsley. We typically serve with tortolini or other pasta and cover with extra dijon sauce. ; name: halibut italiano ; ingredients: halibut fillets, spaghetti sauce, sliced mushrooms, olive, mozzarella cheese, olive oil ; preparation:Place fish in oiled baking pan. Top with mushrooms and olives. Pour spaghetti sauce over the top and bake for 10 minutes at 400 degrees. Remove from oven and sprinkle with cheese. Bake 10 more minutes or until fish flakes easily with a fork. Serve with chopped parsley over the top and a lemon wedge on the side. ; name: spinach dip pinwheels ; ingredients: frozen chopped spinach, knorr vegetable soup mix, sour cream, mayonnaise, water chestnuts, green onions, flour tortillas ; preparation:Stir together soup mix, sour cream, and mayo until well blended. Stir in spinach, water chestnuts and green onions. Spread tortillas with dip, not quite to the edges. Roll up tightly. Slice into 1 inch pieces. Arrange on serving platter and refrigerate until ready to serve. ; name: tomato onion parmesan frittata ; ingredients: eggs, water, red onion, olive oil, tomatoes, fresh parsley, parmesan cheese, salt and pepper ; preparation:Heat 2 t olive oil in a skillet that you can eventually place under the broiler. Add onion to skillet and cook until soft, about 4 minutes. Add 1 t olive oil and heat. Add eggs seasoned with salt, pepper, parsley and cheese. Cook until bottom of frittata begins to solidify. Gently place the rounds of tomato on the egg mixture. Cover and cook over low heat until top of frittata firms, about 5 minutes. Finish by placing under preheated broiler for a minute or two until lightly browned. Cut into triangles. ; name: cheesy beef noodles ; ingredients: ground beef, tomato sauce, taco seasoning, sharp cheddar cheese, egg noodles ; preparation:Brown and drain ground beef. Cook and drain noodles. Mix ground beef, tomato sauce and taco seasoning. Spread noodles in the bottom of a 9x13 pan. Spread beef mixture over noodles. Mix slightly. Cover with cheese. Bake 350 for about 20 minutes until heated though and cheese is melted. ; name: pan fried mozzarella wrapped in prosciutto ; ingredients: mozzarella cheese, prosciutto, olive oil, black pepper, mixed salad green, balsamic vinegar, cranberry sauce, toothpick ; preparation:

name: sandra lee s rose sangria ; ingredients: rose wine, sprite, light rum, brandy, ice cube, apple, red grapes, lemon slice, lime slice ; preparation:Combine wine, sprite, rum, and brandy in a clear glass pitcher filled halfway with ice cubes. Stir with a long wooden spoon. Add a few slices of apple, halved grapes, and lemon and lime slices to pitcher. Stir once more. Pour sangra into tulip glasses. ; name: peach jam ; ingredients: peaches, bottled lemon juice, sugar, nutmeg ; preparation:Prepare peaches by peeling, pitting, and cutting into quarters. Chop in a food processor or cut into small pieces. Put the peaches, lemon juice, sugar, and nutmeg in a saucepan over medium heat, stirring to dissolve all the sugar. Boil rapidly and stir constantly until the jam is thick or has reached the jell point on a thermometer. Remove from heat and let stand 5 minutes. Skim off any foam. Ladle into hot jars. Clean the rims, seal, and process in hot water bath for 10 minutes. ; name: apple and pecan cake ; ingredients: wholemeal self-rising flour, oats, bicarbonate of soda, allspice, brown sugar, pecans, oil, egg, apples ; preparation:Preheat oven to 180 degree celsius. Lightly grease and line a 20cm cake tin and line with baking paper. In a bowl combine the flour, oats, bicarbonate of soda, allspice, sugar and pecans. Make a well in the centre and then add the oil and egg and then the apples and combine all ingredients well together. Pour mix into the prepared tin and cook for 35 minutes until golden brown. ; name: orange crusted fish ; ingredients: bread, fresh parsley, orange, red chile, white fish fillets, cooking spray ; preparation:Preheat oven to 200 degree c. Process the bread in a blender or food processor to form fine crumbs. Transfer to a bowl and stir in the parsley, orange rind and chilli. Season with salt and pepper. Spray the fish with oil. Place into a baking dish and press the crumb mix onto the fish. Spray with oil again. Cook for 10 to 15 minutes or until fish is cooked through. ; name: beef diablo ; ingredients: pot roast, potatoes, onion, flour, prepared mustard, chili sauce, worcestershire sauce, vinegar, sugar ; preparation:Trim all excess fat from roast. Place potatoes and onion in bottom of crockery pot. Make a smooth paste of flour, mustard, chili sauce, worcestershire sauce, vinegar, and sugar. Spread over top of roast. Place roast in crockery pot on top of potatoes and onions. Cover and cook on low setting for 10-12 hours. ; name: molded seafood spread ; ingredients: cream of mushroom soup, cream cheese, unflavored gelatin, cold water, mayonnaise, scallion, baby shrimp, celery ; preparation:Heat soup and cream cheese together in saucepan over low heat, whisking until smooth. In small bowl, soften gelatine in cold water and add to cream cheese mixture. Stir until well blended. In separate bowl, mix together mayonnaise, scallions and celery. Stir into cream cheese mixture until well blended. Gently fold in shrimp until well mixed and turn into a lightly oiled 4 cup mold. Chill several hours or overnight. To unmold, place mold in warm water for a few seconds and invert onto a plate. Place crackers around. ; name: parker s deviled eggs ; ingredients: light mayonnaise, dill, mustard, cider vinegar, hard-boiled eggs, paprika, onion powder ; preparation:Slice eggs in half and remove yolks. Mash yolks, dill and powdered spices together first for smoother filling. Then add wet ingredients - mayo, mustard, vinegar. Stir until smooth. Spoon into egg halves and chill. ; name: baked cauliflower with italian seasoning ; ingredients: cauliflower, margarine, italian seasoned breadcrumbs, garlic powder, dried basil, oregano ; preparation:

name: creamy shrimp salad on romaine ; ingredients: shrimp, celery, egg whites, walnuts, onions, fat-free thousand island salad dressing, romaine lettuce ; preparation:In a large bowl, combine the shrimp, celery, egg whites, walnuts and onions. Add the dressing and stir until the shrimp-mixture is coated. Cover and chill in the refrigerator about 30 minutes to blend the flavors. To serve, divide the lettuce among four plates. Then top with shrimp mixture. ; name: magic bullet speedy guacamole ; ingredients: avocados, garlic cloves, fresh lemon juice, onion, cherry tomatoes, fresh cilantro, jalapeno pepper, salt and pepper ; preparation:Scoop out avocado meat, discarding the pit. Place in the short cup. Place the remaining ingredients, in the order they are listed, into the short cup. Your may need to cut up the tomatoes to make them fit. Twist on the cross blade and place the cup onto the power base. Give it 3-4 quick pulses until all the ingredients are chopped and blended. Make sure to apply a bit of counter-clockwise pressure to the cup to keep it from locking on. And you may need to use the tap technique to make sure everything gets completely chopped. Tastes best chilled. ; name: curried string green beans ; ingredients: onion, oil, garlic cloves, string beans, tomatoes, tomato paste, curry powder, sugar, salt and pepper ; preparation:Saut onion in oil until lightly browned. Add garlic and saut briefly. Add remaining ingredients. Add water to just barely cover string beans. Mix well. Partially cover and cook on low flame for approximately 40 minutes, until string beans are tender and liquid is partially absorbed. ; name: absolutely best brownies ; ingredients: butter, sugar, eggs, vanilla, cocoa, salt, self-rising flour, walnuts ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees fahrenheit. Grease and flour a 9 x 9-inch pan. In a bowl, beat together the butter and sugar. Add eggs and vanilla. Mix well. Combine the cocoa, salt, and flour together. Stir into the sugar mixture. Stir in the walnuts. Spread evenly into prepared pan. Bake for 25 to 30 minutes or until firm. ; name: veal or chicken stew with herbs barley ; ingredients: butter, stewing veal, leek, garlic, barley, water, red wine vinegar, bay leaves, salt and pepper, sage leaves ; preparation:Melt the butter in a heavy pan and fry the meat with the leeks and garlic till the vegetables are slightly softened and the meat lightly browned. Add the barley, water, vinegar, bay leaves and seasoning. Bring the pot to the boil, cover it and simmer gently for 1 to 1 hours or until the meat is really tender and ready to fall from the bone. Add the sage and continue to cook for several minutes. Adjust the seasoning to taste and serve in bowls- the barley will serve as a vegetable. ; name: spicy pork soup ; ingredients: oriental sesame oil, pork tenderloin, green onions, fresh ginger, low sodium chicken broth, linguine, mung bean sprouts, soy sauce, cayenne pepper ; preparation:Heat sesame oil in heavy large saucepan over medium-high heat. Add pork, sliced green onions and minced ginger and stir-fry 1 minute. Add chicken broth, pasta, bean sprouts and soy sauce. Bring soup to boil. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer until pork is cooked through and pasta is just tender, about 3 minutes. Season soup to taste with cayenne pepper and salt. ; name: deviled grilled short ribs ; ingredients: spicy brown mustard, horseradish, worcestershire sauce, short rib of beef, meat tenderizer ; preparation:Prepare grill. Combine mustard, horseradish and worcestershire in a bowl. Sprinkle beef with meat tenderizer. Place meat on grill over medium heat. Cook 30 to 40 minutes, turning often or until desired doneness is reached. Brush with mustard mixture during the last 10 minutes of cooking. ; name: radish slaw with new york deli dressing ; ingredients: radishes, yellow bell peppers, carrots, white wine vinegar, sugar, fresh dill, mustard oil, salt, black pepper ; preparation:

name: french yogurt cake ; ingredients: yogurt, oil, sugar, plain flour, baking powder, eggs, salt, vanilla, coconut ; preparation:Preheat oven 300f. Mix yogurt and sugar. Add the 3 containers of flour, one by one and the salt, the dough will be hard. Add the eggs, the oil and the flavor. Finish with the baking powder. Mix well. Pour into a greased and floured cake pan. Bake for 50 minutes. ; name: garlicky steak marinade ; ingredients: fresh parsley, of fresh mint, fresh rosemary, garlic cloves, fresh lemon juice, soy sauce, olive oil, kosher salt, black pepper ; preparation:Combine parsley, mint, rosemary and garlic in food processor and pulse until finely chopped. Add lemon juice, soy sauce, salt & pepper and process until smooth. With the motor running, add olive oil in a thin stream. Pour marinade over steak and turn to coat. Cover and refrigerate at least 4 hours or overnight, turning occasionally. ; name: easy bake oven english muffin pizza ; ingredients: english muffin, tomato sauce, mozzarella cheese, pepperoni, sliced mushrooms ; preparation:Separate the english muffins and place on a baking sheet. Top each with about 1 tbs. Of prepared sauce. Top with any additional pre-cooked toppings. Top with shredded cheese. Bake in your easy-bake oven for about 15-20 minutes. ; name: horseradish encrusted salmon ; ingredients: olive oil, salmon fillets, breadcrumbs, gingerroot, horseradish ; preparation:Oil baking pan with 1 tsp. Of oil. Place salmon in the dish. In processor, blend the remaining ingredients. Place this mixture on each fillet. Bake in 350f oven for about 12 minutes. ; name: mom s magic muffins ; ingredients: raisin bran cereal, flour, sugar, baking soda, salt, buttermilk, vegetable oil, eggs, dried cranberries ; preparation:Combine cereal, flour, sugar, baking soda and salt in a large bowl, mix well. Combine buttermilk, oil and eggs in a separate bowl, whisk well. Pour egg mixture into cereal mixture, stir until just blended, fold in cranberries. Place in tightly covered container in the refrigerator overnight. The batter will keep for 4 weeks and improves over time. Do not stir at any time after refrigerating or when preparing to bake the muffins. Preheat oven to 400 degrees, grease muffin cups, spoon batter into pan, bake 18 minutes or until toothpick comes out almost clean. Cool in tins 10 minutes. ; name: spiced wassail ; ingredients: cinnamon sticks, cloves, whole allspice, apple cider, cranberry juice, granulated sugar, orange bitters, oranges, rum extract ; preparation:Break the cinnamon stick into pieces, &--along with the whole cloves & whole allspice--tie the cinnamon pieces in a cheesecloth bag. Cut each orange in half. In a large covered saucepan, combine the cider, cranberry juice, sugar & orange bitters. Add the spice bag, oranges & rum extract, & simmer, covered, for 10 minutes. Remove spices & pour into a warm serving bowl, leaving the oranges to float on top. ; name: leftover turkey or chicken casserole ; ingredients: cooked turkey, celery, onion, cream of chicken soup, mayonnaise, salt, pepper, pimientos, potato chips, paprika ; preparation:Mix all ingredients together and place them in a casserole dish. Cover with crushed potato chips and sprinkle with paprika. Bake uncovered at 350f. For about 30 minutes or until heated through and chips are lighty brown. Serve with noodles and a salad. ; name: italian wedding soup made simple ; ingredients: olive oil, italian sausage, onion, carrot, italian seasoning, reduced-sodium chicken broth, kale, ditalini, parmesan cheese ; preparation:

name: bbq jalapeno poppers ; ingredients: jalapenos, cream cheese, cheddar cheese, green onion, bacon, barbecue sauce ; preparation:Preheat oven to 275f. Cut jalapenos in half lengthwise and scrape out seeds. In a bowl, combine cheeses and onion and mix well. Stuff each hollowed jalapeno half with cheese mixture. Wrap bacon slices around each half, cover as much of the surface as possible. Brush bacon surface with bbq sauce. Secure with toothpicks and pop into oven for 1 hr. ; name: sarah s apple pie filling ; ingredients: apples, salt, cornstarch, sugar, cinnamon, nutmeg, lemon juice, water ; preparation:Pack 6-7 quart jars with apples, tightly. Mix the first 5 ingredients. Add water and lemon juice. Cook until it thickens and clears. Pour over apples, leaving an inch of head space. Process in water bath canner for 35 minutes. ; name: peppermint white chocolate chip cookies ; ingredients: butter, sugar, light brown sugar, vanilla, egg, all-purpose flour, salt, baking soda, white chocolate chips, candy cane ; preparation:Cream butter until light. Gradually add sugars, creaming well until blended. Beat in vanilla and egg. Stir together flour, salt and soda. Add flour mixture to butter mixture, blending well. Stir in chips and crushed candy canes. Drop by level tablespoonfuls, 2 inches apart, onto cookie sheets covered with parchment paper. Bake at 375 degrees for about 12 minutes until golden. Remove to wire racks to cool. ; name: peas n peppers ; ingredients: red peppers, water, frozen peas, butter, orange rind, dried rosemary, salt and pepper ; preparation:Cut the peppers in half lengthwise, remove stems, seeds and white membrane. Bring the water to a boil, add peas, return to boil cook 5 minutes until peas are tender, drain, reserve the cooking water. Puree the peas in your food processor add 5 tbsp of the reserved water and the butter return to saucepan and stir in the orange peel& rosemary heat through. Meanwhile immerse the peppers in boiling water and blanch for apprx 5 minutes or until the peppers are hot but still crisp fill the peppers with the pureed peas. Serve hot. ; name: hot roast beef sandwiches ; ingredients: chuck roast, dry onion soup mix, beef bouillon cube, sliced mushrooms ; preparation:Cook beef until tender. Pull apart into shreds, saving beef juice. Use no salt as this contains boullion. Mix all ingredients into beef mixture and reheat. Perfect in a crockput. Serve on fresh rolls. ; name: dutch style potato bake ; ingredients: potatoes, tart apples, sauerkraut, cooking oil, dijon mustard, salt, black pepper, bacon, green onions ; preparation:Toss together the potatoes, apples, sauerkraut, oil, mustard, salt and pepper. Transfer to a lightly greased 9x13-inch baking dish. Bake at 400f for 1 hour, stirring occasionally, until potato and apple are tender and just starting to brown. Scatter crumbled bacon and sliced green onion on top. Serve hot. ; name: smoked cheese gouda or alps potato salad ; ingredients: potatoes, deli ham, smoked cheese, eggs, celery ribs, green onions, mayonnaise, lemon juice, salt & pepper ; preparation:Mix first 6 ingredients together. Mix lemon juice, mayo and salt and pepper. Mix into salad. Chill for 1 hour. Enjoy. ; name: super quick moroccan chicken couscous ; ingredients: pine nuts, cumin seeds, vegetable stock, couscous, red onion, cooked chicken, dried apricots, sultanas, of fresh mint, french dressing ; preparation:

name: strawberry n cream roll ups ; ingredients: strawberry preserves, cream cheese, refrigerated crescent dinner rolls, powdered sugar ; preparation:Add the preserves and cream cheese to a small bowl. Stir to mix well. Separate the crescent roll dough into 8 triangles. Spread the cream cheese mixture evenly over each triangle. Roll up each triangle from the wide end to the point and place seam side down on an ungreased cookie sheet. Curve into crescents. Bake at 375 for 12-15 minutes or until golden. Let cool slightly. Sprinkle with powdered sugar and serve warm. ; name: grilled moroccan chicken ; ingredients: garlic cloves, ground cumin, ground allspice, paprika, salt, turmeric, vegetable oil, chicken ; preparation:Prepare the chicken by washing it and patting it dry. Mix spice paste ingredients together in a small glass bowl. For a whole chicken, rub the paste on the outside and inside and chill in the fridge for a minimum of one hour. For pieces, place them in a large bowl and pour paste over them, mixing until all pieces are coated. Chill for one hour. Grill until done. For whole chicken, until the thermometer registers 175f in the thickest part of the thigh. ; name: summer peach salad ; ingredients: cream cheese, mayonnaise, heavy cream, fresh peaches, pecans, lemon juice ; preparation:Beat cream cheese and heavy cream until fluffy. Stir in mayo and lemon juice. Fold in peaches and pecans. Pour into 9x9x2 glass dish and freeze for 3-4 hours. Using warm knife, cut into squares. ; name: piccadilly s sweet carrot souffle ; ingredients: carrots, sugar, baking powder, vanilla extract, flour, eggs, margarine, powdered sugar ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Steam or boil carrots. Drain well and transfer to a large mixing bowl. While carrots are still warm, add sugar, baking powder, and vanilla. Beat with mixer until smooth. Add flour and mix well. Add beaten eggs and mix well. Add margarine and beat well. Pour mixture into a lightly greased 2-quart baking dish. Bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour or until the top is light golden brown. Sprinkle lightly over the top with powdered sugar before serving. ; name: humous and carrot dip ; ingredients: carrots, chickpeas, lemon juice, tahini, spring onions, olive oil, fresh herb ; preparation:Put the chickpeas, lemon juice, tahini, spring onions and olive oil in a food processor and blend until you get a smooth, soft pat. You may need to add a bit of water to get the right consistency. Stir in the grated carrots. Garnish with fresh herbs and use as a dip for veggies or pita bread. You may also like to add some garlic or a bit of salt, depending on your taste. ; name: mincemeat drop cookies ; ingredients: shortening, sugar, egg, mincemeat, all-purpose flour, baking soda, salt ; preparation:Cream shortening and sugar until light and fluffy. Add egg and beat well. Add mincemeat, mixing well. Combine flour, soda, and salt. Mix well, and stir into creamed mixture. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto greased cookie sheets. Bake at 350 degrees f. For 18 to 20 minutes. ; name: pork tenderloin with roasted sweet potatoes and pears ; ingredients: pork tenderloin, sweet potatoes, bosc pears, spanish onion, extra virgin olive oil, fresh rosemary, garlic salt, dried sage, coarse black pepper ; preparation:Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Parboil potatoes to soften slightly. Spray baking dish with cook spray. Season the pork tenderloin on all sides with garlic salt and pepper. Add the pork tenderloins and surround with sweet potatoes and pears. Drizzle oil over vegetables. Sprinkle rosemary and sage over pork tenderloin. Cook in oven for 25-35 minutes. Let rest out of oven for 10 minutes before slicing. ; name: easy salmon ; ingredients: salmon fillets, italian salad dressing, water, lemon juice, mushroom ; preparation:

name: microwave sweet pickles ; ingredients: salt, turmeric, mustard seeds, celery seed, white vinegar, sugar, cucumbers, onion ; preparation:In small bowl mix salt, tumeric, mustard seed, celery seed, vinegar and sugar. In microwavable bowl, mix cucumbers and onion. Pour vinegar mixture over cucumbers and onion. Microwave, uncovered, on high for 5 minutes. Stir well, return to microwave for 5 minutes more. Cool. Pour into quart jar and refrigerate. Pickles are ready to eat when thoroughly chilled. ; name: crock pot beef with red wine ; ingredients: roast beef, onions, potatoes, onion soup mix, cornstarch, salt & pepper, dry red wine ; preparation:Place the beef, potatoes and onions in a crockpot. Add the dry soup mix over top. Sprinkle with cornstarch, salt and pepper. Pour red wine over all. Cover and cook on low heat setting for 10 to 12 hours. ; name: nachos agrios sour cream nachos ; ingredients: refried beans, tortilla chips, swiss cheese, provolone cheese, jalapeno, sour cream, pimiento ; preparation:Preheat oven to 300 degrees f. Heat refried beans in a pan over medium heat until hot. Spread chips out evenly on large oval oven-proof dish. Spread beans on top of chips, sprinkle cheeses over beans, and scatter jalapenos over cheese. Bake until cheese is completely melted, about 5 minutes. Garnish with dollops of sour cream then scatter pimentos over nachos. Serve immediately. ; name: dressed up burger patties ; ingredients: ground beef, dry breadcrumbs, salt, pepper, egg, onion, beef broth, fresh mushrooms, water, cornstarch ; preparation:Mix first 5 ingredients.
