Serves 6-8. ; name: marinated peppers and mozzarella ; ingredients: sweet peppers, olive oil, garlic cloves, lemon rind, crushed red pepper flakes, salt, mozzarella cheese, basil leaves, fresh lemon juice ; preparation:Preheat broiler to high. Arrange the baby peppers in a single layer on a foil-lined jelly roll pan, and broil peppers for 4 minutes on each side or until blackened and tender. Cool, combine peppers, olive oil, garlic cloves, lemon rind, red pepper, salt, and mozzarella balls, and toss. Cover, and refrigerate overnight, tossing after 6 hours. Let stand at room temperature for 30 minutes. Stir in basil leaves, and lemon juice before serving. Serve with a slotted spoon. ; name: my mom s lentil soup ; ingredients: lentils, celery ribs, onion, garlic, fresh pork hocks, brown sugar ; preparation:

name: couscous with apples chives ; ingredients: apple juice, tart apple, green onion, fresh chives, curry powder, couscous, chicken broth, salt ; preparation:Heat apple juice in 2-quart saucepan over medium-high heat. Bring to boil. Stir in apples, green onions, chives and curry powder and cook 1 to 2 minutes, stirring. Add couscous and cook 1 minute. Add broth and bring to boil. Cover and remove from heat. Let stand 10 to 15 minutes or until liquid is absorbed. Fluff with fork. Season to taste with salt and pepper. ; name: crock pot chops ; ingredients: pork chops, oil, minced garlic clove, soy sauce, chicken broth, brown sugar, cornstarch, water, rice ; preparation:Brown pork chops in oil if desired. I never do this step. Place chops in crock pot. Add to crock pot- garlic, soy sauce, broth, brown sugar. Cook in crock pot on low for 6 hours. Remove the chops carefully as they will fall apart quite easily. Combine cornstarch and cold water. Gradually stir cornstarch into the sauce in crock pot. Put the chops back into the crock pot and cook 20 to 30 minutes longer until sauce thickens. Serve over rice, if desired. ; name: strawberry salad with orange blossom water ; ingredients: fresh strawberries, orange juice, orange blossom water, sugar ; preparation:Mix the orange juice, orange water and sugar. Pour over the strawberries. Place mixture in the fridge for at least 1 hour. Serve cold. Sprinkle with chopped mint or pistachio. ; name: apple cinnamon pork tenderloin ; ingredients: pork tenderloin, cornstarch, ground cinnamon, brown sugar, apples, dried cranberries ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Place the tenderloin in a roasting pan or casserole dish. Combine the remaining ingredients together and stir. Spoon the apple mixture around the tenderloin, cover and bake for 30 minutes. Remove the lid and spoon the apple mix over top of the tenderloin. Place back in the oven and bake 15 to 20 minutes or until tenderloin registers at least 155 to 160 degrees on a meat thermometer. ; name: lemon marinade and sauce for poultry ; ingredients: brown sugar, cornstarch, lemon juice, water, soy sauce, green onion, garlic salt, garlic, margarine, lemon pepper ; preparation:Mix the cornstarch and brown sugar in a small saucepan. Stir in the remaining ingredients except the onions. Blend well and heat to boiling. Add the onions and immediately turn heat down. Stir constantly until sauce is thickened and bubbling. Use this sauce to baste poultry during last few minutes of grilling. You can also use this sauce as a marinade. Put sauce in a heavy plastic bag along with 2 to 3 pounds of chicken pieces and marinate for from 2 hours to overnight, turning bag to coat all sides of meat. Use the leftover sauce to brush on chicken while grilling. This recipe doubles nicely. ; name: patricia greenburg s dairy free tropical banana cream pie ; ingredients: 9-inch graham cracker crust, firm tofu, soy cream cheese, sugar, banana, pineapple ring, macadamia nuts ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350f degrees. Bake the graham cracker crust for 6 minutes and set aside. In a food processor, combine the tofu, soy cream cheese and sugar and puree until smooth. Add the banana and continue to puree until fully combined. Pour into the prepared piecrust and spread the dried pineapple and macadamia nuts evenly across the top of the pie. Bake for 20 minutes. Remove from the oven and cool completely. Refrigerate for at least an hour, or overnight. Wrapped, this pie will keep in the refrigerator for 5 days. ; name: jeweled clementines with vanilla sauce ; ingredients: sugar, white wine vinegar, grand marnier, clementines, nonfat milk, low-fat vanilla yogurt, mint sprig ; preparation:Combine sugar and vinegar in a small, heavy saucepan. Bring to a boil. Cook 6 minutes or until amber brown. Remove from heat and stir in the liqueur. Place the clementine sections in a large bowl. Pour the sugar mixture over the sections. Cover and chill 2 hours, stirring occasionally. Combine the milk and yogurt, stirring with a whisk. Spoon the clementine mixture into individual bowls or stemmed glasses, and top with the yogurt mixture. Garnish with mint, if desired. ; name: cheesy potato and onion casserole ; ingredients: potato, tomatoes, onions, herbs, margarine, salt & freshly ground black pepper, milk, plain flour, cheese ; preparation:

name: mrs clinton s chocolate chip cookies ; ingredients: flour, salt, baking soda, vegetable shortening, light-brown sugar, granulated sugar, vanilla, eggs, old fashioned oats, semi-sweet chocolate chips ; preparation:Heat oven to 350f. Grease baking sheets. Combine flour, salt and baking soda. Beat together shortening, sugars and vanilla in large bowl with electric mixer until creamy. Add eggs, beating until light and fluffy. On low speed, gradually beat in flour mixture and rolled oats. Stir in chococlate chips. Drop batter by well-rounded measuring teaspoonfuls onto greased baking sheet. Bake at 350f oven for 8-10 minutes or until golden. ; name: oven baked french toast ; ingredients: cinnamon-swirl bread, half & half light cream, eggs, butter, brown sugar, vanilla extract, cinnamon ; preparation:Lightly grease a 9x13 pan. Arrange bread in 2 layers in pan. In large bowl, wisk together the remaining ingredients. Pour evenly over bread slices, pressing down until some of the liquid is absorbed and bread does not float. Bake 350f for 45 minutes, or until center reaches 160f and bread is golden brown. ; name: open faced omelet ; ingredients: broccoli floret, sweet red pepper, green onion, ham, frozen hash brown potatoes, egg substitute, pepper, cheddar cheese ; preparation:In a 9inch or 10inch skillet coated with non-stick cooking spray, saute broccoli, red pepper and onions until tender crisp. Add ham and hash browns. Cook for 2 minutes, stirring frequently. In a bowl whisk together egg substitute and pepper. Pour over vegetable mixture. Reduce heat. Cover and cook for 10-12 minutes or until set. Remove from heat. Sprinkle with cheese. Cover and let stand for 5 minutes or until cheese is melted. Cut into wedges. ; name: homemade sun dried tomato paste ; ingredients: sun-dried tomatoes packed in oil, garlic, olive oil, salt & freshly ground black pepper ; preparation:Put the tomatoes in a medium bowl. Add some very hot water to cover. Stir for a few minutes, then drain. In a food processor, combine the tomatoes, garlic, olive oil and seasonings. Puree until smooth. Refrigerate for up to 2 weeks. ; name: grilled apple spice trout fillets ; ingredients: trout fillets, apple juice concentrate, dijon mustard, cider vinegar, paprika, pepper, salt ; preparation:Pat fillets dry. Arrange, skin side down, on plate. In bowl, stir apple juice concentrate, mustard, vinegar, paprika, pepper and salt. Brush some of the sauce onto fillets. Place fillets, skin side down, on greased grill over medium heat. Close lid and cook, brushing once with remaining sauce, for 12 to 14 minutes or until fish flakes easily when tested with fork. ; name: simple stove top macaroni and cheese ; ingredients: pasta, white onion, butter, flour, milk, stone ground dijon mustard, cayenne pepper, sharp cheddar cheese, salt, fresh parsley ; preparation:In large saute pan, over medium heat, cook the onions in the butter until softened. Add the flour and cook for 3 minutes. Add the mustard and cayenne. Continue cooking for another 2 minutes. Pour in the hot milk, whisk and simmer until thickened. Stir in the cheese. Taste for seasonings. Combine the sauce and the macaroni, along with the parsley. Let stand 5 minutes off the heat with the lid on. Serve. ; name: sweet and sour cabbage and carrots ; ingredients: butter, green cabbage, carrots, onion, brown sugar, reduced sodium soy sauce, cider vinegar, pepper ; preparation:In a large skillet over medium-high heat, melt butter. Add to the skillet the cabbage, carrots, onion and brown sugar. Cook, stirring often, for about 10-12 minutes until the veggies are well-browned and softened. Remove from heat and stir in the soy sauce, vinegar and pepper. Serve hot. ; name: fruit plate with marshmallow sauce ; ingredients: sugar, hot water, light corn syrup, egg whites, vanilla, salt, mayonnaise, orange rind ; preparation:

name: artichoke and asparagus salad ; ingredients: marinated artichoke hearts, asparagus, salt water, egg, heavy cream, mayonnaise ; preparation:Drain and chill artichokes. Break off tough ends of asparagus and cut into 3 inch pieces. Cook in lightly salted water until bright green and tender. Be careful not to overcook. Remove asparagus from the water reserving 2 tablespoons of asparagus water. Drain asparagus well on paper towel and chill. Right before serving. Whip cream and fold in mayo. Add chilled asparagus water to taste. Chop egg and add to cream mixture. Pour dressing over asparagus. Add artichoke hearts and mix gently. ; name: pasta salad peas ham and cheese ; ingredients: small shell pasta, sharp cheddar cheese, cubed ham, frozen tiny peas, mayonnaise, salad dressing, seasoning salt, black pepper, garlic salt, fresh dill ; preparation:Place cooled cooked pasta, ham, cheese, peas and cheese in a large bowl. Mix well. Add mayonnaise, miracle whip, seasoning salt, pepper, garlic salt and dill. Mix until everything is well coated and evenly distributed. Chill well before serving. ; name: the easiest mexican chicken ever ; ingredients: chicken breasts, ground cumin, oil, garlic, refried beans, salsa, water ; preparation:Chop the chicken into even peices. Lay the chicken out on a single layer and sprinkle both sides of all the chicken with the cumin. Heat the oil in a fry pan and add the chicken. Cook over a medium heat and brown the chicken and let it cook through, the smaller the pieces the faster is cooks. Add the garlic and cook for another minute. Add the beans, salsa and water. Simmer for 3 minutes. Serve. ; name: sunshine sandwich ; ingredients: bread, egg, orange marmalade, butter ; preparation:Toast the bread in toaster. In a nonstick skillet over medium-low heat, melt the butter. Carefully break egg into the skillet. Fry egg to desired doneness. Spread marmalade over slices of toast. Place one slice bread, marmalade side up, on a dish. Add the egg. Place second slice of bread over the egg, marmalade side down. ; name: afelia pork in coriander wine ; ingredients: pork loin, sea salt, black pepper, dry red wine, coriander seeds, olive oil ; preparation:Season the pork cubes with the salt, and pepper. Combine the coriander seeds with the wine in a large dish, add pork, and cover. Refrigerate for 2-4 hours, stirring once or twice. Heat oil in a large enough pot. Using a slotted spoon, remove pork from the wine marinade, and reserve the marinade. Brown pork, turning frequently, until well browned on all sides, about 10 minutes. Add reserved marinade back into pot. Add enough water to just cover the meat. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat, cover pot, and simmer 30-45 minutes, until meat is fork tender and most of the liquid has evaporated. Taste, and re season with more salt and pepper, if desired. ; name: yellow pear tomato preserves ; ingredients: yellow pear tomatoes, lemon, sugar, salt, gingerroot ; preparation:Wash& dry tomatoes. Cut a thin slice from blossom end and press out seeds and discard. Combine tomatoes, sugar& salt, simmer until sugar is dissolved. Boil for about 40 minutes. Add thinly sliced lemon and minced or sliced ginger. Boil about 10 minutes longer. Pour into hot jars and seal at once. ; name: butterscotch cashew bars ; ingredients: graham cracker crumbs, sugar, butter, butterscotch chips, sweetened condensed milk, salted cashew halves ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a medium bowl, combine graham cracker crumbs and sugar. Stir in melted butter. Press mixture firmly into bottom of a 13 x 9 pan. In a small bowl, combine 1 cup morsels with condensed milk. Microwave on high in 30 second intervals, stirring after each, until melted and smooth. Pour mixture over crumbs. Sprinkle remaining morsels and cashews on top. Bake 20 to 22 minutes, til lightly browned. Let them cool completely before cutting into bars. ; name: black olive dip ; ingredients: cream cheese, lemon juice, garlic salt, milk, black olives ; preparation:

name: garlic lime shrimp ; ingredients: butter, fresh lemon juice, worcestershire sauce, garlic cloves, white sugar, lime peel, cayenne, shrimp, parsley ; preparation:Melt butter in a medium-heave skillet over medium heat. Mix in the next six ingredients. Saut for 30 seconds and add shrimp. Saut shrimp until they are opaque in centre, about 3 minutes, turning occasionally. Stir in parsley and serve over rice or pasta. ; name: cranberry and lime sparkler ; ingredients: cranberry juice, lemon lime and bitters soft drink, limes, sugar cubes, sparkling white wine ; preparation:Combine cranberry juice, soft drink and limes in a large jug. Place 1 sugar cube into each chilled champagne glass. Pour in 100ml sparkling white wine. Top with cranberry and lime mixture. Serve immediately. ; name: chilled cranberry soup ; ingredients: water, granulated sugar, cinnamon sticks, ground cloves, fresh cranberries, fresh lemon juice, orange zest, sour cream ; preparation:In a r4-quart sucepan, mix water, sugar, cinnamon sticks & cloves. Bring to boil over high heat, then add cranberries & return to a boil. Reduce heat & cook until cranberries pop, about 5 minutes. Remove from heat & stir in lemon juice & orange zest. Cool to room temperature, then chill about 4 hours in the refrigerator. When ready to serve, top each bowl of soup with a dollop of sour cream. Refrigerate any leftovers. ; name: chicken noodle casserole ; ingredients: cooked chicken, medium noodles, onions, cream of mushroom soup, salt, pepper, mixed mushrooms, buttered bread crumbs ; preparation:Mix onions with noodles. Add chicken and seasonings. Add soup and mix well. Put mixture in greased 2 quart casserole dish. Sprinkle buttered bread crumbs or corn flake crumbs over top. Cover and bake at 325 degrees for 1 hour. Uncover 10 minutes before done and let brown. ; name: nimbu pani lemon date beverage from india ; ingredients: lemons, water, dates, honey ; preparation:Cut the lemons in halves crosswise. Remove the zest from 6 of the halves and squeeze out the juice. Slice the remaining 2 lemon halves into thin rounds. Place the water and the dates in a sauce pan and gently boil for 10 minutes. Next add the zest and boil for another 2-3 minutes. Remove the pan from the heat, stir in the honey, lemon juice & lemon slices, and set aside, loosely covered, for 8-12 hours. Strain through a muslin lined sieve and place in fridge to chill. For best results, serve in chilled glasses with no ice. ; name: banana honey and walnut ice cream ; ingredients: milk, honey, egg yolks, whipping cream, bananas, walnuts ; preparation:Combine milk and honey in medium saucepan. Bring almost to simmer, stirring occasionally. Beat yolks until pale yellow. Gradually beat in hot milk. Set bowl into a larger bowl filled with ice. Cool custard completely, stirring occasionally. Fold in whipped cream and bananas. Process according to ice cream makers manufacturers instructions, until half set. Add walnuts and process until set. Let ripen in freezer several hours before serving. ; name: socca provencal savory chickpea pancake gluten free ; ingredients: chickpea flour, salt, pepper, warm water, olive oil, onion, fresh rosemary leaf ; preparation:Place heavy skillet in oven and preheat to 450. In a large bowl, sift chickpea flour, pepper and salt together. After sifting, add rosemary leaves. Whisk in warm water and 2 tbsp olive oil. Cover the bowl and allow the batter set for at least 30 minutes, which should have the consistency of thick cream. Stir sliced onion into the batter. Remove skillet from oven. Add 1 tbsp olive oil to the hot pan, pour batter into pan and bake for 12-15 minutes or until the pancake is firm and the edges are set. Set socca a few inches below your broiler for 1-2 minutes, just long enough to brown it in spots. Cut into wedges and serve hot, with toppings of your choice. ; name: breakfast biscuits brekkie bix ; ingredients: orange marmalade, butter, bisquick baking mix, cold water ; preparation:

name: cucumber dill dressing ; ingredients: english cucumber, balkan style yogurt, milk, mayonnaise, cider vinegar, green onion, garlic clove, fresh dill, pepper ; preparation:Peel, seed and shred cucumber. Gently squeeze out liquid. Set aside. In a small bowl, whisk together yogurt, milk, mayonnaise and vinegar. Stir in cucumber, green onion, garlic, dill and pepper. ; name: quaker punch ; ingredients: of fresh mint, ginger, tea bags, boiling water, water, sugar, lemons, juice of, oranges, juice of ; preparation:Bruise the mint. Add the ginger and teabags. Pour over the boiling water, cover and steep for 6 or 7 minutes. Strain and discard the solids. Meanwhile, heat the remaining water and sugar just until the sugar is dissolved. Mix with the tea brew. Add the juice of the lemons and oranges, and strain. Serve chilled, over ice. ; name: rose scented geranium lemonade ; ingredients: water, sugar, rose-scented geranium leaves, fresh lemon juice ; preparation:In a small pot boil water with sugar. Remove from heat, add leaves and let infuse until cold. Squeeze out leaves well. Add lemon or lime juice. Pour it into bottle and refrigerate. To serve, add 1 tablespoon of this concentrate to each cup of chilled water and mix well. Serve over ice in a goblet garnished with a small scented geranium leaf of rose petals. Store refrigerated for at least two weeks. ; name: champinones al ajillo garlic fried mushrooms ; ingredients: olive oil, garlic, fresh mushrooms, dry white wine, fresh parsley, salt and pepper ; preparation:Warm the oil in a large saute pan over medium heat. Add the garlic and saute about 2 minutes. Do not let it burn. Increase the heat to high, and add the mushrooms. Saute until tender for about 5 minutes, stirring occasionally. The time may need to be adjusted according to the type of mushroom used. Add the wine and continue to cook until the liquid is absorbed. Add the parsley, salt and pepper, and stir to combine. Serve while hot. ; name: kool aid pickles ; ingredients: dill pickles, sugar, water, unsweetened cherry drink mix ; preparation:Drain and discard the juice from the pickle jar. Remove the pickles from the jar and cut each one in half lengthwise. Return the pickles to the jar and set aside. In a large measuring cup, combine the sugar, water and kool-aid. Mix until the sugar has completely dissolved. Pour enough of the liquid into the pickle jar to cover the pickles. Discard any excess. Cover the jar and refrigerate at least 24 hours. ; name: good morning sunshine eggs ; ingredients: eggs, milk, sausage, cheese, bread ; preparation:In a 13 x 9 lightly greased baking dish, place your bread cubes evenly on the bottom. In a medium bowl, whip the eggs together with the milk until well beaten. Stir in the sausage and cheese and pour over the bread crumbs. Cover with foil and bake at 325 degrees for 20 minutes. Remove foil and bake an additional 15 minutes. I lightly sprinkle more shredded cheese on top when this comes out of the oven. ; name: potato nuggets with dill cream ; ingredients: potatoes, fresh dill, butter, heavy cream, salt & pepper ; preparation:Steam or boil your new potatoe nuggets until cooked. Melt butter in a skillet, add potatoes, toss to coat. Mix dill into the cream. Pour dilled cream over the potatoes and continue cooking over medium-low heat until the cream has turned into an almost golden sauce, stir frequently. Season to taste. ; name: easy oatmeal favorites ; ingredients: butter, flour, sugar, baking soda, oatmeal ; preparation:

name: pumpkin pie crunch light version ; ingredients: solid pack pumpkin, evaporated skim milk, eggs, egg whites, splenda brown sugar blend, pumpkin pie spice, jiffy corn muffin mix, pecans, quick oats, butter ; preparation:Preheat oven to 325. Spray 9x13 glass pan with non-stick spray. In a large bowl, combine first 6 ingredients. Pour into pan. Sprinkle boxed muffin mix on top of pumpkin. Then sprinkle with quick oats and pecans. Drizzle melted butter over all. Bake 325 degrees for 50 minutes, or until edges are golden and a knife inserted in the center tests clean. May serve with lite cool whip. ; name: ila s delightful sugar cookies ; ingredients: butter, powdered sugar, granulated sugar, eggs, flour, baking soda, cream of tartar, vanilla ; preparation:Cream butter, sugars and eggs until fluffy and mixed well. Add flour, soda cream of tarter and vanilla. Blending thoroughly. Roll out onto lightly floured surface to - inch thickness. Cut with cookie cutters. Sprinkle with sugar if desired. Bake for 12-15 min at 325. ; name: the best creamed onions ; ingredients: onions, butter, all-purpose flour, salt, white pepper, milk ; preparation:In lg skillet or dutch oven, saute onions in butter until tender and golden brown, about 25 minute remove with a slotted spoon. Add flour, salt and pepper to skillet. Stir until smooth. Gradually stir in milk until blended. Bring to a boil. Cook and stir for 2 min or until thickened. Reduce heat to med. Return onions to the pan. Heat through. ; name: cheese stuffed bread ; ingredients: sourdough bread, mozzarella cheese, ricotta cheese, green pepper, red pepper, salt, parmesan cheese, ground cumin, garlic, pepper ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400. Slice top off bread, clean out round. Reserve top and cut scooped out bread into cubes. Mix all ingredients and fill bread cavity. Wrap bread in foil and bake for 1 hour. Meanwhile spread cubes on cookie sheet and crisp on lower rack uncovered about 10 minutes. Remove bread from foil, stir carefully. Surround with toasted cubes to dip. ; name: parmesan crumbed fish bake ; ingredients: bread, basil, olive oil, parmesan cheese, white fish fillets, pasta sauce ; preparation:Preheat oven to 180c lightly grease 7cm deep 24cm square baking dish. Place bread in food processor and process until roughly chopped. Add basil and oil and process to a fine breadcrumb mixture. Transfer to mixing bowl and add parmesan. Season fish with salt and pepper. Place in a single layer in baking dish. Spoon over the pasta sauce. Sprinkle the breadcrumb mixture over the top. Bake for 25 to 30 minutes or until fish is cooked and top is golden. ; name: hamburger hash browns hotdish ; ingredients: hash brown patties, onion, salt and pepper, hamburger, peas, milk, cream of mushroom soup, cheddar cheese, french-fried onions ; preparation:Butter a 9x13-inch pan. Cover bottom of pan with hash browns. Add hamburger, salt pepper and onions. Sprinkle peas on top. Mix soup and milk together and pour over peas. Top with cheese. Cover with foil and bake at 350f for one hour. Sprinkle with french fried onions and return to oven for ten more minutes. ; name: boboli pizza crust clone ; ingredients: water, olive oil, garlic, salt, sugar, all-purpose flour, italian seasoning, parmesan cheese, active dry yeast ; preparation:Add all ingredients to breadmaker in order listed by your manufacturer. Set breadmaker on dough setting. When cycle is done, form two crusts on pizza pans, sprinkle with parmesan cheese, cover and let rise again. Bake 5-10 minutes at 450 f until light brown. Cool. Wrap tightly in foil and freeze. ; name: crock pot citrus ginger chicken ; ingredients: boneless skinless chicken, orange marmalade, lime juice, crushed pineapple, soy sauce, dijon mustard, gingerroot, cayenne pepper, minced garlic clove, sugar ; preparation:

name: pasta house pasta con broccoli actual recipe ; ingredients: shell pasta, cream, butter, garlic, tomato sauce, broccoli, salt and pepper, button mushroom, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Cook pasta until half done. Drain. Return pasta to the pot. Add cream, butter, garlic, tomato sauce, broccoli, salt and pepper. Bring to a hard boil. When noodles are fully cooked and sauce is starting to thicken, add mushrooms and stir to combine. Remove from the heat. Add cheese. Toss and serve. ; name: chocolate eclair torte ; ingredients: graham cracker, french vanilla instant pudding, milk, whipped topping, chocolate frosting ; preparation:Line bottom of 9x13-inch dish with crackers. Mix pudding and milk. Fold in whipped topping. Spoon layer of pudding mixture over crackers. Add another layer of crackers, then pudding mix again then final layer of crackers. Spread chocolate frosting over top. Chill in refrigerator for at least 2 hours. ; name: baked celery with cheese and ham ; ingredients: celery, salt water, ham, sharp cheddar cheese, butter, all-purpose flour, chicken broth, light cream, salt, dry breadcrumbs ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350f. Cover celery with salted water, bring to a boil, and simmer until tender, about 15 minutes. Drain well. Layer celery, ham and cheese in a well-greased 2-quart casserole. Melt the butter in a skillet over low heat. Stir in flour. Gradually stir in broth and cream. Cook, stirring constantly, until smooth and thick. Add salt and pour mixture over mixture in casserole. Top with bread crumbs. Bake until top is browned and mixture is bubbly, 25-30 minutes. ; name: kale with tomatoes and green chiles ; ingredients: kale, garlic, yellow onions, olive oil, tomatoes and green chilies, salt, pepper ; preparation:Rinse the kale and remove the fibrous middle rib, slice the leaves into ribbons. Over medium heat, saute the garlic in the olive oil until fragrant. Then add the onions and saute together, stirring constantly until the onions are limp. Do not allow the garlic or onions to brown. Add the kale and saute for 15-20 minutes or until tender, stirring frequently to prevent the greens from scorching. Add the tomatoes and green chiles and salt and pepper to taste, stirring everything together and cooking until heated through--about 1-2 minutes. Serve over rice or combine with blackeyed peas or refried beans and rice to make a tasty and hearty filling for vegetarian wraps. ; name: kittencal s caesar vinaigrette ; ingredients: fresh lemon juice, anchovy fillets, dijon mustard, fresh garlic, worcestershire sauce, olive oil, black pepper, salt, parmesan cheese, sugar ; preparation:Using a small processor blend lemon juice, anchovies, dijon mustard, garlic and worcestershire sauce until well blended. While the machine is still running slowly drizzle in oil. Add in parmesan cheese blend to combine. Season with black pepper and salt. Add in the sugar only if needed and blend again. Transfer to a glass jar with a tight-fitting lid. Cover and refrigerate 6 hours or overnight before using. Shake well before using. ; name: confetti latkes ; ingredients: eggs, zucchini, yellow squash, carrot, onion, salt, pepper, matzo meal, frying oil ; preparation:Combine all ingredients. Mixture should be thick enough to hold its shape. Add more matzoh meal if needed. Drop by tablespoonfuls into very hot oil. Flatten slightly with the back of the spoon. Fry until golden. Drain on paper towels. ; name: yogurt bran muffins from fiber one ; ingredients: all-bran cereal, egg whites, vegetable oil, nonfat yogurt, all-purpose flour, splenda granular, baking soda, salt ; preparation:Heat oven to 400f. Grease bottoms of 12 muffin molds, or use baking cups. Crush cereal. Stir together egg whites, oil, and yogurt. Stir in cereal and dry ingredients, just until moistened. Fold in optional additions. Spoon batter evenly into tins. Bake 18-20 minutes or until golden brown. ; name: apple bread pudding ; ingredients: butter, baking apples, sugar, white wine, bread, light cream, eggs, orange zest ; preparation:

name: sand dessert aka vanilla dirt dessert ; ingredients: cookies, cream cheese, butter, powdered sugar, vanilla pudding mix, milk, cool whip ; preparation:Crumble cookies in food processor. Set aside. In a medium bowl, combine cream cheese, butter and powdered sugar. Mix in pudding. Slowly add milk. Mix until combined. Fold in cool whip. Using a clean sand bucket or casserole dish, alternate layers of cookie crumbs with the pudding mixture. Chill for at least 2 hours. Imho it tastes better if you make it a day ahead. ; name: butternut squash braised with cream and fresh thyme ; ingredients: butternut squash, butter, onion, garlic, cream, salt & freshly ground black pepper, fresh thyme leave ; preparation:Cover the squash with a generous amount of salted water in a large saucepan and boil for 5 minutes. Drain well. In a slow cooker, combine the squash, butter, onions, garlic, cream and salt and pepper. Set the cooker on low and cook for 6 to 8 hours, adding the fresh thyme in the last hour of cooking. When the squash is tender, turn off the slow cooker. This dish can sit for an hour or two before serving. ; name: mexican grilled cheese sandwiches ; ingredients: bread, jalapeno jack cheese, taco seasoning mix, salsa, butter ; preparation:Heat a griddle, sandwich maker, or a skillet over medium heat. In small bowl, mix butter and taco seasoning mix. Spread half of mixture on one side of each piece of bread. Put cheese slices onto bread and top with remaining bread slices. Place the sandwiches, buttered sides down, on hot griddle. Spread top sides with remaining butter mixture. Cook until golden brown on both sides and cheese is melted. Serve with salsa as a dip. ; name: chocolate mint cookies ; ingredients: flour, baking soda, cocoa powder, brown sugar, sugar, butter, applesauce, vanilla, mint extract, egg white ; preparation:Combine flour, baking soda and cocoa together in a bowl and combine. In a separate bowl, combine brown sugar, sugar, butter, applesauce, vanilla, mint extract and egg white. Beat with a hand mixer until well blended. Combine flour mix with sugar mix to form dough. Roll into a log and cover with plastic wrap. Place in freezer for about 1 hour until firm. Slice into quarter inch pieces and place on a baking sheet that has been sprayed with baking spray. Bake at 350 for about 10 minutes. Cool on wire rack. ; name: almonds great appetizer with drinks ; ingredients: almonds, butter, fresh rosemary, brown sugar, salt, ground red pepper ; preparation:Spread almonds in a single layer on a baking sheet. Bake in a 350 oven for about 10 minutes or until nuts are lightly toasted and fragrant. Meanwhile, in a med saucepan melt butter over med heat until sizzling. Remove from heat. Stir in rosemary, sugar, salt and red pepper. Add almonds to butter mixture and toss to coat. Cool slightly before serving. If desired seal cooled nuts in an airtight container and store for up to 1 month in refrigerator or up to 3 months in freezer. ; name: triple chocolate sour cream bundt cake low fat ; ingredients: chocolate cake mix, sugar-free instant pudding mix, chocolate chips, fat free sour cream, egg substitute, water, vegetable oil, light fudge topping ; preparation:Combine all cake ingredients until well mixed. Spray 12 cup bundt pan with cooking spray. Pour cake batter into bunt pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour. Cool the cake for 15 minutes in pan. Then remove from pan and cool on wire rack. To serve, cut cake into 16 pieces and serve with 1 tbsp chocolate fudge topping drizzled over each slice. ; name: t s sweet and sour pork chops ; ingredients: pork chops, onion, green pepper, apple cider vinegar, ketchup, pineapple chunks, soy sauce, brown sugar, salt ; preparation:Brown pork chops with onion and green pepper. Mix together all other ingredients and pour over browned chops and veggies. Cover. Simmer for 1 hour. Serve over rice. ; name: hamburger pudding ; ingredients: ground beef, salt, worcestershire sauce, onion gravy mix, biscuit mix, milk, brown gravy mix, hot water ; preparation:

name: gluten free fettuccine with tomato basil sauce ; ingredients: olive oil, eggs, gluten-free flour, salt, parmesan cheese, brown onion, garlic cloves, crushed tomatoes, caster sugar, fresh basil leaf ; preparation:Make sauce - heat oil in a saucepan over medium heat and add onion and garlic and cook for 3 minutes or until onion has softened and then add tomato and saugar and season with salt and pepper. Bring to the boil, reduce heat to low and simmer for 15 minutes or until thickened and stir through basil. Meanwhile using a food processor mix oil and eggs until combined and then add flour and salt and process until dough resembles large breadcrumbs. Turn out onto a lightly floured surface and knead for 1 to 2 minutes until a ball forms. Divide dough into quarters and roll out each portion into a 2mm thick rectangle and then slice lengthways into 1cm wide strips. Bring a large saucepan of salted water to the boil and cook pasta for 3 to 5 minutes or until tender. Drain and serve pasta with sauce and parmesan cheese. ; name: honey roasted sweet potatoes ; ingredients: sweet potatoes, butter, honey, fresh lemon juice, salt, cinnamon ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a small micorwave safe bowl combine butter, honey and lemon juice. Microwave until butter melts, add cinnamon. Place cubed potatoes in a large bowl and pour honey mixture over potatoes, toss to coat. Place in a roasting pan, salt and bake for about 50 minutes, or until tender, stirring occasionally. ; name: walnut glazed brie ; ingredients: walnuts, coffee liqueur, brown sugar, vanilla essence, brie cheese, cracker, pear ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350f. Spread the chopped walnuts in an 8 inch square baking pan and bake for 10-12 minutes or until roasted, stirring occasionally. Stir in the coffee liqueur, brown sugar, and vanilla. Set aside. Reduce oven to 325f. Remove the top rind off the brie. Place the brie in a shallow baking dish. Top with the walnut mixture. Bake for about 8-10 minutes or until soft and heated through. Serve immediately with assorted crackers and pear slices. ; name: edamame with mustard vinaigrette ; ingredients: red wine vinegar, dijon mustard, sea salt, extra virgin olive oil, edamame, red onion, celery, fresh parsley ; preparation:Combine first 3 ingredients in a large bowl, stirring with a whisk. Add oil, whisking until well blended. Cook edamame in boiling water for 4 minutes. Add onion and celery and cook an additional 1 minute. Drain well. Add edamame mixture to vinaigrette. Toss well to coat. Stir in parsley. Chill at least 1 hour and serve. ; name: beef with asian mushroom sauce crock pot ; ingredients: sliced mushrooms, beef tip roast, hoisin sauce, garlic cloves, salt, beef broth, cornstarch, water, scallions ; preparation:Put the mushrooms in your slow cooker and place the beef on top. Spread the hoisin sauce over the beef, scatter the garlic and salt over it, and pour in the broth around it. Cover the slow cooker, and cook on low for 6-8 hours. Remove the beef from the slow cooker and put it on a platter. Turn cooker to high. Mix the cornstarch with water and add to the sauce. When sauce is thickened a bit, pour the sauce into a sauce boat. Slice the beef and serve it with the sauce, topped with the scallions. ; name: cactus mexican style ; ingredients: cactus pieces, tomatoes, white onion, jalapeno pepper, cilantro, monterey jack cheese, salt, corn oil ; preparation:Steam the cactus until softened. Drain the cactus. Fry all the ingredients except for the monterrey cheese. Combine fried ingredients with the cactus and allow to simmer for 15 minutes. Top with cheese before serving. ; name: mary s swiss steak ; ingredients: margarine, onions, round steaks, flour, salt, pepper, paprika, water, sour cream ; preparation:Melt 4 tbsp margarine in a large skillet, then saut onions. Remove from the skillet. Coat the steak with the flour. Season with salt and pepper. Melt remaining margarine in the skillet and brown the meat well on both sides. Mix with steak the onions, water, sour cream until blended. Cover and cook over medium heat till meat is tender. Uncover and cook until the sauce thickens. Serve over hot cooked rice or noodles. ; name: dees sweet and sour sauce ; ingredients: ketchup, cider vinegar, orange juice, pineapple juice, wine vinegar, sugar, mustard, cornstarch, water ; preparation:

name: pumpkin pie crunch light version ; ingredients: solid pack pumpkin, evaporated skim milk, eggs, egg whites, splenda brown sugar blend, pumpkin pie spice, jiffy corn muffin mix, pecans, quick oats, butter ; preparation:Preheat oven to 325. Spray 9x13 glass pan with non-stick spray. In a large bowl, combine first 6 ingredients. Pour into pan. Sprinkle boxed muffin mix on top of pumpkin. Then sprinkle with quick oats and pecans. Drizzle melted butter over all. Bake 325 degrees for 50 minutes, or until edges are golden and a knife inserted in the center tests clean. May serve with lite cool whip. ; name: cheesy asparagus and ham ; ingredients: butter, flour, milk, mild cheddar cheese, salt, pepper, asparagus, ham, breadcrumbs ; preparation:In large skillet, melt butter, stir in flour, cook 1 minute. Slowly stir in milk, cook until bubbly. Add cheese, salt and pepper, mix well. Remove from heat. Put 3 pieces asparagus on each ham slice. Roll up and place in 13x9 baking pan. Cover with the cheese sauce. Sprinkle with crumbs. Bake at 375 for 20 minutes. ; name: vanilla cream with coconut and lime ; ingredients: milk, vanilla bean, eggs, sugar, cornstarch, lime, coconut milk, rum ; preparation:Boil milk with the opened vanilla bean. During this time stir egg yolks, sugar and cornstarch together in a pan until incorporated. Add hot milk, lime zest and coconut milk to the egg mixture and stir continuously by medium heat until thick and creamy. Add rum and stir well. Fill this delicious cream in serving cups and decorate with lime zest strips. Cool at least 2 hours and serve chilled. ; name: amazing overnight french toast ; ingredients: corn syrup, brown sugar, butter, raisin bread, eggs, milk, vanilla ; preparation:Over medium heat, bring corn syrup, brown sugar and butter to a boil. Boil 5 minutes and pour into a greased 13 x 9 baking pan. Cut or tear all of the bread and place in the pan, set aside. Beat eggs, milk and vanilla and pour over bread. Cover and refrigerate overnight. Uncover and bake at 350 for 45 minutes. ; name: kittencal s juicy blue cheese hamburgers burgers ; ingredients: lean ground beef, fresh garlic, blue cheese, seasoning salt, fresh ground black pepper, onion, worcestershire sauce, egg, fresh breadcrumb ; preparation:Mix all the ingredients together. Shape into 6 balls. Cover and refrigerate for up to 24 hours to blend the flavors. Grill or cook as desired until cooked through. Serve with your favorite condiments. ; name: breakfast nachos ; ingredients: tortilla chips, refried beans, eggs, salsa, monterey jack pepper cheese, scallions ; preparation:Cover the bottom of a large oven-safe platter with tortilla chips. Microwave refried beans for 1 minute, then spread over the tortilla chips. Crumble scrambled eggs evenly over beans. Evenly pour warmed salsa over eggs. Top with grated cheese. Broil entire platter in oven until cheese is melted. Serve immediately, garnishing with scallions. ; name: maureen s festive cheese ball ; ingredients: cheddar cheese, cream cheese, mayonnaise, worcestershire sauce, onion salt, garlic salt, celery salt, green olives, dried beef, fresh parsley ; preparation:Combine, cheeses, mayonnaise, worcestershire sauce, and salts. Blend until smooth. If too stiff add a bit more mayonaise. Add olives and shape into ball. Combine dried beef and fresh parsley and roll ball in the mixture. Cover with plastic wrap and chill. For a difference you can roll in crushed walnuts or pecans. Serve with crackers. ; name: cornmeal bread ; ingredients: flour, cornmeal, baking powder, baking soda, salt, sugar, egg, canola oil, water ; preparation:

name: rhubarb chicken ; ingredients: rhubarb, sugar, cornflour, water, lemon juice, chicken quarters, butter, salt, cinnamon, nutmeg ; preparation:Preheat the oven to 375 degrees f. Place the cornflour, sugar, rhubarb and water in a saucepan. Mix well then bring to the boil, stirring, over medium heat. Continue to cook for about 2 minutes, until clear and thickened. Remove from the heat, add lemon juice, mix well then set aside to cool. Place chicken in a shallow baking dish. Brush with butter and season with salt. Bake, uncovered for 30 minutes. Remove the chicken from the oven and spoon the rhubarb sauce over the top. Sprinkle with cinnamon and nutmeg, return to oven and continue to cook for a further 20 minutes, basting once or twice during the cooking time. ; name: avocado grilling butter ; ingredients: butter, lime juice, garlic cloves, flat leaf parsley, habanero sauce, worcestershire sauce, salt, jalapeno pepper, avocado ; preparation:Cut softened butter into small squares. Peel and seed avocado and cut into small pieces. Mash butter and avocado and add to a mixing bowl. Seed jalapeno pepper and dice. Add jalapeno and other ingredients and mix in the mixing bowl. Spoon mixture onto plastic wrap. Shape into a log shape. Put the log in the refrigerator to become firm. To use the butter, melt in the last minute of grilling over steak, poulty or fish. Add a slice on top of resting meat. Let melt. Or spread atop french bread as previously mentioned. ; name: cranberry feta pinwheels ; ingredients: dried sweetened cranberries, cream cheese spread, feta cheese, green onion, flour tortillas ; preparation:Combine all ingredients except tortillas, mix well. Divide and spread mixture evenly among tortillas. Roll up tightly, wrap in plastic and refrigerate at least one hour. To serve cut into 12 slices. A nice variation is to add thin slices of ham on top of the spread before rolling. ; name: spicy black beans ; ingredients: olive oil, onions, garlic clove, ground cumin, black beans, red pepper flakes ; preparation:In a saucepan over medium heat, add the oil, onion, and garlic. Sweat the onions for about 2 minutes. Add the cumin and beans. Stir and add the red pepper flakes. Simmer for about 5 minutes. ; name: easy sweet potato pie ; ingredients: sugar, flour, evaporated milk, egg, vanilla, cooked sweet potatoes, unbaked pie shells ; preparation:In a bowl, combine sugar, flour, milk, egg and vanilla. Stir in the sweet potatoes. Pour into pie shell. Cover edges of pastry loosely with foil. Bake at 375 degrees for 45 minutes. Remove foil. Bake 15 minutes longer or until crust is golden brown and a knife inserted near the center comes out clean. ; name: chicago chicken casserole ; ingredients: boneless chicken breasts, broccoli, corn, cream of mushroom soup, milk, velveeta cheese, mushroom, pimiento, ritz cracker, butter ; preparation:Poach chicken in water, when cool enough to handle pull apart into bite-size pieces. In a large 9x12 casserole layer cooked chicken, drained corn and broccoli. Mix soup with milk, cheese, mushrooms and pimentos. Heat and pour over chicken. Sprinkle top with ritz crackers which have been mixed with enough butter to moisten. If prepared ahead and refrigerate, do not top with the ritz until ready to bake. Bake for 1 hour or till bubbly and hot. Do not fill casserole to full. This cooks over easily. ; name: blue cheese pasta salad ; ingredients: penne pasta, plain nonfat yogurt, low-fat mayonnaise, blue cheese, salt, fresh ground pepper, olive oil, garlic, round steaks, cherry tomatoes ; preparation:Cook pasta according to package directions. Meanwhile, combine yogurt, mayonnaise, blue cheese, salt and pepper in large bowl. Heat large non-stick skillet, swirl in oil, then add garlic. Saute 30 seconds. Add beef in two batches, cook til just browned, about 2 minutes. Drain pasta, add to bowl with yogurt dressing. Add steak and tomatoes, toss to coat. Serve immediately. ; name: blueberry crumb pie ; ingredients: deep dish pie shell, fresh blueberries, sugar, flour, cinnamon, orange juice, brown sugar, butter ; preparation:

name: oven roasted tilapia with tomatoes pesto and lemon ; ingredients: cherry tomatoes, garlic cloves, extra virgin olive oil, pesto sauce, lemon, tilapia fillets, salt and pepper, lemon wedge ; preparation:Gently combine the tomatoes, garlic and olive oil with a little salt and pepper if desired and roast in a preheated 425 degree oven for about 10 minutes. Juice the lemon and mix some of the juice with the pesto, adding more if desired or needed keeping the pesto a nice spreadable consistency and not runny. Spread mixture on top of the fish which has been seasoned with a little more salt and pepper if desired. Cut the juiced lemon halves in half again so that you have two pieces of lemon to support each filet. Place a filet on top of two pieces of juiced lemon so that the fish is somewhat out of any liquid that accumulates, allowing it to roast rather than boil. Return to oven for about 10 minutes or until the fish is flaky and no longer opaque. Plate the fish along with the tomatoes and garlic and serve with more lemon wedges if desired. ; name: baked sour cream noodles low fat ; ingredients: yolk-free egg noodles, fat free sour cream, fat-free cottage cheese, skim milk, garlic cloves, low-sodium worcestershire sauce, white pepper, parmesan cheese, poppy seed ; preparation:Preheat the oven to 350 degrees farenheit, 175 celsius, or gas mark 4. Lightly spray a 2 quart casserole dish with cooking spray. Prepare the egg noodles per package directions omitting the oil and salt, drain well. While noodles are cooking, in a large bowl stir together the sour cream, cottage cheese, milk, garlic, worcestershire, and pepper. Stir in the cooked noodles, and spoon into the casserole dish. Bake uncovered, for 15 minutes. Sprinkle with the parmesan and poppy seeds and bake for 5 minutes more. ; name: feta artichoke dip ; ingredients: artichoke hearts, feta, reduced-fat mayonnaise, parmesan cheese, pimientos, garlic cloves, tomatoes, green onions ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350f. Lightly grease 9x9 inch baking dish. Combine the artichoke hearts, feta, mayonnaise, parmesan cheese, pimientos, and garlic in a bowl. Blend thoroughly. Spoon into prepared baking dish. Bake in preheated oven until top is bubbly and lightly browned, 20 to 25 minutes. Remove and garnish with tomatoes and green onions. ; name: shrimp and pasta bordelaise ; ingredients: angel hair pasta, butter, green onions, garlic, shrimp, dry white wine, white pepper, salt, ground cayenne pepper, fresh italian parsley ; preparation:Boil pasta according to the directions on the package, drain and set aside. Melt the butter in large saute pan and saute the green onions and garlic for about 2 minutes. Add the shrimp and cook over medium high heat for about 3 minutes. Add the remaining ingredients except parsley, lower the heat and simmer for about 5 more minutes. Pour over the pasta, add parsley and toss to blend. Serve immediately. ; name: chocolate fudge pecan pie ; ingredients: chocolate crumb crusts, cornstarch, water, unsweetened chocolate squares, condensed milk, eggs, butter, salt, pecans ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Meanwhile, combine cornstarch and water in a small bowl. In saucepan, melt chocolate and condensed milk over low heat, stirring occasionally. Add the cornstarch mixture, then the eggs, butter, and salt. Stir until well-combined and smooth. Remove from the heat and add pecans. Mix well and pour into crust. Bake for approximately 30-35 minutes, until a knife inserted into the center of the pie comes out clean. Cool on a rack, then cover and refrigerate for a minimum of 2 hours. ; name: healthy oat and apricot breakfast bars ; ingredients: whole wheat flour, baking powder, brown sugar, quick oats, dried apricot halves, sunflower seeds, butter, fat free egg substitute ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350f. Coat an 8-inch square baking pan with cooking spray. Whisk together flour, baking powder, sugar, oats, apricots and sunflower seeds. Whisk together margarine and egg substitute. Quickly mix together wet and dry ingredients. Spoon into prepared pan and smooth top. Bake until firm, about 20 minutes. Cool completely before cutting into 8 rectangles. Yields 1 bar per serving. ; name: cranberry cherry relish ; ingredients: cranberries, sweet cherries, bosc pears, brown sugar, ground nutmeg, ground cinnamon ; preparation:In a large heavy saucepan combine all the ingredients and bring to a simmer over medium-high heat. Stir often to prevent sticking. When mixture is simmering, reduce heat to low. Cook mixture until fruit is tender and the relish has thickened, approximately 40-50 minutes, stirring occasionally. Let cool, serve. ; name: breakfast delish ; ingredients: eggs, ricotta cheese, heavy cream, splenda sugar substitute, cinnamon, nutmeg ; preparation:

name: rotkrautsalat red cabbage salad ; ingredients: bacon, vegetable oil, sugar, salt, vinegar, pepper, red wine, caraway seed, red cabbage ; preparation:Fry bacon in medium-size fry pan until crisp. Remove and reserve bacon. Add sugar, vinegar, and wine to bacon fat. Stir and cook until sugar is dissolved. Pour this hot mixture over the cabbage. Toss with vegetable oil, salt, pepper, and caraway seeds. Sprinkle crumbled bacon over mixture. Serve at room temperature. ; name: white beans with garlic crumb crust ; ingredients: olive oil, onion, garlic, balsamic vinegar, tomatoes, zucchini, red bell pepper, white kidney beans, breadcrumbs ; preparation:I just flavoured this with a bit of salt, but if you had fresh basil, thatd be good, too. The recipe called for one bay leaf and some thyme, but i dont have any around. Heat oil in a sauce pan, add onions and garlic. Add balsamic, zucchini and pepper, cook until softened. Add tomatoes, lower heat and simmer 20 min. Heat oven to 350 f, and grease a baking dish. Combine the beans with the tomato mixture and pour into the pan. Mix together crust ingredients and sprinkle overtop. Bake 30 min. ; name: lentil chili soup ; ingredients: vegetable oil, fresh garlic, onions, frozen carrots, dry lentils, low-sodium v8 juice, water, chili powder, ground cumin, dried oregano ; preparation:Pour the vegetable oil into a large cooking pot or dutch oven. Over medium-high heat, saute the onion and garlic until golden, about 2-3 minutes. Add remaining ingredients and stir. Bring to a boil and then reduce the heat to a simmer. Cook uncovered until the lentils are tender, about 45 minutes. Serve. ; name: grandma s gooey butter cake ; ingredients: yellow cake mix, egg, butter, cream cheese, eggs, vanilla, powdered sugar ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Combine all cake base ingredients and mix well. Pat into lightly greasted 13x9 baking pan. Prepare filling. Beat cream cheese until smooth. Add eggs and vanilla. Add butter and beat. Add powdered sugar and mix well. Pour over cake mixture. Bake for 40-45 minutes. You want the center to be a little gooey, so make sure not to overbake. ; name: hot spiced cheer ; ingredients: cloves, cinnamon sticks, crystallized ginger, apple cider, pineapple juice, orange juice, fresh lemon juice, sugar, salt, white rum ; preparation:Place cloves, cinnamon, and crystallized ginger on a double layer of cheesecloth. Gather edges and tie together to make a pouch. Combine cheescloth pouch, cider, pineapple juice, orange juice, lemon juice, sugar and salt in large stockpot and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer 20 minutes. Discard cheesecloth pouch. Serve with rum, if desired. ; name: braised brussels sprouts rachael ray ; ingredients: extra virgin olive oil, butter, onions, brussels sprouts, ground allspice, sage, salt & freshly ground black pepper, chicken stock, radicchio ; preparation:Heat a large saut pan over medium-high heat with the evoo and butter. Add the onions and cook until caramelized, 5-6 minutes. Add the sliced brussels sprouts, allspice, sage, some salt and freshly ground pepper, and toss to combine. Add the stock, bring up to a bubble, then reduce the heat and simmer until the brussels sprouts are tender, about 15 minutes. In the last three minutes of cooking, stir in the radicchio. Serves 4 for a main dish or 6-8 as a side dish. ; name: ana s honey and soy glazed salmon ; ingredients: salmon fillets, olive oil, glaze, honey, soy sauce, fresh lime juice, dijon mustard, water ; preparation:Mix the glaze ingredients together in a small bowl, and set aside. Heat the olive oil in a small skillet over moderately high heat. Place the salmon fillets in the skillet, and cook for 2-3 minutes on each side, or until. Golden, and just cooked through. Transfer salmon onto plates. Add honey glaze to skillet and simmer, stirring, for 1 minute. Pour the honey-soy glaze over the salmon, and serve. ; name: crunchy chocolate cookies ; ingredients: rolled oats, all-purpose flour, sugar, cocoa powder, baking powder, salt, egg whites, corn syrup, vanilla, rice krispies ; preparation:

name: roasted pears with brown sugar and vanilla ice cream ; ingredients: apple juice, dark brown sugar, unsalted butter, bosc pears, vanilla ice cream ; preparation:Preheat the oven to 400 degrees f. Arrange the pears cut side up in an 8-inch square glass baking dish. Whisk the apple juice and sugar in a small heavy saucepan over medium-high heat until the sugar dissolves. Whisk in the butter. Pour the sauce over the pears. Bake until the pears are crisp-tender and beginning to brown, basting occasionally with the juices, about 35 minutes. Spoon the pears onto plates. Top with ice cream. Drizzle with any juices and serve. The pears can also be served frozen. To do so, cool the pears, then place them in the freezer until frozen solid, about 8 hours. ; name: grilled mussels with red wine and chorizo ; ingredients: olive oil, shallot, garlic, spanish chorizo, red wine, mussels, tomatoes, fresh parsley, butter, kosher salt & freshly ground black pepper ; preparation:Heat grill over medium high heat. Meanwhile, heat a large saute pan over medium heat. Add olive oil, shallots, garlic, and chorizo and cook, stirring frequently, until shallots are softened, about 4 minutes. Stir in the red wine and cook until it reduces by about half, 3to 5 minutes. Remove from heat. Using a wire basket, place mussles on the grill until they just begin to open, then transfer to the saute pan. Heat the pan over high heat until the liquid boils. Stir in the tomatoes, parsley, and butter. Season with a pinch of salt and pepper. Serve immediately. ; name: spicy sweet glaze chicken ; ingredients: garlic, apricot preserves, soy sauce, ketchup, tabasco sauce, chicken pieces ; preparation:Mix together garlic, apricot preserves, soy sauce, ketchup and tobasco sauce. Put chicken pieces of choice in a gallon ziplock bag. Add the sauce mixture. Place in a freezer. To cook the chicken, thaw completely in the refrigerator. Dump into a 9x13 pan. Bake at 350 degrees fahrenheit until done, 50 to 60 minutes. ; name: caramelized corn with onions and red bell peppers ; ingredients: fresh corn kernels, olive oil, red bell peppers, onion, garlic clove, fresh cilantro, chili powder ; preparation:Heat large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add corn. Stir until beginning to dry and brown, about 8 minutes. Transfer to small bowl. Add oil to skillet. Heat over medium-high heat. Add bell peppers, onion, and garlic. Saut until peppers are tender, about 8 minutes. Mix in cilantro and chili powder, then corn. Stir until heated through, about 2 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. ; name: brie and cranberry pizza ; ingredients: refrigerated crescent dinner rolls, brie cheese, whole berry cranberry sauce, pecans ; preparation:Preheat oven to 425 degrees. Lightly grease a 9x13 inch baking dish. Unroll the crescent rolls and press into baking dish pinching seams together. Bake 5 minutes, or until lightly brown. Remove from the oven and sprinkle with pieces of brie cheese. Spoon the cranberry sauce over the cheese. Top with pecans. Bake an additional 8 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and the crust is golden brown. Cool 5 minutes and cut into squares. ; name: curried zucchini ; ingredients: butter, zucchini, onion, tomatoes, brown sugar, curry powder, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Melt butter in a large skillet, that is coated with cooking spray. Add zucchini and onion. Saute until tender. Stir in tomato, brown sugar, and curry powder. Cover and cook 1 minute, sprinkle zucchini mixture with parmesan cheese, serve warm. ; name: chicken and chickpea salad ; ingredients: cooked chicken, cherry tomatoes, chickpeas, flat leaf parsley, red onion, feta, olive oil, lemon juice, baby spinach ; preparation:Combine chicken, tomatoes, chickpeas, parsley, onion and feta in a large bowl. Season with black pepper. Toss gently to combine. Whisk oil, juice and salt and pepper together in a small bowl until well combined. Add spinach to chicken, drizzle with dressing and toss again to combine. Serve with crusty bread. ; name: chile chicken ; ingredients: olive oil, garlic cloves, bell peppers, onions, ground cumin, oregano, hot chili peppers, boneless skinless chicken breasts, lemon juice ; preparation:

name: radish olive salad with mustard vinaigrette ; ingredients: radishes, kalamata olive, scallions, olive oil, white vinegar, dijon mustard, garlic, salt, black pepper, boston lettuce leaves ; preparation:Combine radishes, olives and scallions in a small bowl. Whisk oil, vinegar, mustard, salt and pepper together. Pour over radish mixture and toss to coat. Cover and refrigerate. To serve, place one or two boston lettuce leaves on each plate and divide salad evenly among plates. ; name: pear and cashew slice ; ingredients: pears, raw cashews, gluten-free self-raising flour, soft brown sugar, dairy-free margarine, golden syrup, egg ; preparation:Place the pears, cashews, flour and brown sugar in a bowl and mix together. Place the margarine and golden syrup in a small saucepan and stir over low heat until melted. Gently stir golden syrup mixture and egg into the pear mixture. Pour the mixture into a lightly greased 20cm square tin and bake for 35-40 minutes at 180c, or until golden and cooked through. Leave to cool in the tin before slicing. ; name: crisp beef ; ingredients: lean beef chuck, garlic, salt, fresh ground black pepper, dark brown sugar, molasses, lime juice, ground coriander, water, peanut oil ; preparation:Cut the meat in thin slices along the grain, not across it. Pound the slices until they almost fall apart. Put the meat and all the other ingredients except the oil in a heavy saucepan. Bring to a boil over high heat, then reduce the heat to medium low and cook, stirring now and then, until the liquid has evaporated. Remove the meat and tear it into fine strips using two forks. Scrape the bottom of the pan to gather the residue, add the oil and set it over medium heat. When the oil is hot add the meat shreds and fry, stirring, until they are crisp and dark brown. Drain on paper towels before serving. ; name: crunchy no fry chicken ; ingredients: corn flakes, garlic powder, black pepper, boneless skinless chicken breasts, chicken broth ; preparation:Mix all the dry ingredients together. Dip chicken into broth. Coat with corn flakes. Place chicken on a baking sheet. Bake at 400f for about 25 minutes or till chicken is no longer pink. ; name: cinnamon pecan twistcookies ; ingredients: light brown sugar, pecan pieces, ground cinnamon, puff pastry, egg ; preparation:Combine sugar, pecans, and cinnamon in a mini-chopper and process until sandy. Line 2 baking sheets with parchment paper. Unfold pastry and brush with egg. Spread sugar mixture over pastry. Cut in half, then cut into 8 strips. Twist strips. Lay on pans, pushing ends down with your thumb. Freeze 10 to 15 minutes, until firm. Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Bake until golden, rotating pans halfway, 18 to 20 minutes. Cool on a rack. ; name: potato carrot kugel ; ingredients: russet potatoes, carrots, onion, eggs, oil, matzo meal, salt, pepper ; preparation:Grate vegetables, place in large bowl. Preheat oven to 400. Beat eggs in small bowl, add with remaining ingredients. Grease a 13x9 baking dish, add ingredients. Bake aprox 1 hour until top is brown. ; name: lancaster farmhouse baked oatmeal ; ingredients: old fashioned oats, unsalted butter, milk, light brown sugar, ground cinnamon, salt, dried apple, heavy cream ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350. Butter a medium baking dish. Add the oats and butter to a heatproof mixing bowl. Pour 1 cup boiling water over them and let stand 5 minutes. Stir in the milk, brown sugar, cinnamon, and salt. When well mixed, stir in the apples. Spoon mixture into the prepared dish. Cover and bake for 35 minutes, then uncover and continue to cook for 5-10 minutes, until thick and bubbly. Spoon into bowls and serve hot with cream drizzled around the cereal and a dusting of cinnamon. ; name: lentil rice dish mujadarah arabic dish ; ingredients: lentils, basmati rice, water, salt, black pepper, cumin, olive oil, onions ; preparation:

name: dijon herb dressing ; ingredients: dijon mustard, white vinegar, olive oil, fresh basil, parsley, nonfat dry milk powder, water ; preparation:In a small bowl whisk together the mustard, vinegar, oil, basil and parsley. In a separate bowl mix the powdered milk and water. It will not be the consistency of milk, instead creamier and thicker like half-n-half. Combine milk with the dressing and whisk until fully incorporated. This will keep in the fridge for 2 or 3 days. If you are using dried herbs its tastes better if you let the dressing sit in the ice box an hour or so before serving. ; name: microwave lyonaisse potatoes ; ingredients: potatoes, onion, butter, garlic, salt, dry oregano, black pepper ; preparation:In 3 quart microwave container, melt the butter or marg. On high. Add rest ingredients, stir to mix. Cover and nuke for 10 minutes on high. When i first made these, i watched them like a hawk, worried they would burn with that amount of time on high heat but they. Turned out great. ; name: polpette and orzo in broth ; ingredients: white bread, milk, beef stock, orzo pasta, ground sirloin, onion, fresh parmesan cheese, parsley, salt and pepper, carrots ; preparation:Soak the bread in the milk for about 4 or 5 minutes, until soggy. Bring a pot of water to boil and cook pasta until done. Drain and rinse. Heat stock. Squeeze the bread to get out the extra milk. Combine the meat, onion, half the cheese and half the parsley. Add sallt and pepper. Shape into 1-inch meatballs. Season stock and add the carrots. Gently lower meatballs into stock and simmer for about 10, until carrots are tender. Add orzo and cook for 2 more minutes. Adjust seasoning and sprinkle with remaining parmesan cheese. ; name: omelette sandwich ; ingredients: eggs, cumin, extra virgin olive oil, sea salt, black pepper, hoagie rolls, salsa ; preparation:Beat eggs with 1 tbs water and cumin. Coat bottom of non stick pan with 1 tbs oil. Pour in enough egg mixture to coat bottom of pan. Push cooked edges into center allowing uncooked egg to flow around pan, do this twice. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. When almost cooked through, fold in half. Repeat with remaining egg mixture. Split rolls in half and place omelette into each roll. Top with tomato salsa. ; name: banana chip muffins ; ingredients: banana muffin mix, quick oats, mini chocolate chip, mashed banana, egg, milk ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Grease muffin pan. Combine all ingredients until well blended. Pour into prepared muffin pan. Bake 12 - 14 minutes. ; name: yogurt mint marinated chicken ; ingredients: skinless chicken breast halves, coarse salt, fresh lemon juice, plain low-fat yogurt, of fresh mint, fresh ginger, garlic cloves, garam masala, chili powder ; preparation:Rinse chicken under cold water. Place in a large bowl and rub with salt and lemon juice. Set aside. Blend remaining ingredients. Toss well to mix and then coat chicken. Seal bowl with plastic wrap and refrigerate for 24 hours. Preheat oven to 400 f. Place chicken on a foil-lined baking sheet and bake for 35 minutes. ; name: rice with coconut milk ; ingredients: jasmine rice, coconut cream, sugar, salt, coconut milk ; preparation:Rinse rice in several changes of water. Drain, discard water and set aside. In a medium pot, over medium heat, bring coconut cream to a boil. Add rice, sugar and salt. Add coconut milk and return to a boil. Cook, partially covered, stirring occasionally, about 3 minutes. Reduce heat to low and simmer, covered, stirring occasionally, 15 to 20 minutes, or until all the liquid has been absorbed and the rice has fluffed. ; name: old mexico spinach cheese dip ; ingredients: onion, vegetable oil, whole canned tomatoes, diced green chilies, frozen chopped spinach, monterey jack cheese, cream cheese, half-and-half cream, red wine vinegar, salt and pepper ; preparation:

name: easy creamy vegetable soup ; ingredients: onion, carrot, celery, water, vegetables, salt, pepper, chicken broth, half-and-half ; preparation:Simmer onion, carrot and celery in water for 10 minutes or until vegetables are tender. In a blender or food processor. Puree all vegetables. Add salt, pepper, chicken broth and cream. Heat before serving, but do not boil. ; name: modenese pork chops ; ingredients: butter, pork loin chops, dry white wine, salt, black pepper, dried sage, dried rosemary, garlic cloves, lemon juice ; preparation:Melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Brown chops on both sides, then add remaining ingredients, except lemon juice. Cover, reduce heat, and simmer about 20 minutes until chops are tender, turning once during cooking. Remove chops and place on a warm platter. Add lemon juice to pan juices and simmer 1 minute. Pour over chops and enjoy. ; name: chicken olivia ; ingredients: boneless skinless chicken breast, cream of chicken soup, sour cream, diced green chilies, black olives, green onion, sharp cheddar cheese ; preparation:Steam chicken and cut into small pieces. Place in a 2 quart baking dish. Mix soup, sour cream, chiles, olives, and green onions. Pour over the chicken. Cover with the cheese and bake at 350 degrees farenheit for 20-30 minutes. ; name: jalapeno pepper mac n cheese ; ingredients: salt and pepper, cavatappi pasta, extra virgin olive oil, jalapenos, serrano chilies, garlic cloves, whole milk, cream cheese, dried onion flakes, monterey jack cheese ; preparation:Bring a large pot of water to a boil, salt it, add the pasta and cook until al dente. Drain and return to the pot. In a skillet, heat a drizzle of evoo over medium heat. Add the jalapenos, serranos and garlic and cook until tender, about 5 minutes. Add to the pasta. Preheat the broiler. In a saucepan, combine the milk, cream cheese and onion over medium-low heat. Cook, stirring, until smooth, 5 minutes. Stir into the pasta. Stir in the jack cheese. Season with salt and pepper. Transfer the pasta to a baking dish and broil until browned, about 3 minutes. ; name: creamy cheddar potatoes ; ingredients: butter, potatoes, salt, fresh ground black pepper, milk, cheddar cheese, parsley ; preparation:In large, nonstick skillet, melt butter. Add potatoes and cook over medium heat until almost tender and lightly browned. Add salt, pepper, and milk, continuing to cook until milk is absorbed and potatoes are tender. Sprinkle with cheese, heating until melted. Stir well, sprinkle with chopped parsley and serve. ; name: cranberry orange chocolate chip cookies ; ingredients: flour, baking powder, baking soda, kosher salt, butter, granulated sugar, egg, orange zest, dried sweetened cranberries, semi-sweet chocolate chips ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Line cookie sheets with parchment or silpat. Whisk together flour, baking powder, soda, and salt in a medium bowl. Set aside. In a separate large bowl, cream butter and sugar together with an electric mixer until light in color. Beat in egg and orange zest. Add flour mixture a little at a time with mixer on low speed, stirring until just combine. Fold in cranberries and chocolate chips. Drop dough by rounded tablespoons onto prepared cookie sheets. Bake 9-12 minutes in preheated oven or until the edges of the cookies are just slightly golden. Cool for 3-4 minutes on pan, then transfer to a baking rack and cool completely. Adding coconut is an option as is adding nuts. ; name: rumbled eggs ; ingredients: butter, eggs, bottled water, salt and pepper ; preparation:Put a saucepan of boiling water over a low heat. Put the butter in a bowl and stand it in the saucepan to melt, while you beat together the eggs, salt, pepper and water. When the butter is hot and clear, pour in the egg mixture and stir twice. They can then be left over the gently simmering water while you set the table. Give them an occasional stir as you pass by to prevent the eggs at the bottom from sticking. As soon as the eggs are the consistency of clotted cream remove the saucepan from the heat and the eggs will keep hot over the hot water until they are needed. Serve on buttered toast. ; name: the old barn inn breakfast brunch quiche ; ingredients: breakfast sausage, egg, cheese, salt, pepper, garlic powder, crescent rolls, milk ; preparation:

name: catalan style cauliflower ; ingredients: boiling potato, cauliflower florets, extra virgin olive oil, white wine vinegar, salt, white pepper ; preparation:Cut potatoes the same size as the florets. Add to a large sauce pan, cover with water and salt lightly. Bring to a boil and cook until easily pierced with a skewer, about 20 minutes. Drain and transfer to a serving plate. Mix oil, vinegar, salt and pepper, pour over potatoes and cauliflower, breaking them up a bit as you do. Serve immediately. ; name: sugar gems ; ingredients: powdered sugar, white sugar, vegetable oil, margarine, egg, salt, baking soda, vanilla, white flour, cream of tartar ; preparation:Mix sugars, margarine, oil and egg. Stir in rest of ingredients. Roll in small walnut sized balls. Flatten with the bottom of a beverage glass that has been sprayed with vegetable oil and dipped in sugar. Bake at 350 degrees for 12 to 15 minutes. They will not be brown when finished. Do not over bake. Leave on cookie sheets for 5 minutes and then remove to cool. ; name: hawaiian bananas canning recipe ; ingredients: green bananas, fresh lime juice, water, sugar, butter, ground cloves, cinnamon sticks, fresh ginger, salt, nutmeg ; preparation:Combine all ingredients in a sauce pan and bring to a boil. Peel and slice bananas in 1 inch chunks and add to boiling syrup-all at once. Reduce heat and simmer for 5 minutes-stirring very gently. Ladle into sterilized jars. Process in a boiling water bath for 10 minutes at altitudes up to 1000 feet. ; name: turkey burgers with a twist ; ingredients: ground turkey, panko breadcrumbs, mango chutney, sour cream, monterey jack cheese, dijon mustard, chili powder, salt ; preparation:Mix all burger ingredients together, cuting up large pieces of mango in the chutney. Form into four burgers. Grill, broil or pan fry to medium well. Mix together topping ingredients, cutting up large pieces of mango in the chutney. Top burgers and enjoy. ; name: sicilian orange and basil salad ; ingredients: oranges, red onion, basil leaves, red wine vinegar, salt and pepper ; preparation:Peel and section oranges, cut each section in half. Peel red onion and slice it thinly. Tear basil leaves into bite size pieces. Drizzle with red wine vinegar. Salt and pepper. Serve immediately. ; name: beef gravy ; ingredients: beef round steak, cream of mushroom soup, dry onion soup mix, water, cornstarch, cooking oil, mushroom ; preparation:In 6-qt stockpot, in 2 t hot oil, brown meat on all sides. Stir in mushroom soup, onion soup mix, mushrooms and 1 cup water. Cover. Cook 45 minutes or until meat is tender. Stir together cornstarch and cup water until smooth. Gradually stir into gravy mixture. Cook until mixture boils and thickens, stirring constantly. Excellent served with rice and biscuits. ; name: oatmeal banana muffins ; ingredients: flour, rolled oats, baking powder, baking soda, egg, white sugar, butter, mashed bananas, raisins ; preparation:Mix all together well. Place in muffin liners. This recipes is very easily doubled and tripled. You can add nuts or chocolate chips too for a change. Mix all together, place in x-large muffin liners. Bake for 20-25 minutes at 325. Makes 12 big muffins. ; name: simple coconut rice pudding ; ingredients: cooked rice, whole milk, unsweetened coconut milk, sugar, salt, coconut extract, coconut flakes ; preparation:

name: screamin green beans ; ingredients: french style green beans, butter, oregano leaves, garlic cloves, crushed red pepper flakes, salt, ground black pepper ; preparation:Cook beans in a small amount of boiling water for about 10-15 minutes. Drain. Keep warm. Add all ingredients and cook on low until butter has melted and flavors are combined - stir continuously. Serve. ; name: chicken rice bake ; ingredients: long grain rice, condensed cream of celery soup, water, chicken pieces, scallion, longhorn cheese ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Sprinkle rice over bottom of a 13- x 9-inch baking dish. Combine soup and water. Pour carefully over the rice. Lay the chicken pieces over the rice without overlapping. Sprinkle the sliced scallions and grated cheese over the top. Cover dish with foil. Bake in preheated oven 45 minutes. Uncover and bake 15 minutes longer. ; name: ham and asparagus pasta ; ingredients: corkscrew macaroni, fresh asparagus, cooked ham, cream cheese with chives, milk ; preparation:Cook pasta according to directions. Add asparagus and ham or chicken to the pasta during the last 5 minutes of cooking. Drain. Return to pan. In a 2 cup measurer. Stir cream cheese into milk. Add mixture to pasta and stir gently over medium heat until heated through. ; name: chocolate covered saltine crackers ; ingredients: saltine crackers, butter, brown sugar, mini chocolate chips, nuts, toffee pieces, candy sprinkles, raisins, mint ; preparation:Arrange 40 saltine crackers on a non-stick foil in a jelly roll pan. Melt butter and brown sugar in pan and boil 3 minutes. Pour over crackers. Bake at 350f for 5 minutes. Pour chocolate chips over and let stand 5 minutes to melt. Spread around with knife and then sprinkle nuts and toffee bits over top and or raisins. Garnish with colored sprinkles. Place in refrigerator until hard. Break into bite-size pieces. ; name: diet pineapple muffins ; ingredients: flour, baking powder, artificial sweetener, salt, margarine, crushed pineapple, egg ; preparation:Combine flour, baking powder, sweetner and salt. Add melted butter. Add beaten egg and 19 oz tin of crushed pineapple. Ingredients will be very thick in texture. Line your muffin pan cups with cupcake papers. Bake 18 minutes at 400f. ; name: portabellas stuffed with spinach and blue cheese ; ingredients: portabella mushrooms, fresh spinach, onion, blue cheese, garlic cloves, olive oil, balsamic vinegar ; preparation:Remove stems from mushrooms and chop. Bake portabella caps for about 10 minutes in 400 degree oven. Remove and cool. Saute onions and garlic in 1t oil until onions are translucent. Add spinach to onions and garlic and saute until spinach is wilted. Spoon this mixture into portabella caps. Sprinkle blue cheese on top. Bake 15 minutes at 400 degrees. Mix remaining olive oil and balsamic vinegar. Drizzle over the cooked portabellas and serve. ; name: swiss melt with tomato and fresh basil ; ingredients: italian bread, reduced-fat swiss cheese, tomatoes, salt, fresh ground black pepper, fresh basil leaf, butter ; preparation:Spread outside of each piece of bread with 1 t butter. Layer 4 slices of bread with 2 pieces of cheese and 2 slices of tomato each. Salt and pepper, if desired. Top each sandwich evenly with the basil and 1 slice of bread. Heat a skillet over medium-high heat. Place 1 sandwich into skillet. Cook, turning once, until sandwich is golden brown, about 4-5 minutes. Repeat with remaining sandwiches. ; name: pumpkin cheesecake vegan ; ingredients: graham cracker crumbs, vegan margarine, soy cream cheese, pumpkin puree, light brown sugar, rum extract, ground cinnamon, ground allspice, ground nutmeg ; preparation:

name: tangy cranberry relish ; ingredients: cranberries, orange juice, sugar, walnuts, orange, rind of, ground ginger ; preparation:Bring orange juice to a boil. Add washed cranberries and sugar. Cover, reduce heat, and simmer for 10-15 minutes. Remove from heat. Mash berries with a potato masher. Stir in remaining ingredients. Chill for several hours and serve. ; name: tattooed potatoes with rosemary ; ingredients: extra virgin olive oil, salt, cracked pepper, fresh rosemary, russet potatoes ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400f. Pour the olive oil into a medium-sized glass baking dish and add the salt and pepper. Stir to combine. Press a rosemary sprig or parsley leaf on the cut side of each potato half and place cut side down in the oil. Bake until the potatoes are nicely browned, 40 to 45 minutes. While the potatoes are cooking, using a spatula, gently move them every now and then to keep them from sticking. When they are ready, remove them from pan, turning them flat side up and carefully leaving the pressed herb in place. Arrange on a platter and serve immediately. ; name: south beach salmon with creamy lemon sauce low carb ; ingredients: olive oil, garlic clove, lemon juice, capers, lemon-pepper seasoning, fat free sour cream, salmon fillets ; preparation:Preheat the oven to 350f. Coat a baking sheet with cooking spray. Heat the oil in a small saucepan over medium heat. Add the garlic and cook for one minute. Reduce heat to low. Stir in the lemon juice, capers and lemon-pepper seasoning and cook for 5 minutes. Add the sour cream and cook for 5 minutes or until heated though. Meanwhile, place the salmon on the prepared baking sheet. Bake for 20 minutes or until the fish is just opaque. Serve with the sauce. ; name: oriental wrap quick ; ingredients: chicken rice pilaf mix, oil, ginger, garlic, sliced mushrooms, tortillas, lettuce leaf, chicken, green onion, low sodium soy sauce ; preparation:Prepare rice mix according to package directions. While rice is cooking, heat oil in a small frypan. Saute ginger, garlic and mushrooms until tender. Fold into rice mixture. Lay tortilla flat and line with letuce leaves. Divide rice veggie mixture into 4 equal parts. Spreading on top of lettuce. Lay chicken strips and green onions on top of rice. Sprinkle with soy sauce. Wrap tortilla ends in and roll up. Serve immediately with a ginger conserve or your favourite fresh veggie salsa topping. ; name: mushroom and wine steak sauce ; ingredients: fresh mushrooms, butter, onion, garlic, condensed beef broth, tomato paste, ground pepper, cornstarch, water, dry red wine ; preparation:Melt butter in a saucepan. Add mushrooms, onion and garlic. Saute until golden, about 5 minutes. Stir in broth, tomato paste and black pepper. Bring to the boiling point. Reduce heat and simmer, covered, for 10 minutes.
