Garnish the martini with a cucumber slice and the remaining whole basil leaf and serve. ; name: easy salmon ball ; ingredients: cream cheese, fresh lemon juice, onion, prepared horseradish, salt, liquid smoke, green peppers, cucumber, salmon, fresh parsley ; preparation:Cream all of the ingredients together except for the salmon and parsley. Fold into the salmon until well mixed. Chill overnight. Form into a firm ball and roll in the parsley mixture. Chill until ready to serve. Can be made up to 24 hours in advance. ; name: lebanese carrot and orange salad ; ingredients: carrots, oranges, onion, raisins, vegetable oil, lemon juice, water ; preparation:In a medium bowl, combine carrots, oranges and raisins. Toss to combine. In a small bowl, combine remaining ingredients. Spoon over carrot mixture. Mix well. Chill several hours or overnight. Mix before serving. ; name: fettuccini alfonso ; ingredients: frozen corn kernels, soymilk, onion powder, salt, fettuccine pasta, pepper, tahini ; preparation:Thaw corn kernels. Place the corn, soy milk, tahini, and seasoning in a blender and process until completely smooth. Pour the blended mixture into a medium saucepan and warm over medium-low heat, stirring often. While the sauce is heating, cook the fettuccini in a large pot of boiling water until al dente. Drain well and return to the pot. Add the hot sauce and toss until evenly coated. Serve immediately, topping each portion with pepper, if desired. ; name: fried eggs with kansas city style barbecue sauce for 1 ; ingredients: olive oil, arugula leaf, egg, barbecue sauce, sharp white cheddar cheese, fresh cilantro, cracked black pepper ; preparation:Heat up a skillet on medium heat then add the olive oil. Arrange the arugula leaves on a plate. Gently crack the egg and lightly fry for 3 minutes, or to your preference. Carefully arrange the fried egg on the arugula leaves. Spoon barbecue sauce on and around the egg and greens. Grate cheese on top followed by a garnish of fresh cilantro. Season with cracked black pepper. ; name: eggplant and potato indian ; ingredients: oil, black mustard seeds, potato, eggplant, coriander, cumin, turmeric, cayenne, salt ; preparation:Heat oil over medium-high heat in a big skillet. When hot, put in the mustard seeds. When they start to pop, put in the vegetables. Stir once. Add seasonings. Stir and fry for a minute. Add 3 tablespoons of water, lower heat, cover, and simmer 10-15 minutes. Stir every now and then. If vegetables stick, add a little water. Dish is done when the potatoes are tender. ; name: banana cream rum pudding ; ingredients: sugar-free banana cream pudding mix, low-fat milk, rum extract, banana, seedless raisin, graham wafers, ground cinnamon ; preparation:Prepare pudding mix per instructions using milk and rum extaract. Stir in banana slices. Spoon into cups. Garnish with graham wafer pieces. Sprinkle with cinnamon. ; name: eggless salad vegan or vegetarian ; ingredients: extra firm tofu, vegan mayonnaise, celery, onions, dijon mustard, salt and pepper ; preparation:

name: george washington pie dessert ; ingredients: graham cracker crumbs, butter, cream cheese, powdered sugar, walnuts, cool whip, cherry pie filling ; preparation:Mix the melted butter with the graham crackers and press into a 8x8 dish. Bake for 8 minutes in a 350 degree oven. Cool. Cream the cream cheese and powdered sugar and spread over the cooled crust, sprinkle with chopped nuts and spread the cool whip over this and chill for about an hour. Spread the cherry pie filling over the cool whip. Keep refrigerated. Will keep several days in the refrigerator. ; name: garlic chicken with quinoa ; ingredients: quinoa, chicken broth, fresh basil, chicken breasts, olive oil, onion, yellow bell pepper, green bell pepper, garlic, salt and pepper ; preparation:Cook the quinoa in the chicken broth as you would prepare rice, mixing in the basil just before serving. Heat oil in a wok and stir fry the chicken till browned, about 5 minutes. Add vegetables. Stir fry 2 minutes. Add garlic, salt, pepper. Continue to stir fry till peppers are slightly limp. Top the quinoa with the stir fry mixture and serve hot. ; name: fiesta yellow squash ; ingredients: margarine, fresh onion, green pepper, yellow squash, salt, pepper, thyme, lemon juice ; preparation:Melt butter in skillet. Add onion and green pepper. Cook until tender. Add squash and seasonings. Mix well. Cook, covered, over moderately low heat for 10 to 15 minutes until crisp-tender. ; name: raspberry s mores ; ingredients: graham crackers, marshmallows, chocolate candy bars, fresh raspberry ; preparation:Adjust rack to middle position and heat broiler. You may also use a toaster oven. Break the crackers in half to form squares and place on a baking sheet. Arrange 4 marshmallow halves on top of each square. Broil for 30-60 seconds or until golden brown. Remove from oven. Break chocolate bar into 12 pieces. Arrange the chocolate and raspberries on one half of the crackers. Invert remaining marshmallow topped crackers onto the raspberry and chocolate topped crackers, pressing gently to for a cookies sandwich. ; name: chilled cucumber avocado and shrimp soup ; ingredients: avocado, cucumber, chicken broth, plain low-fat yogurt, lime juice, salt, cooked shrimp, green onions, shrimp ; preparation:Cut the avocado in half and remove the pit. Wrap half the avocado in plastic wrap and set aside. Peel the other half of the avocado, then cut it into chunks. Place the avocado, cucumber, broth, yogurt, lime juice and salt in the bowl of a blender. Process until smooth and creamy. Transfer the mixture to a bowl and refrigerate for at least 1 hour or until very cold. To serve, peel and dice the remaining avocado half. Stir the avocado into the soup along with the diced shrimp. Ladle the soup into 4 bowls, sprinkle with green onions and float a single shrimp on top of each. ; name: venezuelan scrambled eggs perico venezolano ; ingredients: oil, onion, bell pepper, garlic cloves, tomatoes, eggs, salt and pepper ; preparation:Heat the oil in a skillet over medium-high flame. Add the onion, bell pepper and garlic and saute for 3 to 4 minutes, or until the onion is softened and translucent. Add the tomatoes and cook for another 3 to 4 minutes to reduce the liquid somewhat. Reduce heat to low, add the eggs, salt and pepper and cook, gently stirring the eggs occasionally to scramble them and just long enough to cook them through while keeping them soft. Serve with bread or arepas and a slice of fresh cheese. ; name: garlic skillet red potatoes ; ingredients: olive oil, small red potatoes, garlic cloves, salt, pepper, fresh parsley ; preparation:In a large skillet, heat oil over medium-high heat. Stir in potatoes. Cover skillet. Cook, stirring, until potatoes are almost tender, about 12-15 minutes. Uncover, reduce heat to low. Stir in garlic, salt and pepper. Cook, stirring, until potatoes are tender, about 2 minutes. Sprinkle parsley and add salt to taste if desired. ; name: garlic lover s shrimps ; ingredients: olive oil, crushed red pepper flakes, garlic cloves, raw shrimp, salt, dry sherry, fresh parsley, old bay seasoning ; preparation:

name: sweet and tangy sloppy joes ; ingredients: ground beef, white onion, tomato sauce, ketchup, brown sugar, soy sauce, orange, juice of, cider vinegar, dry mustard, cayenne pepper ; preparation:In a large skillet brown ground beef and onion over medium heat. Drain off excess fat. Stir in the remaining ingredients until well blended. Cover and simmer over low heat for 20 minutes, stirring occasionally. Serve hot on your favorite buns or bread. ; name: cod vera cruz ; ingredients: cod fish fillet, condensed tomato soup, condensed chicken broth, salsa, lime juice, fresh cilantro, dried oregano, garlic powder, cooked rice ; preparation:Place fish in a 2-qt shallow baking dish. Mix, soup, broth, salsa, lime juice, cilantro, oregano and garlic powder. Pour over fish. Bake at 400 for 20 minute or until fish flakes easily. Serve over rice. ; name: sunday afternoon tea quick pickled cucumber and onion ; ingredients: cucumber, onion, salt, malt vinegar, sugar, mint ; preparation:Use a fork to run through the surface of the cucumber, vertically downwards, to obtain a fluted pattern when sliced. Cut cucumber into thin slices and put into a large bowl, sprinkle with salt and mix well. Leave the cucumber for 10 minutes to absorb the salt then rinse with cold water. Drain off excess liquid in a colander. Return cucumber to the large bowl and add the sliced onions. Combine sugar and vinegar together. Add to cucumber and onion slices and mix well. Decant into a plastic container, and refrigerate overnight or for a few hours before serving. Garnish with mint or parsley. Keeps in the fridge for a week. ; name: beef and bean burrito filling ; ingredients: oil, onion, garlic, ground beef, chili powder, cumin, salt and pepper, tomato sauce, refried beans ; preparation:Saute the onion in the oil until tender. Add the beef and garlic and cook until meat is no longer pink. Add the chili powder, cumin and other seasonings. Stir in tomato sauce and simmer for five minutes. Add refried beans and cook and stir until well blended. ; name: homemade soft taco shells ; ingredients: flour, cornmeal, salt, egg, cold water ; preparation:Combine all ingredients and beat until smooth. Fry slowly on a griddle or in large frypan in small amounts of cooking oil. Using a ladle, pour and swirl into a desired size circle. Let fry until the top is dry, then flip for a minute or so to set the other side. If they turn out like crepes, make the shells thicker. Fill with your favorite ingredients. We use seasoned hamburger, tomato, onion, lettuce, cheese, green peppers, olives. ; name: simple greek beet salad ; ingredients: beet, olive oil, red wine vinegar, walnuts, garlic clove ; preparation:Boil the beets with their skins for about 30 to 40 minutes, let them cool and peel. In a little bowl mix the olive oil, vinegar and garlic. Cut the beets in round slices and place on a plate. Pour the dressing over the beets and sprinkle with the walnuts. You can also cut in cubes and serve in a deeper bowl. ; name: tomato thokku ; ingredients: tomatoes, salt, chili powder, turmeric powder, hing, mustard seeds, oil ; preparation:Wash the tomatoes and cut them into small pieces. Add oil in your pan, when it is heated add mustard seeds. Let the mustard seed splutter. Add tomatoes, turmeric powder, chilli powder and asafoetida. Cook them nicely in a low flame, till the oil sticks out. Relish it with chappati or with bread sandwich. ; name: irish bread and butter pudding ; ingredients: dry white bread, sweet butter, nutmeg, golden raisin, eggs, heavy cream, milk, vanilla, superfine sugar, white sugar ; preparation:

name: baked reuben chicken ; ingredients: chicken thighs, fresh sauerkraut, thousand island dressing, swiss cheese ; preparation:In heavy skillet, sear thighs 5 to 6 minutes on each side. Spread kraut into 3 qt baking dish. Place thighs on top, skin side up. Place cheese slices evenly over entire dish. Spread dressing evenly over cheese. Cover with foil and bake at 350 for 20 minutes. Remove foil and bake additional 20 minutes. Cut breasts so 2 pieces equal a serving portion. Lightly salt and pepper the chicken. Do not skillet brown. Increase cooking time 8-10 minutes. ; name: roasted brussels sprouts with mushrooms ; ingredients: olive oil, thyme, salt and pepper, whole mushrooms, fresh brussels sprouts, balsamic vinegar ; preparation:Preheat over to 450f. On a rimmed baking sheet, toss mushrooms and thyme with brussels sprouts and olive oil. Season with salt and pepper. Roast on lower rack until golden brown and tender when pierced with a knife, 20 minutes. Serve hot, drizzled with balsamic vinegar, if desired. ; name: grizzlenuckles ; ingredients: sweetened condensed milk, graham wafer crumbs, desiccated coconut, chocolate chips, icing sugar ; preparation:Combine all ingredients except icing sugar. Mix well. Pat into a greased 13x9-inch pan. Bake at 350f for 20-25 minutes. Do not overbake. Sprinkle with icing sugar. Cool and cut into squares. ; name: sweet potatoes from the carolinas ; ingredients: olive oil, shallots, sweet potatoes, fresh parsley, salt and black pepper ; preparation:Heat oil in saucepan over medium heat. Add shallots and sweet potatoes. Season well. Cover and cook for 18 to 30 minutes, stirring 3 to 4 times. When vegetables are cooked sprinkle with parsley. Serve. ; name: baked pork chops ; ingredients: ritz cracker, parmesan cheese, salt, pepper, egg, milk, pork chops, butter ; preparation:Combine cracker crumbs, cheese, salt and pepper in a bowl. Dip pork chops in flour, this way, the coating will stick. Beat egg and milk in shallow bowl. Coat pork chops in crumb mixture. Dip in egg mixture and into crumbs again. Pour melted butter into baking dish. Arrange pork chops in prepared dish. Bake at 350 degrees for about 30 minutes on each side. ; name: easy homemade chicken salad ; ingredients: cooked chicken, celery, green onion, lemon juice, pepper, mayonnaise, sweet pickle relish, prepared mustard, hard-boiled eggs ; preparation:In medium mixing bowl combine first three ingredients. Stir in the lemon juice and pepper. Combine the mayo, pickle relish and prepared mustard. Add this sauce to chicken and gently stir in the eggs. Cover and chill until ready to serve. ; name: rebecca s olives olives baked in cheese ; ingredients: cheese, butter, flour, cayenne, garlic-stuffed olives ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350. Drain olives and pat dry. Thoroughly combine cheese and butter. Add flour and cayenne, stirring to fully mix. When thoroughly combined but crumbly, work mixture together with your fingers to form dough. Roll a tablespoon-sized clump of dough into a ball. Press it flat between the palms of your hands. Put an olive in the center and press dough around sides to enclose. Roll it between your palms to smooth surface, if you like. Bake 15 - 20 minutes. Serve warm or at room temperature. ; name: sweet potato puffs ; ingredients: sweet potatoes, butter, milk, salt, brown sugar, pumpkin pie spice, blanched slivered almond ; preparation:

name: cranberry ginger martini ; ingredients: ice, vodka, cranberry juice, lime juice, powdered ginger, sparkling water, cranberries, candied ginger ; preparation:Put the ice in a shaker. Add the vodka, cranberry juice, and lime juice. Shake. Place the powdered ginger in a chilled martini glass. Add the vodka-cranberry mixture and top with the tonic. Place 1 cranberry, some candied ginger, and another cranberry on a toothpick or cocktail skewer. Place in the martini glass. Use a light hand when sprinkling the powdered ginger into the glass, or it will overpower the drink. ; name: roasted red potatoes ; ingredients: small red potatoes, olive oil, italian seasoning, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Spray 13x9 dish with cooking spray. Slice potatoes fairly thin and place in dish. Drizzle with olive oil. Toss to coat. Sprinkle italian seasoning and parmesan cheese on top. Bake for 45 minutes or until golden brown. ; name: family sausage supper ; ingredients: spaghetti, oleo, onion, green pepper, sliced mushrooms, frozen broccoli cuts, oregano, garlic powder, kielbasa, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Cook spaghetti according to package directions. While spaghetti is cooking, melt the 3 tbsp. Butter in large pot and brown the onion, green pepper, mushrooms and kielbasa, about 10 minutes. Add broccoli, oregano and garlic powder. Continue cooking over med heat until broccoli is heated through. Drain cooked spaghetti and stir 1 tbsp. Butter into it, stirring to coat well. Place spaghetti on platter and top with kielbasa-veggie mix then sprinkle with grated parm. ; name: cranberry maple butter ; ingredients: water, fresh cranberries, maple syrup, brown sugar, ground cinnamon, vanilla extract ; preparation:Combine the water and cranberries in a large saucepan or dutch oven. Bring to a boil. Cover, reduce heat, and simmer for 5 minutes or until cranberries pop. Place cranberry mixture in a blender or food processor, and process until smooth. Combine cranberry mixture, maple syrup, sugar, and cinnamon in pan. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Simmer, uncovered 25 minutes or until mixture is thick, stirring frequently. Stir in vanilla. Cool. Store in refrigerator up to 2 months. ; name: watermelon gazpacho ; ingredients: watermelon, apples, onion, green bell pepper, dried basil, salt, pepper, chili powder, cider vinegar ; preparation:In a blender, puree the watermelon. Pour into a large mixing bowl. Stir in remaining ingredients. Refrigerate, covered at least 1 hour to blend flavors. This recipe serves four but can easily be doubled. ; name: southwestern salad ; ingredients: boneless skinless chicken breast, frozen corn, cheddar cheese, lettuce, salsa, taco seasoning mix, kidney bean, tortilla chips, tomatoes, ranch dressing ; preparation:Poach chicken then shred. Mix cooked corn and chicken in a bowl with taco seasoning mix. Divide lettuce, beans, tomato, corn and chicken mixture among two bowls. Top with salsa cheese and crushed chips. Top with ranch dressing if you please. You can mul. ; name: chicken curry bake ; ingredients: honey, lemon juice, curry powder, prepared mustard, onion, slivered almonds, chicken breasts, hot pepper ; preparation:Arrange chicken in a shallow pan. Mix the other ingredients and pour over chicken. Cover pan with foil. Bake at 400 degrees for 30 minutes. Add a little water if needed to bottom of the pan to prevent burning. Uncover and sprinkle almonds over chicken and baste with sauce. Bake uncovered for about 10 more minutes. Careful not to burn. ; name: braised leeks ; ingredients: leeks, garlic, carrots, olive oil ; preparation:

name: evil jungle prince with tofu ; ingredients: bird chiles, lemongrass, kaffir lime leaves, peanut oil, coconut milk, tofu, fresh basil leaves, thai fish sauce, cabbage ; preparation:Pound the peppers, lemongrass and lime leaves to a paste. Heat the oil in a skillet and add the paste. Fry until fragrant. Add the chicken or tofu and cook until chicken is cooked through. Add the basil and fish sauce to taste. Serve on thinly shredded cabbage. ; name: marlin down under ; ingredients: marlin steaks, lemon juice, olive oil, dijon mustard, fresh gingerroot, cayenne pepper, black pepper ; preparation:In a bowl, combine the lemon juice, oil, ginger, cayenne pepper and black pepper to make a marinade. Marinate the fish in the marinade for 30 minutes. Preheat your grill. Grill the fish, brushing several times with the marinade, until cooked through, about 4 to 5 minutes on each side. Serve with a fresh tomato salad. ; name: strawberry banana summer sherbet ; ingredients: strawberry, sugar, bananas, orange juice, fresh lemon juice, milk ; preparation:Roughly mash the strawberries, leaving some chunks. Stir in sugar or splenda. Mash bananas and add to strawberries. Mix well. Add orange juice and lemon juice. Stir in milk and blend well. Pour mixture evenly into 4 ice cube trays. Set trays on a cookie sheet and set in freezer. Freeze solid. When ready to serve, put sherbet cubes in fancy dessert glasses. Let set a few minutes to thaw slightly. ; name: peanut butter chocolate stars ; ingredients: cookie mix, peanut butter, vanilla, egg, chocolate star ; preparation:Dip measuring cup omto mix and level off. Allow to come to room temperature. Heat oven to 375f. In large blow, combine mix, peanut butter, vanilla and egg at low speed until well mixed and dough forms. Shape dough into 1-inch balls and place 2 inches apart on ungreased cookie sheets. Bake at 375 f for 10-15 minutes or until edges are golden brown. Immediately place 1 chocolate star in center of each cookie, pressing down lightly. Remove from cookie sheet and cool completely. ; name: martha s soft baked chocolate chip cookies ; ingredients: all-purpose flour, baking soda, baking powder, salt, dark brown sugar, unsalted butter, light corn syrup, eggs, vanilla, semi-sweet chocolate chips ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350. Whisk together flour, baking soda, baking powder and salt. In a large bowl, using an electric mixer, beat sugar, butter and corn syrup until light and fluffy. Beat in eggs and vanilla. With mixers on low, gradually add flour mixture, beating just until combined. Fold in chocolate chips. Drop dough by tablespoons onto two baking sheets, 2 inches apart. Bake until cookies are no longer shiny - 10-12 minutes. Let cool two minutes and transfer to wire rack. ; name: cheese herb tomato tart ; ingredients: pie crusts, dijon mustard, gouda cheese, swiss cheese, tomatoes, fresh herbs, salt & pepper, olive oil ; preparation:Preheat oven to 425. Roll crust to fit a tart pan with removable bottom or in a pinch, use a pie plate. Brush bottom & sides of crust with mustard. Sprinkle with cheese, top with herbs, overlap tomatoes, sprinkle tomato slices with salt and pepper, drizzle with olive oil. Bake until pastry is golden, about 30-35 minutes. Lest rest for 10 minutes before serving. Cut into wedges. Pillsbury rolled crust works beautifully. Any spicy stone ground mustard will work. I cut the tops off the tomatoes and used a melon baller to scoop out the seeds. I used both cheeses. ; name: suzie s oatmeal chocolate chip cookies ; ingredients: margarine, granulated sugar, brown sugar, eggs, water, vanilla, flour, baking soda, oatmeal, chocolate chips ; preparation:Cream the margarine and sugars. Add the eggs and mix. Add the water and vanilla, mix. Mix together the flour and baking soda and add to the mixture fold in the oatmeal and chocolate chips. Spoon on a cookie sheet and bake at 350 until they just start to turn brown, if you like them chewy. ; name: pineapple raisin broccoli salad ; ingredients: bacon, broccoli florets, cheddar cheese, pineapple tidbits, raisins, red onions, mayonnaise, sugar, vinegar ; preparation:

name: the never enough mushroom vegetarian gravy ; ingredients: olive oil, onions, garlic clove, white button mushrooms, portabella mushrooms, white wine, salt, ground black pepper, bay leaf ; preparation:Heat the oil in a 5 quart pot on medium heat. Add the onions and saute until caramelized, about 20-30 minutes, stirring and scraping the bottom of the pot occasionally. Add garlic, if using, and saute 2 minutes, or until softened. Pour in 5 cups water, bring to a boil, reduce heat and simmer 30 minutes. Blend with an immersion blender. Add the mushrooms, wine, salt, pepper, bay leaf and 2 cups water. Bring to a boil, occasionally pushing the mushrooms into the liquid. Reduce heat and simmer 45-60 minutes, or until of desired thickness. Remove bay leaf and adjust seasoning, if necessary. I also added some fresh chopped thyme before serving. ; name: dijon soy fish marinade ; ingredients: soy sauce, dijon mustard, vegetable oil, honey ; preparation:Add equal parts soy, mustard, and veg. Oil into a bowl. Put fish in a plastic bag and pour sauce over fish. Marinate in the refrigerator for one hour. Cook on the stove, oven, or grill. ; name: crockpot sweet sour chicken ; ingredients: chicken breasts, pineapple tidbits, onion, red bell pepper, green bell pepper, soy sauce, thai sweet chili sauce, chicken broth, cornstarch, cold water ; preparation:Place the frozen chicken in the crockpot and dump the pineapple on top. Scatter the chopped vegetables over the chicken and pineapple. Whisk together the soy sauce, thai sweet chili sauce, and the chicken broth, then pour over all. Cover and cook for 6 hours on low. Remove chicken to cutting board and cut into slices or cubes. Return chicken to pot. Whisk together the cold water and the cornstarch until smooth, then stir into the pot. Cover and continue to cook on low for at least 1 hour. Serve over hot cooked rice. ; name: southern green beans ham potatoes ; ingredients: ham hock, bacon, onions, salt, sugar, garlic, cayenne pepper, parsley, fresh green beans, potato ; preparation:Place ham hock and bacon in large dutch oven pot or soup pot. Cover with water. Bring to a rapid boil. Turn burner to medium to medium-high and let it come to a medium boil. Add the sliced onion. Let this cook while you wash and snap your beans. Wash beans, cut off ends and break in half. Add beans, salt, sugar, garlic, pepper and parsley to the ham hocks. Let it come to a boil, then turn burner to medium, to medium-low. Let it slow boil for about an hour or more or less, depending on how well you like your beans cooked. About 15-20 minutes before done, add your potatoes. Boil until tender. ; name: all in one breakfast ; ingredients: english muffins, bulk pork sausage, eggs, sour cream, diced green chilies, cheddar cheese ; preparation:In the bottom of a greased 3 quart rectangular baking dish, arrange muffin halves in the bottom. Overlap muffins as neccesary to make them fit well. Set aside. Using a large skillet, cook sausage until brown, drain. In a large bowl whisk the eggs. Add sausage, sour cream, and chilies and mix until well combined. Pour egg mixture over the muffins and press lightly to thoroughly moisten the muffins. Sprinkle with cheese, cover with plastic wrap, and refrigerate overnight. Bake in a 375 degree oven uncovered for 35 to 40 minutes or until set. Let stand for 10 minutes before serving. Prep and cook time does not include chilling time. ; name: blackberry liqueur ; ingredients: water, vodka, white sugar, blackberries ; preparation:Shake together the water, vodka and sugar to dissolve sugar. Gently mix together with the blackberries, taking care not to cut or crush the berries. Leave to infuse about 10-12 days until the berries have lost most of their color. Pour thru a fine strainer and discard the berries. Pour into decorative bottles. ; name: cheesy stove top macaroni and cheese ; ingredients: butter, flour, milk, parmesan cheese, colby-monterey jack cheese, sharp cheddar cheese, dry mustard, pepper, salt, cooked macaroni ; preparation:Start cooking the macaroni while you prepare the sauce to save time. Melt butter in a medium sauce pan. Whisk in flour. On medium-high heat, whisk in milk a little at a time. Continue to whisk til thick and bubbly. Do not allow to burn, turn down heat if sauce is cooking to fast to keep from burning. Whisk in mustard, salt and pepper. Reduce to medium heat, stir in cheeses. When melted and blended pour over cooked and drained macaroni. Taste, add more salt if needed. Mix and cook 1 or 2 minutes on medium heat. Serve. ; name: mexican coffee balls ; ingredients: chocolate wafers, blanched almond, unsweetened cocoa powder, white sugar, instant coffee, coffee liqueur, light corn syrup, cinnamon sugar ; preparation:

name: skillet chicken parmesan ; ingredients: parmesan cheese, pasta sauce, olive oil, boneless skinless chicken breast halves, part-skim mozzarella cheese ; preparation:Stir 3 tablespoons parmesan cheese into pasta sauce. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add chicken. Cook 10 min or until brown. Pour sauce mixture over chicken. Cover and cook on medium heat 10 minutes or until chicken is no longer pink. Top with mozzarella and remaining parmesan. Let stand 5 minutes or until cheese melts. ; name: pollo fra diavolo ; ingredients: chicken, olive oil, garlic cloves, onions, italian tomatoes, dry white wine, parsley, ground pepper, dried red pepper ; preparation:Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. Heat the oil in a large skillet and brown the chicken pieces on all sides for about 15 minutes. Remove the chicken to a large casserole. In the same oil saute the garlic and onions until golden, then stir in the tomatoes, white wine, chopped parsley, salt, and a little black and red pepper. Simmer over low heat for about 10 minutes, then pour over the chicken in the casserole. Now cover and place the casserole in the oven for 1 hour. While the chicken cooks, prepare whatever pasta you desire and serve with the chicken peices and sauce poured over. ; name: rich topping for steaks or veal ; ingredients: cheddar cheese, tomato ketchup, sour cream, tabasco sauce, black pepper, grainy mustard, worcestershire sauce, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Mix first 7 ingredients with a fork. Roast or grill meat until nearly done as you like it. Spread the cheese mixture over each portion of meat. Sprinkle over the parmesan. Grill carefully -- watching -- until the cheese melts. Serve immediately on warmed plates. ; name: king and prince oatmeal raisin muffins ; ingredients: rolled oats, buttermilk, eggs, brown sugar, butter, flour, baking powder, salt, baking soda, raisins ; preparation:Fill muffin tins with paper baking cups. Combine oats and buttermilk in a bowl, let stand for 1 hour. Add eggs, sugar and butter, mix 30 seconds, scrape down bowl. Combine dry ingredients, add. Add raisins. Mix on low speed for about 15 seconds or only until dry ingredients are moistened. Fill muffin cups half full. Bake at 400 degrees for 15-20 minutes. ; name: balsamic bean dip with fresh veggies ; ingredients: white kidney beans, olive oil, balsamic vinegar, oil, assorted crudites, pita bread ; preparation:Puree beans, olive oil, and 1 tablespoon vinegar in processor until smooth. Season with salt and pepper. Transfer to bowl. Drizzle with tomato oil and a few drops of vinegar. Serve with crudits and pita wedges. ; name: mashed chipotle sweet potatoes ; ingredients: sweet potatoes, butter, chicken stock, brown sugar, chipotle chile in adobo, adobo sauce, salt, fresh ground black pepper ; preparation:Place the prepared potatoes in a large saucepan with cold water and bring to a boil. Once boiling add a touch of salt and cook until tender, about 10 minutes. Drain the potatoes and return to saucepan, add 2 tablespoons butter, chicken stock, brown sugar, chipotle pepper and adobo sauce. Mash the potatoes until combined, i like to leave them slightly lumpy. Season with salt and black pepper and serve. ; name: cinnamon crusted coffee cake ; ingredients: yellow cake mix, eggs, oil, brewed decaffeinated coffee, brown sugar, cinnamon, shredded coconut, walnut pieces ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Beat cake mix with eggs, oil and coffee in large bowl with electric mixer on medium speed until well blended. Pour evenly into 2 greased round cake pans. Mix brown sugar and cinnamon in medium bowl. Stir in coconut and walnuts. Sprinkle evenly over cake batter. Bake 30 minutes. Cool completely on wire racks before removing cake layers from pans. ; name: pull apart monkey bread ; ingredients: refrigerated biscuits, butter, sugar, cinnamon, nuts ; preparation:

name: linguini alfredo ; ingredients: butter, heavy cream, garlic cloves, romano cheese, dried parsley flakes, dried basil, salt and pepper, linguine ; preparation:Cook linguini as directed on box. While noodles cook heat butter and garlic in small saucepan over medium heat until butter is melted and garlic is browned. Add cream and heat until bubbling. Add cheese, parsley, basil, salt and pepper. Return drained noodles to kettle. Pour sauce over noodles, stirring gently until all are well coated. ; name: hausfreunde friends of the house cookies ; ingredients: eggs, sugar, baking chocolate, almonds, raisins, flour, baking powder, milk, powdered sugar ; preparation:Preheat oven to 300 degrees. Beat the eggs with the sugar till foamy. Add the remaining ingredients one by one, ending with the flour and baking powder together. Spread dough into a large greased 11 inch baking pan. Bake for 28-32 minutes. The top should look dry and crusty with some nice cracks. When done, ice with a mixture of milk and powdered sugar. Let cool 2 hours or more and cut into small squares. Stored in a cookie tin and refrigerated, these bars keep for quite a while. ; name: salmon fusilli salad ; ingredients: tri-colored fusilli, miracle whip, dried dill weed, dried onion flakes, chives, sweet red pepper, lime juice, salt, fresh ground pepper, sockeye salmon ; preparation:Cook pasta in salted boiling water till al-dente. Rinse in cool water and set aside to drain. In the meantime, mix together miracle whip, dill, onion flakes, chives, red pepper, lime juice, salt and pepper. Add the dressing mixture to the pasta and mix thoroughly. Gently fold in the salmon. Cover and chill for 2 hours before serving. ; name: hungarian goulash with caraway and sour cream ; ingredients: side bacon, onions, sweet hungarian paprika, caraway seed, round steaks, tomatoes, salt and pepper, potatoes, sour cream ; preparation:Cook bacon until crisp, then crumble and set aside. Add onions to skillet and brown on medium low in drippings. Stir in paprika and caraway seed. Cook for 10 to 15 seconds, stirring. Add meat. Stir to coat evenly withpaprika. Add 2 cups of the tomatoes, cover and simmer for 1 hour, until meat is almost tender. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Add potato and cook 25 minutes more, until potatoes and meat are both tender. Stir in reserved tomatoes and heat thru. Sprinkle with reserved bacon and serve with sour cream if desired. ; name: easy cheddar bay biscuits like red lobster ; ingredients: bisquick baking mix, old bay seasoning, milk, cheddar cheese, butter, garlic powder, parsley flakes ; preparation:Combine bisquick, milk, first old bay seasoning, and cheese. Beat with a wooden spoon for about 30 seconds. Spoon onto a lightly greased cookie sheet. Bake in oven at 450 degrees for 8 to 12 minutes. Melt butter. Add garlic powder, parsley and last old bay seasoning to melted butter. Brush on hot buscuits. May use more or less seasoning for taste. ; name: pork scaloppine 6 weight watchers points ; ingredients: unsalted butter, olive oil, pork loin, kosher salt, fresh ground black pepper, reduced-sodium fat-free chicken broth, fresh lemon juice, lemon zest ; preparation:Heat the butter and oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Season the 10 pork cutlets with 2 tsp of the salt and pepper. Cook the cutlets until lightly browned and cooked through, about 1 min per side or until tender. Remove from pan. Set aside 4 cutlets and keep warm, and save the other 6 for another meal. Add the chicken broth to the pan and simmer, scraping up the brown bits with a wooden spoon until slightly thickened, about minutes. Remove from heat and stir in the lemon juice and the remaining salt. Drizzle the meat with the pan juices and sprinkle with the zest. Serve with lemon asparagus. ; name: spicy mushroom rice ; ingredients: mushroom, rice, ghee, garlic, peppercorn, cumin, turmeric, coriander ; preparation:Put oil or ghee or butter. Saute garlic fry til turns dark. Add pepper and cumin. Add mushrooms. And salt. Til mushroom cooked. Add rice cook on low 5 minutes. Til liquid from mushrooms is absorbed. ; name: browned kohlrabi karalabe fozelek ; ingredients: kohlrabi, butter, salt, sugar, parsley, flour, chicken broth ; preparation:

name: spicy grilled steak ; ingredients: dry red wine, onion, chili powder, prepared horseradish, ground red pepper, poblano chile, garlic, top sirloin steaks ; preparation:Combine all ingredients except steak in a large resealable plastic bag, mix well. Add steak, turn to coat. Seal bag and refrigerate for 8 hours or overnight. When ready to grill, remove steak from marinade, reserving the marinade. Grill steak to desired doneness. Meanwhile, in medium saucepan bring reserved marinade to a boil. Reduce heat and cook 5 to 8 minutes or until slightly thickened. Serve grilled steak with hot marinade. ; name: syrniki with potato ; ingredients: cottage cheese, potatoes, egg, butter, sugar, flour, salt, sour cream, raisins ; preparation:First clean and peel the potatoes and boil in salted water, drain and mash. Then drain the cottage cheese, sieve to remove lumps, and mix it with the mashed potato. Beat in raw egg, salt, sugar and half the flour. Stir well to form a stiff paste. Work on a floured surface and flatten into thick pancakes about 3 inches in diameter. Coat them with flour and fry in butter on each side until golden brown. Serve hot with sour cream well chilled. ; name: quick crustless quiche ; ingredients: cheese, bacon, broccoli, onion, eggs, flour, butter, salt, milk ; preparation:If using frozen, thaw and drain thoroughly. Preheat oven to 175c. Layer 1st 4 ingredients in 10 buttered pie plate. Blend remaining ingredients and pour over layers. Bake for 35-40 minutes. ; name: cool angel cake ; ingredients: angel food cake, soft cream cheese, powdered sugar, frozen whipped topping, pie filling ; preparation:Cut the cake into 1-inch cubes and set aside. Mix together the cream cheese and powdered sugar with an electric mixer. Use a large spoon to gently mix in the topping and cake cubes. Spread into a 9 x 13 pan. Pour the pie filling on top. Cover and refrigerate for two hours or until set. For pie filling use either blueberry, cherry, or strawberry. ; name: holiday soft caramel corn ; ingredients: popped popcorn, butter, honey, sugar, vanilla, roasted almonds ; preparation:Pop all of the corn and use two large bowls to lift the popped corn from one bowl to the next. On medium high, melt the butter, honey and sugar together, creating a smooth caramel. Simmer on a steady boil until the mixture no longer has a granular sugar texture. An easy way to test this is place cold water in a small bowl and drip a bit of the boiling caramel in the bowl. This will cool off the caramel and allow you to test by tasting. Once the caramel is ready, remove from the heat and add the 1 t vanilla. Whisk together until fully combined. Sprinkle the roasted almonds over the popped popcorn and evenly drizzle the caramel over the top. Quickly toss the caramel corn to coat and then pour out on a greased tabletop. Allow caramel corn to cool before packaging. ; name: monte cristo grinder ; ingredients: ham, turkey, green bell pepper, minced garlic clove, olive oil, maui onion, tomatoes, french bread, swiss cheese, dried oregano leaves ; preparation:Heat oven to 350f. In skillet, over medium-high heat, saute bell peppers and onions and garlic in oil until bell pepper is crisp-tender. Remove bell pepper and onion from skillet, reserving oil mixture. Layer the ham, smoked turkey, tomato, bell pepper and onion on the bottom half of french bread. Drizzle the oil mixture over the top. Sprinkle with oregano. Top with cheese and remaining half of bread. Wrap loaf in foil. Bake 25 minutes or until cheese is melted. ; name: all in one tuna casserole ; ingredients: onion soup mix, milk, frozen peas and carrot, egg noodles, tuna, cheddar cheese, cream of mushroom soup ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. In large bowl, blend onion soup mix with cream of mushroom soup and milk. Stir in peas & carrots, cooked noodles, cheese and tuna. Turn into greased 2-quart baking dish. Bake 30 minutes or until bubbling. ; name: scottish whipped shortbread ; ingredients: salted butter, icing sugar, cornstarch, flour, vanilla extract ; preparation:

name: peanut puffs ; ingredients: margarine, sugar, peanuts, vanilla extract, flour, powdered sugar ; preparation:Preheat the oven to 325. Grease a baking sheet with cooking oil spray or a small amount of margarine. Cream margarine and sugar in medium mixing bowl. Add peanuts, vanilla & flour, mix well. Using your fingers roll dough into small balls about 1 inch across. Place the balls on the greased baking sheet. Bake for 35 minuites. Remove from the oven. While still warm roll puffs in the powdered sugar. Roll in the sugar again when puffs are cool. ; name: jamie oliver s yorkshire puddings ; ingredients: eggs, plain flour, sea salt, milk, vegetable oil ; preparation:Whisk the eggs, flour, salt, and milk together really well in a bowl to make your batter. Pour the batter into a jug, and let it sit for 30 minutes before you use it. Turn your oven up to the highest setting, and place a 12 cup muffin tray in the oven to heat up for 5 minutes. Place 1 tb of oil in each muffin hole, and put the tray back into the oven and heat until oil is very hot. Open oven door, slide the tray half out, and carefully pour the batter into the muffin holes. Close the door and cook for 15 minutes without opening the oven door. Serve immediately. ; name: grilled caesar chicken breasts ; ingredients: caesar salad dressing, olive oil, dijon mustard, garlic cloves, boneless skinless chicken breast halves ; preparation:In a large resealable plastic bag, combine the dressing, oil, mustard and garlic. Add the chicken. Seal bag and turn to coat. Refrigerate for 8 hours or overnight. Drain and discard marinade. Grill chicken, covered, over medium heat or broil 4 inches from the heat for 6-8 minutes on each side or until a meat thermometer reads 170. ; name: peach jam ; ingredients: peaches, bottled lemon juice, sugar, nutmeg ; preparation:Prepare peaches by peeling, pitting, and cutting into quarters. Chop in a food processor or cut into small pieces. Put the peaches, lemon juice, sugar, and nutmeg in a saucepan over medium heat, stirring to dissolve all the sugar. Boil rapidly and stir constantly until the jam is thick or has reached the jell point on a thermometer. Remove from heat and let stand 5 minutes. Skim off any foam. Ladle into hot jars. Clean the rims, seal, and process in hot water bath for 10 minutes. ; name: authentic swiss fondue ; ingredients: garlic, white wine, lemon, juice of, emmenthaler cheese, gruyere cheese, cornflour, kirsch, pepper, nutmeg ; preparation:Rub the inside of a flameproof dish with the garlic, add the wine and lemon juice. Place dish over a gentle heat and warm. Add the cheese and stir mixture until the cheese has melted and is beginning to cook. Blend the cornflour to a smooth cream with the kirsch and add to mixture with seasoning. Continue to cook for a further 3 minutes or until mixture is of a thick consistency. Serve immediately with warm bread and potatoes. ; name: no peeking stewed potatoes ; ingredients: white potatoes, bacon grease, onion, salt, pepper, water ; preparation:Place all the ingredients in the crock pot in exact order given. Cover and cook about 3 hours. Remove lid and cook longer if less juice is desired. Potatoes may be left unattended for 5 to 6 hrs on low. Adjust salt to taste. ; name: pork chops with tangy creole mustard pineapple sauce ; ingredients: olive oil, pork chops, salt, pepper, chicken broth, pineapple preserves, creole mustard, cider vinegar, tabasco sauce, light brown sugar ; preparation:In a large skillet over medium heat, heat the olive oil. Sprinkle pork chops with salt and pepper and add to the skillet. Cook the chops, turning, until well browned. Add the chicken broth. Cover and continue cooking for 10 minutes. Meanwhile, combine remaining ingredients. Add the sauce to the pork chops, turning to coat well. Cook the chops, uncovered, for 15 minutes longer, turning occasionally. ; name: apple cider glazed carrots ; ingredients: butter, carrot, apple cider, brown sugar, tarragon, salt, pepper ; preparation:

name: tuna glazed with ginger and lime ; ingredients: tuna steaks, garlic cloves, ginger, sugar, crushed red pepper flakes, fresh lime juice, soy sauce, dark sesame oil ; preparation:Place steaks in a large shallow dish. Combine garlic and remaining ingredients in a small bowl. Stir well. Pour marinade mixture over tuna steaks. Cover and marinate in the refrigerator for 1 hour, turning once. Remove steaks from the marinade, reserving marinade. Bring marinade to a boil in a small saucepan. Grill tuna steaks, covered, over medium hot coals about 20 minutes or until fish flakes easily. Baste often with marinade. ; name: ham and asparagus pasta ; ingredients: corkscrew macaroni, fresh asparagus, cooked ham, cream cheese with chives, milk ; preparation:Cook pasta according to directions. Add asparagus and ham or chicken to the pasta during the last 5 minutes of cooking. Drain. Return to pan. In a 2 cup measurer. Stir cream cheese into milk. Add mixture to pasta and stir gently over medium heat until heated through. ; name: pecan brie tarts ; ingredients: prepared tart shells, brie cheese, pecans, brown sugar, whiskey ; preparation:Bake tart shells blind, or if bought according to directions on package. Divide brie into 24 wedges and place in baked tart shells. In a saucepan, heat pecans, sugar and whiskey over medium heat, stirring until bubbly. Reduce heat and simmer for 1 minutes or until thickened. Working quickly, spoon pecan mixture over brie. Bake in 375f oven for 10 minutes or until hot and bubbly. ; name: fresh and sun dried tomato salad with parmesan ; ingredients: tomatoes, salt, fresh ground black pepper, sun-dried tomato packed in oil, balsamic vinegar, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Arrange the tomatoes in a single layer on 4 salad plates. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Scatter the sun-dried tomatoes over the fresh tomato slices. Drizzle with oil and vinegar. Use a vegetable peeler to shave the cheese over the salad. ; name: grilled soy honey glazed chicken breasts ; ingredients: chicken breasts, scallion, garlic, honey, dry sherry, fresh ginger, soy sauce ; preparation:Combine scallions, garlic, honey, sherry, ginger and soy sauce. Place chicken in a resealable plastic bag and pour the sauce over the chicken. Close the bag and marinate at room temperature for 30 minutes to 1 hour. Or, refrigerate it overnight. Turn occasionally to keep sauce distributed evenly on the chicken. Remove chicken from bag and pour sauce into a small saucepan. Bring sauce to a boil and let boil for one full minute. Grill chicken over hot coals, turning as needed to prevent charring and to cook evenly. Grill until just done, about 25 minutes. Brush with sauce as needed to keep moist. Serve chicken with remaining sauce and hot cooked rice. ; name: cheesy bacon and vegetable slice ; ingredients: vegetable oil, bacon, onion, garlic, zucchini, carrots, self-raising flour, eggs, cheese, chili sauce ; preparation:Grease a 19cm square cake pan, line base with baking paper. Heat oil in large pan, add bacon, onion and garlic, cook, stirring until onion is soft. Add vegetables and cook, stirring, about 5 mins or until any liquid is evaporated. Cool. Combine vegetable mixture with sifted flour and remaining ingredients in a medium bowl. Mix well. Spread mixture into prepared pan. Bake in moderate oven for about 30 mins or until firm. ; name: trio of t s salad tuna tomato and tarragon ; ingredients: red onion, light mayonnaise, kosher salt, salt & freshly ground black pepper, chunk light tuna, celery, fresh tarragon leaves, lettuce, fresh tomato, lemon ; preparation:Place onion in a small bowl and cover with cold water. Refrigerate for 20 minutes. Drain. Whisk mayonnaise, salt and pepper in a medium bowl. Add tuna, celery, tarragon and the drained onion. Stir to combine. Serve on a bed of lettuce with tomato and lemon wedges. ; name: broccoli and green bean polka ; ingredients: head of broccoli, french beans, olive oil, unsalted cashews, almonds, sea salt ; preparation:

name: oven baked beef or pork steak with tangy sauce ; ingredients: round steaks, salt and pepper, onions, fresh garlic, barbecue sauce, low sodium soy sauce, brown sugar ; preparation:Set oven to 350 degrees f. Grease a roasting pan or baking dish. Heat oil in a large skillet. Season the beef or pork steak with with salt and pepper, then brown on both sides. Place into the prepared pan and top with the onion slices. In a bowl mix the bbq sauce, soy sauce and garlic then pour over meat in the pan. Cover tightly with foil then make a couple of slits in the foil with a sharp knife to allow steam to escape. Cook until meat is fork-tender, about 1 hour. ; name: simply sweet and sour red cabbage ; ingredients: butter, red cabbage, sugar, balsamic vinegar, salt & pepper, fresh parsley ; preparation:Melt butter in a large pot. Over medium heat add 4 cups of cabbage and stir 1 minute. Add remaining cabbage, 4 cups at a time, and stir until cabbage is wilted. Mix sugar and vinegar, then add to cabbage and mix well. Cover and simmer over low heat, stirring occasionally for 30 minutes. Season to taste and stir in parsley before serving. ; name: garlic and kale soup ; ingredients: wheat berries, olive oil, shiitake mushrooms, garlic cloves, white wine, vegetable broth, water, kale, salt and pepper ; preparation:Soak wheat berries in large bowl of cold water overnight. Heat oil in 2 qt saucepan over medium heat. Add mushrooms, and season with salt, if desired. Saute mushrooms 10 minutes or until beginning to brown. Add garlic and saute 2 minutes more. Sir in white wine and simmer until vinegar is almost evaporated, stirring to scrape up browned bits from pan. Drain wheat berries and add to mushroom mixture with vegetable broth and water. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to medium-low and simmer 20 minutes. Add kale, and cook 10-20 minutes more, or until kale is tender. Season with salt and pepper, if desired. ; name: chunky strawberry lemonade ; ingredients: lemons, lime, strawberry, sugar, cold water ; preparation:Rinse and hull strawberries, put in bowl and sprinkle with the 2 t. Sugar, set aside. Squeeze the lemons and limes into large bowl or gallon jar. Add the 2 cups sugar and half the water. Stir until sugar is disolved, add the remaining water. With a potato masher or fork, mash the strawberries, but leave semi chunky. Add to lemonade, stir well. ; name: green chilie squash casserole ; ingredients: eggs, vegetable oil, biscuit mix, green chilies, onion, garlic clove, cheddar cheese, zucchini ; preparation:Combine eggs, oil, and biscuit mix. Stir in chillies, onion, garlic and half of the cheese. Stir in squash. Pour into a greased 9x13 inch baking dish. Bake at 350 degrees for 40 minutes. Sprinkle with remaining cheese and bake 5 minutes more. ; name: teisen sinamon welsh cinnamon cake ; ingredients: flour, sugar, caster sugar, butter, egg yolks, egg whites, baking powder, cinnamon, jam, milk ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400f. Sieve the flour and baking powder and rub in the butter. Add the spice and sugar, then he egg yolks and a little milk to bind to a farily stiff sponge. Turn into a shallow, well greased tin or plate - preferably a dish you can serve it in as the base is best left where it is. Bake for about 20 minutes at 400f. Cool an spread with jam. For the meringue topping, beat the egg whites until stiff, fold in 1 tablespoon caster sugar for each white and beat again in the usual way until shiny. Pile on top of the base and return to a cooler oven to set and until the peaks are. ; name: chicken biscuit bake ; ingredients: condensed cream of chicken soup, milk, dried thyme leaves, pepper, cooked chicken, frozen broccoli carrots cauliflower mix, refrigerated buttermilk biscuits ; preparation:Heat oven to 350 degrees f. In 4 quart saucepan, heat soup, milk, thyme, pepper, chicken and vegetables to boiling over med-high heat, stirring occasionally. Boil and stir 3-5 minutes. Spread in ungreased 13x9-inch glass baking dish. Seperate dough into 8 biscuits. Place evenly over hot chicken mixture. Bake 35-40 minutes or until biscuits are golden brown and no longer doughy on bottom. After 20 minutes, cover with foil if necessary to prevent excessive browning. ; name: easy homemade cookie ice cream paula deen ; ingredients: egg yolks, condensed milk, vanilla extract, chocolate sandwich style cookies, heavy cream ; preparation:

name: irish oatmeal ; ingredients: water, salt, butter, rolled oats, light corn syrup, brandy, raisins, cream, light brown sugar, fresh fruit ; preparation:In a saucepan, heat corn syrup and brandy over medium heat. Bring to a simmer. Add raisins and simmer 3 to 5 minutes. Set aside to cool. In a saucepan, add water and salt. Bring to a boil. Add butter and oats. Lower heat and simmer until oats are tender, about 6 to 10 minutes. Place 2 tablespoons of cream and 1 tablespoon of brown sugar, and 1 tablespoon of drained raisins in 4 bowls. Add steaming cooked oats and top with fresh berries. Each person stirs their bowl to enjoy the hidden surprise waiting underneath. ; name: orange shortbread ; ingredients: unsalted butter, superfine sugar, orange zest, salt, all-purpose flour, coarse sugar ; preparation:Preheat oven to 375f. Blend together butter, superfine sugar, zest, and salt in a bowl with a fork. Sift flour into butter mixture and blend with fork until mixture forms a soft dough. Transfer dough to an ungreased large baking sheet and pat into a 10- by 5-inch rectangle. Prick dough all over with fork and sprinkle with coarse sugar, pressing it gently into dough with your finger. Score dough crosswise with back of a knife into 6 rectangles, then score each rectangle into 2 triangles. Bake shortbread in middle of oven until edges are golden but center is pale, 12 to 17 minutes. Cool on baking sheet on a rack 10 minutes, then cut into 12 triangles along scored lines while still warm. Transfer triangles with a long spatula to a rack to cool completely. Shortbread keeps 1 week. ; name: hot pizza sub sandwich ; ingredients: italian bread, pizza sauce, italian seasoning, green pepper, deli ham, salami, pepperoni, cheddar cheese, mozzarella cheese, american cheese ; preparation:Slice bread in half horizontally. Spread bottom half with pizza sauce, sprinkle with seasoning. Top with green pepper, ham, salami, pepperoni. And cheeses, replace bread top. Place on baking sheet. Bake 425 degrees for 12-15 minutes or until cheese is melted. If cooking on open grill-wrap in foil. If cooking on gas grill covered doesnt need foil. ; name: easy baked custard ; ingredients: sugar, all-purpose flour, vanilla extract, salt, milk, eggs, margarine ; preparation:Preheat oven 350 f. Combine all ingredients in a blender. Blend until smooth. Pour into a buttered 9-in. Deep-dish pie or cake pan. Bake at for 50 minutes or until a knife inserted near the center comes out clean. Cool on a wire rack until room temperature. Refrigerate until serving. ; name: old fashioned blueberry muffins ; ingredients: flour, sugar, baking powder, salt, frozen blueberries, eggs, milk, canola oil ; preparation:In a large bowl combine flour, sugar, baking powder and salt. Stir in blueberries until coated with flour. Put eggs in 4 cup glas measuring cup and add enough milk to measure 2 cups. Add oil and whisk until blended. Make well in center of flour mixture and pour milk mixture. With large spatula, gently fold dry ingredients into wet ingredients just until moistened. Spoon into greased muffin pan. 400f for 30 minutes or until tops are firm to the touch. ; name: boat shrimp ; ingredients: butter, shrimp, onion, garlic salt, salt, basil, flour, vinegar ; preparation:Grab a cast iron pan. Set it on the stove. Melt butter on medium-high heat. Add shrimp and onion. Stir while cooking until shrimp are coated. Sprinkle on spices to taste. Sprinkle on flour. Turn and coat shrimp. Add enough water to make gravy. Add vinegar. Serve over rice. ; name: grilled balsamic london broil ; ingredients: top round steak, olive oil, balsamic vinegar, gluten-free soy sauce, dried thyme, garlic powder, black pepper ; preparation:Put all ingredients, except meat, in a container fitted with a lid. Cover and shake. Pour the marinade over the top round steak and cover. Marinate in the refrigerator for 4 hours or overnight, turning the meat occasionally. Grill or broil until done as desired. Slice thinly. ; name: french silk pie ; ingredients: butter, sugar, cocoa, extra-large eggs, salt, graham cracker crust, whipped cream, nuts, chocolate curls ; preparation:

name: pumpkin garlic soup ; ingredients: chicken stock, pumpkin, garlic cloves, dry white wine, butter, heavy cream, salt & pepper, dried mustard, worcestershire sauce ; preparation:Melt butter in pot and cook garlic. Pour in pumpkin. Stir in chicken stock until smooth. Add dried mustard and worcestershire sauce if desired. Cook for approximately 20 minutes. Add white wine. Stir in heavy cream in the last 1-2 minutes and cook only until warmed through. Season to taste. ; name: chocolate chewy cookies ; ingredients: butter, sugar, eggs, vanilla, unsifted flour, cocoa powder, baking soda, salt, chocolate chips ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350f. In a bowl, combine flour, cocoa powder, baking soda and salt. Set aside. In a large mixing bowl, cream butter and sugar. Add eggs and vanilla, mix well. Gradually beat in the flour mixture then add chocolate chips. Drop the dough by rounded tablespoonfuls onto greased baking sheets. Bake 10-12 minutes. Let cookies rest on baking sheets for 2 minutes before removing with a spatula to wire racks to cool completely. ; name: ww 4 points grilled mushroom sausage pizza ; ingredients: prepared pizza crust, yellow tomatoes, wild mushrooms, red onion, chicken sausage, mozzarella cheese, fresh basil leaf ; preparation:Spray the grill rack with nonstick spray and set to medium-high fire. Place the crust on a pizza paddle or rimless baking sheet. Layer with the tomato slices, mushrooms, onions, chicken sausage, and mozzarella. Using the paddle or baking sheet, slide the pizza onto the grill, away from the heat source. Cover and cook, rotating the pizza a half turn after 8 minutes, until it is hot and cheese is melted. Garnish with basil before serving. 4 points per serving. ; name: no pudge brownie clone ; ingredients: sugar, flour, cocoa, egg whites, cornstarch, baking soda, salt, non-fat vanilla yogurt, nonstick cooking spray ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350f. Mix all dry ingredients. Add yogurt and mix well. Batter will be very thick. Spray an 8x8 pan with nonstick cooking spray. Spread batter evenly. Bake for 30-35 minutes. Remove and cool. Dip a knife in warm water and cut into 16 squares. ; name: kim s midnight brownie recipe as seen on dr oz ; ingredients: black beans, agave nectar, self-rising flour, egg white, unsweetened cocoa, vanilla, baking powder, chocolate chips ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350. Lightly spray a 8x8 baking dish with nonstick cooking spray. In a food processor, or blender, mix all brownie ingredients together. Chop on high, until smooth. Clean off sides and blend for another 20 seconds. Add the chips in and stir well. Spread into the 8x8 baking dish. Cook for 20 minutes, until toothpick comes out clean. Cool for about 1 hour in dish at room temperature. ; name: asian prawn brochette ; ingredients: prawns, garlic, ginger, teriyaki sauce, hoisin sauce, lime, juice of, sesame oil, cilantro, lime ; preparation:Peel the prawns and marinate them with the garlic, ginger, teriaki, hoisin & lime juice, covered, in the fridge for apprx 2 hours. Just before bbq and heat. Use 2 parallel wooden skewers for each brochette. Baste the prawns with the sesame seed oil. Place a quarter wedge of lime on the end of each brochette. Bbq or broil for apprx 5 minutes each side, the time depends on the size of the prawn. Do not over cook they are done when they turn pink to serve garnish with the cilantro. ; name: egg noodles ; ingredients: white flour, egg, egg yolks, salt, vegetable oil, water ; preparation:In a large bowl combine flour and salt. Make a well. Mix together the wet ingredients and pour into well. Mix well. Turn out onto a floured board and knead until firm, shiny and elastic. At this point cover and chill for 1 hour, up to 24 hours. When ready to use follow instructions for manual pasta machine or cut into manageable pieces and roll out to desired thickness, cut into desired shape. ; name: salmon braised in coconut milk ; ingredients: unsweetened coconut milk, orange juice, orange zest, thai fish sauce, asian chili sauce, garlic clove, fresh ginger, of fresh mint, fresh cilantro stems, salmon fillets ; preparation:

name: my real pumpkin pie ; ingredients: pie crusts, eggs, pumpkin, sugar, salt, cinnamon, ginger, ground cloves, sweetened condensed milk, evaporated milk ; preparation:Combine the eggs, pumpkin, sugar, salt, cinnamon, ginger, cloves and milk. Mix well and pour into prepared pie crusts. Bake in a 425f oven for 15 minutes. Reduce temperature to 350f and bake an additional 50-60 minutes or until the center of the pie is no longer wobbly or liquid. Cool and serve with whipped topping or vanilla ice cream. ; name: chocolate covered malt ball fudge slice ; ingredients: self raising flour, cocoa powder, malted milk balls, eggs, sugar, vegetable oil, low-fat vanilla yogurt, icing sugar ; preparation:Preheat the oven to 180c. Coat a lamington tin with cooking spray. Sift the flour and cocoa powder into a large bowl. Stir in the chocolate covered malt balls. Combine the eggs, sugar, oil and yogurt and fold into the flour mixture. Spread into the prepared tin and bake for 30 minutes or until firm to touch. Cool in the pan. Cut into 16 pieces. Dust with icing sugar or cocoa. ; name: mushroom barley casserole ; ingredients: onion, butter, fresh mushrooms, garlic cloves, water, barley, onion and mushroom soup mix, dried thyme, salt ; preparation:In a large skillet, cook onion in hot, melted butter over med heat until tender. Add in mushrooms and garlic. Cook about 5 minutes or until mushrooms are tender, stirring occasionally. Transfer mixture to a greased 3-quart baking dish. Stir in the water, barley, dry soup mix, thyme, and salt. Bake, covered, at 350 for about 1 hour and 15 minutes or until barley is tender and most of the liquid is absorbed, stirring once or twice. Let stand, covered, for 15 minutes before serving. ; name: madras sweet potatoes ; ingredients: sweet potatoes, butter, madras curry powder, salt, honey ; preparation:Chop sweet potatoes into 1 inch squares. Steam in steamer basket over medium-low heat for about 20 minutes or until fork tender. Place in bowl and mash with butter until almost smooth. Add salt and curry powder. Continue to mash until blended. Add honey to sweeten to your liking. ; name: wilted greens with garlic and balsamic vinegar ; ingredients: swiss chard, extra virgin olive oil, balsamic vinegar, garlic cloves, red pepper flakes, salt, black pepper ; preparation:Cut the greens into strips 1 inch wide. In a large saute pan over medium-high heat, warm the olive oil. Add the greens and using tongs, toss them until they are wilted but still retain their bright colour, about 3-4 minutes. Add the vinegar, garlic, red pepper flakes, salt and black pepper to taste and toss well. Transfer to a warmed serving bowl and serve immediately. ; name: passionfruit saucing pudding ; ingredients: butter, caster sugar, egg, self raising flour, milk, passionfruit syrup, boiling water ; preparation:In a bowl, cream the butter and sugar, add the egg and beat well, and stir in the flour and milk. Pour the mixture evenly into a greased 6-8 cup casserole dish. Combine the passionfruit syrup, water and melted butter together, and pour over the pudding mixture. Bake in a preheated oven at 180c for 30 minutes. Serve hot with cream or ice cream. ; name: krispie candies ; ingredients: chocolate chips, butterscotch chips, chow mein noodles, salted peanuts ; preparation:Put chocolate chips and butterscotch chips in the saucepan. Put the saucepan on the burner and turn on the stove to low. Stir and stir until the mixture is melted and smooth. Remove saucepan from heat. Turn off the burner and quickly add the chow mein noodles and the peanuts. Mix and stir until they are evenly coated. Cover the cookie sheets with wax paper. Drop the candy by teaspoonfuls onto the wax paper-covered cookie sheets. Put the cookie sheets into the refrigerator to cool the candies. When they are cool, take them off the waxed paper. Put them in plastic bags. Keep them in the refrigerator. ; name: maple caramel sauce for ice cream served at 2013 obama inaugural ; ingredients: butter, light brown sugar, salt, maple syrup ; preparation:

name: spicy sweet grilled shrimp ; ingredients: guava jelly, garlic cloves, limes, juice of, worcestershire sauce, jalapeno pepper, red pepper flakes, shrimp, salt, bamboo skewers ; preparation:Soak bamboo skewers in water for at least 30 minutes. In a small saucepan combine jelly, garlic, lime juice, worcestershire, jalapeno and chilies. Cook over medium heat until jelly melts. Thread shrimp onto skewers, about 4 per skewer if using large shrimp. Brush both sides of shrimp with jelly mixture and place on a tray to marinate for 30 minutes. Preheat grill on high and sprinkle shrimp with salt on both sides. Grill shrimp for 3 minutes per side, brushing with marinade again before turning. Reduce time for smaller shrimp. Place remaining sauce in a serving dish for dipping. Prep time includes time to marinate but not to soak the skewers. ; name: quick easy tuscan bean soup ; ingredients: baby carrots, onion, olive oil, cannellini beans, reduced-sodium chicken broth, dried italian seasoning, baby spinach, cracked black pepper ; preparation:In a dutch oven, cook and stir carrots and onion in 1 tablespoon olive oil over medium-high heat 3 minutes. Add beans, broth and seasoning. Bring to boiling. Slightly mash beans. Reduce heat. Simmer, uncovered, 8 minutes, stirring occasionally. Meanwhile, in large skillet, heat remaining oil over medium-high heat. Add spinach and toss 1-2 minutes, just until wilted. Remove from heat. Ladle soup, top with the spinach and sprinkle with the pepper. ; name: baked eggs in maple toast cups ; ingredients: butter, pure maple syrup, bread, bacon, eggs, fresh ground black pepper ; preparation:Preheat the oven to 400 degrees f. Butter six muffin cups. In a small saucepan, melt the butter and add the syrup. Remove the crusts from the bread. Flatten each slice with a rolling pin. Brush both sides of each slice with the syrup mixture. Put one slice into each muffin cup and sprinkle the bacon pieces in the cups. Break an egg into each cup and bake until the eggs are set. Start checking after about 5 minutes. Lift the toast cups from the pan and serve immediately, drizzled with additional syrup, if desired. ; name: chocolate dipped krispies peanut butter balls ; ingredients: butter, chunky peanut butter, vanilla, powdered sugar, rice, paraffin wax, chocolate chips ; preparation:Melt butter and while hot, stir in peanut butter. Mix well and add vanilla, powdered sugar and rice krispies. Work in with hands until it will form balls. If using paraffin shred on a box grater then add to the chocolate in a double boil and heat till melted and combined. Dip into melted chocolate and paraffin or shortening with toothpick. Cool on waxed paper. ; name: pesto focaccia sandwiches ; ingredients: low-fat mayonnaise, pesto sauce, fresh mozzarella cheese, tomatoes ; preparation:Slice bread lengthwise into 2 halves. Combine mayo and pesto, spread on each side of bread. Add cheese and tomato. Put top piece of bread back to form sandwich. Cut into 4 wedges. ; name: spinach ham quiche ; ingredients: 9 inch pie shell, eggs, heavy whipping cream, tabasco sauce, tarragon, chicken base, fresh spinach, swiss cheese, parmesan cheese, ham ; preparation:In a large bowl combine eggs, whipping cream, tabasco, tarragon& chicken base. Whip until smooth. Arrange the pie shell in a 9 inch pie pan. Add the grated swiss cheese, spinach, ham and parmesan cheese. Pour the egg mixture over all and bake at 350 for 40-45 minutes. ; name: anise pound cake ; ingredients: flour, salt, butter, sugar, vanilla, anise seeds, eggs, sour cream ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350-degrees f. Grease and flour 10-inch tube or bundt pan. In a small bowl sift together flour and salt and then set aside. In a large mixing bowl, cream butter with sugar, vanilla and anise seed. Add eggs, one at a time, mixing well after each addition. Add dry ingredients alternately with sour cream to mixture and beat well. Pour into prepared pan. Bake for 1 hour or until cake is golden and springs back when touched with fork. ; name: breakfast casserole by loretta ; ingredients: bread, cheese, cooked sausage, eggs, milk, salt and pepper ; preparation:

name: vince gill s peanut butter fudge ; ingredients: sugar, evaporated milk, butter, peanut butter chips, marshmallow cream, peanuts, vanilla ; preparation:Butter sides of heavy 3 qt. Sausepan. Combine sugar, milk, and butter in pan and bring to a boil, stirring, over med. Heat. Cook and stir for 11 minutes. Remove pan from heat. Add chips, m. Cream, peanuts and vanilla. Stir until chips are melted. Spread in an 8x8 pan. ; name: chilli prawn linguine ; ingredients: linguine, olive oil, prawns, red chilies, garlic, flat leaf parsley, fresh lemon rind ; preparation:Cook linguine in a large pan of boiling salted water, uncovered, until just tender, drain. Meanwhile, heat the oil in a large frying pan, add the prawns, chilli and garlic and cook, stirring, until the prawns are just cooked through. Remove from the heat and stir in the parsley and lemon rind. Combine the linguine with the prawn mixture and toss gently. This is great served with a simple green salad, if desired. ; name: buffalo chicken cheese dip ; ingredients: cream cheese, ranch salad dressing, buffalo wing sauce, shredded cheddar cheese, cooked chicken ; preparation:Heat oven to 350f place cream cheese into deep dish plate and microwave 1 minute to soften. Whisk in salad dressing, wing sauce, and cheese into softened cream cheese until smooth. Stir in cooked chicken. Bake 20 mins or until mixture is heated through. Stir. Serve with crackers or veggies or whatever you like. ; name: barbecue prawn ; ingredients: king prawns, garlic, gingerroot, green chili peppers, turmeric powder, red chili powder, salt ; preparation:Clean and devein prawns. Add turmeric powder, salt, mix and set aside. Grind together green chilies, garlic, ginger, and red chili powder. Add the prawns from step 1, mix thoroughly and set aside for 30 minutes. 3barbeque in a charcoal fired grill or oven. Preheat the oven to 350 deg. Put prawns in skewers. Keep the skewers on the separator in the oven. Place a tray below the separator. Bake at 350 deg for 10 to 15 minutes. Serve hot. ; name: low cal tater tot casserole ; ingredients: ground turkey, onion, garlic, frozen tater tots, green beans, cream of celery soup, swiss cheese, salt and pepper ; preparation:Heat oven to 350 degrees. Brown ground turkey and onion with the minced garlic and salt and pepper. Add cans of celery soup and mix well. In 9 x 13 baking dish, spread tater tots on bottom. Spread green beans over tater tots. Spread turkey mixture over green beans. Sprinkle cheese over entire dish. Bake at 350 for 1 hour, or until cheese on top is melted and golden brown. ; name: absolutely best brownies ; ingredients: butter, sugar, eggs, vanilla, cocoa, salt, self-rising flour, walnuts ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees fahrenheit. Grease and flour a 9 x 9-inch pan. In a bowl, beat together the butter and sugar. Add eggs and vanilla. Mix well. Combine the cocoa, salt, and flour together. Stir into the sugar mixture. Stir in the walnuts. Spread evenly into prepared pan. Bake for 25 to 30 minutes or until firm. ; name: chicken cacciatore w shirataki noodles lower cal lower carb ; ingredients: shirataki noodles, butter, olive oil, green pepper, onion, boneless skinless chicken breast, fresh mushrooms, tomato and basil pasta sauce, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Prepare noodles according to package directions. Heat non-stick 12-inch skillet with 2-inch sides over medium high heat. Add butter and oil. Add peppers and onions and chicken and cook until soft and onions are lightly browned. Add mushrooms, cook 1- 2 minutes. Pour in sauce, mix well. Reduce heat. Cover and simmer gently 5 minutes. Spray a non-stick pan with oil, add noodles and stir-fry 1 minute until hot and dry. Place noodles on 4 warm serving plates and portion the chicken and sauce on top. Sprinkle 2 tablespoons parmesan cheese over each serving. ; name: bacon wrapped jalapeno peppers ; ingredients: jalapenos, cream cheese, bacon, toothpick ; preparation:

name: tropical pineapple salad ; ingredients: pineapple, honey, passion fruit, dark rum ; preparation:Halve the pineapple, cut away and discard the core, and scoop out the pineapple flesh. Reserve the shell. Roughly chop the flesh and toss with enough honey to sweeten. Halve the passion fruit, spoon out the pulp, and combine with the pineapple. Stir in the rum and chill for 30 minutes so the flavors marry. Spoon the fruit back into the shell and serve. ; name: creamed pearl onions ; ingredients: white pearl onions, butter, flour, milk, pepper, nutmeg ; preparation:Melt butter in a saucepan over medium heat. Add flour and stir until well blended. Add milk gradually. Reduce heat to low and cook, stirring constantly, until mixture has thickened. Drain onions and add to sauce. Season with pepper and nutmeg. Serve hot. ; name: spinach ricotta frittata ; ingredients: baby spinach leaves, green onions, button mushrooms, roasted red pepper, fresh basil, butter, eggs, ricotta cheese, parmesan cheese, salt and pepper ; preparation:Spray a non-stick 9 or 10 inch omelet pan with cooking spray. Place over medium high heat, add butter. When butter is melted add the prepared vegetables and basil. Cook stirring often just until spinach is wilted. Whisk together the eggs and ricotta cheese. Pour egg mixture over cooked vegetables, cook until almost set, lifting edges frequently to allow uncooked portions to run to bottom of pan. When almost set, reduce heat, cover and allow to cook covered for 1 to 2 minutes. Invert onto a large plate and slip back into pan to finish cooking, top with grated parmesan cheese. Cut in half and serve on warmed plates. ; name: simple banana apple bread ; ingredients: flour, baking soda, salt, sugar, eggs, vegetable oil, milk, bananas, nuts, apple ; preparation:Mix together flour, baking soda, salt, and sugar. Blend in eggs, oil, and milk. Stir in banana, apple, and nuts. Pour batter into greased loaf pan. Bake at 350 degrees for about 1 hour or until toothpick test comes out clean. ; name: lazy mini okonomiyaki ; ingredients: cabbage, flour, dashi, sake, light soy sauce, eggs, green onions, ham, oil, mayonnaise ; preparation:In a non-stick skillet, saute the cabbage mix. Allow to cool to room temperature before adding to the batter. Mix flour, dashi, sake, soy sauce, and eggs together in a large bowl until smooth, although a few small lumps are fine. To the batter, add the cooled cabbage mixture, ham and the green onions. Mix well. Using the same non-stick skillet that you used to cook the cabbage, heat over medium, a small amount of oil or spray with cooking spray. Drop the batter by tablespoonfuls into the pan. Cook until golden on each side. Serve hot, room temperature, or cold with kewpie mayonnaise and bull-dog tonkatsu sauce. ; name: cranberry rita ; ingredients: cranberries, kumquats, orange, sugar, grand marnier, ice ; preparation:Put everything in your blender and blend. Pour. Enjoy. You can replace kumquat, calamondin and orange with lime or lemon for a different flavor. Have fun with it. ; name: chocolate cherry cobbler ; ingredients: dark sweet cherries, brownie mix, water, egg, vegetable oil ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degree oven. Lightly grease a 13 x 9 pan, i use cooking spray. Place cherries in pan. In a large bowl combine brownie mix, water, egg and oil. Mix until well combined. Spread over the cherries. Bake for 50 minutes or until a toothpick inserted near the middle comes out with moist crumbs. Serve warm with vanilla ice cream or whipped cream or cool whip. ; name: pancakes milk free ; ingredients: flour, baking powder, sugar, salt, egg, orange juice, water, vegetable oil, vegetable oil cooking spray ; preparation:

name: italian chicken noodles ; ingredients: italian salad dressing mix, water, boneless skinless chicken breasts, mushroom soup, cream cheese, cooked noodles ; preparation:Mix italian dressing mix with water. Place chicken breasts in baking dish. Pour italian dressing over chicken. Mix soup and cream cheese. Pour over chicken. Cover with lid or foil. Bake at 350 for 25-30 minutes. Serve over cooked noodles. ; name: tuna potato bake ; ingredients: potatoes, evaporated milk, condensed cream of celery soup, eggs, onion powder, salt, ground black pepper, tuna, cheddar cheese ; preparation:Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. Coat an 8 x 8-inch pan with oil or nonstick spray. Dice the potatoes and put them aside. In a medium mixing bowl, whisk together the milk, celery soup, eggs, onion powder, salt and pepper until smooth. Stir in the tuna, cheese, and diced potatoes, then pour the mixture into the prepared pan. It should come nearly to the top. Bake for 55 to 60 mniutes, or until a knife inserted into the center comes out clean. The edges should be golden brown. ; name: peanut butter no bakes ; ingredients: sugar, light corn syrup, creamy peanut butter, vanilla, crisp rice cereal ; preparation:In a large saucepan, bring sugar and corn syrup to boil. Remove from heat. Stir in peanut butter and vanilla. Mix in cereal. Drop by large spoonful onto wax paper. Let cool before removing from wax paper. ; name: light creamed lemon spinach ; ingredients: unsalted butter, onion, garlic cloves, all-purpose flour, skim milk, frozen chopped spinach, fresh lemon juice, lemon zest, imitation bacon bits, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Melt butter in a heavy nonstick skillet over medium high heat. Saut onion and garlic about 6 minutes until tender. Add flour and cook 2 minutes, stirring frequently. Gradually whisk in milk. Increase heat to high and whisk 2-3 minutes, or until mixture boils and begins to thicken. Reduce heat to low and stir in remaining ingredients, except cheese. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Cook until heated through. Serve sprinkled with parmesan cheese. ; name: squash snackers ; ingredients: yellow squash, olive oil, balsamic vinegar, fresh garlic, fresh basil, celery salt, asiago cheese ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350. Coat the bottom of a casserole dish with olive oil. Line the bottom of the dish with the squash making sure that they are laid out evenly and sprinkle with vinegar. Top with even amounts of garlic, basil and celery salt. Bake uncovered at 350 for 20 minutes. Remove from oven and add about one cube of cheese per slice. Cook for another 15 minutes remove and let cool for five minutes and serve on crackers or eat by themselves. ; name: winter squash pie ; ingredients: squash, sugar, salt, ground cinnamon, ground nutmeg, ground ginger, mace, eggs, cream, pie crust ; preparation:Line a pie plate with pastry, crimp edge attractively and chill. Preheat oven to 450f. Strain the cooked squash and set aside to cool. Add sugar, salt and spices. Mix thoroughly. Beat the eggs, add cream and mix with squash. Pour into prepared pie pan, place in oven and bake for ten minutes. Reduce heat to 350f and bake for 40 minutes longer. ; name: banana chip muffins ; ingredients: banana muffin mix, quick oats, mini chocolate chip, mashed banana, egg, milk ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Grease muffin pan. Combine all ingredients until well blended. Pour into prepared muffin pan. Bake 12 - 14 minutes. ; name: red wine mushrooms the easy way ; ingredients: small mushroom, olive oil, butter, garlic granules, red wine ; preparation:

name: filled frankfurters ; ingredients: macaroni, milk, dry mustard, salt, pepper, cheddar cheese, frankfurters ; preparation:Cook the macaroni in boiling salted water until tender. Drain and rinse in hot water. Combine the milk, mustard, salt, pepper and 2 cups of the cheddar cheese in the top of a double boiler and cook until the cheddar is melted and sauce is smooth, stirring frequently. Add the macaroni and blend well. Split the frankfurters lengthwise, without separating them, and fill with the macaroni mixture. Sprinkle with the remaining cheddar and bake in a hot oven for 15 minutes.
