Serve hot. ; name: big batch ranch dressing mix ; ingredients: dried parsley flakes, dill weed, onion powder, salt, garlic powder, ground pepper, dried onion flakes ; preparation:Mix together all ingredients. Store in a 1 cup canning jar or other airtight container. When ready to make dressing, combine 1 cup of mayonnaise, 1 cup buttermilk, and 1 tablespoon dry dressing mix. Whisk well. Store in refrigerator. ; name: spiced iced coffee ; ingredients: hot coffee, sugar, cinnamon sticks, cloves, allspice, black peppercorns, half-and-half ; preparation:Combine first 6 ingredients. Stir well. Let stand at room temperature 1 hour. Strain and serve over cracked ice. Serve with half-and-half and sugar. ; name: mini ham loaves ; ingredients: ground ham, ground pork, dried bread, milk, eggs, brown sugar, vinegar, water, dry mustard ; preparation:Combine ham, pork, bread, milk and eggs. Shape into six little loaves and place in baking pan. Combine brown sugar, vinegar, water and dry mustard. Pour over meatloaves. Bake at 350 for 1 hour and 15 minutes, basting often with sauce. ; name: shredded cabbage with butter and bread ; ingredients: butter, seasoned croutons, dry mustard, caraway seed, head of cabbage, kosher salt, sugar ; preparation:Melt the butter and add croutons. Add the mustard and caraway seeds and stir over medium heat until the butter browns and smells nutty. Remove from heat. Place the cabbage in water and cook for 2 minutes, exactly. I prefer to steam the cabbage instead of boiling it. Add the cabbage to the butter crumb dressing and toss to coat thoroughly. Serve immediately. ; name: rhubarb ginger marmalade ; ingredients: rhubarb, oranges, sugar, lemon, preserved gingerroot ; preparation:In heavy saucepan or metal bowl, mix rhubarb and sugar. Let stand all night or all day. Cut rind from oranges and lemon into 1 inch pieces or smaller. Cover with cold water and bring to a boil and simmer for 15 minutes or until tender. Drain and set aside. Remove pith from oranges and lemon and chop pulp, add to rhubarb. Bring to full rolling boil. Reduce heat and cook about 10 minutes, until jam stage is reached. Remove from heat and add ginger and rind. Stir 5 minutes, skim foam. Pour in sterile hot jars, put hot lids on and screw tight. Makes 7 cups. ; name: unstuffed bell pepper skillet ; ingredients: ground beef, onion, crushed tomatoes, green bell peppers, salt, pepper, garlic powder, dried italian seasoning, cooked rice, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Brown ground meat and onion. Drain. Season with salt, pepper, garlic and italian seasoning. Add crushed tomatoes and green pepper. Cover and simmer until peppers are tender crisp. Serve over cooked rice. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. ; name: extra tasty scrambled eggs ; ingredients: eggs, milk, salt & freshly ground black pepper, butter, cheddar cheese, bread ; preparation:

name: no bake cookies made with chocolate chips ; ingredients: butter, milk, sugar, chocolate chips, peanut butter, oatmeal, vanilla ; preparation:Put oatmeal, optional peanut butter, chocolate chips and vanilla in a mixing bowl. Combine butter, milk and sugar in a saucepan and heat over medium high until boiling. Let boil for 1 minute. Pour hot mix into the oatmeal mix and stir well. Drop spoonfuls onto wax paper and let harden before eating. Freeze to harden faster. ; name: peanut butter crunch bars ; ingredients: peanut butter, light corn syrup, sugar, butter, salt, corn flakes, rice krispies, chocolate frosting ; preparation:Melt sugar with corn syrup. Remove from heat and add the peanut butter. Stir until combined well. Add remaining ingredients. Mix well. Press into a greased 8x8-inch pan and chill. Frost with chocolate frosting, if you like. ; name: roasted brussels sprouts with hazelnut brown butter ; ingredients: butter, brussels sprout, hazelnuts, salt, fresh ground pepper, water ; preparation:Position rack in bottom third of oven and preheat to 450f. Put butter on a large rimmed baking sheet and roast until the butter is melted, browned and fragrant. Remove baking sheet from oven and toss brussels sprouts and hazelnuts with the browned butter. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Return to oven and roast for 7 minutes. Sprinkle with water, toss, and continue roasting until the sprouts are tender and lightly browned. ; name: vidalia onion quiche ; ingredients: butter, vidalia onions, unbaked pie shells, swiss cheese, eggs, cream, salt, pepper, chives ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350. Melt butter in a large frying pan, and add sliced onions. Sautuntil transparent. Set aside to cool. Sprinkle 1 cup of cheese in the bottom of the pie plate. Add the cooled onions. Mix together eggs, cream, salt and pepper. Pour over the onions and top with remaining cheese and chives. Bake for 40 - 50 minutes, or until mixture is set. Allow to cool slightly before serving. ; name: cherry tomato pasta ; ingredients: olive oil, garlic cloves, cherry tomatoes, sugar, salt and pepper, fresh basil leaf, thin spaghetti, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Place oil in a skillet over low heat. Add the garlic and cook, stirring, until golden, about 6-7 minutes. Add the tomatoes, sugar, salt, and pepper. Raise heat to medium and cook, gently smashing some of the tomatoes with the back of the spoon, until the sauce is thickened, about 8 minutes. Stir in the basil. Add the pasta, combine well and serve immediately, topped with grated cheese. ; name: swiss steak mozzarella ; ingredients: beef round steak, flour, margarine, tomatoes, salt, cream of mushroom soup, mozzarella cheese ; preparation:Cut meat into serving size pieces. Coat with flour. Melt margarine in skillet. Brown meat slowly on both sides. Put into a 9x13 inch baking dish. Combine tomatoes, soup and salt. Pour over meat. Bake covered at 350 degrees 1 hour, or until meat is tender. Remove cover and sprinkle with cheese. Bake an additional 5 minutes or until cheese is melted. ; name: rosemary seasoned steak ; ingredients: beef tenderloin steaks, salt, pepper, garlic powder, dried rosemary ; preparation:Mix seasonings together in small dish. Trim fat from steak and rub seasoning mixture on both sides. Place the steak on rack of broiler pan. Position pan so that steak is about 3 inches from heat. Broil 10-12 minutes for a steak, turning once during cooking or grill as desired. Serve with baked potatoes, sour cream and chives, and steamed broccoli. ; name: hotdog rolls with breadcrumbs ; ingredients: hot dogs, eggs, white bread, cheese, breadcrumbs ; preparation:

name: boiled rice ; ingredients: basmati rice, salt, water, oil ; preparation:Measure the rice and. Wash the rice under running cold water until it runs clear. Then. Alternatively, cover the bowl tightly with microwavable film and pierce this three or four times with a sharp pointed knife. Cook on high for 5 minutes. Then on defrost for 10-12 minutes. The rice will stay hot for up to 15 minutes if you keep it covered. I recommend this procedure only for white rice. ; name: green and white salad ; ingredients: cooked bacon, fresh broccoli florets, cauliflower florets, celery, onion, low-fat sour cream, low-fat mayonnaise, garlic powder, salt ; preparation:Cover bacon with paper towel and microwave 2-3 minutes to crisp. Cool. Rinse broccoli and cauliflower. Drain well. Break or chop florets into bite sized pieces. Place florets in bowl. Add celery and onion to the other vegetables. In bowl mix sour cream, mayonnaise, garlic powder, and salt. Pour dressing over vegetables. Crumble bacon over the top. Toss to mix well. Serve at once, or refrigerate up to 24 hours before serving. ; name: lemon chive rice ; ingredients: margarine, onion, rice, curry, turmeric, lemon zest, chicken broth, chives, pepper ; preparation:Melt margarine. Add onions and saute. Add rice and curry or tumeric and cook until grains of rice are all coated. Stir in half the lemon peel and all the broth. Bring to a boil. Cover and simmer over low heat for 20- 25 minutes. Stir in remaining lemon peel and chives just before you serve. ; name: pineapple orange cream cake ; ingredients: yellow cake mix, mandarin oranges in juice, eggs, oil, instant vanilla pudding, crushed pineapple in juice, whipped topping ; preparation:Combine first 4 ingredients. Pour into 2-9 inch greased and floured layer cake pans. Bake at 350 degrees for 30-35 minutes. Cool. Combine instant pudding and crushed pineapple. Put in refrigerator for an hour. When ready to ice, fold in whipped topping. Frost layers and top and sides of cake. ; name: hrudka easter cheese ; ingredients: eggs, milk, black pepper, salt, vanilla ; preparation:Pour milk into saucepan and bring to a boil. Beat eggs slightly and add gradually to milk. Cook over low heat for about seven minutes. Add salt, pepper, and vanilla, stir continually so mixture will not scorch. Pour mixture into a linen towel or cheesecloth, squeeze and tie tightly. Hang and let dry for two hours. Cover with a wet napkin and place in refrigerator. ; name: quinoa salad with black beans and mango ; ingredients: mango, red pepper, scallion, fresh cilantro, red wine vinegar, grapeseed oil, salt, cooked quinoa, black beans ; preparation:Combine the mango, red pepper, scallions, and cilantro in a mixing bowl. Add the red wine vinegar, grapeseed oil, and salt and stir to combine. Add the quinoa and stir until everything is well incorporated. Fold in the black beans. Serve immediately or let it sit for a bit to let the flavors meld. ; name: pumpkin pie milkshake ; ingredients: milk, butterscotch pudding mix, vanilla ice cream, pumpkin pie spice ; preparation:Place all ingredients in large pitcher with tight-fitting lid. Cover. Shake vigorously 1 minute or until well blended. Pour evenly into 4 glasses. Serve immediately. ; name: raspberry rhubarb tart ; ingredients: pie crust, flour, sugar, orange zest, rhubarb, raspberries, red currant jelly, powdered sugar ; preparation:

name: mock pink champagne punch ; ingredients: white sugar, water, frozen concentrated lemonade, frozen orange juice, grenadine, ginger ale, fresh strawberries ; preparation:Combine water and sugar in a small saucepan. Heat on low and stir to dissolve. Do not boil. Combine lemonade, orange juice and grenadine in punch bowl. Add cooled water-sugar mixture. Chill. Just before serving add gingerale. Garnish with fresh strawberries. ; name: perfect divinity ; ingredients: sugar, light corn syrup, water, salt, egg whites, vanilla, pecans ; preparation:In a 2 quart saucepan combine sugar, corn syrup, water, and salt. Cook to hardball stage,, stirring only until sugar dissolves. Meanwhile, as temperature of syrup reaches 250 degrees, beat egg white till stiff peaks form. When syrup reaches 260 degrees, very gradually add the syrup to egg whites, beating at high speed with electric mixer. Add vanilla and beat until candy holds its shape, 4-5 minutes. Stir in the chopped nuts or cherries, if desired. Quickly drop candy from a teaspoon onto waxed paper, swirling the top of each piece. Let cool. ; name: beer cheese dip spread ; ingredients: sharp cheddar cheese, butter, prepared mustard, prepared horseradish, black pepper, beer, chives, pretzels ; preparation:In a small bowl combine cheese, butter, mustard, horseradish and pepper. Heat beer just to boiling and immediately pour over cheese mixture. Beat with electric mixer about 3 minutes or until smooth. Let stand at room temperature for about an hour before serving, whether serving warm or chilled. Garnish if desired. Serve as dip or spread. ; name: frozen peanut butter cream cups ; ingredients: whipping cream, marshmallow cream, cream cheese, peanut butter, chocolate ; preparation:Beat whipping cream until stiff. In a large bowl, with the same beaters, beat the marshmallow cream, cream cheese and peanut butter until smooth. Fold in gently the whipped cream into the peanut butter mixture. Line muffin cups with muffin cup papers. Separate the mixture evenly into the muffin cups. Cover and freeze for 3 or more hours, or until firm. Sprinkle with grated chocolate if desired. ; name: saucy baked chicken breasts ; ingredients: sour cream, lemon juice, worcestershire sauce, celery seed, paprika, garlic, salt, pepper, boneless skinless chicken breast halves, dry breadcrumbs ; preparation:Mix first 8 ingredients in plastic bag. Add chicken and marinate in refrigerator overnight. Remove chicken from bag and coat with crumbs. Heat oven to 350. Place chicken on shallow baking dish. Bake, uncovered for 45 minutes, or until juices run clear. ; name: cream cheese ranch potatoes ; ingredients: baking potatoes, cream cheese, dry ranch dressing mix, sour cream, butter ; preparation:Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add potatoes and cook until tender, about 25 minutes. Drain and mash. In a large bowl beat the cream cheese and dressing mix until smooth. Stir in mashed potatoes, sour cream. And butter. Beat until desired consistency is reached. ; name: grilled ribs ; ingredients: sugar, kosher salt, paprika, cayenne pepper, pork spareribs ; preparation:Prepare grill using charcoal and hickory wood chips or preheat gas grill to low. Combine first four ingredients in a bowl and rub all over ribs. Let the ribs stand a room temperature for 15 minutes. Put ribs on grill grate, skirt side down, cover and slow cook until brown. Turn and cook the second side until brown and ribs are done. ; name: sweet sage apple and cinnamon toddy ; ingredients: dried apples, fresh sage leaf, cinnamon stick, scotch whisky, honey, boiling water ; preparation:

name: peanut butter hot cocoa ; ingredients: milk, smooth peanut butter, powdered chocolate milk mix, whipped cream ; preparation:In a large kettle, combine 1 cup milk and peanut butter. Stirring frequently, cook over low heat until smooth. Increase heat to medium. Slowly stir in remaining 8 cups milk and chocolate mix. Stirring occasionally, cook just until mixture simmers. Garnish with whipped cream. ; name: crab rice primavera ; ingredients: frozen broccoli green beans onions and peppers mix, water, milk, crabmeat, margarine, garlic powder, dried basil, minute rice, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Bring vegitables & water to boil in medium saucepan, stirring occasionally. Reduce heat. Cover & simmer 3 minutes. Add milk, crabmeat, margarine, garlic powder and basil. Bring to full boil. Stir in rice & cheese. Cover, remove from heat. Let stand 5 minutes. Fluff with fork. ; name: granny s coconut pie ; ingredients: frozen pie crusts, milk, flaked coconut, sugar, vanilla, eggs, butter ; preparation:Put coconut in a bowl. Pour milk over and set aside. Cream butter and sugar, add eggs one at a time till mixed well. Add vanilla. Stir in coconut and milk. Poke thawed crusts well with a fork. Pour batter evenly into the two crusts. Bake at 350 for 30 to 40 mins or till center is almost set and pie is golden brown. ; name: simply guacamole ; ingredients: hass avocado, mayonnaise, lime juice, worcestershire sauce, hot pepper sauce, garlic salt ; preparation:Slice avocado lengthwise. Remove pit and scoop avocado into a small bowl. Add mayonnaise, lime juice, worcestershire sauce, hot pepper sauce, and salt. Stir and mash the ingredients together until guacamole is preferred consistency. Serve immediately, or cover and refrigerate if desired. ; name: hot layered hero sandwich ; ingredients: honey mustard, deli turkey, genoa salami, mozzarella cheese, red onions, deli ham, monterey jack cheese, tomatoes, romaine leaves, bread ; preparation:Cut bread in half. Carefully hollow out part of the bottom and top of bread and discard this or give it to the birds. Spread mustard on cut sides of bread. On the bread bottom layer in the order given above except for the lettuce. The lettuce goes on after it comes out of the oven. Replace top and wrap in heavy-duty foil. Place on baking sheet. Bake at 450 degrees for 12-15 minutes or till heated through. Unwrap and put the lettuce on top of the tomato layer. Cut into wedges. ; name: mile high omelette souffle ; ingredients: butter, sliced mushrooms, eggs, salt, pepper, baking powder, milk, cheese ; preparation:Heat large electric frying pan to 300f fry mushrooms in butter. Meanwhile separate eggs whites and yolks into 2 different bowls. Beat egg whites until stiff. Set aside. Beat egg yolks, salt, pepper, flour, baking powder and milk. Fold in egg whites into yolk mixture. Gently pour over mushrooms. Seal tightly with lid and do not lift lid. Cook for 10 to 15 minutes. Sprinkle grated cheese over omelette. Close lid and cook for 5 more minutes. Cut into squares and serve with toast. ; name: ritzy cookies ; ingredients: smooth peanut butter, semisweet chocolate morsel, butterscotch chips, ritz cracker ; preparation:Spread peanut butter on crackers and top with another cracker. Prepare several. Slowly melt morsels on low heat. Dip cookies in melted morsels, place on wax paper. Cool. Place in container and refridge. ; name: continental zucchini ; ingredients: zucchini, corn, pimiento, garlic cloves, oil, salt, pepper, mozzarella cheese ; preparation:

name: quick tomato and beef macaroni and cheese ; ingredients: ground beef, onion, salt and pepper, tomatoes, water, elbow macaroni, cheddar cheese ; preparation:Brown ground beef and onion, drain. Add salt, pepper, tomatoes, and water. And bring to boil. Stir in macaroni and cover and simmer for 10 minutes or until macaroni is tender. Stir in cheese and garnish with sour cream if desired. ; name: white chocolate fudge ; ingredients: white sugar, sour cream, unsalted butter, white chocolate, marshmallow cream, walnuts ; preparation:Combine sugar, sour cream and butter in a pan. Bring mixture to a rolling boil, stirring constantly. Boil for 7 minutes or until softball stage. Remove pan from heat and stir in white chocolate until melted. Add marshmallow cream and walnuts. Beat by hand until completely blended. Spread into a greased 9x9 inch baking pan. Cool at room temperature. ; name: garlic crab ; ingredients: crabs, bulb of garlic, onion, butter, salt, ground pepper, red chili pepper flakes, parsley, lemon slice ; preparation:Place garlic, onions, butter, salt, red and black pepper into a roasting pan and put into a 450 degree oven. Be sure to watch carefully and cook until onions and garlic turn golden brown. Remove from oven, add crab and blend thoroughly. Make sure the crab is coated. Place pan back into oven on 475 degree for 15-20 minutes, turning crab about every 5 minutes. After the crab has been heated throughout remove from oven. Garlic sauce should be braised onto the shell of the crab. Serve as soon as possible, sprinkled with parsley and garnished with lemon. ; name: greek lemon roasted potatoes ; ingredients: red potatoes, water, olive oil, fresh lemon juice, dried oregano, salt, pepper ; preparation:Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Place potatoes in a large baking dish. Add remaining ingredients to the dish and toss until well coated. Bake uncovered about 50 minutes until tender and brown on the edges. Turn the potatoes halfway into cooking time and add more water if the water is all absorbed. Turn on the broiler for a few minutes to make them nice and brown. ; name: french dips with swiss ; ingredients: butter, onion, bell pepper, roast beef, swiss cheese, sandwich buns, beef broth ; preparation:Heat beef broth over low heat. Keep warm. Melt butter in a small frying pan. Fry onion rings and optional bell pepper in butter until tender and slightly browned. Remove vegetables from the pan. Keep warm. Add meat to the pan and heat throughly. Layer one slice of cheese, meat, veggies and another slice of cheese on french bread rolls. Cover with other half of roll. Place sandwiches back in pan over low heat, covered. Heat just until cheese is melted and bottom of rolls are toasted. Serve with warmed broth for dipping. ; name: cranberry cole slaw ; ingredients: miracle whip, red wine vinegar, honey, craisins, packaged coleslaw mix ; preparation:In a bowl with a lid, and large enough for the finished product, mix well the first 4 ingredients. Add the slaw. Put the lid on and shake, shake, shake. Refrigerate at least 2 hours before serving. The cook time is fridge time. ; name: roasted pear and arugula salad with walnuts and parmesan ; ingredients: pears, butter, sugar, extra virgin olive oil, white wine vinegar, salt, black pepper, arugula, parmesan cheese, walnuts ; preparation:Preheat oven to 500 f and put baking sheet in the oven to heat too. Cut each pear lengthwise, remove the core, then set cut side down on a board and slice thinly into 5 pieces lengthwise again. Toss pear with butter and sugar. Place on baking sheet and in oven to roast for 10 min, or until browned on bottom. Flip and roast until tender and deep brown, 5 more minutes. Let pears cool. Toast the walnuts in a small dry skillet until browned, 3 minutes and set aside. Whisk the olive oil, vinegar, salt and pepper together. Combine arugula and pears in large serving bowl, and gentley toss with the dressing. Using a vegetable peeler, shave curls of parmesan cheese on top of salad. Chop walnuts coarsely and sprinkle on top. ; name: spicy green beans and new potatoes ; ingredients: new potatoes, butter, onion, garlic cloves, fresh green beans, creole seasoning ; preparation:

name: threadgill s garlic cheese grits ; ingredients: cold water, grits, garlic, yellow onion, milk, eggs, velveeta cheese, salt, black pepper ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350. Bring water to a boil in a saucepan. Add grits and return to boil, then reduce heat and simmer about 5 minutes. Remove from heat. Add all other ingredients, and put into a greased casserole dish. Bake uncovered for about 45 minutes, stirring once after 20 minutes. ; name: broccoli turkey supreme ; ingredients: cooked turkey breast, condensed cream of chicken soup, frozen broccoli florets, chicken rice pilaf mix, milk, chicken broth, celery, sliced water chestnuts, mayonnaise, onion ; preparation:In a large bowl, combine all of the ingredients. Transfer to a greased 3-qt. Baking dish. Cover and bake at 325 for 1 hour. Uncover. Bake 15-20 minutes longer or until rice is tender. ; name: tropical tapioca ; ingredients: coconut milk, whole milk, quick-cooking tapioca, granulated sugar, egg, strawberry, pineapple bits, banana, shredded coconut, raisins ; preparation:Shake can of coconut milk well. Pour coconut milk into a 1-quart measure. Add whole milk to make 3 cups. Pour milk into a saucepan and add tapioca, sugar and egg. Stir gently just to combine, then let set 5 minutes. Over medium heat, bring tapioca mixture slowly to a full boil, stirring constantly with a rubber or wooden spatula. At the boil, remove from heat. Fold in fruit of choice. Pour into ramekins, dessert bowls, or lidded containers. Cool 20 minutes. Stir tapioca well in each container, then chill. Tapioca will thicken as it cools. ; name: kiwi cookies ; ingredients: butter, white sugar, sweetened condensed milk, baking powder, flour, chocolate chips ; preparation:Combine butter and sugar until creamy. Add milk, and stir. Add baking powder and flour and combine until just mixed. Add chocolate chips and mix all together. Roll dough into balls and place on an ungreased cookie sheet. Press down with fork tines. Bake in a moderate over at 350 and remove when the bottoms become golden brown. Makes approximately 14-16 cookies. ; name: frito corn salad ; ingredients: whole kernel corn, red pepper, yellow pepper, green pepper, green onion, mayonnaise, cheese, fritos corn chips ; preparation:Drain canned corn. Dice peppers and green onion. Put in a large bowl and add mayonaise, you could increase this to 1 cup and cheese. Just before serving add the fritos. The recipe calls for chili cheese fritos. ; name: crispy baked orange roughy ; ingredients: orange roughy, egg, dry breadcrumbs, parmesan cheese, lemon, rind of, lemon pepper, garlic ; preparation:Cut fish into serving-size pieces. Beat egg in small shallow bowl. Combine remaining ingredients in second shallow bowl. Dip fish into egg and then into crumb mixture, coating completely. Place on foil-lined baking sheet tucking tail under if needed. Bake at 450 degrees f oven for 6-8 minutes or until fish flakes easily with fork. ; name: orange ginger glazed salmon ; ingredients: lime juice, orange juice, orange marmalade, ginger, dried mustard, salt, hot pepper flakes, butter, salmon fillets ; preparation:Combine the lime juice, orange juice, orange marmalade, ginger, mustard, salt and pepper flakes in a small saucepan and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat and simmer on low heat for 5 minutes. Until reduced to almost half. Remove from heat. Swirl in the butter. Set aside. While sauce is cooking, place salmon on a hot grill and cook for 5 minutes per side, or until fish flakes easily when tested with a fork. Spoon sauce across salmon and serve. ; name: tunisian rub tabil ; ingredients: coriander seeds, cumin seeds, caraway seeds, hot red pepper flakes, coarse salt ; preparation:

name: chocolate chip blondies ; ingredients: brown sugar, butter, eggs, vanilla extract, flour, baking powder, salt, milk chocolate chips ; preparation:In a large bowl, combine brown sugar, butter, eggs and vanilla just until blended. Combine flour, baking powder and salt. Add to brown sugar mixture. Stir in chocolate chips. Spread into a a greased 13x9 pan. Bake at 350 for 18-20 minutes or until a toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean. Cool on a wire rack. Cut into bars. ; name: mini cheese balls ; ingredients: chive & onion cream cheese, mozzarella cheese, bacon, italian seasoning, garlic powder, walnuts ; preparation:Mix cream cheese spread and mozzarella cheese until well blended. Stir in chopped bacon and seasonings. Shape mixture into 54 balls, using 1 level tsp for each ball. Roll in walnuts. Cover with plastic wrap. Chill at least 2 hours. ; name: lemon parmigiano artichoke casserole ; ingredients: frozen artichoke hearts, lemon, juice of, fresh parsley, seasoned dry bread crumbs, parmigiano, garlic cloves, red pepper flakes, extra virgin olive oil ; preparation:Preheat oven to 375f. Coat a 9-inch glass pie plate with cooking spray. Place artichokes in a colander and, if needed, rinse with cold water to separate. Drain well and pat dry with paper towels. Place artichokes in prepared pie plate. Add lemon juice and parsley. Season with salt and pepper and stir to combine. In a small bowl, combine breadcrumbs, cheese, garlic, olive oil, and red pepper. Sprinkle the mixture evenly over the artichokes. Bake for 15-20 minutes or until topping is golden. ; name: lemony salmon ; ingredients: salmon, lemon juice, parsley, salt and pepper ; preparation:Line a baking sheet with tin foil, and rest the fish on top of the tin foil. Drizzle the lemon onto the fish. Season with parsley, salt and pepper. Put in a preheated 350 f oven. Cook it for 30 minutes or until done. ; name: crab casserole ; ingredients: butter, flour, heavy cream, salt, pepper, sherry wine, lump crabmeat, sharp cheddar cheese ; preparation:In a double boiler, make cream sauce by melting the butter. Add the flour and stir. Add the cream and stir constantly until sauce is thick. Add salt, pepper and sherry to the double boiler. Take the double boiler off the heat and fold in the crab gently. Pour into buttered 1 quart casserole. Sprinkle with grated cheese. Bake, uncovered, for about 30 minutes, or until cheese melts, at 400 degrees f. ; name: garlic dill crackers ; ingredients: dry ranch dressing mix, extra virgin olive oil, dried dill, garlic granules, lemon pepper, cayenne pepper, oyster crackers ; preparation:Preheat oven to 175degf. Combine first 5 ingredients in a large bowl, plus cayenne pepper, if using, and stir until well combined. Add crackers, and toss well to combine. Transfer mixture to a baking sheet. Bake for 30-40 minutes or until dry, stirring occasionally. Store in an airtight container. ; name: strawberries in cointreau ; ingredients: strawberries, cointreau liqueur, dark chocolate, heavy cream ; preparation:Place the strawberries and cointreau in a medium bowl and stir until well combined. Cover and place in the fridge for 1-2 hours to macerate. Run a vegetable peeler to peel along the long edge of the block of chocolate to make chocolate curls. Set aside until serving. To serve, spoon the strawberry mixture into serving bowls. Top with cream and chocolate curls. ; name: sugar bean curry ; ingredients: onion, tomatoes, beans, water, curry powder, oxtail soup mix ; preparation:

name: bacon and egg rice ; ingredients: long-grain white rice, water, bacon, eggs, salt, black pepper, onion, vegetable oil, scallion, sesame oil ; preparation:Bring rice and water to a boil in a 3 quart heavy saucepan, then reduce, heat to low and cook, tightly covered, until water is absorbed and rice is tender, about 20 minutes. Remove from heat and let stand, covered, 5 minutes. Gently stir rice from top to bottom of saucepan with a heatproof rubber spatula. Cook bacon in a 12-inch nonstick skillet over moderate heat, stirring occasionally, until golden and crisp, about 6 minutes. Pour into a sieve set over a heatproof bowl and reserve bacon and fat separately. Whisk together eggs, t salt and t pepper in a medium bowl. Return 3 tablespoons fat to skillet and saut onion over moderately high heat, stirring occasionally, until pale golden, about 5 minutes. Add eggs and cook, stirring, until eggs are just set, about 1 minute. Make a well in center of egg mixture, then pour in vegetable oil and 2 tablespoons reserved bacon fat. Add rice, remaining teaspoon salt and remaining teaspoon pepper and cook, stirring, 2 minutes. Add bacon, scallions, and sesame oil and cook mixture, stirring, 1 minute. Serve immediately. ; name: apple brie omelet ; ingredients: apple, butter, eggs, cream, salt & pepper, brie cheese ; preparation:Melt 1 tablespoon butter in saut pan. Saut apple slices until just turning soft. Beat together eggs, cream or milk, and salt & pepper until blended but not frothy. Melt remaining butter in omelet pan over high heat until foam begins to recede but before beginning to color. Pour in egg mixture and prepare omelet, stirring lightly, but allowing it to set on the bottom. Fill with sauted apples and brie. Fold or roll and slide out of pan onto a heated plate. ; name: citrus jasmine rice ; ingredients: jasmine rice, water, chicken bouillon granule, salt, orange, zest of, lemon, zest of, garlic clove, green onion ; preparation:Rinse the rice well several times until the water runs clean. Drain thoroughly. Bring water to a boil in a lidded saucepan. Stir in rice, bouillon, salt, orange and lemon zest, and the optional smashed garlic clove. Cover, reduce heat and simmer for about 20 minutes or until water has been absorbed. Do not stir during the cooking process to prevent gumming. Remove from heat, add optional green onions and fluff with fork. ; name: chilled sage herb tea ; ingredients: fresh sage, fennel seeds, of fresh mint, lemon rind, boiling water, honey, ice cube, mint leaf ; preparation:Place the sage, fennel seeds, mint and lemon rind in a large teapot or plunger. Add the boiling water and cover with a lid. Set aside for 15 minutes to infuse. Strain into a jug and stir in honey to taste. Cover with plastic wrap and place in the fridge for 1 hour to chill. Place ice cubes and a few mint leaves in serving glasses and pour over the chilled tea to serve. ; name: vermont style coleslaw ; ingredients: green cabbage, sour cream, mayonnaise, real maple syrup, salt & pepper ; preparation:Place shredded cabbage in a bowl. Combine sourcream and mayo until creamy and blend in maple syrup. Mix into cabbage. Salt and pepper to taste. Chill well. ; name: christmas minties ; ingredients: semi-sweet chocolate baking squares, peppermint extract, ritz crackers, candy cane ; preparation:Microwave chocolate in a glass bowl. Stir until melted, then stir in peppermint extract. Dip the crackers singley into the chocolate, shaking off any excess. Place on wax paper-covered baking sheets and sprinkle with crushed candy cane before the chocolate sets. Chill until firm. ; name: easy baked omelets ; ingredients: egg, green pepper, tomatoes, onion, sausage, cheese ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350. Spray muffin tin with non-stick cooking spray. Add one cracked egg to each tin and whisk the yolk. Add your toppings, saving the cheese for last. Bake 30 minutes or until eggs are completely cooked. Cool and serve. ; name: banana quinoa muffins wheat free ; ingredients: quinoa flour, quinoa, baking powder, baking soda, salt, bananas, eggs, honey ; preparation:

name: southern green beans ham potatoes ; ingredients: ham hock, bacon, onions, salt, sugar, garlic, cayenne pepper, parsley, fresh green beans, potato ; preparation:Place ham hock and bacon in large dutch oven pot or soup pot. Cover with water. Bring to a rapid boil. Turn burner to medium to medium-high and let it come to a medium boil. Add the sliced onion. Let this cook while you wash and snap your beans. Wash beans, cut off ends and break in half. Add beans, salt, sugar, garlic, pepper and parsley to the ham hocks. Let it come to a boil, then turn burner to medium, to medium-low. Let it slow boil for about an hour or more or less, depending on how well you like your beans cooked. About 15-20 minutes before done, add your potatoes. Boil until tender. ; name: chunky cheese dip ; ingredients: ground beef, velveeta cheese, tomatoes and green chilies, worcestershire sauce, chili powder, tabasco sauce ; preparation:In saucepan, brown meat. Drain grease. Add remaining ingredients. Simmer until blended, stirring occasionally. I serve with doritos. ; name: lemon parmigiano artichoke casserole ; ingredients: frozen artichoke hearts, lemon, juice of, fresh parsley, seasoned dry bread crumbs, parmigiano, garlic cloves, red pepper flakes, extra virgin olive oil ; preparation:Preheat oven to 375f. Coat a 9-inch glass pie plate with cooking spray. Place artichokes in a colander and, if needed, rinse with cold water to separate. Drain well and pat dry with paper towels. Place artichokes in prepared pie plate. Add lemon juice and parsley. Season with salt and pepper and stir to combine. In a small bowl, combine breadcrumbs, cheese, garlic, olive oil, and red pepper. Sprinkle the mixture evenly over the artichokes. Bake for 15-20 minutes or until topping is golden. ; name: double tomato brie sandwiches ; ingredients: sun-dried tomatoes packed in oil, extra virgin olive oil, white wine vinegar, italian bread, brie cheese, roma tomatoes, fresh basil leaf ; preparation:In small bowl, combine dried tomatoes, olive oil and vinegar. Cut each loaf of italian bread horizontally in half. Evenly spread dried tomato mixture on cut sides of bread. Arrange brie on bottom halves of both loaves and top with tomato slices and basil leaves. Replace tops of loaves. Slice each loaf into eight pieces. Wrap in plastic wrap and refrigerate until ready to serve. Also, i like the sun-dried tomatoes packed in lightly salted olive oil and herbs. If you use the unseasoned variety, you may want to lightly salt the tomatoes. ; name: ricotta spinach dip with chips ; ingredients: fresh spinach, ricotta cheese, scallions, radishes, salt & freshly ground black pepper, fresh dill, water chestnut, parsley, olive, cherry tomatoes ; preparation:Stem the spinach and clean it thoroughly. Dry completely using a salad spiner and mince fine. Place the ricotta in a medium large bowl. Use a wire whisk or wooden spoon to beat until quite smooth stir in the spinach and all other ingredients, except garnishes. Cover tightly and chill until very cold. Serve with chips, raw veggies, or good crackers. ; name: mustard ham sauce ; ingredients: sugar, flour, eggs, prepared mustard, vinegar, beef bouillon, butter ; preparation:Stir flour and sugar together. Add eggs and mix well. Add remaining ingredients. Cook over low heat, stirring constantly until thick. Serve hot over ham. Refrigerate leftover sauce to use for sandwiches. ; name: moroccan cookies ; ingredients: milk, sugar, butter, flour, blanched almond, candied orange peel, chocolate frosting ; preparation:Mix together milk, sugar, butter and flour. Cook over low heat for 1 minute. Add almonds and orange peel. Drop by teaspoon onto greased and floured baking sheet. Bake in preheated 350 oven for 7 minutes. Remove cookie sheets and cool flat side up. Spread flat side with frosting. ; name: jewish old family recipe hamantashen by ileene rubinrotte ; ingredients: eggs, oil, sugar, vanilla, baking powder, salt, flour, raspberry preserves ; preparation:

name: baked barbecue chicken ; ingredients: broiler-fryer chickens, onion, ketchup, brown sugar, worcestershire sauce, lemon juice, liquid smoke ; preparation:Preheat oven to 375f. Place chicken pieces in 13x9-inch baking dish coated with nonstick cooking spray. Arrange onion slices over top. In small saucepan, combine ketchup, brown sugar, worcestershire sauce, lemon juice and liquid smoke. Heat over medium heat 2 to 3 minutes or until sugar dissolves. Pour over chicken. Bake chicken 1 hour or until juices run clear. Discard onion slices. Let stand 10 minutes before serving. ; name: pan de yuca colombian cheese bread ; ingredients: cheese, tapioca starch, butter, eggs, salt ; preparation:Using your hands, combine all ingredients in a large bowl. Knead until very thick and firm, about 5 minutes. Turn out onto a dry surface and divide into 4 pieces. Shape each piece into a ball and flatten slightly. Divide each disc into six pieces. Roll each piece between palms to form a 4 inch long cylinder. Repeat with remaining discs. Rolls can be covered and refrigerated at this point up to 2 weeks. Preheat oven to 550f and arrange rolls on baking sheets. Bake until brown and crisp about 6-8 minutes. Serve warm. ; name: breakfast eggcake ; ingredients: egg, milk, pancake mix, butter, bacon bits, cinnamon sugar ; preparation:Stir ingredients together gently. Add more milk as necessary to make batter the consistency of buttermilk. Melt butter in omelette pan or small skillet over medium high heat. Pour batter into skillet and cook until edges appear dry. Flip eggcake over and cook until set, about another minute. Slide onto serving plate and serve with maple syrup or your favorite pancake topping. ; name: quick fettuccine carbonara ; ingredients: bacon, dry fettuccine, eggs, parsley, dried italian herb seasoning, parmesan cheese, fresh ground pepper ; preparation:Saute the bacon in a small skillet until crisp. Remove with a slotted spoon and drain well on a paper towel. Cook fettuccini noodles according to package instruction until firm and tender. Meanwhile, beat the eggs thoroughly in a large bowl suitable for serving. Have the cooked bacon and the chopped parsley ready at hand. When the pasta is done, drain it immediately in a colander, and pour into the bowl of eggs and immediately begin tossing it. As the strands of pasta become coated with the beaten eggs, their heat will cook the eggs. Sprinkle the bacon, italian seasoning and parsley on, and serve immediately. Top with lots of freshly grated parmesan cheese and freshly ground black pepper. ; name: tsr version of mcdonald s filet o fish sandwich by todd wilbur ; ingredients: mayonnaise, sweet relish, onions, salt, hamburger buns, breaded fish fillets, american cheese ; preparation:In a small bowl, mix together the mayonnaise, relish, minced onion, and salt and set aside. This is your tartar sauce. Lightly grill the faces of the buns. Cook the fish according to the package instructions. You can bake the fish, but your sandwich will taste much more like the original if you fry it in oil. Divide the tartar sauce and spread it evenly on each of the top buns. Place a slice of cheese on each of the bottom buns. Place the cooked fish on top of the cheese slice on each sandwich, and top off the sandwiches with the top buns. ; name: top secret recipes version of arby s sauce by todd wilbur ; ingredients: ketchup, water, garlic powder, onion powder, black pepper, salt, tabasco sauce ; preparation:Combine all ingredients in small saucepan and cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until the sauce begins to boil, 5-10 minutes. Remove sauce from the heat. Cover and allow to cool. Pour into a covered container for storage in the refrigerator. Keeps for 2 months. ; name: gibna with tamatum or cheese with tomatoes ; ingredients: feta cheese, roma tomatoes, cucumber, olive oil, pita breads ; preparation:Use a fork to mash the cheese in a medium mixing bowl. Add the tomatoes and cucumber. Mix well. Add in some of the oil if the mixture is too dry. Fill each half pita bread to eat as a sandwich or serve the dip and pitas as an appetizer. ; name: no bake vanilla orange balls ; ingredients: vanilla wafers, powdered sugar, oleo, nuts, frozen orange juice, coconut ; preparation:

name: rogene s yummie potatoes ; ingredients: potatoes, butter, sour cream, cream of chicken soup, green onion, chicken stock, cheddar cheese, breadcrumbs, salt, pepper ; preparation:Cook potatoes till tender, peel and grate. Heat the butter with soup and chicken stock. Blend in sour cream, onion, and most of the cheese. Mix with the potatoes. Add salt and pepper to taste. Spread into a 9x13 baking dish. Mix the bread crumbs with the melted butter and then place on top of the potatoe mixture. Sprinkle with the remaining cheese. Bake for 45 min at 350 degrees or until bubbly. ; name: salted caramel holiday treats ; ingredients: caramels, sweetened condensed milk, unsalted butter, miniature marshmallows, vanilla extract, flaked sea salt, toasted rice cereal ; preparation:In a medium saucepan, melt caramel ingredients over medium low heat until smooth. Remove from heat. Line a 13x9 inch baking dish with non-stick aluminum foil which extends the 2 inches beyond the edges. In a saucepan, melt the butter over medium low heat. Stir in marshmallows, with a rubber spatula, and continue stirring until almost melted. Stir in vanilla, 1 teaspoon of the sea salt, and 1 cup of the melted caramel stirring until smooth. Remove from heat. Stir in cereal and press mixture into prepared baking dish. Spread the remaining caramel over top and sprinkle with sea salt. Let cool completely, peel off foil, and cut into 24 squares. ; name: cabbage with polish sausage ; ingredients: onion, butter, flour, water, vinegar, salt, sugar, pepper, cabbage, polish sausage ; preparation:Saut onion in butter in a dutch oven over low heat until tender. Add flour, stirring until smooth. Cook 1 minutes, stirring constantly. Gradually add water and vinegar. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until mixture thickens. Stir in remaining ingredients. Reduce heat, cover and simmer for 20 minutes. ; name: spicy cajun crab and greens soup ; ingredients: vegetable oil, all-purpose flour, cajun seasoning, bottled clam juice, diced tomatoes with sweet onions, baby spinach leaves, fresh thyme, garlic clove, lump crabmeat ; preparation:Whisk oil and flour in heavy large saucepan over medium-high heat until smooth and golden brown, about 3 minutes. Add enough cajun seasoning to season to taste and stir 30 seconds. Add clam juice and stir until smooth. Add tomatoes with juices. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer 3 minutes. Add spinach, thyme, and garlic and simmer until spinach is just wilted, about 1 minute. Add crabmeat and simmer until heated through, stirring gently. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Ladle soup into bowls and serve. ; name: mediterranean spiced rice with apricots ; ingredients: olive oil, garlic clove, cumin, powdered ginger, cinnamon, chicken stock, water, long grain white rice, dried apricot, green onion ; preparation:In a saucepan, over medium heat, warm the olive oil, add the garlic and cook for 30 seconds. Stir in the chicken stock and water. Bring to a boil. Add the rice. Reduce heat, cover and cook for 15 minutes or until rice is almost tender. Stir in seasonings, apricots and green onion. Cook an additional 5 minutes to blend flavors. ; name: entire meal entree ; ingredients: olive oil, cinnamon, flank steaks, fresh mushrooms, white wine, linguine, hazelnuts ; preparation:Heat oil in pan over medium heat. Add cinnamon, stir until well blended 5 minute. Add steak and saute 8 min., add mushrooms, saute additional 3 minute. Add wine, scraping any bits off the bottom of pan, bring to boil. Let simmer 5 minutes. Remove from heat. Serve over linguini, top with hazelnuts. ; name: french dip roast beef sandwiches ; ingredients: bottom round steaks, onion soup mix, beef broth, beer, onion, rolls ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Place roast in a large roasting pan. Combine soup mix, broth and beer in a bowl and stir until soup mix is dissolved. Pour over roast and place onions around it. Bake for 2 to 3 hours, basting frequently, or until beef is tender and looks stringy when pulled with a fork. If roast starts getting too crispy, cover pan with foil or lid. Slice meat thinly and serve on rolls. Serve juices in individual cups or bowls to dip sandwiches into. ; name: salt cod chowder ; ingredients: salt cod fish, fat salt pork, onion, raw potatoes, raw carrot, boiling water, salt, pepper, canned corn niblet, milk ; preparation:

name: mom s coconut pie ; ingredients: margarine, sugar, flour, eggs, milk, vanilla, coconut ; preparation:Melt margarine. In bowl, add margarine to sugar and flour and mix well. Beat in remaining ingredients. Pour mixture into two unbaked 9 inch pie shells. Bake at 350 degrees for 35-45 minutes. ; name: banana chip muffins ; ingredients: banana muffin mix, quick oats, mini chocolate chip, mashed banana, egg, milk ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Grease muffin pan. Combine all ingredients until well blended. Pour into prepared muffin pan. Bake 12 - 14 minutes. ; name: roasted eggplant for pasta and recipes ; ingredients: eggplants, olive oil, fresh ground black pepper, eggplant, garlic powder ; preparation:Place eggplant cubes on a plate and sprinkle with salt then let them sit for 30 minutes to remove bitterness. Rinse off the cubes in a collander then pat them dry with a paper towel. Preheat oven to 425 degrees f. Place eggplant cubes onto a nonstick baking sheet and drizzle the oil over them. Grind the fresh pepper over the eggplant to give them all a light dusting. Sprinkle the just under 1 tsp salt over the cubes. Sprinkle the garlic powder over the cubes. Bake for 30 minutes, give it a stir midway thru. ; name: ponkie ; ingredients: butternut squash, eggplant, beef, green pepper, onion, tomatoes, cayenne, ground coriander, olive oil, salt and pepper ; preparation:Soak the diced eggplant in salted water. Heat oil in pan and brown the onion. Add meat, salt, pepper and coriander. Saute for 10 minutes. Stir in peppers, tomatoes and squash. Drain the eggplant and stir into mixture. Reduce heat to low, cover and simmer for 20 minutes. Serve with rice or flat bread. ; name: alien urine sample halloween cocktail ; ingredients: ice, banana liqueur, midori melon liqueur, peach liqueur, coconut rum, blue curacao, soda water ; preparation:Half fill a cocktail shaker with ice. Add all ingredients except for the caracao & soda water. Shake & strain into a highball glass. Top with soda water, leaving enough room to. Float the blue caracao on top. ; name: vegan no bake chocolate oatmeal cookies ; ingredients: margarine, soymilk, sugar, cocoa powder, oats ; preparation:Put first 4 ingredients in saucepan and bring to a boil, stirring often. Boil 5 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in oats. Form into small balls and drop onto wax paper. Let cool and serve. ; name: cumin dusted pork cutlets with citrus pan sauce ; ingredients: all-purpose flour, ground cumin, salt, ground black pepper, pork cutlets, olive oil, garlic cloves, fresh orange juice, fresh lemon juice, orange wedge ; preparation:Mix first 4 ingredients on a plate. Coat pork in seasoned flour, shaking off extra. Heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil in a large skillet over medium high heat. Add pork and saut until cooked about 3 minutes per side. Transfer to plates. Add 4 tablespoons olive oil to skillet. Add garlic and saut until golden brown for about 10 minutes. Add orange juice and lemon juice. Broil until slightly thickened, whisking occasionally for about 30 seconds. Season with salt and pepper. Pour sauce over pork. Garnish with orange wedges and serve. ; name: kahlua pots de crme ; ingredients: eggs, heavy cream, sugar, egg yolks, grand marnier, kahlua, chocolate chips, vanilla extract, whipped cream ; preparation:

name: creamy quick cajun shrimp ; ingredients: large shrimp, lemon juice, worcestershire sauce, cajun seasoning, vegetable oil, onion, garlic, cream of chicken soup, milk, paprika ; preparation:In a large bowl, combine shrimp, lemon juice, worcestershire sauce and cajun seasonings. Toss to coat& set aside. In a large skillet, saute onion& garlic in vegetable oil until tender. Add soup, milk, and paprika, and bring to a boil. Add seasoned shrimp and heat through. Serve over rice or pasta. ; name: easy asian chicken ; ingredients: whole boneless skinless chicken breasts, soy sauce, white vinegar, brown sugar, garlic powder, black pepper ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Place chicken in glass baking dish. In a small bowl combine soy sauce, vinegar, brown sugar, garlic powder and black pepper. Stir or whisk until well blended. Pour sauce mixture over chicken. Bake chicken with sauce mixture for about 20 - 30 minutes or until chicken is cooked through. For best results turn chicken over half way through cooking. ; name: original enchiritos from tyson ; ingredients: ground beef, onion, refried beans, green chili peppers, enchilada sauce, flour tortillas, cheddar cheese ; preparation:Pre-heat oven to 350f. Grease bottom of 9x11 baking dish. In a medium skillet, brown ground beef with onion. Stir in refried beans, green chili peppers and 1 can enchilada sauce and heat until warm. Spoon 3 or 4 tablespoons of meat mxture onto a tortilla and sprinkle with cheese. Fold tortilla around mixture and place in baking dish. Repeat with remaining meat mixture. Top with 1 can enchilada sauce and remaining grated cheese. Bake for 15- 20 minutes. ; name: healthy low fat creamy potato apple brie soup ; ingredients: yellow onion, leek, granny smith apples, reduced-sodium fat-free chicken broth, bay leaf, salt, dried thyme, fat-free evaporated milk, potatoes, brie cheese ; preparation:Spray a soup pot with cooking spray, then add the onion, leeks and quartered apples, sauteing over medium heat until softened, 5 to 7 minutes. Add the chicken broth, bay leaf, salt and thyme, bringing to a boil, then reduce heat to low and simmer for about 15 minutes. Remove the bay leaf, and turn off heat and set the mixture aside. While the broth mixture is cooking, combine the evaporated milk and potatoes in a separate saucepan then cook over medium heat until the potatoes are tender, 15 to 20 minutes, stirring frequently. Pour the potato mixture into the soup pot. Stir to mix evenly. In a blender or food processor, puree the soup in batches until smooth, adding the pieces of brie cheese while pureeing. Return the pureed batch to the soup pot and heat until warmed through. Serve immediately. ; name: all to myself cheesecake ; ingredients: oreo cookies, cream cheese, sugar, vanilla, eggs, chocolate chips, shortening ; preparation:Beat cream cheese, sugar, vanilla and eggs together until smooth place an oreo with frosting side up in the bottom of a lined muffin cup. Top with cream cheese mixture. Top that with crushed oreo tops. Bake at 325 for 25 minutes. Remove from oven and cool. Melt shortening and chocolate chips until smooth. Drizzle over cooled cheesecakes. ; name: halloumi bites nigella lawson ; ingredients: garlic oil, parsley, lime juice, fresh ground pepper, halloumi cheese ; preparation:Combine the oil, parsley, lime juice, and pepper in a large shallow dish. Slice the drained halloumi into -inch wide pieces, and then cut each slice in half again. Heat a dry skillet and dry-fry the slices of cheese until golden on both sides. This should take only a minute or so in a hot pan. Put the fried halloumi into the shallow dish of other ingredients as you go, and then turn the halloumi about t coat each piece before turning into a serving dish. ; name: mom s out of this world salad aka green stuff ; ingredients: boiling water, lime gelatin, miniature marshmallow, pecans, crushed pineapple, shredded coconut, cottage cheese, cool whip, maraschino cherry ; preparation:Pour boiling water over gelatin & marshmellows. Stir until marshmellows are partically melted. Add crushed pineapple. Chill until partically congealed. Fold in nuts & cottage cheese, then whipped cream. Decorate with cherries if desired. Chill until firm. ; name: coconut macadamia nut french toast ; ingredients: coconut, corn flakes, macadamia nuts, eggs, milk, hawaiian sweet bread, vegetable oil, maple syrup, whipped cream ; preparation:

name: summer squash saute ; ingredients: butter, onion, garlic, fresh tarragon, crookneck yellow squash, zucchini ; preparation:Melt butter in large skillet over medium-high heat. Add onion, garlic and tarragon. Saute until onion is just tender, about 2 minutes. Add yellow squash and zucchini. Saute until crisp-tender, about 8 minutes or less. Season with salt and pepper and serve. ; name: little cheesecakes ; ingredients: cream cheese, sugar, eggs, vanilla, chocolate wafers, cherry pie filling ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees fahrenheit. Beat cream cheese at medium speed of electric mixer until fluffy. Mix in sugar. Add eggs one at a time, making sure the mixture is well blended. Stir in vanilla. Line 12 muffin cups with muffin paper, and place a chocolate wafer in each lined cup. Spoon the cream cheese mixture over the wafers. Bake for 20 minutes at 350 degrees. Remove muffin tin from oven, but leave the cakes in the muffin pan and refrigerate them overnight. Remove the cheesecakes from the muffin pan. To serve, spoon a tablespoon of cherry pie filling on each mini cheesecake. ; name: chunky pear and applesauce ; ingredients: mcintosh apples, pears, water, lemon juice, frozen apple juice concentrate, ground cinnamon, ground mace, nutmeg ; preparation:Place all ingredients in a heavy saucepan. Bring to a boil over medium heat, then reduce heat to a simmer. Cover and cook, stirring occasionally, until reduced to a chunky sauce, about 10 minutes. Remove from the heat, cool, and refrigerate until needed. You can also freeze in ice cube trays. Keep frozen cubes in a plastic bag so you can remove one portion at a time. ; name: chilled sage herb tea ; ingredients: fresh sage, fennel seeds, of fresh mint, lemon rind, boiling water, honey, ice cube, mint leaf ; preparation:Place the sage, fennel seeds, mint and lemon rind in a large teapot or plunger. Add the boiling water and cover with a lid. Set aside for 15 minutes to infuse. Strain into a jug and stir in honey to taste. Cover with plastic wrap and place in the fridge for 1 hour to chill. Place ice cubes and a few mint leaves in serving glasses and pour over the chilled tea to serve. ; name: sweet and tangy chicken ; ingredients: roasting chicken, mayonnaise, dry onion soup mix, russian salad dressing, apricot-pineapple preserves, cooked rice ; preparation:In a 12x8x2 inch dish, arrange chicken pieces with the thickest, meaty pieces to the outside edges of the dish. In a small bowl, stir together the mayonnaise, soup mix, dressing and preserves. Spread this mixture over the chicken, coating each piece well. Cover with wax paper. Microwave on high for 18-22 minutes. Let stand 5-10 minutes before you serve it so the chicken absorbs the flavor of the sauce. Serve over rice. ; name: havarti fondue ; ingredients: butter, flour, chicken broth, havarti cheese ; preparation:In heavy 3-quart saucepan, melt butter over low heat. Stir in flour. Cook 3 minutes, stirring constantly. Stir in broth. Heat to boiling. Boil 2 to 3 minutes, stirring constantly, until mixture is thick and smooth. Reduce heat to low. Add cheese, 1 cup at a time, stirring over low heat until cheese is melted and mixture is smooth. Pour cheese mixture into a fondue pot or a little crockpot. Keep warm over low heat. Serve with various dippers - french bread cubes, crackers, or vegetables. ; name: kleftiko ; ingredients: lemon, fresh oregano, salt, ground black pepper, lamb leg steaks, olive oil, onions, bay leaves, dry white wine, plain flour ; preparation:Mix together the lemon juice, oregano and salt and pepper and brush over both sides of the lamb. Leave to marinate for at least 4 hours or overnight. Preheat oven to 325 f. Drain the lamb, reserving marinade, and dry lamb with paper towel. Heat olive oil in frying pan and cook lamb over high heat just until browned on both sides. Transfer the lamb to a shallow pie dish. Scatter the sliced onions and bay leaves around the lamb, then pour the white wine and the reserved marinade on top. Mix the flour with sufficient water to make a firm dough. Moisten the rim of the pie dish. Roll out the dough on a floured surface and use to cover the dish so that it is tightly sealed. Bake for 2 hours, then break away the crust and serve the lamb hot. Potatoes make a great accompaniment. ; name: noodles and pot cheese turos teszia ; ingredients: wide egg noodles, pot cheese, butter, sour cream ; preparation:

name: scallop martinis ; ingredients: vodka, lime juice, jalapeno peppers, olive oil, fresh scallops, salt & freshly ground black pepper, red pepper, yellow pepper, green onions, coriander ; preparation:Combine vodka, lime juice and jalapeo pepper in bowl. Heat oil in a skillet over high heat. Season scallops with salt and pepper and place in skillet. Sear about 2 minutes per side or until scallops are browned on the outside but still raw in the centre. Place scallops on board and cut into quarters and add to vodka mixture. Let marinate for 4 hours in the refrigerator. Stir in peppers and green onions. Divide scallop mixture between 4 martini glasses adding some marinade. Garnish with coriander. Serve at once. ; name: poppy seed lemon pie ; ingredients: sweetened condensed milk, lemonade concentrate, frozen whipped topping, graham cracker crust, poppy seed, yellow food coloring ; preparation:In a mixing bowl, beat mild and lemonade concentrate until smooth. Fold in 2 cups whipped topping. Spread half into the crust. Add poppy seeds and food coloring to the remaining lemon mixture. Stir until blended. Spoon over first layer. Spread with the remaining whipped toping. Refrigerate until ready to serve. ; name: black currant mango iced tea ; ingredients: black currant tea bags, fresh mint leaves, limes, boiling water, splenda granular, mango juice, ice cube ; preparation:Place tea bags, mint and lime in large measuring cup or teapot. Cover with boiling water and steep for 10 minutes. Strain into large pitcher. Stir in splenda granulated until dissolved. Stir in mango juice. Serve over ice. ; name: homemade beefaroni ; ingredients: elbow macaroni, lean ground beef, garlic, onion, condensed tomato soup, water, sugar, salt and pepper ; preparation:Cook macaroni and drain. Brown together the ground beef, onion and garlic. Drain if needed. Mix in the soup, water and sugar to the beef mixture. Add the cooked macaroni and stir. Taste and add salt and pepper. Cook over medium heat for 15 minutes, stirring often. ; name: great garlic beer steaks ; ingredients: steaks, beer, oyster sauce, lemon, juice of, garlic cloves, black pepper, seasoning ; preparation:In a shallow glass dish, combine the beer, garlic, pepper, oyster sauce and lemon juice - mix well. Rub steaks on both sides with the grill seasoning and place them in the marinade. Be sure to coat the steaks well. Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours. Preheat the grill to high, and lightly oil the grate. Remove steaks from the marinade, and discard marinade. Grill steaks for about 5 min on each side, or to desired doneness. ; name: oven fried cheesy italian chicken ; ingredients: margarine, bisquick baking mix, parmesan cheese, italian seasoning, salt, garlic powder, pepper, broiler-fryer chickens ; preparation:Heat oven to 425. Heat margarine in 9 x 13 pan in oven until melted. Mix remaining ingredients except chicken. Coat chicken. Place skin side down in pan. Bake 35 minutes. Turn. Bake until done. About 15 minutes. ; name: english muffin chicken ; ingredients: boneless skinless chicken breasts, salt and pepper, plain yogurt, dijon mustard, english muffins, parmesan cheese, parsley, cayenne pepper ; preparation:Season chicken with salt and pepper. Combine yogurt and mustard. Marinate chicken in mixture for about 20 minutes. Combine crushed muffins, cheese, parsley and pepper. Remove chicken from yogurt mixture shaking off excess. Dredge chicken in english muffin crumbs. Place breaded chicken on cookie sheet and bake at 450 degrees for about 25 minutes. Chicken will be golden brown. ; name: 1960 tomato gravy ; ingredients: bacon grease, onion, flour, salt, pepper, canned tomatoes, sugar, bay leaf, celery leaves ; preparation:

name: avocado mango bruschetta ; ingredients: ciabatta rolls, extra virgin olive oil, avocado, fresh mango, red bell pepper, fresh basil, lime juice, salt & freshly ground black pepper ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400f. Place bread slices on a baking sheet and brush with 1 tablespoon olive oil. Bake for 5 to 10 minutes to lightly toast. In a large bowl, lightly stir together remaining oil with all remaining ingredients, being careful to not mash avocado. Serve with toasted bread slices. ; name: cauliflower patties ; ingredients: cauliflower, eggs, bisquick baking mix, parmesan cheese, garlic powder, oil ; preparation:Cook cauliflower till very tender and separate and chop into tiny pieces. Beat the eggs. Add bisquick, cheese, garlic powder and cauliflower until blended. Heat oil to coat and large frying pan. Drop spoonfuls of cauliflower mixture into the pan allowing room for patties to spread. Cook till brown on both sides and drain on plate covered with paper towels. Sprinkle with additional parmesan cheese if desired. Serve these as an appetizer or a side dish with zucchini sticks, stuffed mushrooms, etc. ; name: chips ahoy freezer dessert ; ingredients: chocolate chip cookies, cool whip, kahlua, milk ; preparation:Mix milk and kahlua and. Dip cookies in milk mixture for 5-6 seconds. Place cookies in the bottom of a 9 inch springform pan. Spread thin layer of cool-whip on top of cookies and repeat until desired depth. Reserve broken cookies for garnish. Top layer should be cool-whip then sprinkle top with reserved cookie crumbs or chocolate curls. Freeze until ready to use. Remove cake from freezer a few minutes before serving to thaw a little for easier cutting. ; name: ham mushroom pie ; ingredients: ham steak, pastry shells, condensed cream of mushroom soup, sour cream, eggs, chives, pepper ; preparation:Cut ham to fit the bottom of pastry shell. Place into shell. In a bowl, combine the remaining ingredients. Mix well. Pour over ham. Cover edges of piecrust loosely with foil to prevent over-browning. Bake at 425 for 35-40 minutes or until a knife inserted near the center comes out clean. ; name: hot chocolate deluxe ; ingredients: boiling water, chocolate syrup, milk, kahlua, whipped cream ; preparation:In a saucepan, mix together the boiling water and chocolate syrup. Add in the milk and stir until blended. Cook and stir over medium heat for 6-8 minutes or until well heated. Add in kahlua. Stir to combine. Pour into mugs or cups. Garnish with whipped cream. ; name: chili mushroom sauce ; ingredients: onion, mushroom, olive oil, curry powder, potato flour, water, cream, sweet chili sauce ; preparation:Fry the onion and mushrooms in the oil a couple of minutes. Add curry powder and fry gently until softened. Add potato flour, stir. Add water, cream and sweet chili sauce. Stir and cook 5-7 minutes on low heat. ; name: date and nut bars ; ingredients: egg, sugar, nuts, dates, milk, vanilla, all-purpose flour, baking powder ; preparation:Beat egg. Add sugar and remaining ingredients. Stir well. Bake at 350 in a greased 7x11 shallow pan for 30-40 minutes. When cool, cut into bars. Sprinkled with powdered sugar if desired. ; name: baked trout amandine ; ingredients: buttermilk, breadcrumbs, fresh parsley, mustard powder, salt, black pepper, trout fillets, slivered almonds, butter ; preparation:

name: bacon pumpkin and pesto pasta ; ingredients: pumpkin, olive oil flavored cooking spray, salt and pepper, dry penne pasta, bacon, basil pesto, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Pre-heat oven to 200c. Line a baking tray with non-stick baking paper, and place the pumpkin in a single layer onto the prepared tray. Spray with olive oil spray and season with salt and pepper. Bake pumpkin in oven for around 25 minutes or until tender. Bring a large pan of lightly salted water to the boil, then cook pasta according to the packet directions, until al dente. Drain and return to the pan. Saute the bacon in a shallow non-stick frying pan over medium-high heat for 5 minutes, stirring often. Add pesto to pasta and toss until coated, then add pumpkin and bacon and toss again until well combined. Divide among serving bowls and sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Serve immediately. ; name: wasabi popcorn ; ingredients: popped popcorn, butter, wasabi, salt, sugar ; preparation:Place popcorn in a large bowl. Microwave butter 20 seconds or until melted. Stir in wasabi until well blended. Drizzle wasabi butter over popcorn and stir to distribute. Sprinkle with salt and sugar, if desired, and stir again. ; name: raspberry chicken for the pressure cooker ; ingredients: sweet red wine, vinegar, raspberry jam, soy sauce, honey, dijon mustard, garlic clove, whole chickens, orange zest ; preparation:Mix all ingredients together except chicken and zest, stir until well combined. Taste and adjust sweetness to your personal preference. Pout mixture over chicken and let it marinate at least 4 hours, preferable overnight, in the refrigerator. Place chicken with marinade in the pressure cooker and bring to a boil. Seal, bring up to 15 pounds pressure, reduce heat to stabilize pressure and cook for 12 minutes. Remove from heat, depressurize using cold water, remove lid and remove chicken leaving marinade in pot. If a thicker sauce is desired, boil sauce in uncovered pot until it thickens. Pour thickened sauce over chicken and sprinkle with orange zest. ; name: almond paste or marzipan ; ingredients: ground almonds, caster sugar, powdered sugar, eggs, egg yolks, brandy, vanilla extract, lemon juice, food coloring ; preparation:Sift the 2 sugars into a bowl. Stir in the eggs and yolks. Place over a pan of nearly boiling water and whisk until thick and fluffy. Remove from heat and sit base in some cold water. Whisk in essence, brandy and juice. Carry on until cool. Stir in ground almonds and knead to form a firm paste. Use as you will. To cover a cake roll out into a circle and drape over the cake. Press into place and leave to set for at least 2 days. Ice the cake. ; name: caramel coffee cake ; ingredients: refrigerated buttermilk biscuits, margarine, brown sugar, almonds ; preparation:Preheat oven to 375f. Split each biscuit in two, rolling into small balls. Layer rolled biscuit pieces in a bundt pan. Combine margarine and brown sugar in small sauce pan. Bring to a boil and allow to boil for 2 minutes. Pour caramel mixture over biscuits and bake for approximately 40-45 minutes, or until golden brown. Carefully invert bundt pan onto a serving dish. Sprinkle nuts on top and serve immediately. ; name: brazilian pie ; ingredients: vanilla pudding mix, instant coffee, powdered cocoa mix, milk, whipping cream, pie shell, sliced almonds ; preparation:In a saucepan, combine pudding, coffee, cocoa, and milk. Cook over medium heat, stirring frequently, until mixture comes to a full boil. Remove from heat and continue to stir frequently until cool. Place plastic wrap directly onto pudding and chill in refrigerator for 1 hours. Beat slightly. Fold in whipping cream which has been beaten until stiff. Pour into pie shell. Garnish with sliced almonds. Refrigerate until ready to use. ; name: bourbon chicken wings ; ingredients: chicken wings, vegetable oil cooking spray, brown sugar, garlic powder, powdered ginger, soy sauce, bourbon, ketchup ; preparation:Lightly coat large non-stick skillet with cooking spray. Place frozen wings in a single layer in the prepared skillet. In a small bowl, combine the remaining ingredients. Pour mixture evenly over chicken. Cover and cook over medium heat 20 minutes or until chicken is no longer pink inside, turning wings often to prevent from sticking. ; name: spicy night cap ; ingredients: spiced rum, milk, cinnamon, sugar ; preparation:

name: ripley tomato salad ; ingredients: tomatoes, blue cheese, italian dressing, fresh basil, fresh ground black pepper, sea salt ; preparation:Cut the tomato into eight wedges. Top with crumbled blue cheese. Top with basil. Top with dressing. Season with salt and pepper to taste. ; name: pineapple fried rice ; ingredients: vegetable oil, garlic clove, fresh ginger, crushed red pepper flakes, cooked rice, light soy sauce, crushed pineapple in syrup, green onion ; preparation:In large nonstick skillet, heat oil over medium-low heat until hot. Add garlic, ginger and red pepper, cook and stir 2 minutes. Increase heat to medium-high. Add rice and soy sauce. Cook 2 minutes, stirring frequently. Add pineapple, tossing to combine. Heat rice through. Sprinkle with green onions before serving. ; name: pineapple and raspberry cocktail ; ingredients: fresh raspberries, fresh strawberries, icing sugar, lime, juice of, pineapple, grapefruit, oranges, lime ; preparation:Make the raspberry juice by whizzing together the raspberries, strawberries and icing sugar. Press through a sieve into a jug. Add about 100ml water to the sieve and push through the pulp to get as much flavour out of it as possible. Stir in the lime juice and chill until needed. Now make the pineapple juice by chopping up the flesh and whizzing in your food processor with the icing sugar. Push through a sieve into a jug. Add 100ml water and stir in the grapefruit, orange and lime juice. Stir until needed. Put a few ice cubes and a slice of lime in each glass. Fill up with the pineapple juice, then top with the raspberry juice. ; name: fresh tomato sandwiches saturday lunch on longmeadow farm ; ingredients: fresh tomatoes, white onion, butter, white bread, fresh chives ; preparation:Slice onions, tomatoes, and chives if using. Spread butter on 4 slices of bread. Top this bread with onions, tomatoes, and chives in this order. Top with other 4 slices, and lightly but firmly pressed top bread onto tomato topped bread. Slice in half, on the diagonal, and eat immediately. Serve with fresh iced tea or lemonade. Sit under a tree and let the warm breezes lull you into total enjoyment. ; name: vegetable fred ; ingredients: frozen mixed vegetables, salt, butter, sour cream, breadcrumbs, garlic salt, flour, velveeta cheese ; preparation:Cook veggies according to package, adding 2 tbsp. Butter, the salt, and garlic salt. To 8 tbsp. Melted butter add flour to make paste. Stir into veggies and cook until thickened, stirring constantly. Remove from heat and stir in sour cream and cheese. Pour into greased casserole dish and cover with crushed ritz crackers or bread crumbs. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes. ; name: washboard cookies ; ingredients: butter, brown sugar, egg, baking soda, hot water, vanilla, flour, sugar ; preparation:Cream butter, brown sugar, and egg. Stir together baking soda and water. Add to creamed mixture. Add flour and mix well. Shape into walnut sized balls. Place on greased cookie sheets. Flatten with fork. Sprinkle with sugar. Bake at 325f degrees for 15 minutes. ; name: tasty bbq ribs ; ingredients: beef, barbecue sauce, spaghetti sauce, brown sugar ; preparation:Line a deep roasting pan with foil. Place ribs in the bottom of pan. Pour bbq sauce and spaghetti sauce over top. Sprinkle brown sugar on top of sauces. Do not mix, just leave it layered. Bake uncovered at 250 degrees fahrenheit for 6 hours, or at 225 degrees fahrenheit for 8 to 10 hours. ; name: broccoli cheese appetizer tarts ; ingredients: wonton skins, butter, egg, flour, cooked broccoli, roasted red pepper, cheddar cheese, onion powder, dried thyme, pepper ; preparation:

name: orange salad with olives mint ; ingredients: red onion, navel oranges, olive oil, lemon juice, orange juice, of fresh mint, kosher salt, black olives ; preparation:Soak onions in ice water for 30 minutes, drain. Meanwhile, peel oranges as directed above, making sure as much of the white pith as possible is removed. Slice, crosswise as thinly as possible and save any juice that accumulates from the slicing. Lay the oranges in a spiral on a platter. Combine the oil, lemon and orange juice with salt, mint and any of the accumulated orange juice. Toss the onion slices over the oranges. Spread the dressing over both evenly. Then sprinkle with olives. ; name: basil chicken over angel hair pasta ; ingredients: angel hair pasta, olive oil, onion, garlic clove, chopped tomatoes, boneless chicken breast halves, fresh basil, salt, hot pepper sauce, parmesan cheese ; preparation:In a large pot of salted boiling water, cook angel hair pasta until it is al dente, about 8 to 10 minutes. Drain, and set aside. In a large skillet, heat oil over medium-high heat. Saute the onions and garlic. Stir in the tomatoes, chicken, basil, salt and hot pepper sauce. Reduce heat to medium, and cover skillet. Simmer for about 5 minutes, stirring frequently, until mixture is hot and tomatoes are soft. Toss sauce with hot cooked angel hair pasta to coat. Serve with parmesan cheese. ; name: monterey green beans ; ingredients: green onion, butter, green beans, mushrooms, lemon pepper seasoning, monterey jack pepper cheese ; preparation:In a saucepan, saute onions in butter until tender. Add beans, mushrooms and lemon pepper. Cover and cook over medium heat for 5 minutes or until beans are tender. Sprinkle with cheese. Cover and let stand for 1 minute or until cheese is melted. ; name: roasted herbed chicken with lemon ; ingredients: whole chickens, lemon, fresh rosemary, garlic, white wine, butter, red potatoes, fresh green beans, salt and pepper ; preparation:Clean and dry chicken and place in the crockpot. Pour butter over chicken and rub with rosemary. Add salt and pepper. Add to crockpot the garlic cloves, wine, and potatoes. Add green beans. Place lemon wedges on top of the chicken. Cook on high 4 hours, or on low for 8 hours. ; name: oprah s classic mashed potatoes ; ingredients: red potatoes, idaho potatoes, butter, creamy pureed horseradish, heavy cream, kosher salt, fresh black pepper ; preparation:Wash potatoes well, leaving the skins on. Cut the potatoes in half lengthwise. Place in a kettle and fill with enough water to cover potatoes. Bring to a boil, reduce heat and simmer until potatoes are very tender. Drain well and add butter while potatoes are hot. Begin to hand mash. Add all remaining ingredients and mash well leaving them just slightly lumpy. Makes about 10-12 cups or 6 to 8 servings. ; name: last minute meatloaf ; ingredients: ground chuck, small curd cottage cheese, egg, quick-cooking rolled oats, catsup, prepared mustard, onions, salt, pepper, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Combine beef with first 8 ingredients. Mix well but lightly until well-blended. Press mixture loosely into an 8-inch square baking dish. Bake at 350-degrees for 20 minutes. Remove from oven and sprinkle with grated parmesan cheese. Return to oven and bake 10 minutes longer. Let stand 5 minutes before cutting into squares. ; name: homemade grand marnier ; ingredients: orange zest, granulated sugar, cognac, glycerine ; preparation:Place zest and sugar in a small bowl. Mash together with the back of a wooden spoon or a muddle. Continue until sugar is absorbed into zest. Place in a container with a tight seal, preferably glass. Add cognac, stir and seal. Allow to age in a cool, dark place 2 to 3 months. Shake monthly. After initial aging, strain and filter. Stir with a wooden spoon to combine. Cap and age 3 months more before serving. ; name: easy campfire potatoes made in the oven ; ingredients: onion, butter, flour, salt, pepper, sharp cheddar cheese, milk, frozen hash brown potatoes ; preparation:

name: grilled corn with citrus butter ; ingredients: orange peel, lemon peel, lime peel, kosher salt, unsalted butter, vegetable oil cooking spray, corn ; preparation:Combine first 4 ingredients in small bowl. Mash to combine. Mix in butter. Preheat barbecue. Spray corn with nonstick spray. Grill until browned in spots, turning often, about 15 minutes. Serve with citrus butter. ; name: parmesan rice pilaf ; ingredients: butter, white rice, chicken broth, garlic powder, parsley flakes, ground black pepper, parmesan cheese, sliced almonds ; preparation:Melt butter in a medium sauce pan on medium heat. Add rice, cook and stir three minutes. Stir in chicken broth, garlic powder, parsley flakes and pepper. Bring to a boil, reduce to low, cover and simmer 20 minutes or until rice in tender. Stir in parmesan cheese and sliced almonds. ; name: ham and asparagus roll ups ; ingredients: asparagus, cream cheese, horseradish, dijon-style mustard, worcestershire sauce, ham ; preparation:Cook asparagus until crisp-tender. Mix together cream cheese, horseradish, mustard and worcestershire sauce. On each slice of ham spread a thin layer of cheese mixture. Place one spear of asparagus at one end of ham slice, and roll up, jelly roll-style. Slice into bite-sized pieces. Chill. ; name: world s most dangerous cake ; ingredients: flour, sugar, cocoa, egg, milk, oil, chocolate chips, vanilla ; preparation:Mix dry ingredients in large coffee mug. Add egg & mix thoroughly. Add milk and oil, mix well. Add vanilla and mix well. Microwave at 1000 watts for 3 minutes. ; name: raspberry topped lemon pie ; ingredients: 9-inch graham cracker crust, frozen raspberries in light syrup, cornstarch, egg yolks, eagle brand condensed milk, realemon juice, yellow food coloring, whipped topping ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 deg. In saucepan, combine raspberries and cornstarch. Cook and stir until thickened. In bowl, beat egg yolk. Stir in sweetened condensed milk, realemon juice and food coloring if desired. Pour over crust. Bake 8 minutes. Spoon raspberry mixture over top. Chill 4 hours. Spread with whipped topping. Garnish as desired. Refrigerate leftovers. ; name: refrigerator cucumber slices ; ingredients: cucumbers, onions, sugar, cider vinegar, pickling salt, mustard seeds, alum ; preparation:In a large container, combine cucumbers and onions. In a large bowl, combine the remaining ingredients, stirring, until sugar is dissolved. Pour over cucumber mixture. Mix well. Cover and chill overnight. May be refrigerated for up to 2 weeks. ; name: meatballs that make their own sauce ; ingredients: whole wheat bread, water, lean ground beef, parsley, onions, egg, dried oregano, garlic, salt and pepper, tomato juice ; preparation:Moisten bread with water. Mix throughly with remaining meatball ingredients. Shape into 8 medium or 16 small meatballs. Brown meatballs on all sides. Combine sauce ingredients in large saucepan. Heat to boiling. Add meatballs. Simmer uncovered until tomato juice has reduced to a fairly-thick sauce-about one hour. Skim any fat.
