Put into a medium frypan and drizzle with oil and massage the oil in to break up the half rings. Cover frypan and cook over a low to moderate heat giving a stir occasionally until a nice golden colour, the longer you take the sweeter the onion will be. Put sweet potatoes in a pot of cold water and season with a little salt and bring to the boil and cook till tender. When potatoes are cook, drain and give a good shake, put in butter and mash till you get the consistency you like. Add your caramelised onions and mix in well and season with salt and pepper to taste. ; name: simplified choucroute garni for crock pot pork chops sauerk ; ingredients: dried italian seasoning, salt, pepper, potatoes, boneless pork chops, tart apples, sauerkraut, kielbasa, sweet white wine, frozen peas ; preparation:

name: betty crocker peach pancakes ; ingredients: egg, flour, milk, vegetable oil, sugar, baking powder, salt, cinnamon, peach ; preparation:Beat egg with hand beater until fluffy. Add rest of ingredients. Grease griddle and heat. Pour about 3 tbsp batter onto hot griddle and cook until edges of pancake puff and look dry around edges. Flip, and cook opposite side until golden brown. ; name: basic rolls ; ingredients: warm water, active dry yeast, sugar, butter, egg, salt, flour ; preparation:Measure water into a warm bowl. Dissolve yeast into water. Add sugar, butter, egg, and salt. Add enough flour to make the dough easy to handle. Knead the dough until it becomes smooth and elastic. Place in a greased bowl to rise until double in size. Divide the dough into small balls and place in greased muffin cups. Brush with butter, if desired. Let rise again until double in size, about another hour. Bake at 375 for 10 - 15 minutes. ; name: barley and pine nut pilaf ; ingredients: pearl barley, butter, pine nuts, scallion, fresh parsley, salt, ground black pepper, chicken broth ; preparation:Preheat your oven to 350. Rinse the barley in cold water and drain. In a medium skillet, heat the butter and brown the pine nuts, be careful, they burn easily so watch them. Remove with a slotted spoon and reserve. Saute the scallions and barley until the barley is lightly toasted. Remove from the heat and stir in the nuts, parsley, salt and pepper- spoon this mixture into an ungreased 2-quart casserole dish. Heat the broth to boiling and pour over the barley mixture. Stir to blend well, bake, uncovered, for 1 hour and 10 minutes. ; name: baked panko chicken parmesan ; ingredients: chicken tenderloins, parmesan cheese, panko breadcrumbs, italian seasoning, salt, black pepper, garlic powder, eggs ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Beat eggs in a bowl. Combine cheeses, bread crumbs and spices in a separate bowl. Dip chicken pieces in egg, then bread crumb mixture, then egg, then bread crumb mixture again. Place chicken on a cookie sheet and bake at 350 degrees for 35 minutes. Serve over pasta with marinara sauce and mozzarella. Or place chicken on a hoagie roll with marinara and mozzarella for a chicken parmesan sub. Also great for dipping with marinara or ranch. ; name: jamaican pumpkin soup ; ingredients: onion, pumpkin, chicken stock, scotch bonnet pepper, scallions, garlic cloves, bay leaf, fresh thyme, salt and pepper, butter ; preparation:Saut onions in butter in a large pot until transparent. Add pumpkin and fill with stock. Add the remaining ingredients and bring to boil. Simmer for about half an hour or to desired consistency. Remove scotch bonnet pepper and serve hot. ; name: dutch almond cookies amandel koekjes ; ingredients: butter, white sugar, brown sugar, eggs, almonds, flour, baking soda, almond paste ; preparation:Cream butter and sugars together. Then beat in the eggs. Add the flour and soda and then mix in the almond paste. If dough gets too stiff andd a few drops of water. Mix in the nut meats. Drop by teaspoonful on greased cookie sheet. Bake in 325 oven for 15 minutes. ; name: diabetic chai tea ; ingredients: water, black tea, nonfat milk, splenda sugar substitute, ground ginger, ground nutmeg, ground cinnamon ; preparation:Heat water to boiling. Add tea bags. Reduce heat and simmer for 2 to 4 minutes, depending on how strong you like your tea. Remove tea bags and add spices. Simmer for additional 2 minutes. Add milk and splenda, heat to a near boil stirring constantly. Serve and enjoy. ; name: sweet cream cheese ball ; ingredients: cream cheese, powdered sugar, mini chocolate chip, vanilla, pecans, graham cracker sticks ; preparation:

name: snow fudge ; ingredients: sugar, sour cream, unsalted butter, white chocolate chips, marshmallow creme, walnuts ; preparation:Combine sugar, sour cream and butter in a saucepan. Bring mixture to a rolling boil stirring constantly. Boil for 7 minutes over medium heat stirring continuously. Remove pan from heat and stir in white chocolate chips until completely melted. Add marshmallow creme and walnuts. Beat by hand until completely blended. Spread into a greased 9x9 pan. ; name: garlic roasted potato salad ; ingredients: new potato, extra virgin olive oil, garlic cloves, mayonnaise, creole mustard, parsley, scallions, lemon, juice of, salt and black pepper ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a bowl, toss potatoes, garlic, and olive oil together to coat. Place potatoes in a single layer on a baking sheet. Sprinkle with salt and pepper to taste. Place in 350 degree oven for 15-20 minutes, or until tender, allow to cool for 10 minutes. Combine mayonnaise, creole mustard, lemon juice, parsley, and scallions. Add to potatoes. Add salt or pepper to taste. Serve cold or room temperature. ; name: roasted potatoes with sage and garlic ; ingredients: small potatoes, flour, oil, garlic cloves, sage leaf, unsalted butter, kosher salt, fresh pepper ; preparation:Preheat oven to 450f and place a large, heavy skillet or roasting pan in the oven to heat. Place the potatoes in a large saucepan and cover with cold salted water. Put on high heat to boil. Once boiling, lower heat and simmer for 5 minutes. Drain the potatoes well, and place on paper towels. Put the flour on a plate. When the potatoes are dry, roll them in the flour to coat. Remove the hot skillet from the oven and add the oil and potatoes. Roast, shaking the pan occasionally until the potatoes are golden brown all over, about 30 minutes. Remove from the oven and add the garlic, sage and butter. Return to the oven for one minute. Season generously with salt and pepper and serve. ; name: low fat guacamole with cottage cheese ; ingredients: avocado, low fat cottage cheese, fresh lime juice, green onion, jalapeno, garlic cloves, salt and pepper ; preparation:Slice the avocado in half and scoop out the flesh. In a food processor, combine the avocado, cottage cheese, lime juice, green onions, jalapeo and garlic. Pure until smooth. Add salt and pepper to taste. Serve immediately or chill. Serve with raw veggies or tortilla chips. ; name: english muffin chicken pizza ; ingredients: english muffins, pizza sauce, chicken breasts, mozzarella cheese ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350. Halve the english muffins and spread each with 1 tablespoon pizza sauce. Add one slice of chicken and top with one slice of cheese. Place on baking sheet and bake for 10 minutes or until cheese is melted. We have also toasted the muffins and cooked these in the microwave. ; name: oriental cabbage ; ingredients: onion, water, garlic clove, fresh ginger, sesame oil, cabbage, soy sauce ; preparation:Slice onion. Place in bowl with water. Cover and microwave on high for 3 minutes. Put onion in large skillet with remaining ingredients. Cook, covered, over medium-low heat, stirring occasionally, until cabbage is tender, about 20 minutes. ; name: sesame and herbes de provence chicken tenders rachael ray ; ingredients: sea salt, sesame seeds, dried onion flakes, herbes de provence, chicken tenders, shallot, sherry wine vinegar ; preparation:Pre-heat oven to 400. Mix the salt, seeds, onion and herbs on shallow plate. Coat chicken tenders in mixture and bake on nonstick baking sheet 18-20 minutes unitil golden and firm. Turn halfway through the cooking. Combine the shallots with the sherry vinegarfor dip. ; name: apple spiced sweet potatoes ; ingredients: sweet potatoes, apple pie filling, golden raisin, butter, apple pie spice, pecans, sugar ; preparation:

name: baileys butterball ; ingredients: caramel topping, dark chocolate, butterscotch schnapps, ice cubes, baileys irish cream, light cream ; preparation:Place topping and chocolate on separate plates. Dip rims of 4 serving glasses in topping, then in chocolate. Place on a tray lined with non-stick baking paper, rim-side down and refrigerate for 5 minutes or until set. Combine baileys and cream in separate jug. Divide butterscotch schnapps evenly among serving glasses. Top with ice. Pour over combined baileys and cream. Serve immediately. ; name: oatmeal banana muffins ; ingredients: flour, rolled oats, baking powder, baking soda, egg, white sugar, butter, mashed bananas, raisins ; preparation:Mix all together well. Place in muffin liners. This recipes is very easily doubled and tripled. You can add nuts or chocolate chips too for a change. Mix all together, place in x-large muffin liners. Bake for 20-25 minutes at 325. Makes 12 big muffins. ; name: haddock steamed with veggies ; ingredients: haddock, red cabbage, spanish onion, tomatoes, sharp cheddar cheese, salt & freshly ground black pepper ; preparation:Bring water in a steamer to a boil, lower heat to a simmer. Layer ingredients in the steamer. Cabbage, break the slice up a little, the slice of onion, broken into rings. Sprinkle with salt and pepper to taste. Sprinkle 1 tablespoon cheese over evenly, add the slice of tomato. Season the fish with salt and pepper and place the fish fillets evenly over the tomato and top with the other tablespoon of cheese. Steam for approximately 10 minutes or until the cabbage is tender crisp and the fish is flaky. Try to retain the layers to remove to plate. ; name: smoked salmon souffle healthy south beach diet low carb ; ingredients: eggs, egg whites, nonfat milk, reduced-fat cream cheese, light whole wheat bread, spinach, asparagus spears, smoked salmon, chives, salt and pepper ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350f coat in 2-qt baking dish with cooking spray. In a large bowl, beat the eggs and egg whites until frothy. Stir in remaining ingredients. Pour into prepared baking dish. Bake for 45 minutes, or until golden and knife inserted in center comes out clean. ; name: mexican egg melts ; ingredients: eggs, plain yogurt, red onions, mexican seasoning, english muffins, green chilies, mexican cheese ; preparation:Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Stir together eggs, yogurt, onion and mexican seasoning. Lightly toast english muffins and place on a foil covered baking sheet. Top each muffin with equal amounts of egg mixture, chilies and cheese. Bake for 10 min or until eggs are warmed and cheese is melted. ; name: cheese stuffed mushrooms ; ingredients: mushrooms, green onion, garlic cloves, butter, dry breadcrumbs, parmesan cheese, parsley, salt, basil, pepper ; preparation:Remove mushroom stems and chop finely. In a small pan, cook stems, green onions, garlic and butter over medium heat til tender, about 5 minutes. Remove from heat and add all remaining ingredients except caps. Fill caps with mixture, place in baking dish. Bake 350f for 15 minutes. ; name: mum s leek and potato soup ; ingredients: butter, leeks, onion, potatoes, salt, pepper, boiling water, chicken stock, milk, cream ; preparation:Wash leeks and chop up. Melt butter in saucepan and add chopped onions and leeks. Fry for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add the potatoes, water, stock and salt. Bring to the boil and then simmer for 20 minutes. When vegetables are tender, put through blender. Return to saucepan and re-heat. Add milk, cream and pepper. Do not re-boil. Serve in soup bowls with bread and butter or french stick and butter on the side. ; name: chilean cilantro salsa pebre ; ingredients: garlic clove, salt, fresh ground pepper, olive oil, sherry wine vinegar, green onions, jalapenos, fresh cilantro leaves, water ; preparation:

name: peanutty chocolate pudding ; ingredients: nonfat milk, sugar-free instant chocolate pudding mix, natural-style peanut butter, sugar-free whipped topping ; preparation:In a mixing bowl, combine milk and pudding mix. Beat on low speed for 2 minutes. Beat in peanut butter until smooth. Spoon into desert dishes. Top with whipped topping if desired. ; name: krispies chocolate chippers ; ingredients: margarine, sugar, vanilla, eggs, flour, salt, baking powder, baking soda, chocolate chips, rice krispies ; preparation:Cream margarine and sugar in mixer bowl til light and fluffy. Add vanilla and eggs. Beat for 5 minutes. Sift flour, salt, baking powder and baking soda into mixture. Mix well. Stir in chocolate chips and rice krispies. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto non-stick cookie sheet. Bake at 375f for 9-10 minutes, or until golden brown. Cool on wire rack. ; name: teresa s stuffed pepper soup ; ingredients: ground beef, tomato sauce, diced tomatoes, rice, green peppers, tomatoes and green chilies, beef bouillon cubes, brown sugar, salt, pepper ; preparation:Brown the meat and drain. Place in large stock pot. If you like your green peppers soft, place in microwave for 2-3 minutes prior to placing them in the pan. If you like them crunchy, add them directly to the pot. Add remaining ingredients and bring to a boil, adding rotel tomatoes if you want to make it spicier. Reduce heat and simmer for 30-40 minutes. Add more tomato juice or water if it is too thick. ; name: penne with tomato mozzarella arugula pasta ; ingredients: olive oil, garlic cloves, tomatoes, salt, arugula, mozzarella cheese, penne, parmesan cheese, chili pepper flakes ; preparation:Heat oil, add garlic and saut until golden brown. Pour into a large bowl. Chop tomatoes and toss with salt. Cut arugula into strips and toss most of it with the tomatoes, saving some to top dish before serving. Mix together with oil, tomatoes, garlic and greens while boiling slated water for pasta. While pasta is cooking, cut mozzarella into small pieces. Mix all ingredients with hot cooked pasta. Sprinkle with remaining arugula and red pepper flakes. ; name: vietnamese spiced pork chops ; ingredients: boneless center cut pork chops, cooking spray, green onion, brown sugar, paprika, ground coriander, salt, crushed red pepper flakes, minced ginger, garlic ; preparation:Lightly score a diamond pattern on both sides of pork. Combine the ingredients for the rub and rub evenly over pork. Let rest at least 5 minutes. Heat a large nonstick skillet coated with cooking spray over medium-high heat. Add pork. Cook 4 minutes on each side or until done. Garnish with sliced green onions, if desired. ; name: janet s onion rice ; ingredients: long grain white rice, french onion soup, water, butter, sliced water chestnuts, frozen baby peas, soy sauce ; preparation:In a skillet, with a tight fitting lid, saute the rice in the butter until a light golden brown. Stir frequently during this process. Add onion soup and the can of water and cover and simmer until the water is nearly all absorbed. Add the peas and water chestnuts and continue to simmer until the water is completely absorbed. If you like the rice alittle more salty, add soy sauce to your taste. ; name: cheese filled little potatoes ; ingredients: red potatoes, plain yogurt, parmesan cheese, garlic cloves, pepper, nonstick cooking spray ; preparation:Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Lightly spray a baking sheet with nonstick cooking spray. Cut each potato in half lengthwise. Using the small side of a melon ball scoop, cut a ball out of the center of each potato half. Slice a very thin sliver off the bottom of each potato to keep them from rolling around in the pan. Place potatoes on baking sheet, skin-side down, and spray lightly with cooking spray. Bake uncovered 30-35 minutes until potatoes are tender. While potatoes are baking, combine remaining ingredients in a small bowl. Mix well and set aside. When potatoes are tender, remove from oven and set the oven to broil. Fill the hole in each potato with yogurt mixture. Place potatoes under the broiler for a few minutes, until cheese is hot and begins to brown. ; name: indonesian corn patties ; ingredients: corn kernels, fish sauce, fresh cracked pepper, crushed red pepper flakes, shallots, egg, cornflour, oil ; preparation:

name: croatian dalmatian shrimps chowder ; ingredients: shrimp, potatoes, fish, olive oil, lemons, juice of, fresh parsley leaves, pepper, salt ; preparation:Divide heads and tails from shrimps. Cook pealed potato with fish and head and shells of shrimps about 30 minutes. When done, remove shrimp shells, potato and fish from soup and drain the soup. Clean the fish and mix with potato. Make puree out of fish and potato. When done, put puree into drained fish stock. Let it boil for minute or two. Remove meat from shrimp tails and put them into soup. Add olive oil, lemon juice, parsley leaves and season with salt and pepper. Cook not more than 15 minutes. Serve hot. ; name: holiday vegan golden gravy ; ingredients: flour, nutritional yeast flakes, oil, water, soy sauce, salt & pepper ; preparation:Toast flour and yeast flakes in a pan until they release a nutty aroma. Add the oil or margarine and stir until bubbly. Add the water and cook until mixture begins to thicken, stirring constantly. Add soy sauce, salt and pepper. Serve warm over tofu or other meal. ; name: cherry cupcakes ; ingredients: chocolate cake mix, eggs, water, vegetable oil, cherry pie filling, vanilla frosting ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Prepare cake mix according to package directions, using the eggs, water, and oil. Spoon batter into 24 paper-lined muffin pan cups, filling two-thirds full. Remove 24 cherries from cherry pie filling and set aside. Spoon generous teaspoon of remaining cherry filling onto center of each cupcake. Bake in preheated 350 degree oven for 20-25 minutes. Cool in pans on wire racks for 10 minutes, then remove from pan and let cool completely. Frost cupcakes with vanilla frosting, and garnish each one with a reserved cherry. ; name: thai celery rice cooker rice ; ingredients: butter, garlic clove, celery, carrot, rice, water, dried chili ; preparation:Saute. Carrot. Add celery. Add garlic. Put into rice cooker. Add rice water and chili. Cook. ; name: mexicali round steak ; ingredients: round steaks, frozen corn, fresh cilantro, fat free low-sodium beef broth, celery, onion, salsa, black beans, fat-free cheddar cheese, cooked white rice ; preparation:Cut beef into 6 pieces. Place in slow cooker. Combine remaining ingredients, except cheese, and pour over beef. Cover and cook on low for 8 to 9 hours. Sprinkle with cheese before serving. Serve vegetables over cooked white rice. ; name: special banana nut bread ; ingredients: flour, baking powder, salt, sugar, canola oil, milk, egg, walnuts, banana, brown sugar ; preparation:Combine all ingredients except for brown sugar and beat on medium speed for 30 seconds. Pour batter into greased loaf pan and generously sprinkle top with brown sugar. Bake at 350 f for 55-65 minutes, or until an inserted toothpick comes out clean. Remove from pan and cool completely on wire rack. Slice when cool. ; name: fruity smokies ; ingredients: cocktail franks, apricot preserves, orange marmalade, mustard ; preparation:Prepare cocktail franks according to packaging. Combine the apricot and orange preserves in a pot over medium heat and mix well. Stir in mustard. Combine franks and sauce, coating franks completely. This can be kept warm in a crockpot for serving. ; name: easy for sheezy goulash ; ingredients: ground turkey, olive oil, garlic, spaghetti sauce, sweet corn, onion, italian seasoning, elbow macaroni ; preparation:

name: cajun okra stew ; ingredients: fresh tomatoes, lima beans, black-eyed peas, fresh okra, onion, garlic cloves, cajun seasoning, salt & pepper, olive oil ; preparation:Heat olive oil in a large stew pot. Add chopped onions and garlic and saute for 2-3 minutes. Add chopped tomatoes, lima beans, blackeye peas and cajun seasoning. Bring to a boil, stir well. Reduce heat and simmer on low 30 minutes, stirring occasionally. If the stew gets too thick add water as needed. Add chopped okra, stir well. Simmer another 15 minutes. Serve over rice. ; name: green pea and potato soup ; ingredients: frozen peas, potatoes, chicken stock, water, olive oil, onion, garlic, parmesan cheese, salt and pepper ; preparation:Heat oil in a large saucepan, add onion and garlic, cook, stirring until the onion is soft. Pour the chicken stock into the saucepan with the onion and garlic and bring to the boil. Add the potatoes, boil uncovered for 5 minutes. Stir in the peas, bring to the boil and cook for a further 5 minutes or until the chopped potatoes are tender. Blend potato and pea mixture in batches until smooth. Serve soup with sprinkled with parmesan cheese. ; name: cod vera cruz ; ingredients: cod fish fillet, condensed tomato soup, condensed chicken broth, salsa, lime juice, fresh cilantro, dried oregano, garlic powder, cooked rice ; preparation:Place fish in a 2-qt shallow baking dish. Mix, soup, broth, salsa, lime juice, cilantro, oregano and garlic powder. Pour over fish. Bake at 400 for 20 minute or until fish flakes easily. Serve over rice. ; name: christmas cheese ball ; ingredients: cream cheese, sharp cheddar cheese, onion, pimiento, green pepper, worcestershire sauce, lemon juice, pecans, cracker ; preparation:Combine the first seven ingredients in a bowl and mix well. Shape into 2 balls. Roll in the pecans. Cover and chill. Remove from refrigerator 15 minutes before serving. Serve with crackers. ; name: pineapple and macadamia cheese ; ingredients: macadamia nuts, camembert cheese, dried pineapple, cream cheese, of fresh mint, curry powder ; preparation:Chop nuts roughly and set 3 tablespoons aside for topping. Using a sharp knife, cut a thin top off the cheese and discard the rind. Using a teaspoon, scoop out the cheese and place in small bowl. Mix in the nuts, pineapple, cream cheese, herbs and curry powder. Stir until mixture is soft and creamy. Spoon the mixture into empty cheese shell. Sprinkle the reserved nuts on top. Serve at room temperature with crackers. ; name: guatemala rellenitos de platano ; ingredients: plantains, refried black beans, white sugar, salt, oil ; preparation:Place the plantains in a large pot and cover with water. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer until tender, 15 minutes, then drain and mash. In a small saucepan over low heat, heat the refried beans and stir in the sugar and salt, mix well then remove from heat. To make the rellenitos, form a palm-sized amount of mashed plantains into a ball. Flatten and place about a teaspoon of the bean mixture in the middle. Then mold the sides of the plantain around the beans, making an egg-shaped ball. Heat oil in a deep-fryer or large skillet to 375 degrees f or until a small amount of batter sizzles and browns in the oil. Fry rellenitos in oil until browned and drain on paper towels. Enjoy plain, with sugar or with sour cream. ; name: tomato and crispy bacon fettuccini ; ingredients: dry fettuccine, lean bacon, green beans, yellow pepper, pasta sauce, dried basil, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Cook fettuccini in a large saucepan of boiling water until dente and drain well. Heat a dash of oil in a frying pan and quickly cook the bacon pieces until crisp and golden, set aside. Add the beans and pepper to the pan and cook until tender. Pour in the pasta sauce, add the bacon and cook, stirring until hot. Toss through the well drained fettuccini with basil leaves. Serve with grated parmesan cheese on the side. ; name: cranberry tea hot punch ; ingredients: tea bags, boiling water, unsweetened cranberry juice, apple cider, brown sugar, cinnamon stick, ginger, cloves, cinnamon sticks, orange slices ; preparation:

name: crock pot baked sliced apples 1 ww point ; ingredients: cooking apples, seedless raisin, splenda granular, apple pie spice, unsweetened apple juice, reduced-calorie margarine ; preparation:Spray a slow cooker container with butter-flavored cooking spray. Combine apples and raisins in crock. Add splenda, apple pie spice, and apple juice. Mix well to combine. Dot top with margarine. Cover and cook on low for 4-6 hours. ; name: roast rack of pork with port sauce ; ingredients: pork loin, salt, pepper, rosemary, garlic, olive oil, low sodium beef broth, port wine ; preparation:Rub salt, pepper and rosemary into the meat. Then pat garlic on. Make several slits with knife and stuff some garlic in the holes. Heat olive oil in large pan on high heat, add meat. Brown about 12-15 minutes transfer to baking pan that can be used on the stove top and bake 1 hour at 375 degrees. Remove meat and pour fat from the pan. Add port wine to the pan, heat on high, loosen all remnants stuck to bottom of pan as you go. Lower heat to medium high and add stock. Let it come to a slow boil for about 15 minutes to reduce. Skim off excess fat, serve with pork. ; name: ooey gooey butter bars ; ingredients: yellow cake mix, margarine, egg, coconut, nuts, cream cheese, eggs, powdered sugar, vanilla ; preparation:Mix together cake mix, melted margarine and 1 egg. Press this mixture into an oblong baking pan. Add a layer of coconut and chopped nuts. Mix together cream cheese, 2 eggs, powdered sugar and vanilla. Spread over coconut and nuts. Bake for 35 minutes at 350 degrees. Cool and cut into small squares. ; name: virginia barbecue ; ingredients: boneless pork loin roast, onion, ketchup, sugar, dry mustard, chili powder, worcestershire sauce, cider vinegar, cayenne pepper ; preparation:Cut roast into chunks. Place in 3-quart or larger slow cooker. Mix onion, ketchup, sugar, mustard, chili powder, worcestershire sauce, vinegar, pepper. Pour on roast. Cook on low for 8 hours. Remove pork from cooker. Shred. Mix with sauce in cooker. ; name: great eggplant dip ; ingredients: eggplant, onion, breadcrumbs, plain yogurt, cloves, parsley, cider vinegar, lemon juice, olive oil ; preparation:Place whole eggplant on oven tray. Bake in a hot oven for one hour or till soft. Remove from oven, cool slightly. Peel eggplant, chop flesh roughly. Combine flesh with remaining ingredients in food processor. Process till smooth. Refrigerate mixture overnight. ; name: orange or lemon glazed snap peas and carrots ; ingredients: butter, onion, dried basil, salt, pepper, orange juice, frozen sugar snap peas, carrot, fresh parsley, orange zest ; preparation:In a large nonstick skillet, melt butter over medium-high heat. Add onion, basil, salt and pepper. Cook, stirring, until just tender, about 3-5 minutes. Add orange juice, bring to boil. Stir in snap peas and carrots. Reduce heat to medium. Cover. Cook 4 minutes. Remove from heat. Add parsley and zest. Transfer to serving bowl. ; name: peach cobbler dump cake ; ingredients: yellow cake mix, peaches in heavy syrup, butter, ground cinnamon ; preparation:Preheat oven to 375f. Empty peaches into the bottom of a 13 x 9- inch pan. Cover with the dry cake mix and press down firmly. Cut butter or margarine into small pieces and place on top of cake mix. Sprinkle top with cinnamon. Bake for 45 minutes. ; name: roasted sweet potatoes with pineapple and pecans ; ingredients: vegetable oil, sweet potatoes, fresh pineapple, salt, pecans, pure maple syrup, orange marmalade, fresh lemon juice, dijon mustard ; preparation:

name: napa salad ; ingredients: coleslaw mix, green onions, beef-flavor ramen noodles, butter, slivered almonds, sunflower seeds, salad oil, soy sauce, sugar, white vinegar ; preparation:Put slaw in a large bowl. Add diced onions. Break up ramen noodles and add them to bowl set the bowl aside. Melt butter in a skillet and brown almonds and sunflower seeds. Cool the almonds and sunflower seeds, then add them to the bowl. Place all of the dressing ingredients in a separate bowl. Whisk together and pour over slaw mixture. Serve immediately. ; name: venetian panino ; ingredients: gruyere, butter, dijon mustard, garlic clove, turkey, whole wheat bread, olive oil ; preparation:Add the cheese, butter, mustard, and garlic to food processor. Blend until thick, smooth and spreadable. Spread the cheese mixture over 1 side of each bread slice. Arrange the turkey slices over the cheese mixture on half of the bread slices. Top with the remaining bread slices and press gently. Cut the sandwiches in half. Heat 3 tablespoons of oil in a heavy skillet over medium-low heat. Cook half of the sandwiches until golden brown, about 4 minutes per side. Transfer to serving platter and tent with foil to keep them warm. Repeat with remaining 3 tablespoons of oil and sandwiches. Serve immediately. ; name: simple italian bean salad ; ingredients: spring onions, garlic cloves, red chile, cannellini beans, butter beans, olive oil, white wine vinegar, salt and pepper, flat leaf parsley ; preparation:In a large bowl, combine the spring onions, garlic and chili. Add the three cans of beans and mix thoroughly. Whisk together the olive oil and white wine vinegar and season. Drizzle over the bean salad and stir in with the parsley. Serve straight away or refrigerate until ready. ; name: pasta salad with chicken and artichokes ; ingredients: pasta shells, oil, mayonnaise, lemon juice, parsley, dried basil, chicken, artichokes, tabasco sauce, toasted almond ; preparation:Cook pasta in large pot of boiling, salted water until tender, but firm, 8 to 12 minutes, stirring often. Drain well and rinse with cold water. Shake out excess water and toss pasta with oil. Combine mayonnaise, lemon juice, parsley and basil. Place pasta in large bowl. Add mayonnaise mixture, chicken, artichokes and tabasco. Toss well. Garnish with almonds. For a decorative presentation, serve in avacado halves, in tomato cups or on lettuce leaves. ; name: chocolate passion bowl ; ingredients: milk, chocolate flavor instant pudding and pie filling mix, whipped topping, brownie, raspberries ; preparation:Pour milk into large bowl. Add dry pudding mixes. Beat with wire whisk until well blended. Gently stir in 1 cup of the whipped topping. Place half of the brownie cubes in 2-quart serving bowl. Top with half of the pudding mixture, half of the raspberries, and half of the remaining whipped topping. Repeat all layers. Refrigerate at least 1 hour or until ready to serve. ; name: weight watchers strawberry pie ; ingredients: fat-free sugar-free instant vanilla pudding mix, water, sugar-free strawberry gelatin, strawberries ; preparation:In a medium saucepan, stir together water and pudding to a boil. Remove from heat and immediately add the jello until dissolved. Set the pan aside and let the mixture come to room temperature. Place strawberries in the bottom of a deep dish pie plate. Add cooled pudding mixture over the strawberries. Refrigerate until chilled. Let it set in well before slicing. ; name: cinnamon sugared almonds ; ingredients: sugar, water, whole almonds, ground cinnamon, salt ; preparation:In a large, heavy bottomed, skillet place the sugar and water. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Add the almonds and cook, stirring constantly, until almost all the water has evaporated. About 5 minutes. Add the cinnamon and salt and cook until the sugar has dried on the almonds. About 2 minutes. Pour onto a large sheet pan and let cool. ; name: mark bittman s chicken and rice soup ; ingredients: chicken broth, long grain white rice, carrot, celery, chicken, salt and pepper ; preparation:

name: barbecued polish sausage or kielbasa ; ingredients: polish sausage, catsup, brown sugar, onion, liquid smoke, garlic powder ; preparation:In a medium saucepan, put catsup, brown sugar, onion, liquid smoke and garlic powder. Cook for 5 minutes. Put sausage in a casserole dish sprayed with cooking spray. Pour sauce over meat. Bake at 350f for 30-40 minutes, or until sausage is completely heated through and barbecue sauce thickens up. ; name: peanut butter corn flakes cookies ; ingredients: sugar, white corn syrup, peanut butter, corn flakes ; preparation:Bring sugar and corn syrup to boil. Remove from heat. Add peanut butter and mix well. Pour mixture over corn flakes. Mix into balls onto waxed paper or spread into buttered pan. ; name: mini mignon s velveeta meat dip ; ingredients: ground beef, velveeta cheese, tomato soup, hot peppers, salt and pepper ; preparation:Brown the ground beef. Add tomato soup and chilies or peppers. Let this simmer for 40 minute. Stir in velvetta cheese and continue to stir until melted. Serve warm with tortilla chips. ; name: joanne s spicy shrimp salsa ; ingredients: tomatoes, red onion, jalapeno pepper, bay shrimp, fresh cilantro, cumin, garlic, lime juice, salt, fresh ground black pepper ; preparation:Drop the fresh tomatoes into a small pan of boiling water for about 2 minutes or until the skins blister. Remove from the water, cool, and peel. Coarsely chop the fresh or canned tomatoes and place in a large bowl. Stir in the remaining ingredients. Cover and refrigerate at least 4 hours. Serve with baked tortilla chips or as a side dish. For a thicker salsa, combine all the ingredients except shrimp in a food processor. Pulse 3 times or until desired consistency. Stir in shrimp. ; name: couscous with mushrooms ; ingredients: water, butter, chicken bouillon granules, salt, pepper, couscous, mushroom stems and pieces ; preparation:In a large sauce pan, bring water, butter, bouillon, salt, and pepper to a boil. Stir in couscous and mushrooms. Cover and remove from the heat. Let stand for 5 minutes. Fluff with a fork. ; name: glazed zucchini ; ingredients: zucchini, yellow squash, water, balsamic vinegar, dried oregano, unsalted butter, salt and pepper ; preparation:Place all squash into a medium sized pot with water and vinegar, over medium high heat. Bring just to a boil. Cover, and reduce heat to medium. Cook 10 minutes. Uncover. Add oregano and raise heat to medium high. Allow water to boil away, and the vinegar to reduce to a glaze for the squash, app. 5-7 minutes. When glazed to a rich brown color, add the butter. Turn squash to coat with butter. Season with salt and pepper. Serve. ; name: grandmother merrill s chili sauce ; ingredients: onion, sugar, salt, cinnamon, tomatoes, vinegar, allspice, pickled peppers ; preparation:Finely chop onions and peppers. Mix with sugar, vinegar, and salt. Cook slowly until onions are tender. Chop tomatoes, and add to the mixture, add allspice and cinnamon. Stir well and cook 3 minutes. Good on dried peas or beans, boiled cabbage, etc. ; name: ginger honey glazed barbecued pork chops ; ingredients: honey, low sodium soy sauce, rice vinegar, garlic cloves, gingerroot, pork loin chops ; preparation:

name: easy pumpkin dump cake ; ingredients: pumpkin puree, evaporated milk, eggs, sugar, salt, cinnamon, yellow cake mix, pecans, margarine, whipped topping ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350. Mix pumpkin, milk, eggs, sugar, salt and cinnamon. Pour batter into a greased 9 x 13 pan. Sprinkle cake mix over batter. Sprinkle pecans over cake mix. Drizzle melted margarine over all. Bake for 50 minutes. Can top with whipped topping if desired. ; name: green beans with pan roasted red onions thanksgiving ; ingredients: water, green beans, olive oil, red onions, fat-free low-sodium chicken broth, balsamic vinegar, brown sugar, salt, black pepper ; preparation:Bring water to a boil in a large saucepan. Add beans and cook 6 minutes or until crisp tender. Drain, keep warm. Heat oil in large, non-stick skillet over medium-high heat, add onions and saute 8 minutes for until browned. Add broth. Cook 3 minutes, stirring occasionally. Stir in vinegar and remaining ingredients. Stir in beans. Cover and cook 2 minutes. ; name: grilled cheddar and bacon on raisin bread ; ingredients: unsalted butter, raisin bread, extra-sharp cheddar cheese, bacon ; preparation:Butter one side of each raisin bread slice and turn slices over. Arrange cheddar on unbuttered sides of bread and top 4 slices with bacon. Flip remaining bread onto bacon. Heat a nonstick sillet over moderate heat until hot and cook sandwiches in batches, pressing lighly with a spatula, until undersides are golden, about 1 minute. Turn sandwiches over and cook, pressing lightly until undersides are golden and cheese is melted about 1 minute. ; name: 911 salmon ; ingredients: soy sauce, brown sugar, whiskey, salmon fillets ; preparation:In ziploc bag combine all ingredients. Place in fridge for one hour. Remove fish from bag and discard marinade. Place salmon skin side down on preheated barbeque grill at medium high heat. Cook for 10 to 12 minutes or until fish flakes easily with a fork. ; name: battered fish ; ingredients: flour, cornstarch, baking soda, baking powder, salt, water, fish ; preparation:Sift dry ingredients. Add water and mix well. Use to coat fish or chicken filets. Cover the fish completely. Deep fry until a nice golden brown. ; name: maple roasted almonds with fleur de sel les fougeres ; ingredients: almonds, maple syrup, vegetable oil, fleur de sel ; preparation:Toss almonds with maple syrup. Add oil and toss to coat. Spread on parchment lined baking sheet and bake at 325 until fragrant and syrup has thickened and coated the nuts, about 20 minutes. Stir every 5 minutes. Remove from oven and sprinkle with salt immediately before the syrup hardens and so they can adhere. Let cool on pan. Break any clumps apart and package in jars. Store airtight at room temperature. ; name: low fat cinnamon rolls ; ingredients: flour, baking powder, salt, water, cinnamon ; preparation:Mix the first three ingredients together. Then mix in the water. Knead the dough on a firm surface. Take 2 tablespoons of dough and dip it in cinnamon. Roll it with a rolling pin. Bake at 450 degrees for 10 minutes. ; name: lime jello and pineapple salad ; ingredients: lime jell-o gelatin, sour cream, pineapple ring, carrot, celery, pecans, boiling water ; preparation:

name: white russian bundt cake ; ingredients: chocolate cake mix, chocolate flavor instant pudding and pie filling mix, butter, vodka, kahlua, half-and-half, powdered sugar ; preparation:Spray a 12 cup bundt pan. Combine all cake ingredients and beat until well mixed. Pour batter into prepared pan. Bake at 350 for 50-60 minutes or until done via toothpick test. Cool 15 minutes, remove from pan and cool completely. Combine glaze ingredients and beat on low speed until powdered sugar is moistened. Increase speed to medium and beat until creamy. Drizzle glaze over cooled cake. ; name: make ahead oven baked french toast ; ingredients: eggs, milk, brown sugar, orange juice, nutmeg, cinnamon, stale bread ; preparation:In large, shallow dish, combine egg, cream, brown sugar, orange juice, and spices. Place bread in mixture. Leave 5 minutes. Turn bread over. Leave 5-10 minutes until all liquid is absorbed. Transfer bread to non-stick cookie sheet or cookie sheet lined with buttered foil. Bake at 375 f for 10 minutes. Turn carefully and bake 10-15 minutes longer, or until puffed and golden. Drizzle with warmed syrup, or sift icing sugar on top, and serve with fresh fruit. ; name: zinger green tea drink ; ingredients: water, fresh mint leaves, green tea bags, agave nectar, fresh lime juice, lime slices ; preparation:Bring the water to boil in a 3-quart saucepan. Add the mint and tea bags, remove from the heat, and let steep for 5 minutes. Strain. Stir in the agave and lime juice. Serve hot or iced, garnished with the lime slices. Makes 11. 2 quarts. ; name: authentic swiss fondue ; ingredients: garlic, white wine, lemon, juice of, emmenthaler cheese, gruyere cheese, cornflour, kirsch, pepper, nutmeg ; preparation:Rub the inside of a flameproof dish with the garlic, add the wine and lemon juice. Place dish over a gentle heat and warm. Add the cheese and stir mixture until the cheese has melted and is beginning to cook. Blend the cornflour to a smooth cream with the kirsch and add to mixture with seasoning. Continue to cook for a further 3 minutes or until mixture is of a thick consistency. Serve immediately with warm bread and potatoes. ; name: paula deen s broccoli casserole ; ingredients: frozen chopped broccoli, mayonnaise, sharp cheddar cheese, condensed cream of mushroom soup, eggs, crackers, butter ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350f. Spray a 13 x 9 inch baking dish with cooking spray. In a large bowl, combine broccoli, mayonnaise, cheese, soup and eggs. Mix well. Place the mixture in pan. Top with crushed crackers and pour the melted butter evenly over crackers. Bake for 35 minutes or until set and browned. ; name: maple pecan pork chops ; ingredients: spicy brown mustard, pepper, maple syrup, pork loin chops with bone, butter, unsweetened apple juice, pecan halves ; preparation:In a small bowl, combine the mustard, pepper and 2 teaspoons syrup. Brush over both sides of pork chops. In a large nonstick skillet, brown pork in butter over medium heat for 2-3 minutes on each side. Add apple juice. Reduce heat. Cover and simmer for 15-20 minutes or until meat is tender. Remove chops and keep warm. Add pecans and remaining syrup to the skillet. Cook and stir for 1-2 minutes or until blended. Serve over pork chops. ; name: tomato and garlic salad salat iz pomidorov s chesnokom ; ingredients: red wine vinegar, garlic cloves, tomatoes, red onion, extra virgin olive oil, salt and pepper, fresh basil ; preparation:In a small bowl, combine the vinegar and the garlic and let stand for 30 minutes. Place the tomatoes and onion in a salad bowl and sprinkle with the vinegar and garlic mixture. Toss with the olive oil and season with salt and pepper. Cover and refrigerate for 30 minutes. Sprinkle the salad with the basil and serve. ; name: green chile scones ; ingredients: all-purpose flour, salt, baking powder, green chili pepper, garlic, whipping cream, cayenne ; preparation:

name: lime mango surprise ; ingredients: mangoes, lime, lemongrass, sugar, ice cream, mint ; preparation:Place your prepared mango in a serving dish. In a pot add the lime juice, lemongrass and sugar. Heat gently, no boiling until the sugar is completely dissolved. Do not use juice until it is completely cooled. Strain the juice and pour over the mango wedges. Sprinkle with the lime rind, cover, chill for at least 3 hours. Serve in small bowls with a scoop of ice cream or sherbert and garnish with the sprigs of mint. ; name: baked fried chicken ; ingredients: flour, seasoned bread crumbs, old bay seasoning, salt, pepper, frying chicken, oil ; preparation:Heat oil on medium high heat in large skillet or frying pan. Preheat oven to 300 degrees. Combine dry ingredients. Moisten chicken pieces with water. Dredge chicken in flour and crumb mixture. Quickly fry chicken on all sides until browned and crisp. Place in covered baking dish and bake at 300 degrees for 30 minutes. Remove cover and bake additional 20-30 minutes to re-crisp chicken, serve. ; name: frosty fruity smoothie ; ingredients: blueberries, unsweetened sliced peaches, milk, vanilla yogurt, honey, ground cinnamon, ground nutmeg ; preparation:Combine blueberries or huckleberries, peaches and milk in a blender. Cover and process on high until smooth. Add yogurt, honey, cinnamon and nutmeg. Process until well blended. Serve immediately. ; name: loz almond sweetmeats ; ingredients: ground almonds, icing sugar, orange blossom water, pistachio nuts, caster sugar ; preparation:Combine the finely chopped pistachio nuts and caster sugar, and set aside. Combine the ground almonds and icing sugar with enough orange-blossom water to form a stiff paste. Knead until smooth and allow to rest for about 10 minutes. Shape the paste into small balls the size of a walnut, and using a teaspoon handle, make a small hole in each ball and fill it with the combined pistachio nuts and caster sugar. Close the hole over the filling and reshape to a round shape. Roll the balls in icing sugar and place in small paper cups or on a serving plate. Decorate the top of each ball with a peeled pistachio nut. Serve with coffee. ; name: baci di dama orange almond cookies ; ingredients: blanched almond, sugar, candied orange peel, all-purpose flour, milk, semisweet chocolate piece ; preparation:Preheat oven 350f. Put ground almonds in bowl with sugar, orange peel & all but 1 t of flour. Mix well, then stir in enough milk to give a smooth, firm dough. Roll into small balls, place well apart, on a baking sheet lined with greased wax paper. Sprinkle with the remaining 1 tbsp flour. Bake for 15 minutes or until golden brown. Transfer to a wire rack to cool. When cold, sandwich cookies together in pairs with the melted chocolate. Chill in the fridge for 1 hour before serving. ; name: broccoli salad with bacon ; ingredients: fresh broccoli, red onion, sunflower seeds, raisins, fresh mushrooms, mayonnaise, red wine vinegar, sugar, bacon ; preparation:Clean and cut the whole broccoli into small pieces. Use all of the broccoli except the end chunks. Mix together broccoli, onion, sunflower seeds, raisins and mushrooms. Make the dressing by mixing the mayonnaise, vinegar and sugar. Twenty minutes before serving the salad, toss and then toss again with the bacon and the dressing. ; name: punky s chocolate peanut butter fudge ; ingredients: evaporated milk, sugar, butter, peanut butter, marshmallow creme, vanilla extract, semi-sweet chocolate chips ; preparation:Grease an 8x8 inch dish. In a medium saucepan over medium heat, combine milk, sugar, and butter. Bring to a rolling boil, and let boil 5 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in peanut butter, marshmallow creme, semi-sweet chips and vanilla until well blended. Spread into prepared dish. Let cool completely before cutting into squares. ; name: beets with onions ; ingredients: beets, butter, onions, sugar, balsamic vinegar, salt and pepper ; preparation:

name: n awlins butter beans with andouille ; ingredients: butter beans, tomato sauce, carrots, frozen spinach, onion, fresh thyme, garlic, andouille sausages ; preparation:In a med. Stock pot, bring all ingredients to a boil. Season with salt & pepper to taste. Reduce heat and simmer for 30 minute or until beans are tender and sausage has shrunk to small disks. Serve hot. ; name: blueberry crunch cobbler ; ingredients: all-purpose flour, quick-cooking oats, brown sugar, sweet creamy butter, fresh blueberries, sugar, water, cornstarch, salt, vanilla ; preparation:Heat oven to 350 degrees. In a large mixing bowl combine all the crust ingredients. Beat at medium speed on mixer, scraping bowl often, until crumbly. Press 2 cups of the crumb mixture on bottom of ungreased 13x9 inch baking pan. Place blueberries over the crumb crust. In 2-qt saucepan combine remaining filling ingredients except vanilla. Cook over medium heat, stirring the mixture occasionally, until it thickens and comes to a full boil. Continue boiling for 1 minute. Mix in vanilla. Pour over blueberries. Sprinkle with the remaining crumb mixture. Bake for 50 to 60 minutes or until lightly browned. ; name: burmese fried shrimp ; ingredients: shrimp, salt, ground turmeric, chili powder, sesame oil, peanut oil, bamboo skewer ; preparation:Dust the shrimps with mixed salt, turmeric and chili powder. Bend shrimps into a half circle and thread on skewer through top and tail to keep this shape. Put four shrimps on each skewer. Shallow fry skewered shrimps until golden. Serve immediately. ; name: low cal tater tot casserole ; ingredients: ground turkey, onion, garlic, frozen tater tots, green beans, cream of celery soup, swiss cheese, salt and pepper ; preparation:Heat oven to 350 degrees. Brown ground turkey and onion with the minced garlic and salt and pepper. Add cans of celery soup and mix well. In 9 x 13 baking dish, spread tater tots on bottom. Spread green beans over tater tots. Spread turkey mixture over green beans. Sprinkle cheese over entire dish. Bake at 350 for 1 hour, or until cheese on top is melted and golden brown. ; name: stevia chocolate chip cookies ; ingredients: flour, salt, baking soda, fat free greek yogurt, stevia powder, pumpkin puree, vanilla, eggs, unsweetened baking chocolate, chocolate chips ; preparation:In a bowl mix together flour, salt, and baking soda. Set aside. In the bowl of a mixer cream yogurt, pumpkin or banana, vanilla and stevia powder until creamy, scraping the sides down at least one time. Add in eggs one at a time. Slowly add the flour mixture. Chop the unsweetened chocolate into very small peices. Add in all the chocolate and mix. Drop by tb size onto a cookie sheet. Then with lightly wet fingers pat down the top of the cookie until flat. Bake at 350 for 15-18 minutes or until golden brown. ; name: salsa tex mex style ; ingredients: rotel, whole tomatoes, fresh jalapeno pepper, garlic clove, onion, fresh cilantro, fresh lime juice, white sugar, cumin, salt ; preparation:First blend the cilantro, onion, jalapeno and garlic clove in a couple ounces of water. Add the rotel and canned tomatoes and continue to blend. Finally, add the rest of ingredients and keep adjusting the seasonings to your liking. After all the ingredients are blended, pour into a saucepan and let it come to slow boil. This will blend the flavors of each ingredients. Refrigerate. Goes well with white corn tortilla chips. ; name: quinoa salad with sun dried tomatoes ; ingredients: quinoa, sun-dried tomatoes, black olives, fat free feta cheese, pine nuts, fresh basil leaves, fresh garlic cloves ; preparation:Thoroughly rinse quinoa in cold water. Drain well in fine sieve. Dry roast in a large fry pan over med-high heat 10 minute or until golden brown. Stirring constantly. Add 4 cups hot water. Bring to boil. Reduce heat, cover and simmer 10 min or until liquid is absorbed. Let cool completely. In large salad bowl, add cooked quinoa and remaining ingredients. Toss and refrigerate till serving time. ; name: healthy lentil dip for cheapo cooks on a budget ; ingredients: brown lentils, vegetable broth, diced onion, red bell peppers, monterey jack cheese, red pepper flakes, salt ; preparation:

name: chocolate chunk cookies with pine nuts ; ingredients: unsalted butter, powdered sugar, unsweetened cocoa powder, vanilla extract, salt, all-purpose flour, pine nuts, semisweet chocolate chunks ; preparation:Preheat the oven to 325 f. Combine the butter, powdered sugar, cocoa powder, vanilla, and salt in a large bowl. Using a hand mixer, beat the mixture until creamy, about 2 minutes. Add the flour, pine nuts, and chocolate. Stir until just mixed. Line 2 baking sheets with parchment paper. Scoop out 1-inch balls of dough. Place on the cookie sheet. Bake until the tops look dry, about 18 minutes. Let cool for 15 minutes on the baking sheets. Dust with powdered sugar and transfer to a serving plate. ; name: beef with asian mushroom sauce crock pot ; ingredients: sliced mushrooms, beef tip roast, hoisin sauce, garlic cloves, salt, beef broth, cornstarch, water, scallions ; preparation:Put the mushrooms in your slow cooker and place the beef on top. Spread the hoisin sauce over the beef, scatter the garlic and salt over it, and pour in the broth around it. Cover the slow cooker, and cook on low for 6-8 hours. Remove the beef from the slow cooker and put it on a platter. Turn cooker to high. Mix the cornstarch with water and add to the sauce. When sauce is thickened a bit, pour the sauce into a sauce boat. Slice the beef and serve it with the sauce, topped with the scallions. ; name: maids of honor tarts ; ingredients: butter, sugar, eggs, all-purpose flour, salt, baking powder, raspberry jam, nuts, whipped cream ; preparation:Cream butter and sugar. Add eggs and beat until light. Add sifted flour, salt, and baking powder. Form small balls between hands and put into small cupcake pans or muffin pans. Make a deep hole in center by pushing up around edges. Mix jam and nuts together. Fill tarts. Bake at 375f for about 12 minutes, until lightly browned. Top with whipped cream when serving. ; name: best herb marinade for grilled steak ; ingredients: olive oil, worcestershire sauce, garlic, rosemary, thyme, salt, pepper ; preparation:Blend together all ingredients. Place in a heavy zip-lock type plastic bag. Add your favorite cut of meat. Place in the refrigerator on a plate. Turn often. ; name: quick easy cheddar garlic with pepperoni biscuit bites ; ingredients: cheddar garlic biscuit mix, pepperoni, dried basil leaves, red pepper, milk ; preparation:Heat oven to 400f. Spray cookie sheet with nonstick cooking spray or lightly grease. Combine biscuit mix, pepperoni, basil and red pepper in medium mixing bowl. Add milk. Stir until soft dough forms. Drop by heaping teaspoonfuls onto cookie sheet. Bake at 450f for 7 to 9 minutes or until golden brown. ; name: another hot crab dip recipe ; ingredients: cream cheese, cheddar cheese, sour cream, worcestershire sauce, dijon mustard, backfin crab meat, green onion ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350f. In a medium bowl, beat the cream cheese, cheddar cheese, sour cream, dijon mustard and worcestershire sauce. Gently stir in the crabmeat and most of the green onions. Reserve some green onions for garnish. Spoon the mixture into a 1-quart buttered casserole dish. Bake for 20-30 minutes until top is set and mixture is hot. Garnish the top with remaining green onions. Serve dip with tortilla chips or crackers. ; name: baked yams with cinnamon chili butter ; ingredients: unsalted butter, mild chili powder, ground cinnamon, salt, cayenne pepper, yams ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400. Using electric mixer, beat first 5 ingredients in a medium bowl until fluffy. Line large baking sheet with foil. Place yams on sheet, bake until tender, 1 hour 10 minutes. Slit each lengthwise. Spoon 1 tbs of butter into each. Pass remaining butter separately. ; name: andreas viestad onion pie with jarlsberg and thyme ; ingredients: unsalted butter, red onions, garlic cloves, bay leaf, black peppercorns, whole cloves, sea salt, puff pastry, jarlsberg cheese, fresh thyme ; preparation:

name: lemon vanilla curd cake irish cheesecake ; ingredients: shortcrust pastry, butter, vanilla sugar, egg yolks, flour, lemon, juice and zest of, cottage cheese, sugar, egg, powdered sugar ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350f, warm a baking sheet and grease a loose-bottomed flan tin. Roll out the shortcrust pastry until thin, then line the flan tin with the dough, trimming off any excess. Chill pastry case in the fridge. Cream the butter and sugar together until fluffy, then beat in the egg yolks, flour, lemon rind, lemon juice and sieved cottage cheese. Mix well, then spoon into the pastry case. Mix topping ingredients together and spread on top of the curd filling. Place the flan tin on the warmed baking sheet and bake for approximately 1 hour or until the top is lightly browned and slightly firm. Dust with powdered sugar and serve cool but not chilled. ; name: turkey chile casserole ; ingredients: cooked turkey, diced green chilies, onion, cream of chicken soup, corn tortillas, butter, sharp cheddar cheese, chicken broth ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Combine turkey meat, chilies, onion, and soup. If desired, spread tortillas with butter. Cut each tortilla in half and arrange 6 halves over bottom of a 13- x 9-inch baking dish. Spread a third of the turkey mixture over tortillas, top with a third of the cheese. Reapeat layers of tortillas, turkey, and cheese two more times. Carefully pour the chicken broth over all. Cover and bake for 25-30 minutes or until heated throughout and bubbly. Remove from oven and let stand 5 minutes. Cut in squares with sharp knife and use a spatula to remove each serving. ; name: rosemary and gouda buttermilk biscuits ; ingredients: all-purpose flour, baking powder, baking soda, unsalted butter, buttermilk, gouda cheese, dried rosemary, salt, milk ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400 f. Whisk together the flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt in a large bowl. Add the butter and rub it into the flour using your finger. Crumble the rosemary needles in your hand and add them to the mixture. Add the cheese and toss to combine. Pour in the buttermilk and fold in gently with a spatula until mixture forms a sticky dough. Divide roughly into 8 and drop onto a parchment lined baking sheet. Bake for about 12 minutes until golden on top or a toothpick comes out clean. ; name: festival sausage crock pot ; ingredients: kielbasa, pineapple chunks in juice, pineapple juice, lemon juice, cornstarch, brown sugar, salt, green pepper, onion, maraschino cherry ; preparation:Combine juices, brown sugar and cornstarch. Boil until thick. Stir in salt. Spray the crock pot with non-stick cooking spray. Put sausage, fruit and veggies in the crock pot, add the juice mixture. Cook on low 4 hours. ; name: lemony salmon ; ingredients: salmon, lemon juice, parsley, salt and pepper ; preparation:Line a baking sheet with tin foil, and rest the fish on top of the tin foil. Drizzle the lemon onto the fish. Season with parsley, salt and pepper. Put in a preheated 350 f oven. Cook it for 30 minutes or until done. ; name: mock chicken stock ; ingredients: water, onions, celery, carrots, garlic, bay leaves, dried thyme, turmeric, salt, fresh parsley ; preparation:Put the water into a large stockpot on high heat. Add the vegetables to the pot, then stir in the garlic, bay leaves, thyme, tumeric, salt, and parsely. Bring to a boil and cook uncovered for 15 minutes. Cover the pot, reduce heat to low, and simmer for one hour. Set aside to cool and then strain. Use the stock right away, refrigerate it in a sealed container for four days, or freeze it for up to six months. ; name: old time hot dog sauce ; ingredients: ground beef, onion, tomato sauce, chili powder, worcestershire sauce ; preparation:In a large skillet, saute ground beef and onion over medium heat, stirring often, until beef is browned. Add tomato sauce, chili powder, and worcestershire sauce. Bring mixture to a boil, lower heat, and simmer for 10 minutes. Add your favorite regular toppings, too. To make the sauce taste as if it came from a new york pushcart, add a little cinnamon. Oregano will give it a greek or italian flavor and a teaspoon of ground cumin will make it an authentic chili dog. ; name: classic one dish chicken stuffing bake with vegetables ; ingredients: hot water, chicken flavor stuffing mix, boneless skinless chicken breasts, condensed cream of chicken soup, sour cream, mozzarella cheese, frozen peas and carrots ; preparation:

name: lime cilantro grilled steak ; ingredients: boneless beef chuck steaks, fresh lime juice, water, fresh cilantro leaves, jalapeno pepper, garlic clove, ground cumin, salt and pepper ; preparation:Combine lime juice, cilantro, water, jalapeo pepper, garlic and cumin and pour into a large zip-top plastic bag. Add steaks, seal and shake bag to coat meat. Let marinate in refrigerator 1-2 hours, shaking bag every now and then. Toss marinade when ready to grill steaks. Grill steaks over medium heated until cooked to your liking, turning once. Once cooked, season to taste with salt and pepper. Carve steaks into thin slices and serve. ; name: hot salami sandwiches ; ingredients: hamburger buns, hard salami, american cheese, onions, barbecue sauce ; preparation:Layer bottom of hamburger buns with salami, cheese, onion. Spread barbecue sauce on top half of bun, and cover rest of sandwich. Wrap each sandwich in aluminum foil and bake in preheated 400 degree oven until cheese melts. About 5-10 minutes. May wrap sandwiches in paper toweling and microwave on half power until cheese melts, if desired. ; name: portuguese chourico and peppers ; ingredients: portuguese chourico, green bell peppers, sweet onions, tomato paste, red wine, water, garlic ; preparation:In a slow cooker, combine the chourico, green pepper, onion, tomato paste, wine, water, and crushed garlic. Stir so that everything is evenly distributed. Cover, and set on low. Cook for 8 hours. Uncover the pot, and cook an additional 2 hours to allow some of the liquid to evaporate. Serve over rice, or with portuguese rolls. ; name: easy low fat black bean soup ; ingredients: black beans, yellow onion, low-fat cream cheese, chicken broth, salt and pepper, low-fat sour cream, chives ; preparation:Using a food processor pulse the onion until minced. Drain and rinse the black beans. Add to the food processor with the cream cheese. Pulse until pureed. Dilute wtih chicken broth to your desired thickness. Transfer to a medium sauce pan and heat over low heat until thoroughly heated. Garnish with sour cream and chives. ; name: deviled ham on celery ; ingredients: celery ribs, smoked ham, fresh flat-leaf parsley, mayonnaise, dijon mustard, worcestershire sauce, sherry wine vinegar ; preparation:Trim a thin strip down length of rounded side of each celery rib to form a flat bottom, then rest celery on flat bottom. Cut away curved edges with a large knife to form flat-sided pieces of celery, discarding trimmings. Diagonally cut celery into 32 lengths. Pulse half of ham in a food processor until finely chopped, then mince remaining ham with a sharp large knife. Stir together finely chopped and minced ham with remaining ingredients and pepper to taste in a bowl, then mound 1 teaspoon of filling onto each piece of celery. ; name: dry and spicy curry ; ingredients: ghee, onion, curry powder, red chili powder, cooked beef, salt, water ; preparation:Heat the ghee or oil in a pan and stir-fry the onion over moderate heat until crisp and light brown. Do not burn. Add the curry powder, chili, and the cooked meat or fish and mix well. Add the salt and water and cook for 5 minutes as a rich, brown sauce develops. Serve warm with rice. ; name: orange julius with the secret ingredient ; ingredients: oranges, ice, water, milk, powdered coffee creamer, sugar ; preparation:Add ice and water to blender and turn on high for a few seconds. Add orange sections about 5 at a time, blending a little as you go. Add the other ingredients in whatever order and blend until smooth. Taste. Add more creamer or sugar if necessary. I use small to medium size seedless, sweet oranges. ; name: spicy cold soba noodles ; ingredients: soy sauce, molasses, sesame oil, tahini, brown sugar, chili oil, balsamic vinegar, green onion, salt, soba noodles ; preparation:

name: mushroom barley casserole ; ingredients: onion, butter, fresh mushrooms, garlic cloves, water, barley, onion and mushroom soup mix, dried thyme, salt ; preparation:In a large skillet, cook onion in hot, melted butter over med heat until tender. Add in mushrooms and garlic. Cook about 5 minutes or until mushrooms are tender, stirring occasionally. Transfer mixture to a greased 3-quart baking dish. Stir in the water, barley, dry soup mix, thyme, and salt. Bake, covered, at 350 for about 1 hour and 15 minutes or until barley is tender and most of the liquid is absorbed, stirring once or twice. Let stand, covered, for 15 minutes before serving. ; name: cheese and rosemary breadsticks ; ingredients: parmesan cheese, gruyere, fresh rosemary leaf, refrigerated breadstick dough, olive oil, sea salt ; preparation:Preheat the oven to 350 degrees f. Line 2 heavy large baking sheets with silicone baking sheets or parchment paper. In a food processor, chop the parmesan, gruyere and rosemary together until coarsely chopped. Set the cheese mixture aside. Separate the dough strips. Using a pizza cutter or a large sharp knife, cut each dough strip in half lengthwise to form thin strips. Working with dough strip at a time, coat each strip with the olive oil and then the cheese mixture, pressing very gently. Twist each cheese covered dough strip and place onto prepared baking sheets. Sprinkle with the salt, if you wish. Bake until the breadsticks are golden brown, about 10 to 15 minutes. Transfer the warm breadsticks to a basket and serve. ; name: marshmallow fudge ; ingredients: semi-sweet chocolate chips, fat-free sweetened condensed milk, vanilla extract, miniature marshmallows, low-fat graham crackers ; preparation:Line an 8-in. Square pan wih foil and coatwith cooking spray. Set aside. In a heavy saucepan over low heat, mel chocolatechips with milk. Stir until smooth. Remove from the hear. Cool for 2 minutes. Stir in vanilla. Fold in the marshmallows and graham crackers. Pour into the prepared pan. Refrigerate for 1 hour or until firm. Lif out pan and remove foil. ; name: gurkensalat cucumber salad ; ingredients: cucumbers, sweet onion, cider vinegar, sugar, salt, pepper, garlic clove, sour cream, fresh dill ; preparation:Peel cucumbers and cut into very thin slices. Mix together vinegar, sugar, garlic, salt, and pepper and pour over cucumbers and onions. Marinate about 20 minutes. Mix dill or parsley with sour cream. Add sour cream to cucumber mixture and toss. Top with chopped onion, sprig of fresh dill or parsley and serve. ; name: colors ; ingredients: tomato and spinach rotini, diced tomatoes, black olives, italian dressing, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Cook pasta well and drain. Return to pan or put in bowl. Add drained diced tomatoes to pasta. Add drained black olives to pasta. Add italian dressing. Mix thoroughly. Spoon into bowls, and sprinkle with parmesan cheese. ; name: raisin bread not bread machine ; ingredients: flour, fast rising yeast, cinnamon, sugar, brown sugar, salt, butter, raisins, water ; preparation:Mix all dry ingredients in a bowl. Melt butter in the microwave, let cool it cool to lukewarm temperature. Add warm water or milk to dry mixture, then add butter. Mix all ingredients together and let stand for a minute. Add flour to the mixture and stir until it forms a ball. Flour countertop, dump out the dough and knead for at least five minutes or until dough no longer sticks to counter. Place in greased bowl and cover. Let rise for 1 hour, then punch the dough down. Let rise for 1 hour and 30 minutes. Place dough into breadpan and bake at 325 for 1 hour and 30 minutes. ; name: chutney chicken salad ; ingredients: cooked boneless skinless chicken breasts, bell pepper, raisins, celery, green onion, miracle whip light, mango chutney, romaine lettuce ; preparation:Toss chicken, bell pepper, raisins, celery and onions in large bowl. Stir mayonnaise and chutney in small bowl until blended. Add to salad. Toss to evenly coat. Serve at room temperature or chilled. Line 4 individual plates with lettuce leaves. Top with salad. ; name: threadgill s cottage cheese cucumber salad ; ingredients: low fat cottage cheese, cucumber, fresh dill, green onion, pepper, tabasco sauce ; preparation:

name: crisp red cabbage ; ingredients: red cabbage, apples, red wine vinegar, brown sugar, salt, nutmeg ; preparation:Place cabbage, apples, vinegar, and brown sugar in a saucepan over medium heat. Mix well. Cover and simmer about 10 minutes until cabbage is tender-crisp. Add salt and nutmeg. Mix well. Serve warm. ; name: fillet bubbly bake ; ingredients: fish fillet, cream of mushroom soup, onions, lemon juice, cheese, water ; preparation:Cut the frozen fillets in four portions. Place in a shallow greased casserole. Mix the mushroom soup, onion, lemon juice and water and pour over the fillets. Top with grated cheese. Bake in hot over for 20 minutes or until done. ; name: imitation crab stir fry ; ingredients: onion, raw cauliflower, fresh garlic cloves, red cabbage, snow peas, tomatoes, imitation crabmeat, olive oil, soy sauce, ginger ; preparation:Prepare all fresh veggies and place into individual bowls. Sprinkle a pinch of ground ginger and salt on onions, cauliflower, cabbage, snow peas and tomatoes. Coat bottom of frying pan or wok with olive oil. When oil is hot add onions and sear for 5 minutes on high. Add garlic, cabbage, snow peas and cauliflower. Stir all ingredients together and add soy sauce to taste. Decrease heat and cover pan. Let simmer for about 15 minutes. Add imitation crab, toss ingredients to mix and cover. Simmer for an additional 15 minutes. Serve as is or over a bed of white rice. ; name: orange delight salad ; ingredients: fat-free sugar-free instant vanilla pudding mix, sugar-free orange gelatin, crushed pineapple, mandarin oranges ; preparation:Drain and reserve liquid from fruit. Add enough water to make two cups of liquid. Pour pudding mix & liquid into a pan. Cook until thickened, stir in dry jello. Mix in pineapple and oranges. Chill. ; name: jackson family rice custard ; ingredients: rice, milk, eggs, brown sugar, butter, raisins, vanilla, nutmeg, whipped cream ; preparation:Heat oven to 350 degrees. Combine rice, milk, eggs, brown sugar and butter in 1 qt casserole or baking dish. Place casserole in baking pan. Fill pan with enough water to go halfway up side of casserole. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes. Remove from oven. Stir in raisins and vanilla. Sprinkle with nutmeg. Return to oven. Bake for 30 minutes. Serve hot or chilled, topped with whipped cream. ; name: sole with light lemon sauce ; ingredients: low sodium chicken broth, garlic cloves, carrots, asparagus, sole fillet, flour, butter, dry white wine, lemon peel ; preparation:In large deep skillet, add broth, garlic, carrots and asparagus and bring to boil. Reduce heat to medium low, add fish and cook for about 3 minutes until fish is done. Carefully remove fish and veggies with a slotted spoon to serving plate. Cover and keep warm. Mix together flour and butter. Bring the broth to a boil and gradually whisk in the butter mixture until sauce begins to thicken. Remove from heat and whisk in wine, lemon rind and juice. Season with pepper is desired. Pour sauce over fish and veggies. Serve with potatoes, brown rice or a multigrain roll. ; name: white mountain coleslaw ; ingredients: green cabbage, red cabbage, red onion, carrot, sour cream, sugar, mayonnaise, malt vinegar, salt and pepper ; preparation:Grate cabbage. Add red onion and carrot. Toss in a large bowl. In a separate bowl, mix together sour cream, sugar, mayonnaise, and vinegar. Add salt and pepper to taste. Taste, adjust seasoning, taste, taste, taste. Add the mixture to the cabbage, toss well, refrigerate overnight or for several hours, and make sure its well and tightly covered. Serve very cold. ; name: banana chocolate chip cookies ; ingredients: butter, unsweetened applesauce, raw sugar, bananas, eggs, pure vanilla extract, unbleached all-purpose flour, baking soda, quick-cooking oats, semi-sweet chocolate chips ; preparation:

name: yummy sweet potato casserole ; ingredients: sweet potatoes, white sugar, eggs, salt, butter, milk, vanilla extract, brown sugar, all-purpose flour, pecans ; preparation:Preheat oven to 325 degrees f. Put sweet potatoes in a medium saucepan with water to cover. Cook over medium high heat until tender. Drain and mash. In a large bowl, mix together the sweet potatoes, white sugar, eggs, salt, butter, milk and vanilla extract. Mix until smooth. Transfer to a 9 x 13 inch baking dish. In a medium bowl, mix the brown sugar and flour. Cut in the butter until the mixture is coarse. Stir in the pecans. Sprinkle the mixture over the sweet pototato mixture. Bake in the preheated oven 30 minutes, or until the topping is lightly brown. ; name: sum dum guy s pork noodles ; ingredients: vegetable oil, ginger, roast pork, bok choy, hoisin sauce, rice wine, green onion, thin egg noodles ; preparation:Heat oil in wok or heavy saut pan. Add ginger and pork and stir fry until pork begins to develop a crust. Add bok choy and hoisin sauce with splash of rice wine. Toss. Add noodles and green onions and continue stir frying until noodles are heated through. To serve, remove pan from heat. Using tongs, pull all noodles from the pan and then top noodles with pork, onions and bok choy. Serve immediately. ; name: sweet cream waffles ; ingredients: flour, baking powder, salt, sugar, eggs, heavy cream, butter ; preparation:In a small bowl combine the flour, baking powder, salt, and sugar. Stir until blended. In a medium bowl, place the egg yolks, cream, and butter. Whisk until well mixed. Stir the dry ingredients into the cream mixture. Whisk until well mixed and smooth. Heat the waffle iron. Brush lightly with butter if not nonstick. Beat the egg whites until stiff, then fold them gently into the batter. Cook until waffles are golden, about 5 minutes. ; name: fish of galilee ; ingredients: cooking oil, ground coriander, trout, onions, parsley sprigs, salt, pepper, lemon juice ; preparation:Brush a little of the cooking oil on the grill grate. Add coriander to remaining oil. Brush oil mixture over the fish, inside and out. Place some onion slices and a sprig of parsley inside each fish. If desired, season with salt and pepper. Combine remaining oil mixture with lemon juice. Cook on oiled grill until browned and cooked through, about 7 minutes per side. ; name: almonds great appetizer with drinks ; ingredients: almonds, butter, fresh rosemary, brown sugar, salt, ground red pepper ; preparation:Spread almonds in a single layer on a baking sheet. Bake in a 350 oven for about 10 minutes or until nuts are lightly toasted and fragrant. Meanwhile, in a med saucepan melt butter over med heat until sizzling. Remove from heat. Stir in rosemary, sugar, salt and red pepper. Add almonds to butter mixture and toss to coat. Cool slightly before serving. If desired seal cooled nuts in an airtight container and store for up to 1 month in refrigerator or up to 3 months in freezer. ; name: barbara s chicken dish ; ingredients: chicken tenderloins, olive oil, onion, chopped tomatoes, garlic, white wine, chicken stock, sour cream ; preparation:Heat the olive oil in a large fry pan. Add the chicken, and the chopped onion. Stir for about 2 minutes. Add the garlic, and continue cooking till the chicken is golden. Add the white wine. Add the tomatos. Add the stock or water. Simmer until chicken is cooked and the sauce is reduced. When done, salt and cracked pepper to taste, turn off heat and cover. When ready to serve, re-heat, stir in the sour cream, but dont re-boil. Serve over pasta, with a green salad. ; name: irish mist whiskey carrots ; ingredients: butter, carrots, whiskey, brown sugar ; preparation:Melt butter. Add carrots. Cook for a minute. Remove from heat. Add whiskey off the stove. Add brown sugar. Return to stove. Cook covered for 5 minutes or until carrots are as tender as you like them. ; name: baked halibut steaks ; ingredients: olive oil, onions, fresh parsley, garlic, tomato sauce, halibut steaks, salt and pepper ; preparation:

name: all in one tuna casserole ; ingredients: onion soup mix, milk, frozen peas and carrot, egg noodles, tuna, cheddar cheese, cream of mushroom soup ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. In large bowl, blend onion soup mix with cream of mushroom soup and milk. Stir in peas & carrots, cooked noodles, cheese and tuna. Turn into greased 2-quart baking dish. Bake 30 minutes or until bubbling. ; name: crisp cucumber radish salad ; ingredients: english cucumber, carrot, radish, white onion, vegetable oil, rice wine vinegar, brown sugar, soy sauce, sesame oil, hot pepper sauce ; preparation:Halve cucumber lengthwise. Seed and thinly slice crosswise. Place in bowl. Peel and halve carrot. Thinly slice crosswise and add to cucumber. Add radish and onion. Whisk together oil, vinegar, sugar, soy sauce, sesame oil and hot pepper sauce. Add to cucumber mixture and toss to coat. ; name: deviled eggs with fresh tarragon and capers ; ingredients: hard-boiled eggs, extra virgin olive oil, mayonnaise, dijon mustard, celery, fresh tarragon, capers, shallots, salt, fresh ground black pepper ; preparation:Boil the eggs, shell and cut in half lengthwise. In a small bowl mash the eggs yolks with a fork. Mix in the olive oil, mayonnaise, and dijon mustard. Stir in the celery, fresh tarragon, capers and the shallots. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Divide and spoon the mixture into the egg halves. Garnish each egg half with 1 or 2 slices of celery. If not eating immediately, cover well and refrigerate. ; name: creamy asparagus leek and potato soup ; ingredients: leeks, butter, potatoes, asparagus, chicken stock, salt, pepper, evaporated milk ; preparation:Cut leeks in half lengthwise, wash and thinly slice. In large pan lightly saut leeks in butter. Add potatoes. Saute for about 3 minutes. Add asparagus, chicken stock, salt and pepper. Bring to a boil. Lower heat and simmer gently for about 20-30 minutes, until all vegetables are soft. Put contents in blender or processor and pure. Add evaporated milk and adjust salt and pepper for seasoning. Serve warm with garlic or herb flavored crutons, or toasted bread slices. ; name: homemade apple butter bars ; ingredients: brown sugar, all-purpose flour, butter, quick-cooking oats, baking soda, almond extract, salt, apple butter ; preparation:Mix the first 7 ingredients together until crumbly. Spread half the mixture into a lightly greased 13x9 inch pan. Spread apple butter on top. Cover with remaining crumb mixture. Bake in a 350 degree oven for 20-25 minutes. Cool and cut into squares. ; name: rustic honey baked nectarines ; ingredients: nectarines, parchment paper, brown sugar, vanilla extract, honey, greek yogurt ; preparation:Set oven temp to 350 degrees. Remove stones and place cut nectarines on the parchment paper in an oven proof dish or pan facing up. Drizzle honey, vanilla and sprinkle brown sugar over the top. Bake for 15 minutess, scoop up the juices from the bottom of the pan and coat nectarines and bake for an additional 15 minutes or until golden and sticky. Serve with yoghurt, drizzled with honey. ; name: gingersnap oatmeal ; ingredients: old-fashioned oatmeal, skim milk, water, molasses, ground ginger, ground cinnamon, ground cloves, vanilla extract, kosher salt ; preparation:In a small pot, heat oatmeal, skim milk, and water over medium heat. As oatmeal mixture is warming, add all the other ingredients. Stir thoroughly to combine. Let cook until most of the liquid is absorbed, and the oatmeal reaches yknow an oatmealy consistency. Serve warm. ; name: broccoli and cheddar bow ties ; ingredients: bow tie pasta, broccoli, all-purpose flour, salt, pepper, milk, dijon mustard, old cheddar cheese ; preparation:

name: baked bourbon chicken ; ingredients: chicken pieces, garlic, cayenne pepper, dark brown sugar, sage, rosemary, thyme, flour, salt, bourbon ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Brown chicken in skillet. Remove chicken from skillet and place into a baking dish. In the same skillet, combine garlic, cayenne, sugar, salt, sage, rosemary, thyme, and flour. Add bourbon and whisk to combine. Remove from heat. Pour sauce over chicken in baking dish. Cover dish and place in oven. Bake 1 hour or until juices run clear. ; name: nutella blossoms ; ingredients: butter, creamy peanut butter, brown sugar, granulated sugar, egg, baking mix, toffee pieces, chocolate hazelnut spread, milk, powdered sugar ; preparation:Preheat oven to 325. In a large mixing bowl use an electric mixer on medium speed to cream together butter, peanut butter, granulated and brown sugars until fluffy. Add egg and mix to combine. Reduce speed and add baking mix, mixing thoroughly. Stir in toffee chips. Shape into 1 inch balls and bake on ungreased cookie sheet for 10-12 minutes at 325. Remove to a wrire rack to cool. In a small saucepan over low heat, stir together nutella, milk and powdered sugar until smooth.
