Dip top of cooled cookies into glaze and dry on wax paper. ; name: butternut squash braised with cream and fresh thyme ; ingredients: butternut squash, butter, onion, garlic, cream, salt & freshly ground black pepper, fresh thyme leave ; preparation:Cover the squash with a generous amount of salted water in a large saucepan and boil for 5 minutes. Drain well. In a slow cooker, combine the squash, butter, onions, garlic, cream and salt and pepper. Set the cooker on low and cook for 6 to 8 hours, adding the fresh thyme in the last hour of cooking. When the squash is tender, turn off the slow cooker. This dish can sit for an hour or two before serving. ; name: slow cooker cranberry sauce ; ingredients: fresh cranberries, sugar, water, lime zest ; preparation:Combine the cranberries, sugar and water in the slow cooker. Cover and cook on high for 2 to 2. 5 hours. The cranberries will have popped open. Stir the zest into the hot sauce. Turn off the cooker, remove the lid, and let cool in the crock to room temperature. When cooled store covered in the refrigerator for up to 3 weeks. Serve chilled or at room temperature. If you use frozen cranberries, add 30 to 45 minutes cooking time. ; name: cucumber carrot salad ; ingredients: cucumbers, seasoning salt, carrot, rice wine vinegar, sesame oil, sugar, red pepper flakes ; preparation:Combine cucumbers and salt in large mixing bowl. Toss to coat. Let stand at room temperature 15 minutes. Rinse salt off of cucumbers and return to bowl. Add carrot. In a small bowl mix together remaining ingredients. Pour over cucumber mixture and toss well to coat. Cover and refrigerate at least four hours. ; name: potato everything hash stove top ; ingredients: red potatoes, red onion, garlic cloves, paprika, lemon juice, parmesan cheese, baby spinach, flat leaf parsley, salt & pepper ; preparation:Par-boil the potatoes for approximately 5-10 minutes. Soften the onion and garlic in a large frying pan with a knob of butter. When the potatoes are softened but not totally cooked, use a slotted spoon to transfer them into the frying pan with the onions. Cook on a medium heat for 5 minutes, stirring regularly. Add the paprika, lemon juice and parmesan cheese and cook for 5-10 minutes or until the potato is totally cooked through. Add the chopped spinach and stir well. It should only take a minute or so for it to cook down. Remove from the heat, mix in the parsley and season well with salt and pepper. Serve immediately. ; name: robert s hot dog sauerkraut ; ingredients: sauerkraut, bacon grease, mayonnaise, horseradish, swiss cheese ; preparation:Mix mayonnaise and horseradish together in a large bowl. Melt bacon grease in frying pan over medium high heat. Add sauerkraut to frying pan and brown lightly. Mix warm sauerkraut to mayonnaise and horseradish. Mix well. Stir in cheese until mixed. Serve on top of your favorite hot dog while warm. ; name: thai shrimp fried rice with pineapple ; ingredients: jasmine rice, vegetable oil, garlic, onion, medium shrimp, fish sauce, sugar, crushed pineapple, green onions ; preparation:

name: tex mex egg burritos ; ingredients: pork sausage, eggs, green chilies, picante sauce, cheddar cheese, 8-inch flour tortillas ; preparation:Brown sausage in a large skillet, stirring to crumble. Drain and return to skillet. Add eggs and chilies to sausage. Cook, stirring gently, until eggs are thickened, but still moist. Do not stir constantly. Microwave tortillas about 10 seconds each until soft. Spoon egg mixture down centers of warm tortillas. Top each with picante sauce and cheese. Fold opposite sides over filling. Serve immediately. ; name: potato nuggets with dill cream ; ingredients: potatoes, fresh dill, butter, heavy cream, salt & pepper ; preparation:Steam or boil your new potatoe nuggets until cooked. Melt butter in a skillet, add potatoes, toss to coat. Mix dill into the cream. Pour dilled cream over the potatoes and continue cooking over medium-low heat until the cream has turned into an almost golden sauce, stir frequently. Season to taste. ; name: fudge nut brownie cookies ; ingredients: pillsbury fudge brownie mix, flour, water, vegetable oil, egg, chocolate chips, walnuts, chocolate fudge frosting ; preparation:Heat oven to 350 degrees. Generously grease cookie sheet. In large bowl, combine brownie mix, flour, water, oil and egg. By hand, stir with spoon until dough is formed. Stir in chocolate chips and nuts. Drop by teaspoons 2 inches apart onto greased cookie sheet. Bake at 350 degrees for 8-12 minutes. Cool 1 minute. Remove from cookie sheet, cool completely. Frost cookies with chocolate frosting. ; name: d liteful salad or dessert ; ingredients: small curd cottage cheese, sugar-free jello, fat-free cool whip, crushed pineapple, mandarin orange segments, nuts, maraschino cherry ; preparation:Place cottage cheese in a bowl. Place dry gelatin on cottage cheese, along with the coolwhip, crushed pineapple, and mandarin orange segments. Mix well. Garnish with crushed nuts and cherries. Refrigerate 3 hours. Serve. ; name: simple spiced cider ; ingredients: apple cider, whole cloves, ground nutmeg, cinnamon sticks ; preparation:Heat all ingredients to boiling in 3-quart saucepan over medium-high heat. Reduce heat. Simmer uncovered 10 minutes. Strain cider mixture to remove cloves and cinnamon if desired. Serve hot. ; name: linguine with broccoli peas ricotta and bacon ; ingredients: bacon, linguine, broccoli, peas, butter, ricotta cheese, basil ; preparation:Fry the bacon over a medium heat until crispy and drain on a plate lined with paper towels. Bring to boil one medium saucepan and one large saucepan of salted water. Put the linguine into the large saucepan and swirl the water to ensure it does not stick together. When the pasta is almost cooked plunge the broccoli and peas into the other saucepan of boiling water. Drain the pasta and return to the large pan with the butter. Drain the broccoli and peas well and add to the pasta with the ricotta, bacon and basil. Toss gently, transfer to four warm bowls and serve immediately. ; name: moules marinieres belgian mussels ; ingredients: mussels, onion, celery, white wine, pepper, butter, cream, parsley ; preparation:Melt 1 tablespoon of butter in a casserole pot. Add onions, celery, and saute for a few minutes. Add the wine a bring to the boil. Add the mussels and place lid on pot give a good shake to mix. Cook until mussels have opened shaking even now and again. Add 1 tablespoon of butter, cream and the parsley and stir. Serve with crusty bread or as in belgium with frites. ; name: spicy ranch chicken wings ; ingredients: chicken wings, hot pepper sauce, butter, cider vinegar, ranch dressing mix, paprika ; preparation:

name: green bean casserole ii ; ingredients: adzuki beans, shoe peg corn, sour cream, sharp cheddar cheese, onion, cream of celery soup, ritz cracker, margarine ; preparation:Drain beans, put in 9 x 13-inch baking dish. Drain corn, pour over beans. Mix onions, celery soup, sour cream and cheese. Pour over beans and corn. Crush crackers, melt butter and mix with crackers. Spread over top and bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes. ; name: hot pepper butter ; ingredients: banana peppers, salt, white vinegar, water, sugar, flour, dry mustard, yellow mustard ; preparation:Seed, devein and grind peppers. Cover with vinegar, salt and water. Bring to a boil and simmer while you get the rest of the ingredients ready. Mix sugar, flour, dry mustard and yellow mustard. Add to pepper mixture. Stir well and cook until thick and bubbly. Fill jars, put on lids and turn upside down for 5 minutes then turn them right-side up and let them seal. ; name: sweet and sour stir fry chicken ; ingredients: cornstarch, boneless skinless chicken breasts, vegetable oil, red bell pepper, sugar snap peas, sliced water chestnuts, sweet and sour sauce ; preparation:Put cornstarch in a plastic food bag. Add chicken and toss to coat. Heat oil in wok or nonstick skillet over medium-high heat until hot but not smoking. Add chicken and stir-fry for 3-4 minutes until golden brown on all sides. Remove to a bowl with a slotted spoon. Add bell pepper, snap peas and water chestnuts to drippings in skillet. Stir-fry 2 to 3 minutes or until vegetables are crisp-tender. Pour in stir-fry sauce and return chicken to skillet. Stir to coat chicken and vegetables. Garnish with scallions. Serves 4. ; name: zucchini bites ; ingredients: zucchini, margarine, garlic powder, mozzarella cheese ; preparation:Preheat oven broiler or toaster oven broiler. Arrange zucchini slices on cookie sheet. Spread each with a little soft margarine. Sprinkle with garlic powder, to taste. Top with shredded or sliced mozzarella. Place in broiler and broil until cheese is melted and bubbly. ; name: grilled ham cheese sandwich ; ingredients: bread, ham, cheese, butter ; preparation:Put butter on one side of each piece of bread. Put ham and cheese onto the bread then cook like you would grilled cheese. In a pan with butter, or stick on an electric grill. Cook on each side till brown. Open sandwich on side without cheese and add your condiments. ; name: nordic moon ranch s most excellent ground lamb ; ingredients: ground lamb, onion, olive oil, curry powder, red wine, tomato paste, garlic, salt, red pepper flakes, ground cumin ; preparation:In a large, preheated heavy skillet over medium heat, brown lamb evenly. Drain of all fat. In same skillet, saute onion in olive oil until soft. Using mortar and pestal, grind garlic to a paste with the salt. Add paste to onions in skillet. Stir in curry powder and red pepper flakes if used. Return lamb to skillet and add tomato paste and broth or wine. Reduce heat and let simmer for 10 to 20 minutes, or until flavors have blended and liquids are thickened. ; name: scallops of the provence ; ingredients: sea scallops, lemon juice, salt, flour, tomatoes, shallots, garlic, herbes de provence, salt and pepper, olive oil ; preparation:Toss scallions in lemon juice. Drain, salt and dredge in flour. Sautee in olive oil until brown. Set scallops aside. Drain off any extra olive oil, keeping only about 1 tablespoon. Add garlic, and shallots and sauteing until lightly browned. Add remaining ingredients and simmer until slightly thickened. Serve sauce over scallops. ; name: raspberry jello salad ; ingredients: pretzel sticks, white sugar, margarine, cool whip, cream cheese, raspberry jell-o gelatin, boiling water, frozen raspberries ; preparation:

name: baked mushroom bacon rice ; ingredients: basmati rice, bacon, butter, celery, onion, fresh mushrooms, chicken broth, garlic, fresh ground black pepper, dried oregano ; preparation:Pre-heat the oven to 425 f or 220 c. If you are using a fan assisted oven, you can cut the heat by about 10 percent. In a large skillet, melt the butter and saut the rice and bacon for two minutes. Add the celery, onion and mushrooms. Cook and stir for a further 2-4 minutes, until the vegetables just start to soften. Pour into a large casserole dish. Stir in the broth and garlic. Add a generous amount of black pepper and a couple pinches of oregano. Mix well. Cover and bake for 30 minutes, or until the liquid is absorbed and the rice is cooked. ; name: grandma s pecan balls from aunt katie ; ingredients: flour, ground pecans, butter, sugar, superfine sugar ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350. Cream butter with sugar. Add flour and pecans, mix well. Roll into balls, about the size of a large gumball, and place on a cookie sheet. Bake at 350 for 20 minutes, or until very lightly browned. While still warm, roll in superfine sugar - this is important because the dough does not have much sugar. ; name: crispy coated garlic chicken ; ingredients: chicken, olive oil, garlic, corn flake crumbs, garlic powder, salt, pepper, paprika ; preparation:Place chicken in a large, shallow container. Combine oil and garlic, pour over chicken, tossing to coat. Cover and marinate 8 hours or overnight. Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Line a large, shallow roasting pan with foil, grease well with a thin layer of olive oil. Combine crumbs, garlic powder, salt, pepper and paprika in a shallow bowl. Dredge chicken in crumb mixture and place in prepared pan. Bake uncovered for 1 hours, or until done. ; name: grilled lime chicken with pineapple salsa ; ingredients: honey mustard, frozen limeade concentrate, ground cumin, boneless skinless chicken breasts, fresh pineapple, red bell pepper, cilantro ; preparation:Mix 3 tablespoons mustard, 3 tablespoons limeade concentrate and cumin in plastic food storage bag. Add chicken, seal bag. Marinate in refrigerator 1-2 hours. Stir together pineapple, bell pepper, cilantro and remaining mustard and limeade concentreate in medium bowl. Grill chicken over medium heat until no longer pink in center. Serve with salsa. ; name: caramel custard pudim flan ; ingredients: soft brown sugar, sugar, eggs, milk, coffee extract ; preparation:Put a heaped teaspoon of brown sugar into 6 individual ramekins. In a large bowl, beat sugar and eggs together until yellow and frothy. Bring milk to boil, gradually add it to the egg mixture, beating constantly. Add coffee essence. Pour this mixture into ramekins, place in roasting pan. Add enough water to come half way up the sides of the ramekins. Bake in a moderate oven, 350 degrees until just set, about 45 minutes. To test, stick a skewer into the custard, if it comes out clean, the custard is done. Remove from oven and allow to cool. ; name: catalan style cauliflower ; ingredients: boiling potato, cauliflower florets, extra virgin olive oil, white wine vinegar, salt, white pepper ; preparation:Cut potatoes the same size as the florets. Add to a large sauce pan, cover with water and salt lightly. Bring to a boil and cook until easily pierced with a skewer, about 20 minutes. Drain and transfer to a serving plate. Mix oil, vinegar, salt and pepper, pour over potatoes and cauliflower, breaking them up a bit as you do. Serve immediately. ; name: mirj s not low carb crunchy chicken nuggets ; ingredients: boneless chicken breasts, egg, sweet paprika, corn chips, parsley, oil ; preparation:Cut the chicken breasts into two inch cubes. Mix the egg with the paprika in one bowl. Mix the corn chip crumbs with the parsley in another bowl. Dip the chicken cubes first into the egg mixture, then into the crumb mixture, coating well. Either shallow fry for about 7 minutes, turning once, until done, or place on a baking sheet, spray with oil and bake at 350 degrees f for about 25-30 minutes. ; name: cranberry raspberry salad ; ingredients: jello gelatin, boiling water, cranberry sauce, lemon juice, red raspberries ; preparation:

name: danish aebleskiver ; ingredients: egg whites, all-purpose flour, baking powder, white sugar, baking soda, salt, butter, buttermilk, vegetable oil ; preparation:Beat the egg whites until stiff. In a separate bowl, mix together the flour, baking powder, salt, baking soda, sugar, melted butter and buttermilk at one time and beat until smooth. Gently fold in the egg whites last. Put about 1 tablespoon of vegetable oil in the bottom of each aebleskiver pan cup and heat until hot. Pour in about 2 tablespoons of the batter into each cup. As soon as they get bubbly around the edge, turn them quickly. Continue cooking, turning the ball to keep it from burning. ; name: very chewy chocolate chip cookies ; ingredients: shortening, margarine, brown sugar, sugar, eggs, vanilla, flour, baking soda, salt, chocolate chips ; preparation:Heat oven to 375f. First, cream both sugars with the shortening, margarine, eggs, and vanilla. Then, gradually add soda, salt and flour. Stir in chocolate chips. Bake 8-9 minutes. ; name: mexican prune chipotle pork ; ingredients: pork, prunes, fresh tomato, chipotle chile, cooking oil ; preparation:Prehat oven to 150c. Sear the meat on all sides on a pan in the hot oil. Place on a baking dish in the oven for one hour. Process rest of the ingredients in the blender, strain, and pour over the meat. Continue cooking in oven until meat isdone and sauce is bubbly. ; name: to die for chocolate mud cake ; ingredients: unsalted butter, dark chocolate, sugar, hot water, plain flour, self-raising flour, cocoa, eggs, cream ; preparation:Melt butter & chocolate with sugar and cocoa in large pan. Heat gently till well combined. Stir in hot water. Cool. Sift flours together and stir in beaten eggs. Bake in a lined cake tin in oven at 170 degrees celcius for 1 hour. Stand 5 - 10 minutes before turning out from cake tin. Melt dark chocolate over gentle heat, stir in cream and mix well to make icing. Ice mudcake when cool. ; name: pecan delight pie ; ingredients: egg whites, salt, cream of tartar, vanilla, granulated sugar, brown sugar, soda crackers, pecan pieces ; preparation:Beat egg whites to foam. Add salt and cream of tartar. Beat to stiff peaks. Add vanilla extract and both sugars. Beat until consistency of 7 minute frosting. Fold in crackers and nuts. Grease bottom and sides of pyrex dish and add mixture to dish. Bake at 350 degrees for 15-20 minutes. Top with cool whip or whipped cream when pie is completely cool, or slice and add topping on individual slices when serving. ; name: heart chop suey 1952 ; ingredients: meat, flour, fat, boiling water, soy sauce, fresh mushrooms, onion, celery, bean sprouts ; preparation:Dip meat strips in flour. Heat fat in a heavy skillet and cook meat until browned. Add boiling water and soy sauce. In separate skillet, heat remaining fat. Brown mushrooms onions and celery. Add to meat mixture. Cover and simmer about 15 minutes. If using cabbage, cook 5 minutes and drain. Add bean sprouts or cabbage to meat mixture. Serve over rice. ; name: sour cream banana loaf ; ingredients: butter, sugar, eggs, sour cream, baking soda, vanilla, bananas, salt, flour ; preparation:Set oven to 350 degrees f. Grease four 9 x 5-in loaf pans. Cream butter, sugar and eggs. Mix sour cream and soda in a separate bowl. Let stand until foamy. Add vanilla, bananas, salt and flour. Mix well. Place in 4 prepared loaf pans. Bake for 50 minutes or until cake tests done. ; name: baked beef and ravioli ; ingredients: cheese ravioli, ground beef, spaghetti sauce, frozen spinach, mozzarella cheese ; preparation:

name: garlic cheese biscuits ; ingredients: bisquick, milk, cheddar cheese, butter, garlic salt ; preparation:Mix bisquick, milk and cheddar cheese until a soft ball forms. Beat vigorously for 30 seconds. Drob by balls onto ungreased baking sheet. Bake at 450 degrees for 8-10 munutes. Melt butter. Mix butter and garlic salt. Brush garlic butter on rolls while still hot on the pan. ; name: banana coconut cream pie smoothie ; ingredients: light coconut milk, pineapple juice, vanilla, sugar, ground nutmeg, ice cubes, bananas, sweetened coconut, whipped cream ; preparation:Place coconut milk, pineapple juice, vanilla, sugar, nutmeg, ice cubes, and frozen banana pieces in a blender. Blend on high until mixture is frothy and ice cubes are finely ground, about 30 seconds to 1 minute. Pour into 4 glasses. Garnish with whipped cream and sprinkle on a little toasted coconut if desired. For vegan omit whipped cream. ; name: mexican dinner pronto ; ingredients: vegetable oil, onion, tamales, chili without beans, chili with beans, oregano, monterey jack cheese ; preparation:In skillet heat oil. Saute onion until tender. Transfer to ovenproof baking dish. Arrange half the tamales and gravy over onions. Add the two cans of chili. Sprinkle with oregano. Top with remaining tamales. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes, or until bubbling hot. Remove from oven. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake 15 minutes more or until cheese has melted. ; name: drumstick dessert ; ingredients: graham wafers, peanuts, butter, peanut butter, cream cheese, white sugar, vanilla, eggs, cool whip, chocolate syrup ; preparation:Mix first 4 ingredients and press into a 9x13 pan. Cream next 3 ingredients together. Add vanilla, the eggs, and cool whip. Spread filling into crust. Dribble on sauce and marbilize with a knife. Sprinkle remaining crumbs on top. Freeze. Thaw before eating. ; name: roasted zucchini and garlic spread ; ingredients: cooking spray, zucchini, onion, garlic cloves, plain yogurt, fresh parsley, lemon juice ; preparation:Line a jelly roll pan with foil and spray with cooking spray. Arrange zucchini, onion and garlic in a single layer on the pan. Bake at 425 until vegetables are very tender, about 15-25 minutes. Cool. Process vegetables in a food processor, until coarsely chopped. Stir in yogurt and parsley. Season to taste with lemon juice, salt and pepper. ; name: lancaster farmhouse baked oatmeal ; ingredients: old fashioned oats, unsalted butter, milk, light brown sugar, ground cinnamon, salt, dried apple, heavy cream ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350. Butter a medium baking dish. Add the oats and butter to a heatproof mixing bowl. Pour 1 cup boiling water over them and let stand 5 minutes. Stir in the milk, brown sugar, cinnamon, and salt. When well mixed, stir in the apples. Spoon mixture into the prepared dish. Cover and bake for 35 minutes, then uncover and continue to cook for 5-10 minutes, until thick and bubbly. Spoon into bowls and serve hot with cream drizzled around the cereal and a dusting of cinnamon. ; name: spiced couscous ; ingredients: butter, oil, onion, curry powder, cumin, cayenne pepper, couscous, chicken broth, salt ; preparation:In a small saucepan, heat butter and oil over medium heat. Saute onion until softened, about 5 minutes. Add curry, cumin and cayenne, stirring constantly, for 1 minute. Adjust heat to medium-high, add couscous, blend well and cook 1 minute, stirring constantly. Add chicken broth, stir to incorporate, and bring to boiling point. Cover pan, remove from heat and let stand 5 minutes. Fluff with fork, season with salt if needed, and serve hot. ; name: terrific tuna melt ; ingredients: solid white tuna packed in water, chive & onion cream cheese, pita bread, mild cheddar cheese, assorted fresh vegetable ; preparation:

name: shrimp and croissant brunch casserole ; ingredients: plain croissants, monterey jack cheese, small shrimp, green onions, eggs, milk, dried thyme, salt, white pepper ; preparation:Place half the croissant cubes in the bottom of a lightly greased 11 x8 inch baking dish. Sprinkle with half the cheese, all the shrimp and green onions. Top with remaining croissant cubes. In a mixing bowl, whisk the eggs, milk, thyme, salt, and pepper together. Pour pour over mixture in baking dish. Sprinkle with remaining cheese. Cover and refrigerate for several hours. Bring to room temperature. Bake in a 350 degree oven, uncovered, for about 40 minutes or until set. Let stand for 10 minutes. Cut into squares and serve. ; name: cheddar cheese grits ; ingredients: water, whole milk, quick-cooking grits, sharp white cheddar cheese, unsalted butter, salt, hot pepper sauce ; preparation:In a large saucepan over medium heat, add the water and milk. When bubbles just begin to break the surface, slowly add the grits, whisking constantly. Cook, stirring frequently and scraping the bottom of the pan, until thickened and cooked, about 7 minutes. Add the cheese and butter and stir just until melted. Remove from the heat. Add salt to taste and hot pepper sauce, if desired. Serve immediately. ; name: hot and creamy cocoa with gooey toasted marshmallows ; ingredients: heavy cream, sugar, semisweet chocolate, marshmallows ; preparation:Place the cream in a heavy-bottomed saucepan and bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Reduce the heat slightly so the cream remains at a low boil, and boil for 3 to 4 minutes, until it begins to thicken. Stir in the sugar and chocolate and continue to simmer, stirring constantly, until the sugar dissolves and the chocolate melts. Remove the saucepan from the heat and set aside to keep warm. Place the marshmallows on a small cookie sheet. Place under your broiler in the oven for 2 to 3 minutes, until toasted or charred. The charred flavor, as we all know from campfires, is ideal. If necessary, reheat the hot chocolate over low heat, stirring constantly. Pour the hot chocolate into four demitasse cups. Top each with a toasted gooey marshmallow and serve immediately with spoons. ; name: eggs baked in potatoes ; ingredients: potatoes, butter, milk, salt, pepper, eggs, cheese ; preparation:Bake the potatoes. Scoop out the pulp, after cutting a thin slice from the length of the potato. Mash pulp to a creamy fluff with butter, hot milk, salt and pepper. Fill potato shells, leaving a dent in the middle of each to hold a raw egg. Break 1 or 2 eggs into each potato. Cover with cheese. Bake at 400f for 10 minutes until the egg is firm and cheese is browned. ; name: katrina s hot cocoa ; ingredients: hot chocolate powder, brown sugar, cinnamon, milk, boiling water, chocolate syrup ; preparation:Boil the water in a kettle. Put the other ingredients in a cup. Then pour the water into the cup. Then carefully add a decent amount of chocolate syrup. Stir thoroughly. ; name: luby s cafeteria waldorf salad ; ingredients: apples, pineapple tidbits, celery, mayonnaise, whipping cream, powdered sugar, vanilla extract, walnuts ; preparation:In large bowl, combine apples and next three ingredients ingredients. Toss lightly to coat evenly. In another bowl, whip cream at high speed with an electric mixer just until stiff peaks form, taking care not to overbeat. Blend in sugar and vanilla. Fold into fruit. Cover and refrigerate at least 2 hours. Garnish with walnuts. ; name: avocado open facers ; ingredients: mayonnaise, lemon juice, whole wheat bread, avocado, lettuce, tomatoes, cooked bacon, thousand island dressing, pickle, olive ; preparation:Combine mayonnaise and half the lemon juice. Spread on one side of each slice toast. Brush avocado with remaining lemon juice. Place leaf lettuce, tomato slices, and avocado slices on toast. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Crisscross 2 bacon slices atop each. Spoon on thousand island dressing. Garnish plate with pickles and olives. ; name: spinach with sesame dressing from japanese home cooking ; ingredients: spinach, sesame seeds, dashi, soy sauce ; preparation:

name: loaded lemonade ; ingredients: fresh orange juice, prepared sweet-and-sour mix, tequila, triple sec, sprite ; preparation:Add first four ingredients to a pitcher or large bowl. Stir to combine. Chill for 2 hours. Right before ready to serve, add sprite. Stir to combine. Serve in ice-filled glasses. ; name: lighter meatloaf ; ingredients: worcestershire sauce, egg whites, black pepper, salt, hot pepper sauce, onion, canned tomato sauce, old fashioned oats, lean ground turkey, lean ground beef ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350f. Spray loaf pan with cooking spray. Combine beef, turkey, onion, and oats in a large bowl, set aside. Mix together tomato sauce, worcestershire sauce, hot pepper sauce, egg whites, salt, and pepper. Add to meat mixture and mix well with hands. Press into pan and bake for 60-70 minutes. ; name: dijon herb dressing ; ingredients: dijon mustard, white vinegar, olive oil, fresh basil, parsley, nonfat dry milk powder, water ; preparation:In a small bowl whisk together the mustard, vinegar, oil, basil and parsley. In a separate bowl mix the powdered milk and water. It will not be the consistency of milk, instead creamier and thicker like half-n-half. Combine milk with the dressing and whisk until fully incorporated. This will keep in the fridge for 2 or 3 days. If you are using dried herbs its tastes better if you let the dressing sit in the ice box an hour or so before serving. ; name: simple apple crisp ; ingredients: apples, cinnamon, nutmeg, water, lemon juice, butter, sugar, flour ; preparation:Pre-heat oven to 350. Placed sliced apples in buttered 8x8 pan. Add spices, lemon juice and water. In separate bowl, mix butter, sugar and flour until crumbly. Sprinkle on top of apples. Bake for 1 hour or until top is golden brown and apples are tender. ; name: pureed watercress ; ingredients: salt, potato, watercress, butter, pepper ; preparation:Bring a pot of water & salt to a boil. Add potato. Boil until very soft, about 20 minutes. Add watercres. When the water comes back to a boil, cook 1 minute. Drain & press down to get all the liquid out. Puree in a food processor, add butter, puree again. Season to taste. ; name: celery parmesan ; ingredients: celery, onion, garlic cloves, diced tomato, bacon, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Prehaet oven to 325 degrees. Lightly spray a 2-qt casserole dish with nonstick cooking spray. Cook celery, onion and garlic in small amount of boiling salted water until tender. Drain. Pour into prepared casserole dish. Top with tomatoes and bacon, then sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Bake at 325 degrees for 30 minutes. Serve. ; name: emily s favorite breakfast pizza ; ingredients: margarine, onion, green bell pepper, canadian bacon, 12-inch pizza crust, eggs, salt and pepper, picante sauce, cheddar cheese, fresh cilantro ; preparation:Melt butter in a large skillet. Saute onion, green bell pepper, and bacon until tender. Add eggs, salt, and pepper to skillet. Stir and cook until eggs are almost set, but not runny. Place pizza crust in pizza pan or baking stone. Spread egg mixture evenly over pizza crust. Top with picante sauce. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake at 400 degrees for 5-10 minutes or until cheese melts. Sprinkle with cilantro. ; name: turkey and hash browns pie ; ingredients: ground turkey, carrots, egg, italian seasoned breadcrumbs, worcestershire sauce, garlic powder, frozen hash browns, butter, cheddar cheese ; preparation:

name: roasted glazed sweet potatoes with apples ; ingredients: sweet potatoes, apples, vegetable oil, salt, pepper, butter, brown sugar, pumpkin pie spice ; preparation:Heat oven to 375 degrees f. On a baking sheet with sides, toss sweet potatoes and apples with oil, salt and pepper. Spread out into single layer. Roast 30 minutes or until potatoes are tender. Meanwhile, stir together butter, brown sugar and pumpkin pie spices. Spoon over potato mixture and toss to coat. Continue baking for 10 minutes or until sugar has melted. ; name: cinnamon toast delight ; ingredients: bread, butter, cinnamon, brown sugar ; preparation:Preheat the oven to 400 degrees. Smear butter over both surfaces of each slice of bread. Add lots of brown sugar to the tops, enough to cover the tops without seeing the butter. Sprinkle the cinnamon over the top of the brown sugar. Let bake for about 5-6 minutes, then turn to broil till the top of the brown sugar is bubbling. Remove from oven and let cool for 1-2 minutes. ; name: cranberry and vanila sorbet ; ingredients: cranberries, water, sugar, kosher salt, vanilla bean, lemon juice ; preparation:In a saucepan combine first 4 ingredients, scrape seeds from vanilla bean and add bean to mixture and bring to a boil over medium heat, stirring until sugar dissolves. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 10 more minutes or until cranberries pop. Cool to room temperature. Remove vanilla bean. Working in batches puree mixture in a blender and then strain into a large bowl discarding solids. Stir in lemon juice. Refrigerate for 4 hours or overnight or until chilled. Transfer mixture to ice cream maker and process according to directions. Transfer to a container, cover and freeze. ; name: sweet shortcrust pastry gluten free ; ingredients: butter, sugar, egg, plain flour, gluten-free self-raising flour ; preparation:Cream the butter and sugar together in a large bowl, until light and fluffy. Whisk in the egg. Fold in the combined flours and then mix to form a soft dough. Shape the dough into a ball. Cover with clingwrap and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes before using. Dough can be stored in the fridge for up to two weeks. ; name: coffee fizz ; ingredients: orange wedges, coffee liqueur, vanilla vodka, ginger ale ; preparation:Fill brandy sniffer or highball glass with ice. Squeeze one of the orange wedges over ice, twisting rind to release oil. Discard rind. Add coffee liqueur and vodka. Stir in ginger ale. Garnish with remaining orange wedges. ; name: sour cream cherry cake ; ingredients: low-fat plain yogurt, sugar, eggs, flour, lemon juice, lemon rind, baking soda, salt, cherries ; preparation:Mix egg yolks, lemon rind and juice, sugar and yogurt together. Sift in flour, baking soda, salt and mix thoroughly. Mix in cherries or other fruit. Beat egg whites until stiff and mix inches. Pour into greased loaf pan. Bake at 350 for 40-50 minutes. ; name: seriously strong scottish cheese scones ; ingredients: self raising flour, salted butter, egg, whole milk, mull of kintyre cheese, salt, mustard powder, cayenne pepper ; preparation:Mix the flour, salt and pepper together. Massage in the butter and then slowly mix in the grated cheese. Beat the egg and add in the milk. Add mixture to the dry ingredients to create a soft, elastic dough. Roll out the mixture on a lightly floured surface. Cut into round shapes and place on a well greased tray. Brush the top with milk and sprinkle a little extra cheese and pepper on top. Bake in a pre-heated oven in the center at 400 until golden brown. ; name: delicious no flour walnut cookies ; ingredients: extra-large egg yolks, sugar, vanilla extract, walnuts, lemon rind ; preparation:

name: pork chops with dried fruit skillet ; ingredients: pork chops, water, vinegar, brown sugar, salt, ginger, pepper, dried apricot, dried prune, cornstarch ; preparation:Brown chops in skillet, over low heat, on both sides and pour off drippings. Combine water, vinegar, brown sugar, and seasonings. Mix well and pour over the chops. Add the spricots and prunes and cover. Continue cooking for about 40 minutes or until chops are tender. Remove from skillet to a serving platter and set aside. Add water slowly to cornstarch in small cup, stirring to blend. Gradually add this to the skillet and stir until thickened and well combined. About 5 minutes. Pour over the chops and serve. ; name: tuna rice casserole ; ingredients: brown rice, cream of mushroom soup, water, tuna fish, frozen peas, mozzarella cheese ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400 and put rice and tuna into casserole dish. On the stove, heat soup, adding the water to it. Bring to a boil. Add peas, stir and bring to boil again. Pour on top of rice. Lay cheese on top. Bake at 400 degrees for 20 minutes. ; name: green beans with warm bacon dressing ; ingredients: green beans, bacon, shallot, white wine vinegar ; preparation:Cook beans in a large pot of salted water until tender, about 8 minutes. Drain and transfer to a bowl. While the beans are boiling, cook bacon in a medium skillet until crisp, about 8 minutes. Drain bacon on paper towels. Add shallot to skillet and saute 30 seconds. Remove from heat and cool slightly. Stir vinegar into shallot mixture. Season with salt and pepper. Pour dressing over green beans and toss until coated. Crumble bacon over. ; name: seared tuna with ginger noodles ; ingredients: somen noodles, sesame oil, lime juice, wasabi, pickled ginger, fresh chives, tuna, sesame seeds ; preparation:Boil a large pot of water, throw in the noodles and cook for two minutes or until soft. Drain, rinse and cool. Mix the sesame oil, lime juice and wasabi paste together. Pour this over the noodles and mix in the pickled ginger and garlic chives. Press the tuna into the sesame seeds until the fish is coated on all sides. Heat a non-stick frying pan and cook the tuna for one minute on all sides or until just seared. Transfer to a chopping board, let the tuna rest for a moment and then cut it into thick slices. Serve with soy sauce and wasabi in dipping bowls. ; name: basil carrots ; ingredients: carrots, butter, salt, basil ; preparation:Slice carrots. Simmer, covered, in salted water until tender, about 10 to 15 minutes. Drain. Combine remaining ingredients. Toss with carrots. ; name: south african chicken kurma ; ingredients: fryer chickens, oil, onion, curry powder, garlic, sugar, salt, cayenne pepper, water ; preparation:Place all ingredients into a large stock pot with a lid. Bring to a boil on high heat for 15 minutes. Lower heat to medium. Simmer for one hour. Serve over rice. ; name: cajun alfredo sauce ; ingredients: butter, heavy cream, garlic, parmesan cheese, cajun seasoning ; preparation:Melt butter. Add garlic. Saute till you smell the garlic. Add cream. Hard simmer for 20 - 30 or until desired consistency. Add cheese and cajun seasoning. Cook until melted. Pour over favorite pasta. ; name: russian style turkey cutlets ; ingredients: white bread, half-and-half, ground turkey, egg, salt, fresh ground black pepper, dried dill, butter, dry breadcrumbs, cooking oil ; preparation:

name: grandma s coleslaw ; ingredients: cabbage, green pepper, celery, onion, carrot, vinegar, sugar, salt, celery seed, mustard seeds ; preparation:Prepare vegetables as directed. Combine in medium bowl. Set aside. In a small saucepan, combine vinegar, sugar and salt. Simmer until sugar is dissolved. Add celery seed and mustard seed. Cool. Pour vinegar mixture over vegetables. Stir until well coated. Chill and serve. ; name: panko fried jumbo shrimp ; ingredients: jumbo shrimp, seafood seasoning, salt, pepper, flour, eggs, milk, panko breadcrumbs, light olive oil ; preparation:Wash and dry shrimp. Season with essense or seafood season of your choice. Salt and pepper to taste. Coat in flour. Mix eggs and milk to make a wash. Run floured shrimp through egg wash. Coat with panko crumbs, set aside. Heat oil in fry pan over medium high heat until a popcorn kernal pops. Add half of shrimp to oil, cook to golden brown both sides. Remove and add second half of shrimp and repeat. ; name: golden vanilla wacky cake ; ingredients: all-purpose flour, sugar, baking soda, salt, whole milk, vegetable oil, vanilla extract, white vinegar ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350. Spray an 8-inch square metal baking pan with nonstick cooking spray. In a large bowl, whisk together flour, sugar, baking soda, and salt. Add in milk, oil, and vanilla to the flour mixture and stir until just blended. Whisk in vinegar until just blended. Immediately pour batter into pan. Bake for 25-30 minutes or until a pick comes out clean. Let cool completely in pan on a wire rack. Can eat as is, or dust with powdered sugar or top with frosting. ; name: carrots with raisin sauce ; ingredients: carrots, brown sugar, cornstarch, water, cider vinegar, raisins, butter ; preparation:Cook carrots in salted water until tender, drain. While carrots are cooking, mix brown sugar and cornstarch in a small saucepan. Stir in water, vinegar and raisins. Cook over low heat until sauce is thickened. Remove from heat, add butter, stir until melted and pour over carrots. ; name: spinach cucumber salad with yogurt dressing ; ingredients: lemon juice, honey, yogurt, olive oil, of fresh mint, salt and pepper, baby spinach leaves, cucumbers, red onion ; preparation:Whisk the lemon juice and honey in a bowl. In a separate bowl, whisk the yogurt and olive oil together. Whisk while adding the yogurt to the lemon juice in a thin stream. Add the mint, then add the salt and pepper to taste. Cover and chill the dressing for up to 24 hours. Combine the spinach, cucumbers and onion in a large bowl. Season with a little salt and pepper. Add just enough dressing to moisten the salad. Toss to coat, and serve with extra dressing on the side. ; name: cheddarburger loaf ; ingredients: lean ground beef, cheddar cheese, plain breadcrumbs, egg, onion, heinz 57 steak sauce, milk, salt, pepper ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350f. Combine all ingredients in a large bowl. Make into loaf. Bake in oven for 1 hour. Serve. ; name: kenyan greens simmered with tomatoes sukuma wiki ; ingredients: oil, onions, kale, tomatoes, water, salt and pepper ; preparation:Heat the oil over med-high flame in a large, heavy-bottomed pot. Add the onion and saute until translucent. Add the greens in batches, sauteing each addition until wilted. Add the tomatoes, water or stock, salt and pepper. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low and simmer gently until tender, from 20 to 30 minutes or done to your liking. Adjust seasoning and serve with a little bit of the broth. You can add a chopped chili pepper or two with the onions. If you like, add some leftover meat for more flavor. ; name: chicken salad sandwiches with poppy seed dressing ; ingredients: mayonnaise, honey, rice wine vinegar, poppy seeds, fuji apples, cooked chicken, dried cranberries ; preparation:

name: blue plate beef patties ; ingredients: egg, green onions, seasoned bread crumbs, prepared mustard, ground beef, beef gravy, water, prepared horseradish, fresh mushrooms ; preparation:Beat egg, stir in onions, crumbs, and mustard. Add ground beef, mix well. Shape into 4 patties. In ungreased skillet, cook patties for 5-6 minutes per side, until no longer pink. Drain. Mix gravy, water and horseradish. Add mishrooms. Pour over patties. Cook, uncovered, for 5 more minutes. ; name: adult popcorn ; ingredients: parmesan cheese, cayenne pepper, salt, cumin, thyme, butter, popcorn ; preparation:Combine parmesan, salt, cayenne, cumin& thyme. This is best done in the processor with the blade, process for 3 minutes so the mix is very fine. Pop the corn. Toss with the butter. Toss with the cheese mix. Best served now but may be prepared up to 4 hours in advance and served at room temperature. ; name: cherry o creamy cheesecake pie ; ingredients: graham cracker crust, cream cheese, sweetened condensed milk, bottled lemon juice, vanilla extract, cherry pie filling ; preparation:Whip cream cheese until fluffy. Gradually beat in sweetened condensed milk and blend. Blend in reallemon lemon juice and vanilla extract. Pour into pie crust and chill until firm. Top with chilled cherry pie filling and chill for at least 2 hours. ; name: govyadina v smetane russian steak in sour cream ; ingredients: steaks, olive oil, salt and pepper, onions, velveeta cheese, sour cream ; preparation:Prepare the 4 steaks and brown them quickly in the olive oil. Transfer them to a baking pan, season with salt and pepper. Keep warm. Chop the onions and soften them in the same frying pan. Spread them over the steaks. Sprinkle with the grated cheese and pour over the sour cream. Cover with foil. Bake in a pre-heated oven at 350f for one hour, removing the foil for the last 20 minutes. Serve with plain cooked vegetables. ; name: riverboat crescent ; ingredients: crescent rolls, parmesan cheese, dill weed, butter ; preparation:Separate dough and cut each triangle into half to form 2 triangles. Sprinkle each with approximately teaspoonful combined cheese and dill weed and press lightly. Roll up and place on ungreased cookie sheet with point side down. Brush with butter and sprinkle with remaining cheese mixture. Bake at 375 degrees for 10-12 minutes or until lightly brown. ; name: spicy bread discs ; ingredients: bread, green chilies, fresh coriander leaves, plain low-fat yogurt, semolina, red chili powder, fresh lemon juice, garam masala powder, garlic, salt ; preparation:Soak the bread slices in water for 30 seconds. Squeeze out the water by squeezing the bread between the palm of your hands. Mix all the ingredients together with the bread and knead into a dough. Divide the dough into 1 tbsp. Sized equal parts. Flatten and fry in hot oil until golden brown on either side. Drain on clean paper kitchen napkins. Serve hot with tomato ketchup or mint chutney. ; name: cheese burgers ; ingredients: vegetable oil, onion, lean ground beef, egg, parsley, roquefort cheese, worcestershire sauce, tabasco sauce, salt, pepper ; preparation:In small frying pan, heat 1 tablespoon of the oil. Add onion, cover, and cook over low heat for 4 minutes. Combine beef and egg, mixing well. To beef mixture, add cooked onion, parsley, worcestershire and tabasco sauces and mix well. Shape mixture into 4 large patties, scoring each with a knife. Heat remaining tablespoon of oil in large frying pan. When hot, add meat patties and cook 10 to 12 minutes over medium heat. Turn 4 times during cooking, and once seared, season well. When burgers are done, transfer to ovenproof dish. Cover each burger with a slice of cheese and broil 2 to 3 minutes. ; name: hungarian nut nuggets cookies ; ingredients: butter, powdered sugar, walnuts, vanilla extract, flour ; preparation:

name: skewered cheese tortellini with garlic parmesan sauce ; ingredients: cheese tortellini, parsley, virgin olive oil, parmesan cheese, fresh lemon juice, garlic cloves, salt & freshly ground black pepper ; preparation:Prepare the tortellini according to the packages directions. Add a little fresh water to the cooked tortellini to keep them from sticking together. Thread 24 4-inch skewers with 3 tortellini each. Arrange the skewers on a platter and sprinkle with 2 tablespoons of the parsley. In a small mixing bowl, mix together the remaining parsley, oil, parmesan cheese, lemon juice, garlic, salt and pepper. If desired, puree the sauce in a blender for 1 minute. With a pastry brush, brush the sauce on the tortellini. Reserve the remaining sauce to dip the skewers into the serving. ; name: welsh five minute potatoes ; ingredients: white potatoes, bacon, chicken stock, onion, salt & freshly ground black pepper ; preparation:Thinly slice the potatoes, then place in a bowl of water to prevent browning until needed. Brown bacon in a large skillet over medium heat. Remove and set aside. Add stock, onions, and potatoes to the pan and simmer until the potatoes are tender, about 8 minutes. Season with salt and pepper, then top with the bacon to reheat. Plate, leaving bacon on top. ; name: classic apple pie ; ingredients: apples, sugar, flour, cinnamon, nutmeg, lemon zest, butter, lard, salt, cold water ; preparation:Pastry for double crust pie-------------. Combine flour, lard and salt with a pastry blender or fork until balls are the size of a large pea. Add cold water by the spoonful and blend until the bowl starts to clean itself as you work the dough. Then it is ready for rolling. Preheat oven to 450f. Combine sliced apples with sugar, flour, cinnamon, nutmeg and lemon rind. Line pie plate with unbaked pie crust, trim pastry, crimp to edge of pie plate. Fill pie crust with apple mixture and dot with softened butter. Brush crust edge with water and place pie crust top on top of pie, crimp to the bottom crust. Make some slits in the top crust for steam to escape. Bake for 10 minutes. Turn oven down to 350f and bake for 45 minutes longer. ; name: berries n bits ; ingredients: condensed milk, cold water, cool whip, instant vanilla pudding, vanilla wafer, mini chocolate chip, strawberry ; preparation:Combine milk, water, and pudding. Mix well. Let chill for 5 minutes. Add cool whip to mixture and mix well. Layer vanilla wafers, pudding mixture, sliced strawberries, and chocolate chips. ; name: outback steakhouse outback special ; ingredients: sirloin steaks, old bay seasoning, light brown sugar, garlic powder, onion powder, ground cumin ; preparation:Heat an outdoor grill, stovetop grill pan, or broiler. Mix spice rub ingredients. Rub on both sides of steak. Grill or broil 5 minutes on each side for medium-rare. Remove to plates. Let rest 5 minutes before serving. ; name: hamburger dips ; ingredients: hamburger, french rolls, onion, swiss cheese, bacon, fresh mushrooms, au jus sauce ; preparation:In a large fry pan place patties, bacon, onion, and mushrooms fry over medium heat until patties are done. Place cheese slices on patties. Taost french rolls. Heat au jus. Assemble sandwiches pour au jus into bowls and serve. ; name: creamsicle jello shots ; ingredients: orange jell-o, boiling water, orange juice, water, triple sec, vodka ; preparation:Dissolve jello in boiling water. Stir for about 3 minutes. Add remaining ingredients and pour into shot containers. Chill for 4 hours and enjoy. If you have fresh squeezed oj that is the way to go. ; name: steak with caramelized onions ; ingredients: butter, onions, garlic, brown sugar, salt, boneless beef top sirloin steak, pepper, balsamic vinegar, fresh parsley ; preparation:

name: napa salad ; ingredients: coleslaw mix, green onions, beef-flavor ramen noodles, butter, slivered almonds, sunflower seeds, salad oil, soy sauce, sugar, white vinegar ; preparation:Put slaw in a large bowl. Add diced onions. Break up ramen noodles and add them to bowl set the bowl aside. Melt butter in a skillet and brown almonds and sunflower seeds. Cool the almonds and sunflower seeds, then add them to the bowl. Place all of the dressing ingredients in a separate bowl. Whisk together and pour over slaw mixture. Serve immediately. ; name: chilli spare ribs ; ingredients: spareribs, peanut oil, garlic, dry sherry, chili bean paste, water, hoisin sauce, sugar, soy sauce ; preparation:Place the pork in a large pot with water to cover. Bring to a boil and simmer for 5 minutes. Drain well. Place all the remaining ingredients and the pork ribs in a wok. Cover and simmer for 45 minutes. Drain, reserving 1 cup liquid. Heat a clean wok and sear the pork until browned. Add the reserved liquid and cook over medium until it glazes. Chop the pork into bite size pieces and serve. ; name: spicy potato wedges ; ingredients: potatoes, olive oil, salt, garlic powder, red pepper ; preparation:Preheat oven to 425 degrees. Combine potatoes and oil in a large bowl or plastic bag, tossing well to coat. Combine salt, garlic powder, and red pepper in a small bowl. Sprinkle salt mixture over potatoes, tossing well to coat. Arrange potatoes in a single layer on 2 baking sheets coated with cooking spray. Bake at 425 degrees for 25 minutes. Turn potato wedges over, and rotate pans. Baking an additional 20 minutes or until golden brown. ; name: asian green beans ; ingredients: fresh green beans, soy sauce, vegetable oil, vinegar, sesame oil, garlic clove ; preparation:Wash the beans and snap the ends off. Blanche them in boiling water for 3-4 minutes. Drain immediately and put into an ice cold water bath to retain crispness. Mix remaining ingredients in a small bowl. Pour over cooled green beans and refrigerate for at least half an hour, then serve. The longer they marinate the more intensely the flavors will develop. ; name: saki shrimp kabobs ; ingredients: soy sauce, oil, sake, ground ginger, garlic, large shrimp, mixed mushrooms, onion, cherry tomatoes, rice ; preparation:Combine soy sauce, oil, saki, garlic and ginger. Marinate shrimp about 2 hours. If you like softer grilled veggies, microwave them first to your taste. Skewer shrimp with a combination of mushrooms, onions and tomatoes. Grill or broil 10 to 12 minutes, turning frequently. Serve over rice pilaf. ; name: jane austen s regency toasted cheese welsh or scotch rarebit ; ingredients: cheddar cheese, cream, dry english-style mustard, worcestershire sauce, salt, pepper, thick bread, butter, chutney ; preparation:Melt the cheese over hot, but not boiling, water and then gradually stir in the rest of the ingredients. Mix well and set to one side. Taste and adjust seasonings. Toast the bread on one side only and then butter the untoasted side. Spread the melted rarebit mixture over the top of the bread - on the untoasted side - make sure the mixture is spread upto the edges. Place under a hot grill and cook until the rarebit mixture is bubbling hot and brown in patches, about 3 to 5 minutes depending on the heat of your grill. Serve immediately with a selection of chutneys, relishes and pickles. ; name: skillet caramelized parsnips ; ingredients: butter, parsnip, nutmeg, water, salt, cracked black pepper ; preparation:After peeling the parsnips, cut them into sticks the size of your pinkie finger. Dry off any moisture with a paper towel or sacking cloth. Melt the butter in a skillet over medium heat then add the parsnips, tossing to coat. Sprinkle the parsnips with the nutmeg. Cover the skillet tightly with a lid and cook the parsnips over medium heat for approximately 10 minutes or until the parsnips reach a golden brown color. All stoves are different so if it looks like the parsnips may be cooking too quickly, lower the heat. Add the water, place the lid back on the skillet and steam until the water has evaporated and the parsnips are golden, tender and caramelized. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Serve immediately. ; name: weeknight meatballs ; ingredients: ground beef, white bread, egg, garlic powder, onion powder, ground pepper, tomato paste, hunts tomato sauce, sugar, salt ; preparation:

name: lauralie s low fat zesty black bean dip ; ingredients: black beans, diced tomatoes with green chilies, cilantro, lime, reduced-fat mexican cheese blend, fat free sour cream, tortilla chips ; preparation:Drain and rinse black beans. Drain tomatoes and chilies. Add cilantro, and squeeze in lime. Mash and mix together in a pie pan. Bake for 10 minutes. Add cheese and cook until melted. Serve with sour cream and tortilla chips. ; name: 1 2 3 granola ; ingredients: rolled oats, wheat germ, sunflower seeds, walnuts, honey, oil, vanilla extract ; preparation:Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. In a large mixing bowl, combine the first 4 ingredients. In a 2-quart saucepan, heat the honey, oil and vanilla until syrupy. Add to the dry ingredients and mix well. Spread on a jellyroll pan. Bake for 20 minutes, stirring every 5 minutes. Store in a covered container. ; name: tofu quick lemon cream pie ; ingredients: extra-firm silken tofu, fresh lemon juice, lemon peel, sugar, egg white, graham cracker pie crust, frozen light whipped dessert topping ; preparation:Blenderize tofu, lemon juice and sugar. Add lemon peel. Fold in thawed whipped topping. Brush graham cracker crust with slightly beaten egg white. Bake at 375 degrees f for 5 minutes. Allow crust to cool. Pour lemon filling into cooled pie crust. Chill. When ready to serve, garnish with fresh berries or other fruits. Can also be frozen. ; name: zucchini and caramelized onions ; ingredients: olive oil, onion, sugar, zucchini, tomatoes, red pepper flakes, salt and pepper ; preparation:Heat oil over medium high heat. Add onions, cook stirring for 5 minutes. Add sugar, cook about 7 minutes until carmelized. Add water if necessary to prevent sticking. Add zucchini, cook about 5 minutes until tender. Add tomato and pepper flakes. Cook until heated through and tomato begins to release juices, about 5 minutes add salt and pepper. ; name: skillet pork chops ; ingredients: pork chops, oil, onion, chicken broth, grape jelly, ginger, cornstarch, water ; preparation:Brown chops in oil. Add onion, cook until tender. Add broth, bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 12 minutes. Remove chops, keep warm. Stir in jelly and ginger. Mix cornstarch with water, add to skillet. Bring to a boil, cook and stir 2 minutes. Serve over the chops. ; name: green beans with dijon mustard and caramelized shallots ; ingredients: frozen green beans, butter, shallots, dijon mustard ; preparation:Heat frozen green beans according to package directions. Melt 1 tbutter in heavy large skillet over medium-high heat. Add shallots and saute until deep brown and crisp. Melt 1 t butter in heavy large pot over medium-high heat. Whisk in mustard. Add green beans. Toss until heated through and evenly coated, about 4 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Mound beans on platter. Sprinkle with shallots. ; name: butterscotch buttercream icing ; ingredients: butterscotch chips, heavy whipping cream, butter, vanilla, powdered sugar ; preparation:Place butterscotch chips in a small saucepan with whipping cream and melt on low temperature. Stir constantly. Allow to cool for approximately 20 minutes. In mixing bowl cut up the butter into small pieces and add the butterscotch mixture. Blend together on high until mixed well and fluffy. Add vanilla and mix well. Add powdered sugar and blend until light and fluffy add more sugar if necessary. ; name: easy honey cranberry french toast with brie ; ingredients: butter, cranberries, honey, eggs, sugar, milk, vanilla, whole grain bread, brie cheese ; preparation:

name: apple ham steak ; ingredients: vidalia onion, fresh ground pepper, butter, ham steak, cornstarch, unsweetened apple juice, apple butter ; preparation:In a large skillet, saute onion and pepper in butter until crisp tender. Remove from pan and set aside. Cut ham steak into 4 pieces and in the same skillet, brown ham on both sides. While ham is browning, in a small bowl, combine the cornstarch and apple juice until smooth. Then pour over ham. Bring juices to a boil and cook while stirring for 1-2 minutes or until slightly thickened. Reduce heat and spread apple butter over ham. Top with sauteed onion. Cover pan and simmer for 5-7 minutes or until thoroughly heated through. ; name: crock pot beef with red wine ; ingredients: roast beef, onions, potatoes, onion soup mix, cornstarch, salt & pepper, dry red wine ; preparation:Place the beef, potatoes and onions in a crockpot. Add the dry soup mix over top. Sprinkle with cornstarch, salt and pepper. Pour red wine over all. Cover and cook on low heat setting for 10 to 12 hours. ; name: super easy peanut noodles ; ingredients: ramen noodles, creamy peanut butter, garlic clove, soy sauce, lime, juice of, red pepper flakes, carrots, red peppers, scallion ; preparation:Break up noodles in the package into smaller pieces. Throw away flavor packets. Cook in boiling water for two minutes or until al dente and then drain. Combine the peanut butter, garlic, soy sauce and lime juice. Add red pepper flakes to your preference. Stir or whisk until smooth. Add the carrots, red pepper and scallions. Pour over the noodles. You can substitute whatever vegetables you have on hand, if you have a can of water chestnuts or a bag of bean sprouts or some celery that works too. ; name: dads favorite mac and cheese ; ingredients: elbow macaroni, cheese, butter, flour, milk, breadcrumbs ; preparation:Cook pasta as per package directions. Combine butter and flour in a medium saucepan and melt on low to medium heat. Add half of the milk and cheese to saucepan and stir until melted. Add the rest of the milk and cheese to saucepan and stir until melted. Place pasta in baking dish and pour cheese sauce over pasta and then stir. Salt and pepper to taste and top with bread crumbs if desired. Bake uncovered for 30 mins at 350. ; name: mock girl scout thin mint cookies ; ingredients: chocolate-flavored candy coating, vegetable shortening, peppermint oil, ritz crackers ; preparation:Melt chocolate coating. I melt mine in a large bowl in the microwave. Stir in the peppermint oil and the shortening. Dip ritz crackers in chocolate cover completely. Place coated crackerers on waxed paper and let sit until chocolate is hard. Store in air tight container. ; name: ww sliced baked potatoes 4 points ; ingredients: baking potatoes, parmesan cheese, cheddar cheese, butter, fresh herbs, salt ; preparation:Preheat the oven to 425 degrees f. Peel the potatoes if the skin is too tough, otherwise just scrub and rinse them. Cut the potatoes into thin slices. Put the potatoes in a baking dish. Slightly fan out the slices. Drizzle the potatoes with melted butter and sprinkle with herbs and salt. Bake the potatoes for about 50 minutes. Remove the potatoes from the oven, sprinkle with parmesan and cheddar cheese. Bake the potatoes for another 10-15 minutes. ; name: pound cake s mores ; ingredients: poundcake, mini marshmallows, semi-sweet chocolate chips, caramel ice cream topping, nuts ; preparation:Place pound cake slices on a baking sheet. I line the sheet with foil for easy clean-up. Sprinkle each slice with marshmallows and chocolate chips. Above measurements are approximate for these toppings. I make sure each slice is covered but not heaping. Broil 4-6 inches from the heat for 1-2 minutes or til marshmallows are lightly browned. Transfer to a plate. Drizzle with caramel ice cream topping and sprinkle on nuts if desired. ; name: the best spinach pie and so easy ; ingredients: pie crust, butter, mushrooms, jarlsberg cheese, spinach souffle ; preparation:

name: poat dot cambodian grilled corn ; ingredients: corn, vegetable oil, fish sauce, water, sugar, salt, green onions ; preparation:Prepare charcoal grill or preheat an ungreased cast-iron skillet over medium heat. Very lightly brush the corn with oil and set on the grill rack or in the skillet. Cook, turning every 2-3 minutes, until the kernels are tender and nicely charred, 12-15 minutes total. Keep warm. Meanwhile, in a bowl stir together the fish sauce, water, sugar and salt until it is dissolved. Heat the 2 tbsp oil in a saucepan over medium heat until very hot but not smoking. Carefully pour liquid mixture in. Add the green onions and simmer until the sauce begins to thicken, about 30 seconds. Remove from heat and cool. Brush cooked corn with the sauce and serve. ; name: pumpkin french toast vegan ; ingredients: pumpkin puree, almond milk, cornstarch, cinnamon, ground ginger, ground cloves, pure vanilla extract, baguette, cooking oil ; preparation:Mix together all ingredients except for the bread. Spread out baguette slices on a rimmed baking pan in a single layer. Pour on pumpkin mixture and flip to coat. Let sit for 20 minutes, then flip over and soak for 10 minutes more. Preheat a large non-stick skillet over medium heat. Spray with cooking oil, or drizzle a little into the pan, and cook about half of the soaked breads at a time for 5 to 7 minutes on one side and about 3 minutes on the other. They should be golden to medium brown and flecked with darker spots. Keep warm on a plate covered with tin foil while you cook the second batch. If not serving immediately, cover and place in a 200f oven for up to an hour. Serve with maple syrup and margarine, of course. ; name: crab melt ; ingredients: cheddar cheese, butter, lemon juice, worcestershire sauce, garlic salt, crabmeat, chives, french bread ; preparation:Melt butter and cheese over low heat. Add lemon juice, worcestershire sauce, and garlic salt. Mix well. Process in blender until smooth. In bowl, fold in crabmeat and chives. Slice bread into half inch slices and spread on crabmeat mixture. Place on ungreased baking sheet. Bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes. Serve immediately. ; name: rack of lamb persille ; ingredients: racks of lamb, dijon mustard, unsalted butter, shallot, dried thyme, italian style breadcrumbs, salt, pepper, parsley ; preparation:Preheat oven to 450 degrees f. French the lamb by trimming the. Rub the fat side of each rack with mustard. In a saute pan, melt the butter over medium-low heat and cook shallots for 2 minutes, stirring constantly. Remove from the heat. Add thyme, bread crumbs, salt and pepper to taste and pat the mixture evenly onto the mustard, and arrange crumb side up in a roasting pan. Roast for 30 minutes, or until meat thermometer reaches 130-140 for medium rare. Carefully remove from the oven and let stand for 10 minutes. To serve, interlock the ribs, transfer to a serving platter and cut the chops. If you like, you could put paper frills on the frenched end bone of each chop. ; name: leek onion and potato soup ; ingredients: leeks, potatoes, onion, butter, chicken stock, milk, heavy cream ; preparation:Melt butter in a large saucepan. Add leeks, onions and potatoes and stir. Cover saucepan and sweat veg for 10-15 minutes. Add stock and milk and bring to boil. Replace lid and simmer for 20 minutes. Blend the soup and return to the saucepan. Season and add cream to taste. ; name: bettyo s rigatoni ala vodka ; ingredients: scallions, garlic clove, butter, vodka, half-and-half, tomato sauce, pecorino romano cheese, basil, garlic powder ; preparation:In a skillet saute butter and finely chopped garlic and scallions until tender. Remove from heat. Ignite and let vodka cook down,. In a sauce pot add tomato sauce, half and half, pecarino romano, basil, and garlic powder. Then add vodka and chopped scallion and garlic butter mixture into the sauce. Cook over medium heat, stirring. Pour over cooked rigatoni. Garnish with fresh parsley. I recommend pouring the sauce over each individual dish it goes further. ; name: fooled you maple spread ; ingredients: brown sugar, all-purpose flour, milk, butter, maple extract ; preparation:In a saucpan, stir together brown sugar, flour, milk and butter. Turn heat to low and cook, stirring often, until mixture is lump-free and smooth. Remove from heat and stir in maple extract. Place in a bowl or jar and refrigerate until serving. After it is chilled you can bring it to room temperature if you wish, to make spreading easier. ; name: grainy french style mustard ; ingredients: brown mustard seeds, rice vinegar, mustard powder, salt, beer ; preparation:

name: sweet potato gravy ; ingredients: flour, onions, garlic, pecan pieces, water, salt, cayenne pepper, sweet potato ; preparation:Make a dark brown roux, about 3 minutes. Add the onions and saute for 5 minutes, or until wilted. Stir in the garlic, pecans and water. Season with salt and cayenne. Bring the liquid to a boil. Add the sweet potatoes and blend to make the sauce smooth. Stir in the cane syrup and green onions. ; name: brown sugar chili ; ingredients: extra lean ground beef, brown sugar, prepared mustard, onion, kidney beans, low-sodium tomato juice, salt, black pepper, chili powder ; preparation:Brown ground beef and onion in non-stick skillet over medium heat. Stir brown sugar and mustard into meat. Combine all ingredients in crockpot. Cover, cook on high for 2 hours. If convenient, stir several times during cooking. ; name: coffee biscuits ; ingredients: butter, sugar, flour, vanilla essence, instant coffee powder, baking powder, chocolate ; preparation:Cream butter and sugar. Add sifted dry ingredients. Roll into balls and place on a greased oven tray and flatten. Place a chocolate button in the centre of each biscuit. Bake for 15 - 20 minutes at 175c. ; name: rice bubble cake ; ingredients: butter, sugar, honey, rice bubbles ; preparation:Melt butter, sugar and honey in a large pot. Bring to the boil. Boil for 1 to 2 minutes stirring constantly to prevent burning. The longer you cook your toffee for, the crunchier your cakes will be. Remove from the heat and working quickly, add rice bubbles and press into a greased tin. Mark into squares while still warm. ; name: cherry chocolate cookies ; ingredients: butter, sugar, eggs, pure vanilla extract, all-purpose flour, cocoa powder, cream of tartar, baking soda, salt, dried cherries ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease a large cookie sheet. Beat butter and sugar in a large bowl with mixer at high speed, until light and fluffy. Add egg and vanilla. Beat until well blended. Combine flour, cocoa, cream of tartar, baking soda and salt in a medium bowl. Add to butter mixture. Mix until uniform. Mix in chopped cherries. Drop dough by tablespoonfuls onto prepared cookie sheet. Bake about 10-12 minutes or until set. ; name: sweet cabbage salad ; ingredients: cabbage, carrot, green bell pepper, red onion, sugar, white wine vinegar, olive oil, dry mustard, celery seed, salt ; preparation:Combine first 4 ingredients in a large bowl. Toss well. Combine sugar and remaining ingredients in a small bowl, stirring with a whisk. Pour vinegar mixture over cabbage mixture, tossing gently to combine. Cover. Chill 1 hour. ; name: roasted corn and pepper salad ; ingredients: white shoepeg corn, red bell pepper, olive oil, green onions, sugar, cumin, salt, lime juice, fresh cilantro ; preparation:In medium bowl, combine corn, bell pepper and oil. Toss to coat. Spread in ungreased 15 x 10 x 1 inch baking pan or on cookie sheet. Broil 4 to 6 inches from heat for 9 to 14 minutes or until corn is light golden brown, stirring once or twice. Place corn mixture in same bowl. Add onions, sugar, cumin, salt and lime juice. Mix well. Sprinkle with cilantro. Serve immediately. ; name: weight watchers brownie cupcake bites ; ingredients: brownie mix, water, unsweetened applesauce, egg whites, light whipped topping, candy corn ; preparation:

name: easy chicken cordon bleu pockets ; ingredients: refrigerated reduced-fat crescent rolls, cooked chicken, ham, swiss cheese, egg ; preparation:Heat oven to 350. Combine chicken, ham and cheese in a bowl. Separate dough into 8 rectangles. Firmly press perforations to seal well. Evenly divide mixture between rectangles. Pull up corners of rectangles to center and twist. Pinch edges to seal & place on a cookie sheet lined with foil and sprayed with olive oil spray. Brush pockets with egg & bake for about 20 minutes or until golden brown. ; name: lentils couscous recipe ; ingredients: lentils, couscous, onions, olive oil, water, salt, black pepper, cumin, cayenne ; preparation:Saute onions with olive oil until golden brown. Reserve 4 tablespoons of browned onions for garnish. Meanwhile place lentils, water salt, and black pepper in a different saucepan and cook for around 20 minutes or until lentils are tender. Add couscous, browned onions, cumin, and dash of cayenne to the lentils, stir, cover and simmer for about 5-10 minutes or until water is absorbed. Place lentils and couscous in serving dish and garnish with 4 tablespoons of reserved browned onions. This recipe is best when served with tomatoe salad. See my recipe for tomatoe salad. ; name: garlic lime chicken breasts ; ingredients: fresh lime juice, olive oil, garlic, salt, black pepper, chicken breast halves, lime wedge ; preparation:Whisk together lime juice, oil, garlic, salt, and pepper in a large bowl. Add chicken, turning to coat. Marinate chicken, covered and refrigerated, turning once or twice, for at least 2 hours and up to 8 hours. Put a rack in the upper third of the oven and preheat to 400 degrees. Remove chicken from marinade and arrange skin side up, without crowding, in a shallow baking dish. Season with salt and pepper. Roast until just cooked through, 25 to 30 minutes. If chicken has a skin, turn oven to broil. Broil chicken about 2 inches from the heat until skin is crisp, about 2 minutes. Serve with lime wedges. ; name: paula deen s fiery cajun shrimp ; ingredients: butter, worcestershire sauce, fresh lemon juice, ground pepper, hot sauce, garlic cloves, salt, medium shrimp, lemons, french bread ; preparation:Preheat the oven to 400 degrees f. Stir together the butter, worcestershire sauce, lemon juice, pepper, hot sauce, garlic, and salt. Pour half this mixture into a large heatproof dish. Layer half the shrimp and half the lemon slices in the dish. Then form a second layer with the remaining shrimp and lemon slices, and pour remaining sauce into the dish. Bake, uncovered, for 20 minutes, or until the shrimp are pink, stirring twice. Pour off the sauce into individual serving dishes. Serve the shrimp with plenty of french bread for dipping in the spicy butter sauce. ; name: cookies cream banana pie ; ingredients: oreo cookies, unsalted butter, cookies & cream ice cream, banana, hot fudge ; preparation:Grind the cookies in processor. Place 2 tablespoons of crumbs into a small bowl. Set aside for now. Add the melted butter to crumbs in the processor. Blend until moist crumbs form. Press mixture onto bottom and sides of 9-inch metal pie pan and freeze until firm, 10 minutes. Spread half of the ice cream into the crust. Top pie with slices of banana and spread remaining ice cream over. Sprinkle remaining 2 tablespoons of crumbs over pie. Freeze until firm. Serve with fudge sauce. ; name: warm potato salad low fat ; ingredients: small potato, dijon mustard, whole grain mustard, rice vinegar, red wine vinegar, shallots, extra virgin olive oil, fresh flat-leaf parsley, salt, fresh ground black pepper ; preparation:Put the potatoes in a saucepan, add water to cover and bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce the heat to medium and cook, uncovered, until the potatoes are tender, 15 to 20 minutes. Drain and let stand until just cool enough to handle. Cut each potato in half and place in a warmed serving dish. In a small bowl, whisk together the mustards, the vinegars and the shallot until well blended. While whisking, slowly drizzle in the olive oil to make a thick dressing. Stir in the parsley, salt and pepper. Pour the dressing over the warm potatoes, mix gently and serve immediately. ; name: spicy tuna gourmet ribbon sandwiches ; ingredients: tuna, cream cheese, green capsicum, red capsicum, margarine, white sandwich loaf, whole wheat sandwich loaf ; preparation:Spread a slice of white bread with margarine, top with spicy tuna. Spread a slice of wholemeal bread with margarine and cover. Top this layer with cream cheese mixed with finely chopped capsicums and top again with a slice of white bread. Cut off the crusts as accurately as possible, and then cut long ways into three and then in half. Makes almost both loaves of sandwich bread. You can also mix and match using wholegrain loaf. Garnish sandwiches on a tray with parsley and serve. ; name: gluten free sponge cake ; ingredients: cornflour, baking powder, eggs, salt, sugar ; preparation:

name: speedy moroccan meatballs ; ingredients: frozen meatballs, olive oil, onion, dried apricots, cinnamon stick, chopped tomatoes, sliced almonds, cilantro ; preparation:Fry the meatballs in oil for 10 minutes, turning occasionally until cooked. Remove meatballs from pan and set aside. Add the onion and cook for a further 5 minutes, until soft. Add the apricots, cinnamon and tomatoes. Half fill the empty can with water and add to the pan, then bring to the boil and simmer for 5 minutes. Remove the cinnamon. Return the meatballs to the pan and coat with the sauce. Sprinkle over the almonds and cilantro. ; name: carne adovada marinated pork ; ingredients: pork ribs, salt, garlic, whole leaf oregano, blended red chili sauce ; preparation:Sprinkle meat with salt. Add garlic and oregano to blended chili. Pour over meat and marinate in refrigerator 6-8 hours or overnight. Cook slowly on top of stove or in 350 oven until meat is done, about 1 hour. Thick slices of potatoes may be marinated with the meat. ; name: mushroom ramen ; ingredients: ramen noodles, wild mushroom, vegetable oil, butter ; preparation:Soak 1 packet ramen noodles in warm water, 5 minutes. Drain. Stir-fry 1 pound sliced wild mushrooms and the ramen flavor packet in a cast-iron skillet with vegetable oil, 3 minutes. Transfer to a plate. Add 1 tablespoon butter and the noodles to the skillet, toss 1 minute, then add the mushrooms. ; name: roasted pumpkin seeds with a twist ; ingredients: pumpkin seeds, olive oil, garlic salt, onion powder, hot sauce ; preparation:Preheat oven to 300f. Place the seeds in a bowl and add the olive oil then the seasonings. Mix well. Spread pumpkin seeds on a single layer on baking sheet. Bake for about 30 minutes depending on your oven. Stir half way through. ; name: potato and carrot salsa ; ingredients: carrots, potatoes, tomatoes, fresh oregano, jalapeno chiles, orange, juice of, salt ; preparation:Wash and peel the carrots and potatoes. Cook separately in boiling water until tender. Dice and put into a bowl. Set aside. In blender, liquify tomatoes, oregano jalapeos, and salt. Add to carrot and potato mixture along with the orange juice. ; name: roasted garlic thyme chicken ; ingredients: chicken breasts, garlic cloves, thyme, butter, red onions, pancetta, oil, mixed salad greens ; preparation:Heat the oven to 400f. Put the chicken skin-side-up in a small roasting tin. Mix together the garlic, thyme and butter and dot over the chicken. Scatter around the red onions and pancetta and drizzle with oil. Roast for 20 minutes until the chicken has cooked through and the onions are softened. Divide the salad between 4 plates and top with the red onions, pancetta and chicken. ; name: spice of life flank steak ; ingredients: garlic clove, vegetable oil, vinegar, salt, pepper, dry mustard, worcestershire sauce, cayenne, tabasco sauce ; preparation:Whisk all ingredients together. Marinate flank steak in the marinade for at least 3 hours and if possible, overnight. Turn the meat a few times during marination. Remove meat from marinade and discard. Grill or broil to your liking. ; name: orange sunshine cake ; ingredients: eggs, sugar, self rising flour, salt, orange, juice and rind of, butter ; preparation:

name: orange beef and rice ; ingredients: oil, top round beef, onion, garlic cloves, sliced mushrooms, carrot, rice pilaf mix, orange juice, beef broth ; preparation:Briefly heat oil in large, deep pot over medium-high heat. Add beef and onion. Cook, stirring frequently, for 5 minutes. Add garlic, mushrooms and carrots. Cook another 5 minutes. Add pilaf mix, orange juice and beef broth. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer, covered, for 20 minutes or until liquid has been absorbed. ; name: quick party pitcher ; ingredients: frozen limeade concentrate, apple juice, ginger ale, ice, maraschino cherry ; preparation:In a large pitcher combine limeade and apple juice. Shake vigorously. Add ginger ale. Put ice in glasses, pour in mixture. Top with maraschino cherries. ; name: stuffed shell pierogies ; ingredients: potatoes, cheddar cheese, salt, pepper, onions, butter, jumbo pasta shells ; preparation:Cooks potatoes until soft, drain. Add cheese, salt & pepper and mash until smooth. Melt margarine or butter in large skillet. Add onions and cook 10 to 15 minutes until tender but not browned. Spread half the onions over the bottom of a 13x9 baking dish. Stuff each shell with heaping tablespoon of the potato mixture, close edges. Arrange in single layer over onions, spread remaining onions on top. Bake at 350 degrees uncovered 15 to 20 minutes or until heated through. ; name: pancake syrup increaser ; ingredients: granulated sugar, brown sugar, water, maple extract, vanilla ; preparation:In a large saucepan combine the white sugar, brown sugar and water. Bring to a boil, lower heat and simmer stirring for 3 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in vanilla and maple extract. Cool to almost room temperature then add to your bottle of store-bought syrup. Seal tightly and refrigerate. This will last as long as your bottled pancake syrup. ; name: greek pasta ; ingredients: boneless skinless chicken breasts, black olives, red onion, green pepper, plum tomato, feta cheese, vinaigrette, cooked spaghetti ; preparation:Cut chicken into chunks and stir fry in olive oil until cooked. Add olives, red onion, and green pepper. Fry until softened. Add spaghetti, dressing, feta cheese and tomato. Stir fry until thoroughly heated and well combined. Serve hot. Serves 4 generously. ; name: pesto havarti grilled eggplant burgers ; ingredients: eggplant, olive oil, havarti cheese, pesto sauce, sandwich bread ; preparation:Cut the eggplant into hamburger-sized pieces. Brush each piece, front and back, with olive oil. Shred the havarti cheese. Grill the eggplant until almost done. Sprinkle the shredded havarti cheese on each eggplant. Remove the eggplant when the cheese is melted. Spread the pesto on each eggplant. Serve on the bread of your choice. ; name: kelly s fresh peach cobbler ; ingredients: peaches, sugar, ground cinnamon, butter, flour, baking powder, salt, vanilla extract, milk ; preparation:In large bowl, combine, peaches, cup sugar, and teaspoon cinnamon. Set aside. Melt butter and pour into an 8 square baking dish or pan. In another lg. Bowl, whisk together flour, baking powder, salt teaspoon cinnamon, and cup sugar til all mixed. Stir in milk and vanilla til just combined. Dont over mix. Pour batter over butter evenly. Top batter evenly with peaches,.
