Add flour and mustard. Keep it a nice smooth paste. Add melted butter, milk, water and lastly vinegar. Cook over low heat until as thick as cream. Do not boil. Keep in refrigerator. ; name: hamburger mushroom bake ; ingredients: biscuit mix, water, ground beef, onion, cream of mushroom soup, onion soup mix, sliced mushrooms ; preparation:

name: potato au gratin bordeaux region ; ingredients: potatoes, cream, milk, garlic cloves, salt, pepper, butter ; preparation:Peel and slice the potatoes about 3-5mm thick. Add to a saucepan and cover with water, bring to the boil and reduce to a simmer for 7- 10minutes, they should be just cooked. Grease a 25x25 cm square baking dish with butter. Well drain the potatoes and pour into the dish, let cool for 20 minutes. In a bowl, mix the other ingredients in and pour over the almost cold potatoes. More butter can be dotted over the top if desired. Bake at 180oc for 25 minutes. ; name: chicken chorizo skewers ; ingredients: chicken thigh fillets, olive oil, garlic cloves, ground oregano, sweet paprika, lemon juice, brown sugar, chorizo sausages ; preparation:Combine chicken, oil, garlic, oregano, paprika, lemon juice and sugar in a bowl. Place in the fridge for 2 hours to marinate. Evenly thread the chicken, alternating with chorizo, among the skewers. Heat a char-grill pan or barbecue on high. Add the skewers and cook, turning, for 6-8 minutes or until chicken is cooked through. ; name: apples in wine and cinnamon sauce ; ingredients: margarine, dry white wine, sliced apples, ground cinnamon, sugar, lemon juice, vanilla ; preparation:Over medium heat in a heavy saucepan, melt the margarine, then add the wine and stir in the apples. Sprinkle the cinnamon and sugar over the mixture and stir. Continue cooking for about 10 minutes, then stir in the lemon juice and vanilla. Lower the heat to a simmer and cover. Continue cooking for 2 hours, stirring occasionally until the apples break up. ; name: hot feta ; ingredients: feta cheese, lemon thyme leaves, olive oil, olive ; preparation:Preheat oven to 180 c. Cut two 40cms lengths of foil and layer on top of each other. Top with a piece of baking paper. Place feta in middle of baking paper. Sprinkle with thyme or other herbs. Season with salt and pepper. Drizzle with oil. Fold paper and foil edges and turn upwards to seal and form a parcel. Place parcel on a baking tray. Bake 20 minutes till feta is heated through and slightly soft. Serve warm with crackers and olives. ; name: chocolate chip blondies ; ingredients: brown sugar, butter, eggs, vanilla extract, flour, baking powder, salt, milk chocolate chips ; preparation:In a large bowl, combine brown sugar, butter, eggs and vanilla just until blended. Combine flour, baking powder and salt. Add to brown sugar mixture. Stir in chocolate chips. Spread into a a greased 13x9 pan. Bake at 350 for 18-20 minutes or until a toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean. Cool on a wire rack. Cut into bars. ; name: southwestern chicken foil packets ; ingredients: aluminum foil, boneless skinless chicken breasts, chunky salsa, black beans, sweetcorn ; preparation:Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Rinse chicken breasts and pat dry. Place one chicken breast in the middle of each sheet of foil wrap or parchment paper. Spoon one fourth of the salsa, black beans and sweetcorn on each of the four chicken breasts. Seal each pack by bringing up sides and folding the top edge over twice. Seal the edges in the same way, leaving enough room for heat to circulate inside. Place packs on a cookie sheet and cook for 20 minutes. Unseal packs carefully. ; name: goulash heart healthy version ; ingredients: ground turkey, whole wheat elbow macaroni, onion, light cheese whiz, garlic powder, diced tomatoes, salt and pepper ; preparation:Cook macaroni until al dente, drain and reserve. Brown ground turkey. Add onion and garlic powder, cook until onion is translucent. Add tin of tomatoes, with their juices. Return cooked macaroni to pot, heat through. Add cheez whiz, stir until melted. Season with salt and pepper, to taste. ; name: no bake chocolate mousse pie ; ingredients: cream cheese, sugar, baking cocoa, milk, vanilla, frozen whipped topping, 9-inch graham cracker crust ; preparation:

name: rutabaga pudding irish ; ingredients: rutabaga, fine breadcrumbs, milk, butter, salt, sugar, egg ; preparation:Clean, peel and cube the rutabaga, and cook in boiling water until tender, then drain. Mash thoroughly. Then add all the other ingredients. Put into a 2-quart casserole and bake at 350f for 1 hour. A pinch of cinnamon or ginger might be added. ; name: crispy bananas with cinnamon chocolate sauce ; ingredients: bananas, flour, egg, half-and-half, panko breadcrumbs, semi-sweet chocolate chips, cinnamon, whipped cream, vegetable oil ; preparation:Add 1 cup half and half and chocolate chips to a small saucepan, and melt together over low heat. Add cinnamon, stir well. Cut bananas into quarters. Beat egg with 1 tbsp half and half. Dredge bananas in flour, egg, and then panko crumbs. Heat oil in a wide skillet over medium heat. Fry bananas just until crisp and lightly browned. Serve 1 banana in each dish, drizzled with chocolate sauce and topped with whipped cream. ; name: orange witches brew punch ; ingredients: orange gelatin, sugar, boiling water, apricot nectar, pineapple juice, lemon juice, ginger ale ; preparation:In a large bowl, dissolve gelatin and sugar in water. Stir in the apricot nectar, pineapple juice and lemon juice. Freeze in two 2-qt. Freezer containers. Remove from the freezer 2-3 hours before serving. Place contents of one container in a punch bowl. Mash with potato masher. Stir in ginger ale just before serving. Repeat. ; name: intense black bean soup ; ingredients: water, black beans, onions, garlic cloves, olive oil, cayenne pepper, crushed red pepper flakes, green bell pepper, salt, pepper ; preparation:Mix 7 cups of water and black beans and set to boil on medium heat. Sautee onions, garlic, cayenne, and crushed red pepper in olive oil until onions are soft. Add onion mixture to the beans and water and stir. Boil for 15 minutes. Add chopped green bell pepper and lower heat to simmer for 20 minutes. Allow to cool for 15-20 minutes. Pour half of the mixture into a blender and puree. Add to pot and reheat until ready to serve. Good with crackers, whole wheat toast, and pitas. ; name: buffalo ranch chicken dip with frito scoops ; ingredients: chicken, ranch salad dressing, hot sauce, philadelphia cream cheese, cheddar cheese ; preparation:Mix all ingredients except cheese. Bake at 350f for 25 minutes and stir after 12 minutes. Optional take a cup of cheese and mix it in the mixture when you stir after 12 minutes. Place back in oven for 8 minutes. Take remaining cheese and put it on top of the mixture and replace in oven for 5 minutes or until cheese is melted. I usually double this recipe. ; name: asian chili pork tenderloin ; ingredients: pork tenderloin, sweet chili sauce, soy sauce, fresh orange juice, green onion, fresh ginger, sesame seeds, honey, vegetable oil ; preparation:Mix all the ingredients except the oil in a large plastic zip lock bag, mix well so the meat is coated. Place in the fridge for at least 2 hours or overnight. Remove pork from marinade -save marinade. Heat oil in a skillet and saute the pork over medium high heat for 3 minutes, flip and continue cooking for another 3 minutes or until the pork is nicely browned on both sides. Pour in the marinade cook for an additional 3 minutes or until the sauce has thickened. ; name: beans and burger hillbilly chili ; ingredients: lean ground beef, baked beans, onion, barbecue sauce ; preparation:Brown beef in a large high-sided skillet or soup pot. Drain the fat from the beef and discard. Return the cooked beef to the pot and add the onion, beans, and barbecue sauce. Cook for about 30 minutes over medium heat, stirring occaisionally. Serve with corn muffins, fried potatoes, hot sauce, or diced raw onion. ; name: hot mexican potato salad ; ingredients: tiny new potatoes, picante sauce, lime juice, olive oil, salt, pepper, roma tomato, black olives, green onions, fresh cilantro ; preparation:

name: hot scarlet wine punch ; ingredients: cranberry juice, brown sugar, cinnamon sticks, cloves, white zinfandel wine ; preparation:In a lrg saucepan, combine cranberry juice, brown sugar, cinnamon stick & cloves. Bring to a boil, reduce heat & simmer uncovered for 5 minute remove spices. Add white zinfandel. Heat till just warm. Ladle into mugs or transfer to a warm, heatproof pitcher & pour into mugs. ; name: banana cardamom muffins ; ingredients: butter, sugar, bananas, eggs, buttermilk, vanilla, salt, baking powder, ground cardamom, flour ; preparation:Preheat oven to 425f, spray muffin tin with non-stick cooking spray. In a bowl, cream butter and sugar. Add the bananas, eggs, buttermilk and vanilla and mix well. In another bowl, mix the salt, baking powder, cardamom and flour. Add the flour to the banana mixture and mix until just combined. Fill muffin tin and bake for 19 minutes. ; name: glazed carrots with ginger ; ingredients: unsalted butter, baby carrots, sugar, chicken broth, gingerroot, golden raisins, salt, black pepper ; preparation:Melt butter in a large skilloet over medium heat, tilting pan to coat completely. Add carrots and cook for 1 minute. Add sugar and stir to combine, cook for 1 minute. Add chicken broth, grated ginger, raisins, salt and pepper and cook for 20 minutes or until carrots are tender when pierced with a fork. Serve warm. Makes 4 servings. ; name: mango agua fresca ; ingredients: mango, cold water, lime juice, honey, lime wedge, mint leaf ; preparation:In a blender, combine mango and water and blend until smooth. Pour through a strainer into ice-filled glasses. You should end up with about 1 cup of liquid. Stir in lime juice and agave. Garnish with lime and mint, and serve. ; name: spanish chicken with vegetables and olives pollo a la chilindr ; ingredients: broiler-fryer chickens, butter, tomatoes, green peppers, onions, garlic clove, smoked ham, pitted ripe olives, salt, pepper ; preparation:Preheat oven to 375. Truss your chicken. Brush with butter salt and pepper. Place chicken breast up in dutch oven. Cook, uncovered until thighs test done. Add rest of ingredients, cover and bake until veggies are tender., about 30 minutes. Remove chicken to a serving platter, surround with vegetables. Serve with rice. ; name: chicken wings with honey soy and sesame ; ingredients: vegetable oil, chicken wings, soy sauce, water, honey, sesame seeds ; preparation:Preheat the oven to 375f heat the vegetable oil in a small ovenproof frying pan. Fry the chicken wings for 2-3 minutes on each side, until golden. Remove the pan from the heat and add the soy sauce, water and honey. Transfer to the oven and cook for 10-12 minutes, turning the chicken wings once. Arrange the chicken wings on a warmed platter, scatter over the sesame seeds and serve. ; name: buffalo meatballs gravy ; ingredients: ground buffalo meat, egg, ritz cracker, onion, garlic powder, pepper, beefy mushroom soup, flour ; preparation:Combine the first 6 ingredients. Mix well. Using a large scoop,. Scoop into balls and place on large jellyroll pan. Bake at 350 for 20 minutes. In a large skillet, combine the soup and flour. Cook over medium heat until thickened. Add cooked meatballs, and simmer 10 minutes. Serve over mashed potatoes, or egg noodles. ; name: classic hummus my way ; ingredients: chickpeas, olive oil, lemon juice, garlic, cumin, ground red pepper, salt, garlic powder, onion powder, water ; preparation:

name: texas trash salsa ; ingredients: diced tomatoes, onion, green chilies, black olives, vinegar, garlic salt, olive oil, salt and pepper, tortilla chips ; preparation:Drain tomatoes well, reserving juice. Put peeled and quartered onion in a blender, then top with remaining ingredients. Pulse blender until ingredients are chopped as finely as you wish. By putting onion in the blender first, it will chop more finely than remaining ingredients. If salsa seems too thick, you can thin it by adding some of the reserved tomato juice. This can be eaten immediately, but tastes best if allowed to chill for 2 hours. ; name: pineapple orange cream cake ; ingredients: yellow cake mix, mandarin oranges in juice, eggs, oil, instant vanilla pudding, crushed pineapple in juice, whipped topping ; preparation:Combine first 4 ingredients. Pour into 2-9 inch greased and floured layer cake pans. Bake at 350 degrees for 30-35 minutes. Cool. Combine instant pudding and crushed pineapple. Put in refrigerator for an hour. When ready to ice, fold in whipped topping. Frost layers and top and sides of cake. ; name: banana and peanut butter toast ; ingredients: bread, banana, creamy peanut butter, egg, milk, butter, salt, pancake syrup ; preparation:Spread bread slices with peanut butter. Arrange half of sliced banana on one slice of bread. Cover with another slice of bread. Heat a nonstick frying pan and grease with butter. Coat sandwich with egg and milk mixture and grill for 2 minutes on each side. Served garnished with remaining sliced banana and hot syrup. ; name: chocolate drops aka macaroons ; ingredients: sugar, cocoa, milk, margarine, oats, coconut, chocolate chips, vanilla ; preparation:In a microwave safe bowl mix, sugar, cocoa, milk and margarine. Microwave until boiling. Add oats, coconut, chocolate chips and vanilla. Drop tbsp sized cookies on a waxed paper covered cookie sheet. Chill in fridge until firm. ; name: potato carrot kugel ; ingredients: russet potatoes, carrots, onion, eggs, oil, matzo meal, salt, pepper ; preparation:Grate vegetables, place in large bowl. Preheat oven to 400. Beat eggs in small bowl, add with remaining ingredients. Grease a 13x9 baking dish, add ingredients. Bake aprox 1 hour until top is brown. ; name: scallops of the provence ; ingredients: sea scallops, lemon juice, salt, flour, tomatoes, shallots, garlic, herbes de provence, salt and pepper, olive oil ; preparation:Toss scallions in lemon juice. Drain, salt and dredge in flour. Sautee in olive oil until brown. Set scallops aside. Drain off any extra olive oil, keeping only about 1 tablespoon. Add garlic, and shallots and sauteing until lightly browned. Add remaining ingredients and simmer until slightly thickened. Serve sauce over scallops. ; name: crookneck squash medley ; ingredients: yellow squash, onion, frozen corn, butter, salt, pepper ; preparation:Saut the onion in butter until almost translucent. Add the squash and cook until tender. Add one half of a bag of frozen corn. Salt and pepper to taste. Cook to desired doneness. ; name: rava semolina ladoo ; ingredients: rava, sugar, ghee, milk, green cardamoms, saffron strands, coconut flakes ; preparation:

name: mock crab soup ; ingredients: imitation crabmeat, potatoes, celery, sweet onion, bacon, old bay seasoning, chicken bouillon cubes, cream cheese, parsley, salt and pepper ; preparation:In a large pot, cook the bacon crisp, remove and leave the grease in the pot. Saute the onion and celery the bacon grease. Add 2 quarts water to the pot, add the potatos and boil till you can stick a fork in them easily. Turn the heat down and add the bouillon, cream cheese, crab meat and seasonings. Simmer about an hour, stirring often. ; name: elana s paleo banana bread ; ingredients: bananas, eggs, vanilla, honey, palm oil shortening, almond flour, sea salt, baking soda, chocolate chips ; preparation:Pulse bananas, eggs, vanilla, honey and shortening in a food processor. Pulse in almond flour, salt and baking soda. If desired, pulse chocolate chips into batter. Scoop batter into a greased 7. 5 x 3. 5 inch loaf pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 55-60 minutes. Remove from oven and allow to cool. ; name: cranberry pumpkin muffins ; ingredients: eggs, sugar, cooking oil, pumpkin, flour, pumpkin pie spice, baking soda, salt, fresh cranberries ; preparation:Combine eggs, sugar, oil and pumpkin, mix well. Combine flour, spice, soda, and salt in a bowl. Make a well in the center and pour pumpkin mixture into well. Stir just until dry ingredients are moist. Stir in cranberries. Spoon into greased muffin pans. Bake at 350 degrees for about 30 minutes. I start checking for doneness around 20 minutes. ; name: deviled chicken thighs ; ingredients: chicken thighs, salt, fresh ground black pepper, dijon mustard, shallots, cayenne pepper, fresh parsley ; preparation:Preheat broiler to its maximum. Set the rack about 4 inches from the heat. Season chicken on both sides and place it in a pan, skin side up. Broil, watching carefully, until the skin is golden brown, about 5 minutes. Meanwhile, combine the mustard, shallot, and cayenne. When the chicken has browned, remove it from the oven and turn it. Spread just a teaspoon or so of the mustard mixture on the underside of the chicken and broil for about 5 minutes. Turn the chicken and spread the remaining mixture on the skin side. Broil until the mustard begins to brown, about 5 minutes. At this point, the chicken may be done, an instant read thermometer inserted into the meat will read 160. If it is not, turn off the broiler and let the chicken remain in the oven for another 5 minutes or so. Garnish with the parsley if you like and serve. ; name: lea s peach pie cobbler ; ingredients: peaches, sugar, cinnamon, nutmeg, dry tapioca, butter, cinnamon sugar ; preparation:Drain peaches, reserving 1 cup of syrup for recipe. Combine peaches, syrup, cinnamon, nutmeg & tapioca in large sauce pan. Bring mixture to a boil, and boil for one minute. Remove from heat and cool. Prepare 9x13 pan lined with pie crust. Prepare lattice topping for cobbler. Place peach mixture in crust lined pan. Dot mixture with butter portions, spaced evenly. Arrange lattice topping, crimping into top edge of crust. Sprinkle crust with cinnamon-sugar mixture for color. Place, uncovered, in 450f oven for 10 minutes. Reduce heat to 400f and bake 60 minutes, or until golden brown. ; name: eggs and chiles ole ; ingredients: green chilies, monterey jack cheese, eggs, sour cream, salt and pepper ; preparation:Preheat oven to 375. Grease a 13x9 pan. Line bottom of the pan with chiles. Slice the cheese and place on top of the chiles to cover evenly. In a large bowl, beat eggs with sour cream until well blended. Add salt and pepper to taste. Pour egg mixture over chiles and cheese. Bake 30-40 minutes or until knife inserted into dish comes out clean. ; name: quick beef and broccoli ; ingredients: beef, water, soy sauce, sliced water chestnuts, broccoli floret, maggi seasoning, onion, canola oil ; preparation:Brown beef in skillet. Remove. Whisk together water, soy sauce and seasoning mix. Set aside. Saute all veggies in oil for 3 minutes. Add beef and liquid to pan. Stir frequently-cook until liquid thickens up to desired consistency. Serve over rice. ; name: braised chicken with red potatoes and tarragon broth ; ingredients: olive oil, shallot, chicken breast halve, reduced-sodium fat-free chicken broth, dry white wine, fresh tarragon, salt, fresh ground black pepper, red potatoes, fresh flat-leaf parsley ; preparation:

name: sugarplums ; ingredients: whole almonds, honey, orange zest, ground cinnamon, ground allspice, nutmeg, dried apricot, dates, almond oil, icing sugar ; preparation:Preheat oven to 180c. Place nuts on a baking tray and toast in the oven for about 10 minutes, then cool. Process nuts in a food processor until quite fine, but not to dust. Add remaining ingredients except the oil and the icing sugar. Pulse a few times to mix. Turn mix into a bowl and rub your hands with a little of the oil. Pinch of walnut sized pieces and roll into balls. Sift the icing sugar over the rolled balls, enough to coat well. Store in an airtight container. Refrigerate in hot weather. ; name: spinach ricotta frittata ; ingredients: baby spinach leaves, green onions, button mushrooms, roasted red pepper, fresh basil, butter, eggs, ricotta cheese, parmesan cheese, salt and pepper ; preparation:Spray a non-stick 9 or 10 inch omelet pan with cooking spray. Place over medium high heat, add butter. When butter is melted add the prepared vegetables and basil. Cook stirring often just until spinach is wilted. Whisk together the eggs and ricotta cheese. Pour egg mixture over cooked vegetables, cook until almost set, lifting edges frequently to allow uncooked portions to run to bottom of pan. When almost set, reduce heat, cover and allow to cook covered for 1 to 2 minutes. Invert onto a large plate and slip back into pan to finish cooking, top with grated parmesan cheese. Cut in half and serve on warmed plates. ; name: easy chicken divan ; ingredients: chicken, frozen broccoli, mayonnaise, cream of mushroom soup, curry, lemon juice, cheddar cheese ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Cook broccoli according to directions, arrange in greased 9 x 11 pan. Cut up cooked chicken into slices, arrange in pan. Mix soup, mayonnaise, curry, and lemon juice and pour over chicken. Sprinkle cheddar cheese over top. Bake at 350 degrees for 25 minute may make ahead and refrigerate, extend bake time to 50-55 minute. Starting with raw chicken will extend the cooking time by 30-40 min, or the time it takes to cook the chicken. ; name: the queen s spread ; ingredients: pimento stuffed olives, garlic powder, paprika, pepper, cream cheese ; preparation:Set your cream out until soft and quarter. Chop olives. Add one quarter to the bowl and mix in a small amount of the chopped olives. After the second quarter add the rest of the ingredients. Add the rest of the cream and keep mixing ingredients until there seems to be equal amounts throughout the spread of all the ingredients. ; name: baked parmesan trout fillets ; ingredients: trout fillet, sour cream, parmesan cheese, lemon juice, onion, salt, paprika ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Place trout fillets in a greased shallow baking dish. In a small bowl, combine sour cream, parmesan cheese, lemon juice, onion, and salt. Spread over fillets. Sprinkle with paprika. Bake 20-25 minutes or until fillets flake easily with a fork. ; name: corn chowder rosie daley ; ingredients: cooking spray, onion, fresh corn kernels, chicken broth, red pepper, fresh rosemary, dried thyme, pepper, cayenne, fresh basil ; preparation:Preheat a large, heavy saucepan over medium heat for about 1 minute. Spray it twice with the vegetable oil. Saute the onion for about 5 minutes, until translucent. Add 4 cups of corn and saute for 4-5 minutes, until it softens a bit. Add 2 cups of chicken stock and cook until the corn can be mashed easily with a fork, about 20 minutes. Transfer the contents of the pan to a blender and puree until smooth. Return the puree to the saucepan over medium-low heat. Add the bell pepper, rosemary, thyme, black pepper, cayenne pepper, and the remaining 1 cup chicken stock and 2 cups corn. Stir and cook for about 10 minutes more, until the chowder is thick and creamy. Garnish with the chopped basil. ; name: quaker steak and lube s beer cheese dip ; ingredients: cream cheese, sharp cheddar cheese, garlic clove, worcestershire sauce, dry mustard, cayenne powder, beer ; preparation:Combine cream cheese and cheddar cheese in an electric mixer beat on medium until smooth. Add garlic and spices. Beat well. Gradually add beer, beating until blended. Chill 1 hour. Serve with potato chips, crusty bread or crackers. ; name: spanish rice casserole ; ingredients: bulk sausage, rice, onion, chicken stock, diced tomatoes, chili powder, garlic powder, pepper ; preparation:

name: solar dill pickles ; ingredients: water, white vinegar, kosher salt, alum, garlic cloves, dill ; preparation:Dissolve in 1 gallon glass jar. Pack with clean cucumbers. Put on lid. Let stand in the sun for 48 hours. Chill in frig until gone. ; name: beets with onion cumin ; ingredients: canola oil, onion, garlic, cumin seeds, all-purpose flour, beets, tomatoes, water, salt ; preparation:Heat a medium saucepan over medium-high heat. Pour in oil and saute onion and garlic until translucent. Mix in cumin seed and saute an additional 2 minutes. Sprinkle in flour and saute 1 minute more. Stir in beets, tomatoes, water, and salt. Reduce heat to low, cover pan with lid, and allow to simmer 30 to 45 minutes, until beets are tender. ; name: sugar free pickle relish ; ingredients: dill pickle spears, onion, splenda sugar substitute, celery seed, mustard seeds, cider vinegar ; preparation:Drain liquid from pickles into a non reactive pan. Throw in the onion, splenda, celery seed and mustard seed. Bring to a simmer for about 20 to 30 minutes. While that is simmering chop the pickles either by hand or in the food processor to the consistancy you like your relish to be, fine or coarse. Add the 2 tablespoons of cider vinegar to the chopped pickles. Put the chopped up pickles back in the jar and pour the brine back over the whole thing. Store in the fridge and use like store bought relish. ; name: butter creme frosting ; ingredients: butter, powdered sugar, light cream, vanilla, salt, unsweetened chocolate squares ; preparation:Cream butter. Gradually add sugar and light cream, alternately. Add vanilla and salt. Add melted chocolate for chocolate frosting. Refrigerate for a bit before spreading. ; name: marinated peppers and mozzarella ; ingredients: sweet peppers, olive oil, garlic cloves, lemon rind, crushed red pepper flakes, salt, mozzarella cheese, basil leaves, fresh lemon juice ; preparation:Preheat broiler to high. Arrange the baby peppers in a single layer on a foil-lined jelly roll pan, and broil peppers for 4 minutes on each side or until blackened and tender. Cool, combine peppers, olive oil, garlic cloves, lemon rind, red pepper, salt, and mozzarella balls, and toss. Cover, and refrigerate overnight, tossing after 6 hours. Let stand at room temperature for 30 minutes. Stir in basil leaves, and lemon juice before serving. Serve with a slotted spoon. ; name: pear honey ; ingredients: pears, pineapple, lemon, juice and rind of, sugar ; preparation:Run the pears through a food chopper using fine blades. Combine all ingredients. Cook on low heat, stirring frequently, until the mixture is thick and clear. Pack in hot jars and seal. Process in a water bath for 10 minutes. ; name: mixed greens with honey lime dressing ; ingredients: olive oil, fresh lime juice, honey, lime zest, salt and pepper, red onion, mixed greens, plum tomatoes ; preparation:Whisk first 4 ingredients in a small bowl to blend, season dressing with salt and pepper. Transfer 2 tablespoons dressing to another smaller bowl. Mix in onions. Let onion and remaiming dressing stand at least 1 hour and up to 3 hours. Toss onion mixture occasionally. Mix lettuces, tomatoes, and onion mixture in bowl. Toss with dressing, serve. ; name: arugula pear and parmesan salad ; ingredients: pears, lemon juice, hazelnut oil, arugula, parmesan cheese, fresh ground black pepper, blue cheese, walnuts ; preparation:

name: pita stuffed souvlaki ; ingredients: olive oil, red onion, garlic cloves, lamb, pita bread, tzatziki, roma tomatoes ; preparation:Over medium high heat, warm the oil in a non-stick skillet or wok. Separate the onion into rings and add along with garlic to oil. Cook 10 to 15 minutes or until onions are lightly brown. Stirring frequently. Add the sliced meat and cook for 4 to 5 minutes or until meat is warmed. Fill pita halves with meat and onion mixture, garnish with sliced tomatoes and tzatziki. Serve immediately. ; name: rocky road frosting ; ingredients: semi-sweet chocolate chips, unsweetened chocolate, butter, vanilla extract, salt, mini marshmallows, nuts ; preparation:In a medium, heavy saucepan over low heat, melt 1 cup of the semisweet chocoalte chips with the unsweetened chocoalte. Remove pan from heat. Add the butter, vanilla, and salt to the melted chocolate and stir until the butter melts and is incorporated into the chocolate. Let stand until the mixture is at room temperature. Using an electric mixer at high speed, whip the chocolate until it holds soft peaks. Fold in the remaining chocolate chips, marshmallows, and nuts. Frost as desired. ; name: wine thyme potatoes ; ingredients: potatoes, extra virgin olive oil, sea salt, fresh ground pepper, dry white wine, fresh thyme leaves ; preparation:Pre-heat oven to 200c. Peel potatoes, and slice them cross-wise as thinly as possible by hand using a knife. Put the potato slices in a large bowl and pour the olive oil over. Mix well, insuring all slices are separated and coated with the oil. Salt and pepper the potatoes to taste, and again mix well. Add the thyme and mix well. Place the potatoes in a baking dish. Pour the white wine in the dish and place uncovered in the oven. Bake for 30 to 40 minutes, until the wine has nearly all evaporated and the potatoes become golden and tender. Keep an eye on them the last few minutes because they can crisp quickly at the end. Serve warm from the oven. ; name: brie and green chilie sauce for pasta ; ingredients: butter, shallot, garlic clove, chicken stock, whipping cream, dry white wine, chili powder, brie cheese, chili peppers ; preparation:Melt the butter over moderate heat in a large skillet. Add the shallots and saute until soft. About 3 minute. Add the garlic and saute for 1 minute. Add the chicken stock, cream, wine, and chili powder. Bring to a boil. Reduce the heat and simmer. Stir occasionally for 15-20 min or until sauce is reduced by almost half. Whisk in the brie a little at a time until the brie has melted. Add the chili peppers. Serve at once over hot pasta. Fettucini is recommended. ; name: red cabbage and apple salad ; ingredients: onion, red cabbage, apples, brown sugar, red wine vinegar, salt, allspice, water, raisins ; preparation:Slice onion, cook on high 90 seconds in microwave. Or saute in a little oil. Shred cabbage, chop apples and put in medium saucepan with sugar, vinegar and spices. Fry for 5 minutes over medium heat to meld flavors. Add water and simmer for 15 minutes, or until cabbage is soft. Mix in the onions and sprinkle with rasins. Serve warm, or chill for a few hours before serving. ; name: creamy peppercorn steaks ; ingredients: black peppercorns, white pepper, new york strip steaks, salt, butter, worcestershire sauce, tabasco sauce, half-and-half ; preparation:Mix the peppercorns and white pepper. Rub over both sides of meat. Chill 1 hour. Sprinkle salt in large skillet, heat on high until salt starts to brown. Sear steaks on both sides. Add butter, reduce heat to med and cook for 2 minutes per side. Add worcestershire sauce and tobasco, cook each side 2 more minutes, or until desired doneness. Remove steaks. Add cream, cook and stir until smooth. ; name: italian rice balls ; ingredients: rice, eggs, parmesan cheese, parsley, salt, garlic cloves ; preparation:Using a 4 liter pot, cover the rice with water and bring to boil. Simmer for 20 minutes, then cool until cold. Add the eggs, parmesan cheese, salt, parsley and garlic and mix by hand. Mold the balls into desired shape. Then fill a deep frying pan with mazzola oil enough to cover at least half of a rice ballheat oil and carefully add the rice balls. The balls will cook fast, so make sure to turn them quickly, when golden brown place on plate to cool. ; name: turkish apricot compote kayisi kompostosu ; ingredients: fresh apricots, sugar, water, almond extract, almonds ; preparation:

name: ecuadorean beet salad ; ingredients: potato, carrot, cooked beets, hard-boiled egg, red onion, vegetable oil, fresh lemon juice, water, salt, cooked white rice ; preparation:Mix potatoes, beets, carrots, egg and onion together. In a separate bowl mix the oil lemon water and salt. Mix all the ingredients together. Taste make sure it is real tangy from the lemon and salty from the salt. If not then add more. The oil can be substituted with extra water for dieters. Then either steam or boil white rice serve the hot rice with the chilled beat salad and taste them together. ; name: butter crunch clusters ; ingredients: butter, brown sugar, corn syrup, cheerios toasted oat cereal, salted peanuts ; preparation:Heat butter in saucepan over low heat until melted. Stir in brown sugar and corn syrup. Heat to boiling over medium heat, stirring constantly. Boil and stir 1 minute. Remove from heat. Stir in cereal and peanuts until well coated. Drop mixture by tablespoonfuls onto waxed paper. Cool. ; name: herb and garlic goat cheese truffles ; ingredients: cream cheese, goat cheese, fresh lemon juice, fresh chives, fresh basil, garlic, black pepper, pecans, fruit ; preparation:Beat the cream cheese, goat cheese and lemon juice with an electric mixer until smooth. Stir in chives, basil, garlic, and black pepper. Cover and chill for 2 hours or until firm. Shape cheese mixture into 24 balls. Roll each ball in the pecans. Cover and chill for at least 1 hour. Serve with fruit. ; name: taramasalata ; ingredients: potato, codfish roe, fresh lemon juice, onion, olive oil, bread ; preparation:Place potato in saucepan and cover with water. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer until cooked through. Drain and set aside to cool a bit. Process potato, roe, onion and lemon juice thoroughly. The more roe that is mashed, the better the dip will taste. Gradually add in the oil until thoroughly combined. Transfer to a serving bowl. Can garnish with kalamata olives if desired. Serve with bread. ; name: parmesan breadcrumb baked chicken ; ingredients: chicken breasts, butter, plain breadcrumbs, dried parsley, salt, parmesan cheese, pepper, lemon, juice of, paprika ; preparation:Mix dry ingredients. Dip chicken breasts in melted butter then dredge in bread crumb mixture. Place on baking sheet or casserole dish sprayed with cooking spray. Pour lemon over the chicken then remaining butter. Sprinkle with paprika. Bake at 350 for 45 minutes. ; name: beet and raisin salad ; ingredients: beets, raisins, brown sugar, oil, lemon juice, lettuce leaf, parsley ; preparation:Peel and grate the beets. Chop the raisins coarsely and mix with the beets and the brown sugar. Mix together the oil and lemon juice. Pour over the beets and raisins and mix well. Serve on crisp lettuce leaves sprinkled with chopped parsley. ; name: fluffy 2 step cheesecake ; ingredients: cream cheese, cool whip, sugar, graham cracker crust, pie filling ; preparation:Beat cream cheese and sugar in large bowl, with a mixer, on high speed until smooth. Gently stir in whipped topping. Spoon into crust. Refrigerate 3 hours or until set. Add pie filling as a topping. Keep leftovers refrigerated. ; name: lemon poppy seed bread ; ingredients: lemon cake mix, eggs, vegetable oil, instant lemon pudding, water, poppy seed ; preparation:

name: stove top cream cheese and velveeta mac and cheese ; ingredients: macaroni noodles, velveeta cheese, cream cheese, butter, flour, milk, sharp cheddar cheese, salt, white pepper ; preparation:Boil noodles and drain. While boiling, melt butter in saucepan on low -medium slowly add the flour well continuously stirring. Slowly add the milk will continuously stirring. Add the cheeses, salt and white pepper, increase heat to medium while continuously stirring until all cheese is melted. Remove from heat and let cool 10 minutes. Poor over noodles and mix well. ; name: squash delight ; ingredients: squash, maple syrup, onion, oil, carrot, sour cream, cream of chicken soup, chicken flavor stuffing mix ; preparation:Prepare squash, either by peeling and boiling or bake in oven until tender. Cool and mash. Yield for cooked squash is about 2 cups of puree. Saute onion and carrot in frying pan with tsp oil. Cool. In small bowl combine cooled onion, carrot, sour cream, maple syrup and soup. Fold in squash. Prepare stuffing according to package directions. Spread half of stuffing in bottom of prepared 8x8 baking dish. Spoon squash mixture on top, sprinkle with remaining stuffing. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes. ; name: corn black bean salsa ; ingredients: black beans, corn kernels, rotel diced tomatoes, green onion, fresh cilantro, oil, red wine vinegar, salt, black pepper ; preparation:Combine beans, corn, diced tomatoes, green onions and cilantro in large bowl. Whisk together oil, vinegar, salt and black pepper. Pour dressing over bean mixture. Stir gently to combine. Can be served immediately, or chilled for a few hours before serving. ; name: kickn quesadillas ; ingredients: cheese, vegetables, hot sauce, chicken, garlic, jalapeno, tortillas ; preparation:Take your tortillas and drop in all of your ingredients on top of it. Cheese will normally go first. If you would like to add your hot sauce, drop a tsp. Of it on top of every thing. Put into a hot pan and let cook until cheese starts to melt. Next add your second tortilla on top and flip. Let cook for about 3-8 minutes until serving. ; name: 5 minute southwest layered salad k ; ingredients: romaine lettuce, black beans, frozen corn, salsa, monterey jack and cheddar cheese blend, ranch dressing, tortilla chips ; preparation:Arrange lettuce in bottom of glass serving bowl or on serving plate. Layer beans, corn, salsa and cheese evenly over top. Drizzle with dressing. Sprinkle with chips. You can change the cheese and beans to your favorites. ; name: seafood bisque ; ingredients: green onion, butter, all-purpose flour, milk, hot sauce, salt, pepper, fresh lump crabmeat, shrimp, fresh parsley ; preparation:In a large saucepan, saute the green onions in melted butter until the onions are tender. Add in the flour. Stir until smooth. Cook for 1 minutes stirring constantly. Gradually add in the milk. Cook and stir constantly over medium heat until mixture is thickened and bubbly. Stir in hot sauce, salt and pepper to taste. Add in crabmeat and shrimp. Cook and stir over low heat until shrimp turn pink. Add in parsley and stir to combine. Serve. ; name: egg flower soup ; ingredients: chicken broth, eggs, dried chinese mushrooms, salt, msg, frozen peas ; preparation:Boil chicken broth, ginger and green onion 2 minutes. Add salt, msg, mushrooms and frozen peas. Cook 5 minutes. Pour soup slowly into serving bowl containing eggs. Stir gently. Serve hot. ; name: dillsas dill sauce ; ingredients: butter, flour, chicken stock, fresh dill, vinegar, sugar, egg yolk, salt ; preparation:

name: 8 minute cheesecake ; ingredients: cream cheese, sugar, sour cream, vanilla, cool whip topping, graham cracker crust ; preparation:Beat cream cheese until smooth. Gradually beat in sugar. Blend in sour cream and vanilla. Fold in whipped topping. Blend well. Spoon into crust. Chill until set. At least 4 hours. Garnish with your favorite topping or eat plain. ; name: chinese sweet and sour sauce ; ingredients: catsup, apple cider vinegar, orange juice, red wine vinegar, granulated sugar, dry mustard, hot sauce, cornstarch, water ; preparation:Combine cornstarch and water. Set aside. In saucepan heat all remaining ingredients until sugar is dissolved and liquid is hot. Slowly add the cornstarch and water mixture, stirring constantly until the mixture thickens, about 1 minute. Remove from heat. Serve warm or room temperature. ; name: curry frittata ; ingredients: vegetable oil, onion, sweet potato, salt, black pepper, mild curry paste, eggs, cilantro, lime wedge ; preparation:Preheat the broiler. Peel and slice the onion. Peel and cube the sweet potato. Crack the eggs into a bowl and beat them with a fork until well mixed. Add a little salt an pepper. Saute the onion and sweet potato, stirring frequently, over medium-high heat in the oil until the sweet potatoes are cooked through and beginning to brown. Add a little salt and pepper. Add the curry paste and stir for about a minute. Add the eggs, and stir until eggs start to set. Leave on the stovetop for a few minutes more until about half-way cooked. Place under the broiler until the top is cooked. Cut into wedges and serve with cilantro and limes, if desired. ; name: mozzarella and spinach crostini ; ingredients: french bread, garlic salt, fresh spinach, cream cheese, mozzarella cheese ; preparation:Cut the french bread in half lengthwise. Place cut side up on a baking sheet and toase in a 350 degree oven until lightly browned. Sprinkle with garlic salt. Put the spinach and a small amount of water in a saucepan and cook until tender. Drain and squeeze out all moisture. Combine the spinach and the cream cheese and mix well. Spread over the cut sides of the bread. Lay mozzarella slices over the spinach. Broil until cheese melts. Slice into 1- or 2-inch pieces to serve. ; name: grilled pear and blue cheese sandwich ; ingredients: blue cheese, havarti cheese, sourdough bread, unsalted butter, pears, salad greens ; preparation:Toss cheeses together in a small bowl. Set aside. Place bread slices on a work surface. Spread 1 teaspoon of the butter on each of 4 bread slices. Set aside. Arrange pear slices evenly on the unbuttered slices. Top with the cheese. Top with the greens, then the buttered slice of bread. Heat remaining 2 tablespoons of the butter in a skillet over medium heat, or prepare a panini pan. Add sandwiches to pan. Heat, turning once, pressing with a spatula to flatten, until cheese melts and bread browns, about 3 minutes per side. ; name: walnut spread ; ingredients: garbanzo beans, walnuts, basil leaves, olive oil, lemon juice, salt, pepper, cayenne, flour tortillas ; preparation:In a blender or food processor combine beans and 4 tablespoons of reserved liquid and the rest of the ingredients, except the tortillas and olive oil. Cover and blend until nearly smooth. Add a little more liquid if mixture seems stiff. Lightly oil a cookie sheet or two. Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Cut the tortillas into 8-10 wedges and brush with olive oil. Bake on the cookie sheets for about 5-8 minutes or just until lightly colored and crisp. Serve the spread with the tortillas and some celery, carrot sticks and scallions for dipping. ; name: tomatillo salsa fresca ; ingredients: tomatillo, white onion, cilantro leaf, jalapeno pepper, garlic cloves, sugar, salt ; preparation:First prepare the tomatillos. Remove papery husks and then rinse tomatillos under warm running water, using your fingers to remove the sticky residue. Remove stems. Chops into quarters. Place all the ingredients into a blender or food processor. Blend either coarse or smooth, depending on your preference. Transfer tomatillo salsa to covered container and refrigerate at least 3 hours. Good with tortilla chips, enchiladas, tacos, etc. I always triple the recipe and freeze in 8 ounce containers. ; name: cranberry special meatballs ; ingredients: ground beef, seasoned stuffing mix, eggs, onion, salt, black pepper, whole berry cranberry sauce, chili sauce, light brown sugar, ground ginger ; preparation:

name: pecan bread ; ingredients: flour, baking powder, sugar, salt, milk, egg, pecans ; preparation:Sift dry ingredients together. Mix milk and egg and add to dry ingredients. Mix, do not beat. Stir in pecans. Baked in greased loaf pan in a 350 preheated oven about 1 hour. Best kept a day or two before eating. Freezes well, great thinly sliced with cream cheese. ; name: ham balls in sauce ; ingredients: ground ham, ground pork, ground beef, eggs, milk, graham cracker crumbs, tomato soup, vinegar, brown sugar, mustard ; preparation:Mix ham ball ingredients together. I use a stand mixer, but this can be done by hand. Form mixture into large meatballs. Place in a 9x13 pan. Combine sauce ingredients and pour over meatballs in pan. Bake uncovered at 350 degrees for 1 hour. If desired, spoon some of the sauce over the meatballs a couple times as they bake to keep the tops moist. ; name: banana cardamom muffins ; ingredients: butter, sugar, bananas, eggs, buttermilk, vanilla, salt, baking powder, ground cardamom, flour ; preparation:Preheat oven to 425f, spray muffin tin with non-stick cooking spray. In a bowl, cream butter and sugar. Add the bananas, eggs, buttermilk and vanilla and mix well. In another bowl, mix the salt, baking powder, cardamom and flour. Add the flour to the banana mixture and mix until just combined. Fill muffin tin and bake for 19 minutes. ; name: apricot pork chops ; ingredients: dried apricot, orange juice, apricot preserves, brown sugar, curry powder, olive oil, boneless pork chops, salt and pepper, green onions ; preparation:Place apricots in a bowl. Pour orange juice over apricots. Add preserves, brown sugar, and curry powder and stir gently. Set aside. Heat large skillet over medium high heat. Add oil. Cook chops about 3 minutes on each side or until browned. Season lightly with salt and pepper. Reduce heat to low. Add apricot and juice mixture. Cover and simmer about 5 minutes or until chops are done. Remove from heat and sprinkle with green onions. ; name: taco stuffed bell peppers cups ; ingredients: green peppers, lean ground beef, onions, kidney beans, tomato sauce, taco seasoning, cheddar cheese, tomatoes ; preparation:Cut peppers in half lenghtwise and remove seeds. Cook in boiling water for 5 minutes. Drain and set aside. In a large skillet, cook beef and onion over medium high heat until meat is no longer pink. Drain. Add beans, tomato sauce and taco seasoning, bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer, uncovered, for 5 minutes. Place pepper halves in an ungreased 8 inch square pan. Fill with meat mixture. Bake, uncovered, for 10 minutes or until peppers are tender. Top with sour cream, tomato, and cheese. ; name: craig claiborne s southern cornbread ; ingredients: flour, cornmeal, baking soda, salt, eggs, buttermilk, whole milk, butter ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Sift the flour, cornmeal, baking soda, and salt into a mixing bowl. Beat the eggs until foamy and stir them into the dry mixture. Stir in the buttermilk and 1 cup whole milk. Heat the butter in a 9 x 2-inch black skillet, and when it is very hot but not brown, pour in the batter. Carefully pour the remaining 1 cup whole milk on top of the batter without stirring. Place the dish in the oven and bake 50 minutes, or until set and baked through. Slice into wedges. ; name: mushroom red pepper and onion saute ; ingredients: sliced mushrooms, onion, red pepper, lemon juice, red wine, salt, pepper, garlic powder, olive oil ; preparation:Saute onions in olive oil until translucent, about 5 minutes on medium heat. Add mushrooms and saute for another five minutes. Add red pepper, and saute for two more minutes. Put on low and add lemon juice and wine. Add seasonings. It is best served warm. ; name: blt on croissant ; ingredients: shortcut bacon, croissants, tomatoes, butter lettuce leaves, mayonnaise, garlic clove, flat leaf parsley ; preparation:

name: capirotada ; ingredients: piloncillo cones, water, cinnamon sticks, green onions, french bread, soft margarine, raisins, pecans, cheddar cheese ; preparation:Combine water, piloncillos, cinnamon sticks and green onions in large pot or dutch oven. Bring to a boil and cook until the piloncillos are dissolved and the syrup is dark from the spices. Taste- you may want to add additional brown sugar or spices depending on your personal tastes. Remove from heat and take out onions and cinnamon sticks. Toast the french bread. Spread margarine liberally on both sides of toast. Layer toast, cheese, raisins, and nuts in 2 9x13 pans, repeating until both pans are full, ending with a layer of cheese, raisins and nuts. Pour the syrup over the top, dividing evenly between both pans, and making sure that all the bread is moistened. Bake in a 350 degree oven for 30 to 40 minutes. Serve hot or cold. Store in the refrigerator. ; name: christmas strawberries ; ingredients: strawberry gelatin, sweetened condensed milk, flaked coconut, vanilla extract, decorator sugar, slivered almonds ; preparation:Blend together the gelatin and condensed milk. Add coconut and vanilla. Mix well and refrigerate until chilled. Roll into small balls and shape into strawberries. Roll in red sugar crystals. Dip fat end into green sugar crystals. Place an almond sliver into the fat end for a stem. To prevent hardening, store in an air tight container until ready to serve. ; name: creamy spinach and pine nut gnocchi ; ingredients: cream, tomatoes, garlic cloves, sun-dried tomato, black olives, gnocchi, spinach, pine nuts ; preparation:Combine cream, canned tomatoes and garlic in large pan and bring to the boil. Simmer until sauce slightly thickens. Add sun-dried tomatoes and olives. Simmer for 2 minutes. Add gnocchi to saucepan of boiling, salted water and cook until gnocchis rise to the top of the saucepan. Drain. Gently toss gnocchi, spinach and pine nuts in pan with sauce until spinach wilts. ; name: blood orange margaritas ; ingredients: kosher salt, ice, blood orange juice, tequila, triple sec, orange wedge ; preparation:Moisten rim of 2 margarita glasses and dip in kosher salt. Fill a cocktail shaker with crushed ice. Add orange juice, tequila, and triple sec. Shake well and strain into glasses. Garnish with orange wedges, if desired. ; name: healthy soft chicken tacos ; ingredients: chili powder, salt, ground cumin, fresh ground black pepper, boneless skinless chicken breast, cooking spray, white corn tortillas, green cabbage, monterey jack cheese, low-fat sour cream ; preparation:Prepare grill. Combine first 4 ingredients in a small bowl. Rub spice mixture over chicken. Place chicken on grill rack coated with cooking spray. Grill 10 minutes on each side or until done. Let stand 5 minutes. Chop. Heat tortillas according to package directions. Divide chicken evenly among tortillas. Top each tortilla with 2 tablespoons cabbage and 1 teaspoon cheese. Serve with sour cream, if desired. ; name: spaghetti with basil cream sauce ; ingredients: heavy cream, basil leaves, fresh lemon juice, salt, spaghetti ; preparation:In a saucepan, gently boil the cream until it is reduced by half, about 10 minutes. Stir in the basil, lemon juice, and salt. Meanwhile, cook pasta in a large pot of salted boiling water until al dente, about 7-10 minutes. Drain. Toss pasta with cream sauce and serve. ; name: scampi lower fat ; ingredients: butter, shallot, garlic cloves, fresh lemon juice, salt, fresh coarse ground black pepper, large shrimp, parsley, lemon wedge ; preparation:Preheat the broiler. Melt butter in large non-stick skillet over medium heat, add shallot and garlic and cook, stirring frequently, until golden, 4-5 minutes. Remove from heat, add lemon juice, salt and pepper, then add shrimp and toss to coat. Spread shrimp in a shallow baking dish large enough to hold shrimp in a single layer. Broil 3-4 inches from the heat, until shrimp are just opaque in the center and lightly browned on the outside, about 3 minutes on each side. Sprinkle with parsley and serve with lemon wedges. ; name: seafood layer dip ; ingredients: cream cheese, ranch salad dressing, seafood cocktail sauce, cheddar cheese, imitation crabmeat, shrimp, green pepper, tomatoes, green onions ; preparation:

name: herbed biscuits quick and easy ; ingredients: butter, garlic cloves, onion, dried dill, poppy seed, parmesan cheese, refrigerated buttermilk biscuits ; preparation:Pour the melted butter into an 8-inch round cakepan. Sprinkle onion, garlic, basil or dillweed, and poppy seeds evenly over the butter. Set aside. Place the parmesan cheese in a large heavy duty, zip-lock plastic bag. Cut each biscuit into 4 pices. Add the biscuit pieces to the bag and shake them to coat. Arrange the coated biscuit pieces in the prepared pan. I like to turn mine over a bit so all sides have a little bit of the seasoning. Sprinkle with any remaining parmesan cheese from the zip-lock bag. Bake at 400 degrees for 14 to 16 minutes or until golden brown. ; name: green bean stir fry ; ingredients: green beans, sunflower oil, ground star anise, garlic cloves, soy sauce, clear honey, tabasco sauce ; preparation:Heat the oil in the wok until very hot. Stir fry beans for 2 to 3 minutes. Add star anaise and garlic then fry for 1 minute. Add remaining ingredients then fry for 1 minute. Serve immediately. ; name: slow roasted garlic lemon chicken ; ingredients: roasting chicken, garlic, lemons, fresh thyme, olive oil, white wine, black pepper ; preparation:Pre-heat the oven to 160c. Put the chicken pieces into a roasting tin and add garlic cloves, lemon chunks and the thyme. Just roughly pull the leaves off the stalks, leaving some intact for strewing over later. Add the oil and using your hands mix everything together, then spread the mixture out, making sure all the chicken pieces are skin side up. Sprinkle over the white wine and grind on some pepper, then cover tightly with foil and put in the oven to cook, at flavour-intensifying low heat, for 2 hours. Remove the foil from the roasting tin, and turn up the oven to 200c and cook the uncovered chicken for another 30-45 minutes, by which time the skin on the meat will have turned golden brown and the lemons will have begun to scorch and caramelise at the edges. Serve straight from the roasting tin to plate. ; name: one pan sage and onion chicken and sausage ; ingredients: onions, olive oil, english mustard, dried sage, fresh ground black pepper, worcestershire sauce, lemon, roasting chickens, sausages, fresh sage leaves ; preparation:Peel and cut the onion into eighths, and put into a freezer bag with the oil, mustard, dried sage, a good grinding of pepper, and worcestershire sauce. Cut lemon in half, squeeze juice into bag, and then cut the halves into eighths and add them. Squidge everything around to mix and then add the chicken pieces. Leave to marinade in the refrigerator overnight, or for up to 2 days. Preheat the oven to 425 degrees f. Allow the chicken to come to room temperature in its marinade. Arrange the chicken pieces in a roasting tin skin side up with the marinade, including all the bits and pieces, and tuck the sausages around them. Sprinkle the fresh sage leaves over the chicken and sausages and then put the tin into the oven to cook for 1 hour and 15 minutes. Turn the sausages over half way through to color them evenly. Arrange the chicken and sausages on a large platter. ; name: baked eggs in maple toast cups ; ingredients: butter, pure maple syrup, bread, bacon, eggs, fresh ground black pepper ; preparation:Preheat the oven to 400 degrees f. Butter six muffin cups. In a small saucepan, melt the butter and add the syrup. Remove the crusts from the bread. Flatten each slice with a rolling pin. Brush both sides of each slice with the syrup mixture. Put one slice into each muffin cup and sprinkle the bacon pieces in the cups. Break an egg into each cup and bake until the eggs are set. Start checking after about 5 minutes. Lift the toast cups from the pan and serve immediately, drizzled with additional syrup, if desired. ; name: beef with asian mushroom sauce crock pot ; ingredients: sliced mushrooms, beef tip roast, hoisin sauce, garlic cloves, salt, beef broth, cornstarch, water, scallions ; preparation:Put the mushrooms in your slow cooker and place the beef on top. Spread the hoisin sauce over the beef, scatter the garlic and salt over it, and pour in the broth around it. Cover the slow cooker, and cook on low for 6-8 hours. Remove the beef from the slow cooker and put it on a platter. Turn cooker to high. Mix the cornstarch with water and add to the sauce. When sauce is thickened a bit, pour the sauce into a sauce boat. Slice the beef and serve it with the sauce, topped with the scallions. ; name: cocoa pebbles cookies ; ingredients: unsweetened cocoa powder, milk, sugar, oatmeal, peanut butter, butter ; preparation:Mix cocoa and milk in a sauce pan. Stir in the sugar and butter and bring to a boil, for 1 minute. Remove from heat and stir in peanut butter and oatmeal. Drop by spoonful onto waxpaper. Let cool until firm. ; name: cucumber red onion and radish salad ; ingredients: cucumber, red onion, red radishes, vegetable oil, white wine vinegar, sugar, dry crushed red pepper ; preparation:

name: chowder quiche ; ingredients: clam chowder, eggs, swiss cheese, green onions, parsley, pepper, pie crust ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350. In mixing bowl, combine chowder, eggs, cheese, onions, parsley& pepper. Blend well. Set empty piecrust on baking sheet on extended oven rack. Ladle chowder mixture into crust. Carefully slide rack back into place. Bake 1 hour or till set. Cool 10 minutes before slicing. ; name: addictive corn dip ; ingredients: mexicorn, sour cream, mayonnaise, cilantro, green onions, four-cheese mexican blend cheese, cumin, cayenne pepper, lime, tortilla chips ; preparation:Mix together the corn, sour cream, and mayonnaise. Slice the lime in half and squeeze the juice from one half over corn mixture. Mix well. Chop the cilantro and green onions. Add to the corn mixture. Blend in the cumin and cayenne pepper. Mix in shredded cheese. Refrigerate overnight. Serve with tortilla chips. ; name: grandma shufelt s potato candy ; ingredients: potatoes, coconut, nuts, vanilla, powdered sugar, dipping chocolate ; preparation:Cook and mash potatoes. While still warm, add the powdered sugar. Mix well. Add the coconut and nuts. Add vanilla. Mix well. Form into small shapes or balls and leave for a while to cool and set. Melt dipping chocolate in a double boiler. Using a toothpick, roll each ball into the melted chocolate. Store in a cool place. ; name: plum good pickled plums ; ingredients: italian plums, fresh ginger, chilies, clove, cinnamon, allspice, salt, sugar, vinegar ; preparation:Wash the fruit and prick each plum with a fork. Put all the other ingredients into a saucepan and bring to a gentle boil, stirring until the sugar has melted. Add plums and cook for 3-4 minutes. Put plums into sterilized jars. Keep boiling the syrup until it thickens, pour over plums. Check the jars are sealed, keep for 2 months before using. ; name: spiced cranberry and zinfandel sauce ; ingredients: zinfandel, sugar, orange rind, orange juice, cloves, ginger, cinnamon sticks, fresh cranberries ; preparation:Combine everything except the cranberries in a medium saucepan. Bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat to medium and cook 15 minutes or until mixture begins to thicken and sugar dissolves, stirring occasionally. Strain the mixture through a sieve into a bowl, and discard the solids. Return mixture to pan. Add cranberries to pan. Cook over high heat 10 minutes or until berries pop. Reduce heat to low. Simmer 30 minutes or until mixture is slightly thick. Pour into a bowl and allow to cool. ; name: roasted red potatoes ; ingredients: small red potatoes, olive oil, italian seasoning, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Spray 13x9 dish with cooking spray. Slice potatoes fairly thin and place in dish. Drizzle with olive oil. Toss to coat. Sprinkle italian seasoning and parmesan cheese on top. Bake for 45 minutes or until golden brown. ; name: chocolate almond butter crunch ; ingredients: butter, sugar, light corn syrup, water, vanilla extract, toasted almonds, semi-sweet chocolate chips ; preparation:Melt the butter in a heavy 3-liter saucepan on low heat. Add the sugar, corn syrup and water. Cook over medium heat. Stir constantly until it reaches hard crack stage, 300 on candy thermometer. Remove from heat and stir in vanilla extract and the almonds. Spread into a buttered 13 x 9-inch pan. Let stand 5 minutes. Sprinkle with chocolate chips. When chocolate is melted, spread evenly over candy. Let cool completely, and when chocolate is set, break into pieces. ; name: green bean and carrot soup vegan gluten free ; ingredients: olive oil, onion, carrots, green beans, vegetable stock, almond milk, salt, dried herbs, fresh parsley ; preparation:

name: stevia chocolate chip cookies ; ingredients: flour, salt, baking soda, fat free greek yogurt, stevia powder, pumpkin puree, vanilla, eggs, unsweetened baking chocolate, chocolate chips ; preparation:In a bowl mix together flour, salt, and baking soda. Set aside. In the bowl of a mixer cream yogurt, pumpkin or banana, vanilla and stevia powder until creamy, scraping the sides down at least one time. Add in eggs one at a time. Slowly add the flour mixture. Chop the unsweetened chocolate into very small peices. Add in all the chocolate and mix. Drop by tb size onto a cookie sheet. Then with lightly wet fingers pat down the top of the cookie until flat. Bake at 350 for 15-18 minutes or until golden brown. ; name: onion thyme gravy for turkey thanksgiving ; ingredients: butter, onion, shallots, dried thyme, all-purpose flour, reduced-sodium chicken broth, reduced sodium soy sauce, worcestershire sauce, salt, black pepper ; preparation:In a medium saucepan melt butter over medium-high heat. Add onions, shallots and thyme. Cook, stirring occasionally, for 10-12 minutes or until vegetables are tender and browned. Stir in the all-purpose flour. Cook and stir 1 minute. Add the broth, soy sauce, and the worcestershire sauce. Cook and stir until the mixture comes to a boil. Reduce heat to medium. Simmer, uncovered, for 8-9 minutes or until slightly thickened. Stir in salt and pepper and adjust to taste if necessary. ; name: indian cucumber raita ; ingredients: plain yogurt, honey, cucumber, fresh coriander, ground cumin ; preparation:Place all ingredients in a bowl. It may be easier to warm the honey, as it is easier to blend with the other ingredients. Make sure the cucumber is drained well, otherwise your raita will be too watery. Mix well, and add to serving bowl. Sprinkle cumin over the top. Serve on top or on the side of your favorite indian dish, or serve as a dipping sauce with naan bread. ; name: a simple greek salad ; ingredients: tomatoes, cucumber, red onion, capers, feta cheese, black olives, olive oil, dried oregano, sea salt ; preparation:Slice the tomatoes, onion and cucumber. Combine. Sprinkle over the 1 tablespoon of oregano and pour over the olive oil. Add the capers. Toss the salad lightly. Just prior to serving sprinkle cubed feta cheese and olives over the top of the salad. Sprinkle with some extra dried oregano and sea salt if desired. You can drizzle over some extra olive oil if desired. ; name: balsamic leg of lamb ; ingredients: pesto sauce, balsamic vinegar, olive oil, garlic, salt and pepper, leg of lamb ; preparation:Combine all but the lamb. Trim fat from lamb and marinade in above up to 24 hours. Foil line a baking pan, place lamb on a rack in pan. Roast at 450 f for 20 to 30 minutes until thermometer reads 140 f. Tent with foil and let stand 10 minutes. Serve with pan juices. ; name: parmesan rice and pasta pilaf ; ingredients: olive oil, vermicelli, onions, long-grain white rice, hot chicken stock, hot water, white pepper, bay leaf, parmesan cheese ; preparation:In a large skillet, heat oil. Saute vermicelli and onion until golden brown, about 2 to 4 minutes over medium-high heat. Drain off oil. Add rice, stock, water, pepper, and bay leaf. Cover and simmer 15-20 minutes. Fluff with fork. Cover and let stand 5-20 minutes. Remove bay leaf. Sprinkle with cheese and serve immediately. ; name: green tea berry smoothie ; ingredients: water, green tea bag, ground flax seeds, oat bran, frozen mixed berries, low-fat vanilla yogurt, cranberry juice, honey ; preparation:Microwave water on high until boiling, about 45-60 seconds. Add tea bag and steep for 3 minutes. Meanwhile, in a blender or food processor, combine ground flaxseed, oat bran, berries, yogurt and juice and blend until smooth. Squeeze and remove tea bag and add tea to berry mixture, blending until smooth. Adjust consistency with additional water, if needed and sweeten with honey, if desired. Makes 1 large or 2 small servings. ; name: apple corned beef brisket for the slow cooker ; ingredients: red potatoes, onion, apple, corned beef brisket, cabbage, apple cider, brown sugar, dijon mustard, ground cloves, black pepper ; preparation:

name: black bean corn and salsa dip weight watchers ; ingredients: black beans, frozen corn kernels, diced tomatoes with basil oregano and garlic, salsa ; preparation:Rinse and drain beans. Add frozen corn. Add can of tomatoes and the salsa. Mix well. Serve with the scoops. ; name: eggnog not just for holidays ; ingredients: eggs, icing sugar, salt, cinnamon, vanilla, milk, brandy, nutmeg ; preparation:Using a large mixing bowl beat eggs until very light and lemon coloured. Gradually beat in sugar, salt, cinnamon and vanilla. Stir in milk, using larger container if neccessary. Add liquor to taste. Refrigerate 24 hours before serving. To serve, run through a blender to foam up. To store keep covered in refrigerator up to 4 days. Strength may be adjusted by adding more or less liquor, or more or less milk. Garnish with nutmeg and serve in a pretty glass. ; name: armenian lemon rice pilaf ; ingredients: butter, long grain rice, lemon zest, white pepper, chicken broth, lemon juice, fresh parsley, lemon ; preparation:Melt butter in a skillet. Add rice and stir, about 2 minutes, making sure grains are nicely coated with butter. Add lemon zest, pepper, and the broth. Simmer uncovered over low heat for about 40 minutes, or until the liquid has absorbed and rice in tender. Remove from heat. Add lemon juice and stir. Let stand 5 minutes. Garnish with lemon slices to serve. ; name: p r soup potato rice soup ; ingredients: garlic clove, olive oil, onion, potato, rice, chicken broth, water, fresh parsley, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Heat oil in a pot and saute garlic until golden brown. Add onion, potato, rice, broth, parsley, and 2 cups water. Stir, bring to a boil, reduce heat and simmer for 1 hour, stirring occasionally. Add more water if soup appears too thick. Stir in cheese and serve. ; name: sausage ball appetizers ; ingredients: red cinnamon candies, sausage, bread, applesauce, sage ; preparation:Toast bread and crumble finely. Combine crumbs with sausage and sage. Form into balls about the size of golfballs. Bake at 400 degrees for 20 minutes. Drain and set aside. In saucepan, heat applesauce and red hots until candy is melted completely. Add sauce to sausage balls and keep warm in a fondue pot or crockpot. Serve with toothpicks. ; name: italian nachos ; ingredients: baguette, olive oil, fontina cheese, tomatoes, pepperoncini pepper ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400. Toast baguette rounds on a baking sheet in oven until crisp, 5-6 minutes, more if large slices. Turn oven off and preheat broiler to high. Drizzle toasted bread with oil and salt, broil until golden, 2-3 minutes. Transfer to oven safe serving dish or leave on baking sheet. Top with fontina and broil until melted, 2-3 minutes. Remove from oven. Sprinkle with tomatoes and peperoncini. Serve immediately. ; name: lauralie s low fat zesty black bean dip ; ingredients: black beans, diced tomatoes with green chilies, cilantro, lime, reduced-fat mexican cheese blend, fat free sour cream, tortilla chips ; preparation:Drain and rinse black beans. Drain tomatoes and chilies. Add cilantro, and squeeze in lime. Mash and mix together in a pie pan. Bake for 10 minutes. Add cheese and cook until melted. Serve with sour cream and tortilla chips. ; name: kremidotiganites greek onion fritters ; ingredients: onion, flour, of fresh mint, oil, salt and black pepper, water ; preparation:

name: beef noodle bake ; ingredients: ground beef, onion, green pepper, tomato sauce, seasoning salt, pepper, cream-style cottage cheese, cream cheese, medium noodles ; preparation:Cook beef, onion and pepper in skillet until meat is browned and vegetables are tender. Drain. Stir in tomato sauce, seasoned salt, and pepper. Blend cottage cheese and cream cheese together until fluffy. Spoon noodles into grease 10x6x2 inch baking dish. Spread cheese mixture over noodles. Pour meat sauce on top. Bake uncovered at 350 for 30 to 40 minutes or until heated through. ; name: jicama apple salad ; ingredients: jicama, granny smith apple, carrot, mayonnaise, lemon juice, water, sugar, salt, pepper, cayenne pepper ; preparation:Peel jicama and cut into chunks. Wash apple, core and cut into chunks. Wash carrot, peel if needed, cut into chunks. Add above chunks to food processor and pulse until desired texture is reached. Transfer to bowl and set aside. Combine remaining ingredients, whisk until smooth. Taste for desired seasoning, adjust accordingly. Pour over vegetable mixture and toss. May be served immediately or refrigerate and let flavors meld. ; name: flying biscuit s creamy dreamy white cheddar grits ; ingredients: water, half-and-half, kosher salt, white pepper, quick-cooking grits, white cheddar cheese, unsalted butter ; preparation:In a saucepan, combine water, half-and-half, salt and white pepper and bring to a boil. Slowly pour grits into boiling water while whisking the entire time. Reduce to low heat and continue to whisk often, until thick and completely smooth, about 10 minutes. Add cheese and stir gently until cheese melts. Whisk again to combine. Turn heat off and allow grits to rest 5 minutes. Add butter and stir until completely smooth, silky and shiny. ; name: peanut butter hot cocoa ; ingredients: milk, smooth peanut butter, powdered chocolate milk mix, whipped cream ; preparation:In a large kettle, combine 1 cup milk and peanut butter. Stirring frequently, cook over low heat until smooth. Increase heat to medium. Slowly stir in remaining 8 cups milk and chocolate mix. Stirring occasionally, cook just until mixture simmers. Garnish with whipped cream. ; name: avocado cream pasta ; ingredients: spaghetti, lemon, avocado, garlic cloves, olive oil, pepper, parsley, salt, black olives ; preparation:Put garlic lemon juice zest and oil in blender. Add parsley. Add peeled avocado add salt and pepper and blend. Top pasta and toss garnish. Top with olives. ; name: fresh pasta shrimp salad ; ingredients: mayonnaise, plain yogurt, fresh basil, scallion, garlic clove, red wine vinegar, medium pasta shell, frozen peas, shrimp, avocado ; preparation:In blender or food processor, puree the first 6 ingredients until smooth. Pour into serving bowl. Add cooked pasta, peas, shrimp, and avocado. Toss to coat well. Salt and pepper to taste. ; name: baked ham california style ; ingredients: ham, orange peel, brown sugar, olive oil, dry mustard, pepper, whole cloves, grape juice ; preparation:Rinse ham thoroughly. Pat dry and cut slits randomly with a paring knife. Remove pith of orange peel and discard, cut remaining orange skin into small pieces and insert into slits. Combine next four ingredients and rub over entire surface of ham. Insert cloves in a regular pattern across the surface of the ham. Place in a covered roasting pan and bake at 325f, allowing 22 minutes per pound. Baste every 15 minutes during baking with grape juice. Uncover during last 45 minutes to brown. ; name: kraft bacon tomato cheese crescents ; ingredients: crescent rolls, cream cheese, tomatoes, bell pepper, bacon ; preparation:

name: hummus with pureed sesame seeds no pre made tahini here ; ingredients: chickpeas, sesame seeds, garlic, lemon juice, olive oil, salt, fresh parsley ; preparation:Drain chick pea liquid directly into a blender or food processor. Set chick peas aside. Add the sesame seeds and garlic to the blender, cover, and puree until smooth. Add chick peas, lemon juice, salt, and oil to blender. Cover and mix until well blended, stopping and scraping down sides of bowl occasionally. Pour into a serving dish and garnish with chopped parsley. Serve with pita chips or wedges. ; name: zesty chipotle lime crema ; ingredients: sour cream, chipotle chile in adobo, garlic clove, lime, lime zest ; preparation:Mix all ingredients in a bowl with an immersion blender or in a regular blender. Make sure all ingredients have fully blended, no lumps. Serve or chill for later - will thicken slightly. This is a recipe that really flexes to personal taste. Add a little zest unless you like a lot - then add more. Start with juice from half the lime, one garlic and one chipotle, ziz it up, then add what you like more of - i like 1 chipotle, 2 garlic and juice from the whole lime and zest from half a lime, but lime sizes vary greatly and so does how much juice you get. You want a tangy, garlicky crema with some pow from the chipotle. ; name: carrot cheese soup ; ingredients: butter, flour, carrots, green onions, ham, hot chicken broth, cheddar cheese, parsley, black pepper ; preparation:In a saucepan, melt butter. Stir in flour until smooth cook and stir over med heat for 2 minutes. Add carrot, onions and ham. Cook, and stir for 1 min, then gradually add broth. Bring to a light boil, and stir 2 minutes. Add cheese, parsley, and pepper. Heat until cheese is melted, and veggies are tender. ; name: sauted kale red onions with garlic and lemon ; ingredients: kale, boiling water, olive oil, garlic cloves, red onion, soy sauce, lemon juice ; preparation:Tear the leaves off the kale into bite-size pieces. Slice the stems into 1 inch long pieces. Blanch the stems for 2 to 3 minutes. Remove, place in a strainer, quickly rinse under cold water to halt cooking. Blanch the kale leaves for 1 to 2 minutes, and rinse in a strainer under cold water. Drain. Heat the oil in a medium skillet and saut the garlic for 1 minute. Saute the onions for 2 to 3 minutes. Add the kale leaves, stems and shoyu soy sauce. Saut for 2 to 3 minutes, stirring constantly. Sprinkle the lemon juice over and toss to mix. Serve immediately after adding the lemon juice or the leaves may loose their bright green color. ; name: weight watchers chocolate chip blondies 3 points ; ingredients: all-purpose flour, baking powder, table salt, brown sugar, light butter, egg whites, vanilla extract, mini chocolate chip, water ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350f in a small bowl, combine flour, baking powder and salt. In a large bowl, beat brown sugar and butter until fluffy. Add egg whites and vanilla. Gradually beat in flour mixture alternating with water. Stir in chips. Spread into a foil-lined 9- x 13-inch baking pan. Bake until golden, about 20 to 25 minutes. Cool on wire rack. Remove foil and cut into 24 two-inch squares. ; name: pimento cream cheese spread ; ingredients: diced pimentos, cream cheese, walnuts, milk ; preparation:Let cream cheese soften slightly. Cream with the milk till smooth. Drain pimentos and add with nuts to cream cheese. Mix well. Add tiny bit more milk if necessary to make a spreadable consistency. Serve with rye bread, wheat crackers, triscuit, or melba toast. Store in fridge. ; name: simple brown rice pilaf ; ingredients: instant brown rice, chicken stock, butter, green onion, garlic, onion flakes, garlic salt, salt & fresh ground pepper ; preparation:Mix chicken stock and next 5 ingredients in saucepan and bring to a boil. Add rice, return mixture to boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 5 minutes. Remove from heat and let stand 5 minutes. Fluff with fork. Season with salt and pepper to taste. ; name: cranberry ginger pudding ; ingredients: butter, caster sugar, eggs, self raising flour, gingerroot, orange, juice and zest of, ground ginger, fresh cranberries, dried cranberries ; preparation:

name: sesame seed biscuits ; ingredients: rolled oats, plain flour, caster sugar, desiccated coconut, sesame seeds, margarine, golden syrup, bicarbonate of soda, hot water ; preparation:Melt margarine and golden syrup over low heat or in the microwave. Mix bicarb soda with water and add to margarine and syrup mix. Combine dry ingredients in a large bowl. Mix margarine and syrup through. Place small balls onto lightly greased trays and flatten slightly. Bake 150 deg celcius for 15 minutes. Allow to cool on trays. ; name: apple walnut salad ; ingredients: apples, walnut halves, lemon, juice of, fresh lemon zest, mayonnaise, mint leaf, honey ; preparation:Mix together apples, lemon juice, mint leaves and walnuts. In a separate bowl, mix mayonnaise and honey, then pour over apple mixture and toss. Refrigerate for 1 hour, then remove. Serve cold or at room temperature. Garnish with mint sprigs. ; name: fresh corn pie ; ingredients: deep dish pie shells, eggs, whipping cream, salt, yellow onion, fresh corn kernels, extra-sharp cheddar cheese, paprika, fresh parsley ; preparation:Preheat oven to 425. Prick crust well on bottom and sides with fork, par-bake pastry crust with parchment paper and pie weight beans for 5-7 minutes until firm but not brown. Stir together rest of ingredients except paprika and parsley. Pour carefully into pie shell. Sprinkle with a little paprika. Bake 10 minutes, reduce heat to 350 and bake 30 minutes longer or until center is almost firm. Cool about 10 minutes. Garnish with fresh chopped parsley if desired. ; name: apple mac salad ; ingredients: elbow macaroni, green bell pepper, onion, roasted red peppers, sugar, mayonnaise, red delicious apples ; preparation:Boil pasta until smooth and tender. After draining pasta, in a big bowl, mix all ingredients. Drain roasted peppers very well, otherwise the salad will turn redish. Refrigerate for about 3 hours. Serve cold. ; name: crock pot cheese dip ; ingredients: hamburger, velveeta cheese, salsa, sour cream ; preparation:Brown hamburger. Cook till done and drain fat. Cut cheese into small chunks. Mix hamburger and all remaining ingredients in a crock pot. Turn on low and warm all. When thoroughly warmed through, serve with your favorite tortilla chips, toasted or grilled bread, corn chips, bagel chips, or whatever you like. ; name: rocky road ; ingredients: dark chocolate melts, marshmallows, glace cherries, copha, unsalted peanuts, desiccated coconut ; preparation:Line a 30cm square tin with baking paper. Melt chocolate and copha in a heatproof bowl over gently boiling water and stir until smooth. Combine all other ingredients in another large bowl leaving aside 2 tblsp of coconut. Pour in melted chocolate and mix well. Pour completed mixture into the lined tin and spread. Sprinkle on the remaining coconut. Refrigerate then cut into chunky squares. Enjoy. ; name: crunchy pound cake ; ingredients: butter, shortening, sugar, flour, eggs, vanilla, almond extract, salt ; preparation:Preheat oven to 325. Grease and flour bundt pan. Combine butter and shortening in mixer bowl. Add eggs and blend well. Add other ingredients. Beat on medium speed for 10 minutes. Pour into pan. Bake 70 minutes or until golden brown. Cool in pan 10 minutes. ; name: baked chicken fajitas ; ingredients: boneless skinless chicken breast, diced tomatoes with green chilies, onion, green pepper, red pepper, canola oil, chili powder, ground cumin, salt, flour tortillas ; preparation:

name: smashed red potatoes with parmesan basil butter ; ingredients: red potatoes, olive oil, salt, pepper, unsalted butter, parmesan cheese, fresh garlic, fresh basil ; preparation:Preheat oven to 375 degrees. To a mixing bowl, add red potatoes, olive oil, salt and pepper. Toss to coat potatoes. Place on a baking sheet. Cook potatoes until largest potatoes are soft, about 25-30 minutes. While potatoes are cooking use a mixer to whip the butter, shredded parmesan, chopped garlic, chopped basil and salt and pepper. Add the roasted potatoes to bowl and smash potatoes to a coarse mash. ; name: delightfully easy and delicious bruschetta ; ingredients: italian-style stewed tomatoes, garlic clove, fresh basil, french baguette, olive oil ; preparation:Drain tomatoes, reserving liquid. In small saucepan, boil reserved liquid with garlic, 5 to 6 minutes, stirring occasionally. Remove from heat. Chop tomatoes. Combine with garlic mixture and basil. Brush bread with oil and broil until golden. Top with tomato mixture.
