Let marinade 1 hour. Transfer to food processor or blender and process until pureed. Transfer to medium bowl, fold in whipped cream. Serve immediately or cover with plastic wrap and freeze. 2 points per serving. ; name: white choc chip cookies ; ingredients: brown sugar, white sugar, butter, egg yolk, vanilla essence, self-raising flour, white chocolate chips ; preparation:Preheat oven to 180 c. Grease or line cookie tray. Mix together sugar and butter. Add egg yolk and vanilla, mix well. Stir in flour and choc chips. Place teaspoonfuls onto tray and bake for 12 minutes. ; name: a molasses ginger snaps ; ingredients: molasses, sugar, egg, crisco shortening, flour, salt, cinnamon, clove, ginger ; preparation:

name: yummy banana strawberry cheesecake pudding ; ingredients: butter pound cake, bananas, fresh strawberries, sugar-free instant cheesecake pudding mix, low-fat milk, sugar-free cool whip ; preparation:Slice pound cake and layer on the bottom of a cake pan. Slice bananas and strawberries and layer slices on top of cake. Mix pudding mix & milk then pour over cake and fruit. Top with cool whip. Refrigerate for at least 1 hour and enjoy. ; name: boboli pizza crust clone ; ingredients: water, olive oil, garlic, salt, sugar, all-purpose flour, italian seasoning, parmesan cheese, active dry yeast ; preparation:Add all ingredients to breadmaker in order listed by your manufacturer. Set breadmaker on dough setting. When cycle is done, form two crusts on pizza pans, sprinkle with parmesan cheese, cover and let rise again. Bake 5-10 minutes at 450 f until light brown. Cool. Wrap tightly in foil and freeze. ; name: chicken salad ; ingredients: chicken breasts, celery, green onions, mayonnaise, salt and pepper ; preparation:Boil chicken for 40 minutes. Cool. Shred cooled chicken with two forks. Add mayo to desired consistency. Add celery and green onions. Add salt and pepper to taste. Chill. Enjoy. ; name: zingy jello salad ; ingredients: lemon jell-o gelatin, lime jell-o gelatin, boiling water, small curd cottage cheese, crushed pineapple in syrup, miracle whip ; preparation:Empty both boxes of jello into a large bowl and add boiling water. Stir to dissolve and let cool. Add miracle whip and beat to a smooth consistency. Add cottage cheese and pineapple with the syrup. Mix and refrigerate until set up. ; name: garden green beans ; ingredients: fresh green beans, fresh mushrooms, onions, garlic, olive oil, sliced water chestnuts, italian seasoning, salt, pepper, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Place beans in a saucepan and cover with water. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Cover and simmer until crisp-tender. Meanwhile, in a skillet, saute mushrooms, onion and garlic in oil until tender. Stir in water chestnuts and seasonings. Heat through. Drain beans and stir into skillet. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Serve immediately. ; name: must love cheese chicken wild rice soup ; ingredients: chicken tenderloins, wild rice, chicken broth, water, salt, black pepper, half-and-half cream, velveeta cheese, sharp cheddar cheese, cornstarch ; preparation:Cut the tenderloins into bite size pieces then sprinkle with salt & pepper. Spray a large pot with cooking spray & cook the chicken until no longer pink. Pour the broth & water in the pot then add the rice & seasoning packet. Bring to a boil then lower heat & simmer for 20 minutes, covered. Mix the salt, pepper, & half-and-half in with the broth. Then add the velveeta & shredded cheese to the pot. Stir until the cheese is melted. Mix the cornstarch & a small amount of water in a cup to form a running paste. Pour this into the broth, stirring until it thickens. ; name: incredibly cool and refreshing mandarin orange cake ; ingredients: yellow cake mix, eggs, vegetable oil, mandarin oranges, frozen whipped topping, instant vanilla pudding ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease and flour a 9 x 13 inch pan. In a large bowl, combine cake mix, eggs, oil and one can of oranges with juice. Mix by hand or with mixer until smooth. Pour into prepared pan. Bake for 30-40 minutes or until thin steak knife inserted in center come out clean. Allow to cool completely on rack. In a large bowl, mix whipped topping, the other can of mandarin oranges with juice and dry pudding mix until well combined and smooth. Spread on cooled cake. ; name: steamed clams with bacon and beer ; ingredients: bacon, onion, steamer clams, beer ; preparation:

name: beer buns ; ingredients: bisquick, egg, sugar, beer ; preparation:Blend all ingredients with a fork. Do not beat. Heat oven to 400 degrees. In 12 muffin cups put a dab of solid shortening. Place in oven for shortening to melt. When melted, remove muffin pan from oven and swirl the melted shortening in the cups. Drop batter by spoonfuls into prepared muffin cups. Bake 12-15 minutes. ; name: cantaloupe red wine surprise ; ingredients: red wine, sugar, cantaloupe, lemon, basil leaves ; preparation:Warm wine in a shallow saucepan over low heat. It should be steaming but not simmering. Dissolve sugar in wine. Remove from heat. Pour into medium glass bowl and allow to completely cool. Using a melon baller, scoop out balls of cantaloupe and add to the wine mixture. Thinly slice the outer peel from half a lemon into 4 strips. Add to bowl. Add chopped basil. Stir gently. Cover and refrigerate at least 30 minutes. Divide between 4 wine glasses and serve chilled. ; name: italian style tomato sauce ; ingredients: italian plum tomatoes, olive oil, onions, tomato paste, basil, oregano, sugar, salt, pepper ; preparation:Place tomatoes in food processor. Process on high for 1 minute. In dutch oven on medium heat, saut onions in olive oil till soft but not browned. Add tomatoes, tomato pure and all spices. Cook sauce on very low heat for about 2 hours, stirring occasionally. Add a little water if necessary as sauce cooks. ; name: jackie s famous broccoli salad ; ingredients: broccoli, red onion, bacon, old cheddar cheese, raisins, mayonnaise, red wine vinegar, worcestershire sauce, sugar, salt ; preparation:Wash broccoli and cut into bite-size pieces. Thinly slice red onion. Fry bacon until crisp and break into pieces. Shred cheddar cheese. In medium size bowl mix all ingredients until well blended. Add sugar to your taste preference. Cover and refrigerate for 3 hours or overnight. ; name: blintz casserole ; ingredients: all-purpose flour, baking powder, butter, white sugar, eggs, milk, cream-style cottage cheese, egg, sour cream, salt ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Grease a 9-in square baking pan. In a med-size bowl, mix flour, baking powder, butter and sugar, then stir in 2 eggs and milk. In a separate bowl mix cottage cheese with 2 tablespoons butter 1 egg, sour cream and salt. Place half of the flour mixture in the greased baking dish, then cover with the cottage cheese mixture. Top with the remaining flour mixture. Bake for 50 minutes until puffed and golden brown. Cool slightly then cut into squares to serve. ; name: grilled vegetable skewers ; ingredients: olive oil, balsamic vinegar, fresh oregano, dijon mustard, japanese eggplants, zucchini, yellow squash, cherry tomatoes, wooden skewers ; preparation:Soak wooden skewers for at leat 30 minutes in water. Whisk dressing ingredients in a jar and set aside. Alternate vegetables with tomatoes on skewers. Each skewer should hold approximately 6 vegetables and 6 tomatoes. Arrange skewers on baking sheet while you complete all 10 skewers. Brush skewers with dressing. Prepare barbecue. Brush skewers with dressing, sprinkle with salt and pepper. Grill until skewers are tender and charred slightly, turning often. Transfer to serving platter and brush again with dressing. ; name: smucker s thumbprint cookies ; ingredients: butter, sugar, vanilla extract, flour, salt, jam ; preparation:Cream butter& sugar, stir in vanilla. Mix in flour and salt. Chill dough 2 hours. Shape rounded teaspoons of dough into balls. Place on ungreased cookie sheet, flatten shighlty. Indent centers and fill with jam. Bake at 375 for about 12 minutes. Watch the bottoms as they are alot like shortbread cookies and the bottoms get brown quickly. ; name: hot crab and cheese dip ; ingredients: crabmeat, cream cheese, cheese, bottled hot pepper sauce, shrimp, garlic, old bay seasoning, onion powder, fresh parsley, salt and pepper ; preparation:

name: cream cheese dip for the lazy ; ingredients: cream cheese, tomatoes, garlic, fresh ground pepper ; preparation:Slice tomato in half and scoop out inside pulp. Combine tomato pulp with cream cheese and garlic. Mix with a mixer for several minutes until smooth. Place mixture in a small bowl and sprinkle with fresh ground pepper. Refrigerate until ready to serve. ; name: easy chahan japanese fried rice ; ingredients: rice, egg, green onion, carrots, bacon, soy sauce, sake, salt, pepper, olive oil ; preparation:Chop long green onions, carrots, and bacon into little pieces. Put 400g warm rice into a bowl and mix raw egg with it throughly, make sure the egg is coating the rice totally. Fry the egg and rice mix with olive oil in a frying pan. When the rice starts to spatter, add all the other ingredients except soy sauce and sake. Fry all of the contents. Add soy sauce and mix it throughly. Add sake and mix it throughly. Lastly, add salt and pepper to taste. ; name: extra creamy fluffy white frosting ; ingredients: crisco shortening, salt, vanilla, icing sugar, heavy whipping cream ; preparation:In a bowl using an electric mixer, beat together the shortening, salt, vanilla and half of the icing sugar. Beat until very smooth. Add in whipping cream. Beat well. Add in remaining icing sugar to desired texture. Beat until fluffy and creamy. ; name: broccoli saute ; ingredients: broccoli, yellow bell pepper, cherry tomatoes, garlic, olive oil, southwest seasoning ; preparation:In a saucepot, bring 2 inches of water to a boil. Add broccoli. Cover. Cook for 5 minutes, or until broccoli is tender. Place peppers and tomatoes in colander, pour in cooked broccoli and hot water to drain. In skillet over high heat, cook garlic in olive oil 1 minute. Add vegetables and seasoning blend. Cook 2 minutes. Arrange on serving platter. ; name: linguine with clams bacon and tomato ; ingredients: bacon, garlic cloves, dry white wine, crushed tomatoes, bottled clam juice, clam, flat leaf parsley, salt, dried red pepper flakes, linguine ; preparation:In large frying pan, cook the bacon over moderate heat until almost crisp. Remove bacon with slotted spoon and pour off all but 2 tbs fat. Add garlic and cook, stirring, for 30 seconds. Add wine. Stir in bacon, tomatoes and clam juice and heat to a simmer. Cook for 10 minutes. Add the clams, parsley, salt and red-pepper flakes and cook for one minute longer. In the meantime, boil the linguine until just done, about 12 minutes. Drain the linguine well and add to the sauce. Allow the linguine to sit for 2 to 3 minutes to absorb some of the liquid. ; name: favorite chocolate chip and fruit bars ; ingredients: flour, baking soda, butter, sugar, eggs, raisins, dates, semi-sweet chocolate chips, walnuts ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350f. Spray an 11 x 17-inch pan with pam non stick cooking spray. Combine flour and baking soda in bowl and set aside. Cream butter with sugar. Add eggs one at a time. Alternately stir in raisins and flour mixture. Fold in remaining ingredients. Spread evenly in prepared pan. Bake for 30 minutes or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool and then cut into bars. ; name: herbed scrambled egg on croissants vegetarian option ; ingredients: croissants, cherry tomatoes, cooking spray, eggs, cream, butter, chives, ham ; preparation:Preheat oven to 170c. Line a baking tray with baking paper. Remove croissants from packaging and place on prepared tray with tomatoes and spray with oil and bake for 10-12 minutes or until croissants are heated. Meanwhile, combine eggs and cream in a medium bowl and season with salt and pepper and beat mixture lightly with a whisk to combine. Melt butter in a large non-stick frying pan over low heat and add egg mixture and cook for 30 seconds, gently stir egg mixture from outer edges to centre until egvg forms creamy curds and then stir in chives. Cut croissants in half and top with ham, them top with scrambled eggs and serve scrambled eggs with tomatoes. ; name: cherry bomb jello shots ; ingredients: water, sugar-free black cherry gelatin, cherry vodka, red bull energy drink ; preparation:

name: lemon cod ; ingredients: cod fish fillets, vegetable oil cooking spray, parsley, italian seasoning, salt, pepper, lemon ; preparation:Spray a nonstick frypan with veggies cooking spray and heat to medium. Spray veggie cooking spray over both sides of the cod fillets. Squeese 2 lemon sections over cod surfaces. Sprinkle parsley, italian seasoning, salt and pepper over both sides of the cod filets. Place cod into medium hot frypan, cook for about 5 minutes, carefully turn and cook a further 5 minutes or until fish flakes easily with a fork. Serve hot with the other 2 lemon sections for garnish. ; name: chicken marsala with mushrooms ; ingredients: chicken tenders, lemon, salt, white pepper, flour, butter, olive oil, mushrooms, dry marsala wine ; preparation:Squeeze the lemon over the chicken and sprinkle with the salt& pepper. Coat with flour. In a large skillet, melt three tbsp. Of the butter, add the mushrooms and cook until wilted. Remove mushrooms from skillet and set aside. To skillet, add remaining butter& olive oil. Add chicken tenders and brown lightly on both sides over moderate heat. Add mushrooms& wine. Cover and simmer 5-10 minutes until chicken is tender. ; name: plain roasted artichoke hearts ; ingredients: artichoke hearts, garlic cloves, extra virgin olive oil, salt and pepper, lemon juice, butter ; preparation:Preheat oven to 375f. Drain artichokes in colander and rinse a bit to remove brine. Mix gently with garlic and olive oil in a bowl. Pour artichoke mixture in a metal roasting pan and roast for about one hour, tossing a few times if desired. Sprinkle with salt and pepper, and add lemon juice and butter. ; name: turnaround turkey and rice ; ingredients: butter, celery, onion, cooked turkey, water, turkey gravy mix, milk, flour, season-all salt ; preparation:In a saucepan, melt butter over medium heat. Add celery and onion and cook for 5 minutes or until tender, stirring occassionally. Add cooked turkey. Blend water, gravy mix, milk, flour, and season-all. Pour over turkey mixture. Stir. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer 5 minutes. Serve over rice. ; name: amaretto eggnog bread pudding ; ingredients: challah, eggs, sugar, vanilla extract, amaretto, eggnog, cinnamon, raisins ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350. Tear bread into chunks. Beat the eggs into the eggnog and then add the amaretto and vanilla. Pour over bread. With hands, mix until it has texture like very wet, soft stuffing. You may need to add more amaretto, for proper texture. Add the raisins. Bake about 45 minutes, uncovered. You may serve warm or cold. ; name: whiskey lemonade ; ingredients: fresh lemon juice, crown royal whiskey, simple syrup, ice ; preparation:To make simple syrup, combine 2 cups of sugar and 2 cups of water over medium-high heat in a saucepan until the sugar is dissolved. Remove from heat and let cool completely before using. To store, refrigerate up to 2 months. In a glass, combine lemon juice, whiskey and simple syrup over ice. Add a splash of water if desired. Enjoy. ; name: simple apple crisp ; ingredients: apples, cinnamon, nutmeg, water, lemon juice, butter, sugar, flour ; preparation:Pre-heat oven to 350. Placed sliced apples in buttered 8x8 pan. Add spices, lemon juice and water. In separate bowl, mix butter, sugar and flour until crumbly. Sprinkle on top of apples. Bake for 1 hour or until top is golden brown and apples are tender. ; name: crepes florentine ; ingredients: crepes, frozen spinach, butter, flour, milk, salt, mozzarella cheese, onion, parmesan cheese ; preparation:

name: roasted potatoes with sage and garlic ; ingredients: small potatoes, flour, oil, garlic cloves, sage leaf, unsalted butter, kosher salt, fresh pepper ; preparation:Preheat oven to 450f and place a large, heavy skillet or roasting pan in the oven to heat. Place the potatoes in a large saucepan and cover with cold salted water. Put on high heat to boil. Once boiling, lower heat and simmer for 5 minutes. Drain the potatoes well, and place on paper towels. Put the flour on a plate. When the potatoes are dry, roll them in the flour to coat. Remove the hot skillet from the oven and add the oil and potatoes. Roast, shaking the pan occasionally until the potatoes are golden brown all over, about 30 minutes. Remove from the oven and add the garlic, sage and butter. Return to the oven for one minute. Season generously with salt and pepper and serve. ; name: roasted napa cabbage ; ingredients: vegetable oil, garlic cloves, napa cabbage, salt, pepper ; preparation:Heat the oil in a skillet on low. Add the garlic cloves and cook very gently for 15 minutes. Discard the garlic and toss the cabbage with the oil, salt and pepper. Preheat your oven to 450. Place the cabbage on a baking sheet and bake for about 15 minutes or until the tops of the cabbage pieces are browned. Serve hot. ; name: the best ever pimiento cheese spread ; ingredients: extra-sharp cheddar cheese, cream cheese, pimientos, vinegar, flour, lemon pepper, yellow mustard, mayonnaise ; preparation:Bring vinegar to a boil in the microwave. Add flour to vinegar and stir to make a paste. Add softened cream cheese to above mixture and stir thouroughly. Add all other ingredients except cheese to above mixture and mix well. Grate the cheese with manual cheese grater or in your food proccessor. Add cheese into mixture and mix well. Serve on bread as a sandwich or on crackers, wheat thins, etc. ; name: glazed crackers ; ingredients: butter, sugar, vanilla extract, pecans, crackers, semi-sweet chocolate chips, white chocolate chips ; preparation:Arrange crackers on two baking sheets. In a small saucepan over medium heat on stovetop, combine butter and sugar. Bring to a boil and cook for 3 minutes. Stir in vanilla and chopped pecans. Spoon pecan mixture over crackers. Bake at 325 degrees for 6 minutes. Remove from oven and sprinkle chocolate chips over crackers. Return to oven and bake for 2 minutes more, or until chocolate chips are melted. Remove from oven and let cool briefly. Using a spatula, transfer crackers to a serving plate or an airtight container. ; name: lemon pepper turkey breast crock pot ; ingredients: turkey breast, lemon pepper, flour, water ; preparation:Sprinkle turkey with lemon pepper. Place turkey breast halves, meaty sides down in a 5 quart crock pot. Cover and cook on high for 1 hour. Reduce heat to low and clook for 5 hours. Remove turkey to platter, reserving cooking liquid in cooker. Set turkey aside and keep warm. Combine flour and water in a saucepan, stirring with a whisk unti blended. Gradually add reserved cooking liquid, stirring constantly. Bring to a boil over medium high heat, stirring constantly. Reduce heat and simmer for 3-5 minutes or until thick, stirring ocassionaly. Serve turkey with gravy. ; name: pomegranate and poppy seed salad ; ingredients: romaine lettuce, red onion, pomegranate seeds, mayonnaise, sugar, milk, white vinegar, poppy seeds ; preparation:In a large bowl, mix the romaine, onion and pomegranate seeds. In a small bowl, mix the remaining ingredients until well blended. Pour over salad. Toss to coat. Serve immediately. ; name: pasta and tuna cheddar bake ; ingredients: corkscrew macaroni, chicken broth, water, cream of mushroom soup, milk, tuna, cheddar cheese, breadcrumbs, butter ; preparation:Cook pasta in water and broth in a heavy skillet untill just tender. Do not drain add soup, milk and tuna. And mix well. Sprinkle cheese on top. Mix bread crumbs and butter and put on top heat through. ; name: gooiest butter cookies ; ingredients: butter, vanilla extract, egg, cream cheese, butter recipe cake mix, nonstick cooking spray, powdered sugar ; preparation:

name: chocolate covered pretzels ; ingredients: semisweet chocolate, vegetable shortening, pretzels, white chocolate ; preparation:Cover a baking sheet with waxed paper. In a double broiler set over simmering water, melt the semisweet chocolate with 2 teaspoons shortening, stirring gently constantly. Remove from heat. Using tongs dip each pretzel in chocolate allowing excess to drip off. Place onto waxed paper. If you are sprinkling any toppings on do it right after dipping into the chocolate so it will stick. Place the coated pretzels in the refrigerator to harden. After the pretzels have hardened place the white chocolate in a double boiler and melt over simmering water. Drizzle the white chocolate in small strands over each pretzel. Return to waxed paper and refrigerate. ; name: orange ginger tea loaf ; ingredients: sugar, margarine, eggs, flour, baking powder, ground ginger, orange juice, milk, orange rind, walnuts ; preparation:Preheat oven to 180c. Cream together sugar and margarine. Add eggs, beat till light and fluffy. Combine dry ingredients in another bowl. Mix together orange juice and milk. Add the orange juice mixture alternately with the dry ingredients to the batter, beating till blended. Fold in orange rind and walnuts. Bake in a loaf pan about for 45 minutes or until the cake is cooked when tested with a skewer. ; name: skillet chicken cacciatore ; ingredients: italian dressing, onion, green bell pepper, boneless skinless chicken breast halves, italian seasoning, sugar, stewed tomatoes ; preparation:In a large skillet, heat italian dressing. Add onion, bell pepper, and chicken. Mix well to combine, and cook over moderate heat for approximately 6 minutes, stirring occasionally. In a small bowl, combine italian seasoning, sugar, and undrained stewed tomatoes. Spoon this over the chicken evenly, and lower heat so chicken is just simmering. Simmer for about 12-14 minutes, stirring occasionally. When chicken is fork-tender, it is ready to be served over hot noodles. ; name: oktoberfest curry catsup ; ingredients: oil, onions, curry powder, sweet hungarian paprika, ketchup, water ; preparation:Saute the onion in oil until it is transparent, about 2-3 minutes. Do not brown. Add curry powder and paprika to onion and continue to saute for a about 1 minute. Add ketchup and water to the onion mixture and simmer uncovered until sauce thickens a bit about 5 minutes. Taste and adjust the seasoning. Refrigerate and serve with brats, hamburger or hot dogs. ; name: ice cream rolls ; ingredients: refrigerated biscuits, butter, sugar, brown sugar, vanilla ice cream, ground cinnamon, raisins ; preparation:Spray 13 x 9 pan with cooking spray. Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Cut biscuits in half. Place in pan in 1 layer. Pour butter evenly over biscuits. Sprinkle sugars evenly over biscuits and butter. Pour ice cream evenly. Bake for 30 minutes. Cool slightly. Turn pan over onto serving platter. ; name: nif s pan prepared parmesan and rosemary rice ; ingredients: butter, white rice, dried rosemary, chicken broth, white wine, fresh parmesan cheese, salt & freshly ground black pepper ; preparation:Heat butter in a frying pan over medium heat and add rice. Stir rice around for a few minutes to absorb the butter and get a little nutty tasting. Stir rosemary into rice. Add chicken broth. Bring broth to a boil, reduce heat to low. Cover and simmer for 20-25 minutes, until rice is cooked. Add white wine and parmesan cheese and heat through. Salt and pepper to taste. ; name: oven baked panko breaded eggplant ; ingredients: eggplant, plain yogurt, panko breadcrumbs, extra virgin olive oil, cumin, paprika, lemon zest, italian seasoning, seasoning ; preparation:Slice eggplant lengthwise into fairly thin slices. Season yogurt and panko breadcrumbs with desired seasonings. Coat both sides of eggplant in yogurt. Press coated eggplant into panko bread crumbs pushing down into mixture to get even coating. Place onto cookie sheet. Drizzle both sides with of breaded eggplant with olive oil. Place in oven at 350f for 15 to 20 minutes take out and flip each eggplant and return to oven for 20 minutes or desired crispness. ; name: basque style potatoes ; ingredients: olive oil, onion, garlic, parsley, pimiento, salt and pepper, potatoes, chicken broth ; preparation:

name: blueberry spice sauce ; ingredients: sugar, cornstarch, cinnamon, nutmeg, hot water, lemon juice, blueberries ; preparation:Rinse and clean blueberries. If using frozen dry pack blueberries, thaw them first. In small saucepan, combine sugar, cornstarch, cinnamon and nutmeg. Gradually stir in water and lemon juice. Over medium heat, cook, stirring constantly, until mixture thickens and comes to a boil. Add blueberries. Cook and stir until mixture comes back to a boil. Serve warm over ice cream or cake or frozen pies. ; name: 100 whole wheat rolls ; ingredients: yeast, water, honey, olive oil, eggs, salt, whole wheat flour ; preparation:Dissolve yeast in water and honey for about 5 minutes. Combine honey, olive oil, eggs, and salt in a large mixing bowl. Slowly add flour and knead until it loosens from sides of the bowl. Place in large oiled bowl, cover and let rise until about double. About one hour, be sure it is in a warm place. Punch down and remove dough. Shape dough into rolls about 2 inch in diameter. Place on an oiled or non stick baking sheet, cover and let rise for 30 minutes. Pre-heat oven to 375 degrees. Bake at about 375 degrees for about 20 minutes or until browned. ; name: nthochi banana bread ; ingredients: margarine, sugar, flour, egg, milk, baking powder, salt, bananas ; preparation:Grease a loaf pan well. Preheat oven to 325degrees f. Cream margarine with sugar. Beat in egg. Add flour, salt, baking powder, milk, and bananas. Pour into loaf pan. Bake for about 1 hour. Cool well and slice. ; name: italian vegetable casserole ; ingredients: zucchini, yellow squash, onions, butter, garlic clove, oregano, tomato sauce, mozzarella cheese ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Saute zucchini, yellow squash and onion with the butter and garlic. Add oregano and tomato sauce. Simmer for 5 - 7 minutes. Place in a casserole dish and sprinkle with cheese. Bake for 30 minutes. ; name: turkey beef kebabs ; ingredients: lean ground turkey, lean ground beef, fine dry breadcrumbs, onions, egg yolk, salt, pepper ; preparation:In a bowl, mix turkey, beef, bread crumbs, onion, egg yolk, salt, and pepper. Divide meat mixture into 4 equal portions. Pat each portion around a metal skewer to form a log 1-inch thick and 7 to 8 inches long. Lay skewers on lightly oiled barbecue gril over a solid bed of hot coals or high heat on a gas grill. Close lid on gas grill. Rotating skewers to brown meat evenly, cook until kebabs are no longer pink in center, 7 to 8 minutes, if desired, about 1 minute before meat is done, brush lightly with sauce of your choice. Enjoy. ; name: cooked chicken for dumplings ; ingredients: whole chickens, water, onions, carrots, celery & leaves, garlic cloves, salt, pepper ; preparation:Put chicken, vegetables and seasoning in largest stockpot you have. Cover with water to fill almost to top. Bring to boil, then reduce heat to simmer for 30-45 minutes. Carefully lift chicken out of broth, it will most likely fall apart. Place in bowl to cool so you can pick meat off bones. Strain the broth to remove the soggy vegetables. Pour broth back into stock pot. Check for seasoning. Pick chicken meat off bones and tear into bite size pieces. Return chicken to broth. Bring stew back to boil and reduce heat to simmer. Add dumplings of your choice. ; name: crustless apple butter pumpkin pie 2 ww points ; ingredients: canned pumpkin, egg beaters egg substitute, skim milk, salt, pumpkin pie spice, all-purpose flour, apple butter, cool whip free ; preparation:Beat all together until smooth. Pour into a pam sprayed pie pan. Bake at 400 for 15 minutes, then at 375 for 45 minutes, or until a knife inserted comes out clean. Top each slice with 1 t. Cool whip. ; name: christmas morning eggs ; ingredients: white bread, eggs, milk, cheddar cheese, salt and pepper, bacon ; preparation:

name: ginger chicken with peaches and onions ; ingredients: peach, red onions, gingerroot, soy sauce, olive oil, toasted sesame oil, chicken breasts ; preparation:Preheat oven to 450. Place frozen peaches and onion slices on a large rimmed baking sheet. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Sprinkle with ginger, soy sauce, one tablespoon of olive oil, sesame oil, and red pepper flakes, and toss to coat. Rub chicken breasts with remaining teaspoon of olive oil, and season with salt and pepper to taste. Arrange chicken skin-side up among peaches and onions. Roast until chicken is opaque throughout and registers 160 on a thermometer inserted in the thickest part of the breast, about 25 to 30 minutes. Serve over rice, couscous, or bulgur. ; name: no cook brownies ; ingredients: almond meal, cocoa powder, sea salt, agave, water, cocoa nibs ; preparation:Mix almond meal, cacao, salt in mixing bowl. Mix in agave or honey and water. Stir in cacao nibs. Use a 2 tablespoon scooper to portion onto dehydrator trays. Dehydrate for 6 to 7 hours, or to desired consistency. ; name: saucy bacon roll ups ; ingredients: bacon, water chestnuts, toothpick, chili sauce, mayonnaise, brown sugar ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350. Seperate bacon into slices. Cut each slice in thirds. Wrap each cut slice of bacon around a water chestnut. Secure with a toothpick. Place in a baking dish. In a bowl combine chili sauce, mayonnaise, and brown sugar. Pour sauce over bacon roll ups and bake in the preheated oven for 35 to 40 minutes. ; name: coleslaw with raisins ; ingredients: coleslaw mix, pine nuts, raisins, onion, mayonnaise, malt vinegar, sugar, mustard, salt, pepper ; preparation:Open the bag of coleslaw cabbage into a large mixing bowl. Add raisins, onions and nuts. Combine gently. In a small bowl, whisk together the remaining ingredients until very well blended. Pour the dressing over the cabbage mixture and gently combine until evenly blended. Refrigerate for a minimum of 2-hours. Garnish with a sprig of cilantro or parsley leaf. ; name: swiss steak quick and easy this is wrong category should be in ; ingredients: vegetable oil, cube steaks, all-purpose flour, onion, mushroom, salt and pepper, brown gravy mix, stewed tomatoes, egg noodles ; preparation:Heat oil in a dutch oven over medium heat. Dredge steak strips in flour. Working in batches, place strips in hot oil. Fry until browned on both sides. Remove to a warm platter. When all meat is browned, return meat to dutch oven, and stir in onions, mushrooms, salt, pepper, gravy mix, and stewed tomatoes. Bring to a boil, then simmer about 30 to 45 minutes. About 20 minutes before steak is finished, fill a large pot with water and bring to a boil. Add pasta, and cook until al dente, about 8 to 10 minutes. Drain. Serve swiss steak over noodles. ; name: taco soup with beans ; ingredients: ground beef, onion, pinto beans, tomatoes and green chilies, tomatoes, tomato paste, ranch dressing mix, taco seasoning mix, corn ; preparation:Brown meat and onions in skillet. Drain. Add meat and remaining ingredients in slow cooker. Cover. Cook on low 4 hours or until ingredients are heated through. ; name: new york steak with garlic cheese sauce ; ingredients: new york strip steaks, vegetable oil, green onion, red wine, half-and-half cream, boursin cheese, parsley ; preparation:Sear steaks in hot oil, until cooked to your preference. Remove steaks, cover and keep warm. In same pan saute onions for 2 minutes, add wine and cook over high heat until reduced to 1 tbsp. Add half and half cream. Boil until reduced by half. Stir in boursin cheese or garlic cream cheese until thick and hot. Pour sauce over hot steaks, garnish with parsley. ; name: v s short cut chocolate eclairs ; ingredients: graham cracker squares, vanilla instant pudding mix, milk, frozen whipped topping, chocolate frosting ; preparation:

name: friendship banana nut bread ; ingredients: shortening, sugar, banana, active starter, eggs, flour, baking soda, baking powder, salt, nuts ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Grease& flour 2 loaf pans& set aside. Sift together dry ingredients. Cream shortening, sugar and bananas. Add friendship starter& eggs, mixing well. Add dry ingredients and nuts. Pour batter into prepared loaf pans& bake for 40 minutes or until done. ; name: really easy and good honey mustard chicken ; ingredients: chicken pieces, liquid honey, butter, dijon mustard, curry powder, red cayenne pepper ; preparation:Set oven to 350. Grease a large shallow baking dish. Place the chicken pieces in a single layer. In a small bowl, combine honey, butter, dijon mustard, curry powder and cayenne. Mix well to combine. Pour over the chicken pieces in the baking dish. Mix the chicken pieces slightly with your hands to coat. Bake uncovered for 20 minutes. Remove from oven. Turn the chicken pieces over. With a spoon, baste with sauce. Bake for another 25 minutes or until chicken is cooked. ; name: orange rosemary chicken ; ingredients: frozen orange juice concentrate, dry white wine, honey dijon mustard, fresh rosemary, soy sauce, tabasco sauce, garlic, hickory chips, chicken ; preparation:Blend first 7 ingredients in processor. Set orange glaze aside. Prepare bbq. Place smoke chips in 8x6-inch foil packet with open top. Set packet atop coals about 5 minutes before grilling. Sprinkle chicken with salt and pepper. Grill chicken until golden, turning occasionally, about 5 minutes per side. Continue grilling chicken until cooked through, brushing glaze over chicken and turning occasionally, about 25 minutes longer. ; name: chocolate peanut butter granola ; ingredients: margarine, peanut butter, honey, vanilla, oatmeal, miniature semisweet chocolate chips, banana chips, pecans, heath candy bar ; preparation:Melt together margarine, peanut butter and honey. Add vanilla. Pour over oatmeal and toss to coat. Spread on baking sheet. Bake at 350, for 10-15 minutes, stir frequently as the edges may burn easily. Let cool a few minutes. While oats are still mostly warm, transfer to a bowl and stir in chocolate chips. The warmth of the oats should melt the chips. Cool completely. ; name: stuffed eggs beyth mahshi ; ingredients: hard-boiled eggs, sherry wine, spinach, herb salad dressing, yoghurt, olive oil, french mustard, salt and pepper ; preparation:Cut a slice from pointed end of each egg and remove the yolks, taking care not to break the whites. Sieve the yolks and put in bowl with the yoghurt, sherry, olive oil, mustard and seasoning. Mix well together, then fill the whites with mixture. Stand eggs upright on a bed of spinach and add herb dressing. Chill for 1 hour before serving. ; name: easy peasy bisquick cherry cobbler ; ingredients: cherry pie filling, milk, sugar, bisquick, butter, vanilla ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400. Melt butter in microwave safe bowl. Stir together milk, sugar, bisquick, vanilla and butter. Pour batter in 9 x 9 inch glass dish. Pour cherry pie filling in and press down gently with spoon so that most of the filling is covered with your batter. Bake for 45 minutes to 1 hour. Important - as soon as the cobbler is done cooking place on towel inside refrigerator and cool for at least 4 hours. This step is very important for your crust to turn out buttery. ; name: pork chops with potatoes and mushrooms ; ingredients: olive oil, baking potatoes, sliced mushrooms, onion, salt, dried sage, heavy cream, boneless pork chops, fine dry breadcrumb ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400. Brush a 13 x 9 inch baking dish with olive oil. Layer the sliced potatoes, mushrooms, and onions, in the dish. Sprinkle with the salt and sage leaves. Pour the cream over evenly. Brush the pork chops with olive oil, and rub the breadcrumbs onto both sides of each pork chop. Place pork chops on top of the vegetables. Bake, uncovered, for 45 minutes to 1 hour, or just until the pork chops are cooked through and the potatoes are tender. ; name: gingerbread french toast ; ingredients: eggs, milk, cinnamon, ginger, allspice, bread ; preparation:

name: barbecued lil smokies ; ingredients: little smokies sausages, barbecue sauce, water, potato chips ; preparation:Place smokies in a 6-quart crock pot. Pour in barbecue sauce and water. Bring to a boil, then simmer. Serve once smokies plump up. Serve with potato chips. ; name: fresh tomato basil salad weight watchers ; ingredients: red wine vinegar, sherry wine vinegar, shallot, salt, fresh ground black pepper, olive oil, basil sprig, tomatoes, fresh basil ; preparation:Whisk together 2 vinegars, shallot, salt and pepper in a small bowl. Slowly whisk in oil until blended. Add the basil sprig and bruise it with the back of a wooden spoon. Let mixture stand at room temperature for about 20 minutes. Discard sprig of basil. Put the tomatoes in a serving bowl. Drizzle with the dressing and add shredded basil. Toss to coat. Let stand at room temperature at least 30 minutes or up to an hour before serving. ; name: lower calorie chicken piccata ; ingredients: dijon mustard, egg, italian seasoned breadcrumbs, chicken breast, olive oil, chicken broth, lemon juice, parsley, lemon ; preparation:Combine the mustard and egg in a small bowl. Place the bread crumbs on a sheet of wax paper. Dip the chicken in the egg, then in the bread crumbs to cover. Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Cook the chicken in the oil until golden and cooked through, about 5 minutes on each side. Transfer to a plate. Add the broth and lemon juice to the skillet. Simmer 30 seconds, stir in the parsley. Pour the sauce over the chicken and garnish with the lemon sliced, if desired. ; name: strawberry asparagus salad ; ingredients: asparagus, strawberries, lemon juice, vegetable oil, honey ; preparation:Toss the asparagus and strawberries together in a bowl. Set aside. In a small bowl, combine the dressing ingredients and mix well. Pour dressing over salad and toss. Chill before serving. ; name: tomatoes and macaroni ; ingredients: macaroni noodles, onion, butter, diced tomatoes, garlic, salt and pepper, parsley, basil ; preparation:Begin boiling the macaroni noodles. In another saucepan, add onion and butter or margarine. Cook on medium high heat until the onions are soft. Add the tomatoes, garlic, salt, pepper, parsley, and basil to the onions. Reduce heat to medium. Cook the macaroni noodles until they are 2 or 3 minutes away from being done. Drain the water from the noodles. Add the noodles to the sauce and continue cooking on medium heat until the noodles are done. Enjoy. ; name: tiramisu balducci s in new york city ; ingredients: ladyfingers, espresso coffee, eggs, sugar, mascarpone, marsala wine, triple sec, brandy, orange extract, bittersweet chocolate ; preparation:Arrange the ladyfingers on a plate and lightly soak them with the cooled espresso. Put half of the soaked ladyfingers in one layer in a rectangular serving dish. While the ladyfingers are soaking, beat the egg yolks with the sugar until the yolks turn pale in color. Add the mascarpone, the liquors, and the extract, and stir gently. In a separate bowl, beat the egg whites with a wire whisk until they are stiff. Gently fold the whites into the mascarpone mixture. Use half of this mixture to make a layer on top of the ladyfingers in the serving dish. Sprinkle with half of the chopped chocolate. Repeat the procedure with another layer of soaked ladyfingers, the mascarpone mixture, and chocolate. Cover with tin foil and refrigerate for at least 1 hour before serving. ; name: fat freddie s beet horseradish ; ingredients: red beet, salt, horseradish, water, vinegar, pepper, sugar ; preparation:Grate beets and horseradish. Combine vinegar, sugar, salt, pepper and water. Bring to a boil. Pour over grated beets and horseradish. Mix thoroughly. Store in jar in refrigerator. ; name: dove kabobs ; ingredients: dove breasts, onions, bell pepper, teriyaki sauce, cherry tomatoes, mushroom ; preparation:

name: irish brown scones ; ingredients: whole wheat flour, all-purpose flour, wheat bran, baking soda, salt, butter, brown sugar, buttermilk ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400f lightly dust a baking sheet with some flour. Put the whole wheat flour and wheat germ into a large mixing bowl. Sift the all-purpose flour, salt and baking soda into the bowl. Mix the ingredients well together with fingers. Next, rub in the butter to pea-sized pieces. Then mix in the sugar. At this stage, put the lightly dusted tin into the oven to preheat. Stir in enough buttermilk to make a soft dough. Turn onto a lightly floured surface and gently knead for a few seconds. Cut out scones with a round cookie cutter. Put the scones on the preheated baking sheet and bake for about 15 minutes or until risen and a golden brown. Cool on a wire tray. ; name: fig and crispy prosciutto salad ; ingredients: prosciutto, spinach, fresh basil, figs, balsamic vinegar, truffle oil ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Place slices of prosciutto flat on parchment paper over a baking sheet. Bake about 13 minutes, or until fairly crisp. Remove from oven and let cool slightly. Break the prosciutto up into pieces and set aside. Assemble salad with the spinach and basil on the bottom. Top with figs and crispy prosciutto, and dress with balsamic vinegar and truffle oil, to taste. ; name: black currant mango iced tea ; ingredients: black currant tea bags, fresh mint leaves, limes, boiling water, splenda granular, mango juice, ice cube ; preparation:Place tea bags, mint and lime in large measuring cup or teapot. Cover with boiling water and steep for 10 minutes. Strain into large pitcher. Stir in splenda granulated until dissolved. Stir in mango juice. Serve over ice. ; name: low carb fudge ; ingredients: margarine, unsweetened chocolate, equal sugar substitute, vanilla extract, cream cheese, nuts ; preparation:Melt butter over low heat. Add chocolate and stir until melted. Remove from heat and stir in sweetener and vanilla. Combine the chocolate mixture with the cream cheese and beat until smooth. Stir in nuts and spread in lightly greased 8-inch square pan. Refrigerate until firm. ; name: yam or sweet potato puff ; ingredients: yams, butter, eggs, sugar, baking powder, salt ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350f and butter a casserole dish. Peel potatoes and boil until soft. Mash and add remaining ingredients. Beat well and pour into prepared casserole. Dot with additional butter and bake until brown, 30 to 40 minutes. ; name: parmesan pita triangles ; ingredients: pita bread rounds, butter, garlic powder, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Preheat oven to broil. Cut each pita into 6 pie slice-shaped triangles. Separate each triangle into 2 triangles and place on a cookie sheet. Brush each pita triangle with butter. Sprinkle with garlic powder and parmesan cheese. Broil for 1-2 minutes until cheese is bubbly and lightly browned. Serve warm. ; name: ham and cheese mini s ; ingredients: ham, onion, green chili peppers, monterey jack and cheddar cheese blend, egg, dijon mustard, pepper, crescent roll dough ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 f. Combine all ingredients except for dough in a medium sized bowl. Divide crescent roll dough into 24 rounds. Press into miniature muffin cups. Spoon 1 tbl. Of ham mixture into cups. Bake at 350 f. For 13-15 minutes or until golden brown. ; name: chicken lickin good pork chops ; ingredients: lean pork chops, flour, salt, dry mustard, garlic powder, oil, chicken rice soup ; preparation:

name: honey buttermilk cornbread ; ingredients: cornmeal, flour, baking powder, salt, egg, buttermilk, oil, honey ; preparation:Preheat oven to 425 degrees f. And grease a 8 inch square baking pan. Sift the cornmeal, flour, baking powder and salt together. In a seperate bowl mix the egg, buttermilk oil and honey. Add the egg mixture to the dry ingredients. Beat until smooth. Pour into pan. Bake 20 minutes edges may start to brown a little. ; name: mahi mahi polynesian style ; ingredients: mahi mahi fillet, soy sauce, pineapple chunks in juice, red bell pepper, green bell pepper, curry powder, cinnamon, ginger, clove, olive oil flavored cooking spray ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Mix together soy sauce, cinnamon, ginger, and cloves. Add to mahi mahi in a ziploc bag and let marinate at room temperature for 30 minutes. Spray non-stick baking pan with cooking spray. Place fish in pan. Drain juice from pineapple, reserve. Combine pineapple juice with curry powder and pour over fish. Add pineapple chunks and pepper slices on top of fish. Wrap pan tightly with foil. Bake for 15 minutes at 350 degrees, then uncover and bake for 5 minutes more, until fish flakes easily with fork. ; name: bananacran bread ; ingredients: bananas, frozen cranberries, butter, sugar, eggs, flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt, cinnamon ; preparation:Beat together butter, sugar and eggs until creamy. Add bananas and cranberries. Combine the remaining dry ingredients in a separate bowl. Add to the wet ingredients and stir until well mixed. Pour into a large greased loaf pan and bake in a 350 oven for an hour. Remove and cool for 20 minutes in the pan before removing. ; name: not just for campout beanie weenies ; ingredients: pork and beans, ketchup, mustard, brown sugar, onions, frankfurters ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350. Mix together first 5 ingredients in a bowl and pour into greased baking dish. Slice frankfurters into chunks and place on top of bean mixture. Cover and bake at 350 for 45 minutes. Remove cover for last 15 minutes to brown the franks. ; name: bavarian strawberry cream pie ; ingredients: strawberry, sugar, cold water, unflavored gelatin, boiling water, fresh lemon juice, heavy cream ; preparation:In a large bowl, crush strawberries and add sugar. Let stand 30 minutes. Pour cold water in a bowl and add the unflavored gelatin to the top. Let stand 5 minutes. Add boiling water to dissolve the gelatin. Stir. Stir in the the strawberries and add fresh lemon juice. Chill the gelatin until it is the thickness of unbeaten egg whites. Whip the cream until firm peaks form. Gently fold into strawberry mixture. Pour into pie crust and refrigerate for at least 4 hours. ; name: chicken casserole with broccoli ; ingredients: baking mix, cooked chicken, frozen chopped broccoli, cheddar cheese, milk, eggs, seasoning salt, pepper ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400, grease 2 quart casserole dish. In prepared casserole dish, place chicken, broccoli and cheese. In a separate mixing bowl, blend baking mix, milk, eggs, salt and pepper on high speed until well mixed. Pour into dish over chicken, broccoli and cheese. Bake for 35-40 minutes until knife inserted in center comes out clean. Let cool 5 minutes before serving. ; name: spinach ricotta pizza with fresh tomato puree ; ingredients: pizza dough, tomatoes, garlic cloves, olive oil, fresh spinach, ricotta cheese, mozzarella cheese, fresh basil ; preparation:Divide dough into two and roll out into two thin crusts. Lightly brush olive oil to taste on top and bake the dough for 5 minutes in a 425 degree oven on a greased and floured pan. Meanwhile grate the four tomatoes into a medium bowl. If your tomatoes are really ripe, you can drain the excess liquid slighlty. Add the pressed garlic and olive oil. Add the spinach to a medium pan over medium heat and saute with salt and pepper to taste until half-wilted. Spread the tomato mixture on both crusts. Return to the oven for another 5 minutes. This should get rid of any excess liquid in the sauce. Top the pizzas with spinach, basil, and a light sprinkling of mozzarella. Finish by placing small dallops of ricotta around the pizza, using a small spoon. Bake for an additional 10 minutes or until cheese bubbles and begins to brown. ; name: philly cheesesteak sandwiches rachael ray ; ingredients: olive oil, yellow onions, salt and pepper, steak seasoning, lean sirloin steaks, garlic salt, black pepper, provolone cheese, hoagie rolls ; preparation:

name: yummy cincinnati chili ; ingredients: ground sirloin, onion, tomato sauce, diced tomatoes, dark red kidney beans, chili powder, salt and pepper, cooked spaghetti, cheddar cheese, sour cream ; preparation:Brown meat and onion together and drain off fat. Add tomato sauce, undrained beans, undrained tomatoes, chili powder and salt and pepper to taste. Simmer for 20 minutes. Serve over hot spaghetti. Sprinkle cheddar cheese and sour cream on top. Enjoy. ; name: cucumber tuna boat ; ingredients: cucumbers, tuna, hard-boiled eggs, cheddar cheese, celery, mayonnaise, sweet pickle relish, onion, lemon juice, salt ; preparation:Cut cucumber in half lengthwise. Remove and discard seeds. Cut a thin slice from bottom if necessary so they sit flat. In a bowl, combine the remaining ingredients. Spoon into the cucumbers. Serve immediately. ; name: chicken almond casserole ; ingredients: chicken, mayonnaise, cream of chicken soup, celery, sliced almonds, cracker crumb, onion, eggs, potato chips ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 deg. Mix all ingredients together well except for the corn flakes. Lightly grease a casserole dish and add mixture. Top with corn flakes. May drizzle a little melted butter over corn flakes if desired. Bake at 350 for 35 minutes. ; name: chinese prawn cakes with sweet chilli sauce ; ingredients: white fish fillets, prawns, spring onions, coriander, fresh breadcrumbs, eggs, salt and pepper, vegetable oil, sweet chili sauce ; preparation:Place fish and prawns in processor. Chop to chunky paste. Remove to bowl. Stir in onions, coriander and breadcrumbs. Season. Moisten your hands, and form mixture into small cakes. Heat a little vegetable oil in pan or wok and cook cakes in batches until golden brown on both sides. Drain on paper towels. Serve with sweet chilli sauce for dipping. ; name: basmati chaaval ; ingredients: basmati rice, salt, unsalted butter, water ; preparation:Pick the rice over and put in a bowl. Wash in several changes of water. Drain. Pour 3 times the water you have rice over the rice and let soak for 30 minutes hour. Drain thoroughly. Combine the rice, salt, butter and the water in a pot. Bring to a boil. Cover with a tight fitting lid, turn heat to very low and cook for 20 minutes. Lift the lid, mix gently but quickly with a fork and cover again. Cook for 5-10 minutes until tender. ; name: polish stir fry ; ingredients: kielbasa, potatoes, carrot, onion, cabbage ; preparation:Lightly grease big, iron skillet, with canola oil. Brown the kielbasa. Take it out and put it aside. Drain excess grease. Fry potatoes and carrots, stirring often, until half-cooked. Add onion and keep frying, stirring frequently. When the onion is half-cooked, add the cabbage and continue until everything is completely cooked. Return kielbasa to the pan, mix well, and serve once it is reheated. This dish travels well and reheats well. ; name: apples with honey ; ingredients: dessert apples, lemon, juice of, clarified butter, pine nuts, raisins, honey, orange flower water ; preparation:Peel & core the apples. Cut each into 12 pieces & sprinkle with the lemon juice to prevent from browning. Heat the butter & saut the apple pieces over a moderate heat. Add the pine nuts & raisins, cook for 1 minute then add the honey. Immediately after adding the honey stir the apples quickly & frequently so they caramelize evenly. Add the orange-flower water to deglaze the apples. Serve hot --. ; name: skillet pecan rice ; ingredients: quick-cooking rice, red bell pepper, onion, fresh mushrooms, vegetable oil, garlic clove, cajun seasoning, salt, black pepper, pecans ; preparation:

name: chinese prawn cakes with sweet chilli sauce ; ingredients: white fish fillets, prawns, spring onions, coriander, fresh breadcrumbs, eggs, salt and pepper, vegetable oil, sweet chili sauce ; preparation:Place fish and prawns in processor. Chop to chunky paste. Remove to bowl. Stir in onions, coriander and breadcrumbs. Season. Moisten your hands, and form mixture into small cakes. Heat a little vegetable oil in pan or wok and cook cakes in batches until golden brown on both sides. Drain on paper towels. Serve with sweet chilli sauce for dipping. ; name: michael s granny s sour cream taters ; ingredients: new potatoes, green onion, sour cream, hidden valley ranch dressing mix, butter, evaporated milk ; preparation:Mix the package of original ranch mix into the sour cream. Wash the potatoes, and cut them into halves if they are very large new potatoes. Boil the potatoes in salted water, until soft. When potatoes are soft, drain them in a colander. Put the potatoes back in the pot after draining, add the butter, the evaporated milk, salt and pepper to your taste, and stir together. Add in the sour cream mixture, and the chopped green onions. Cover and let sit for 10-15 minutes. Heat over a medium-low heat for about 3 minutes, stirring often, until all is hot again. Serve. ; name: yams hash brown style ; ingredients: yams, vegetable shortening, unsalted butter, black pepper, honey ; preparation:Peel & coarsely grate yams. Heat shortening in large skillet, then add grated yams. Cook, stirring occasionally, for 10 minutes. Add butter & pepper, & continue cooking & stirring until lightly browned. Drizzle with honey & stir to blend before serving. ; name: skillet caramelized parsnips ; ingredients: butter, parsnip, nutmeg, water, salt, cracked black pepper ; preparation:After peeling the parsnips, cut them into sticks the size of your pinkie finger. Dry off any moisture with a paper towel or sacking cloth. Melt the butter in a skillet over medium heat then add the parsnips, tossing to coat. Sprinkle the parsnips with the nutmeg. Cover the skillet tightly with a lid and cook the parsnips over medium heat for approximately 10 minutes or until the parsnips reach a golden brown color. All stoves are different so if it looks like the parsnips may be cooking too quickly, lower the heat. Add the water, place the lid back on the skillet and steam until the water has evaporated and the parsnips are golden, tender and caramelized. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Serve immediately. ; name: pork chops with potatoes and mushrooms ; ingredients: olive oil, baking potatoes, sliced mushrooms, onion, salt, dried sage, heavy cream, boneless pork chops, fine dry breadcrumb ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400. Brush a 13 x 9 inch baking dish with olive oil. Layer the sliced potatoes, mushrooms, and onions, in the dish. Sprinkle with the salt and sage leaves. Pour the cream over evenly. Brush the pork chops with olive oil, and rub the breadcrumbs onto both sides of each pork chop. Place pork chops on top of the vegetables. Bake, uncovered, for 45 minutes to 1 hour, or just until the pork chops are cooked through and the potatoes are tender. ; name: double peanut cereal nuggets ; ingredients: puffed wheat cereal, oatmeal, chex cereal, roasted peanuts, raisins, honey, peanut butter, vanilla ; preparation:Toss together cereals, raisins or dates, oats and peanuts. Cook honey over medium heat until foamy. Remove from heat and stir in peanut butter and vanilla. When smooth, pour over cereal mixture. Toss until evenly coated. Spread on cookie sheet to cool. Store in airtight container. ; name: new potatoes in creamy dill sauce ; ingredients: tiny new potatoes, water, chive & onion cream cheese, milk, dill weed ; preparation:Microwave potatoes and water in covered 3-quart microwaveable dish on high 15 to 17 minutes or until potatoes are tender. Stirring after 10 minutes. Drain. Return potatoes to dish. Set aside. Microwave cream cheese spread and milk in microwaveable bowl 1 minute. Stir until smooth. Pour over potatoes. Sprinkle with dill. Microwave 1 to 2 minutes or until heated through. Stir gently. ; name: tagliatelle with parmesan and courgettes zucchini ; ingredients: olive oil, garlic clove, courgettes, lemon, juice of, fresh basil, tagliatelle pasta noodles, parmesan cheese ; preparation:

name: cucumber tuna boat ; ingredients: cucumbers, tuna, hard-boiled eggs, cheddar cheese, celery, mayonnaise, sweet pickle relish, onion, lemon juice, salt ; preparation:Cut cucumber in half lengthwise. Remove and discard seeds. Cut a thin slice from bottom if necessary so they sit flat. In a bowl, combine the remaining ingredients. Spoon into the cucumbers. Serve immediately. ; name: raisin buns ; ingredients: flour, baking powder, sugar, eggs, butter, milk, raisins, vanilla ; preparation:Mix flour, baking powder and sugar. Cut in butter. Then add beaten eggs, milk, vanilla and raisins. Mix just until all flour is moistened. Roll out dough onto lightly floured surface with rolling pin. Roll out to about 2 inch thickness. Use a round cookie cutter or the top of a glass to cut out buns. Put them into a 13x9-inch baking pan. Place them all together, no need to separate them. Bake at 450f until golden brown about 12-15 minutes. ; name: mashed potatoes extraordinaire ; ingredients: potatoes, cream cheese, sour cream, butter, onion powder, salt, pepper, paprika ; preparation:Cook potatoes as usual in salted water until tender. Drain. Push through potato ricer. Add cream cheese in pieces. Add next 5 ingredients. Beat until smooth and fluffy. Scrape into a 2 qt casserole. Place dabs of butter here and there over the top of the potatoes. Sprinkle with paprika. Cover and heat in 350 f oven until heated through. ; name: chunky strawberry lemonade ; ingredients: lemons, lime, strawberry, sugar, cold water ; preparation:Rinse and hull strawberries, put in bowl and sprinkle with the 2 t. Sugar, set aside. Squeeze the lemons and limes into large bowl or gallon jar. Add the 2 cups sugar and half the water. Stir until sugar is disolved, add the remaining water. With a potato masher or fork, mash the strawberries, but leave semi chunky. Add to lemonade, stir well. ; name: liver dumplings calf pork beef or lamb ; ingredients: liver, onion, butter, soft breadcrumbs, eggs, flour, salt and pepper, parsley ; preparation:Simmer liver in water for a few minutes before grinding and force meat through a food chopper. Fry onion in butter. Add bread crumbs. Combine liver and eggs. Mix well. Add bread crumb mixture. Season to taste. Stir in flour to make a batter stiff enough to drop from the spoon. Drop into a kettle of hot broth or soup. Cover tightly and cook for 30 minutes. Shake pan frequently to prevent dumplings from sticking to each other. ; name: quick and easy tuna noodle casserole ; ingredients: cream of mushroom soup, elbow macaroni, water, extra-sharp cheddar cheese, peas ; preparation:Boil noodles. Then strain. Mix in cream of mushroom soup and tuna. Pour into casserole dish. Sprinkle cheese of top. Bake at 350 until cheese is melted. Let cool and serve. ; name: ww 4 pt diet soda cake ; ingredients: cake mix, diet soda, sugar free fat free instant pudding mix, cool whip free ; preparation:Mix cake mix and can of drink together using mixer. Pour into a greased 9 x 13 baking pan. Bake according to package directions. While cake is baking, make pudding mixture using ff milk. When cake is cooled, top with pudding then cool whip. ; name: donut holes ; ingredients: vegetable oil, pancake mix, sugar, egg, cinnamon ; preparation:

name: cannellini bean salad with roast cherry tomatoes chorizo ; ingredients: cherry tomatoes, olive oil, salt and pepper, cannellini beans, chorizo sausage, red onion, sherry wine vinegar, honey, mixed salad greens ; preparation:Heat oven to 350f put the tomatoes on a baking tray and drizzle with some of the oil. Season and roast for 20 minutes and then remove. Drain and rinse the beans. Fry the chorizo in a non-stick pan until crisp, then drain on kitchen paper. Wipe the pan clean and add the olive oil, onion and seasoning. Cook for 5 minutes, then add the vinegar and reduce by half. Add the honey and whisk to emulsify. Pour the warm dressing over the beans and mix. Add the chorizo, tomatoes and salad leaves and mix again. Divide between 2 plates. ; name: linda s politically incorrect make ahead smashed potatoes ; ingredients: potatoes, kosher salt, cream cheese, unsalted butter, heavy cream ; preparation:Gently boil the potaotes in a large pot of water. Make sure to add the salt to the water before it boils. Potatoes should take 15 minutes or so, just boiled until they are fork tender. Drain potatoes and return to hot pot and shake them around until they are on the dry side and no water remains. Add cream cheese and butter and smash the potatoes with a potato masher or large spoon. Add ceam a little at a time until the potatoes are the consistancy you desire. You may need more or less depending on the moisture content of the potatoes. Pile into a warm buttered bowl with a pat of butter on top. You can make this dish up to 3 days ahead. To add interest to the potatoes add a little paprika, parsley or snipped chives after you plate them. ; name: grilled ribs ; ingredients: sugar, kosher salt, paprika, cayenne pepper, pork spareribs ; preparation:Prepare grill using charcoal and hickory wood chips or preheat gas grill to low. Combine first four ingredients in a bowl and rub all over ribs. Let the ribs stand a room temperature for 15 minutes. Put ribs on grill grate, skirt side down, cover and slow cook until brown. Turn and cook the second side until brown and ribs are done. ; name: oven baked chicken with tasty rub ; ingredients: chicken breasts, salt, garlic, oregano, paprika, pepper, chili powder, onion powder, thyme, olive oil ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Take all ingredients except for olive oil and chicken and combine in small bowl. Vary amount of chili powder depending on desired level of spice. Take chicken and lightly coat both sides with olive oil. Place chicken in oven-safe dish and rub both sides heavily with ingredients previously mixed. Pour a little bit more olive oil into the bottom of the dish, enough so that it is lightly covered. Cook for roughly 35-45 minutes. ; name: caramelized chicken drumsticks ; ingredients: skinless chicken drumsticks, soy sauce, sugar, water, fresh ginger, garlic, sesame oil, pepper, sesame seeds ; preparation:In a small bowl, combine soy sauce, sugar, water, ginger, garlic, sesame oil, and pepper. Place drumsticks on non-stick skillet and pour the soy sauce mixture on top. Cover with lid and bring to boil. Reduce the heat to low and cook for 15 min until they are cooked through. Remove the cover, turn up the heat to mid-high. The sauce will get thicken and start to caramelize in a few minutes. Continue to cook drumsticks turning them around so the sauce can cover them evenly, about 5 more minutes. When you see the sauce becomes like dark brown glaze and stick on to the meat, it is done. Remove from the heat, sprinkle sesame seeds all over them. Serve with hot rice and my steamed broccoli. ; name: mom s fried green tomatoes ; ingredients: green tomatoes, flour, salt, pepper, oil ; preparation:Slice the green tomatoes in thin slices. Dip the tomatoes in the flour. Heat the oil until hot. Fry until golden brown on each side making sure to season each side with salt & pepper. Remove from the oil when browned and season again with salt & pepper. ; name: greek rice with cabbage and tomatoes lahanorizo ; ingredients: cabbage, olive oil, white onion, parsley, salt, black pepper, long grain rice, tomatoes, water ; preparation:Over low heat in a large skillet, saut onion until just translucent. Increase heat to medium and add cabbage. Continue cooking until wilted. Add tomatoes and water. When in comes to a boil, add rice, parsley, salt and pepper. Reduce heat to simmer, cover and cook until very little liquid remains and rice is tender. Serve. ; name: tart and tangy potato salad ; ingredients: potatoes, red onions, hard-boiled eggs, fresh parsley leaves, light sour cream, lemons, juice of, olive oil, dijon mustard ; preparation:

name: creamy fresh cranberry and fruit salad ; ingredients: fresh cranberries, sugar, crushed pineapple, green grape, apples, miniature marshmallow, macadamia nuts, heavy cream ; preparation:Mince the cranberries in a food processor. Do this in two batches. Stir together the cranberries and sugar. Let sit and chill for about 8 hours. After about 8 hours, drain the cranberries well and stir in the well-drained crushed pineapple. Add the grapes and apples and stir. Then fold in the marshmallows and nuts. Let sit overnight in the refrigerator. A few hours before serving, whip the cream until it is becoming stiff. Fold into the fruit mixture. Chill until serving. ; name: german style spinach or chard ; ingredients: frozen chopped spinach, onion, garlic cloves, butter, bacon, ground nutmeg, salt, pepper ; preparation:Cook spinach according to package directions. Drain well and set aside. In a large skillet, saute onion and garlic in butter until tender. Stir in spinach, bacon, nutmeg, salt, and pepper. Heat through. ; name: wilted dandelion greens ; ingredients: dandelion greens, bacon, dry mustard, sugar, cider vinegar, salt, cracked pepper ; preparation:Washing the greens very carefully, discarding the roots and tough stems. Dry between two towels. Tear the greens into small pieces. Fry the bacon in a large skillet until the bacon is very crisp. Remove bacon to paper towel. Add the mustard, sugar, vinegar, salt and pepper to the fat in the pan. Bring to boil and put in dry greens. Cover and cook the greens for about 3 minutes, until just hot and wilted. Transfer to a warm vegetable dish and crumble bacon all over the top. ; name: super spuds ; ingredients: potatoes, mayonnaise, brown mustard, garlic clove, salt, pepper, hot dog ; preparation:Bake 6 potatoes. Cut in half. Scoop shells. Mash with mayonnaise, brown mustard, garlic, salt, pepper. Fold in hot dogs that have been cooked and sliced. Return to shells. Bake 20 minutes in 350 oven. ; name: vegan white bean aioli ; ingredients: navy beans, lemon juice, salt, fresh ground black pepper, olive oil, garlic cloves ; preparation:Combine the beans, lemon juice, salt and pepper in a blender or food processor and puree until smooth, scraping down the sides of the bowl to get everything. Preheat a small pan over low heat. Cook the garlic in the olive oil for about 3 minutes. Add the garlic and oil to the mixture in the blender and puree. Taste for salt, pepper and lemon and adjust to your liking. Transfer to a container, cover and refrigerate until ready to use. ; name: brie appetizer to travel ; ingredients: brie round, caramel apple dip, mixed dried fruit, cashews, crackers ; preparation:Cut off top rind of brie. Center cheese on a plate. Cover with caramel apple dip. Sprinkle with dried fruit, then the cashews. Surround with crackers and serve. ; name: cherry tiramisu cups ; ingredients: mascarpone cheese, kahlua, brewed coffee, white sugar, fresh cherries, water, amaretto, lemon juice, shortbread, powdered chocolate milk mix ; preparation:To make the cherry sauce, bring the water to a boil in a small saucepan. Add as much sugar as will dissolve into the water, then add the amaretto and lemon juice. Just before it starts to boil, add the cherries, and stir it over a high heat until the liquid takes on the color of the cherries. Reduce the heat, and simmer until most of the liquid has evaporated. Place the mixture in a small bowl, cover tightly, and place in the fridge. To make the coffee cream, simply combine the cheese, kahlua, and coffee in a bowl, and stir until the mixture is uniform in color. Add sugar to taste, if necessary. Once the cherry sauce has cooled, arrange the three components in layers in a martini glass, with the biscuit crumbs on the bottom, cherry sauce in the middle, and coffee cream on top. Refridgerate until the coffee cream is firm. Decorate with powdered sugar, and place a cherry on top. ; name: jill samwiches ; ingredients: bread, swiss cheese, cream cheese, butter, mayonnaise ; preparation:

name: soda bread ; ingredients: flour, baking soda, salt, butter, sour milk ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400. Stir flour, baking soda and salt together. Cut in butter, until mixture resembles crumbs. Pour in sour milk. Knead dough, cut cross at center and bake for 40 minutes. ; name: peppered almonds ; ingredients: almonds, vegetable oil, sugar, ground black pepper, salt ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400f. Stir all ingredients in small baking pan to coat almonds. Arrange in single layer. Bake until coating is crisp and almonds are toasted, stirring occasionally, about 12 minutes. Cool. ; name: pasta with leek bacon ; ingredients: butter, bacon, leeks, cream, pasta, parmesan cheese, salt and pepper ; preparation:Cut bacon into 1cm cubes. Trim the leeks and cut in half length ways, rinsing any dirt out from beneath the layers. Cut the halves into thin strips length ways. Melt butter in frying pan and saute the bacon and leeks for about 5 - 6 minutes. Add cream, mix well and simmer for 2 - 3 minutes. Meanwhile, cook the pasta according to packet instructions, then drain. Add the bacon and leek mixture to the hot pasta and season well. Mix together and serve immediately. Top with parmesan. ; name: legal seafoods crab dip ; ingredients: cream cheese, heavy cream, onion, prepared horseradish, old bay seasoning, white cheddar cheese, chives, canned crabmeat ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350f. Combine cream cheese and cream, stirring until smooth. Stir in onion, horseradish, old bay, cheddar and chives. Add crabmeat with liquid and fold in gently. Place in a small baking dish, bake 8-10 minutes or until hot. ; name: potato cakes with goat cheese petites galettes de pommes de ; ingredients: potato, fresh thyme, garlic clove, scallions, salt & freshly ground black pepper, olive oil, sweet butter, goat cheese ; preparation:Squeeze all of the liquid out of the potatoes with your hands, then add the thyme, garlic, scallions and seasonings. Heat half the oil and butter in a non stick frying pan. Drop two large spoonfuls of the potato mixture in the oil, press down with spoon. Fry for 2-3 minutes on each side. Remove and drain. Repeat with rest of mixture, keeping the others warm. Preheat the broiler. Cut the cheese into 4 slices. Place on potato cakes and broil until the cheese is golden. Garnish with sprigs of thyme and salad greens. Serve immediately. ; name: lemon broccoli and peppers ; ingredients: broccoli florets, water, butter, olive oil, red bell pepper, yellow bell pepper, lemon juice, white pepper ; preparation:Place broccoli on bottom of glass casserole dish. Add water, cover, and heat in microwave for 4 minutes on high. Remove broccoli from microwave, add bell peppers, and saut in butter and olive oil in a skillet over medium heat for approximately 2 minutes. Sprinkle on lemon juice and white pepper. Mix thoroughly, and saut for 1 more minute remove from heat. ; name: spinach stir fry with garlic ; ingredients: peanut oil, garlic clove, fresh spinach, soy sauce, rice vinegar, sugar, sesame seeds ; preparation:Heat oil in a wok or large skillet over medium high heat. Add garlic and cook 1 minutes. Add spinach, soy sauce, vinegar and sugar. Stir fry 2 minutes until spinach begins to wilt. Sprinkle with sesame seeds and serve. ; name: salted caramel treats ; ingredients: caramels, sweetened condensed milk, unsalted butter, miniature marshmallows, vanilla extract, flaked sea salt, toasted rice cereal ; preparation:

name: easy white chicken chili ; ingredients: white chicken meat packed in water, cream of chicken soup, skim milk, great northern beans, onion, diced tomatoes with green chilies, chili seasoning mix, cheddar cheese ; preparation:In a heavy saucepan, open all cans and mix together. Add onion and white chicken chili mix to taste. Stir well. Simmer for 45 minutes, stirring frequently. Sprinkle cheese on the top when serving. ; name: double almond crunch toffee ; ingredients: almonds, butter, sugar, light corn syrup, water, chocolate chips ; preparation:Spread almonds in seperate shallow pans. Place in low temp oven to roast them until light brown. Meanwhile melt butter over low heat in a 2 qt pan. Add sugar, corn syrup and water. Cook, stirring occasionally to hard crack stage watch close, when it gets to 280, quickly stir in coarse chopped nuts. Spread in ungreased pan. Cool. Spread with melted chocolate chips. Sprinkle with nuts. Flip over onto wax paper. Spread more chocolate and nuts. ; name: friendship banana nut bread ; ingredients: shortening, sugar, banana, active starter, eggs, flour, baking soda, baking powder, salt, nuts ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Grease& flour 2 loaf pans& set aside. Sift together dry ingredients. Cream shortening, sugar and bananas. Add friendship starter& eggs, mixing well. Add dry ingredients and nuts. Pour batter into prepared loaf pans& bake for 40 minutes or until done. ; name: kathleen s burgundy pork tenderloin ; ingredients: pork tenderloin, salt, ground black pepper, garlic powder, onion, celery, red wine, brown gravy mix ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Place pork in a 9x13 inch baking dish and sprinkle meat with salt, pepper and garlic powder. Top with onion and celery and pour wine over all. Bake in preheated oven for 45 minutes. When done baking, remove meat from baking dish and place on a serving platter. Pour gravy mix into baking dish with wine and cooking juices and stir until thickened. Slice meat and cover with the gravy. ; name: sicilian broccoli ; ingredients: frozen broccoli, extra virgin olive oil, red onion, garlic, salt, pepper, asiago cheese ; preparation:Fill medium saucepan half full of water and cover and bring to boil on high for the broccoli. Stir broccoli into the boiling water and boil 3-4 minutes, stirring occasionally, or until desired tenderness. Drain broccoli thoroughly. Return saucepan to the stove. Reduce heat to medium-high. Place olive oil in pan and swirl to coat. Add onions and garlic and cook 2-3 minutes to brown. Stir in broccoli until coated with oil. Cook 3-4 more minutes, stirring occasionally, until flavors are well blended. Season with salt and pepper. Sprinkle the cheese over the broccoli and serve. ; name: all day mushrooms ; ingredients: button mushrooms, butter, burgundy wine, worcestershire sauce, garlic, dried dill, pepper, chicken bouillon cubes, beef bouillon cubes ; preparation:Wet a paper towel and wipe any dirt from the mushrooms. Place the mushrooms in a large stockpot. Add the remaining ingredients to the pot. The liquid will not cover the mushrooms at first. Cook, covered, over very low heat for 4 hours. Stir occasionally so that all of the mushrooms are completely coated with the cooking liquid. Remove the cover and cook for an additional 4 hours. The mushrooms will shrimk by half and become saturated with cooking liquid. Remove with a slotted spoon and serve in a bowl. ; name: creamy crock pot chicken with mushrooms ; ingredients: boneless skinless chicken breasts, cream of mushroom soup, dry onion soup mix, cream cheese, onion, sliced mushrooms, garlic cloves, chicken broth, parsley flakes ; preparation:Grease the inside of the slow cooker. Place chicken breasts in the bottom of the crock pot. Combine the rest of the ingredients in a medium pot and heat on medium high. Stirring occasionally until cream cheese is incorporated. Pour sauce over chicken in crock pot, and heat on low approximately 4 hours until chicken is tender and falling apart. Sprinkle with parsley flakes. Serve over pasta, egg noodles, or rice. ; name: easy chicken cacciatore ; ingredients: tomato sauce, italian seasoning, garlic powder, eggs, corn flake crumbs, parmesan cheese, dried parsley, butter, boneless skinless chicken breast halves, mozzarella cheese ; preparation:

name: corn chorizo tacos ; ingredients: chorizo sausage, red onion, fresh corn kernels, corn tortillas ; preparation:In a large skillet cook chorizo until crispy. Drain on a paper towel-lined plate. Pour off all but 1 tbsp of fat from skillet and add sliced red onion. Cook, stirring over medium-high heat until just soft, about 5 minutes. Add corn kernels and chorizo and cook briefly to heat through. Fill 12 heated corn tortillas with corn mixture and serve with lime wedges, sour cream and chopped cilantro. ; name: chipotle restaurant guacamole recipe ; ingredients: avocados, red onions, jalapeno, garlic cloves, lime juice, salt ; preparation:Wash avocados. Cut in half and scoop out the meat into a large bowl. Partially mash the avocados. Add onion, jalapenos, garlic and lime juice. Mash together until well blended and fairly creamy in consistency. Salt to taste. ; name: creamy baked gouda macaroni ; ingredients: cream of chicken soup, milk, chives, dry mustard, hot pepper sauce, elbow macaroni, gouda cheese, buttered bread crumbs ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Cook macaroni according to package directions. Drain. In 2-quart casserole dish, combine soup, milk, chives, mustard, and hot pepper sauce. Stir in macaroni and cheese. Sprinkle with bread crumbs. Bake 25 minutes or until hot and bubbly. ; name: roasted rack of lamb ; ingredients: racks of lamb, fresh thyme, fresh rosemary, olive oil, salt and pepper, garlic cloves ; preparation:Mix oil, garlic, rosemary, and thyme in a large bowl. Add lamb, and coat with herbs. Grind pepper and salt over all. Wrap well and marinate in the fridge 4 hours or overnight. Remove from marinade, scraping off as much herbs as possible. Preheat oven to 400f. Heat large saut pan high, add 2 tbsp oil. Sear both sides of meat. Transfer to large baking dish in oven. Bake 10 minutes for medium rare. Cover with foil and let rest for 10 minutes before slicing. Garnish with sprigs of rosemary. ; name: cranberry and pecan cheese log ; ingredients: cream cheese, dried cranberries, orange zest, planters pecans, cracker ; preparation:Mix reduced-fat cream cheese, cranberries and zest. Shape into 6-inch log. Coat with pecans. Wrap in plastic wrap. Refrigerate at least 30 minute serve with the crackers. ; name: crunchy baked bananas ; ingredients: bananas, orange juice, honey, sultanas, walnuts, cinnamon, yoghurt ; preparation:Slice bananas in half lengthways. Place in baking dish. Cut side up. Pour over juice, drizzle honey. Sprinkle on nuts, cinnamon and sultanas. Bake 200 c for 15 minutes. Serve with yoghurt. ; name: strawberry crumble bars ; ingredients: bisquick, quick-cooking oats, brown sugar, butter, strawberry jam ; preparation:Heat oven to 400. Grease a 9x9x2 pan. Mix bisquick, oats and sugar. Cut in the butter until fully mixed. Press half of the bisquick mixture into the pan and spread the jam on top. Press the rest of the mixture gently on top of the jam. Bake 25 to 30 minutes until lightly browned. ; name: ww pizza pasta ; ingredients: ground round, pizza sauce, salt, pepper, cooked elbow macaroni, reduced-fat sharp cheddar cheese ; preparation:

name: tastes like chick fil a chicken salad sandwich ; ingredients: cooked chicken breasts, celery, sugar, salt, fresh ground pepper, sweet pickle relish, mayonnaise, bread ; preparation:Pull apart the chicken into large chunks and either cut it into a small dice or process in a mini food processor. Place chicken in a large mixing bowl and add all remaining ingredients. Mix well. Toast your bread of choice and place salad in between toasted bread and serve.
