Gently squeeze out liquid. Set aside. In a small bowl, whisk together yogurt, milk, mayonnaise and vinegar. Stir in cucumber, green onion, garlic, dill and pepper. ; name: birthday cookie ; ingredients: butter, brown sugar, sugar, egg, vanilla extract, all-purpose flour, baking soda, salt, chocolate chips ; preparation:Cream butter and sugars. Add egg and vanilla. Mix on low speed, add dry ingredients. Mix well. Stir in chocolate chips or m&ms. Spray a 12 inch round pizza pan with pam and spread cookie dough evenly to the edges. Bake at 325 degrees f for 15 to 20 minutes, or until light golden brown. When cool, decorate as desired. ; name: breakfast crescent pizza ; ingredients: crescent rolls, sausage, bacon, hash brown, cheddar cheese, eggs, milk, salt and pepper ; preparation:Preheat oven to 375 degrees fahrenheit. Unroll rolls into 4 rectangles and place in a 13 x 9 inch baking dish. Press up sides slightly and press perforations together. Layer cooked sausage, cooked bacon, hash browns, and cheese. At this point you can make it ahead and refrigerate for up to 24 hours. Mix together eggs, milk, salt and pepper. Pour mixture over the dish. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes. ; name: hot salami chicken stroganoff ; ingredients: onion, garlic clove, mushrooms, salami, chicken strips, tomato paste, sour cream, ground pepper ; preparation:Saute onions and garlic in a large frypan until brown. Add mushrooms and salami to the pan with the chicken strips. Cook for 6-8 mins and add tomato paste, simmer for 2 minutes. Turn heat to low and stir in sour cream, simmer for another 2 minutes. Season with ground pepper and serve over rice or noodles. ; name: easy cheesy potatoes for the barbecue ; ingredients: potatoes, onion, green bell pepper, salt and pepper, butter, cheddar cheese ; preparation:Preheat an outdoor grill for medium high heat and lightly oil grate. Take a piece of aluminum foil big enough to hold all the potatoes and vegetables and spray with the vegetable cooking spray. Place the potatoes, onion and green bell pepper in the middle of the foil and season with salt and pepper to taste, then place small pats of the butter or margarine over the vegetables. Carefully seal all the edges of the foil around the vegetables to form an enclosed packet grill over medium high heat for 20 minutes, then flip over and grill for 10 more minutes. Carefully open packet, check for tenderness with a fork. If tender, sprinkle the cheese over the vegetables and allow it to melt. Transfer to a platter and serve with your main entree. ; name: felicia s cheesecake ; ingredients: low fat cottage cheese, eggs, powdered milk, lemon juice, honey, vanilla, almond essence ; preparation:

name: lima bean soup ; ingredients: olive oil, onion, diced tomatoes, pinto beans, frozen lima beans, brown sugar, salt, water, white kidney beans ; preparation:Heat oil in large saucepan over medium heat. Add onion and cook until onion is translucent, stirring occasionally. Add tomatoes with their liquid, pinto beans, lima beans, brown sugar, salt and water. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low. Cover and simmer 15 minutes or until lima beans are tender, stirring occasionally. Stir in white kidney beans, heat through. To serve, ladle soup into warm serving bowl. Sprinkle with 1 to 2 ounces shredded cheddar cheese if desired. ; name: spiced iced coffee ; ingredients: hot coffee, sugar, cinnamon sticks, cloves, allspice, black peppercorns, half-and-half ; preparation:Combine first 6 ingredients. Stir well. Let stand at room temperature 1 hour. Strain and serve over cracked ice. Serve with half-and-half and sugar. ; name: potato leek and quinoa soup ; ingredients: leeks, onion, potatoes, quinoa, swanson vegetable broth, olive oil ; preparation:Slice leek and rinse well. Peel and cube potato. Peel and chop onion. Turn slow cooker on high to preheat. Saute leek, onion and potato in olive oil on stove. Add stock and bring to a boil. Add quinoa and return to boil. Transfer to slow cooker. Cook on low 5-6 hours. ; name: white bean and sausage soup ; ingredients: yellow onion, carrots, chicken sausage, white beans, chicken stock, basil pesto ; preparation:In a 3-4 qt pot, saute the onion and carrot in a little olive oil until the onion is translucent. Add the sausage and brown a bit. Add the rest of the ingredients. Simmer for 30 minutes. Serve with crusty bread and a green salad. ; name: asparagus sauteed in butter and mustard ; ingredients: asparagus, butter, dijon mustard, fresh lemon juice, pepper ; preparation:Heat a large skillet over high heat. Add asparagus and cook for 1 minutes. Reduce heat to medium. Add the butter. Cook, stirring, until butter begins to brown, about 1 minute more. Combine mustard, lemon juice and pepper, and add to skillet. Cook, stirring occasionally, until asparagus is tender but still firm, 5-7 minutes. ; name: rudy s creamed corn ; ingredients: frozen whole kernel corn, fat free cream cheese, heavy whipping cream, splenda sugar substitute, black pepper, unsalted butter ; preparation:Spread corn over bottom of a crockpot or slowcooker. Top with cream cheese, cubed into pieces. Mix remaining ingredients together and pour over corn. Cover and cook on high heat for 2-3 hours till creamy. Stir occasionally as it cooks. ; name: pork n tater skillet ; ingredients: vegetable oil, boneless pork, onion, green pepper, seasoning salt, ground black pepper, water, milk, potatoes ; preparation:In a large skillet over medium heat, add oil, pork, onion, and green pepper. Sprinkle with seasoned salt and pepper. Cook until onions and peppers are slightly tender and pork is lightly browned. Add water and milk to skillet, then add potatoes and seasoning packet. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and cover. Simmer for 20 minutes or until potatoes are tender, stirring ocasionally. ; name: cool cannoli pudding ; ingredients: ricotta cheese, semisweet mini chocolate chips, maraschino cherry, pecans, sugar, whipping cream ; preparation:

name: white chocolate chunk almond cookies ; ingredients: butter, sugar, eggs, almond extract, flour, baking soda, salt, white baking chocolate, slivered almonds ; preparation:With an electric mixer cream the butter & sugar in a large bowl. Add the eggs one at a time until well blended. Add the almond extract. In a separate bowl combine the flour, baking soda, & salt. Gradually beat flour mixture into the butter mixture until well blended. Stir in white chocolate chips & almonds. Drop cookies in heaping tablespoonfuls about 1-inch apart on ungreased cookie sheet & bake at 375 degrees for 10 minutes or until cookies are lightly browned. Let cookies cool on cookie sheet for 2 minutes then transfer them to a wire rack to cool completely. These cookies freeze well. ; name: sloppy joes sandwiches ; ingredients: ground beef, ketchup, water, brown sugar, worcestershire sauce, prepared mustard, garlic powder, onion powder, salt, hamburger buns ; preparation:In a large saucepan, cook beef over medium heat until no longer pink. Drain. Stir in the ketchup, water, brown sugar, worcestershire sauce, mustard, garlic powder, onion powder, and salt. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Cover and simmer for 30-40 minutes. Serve on buns. ; name: red onion confit ; ingredients: red onion, olive oil, red wine vinegar, marsala wine ; preparation:Slice the onion very thin and evenly. A mandolin is perfect for this. Sweat the onions in olive oil on low till very soft. Add the red wine vinegar and marsala. Simmer till all the liquid has reduced. ; name: tomato mint and red onion salad ; ingredients: cherry tomatoes, red onion, mint, extra virgin olive oil, lemon, salt, pepper ; preparation:Slice tomatoes in half and place in bowl. Add onion and mint to tomatoes and mix. Drizzle with olive oil and lemon juice. Sprinkle the lemon zest on top. Salt and pepper to taste. Let salad marinate for 20 minutes before serving. ; name: jack daniels chicken ; ingredients: boneless skinless chicken breasts, shallots, jack daniels whiskey, chicken broth, heavy cream, tarragon, lemon, juice of ; preparation:Saute chicken breasts in butter. Wrap in foil and keep warm in 350 oven. Saute shallots. Add jack daniels and light with a match, flame will be high, let flame die down. Add broth and tarragon. Fast boil, uncovered, until sauce reduces to thick syrupy glaze. Add lemon juice and cream. Simmer until thickened. Put chicken breasts into sauce to coat. Serve with pasta or rice to utilize the yummy sauce. ; name: garlic pizza wedges ; ingredients: bread pizza crust, parmesan cheese, mayonnaise, red onion, garlic, dried oregano ; preparation:Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Place crust on an ungreased 14 in pizza pan. In a small bowl, combine cheese, mayonnaise, onion, garlic and oregano. Spread over crust. Bake at 450 degrees for 8 to 10 minutes or until edges are lightly browned. Cut into wedges and serve warm or slightly cooled. ; name: warm mushroom spread ; ingredients: butter, fresh mushrooms, onion, all-purpose flour, sour cream, lemon juice, salt and pepper, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. Melt the butter in a skillet over medium heat. Stir in the mushrooms and onion, and cook until tender. Sprinkle with the flour. Reduce heat to low, and continue cooking 5 minutes. Mix in sour cream and lemon juice, and season with salt and pepper transfer to a small casserole dish, and top with parmesan cheese. Bake 15 minutes in the preheated oven, until bubbly. ; name: cranberry port sauce ; ingredients: ruby port, cinnamon stick, dried cranberries, fresh cranberries, water, sugar ; preparation:

name: sloppy joe pasta skillet dinner ; ingredients: pasta, water, sloppy joe meat, frozen corn, tomatoes and green chilies, mexican blend cheese ; preparation:In a 10 inch non-stick skillet over medium heat add water. When water reaches boiling point add pasta, and cook until desired doneness is reached. Drain and return to skillet. Add meat, rotel, corn and 1 cup of cheese. Stirring until meat is heated through and cheese is melted. Sprinkle remaining cheese on top and serve. ; name: crock pot applesauce chicken ; ingredients: chicken breast halves, applesauce, dried onion flakes, apple cider vinegar, cinnamon, black pepper, garlic cloves, red pepper flakes ; preparation:Put the frozen chicken pieces into your crockpot. Add the onion. In a bowl, mix the applesauce, vinegar, garlic, and spices together. Pour on top of the chicken. Cover and cook on low for 5-7 hours, or on high for 3-4. Serve with rice or noodles. ; name: chocolate holiday bark ; ingredients: semisweet baking chocolate, premium white baking chocolate, almonds, dried cranberries, dried apricot ; preparation:In separate microwaveable bowls, microwave to melt the two chocolates as directed on the packages. Mix almonds & dried fruits together, putting half of this mixture into the dark chocolate & half of it into the white chocolate. Stir each until well blended. Drop the chocolate mixtures by spoonfuls onto a wax paper-covered baking sheet, alternating the dark & white. Cut through the chocolate mixtures with a knife several times to give a marble effect. Refrigerate at least 1 hour or until firm. Break into pieces, about 24, & store in a tightly covered container at room temperature. ; name: mandarin jell o salad ; ingredients: orange jell-o, boiling water, lemon juice, mandarin oranges, pineapple tidbits, orange sherbet, miniature marshmallow, whipped topping ; preparation:Add lemon juice to boiling water, then add water to jell-o. Stir in sherbet until dissolved. Mix oranges, pineapple, marshmallows and whipped topping together. Fold into mixture. Chill for two hours. ; name: cherry crisp ; ingredients: cherry pie filling, white cake mix, pecans, margarine ; preparation:Spread pie filling in 9x13 cake pan. Sprinkle dry cake mix on top. Spread with fork to even it out. Sprinkle nuts on top of cake mix. Pour melted margarine over all. Bake at 350 degrees for 30-35 minutes or until golden brown. ; name: cauliflower with scallions ; ingredients: cauliflower florets, butter, scallions, salt and pepper ; preparation:In a large pot of boiling salted water, cook cauliflower until tender, 3-5 minutes. Drain and transfer to a serving dish. In a small skillet, melt butter over medium low heat. Add scallions and cook 2 minutes. Pour over cauliflower and toss. Season with salt and pepper. Serve hot. ; name: roasted green chilies in cumin garlic cream ; ingredients: anaheim chilies, butter, onion, garlic cloves, ground cumin, light cream, chicken stock, salt and pepper, lime ; preparation:Roast the milk chilies, or the combination of bell peppers and jalapenos, in a heavy-based ungreased skillet until the skins are charred. Place in a plastic bag, twist to seal well and let stand for 20 minutes to allow the skins to loosen. Remove the seeds from the chilies and bell peppers, if using, and peel off the skins. Melt the butter in a large skillet, add the onion and garlic and saut for about 3 minutes until softened. Sprinkle with the cumin and season with salt and pepper to taste. Stir in the sliced chilies and pour in the cream and stock. Cook over a medium heat, stirring always, until the liquid reduces in volume and form a richly flavored sauce. Transfer to a serving dish and serve warm, squeezing the lime juice at the last minute. ; name: cornmeal jambuster muffins ; ingredients: cornmeal, buttermilk, flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, salt, eggs, margarine, jam ; preparation:

name: mama s no bake banana pudding ; ingredients: banana, wafer cookies, sweetened condensed milk, cool whip, instant vanilla pudding ; preparation:Make pudding according to directions on box for pie filling, but do not let set. Mix in cool whip & eagle brand. Slice bananas into desired thickness. In a large bowl, starting with pudding mixture, layer pudding, then cookies, then bananas. Repeat until all pudding mixture is used and top with cookies. Cover & refrigerate 3-4 hours until set. ; name: mulled fruit tea puncher ; ingredients: tea bag, cinnamon sticks, whole cloves, fresh water, white sugar, orange juice, pineapple juice, lemonade, ginger ale ; preparation:Steep tea bag, cinnamon and cloves in water to make 1 cup of spiced black tea. In a pitcher, combine sugar and spiced tea. Stir until sugar isdissolved. Stir in orange juice, pineapple juice and lemonade. Chill in refrigerator for 4 hours. To serve, pour chilled mixture into a punch bowl and stir in ginger ale. ; name: ice cream rolls ; ingredients: refrigerated biscuits, butter, sugar, brown sugar, vanilla ice cream, ground cinnamon, raisins ; preparation:Spray 13 x 9 pan with cooking spray. Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Cut biscuits in half. Place in pan in 1 layer. Pour butter evenly over biscuits. Sprinkle sugars evenly over biscuits and butter. Pour ice cream evenly. Bake for 30 minutes. Cool slightly. Turn pan over onto serving platter. ; name: vinegar pie ; ingredients: sugar, egg yolks, vinegar, flour, water, butter, lemon extract, pie shells ; preparation:In medium saucepan mix together sugar, beaten egg yolks, vinegar, flour and water. Cook over medium heat stirring constantly until thick. Remove from heat. Add lemon extract and butter. Continue to stir until butter has completely melted. Pour into baked pie crust. Top with meringue, made with left over egg whites, and bake in 350f pre-heated oven until golden brown. Let cool and serve. ; name: buffalo meatballs gravy ; ingredients: ground buffalo meat, egg, ritz cracker, onion, garlic powder, pepper, beefy mushroom soup, flour ; preparation:Combine the first 6 ingredients. Mix well. Using a large scoop,. Scoop into balls and place on large jellyroll pan. Bake at 350 for 20 minutes. In a large skillet, combine the soup and flour. Cook over medium heat until thickened. Add cooked meatballs, and simmer 10 minutes. Serve over mashed potatoes, or egg noodles. ; name: real deal sloppy joes remember these so good ; ingredients: canola oil, onion, lean ground beef, ketchup, chili powder, garlic powder, hot red pepper flakes, red wine vinegar, hamburger buns ; preparation:Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the onion and saut, stirring frequently, until softened and translucent, about 3 minutes. Add the ground beef to the skillet, breaking it up well with a spoon, and cook until the meat has lost its raw color, about 10 minutes, stirring frequently to break up any clumps. Pour off and discard any juices and fat that have accumulated in the skillet. Add 2 cups ketchup, the chili powder, garlic powder, pepper flakes, and salt and stir well to mix. Cook, uncovered, until the meat is cooked through and the flavors are blended, about 20 minutes, stirring frequently. The mixture should be loose, with enough sauce to bind the meat. If it gets too dry, add more ketchup or a bit of water and cover the skillet during the last 5 minutes of cooking. Stir in a splash of vinegar, then remove the skillet from the heat. Taste and adjust the seasoning, then spoon onto hamburger buns and serve. ; name: chocolate chewy squares ; ingredients: graham cracker crumbs, chocolate chips, butterscotch chips, walnuts, sweetened condensed milk ; preparation:Combine all ingredients in large bowl, mixing well. Using no-stick cooking spray, lightly grease 13x9 pan and then spread mixture evenly into pan. Bake at 350 for 25 minutes. Remove from oven and let cool completely before cutting into squares. Important to cool completely so it sets up firmly before cutting. ; name: ting a lings ; ingredients: whole wheat cereal, peanuts, butterscotch chips, chocolate chips ; preparation:

name: quick chili croutons ; ingredients: garlic butter croutons, olive oil flavored cooking spray, paprika, chili powder, ground cumin ; preparation:Place croutons in a large heavy-duty, zip-top plastic bag. Coat croutons with cooking spray. Combine paprika, chili powder, and cumin in a small bowl. Sprinkle over croutons in bag. Shake bag to coat. ; name: peanut brittle ; ingredients: sugar, white corn syrup, dry roasted salted peanut, butter, vanilla, baking soda ; preparation:In 2 quart microwave safe bowl stir together the sugar & corn syrup. Microwave on high for 4 minutes. Stir in peanuts and microwave on high for another 4 minutes. Add butter & vanilla, stirring well. Microwave on high for additional 2 minutes. Stir in baking soda until light and foamy. Quickly pour mixture onto a lightly greased cookie sheet or slab marble. Let cool for 1 hour - break into pieces and store in tight container. ; name: chocolate caramel squares ; ingredients: butter, brown sugar, all-purpose flour, rolled oats, sweetened condensed milk, dark chocolate chips, white chocolate chips ; preparation:Add all ingredients for crust, except butter, in a mixing bowl. With pastry blender, cut in butter until mixture is crumbly. Press the mixture into an 8-inch square cake pan. Bake in a preheated oven at 350f for about 25 minutes or until just golden and firm. Cool in the pan. Place ingredients for caramel filling in saucepan and heat over low heat, stirring until sugar is dissolved. Bring to a boil over low heat and boil very gently for 3 to 4 minutes, stirring constantly until thickened. Pour the caramel filling over cookie base and allow to set. Melt the dark chocolate chips and spread over the caramel, allow to cool and set. When dark chocolate is set, melt the white chocolate and drizzle over top. Cut into squares and enjoy. Dh suggested to use a pizza cutter to cut bar cookies and it works like a charm. ; name: asparagus with basil parmesan butter ; ingredients: asparagus, butter, parmesan cheese, fresh basil, garlic, fresh lemon juice ; preparation:In a large pot of boiling water, cook the asparagus until just crisp tender, about 3 minutes. Arrange on a broilerproof platter. Preheat broiler. Beat butter in a medium bowl until fluffy. Beat in cheese, basil, garlic and lemon juice. Season. Drop butter mixture by teaspoonfuls over asparagus. Broil until topping browns, about 3 minutes. Be careful not to burn. Serve hot. ; name: easy pleasing meatballs ; ingredients: ground beef, onion, garlic cloves, breadcrumbs, italian seasoning, egg, milk ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Line a large glass baking dish with foil,. Put the ground beef in a large bowl and add the onion and garlic, knead together, add bread crumbs and italian seasoning -- mix all together. Add the egg and milk -- knead together well with hands --. Form pieces of meat into 1 inch balls, place in baking dish -- bake for about 20-30 minutes --. I usually put them in a large pan on the stove and cover with spaghetti sauce for a few minutes at medium heat, but thats optional. ; name: incredible granola bars ; ingredients: rolled oats, oat bran, brown sugar, sunflower oil, honey, salt, cocoa nibs, dried banana ; preparation:Mix all ingredients thoroughly,. Press into an oiled 9 inch square tray,. And bake for 20-25 minutes at 350 degrees. Allow to cool before cutting into bars. Will keep for weeks stored in airtight container in fridge. Also freezes well. ; name: anita s wonderfully easy chicken ; ingredients: boneless skinless chicken breasts, sliced mushrooms, progresso italian-style fine bread crumbs, swiss cheese, condensed cream of mushroom soup, white wine ; preparation:Roll the chicken breasts in the bread crumbs and place in a pyrex baking pan, being sure they fit without overlapping. Cover each breast with a slice of swiss cheese. Sprinkle mushrooms over, if used. Mix together the wine and cream of mushroom soup and pour over all. Bake 50 minutes in a preheated 350 degree f. Oven. ; name: chicken reuben sandwiches in a crock pot ; ingredients: boneless skinless chicken breast halves, sauerkraut, swiss cheese, thousand island dressing, pumpernickel bread ; preparation:

name: baked barbecue chicken ; ingredients: broiler-fryer chickens, onion, ketchup, brown sugar, worcestershire sauce, lemon juice, liquid smoke ; preparation:Preheat oven to 375f. Place chicken pieces in 13x9-inch baking dish coated with nonstick cooking spray. Arrange onion slices over top. In small saucepan, combine ketchup, brown sugar, worcestershire sauce, lemon juice and liquid smoke. Heat over medium heat 2 to 3 minutes or until sugar dissolves. Pour over chicken. Bake chicken 1 hour or until juices run clear. Discard onion slices. Let stand 10 minutes before serving. ; name: garlic shrimp with basil tomatoes ; ingredients: grape tomatoes, fresh basil, kosher salt, fresh ground black pepper, olive oil, raw shrimp, garlic ; preparation:If using larger than cherry or grape tomatoes, cut them in segments about the same size as your shrimp. In a medium bowl, combine tomatoes & basil. Season with salt & pepper. Set aside. Rinse, drain & pat shrimp dry. Season with salt & pepper. Heat a large saute pan or skillet over medium heat. When hot, add shrimp and saute for about 1 minute. Add garlic, and continue to saute shrimp until pink and cooked through. Add shrimp and garlic to bowl of tomatoes & basil, and toss well. May be served hot. ; name: eggless chocolate souffle ; ingredients: nestle sweetened condensed milk, cocoa powder, vochelle cocoa cooking chocolate, walnuts, gelatin, milk, nestle cream, hot water, cream, chocolate ; preparation:Dissolve gelatine in hot water. Add cocoa powder to one cup of milk and heat for 5-7 minutes. To make a smooth paste. Add the gelatine, walnuts, chocolate, the other cup of milk and the condensed milk. Mix very nicely and keep aside. Whisk cream in another bowl and fold in the chocolate mixture. Serve chilled with cream and grated chocolate. ; name: potato soup with ham and cheese ; ingredients: potatoes, water, ham, milk, cheddar cheese, salt, pepper, red pepper flakes, butter, flour ; preparation:Boil potatoes until tender enough to eat but not to soft. Drain potatoes and reserve the liquid. In a large pot melt butter. When the butter is melted add the flour and whisk to combine until smooth. Add the milk whisking to combine until smooth. Add 2 cups of the potato cooking water. Add the ham and cook for 5 minutes. Add the cheese and stir till melted. Add the potatoes, salt, pepper, and red pepper. Place on the lowest heat and let set for 5 to 10 minutes for the flavors to blend. Serve with crusty bread and maybe a salad. ; name: george washington pie dessert ; ingredients: graham cracker crumbs, butter, cream cheese, powdered sugar, walnuts, cool whip, cherry pie filling ; preparation:Mix the melted butter with the graham crackers and press into a 8x8 dish. Bake for 8 minutes in a 350 degree oven. Cool. Cream the cream cheese and powdered sugar and spread over the cooled crust, sprinkle with chopped nuts and spread the cool whip over this and chill for about an hour. Spread the cherry pie filling over the cool whip. Keep refrigerated. Will keep several days in the refrigerator. ; name: cheesy chicken casserole ; ingredients: chicken stove top stuffing mix, cooked chicken, condensed cream of chicken soup, velveeta cheese ; preparation:Prheat oven to 350 degrees. Prepare stuffing mix as directed on package. Stir in remaining ingredients. Mix well. Spoon into 2 quart baking dish. Bake 30 minutes or until heated through. ; name: squash zucchini and potatoes ; ingredients: squash, zucchini, potatoes, salt, pepper ; preparation:Put water in pot add potatoes. Cook potatoes until a little soft. Add vegetables and cook until desired texture of veges. Olive oil or butter can be spread on top. Salt and pepper to desired taste. Since i am always watching my weight i do not put butter or olive oil on top only salt and pepper. ; name: hoppin john soup ; ingredients: olive oil, onion, kielbasa, black-eyed peas, navy beans, brown rice, chicken broth, garlic powder, cayenne pepper, thyme ; preparation:

name: lemon pepper veggies ; ingredients: fresh broccoli florets, cauliflower florets, fresh carrot, water, butter, lemon-pepper seasoning, garlic powder ; preparation:In a microwave-safe bowl, combine the broccoli, cauliflower, carrots and water. Cover and microwave on high for 4-7 minutes, or until crisp-tender. Drain. Combine the rest of the ingredients. Drizzle over vegetables and toss to coat. ; name: blueberry muffins from the loveless cafe ; ingredients: unsalted butter, sugar, salt, eggs, vanilla extract, unbleached all-purpose flour, baking powder, blueberries, buttermilk ; preparation:Preheat the oven to 375 degrees. Whisk the butter, sugar, salt, eggs, and vanilla together in a bowl. Sift the flour and baking powder into the butter mixture. Stir. Add the berries to the mix and gently fold a few times. Add the buttermilk and mix gently. Scoop out the dought into paper-lined muffin pans. Sprinkle with additional sugar if desired, and bake for 20 to 35 minutes, depending on the size of your muffin pans. This will make 12 standard sized muffins or 6 texas sized muffins. ; name: egg free no bake pineapple cheese cake ; ingredients: graham cracker crust, cream cheese, cool whip, crushed pineapple, sugar ; preparation:Drain the pineapple squeeze the excess juice off and let it drain. Cream the cream cheese in a mixing bowl,. Then mix in the coolwhip, pineapple and sugar. When well mixed pour into the grahm cracker crust. Put in the refrigerator to chill. Total time to mix is 10 miniute and chill varies depending on how cold your fridge is, 30 minute. ; name: portabellas in pita ; ingredients: portabella mushrooms, pita bread rounds, olive oil, garlic cloves, fresh lemon juice, salt, mesclun, extra virgin olive oil, white wine vinegar ; preparation:Place the mushrooms, gill side up, on a baking sheet. Whisk together olive oil, garlic, lemon juice, and salt. Pour mixture over mushrooms, making sure it pools up over gills. Allow to marinate for 30 minutes, turning a few times during marination and brushing the tops with marinade. While mushrooms are marinating, whisk together ingredients for vinaigrette and set aside. Oil grill or skillet and cook mushrooms about 5 minutes per side, or until the have become slightly crispy. Toss mesclun with vinaigrette and set aside. Serve two mushrooms in warm pita bread or nane lavash, along with some dressed meslun. ; name: baked leeks with cheese and yogurt ; ingredients: butter, leeks, eggs, fresh goat cheese, plain yogurt, parmesan cheese, fresh white breadcrumbs, salt & freshly ground black pepper ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350f. Butter a shallow ovenproof dish. Trim the leeks, cut a slit from the top to bottom and rinse well under cold water. Place the leeks in a saucepan of water, brind to a boil, and simmer gently for 6-8 minutes, until just tender. Remove and drain well using sloted spoon. Arrange in the prepared dish. Beat the eggs with the goat cheese, yogurt, and half the parmesan cheese. Season well with salt and pepper. Pour the cheese and yogurt mixture over the leeks. Mix the breadcrumbs with the remaining parmesan cheese, and sprinkle over the sauce. Back for 35-40 minutes, until the top is crisp and golden brown. ; name: orange soak cake ; ingredients: orange cake mix, water, vegetable oil, eggs, powdered sugar, orange juice, butter ; preparation:Just add 1 tbs of orange extract and 1 tbs grated orange peel to the batter before mixing preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Grease and flour a 13x9-inch pan. Prepare and bake cake mix according to package directions. While cake is baking, combine powdered sugar, orange juice, melted butter, and water in a medium bowl. When cake is done, remove from oven and immediately poke holes in top with a fork or toothpick. Pour glaze slowly over top of hot cake, allowing it to soak in. Cool completely on a wire rack. ; name: honey nut berry berry parfait ; ingredients: frozen strawberries, frozen blueberries, splenda sugar substitute, sugar-free non-fat vanilla yogurt, honey nut cheerios ; preparation:Mix berries with splenda in a small bowl. Defrost berries slightly. Layer half of the yogurt, berries, cereal in serving glass. Repeat. Enjoy. ; name: favorite pumpkin pie ; ingredients: unbaked pastry shells, fresh pumpkin, milk, egg yolks, egg whites, salt, clove, cinnamon, sugar ; preparation:

name: easy peanut blossoms ; ingredients: sweetened condensed milk, smooth peanut butter, biscuit mix, vanilla extract, white sugar, hershey chocolate kiss ; preparation:Mix milk and peanut butter until smooth. Add biscuit mix and vanilla. Shape into 1 inch balls. Roll in sugar. Place 2 inches apart on ungreased pan. Bake at 375 degrees for 6-8 minutes or until light brown. While cookies are baking, unwrap hersheys. Press kisses into center as soon as cookies are out of oven. ; name: basil garlic butter ; ingredients: unsalted butter, basil, garlic, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Place the butter in a mixing bowl. Add basil, garlic, and cheese and whip with an electric mixer until mixture is smooth and evenly blended. Add salt to taste. Pack butter into four crocks. Allow flavors to blend for at least 4 hours before serving. Can be frozen for up to 3 months. ; name: hovis granary hand baked bread ; ingredients: bread flour, salt, butter, yeast, warm water ; preparation:In a large bowl mix together the flour salt, butter and yeast. Stir in the water and mix into a soft dough. Turn out onto a floured surface and knead well for 10 minutes by hand or 5 in a electric mixer fitted with a dough hook. Let the dough rise for 1 hour or until double in size, covered and in a warm place. When the dough has risen shape as required and place in a greased tin or tray. Cover with a polythene and leave in a warm place until doubled in size. Uncover and bake in an ove, pre-heated to 230c, 450f, gas mark 8, for around 30-35 minutes. Baked loaf should sound hollow when tapped underneath. For a soft, moist crust remove from the oven and wrap in a clean te-towel to cool. ; name: broiled pineapple bagel ; ingredients: bagel, cream cheese, cinnamon, sugar, canned pineapple ; preparation:Combine the sugar and cinnamon together in small bowl. Split the bagel. Spread each half of the bagel with 1 tbsp cream cheese, and top with pineapple slice. Sprinkle with cinnamon-sugar mixture. Broil 1 minute. ; name: rice pilaf with mushrooms ; ingredients: butter, onion, mushroom, salt & freshly ground black pepper, long-grain white rice, low sodium chicken broth ; preparation:Melt butter in a large flameproof casserole and cook the onion over low heat for 5 minutes. Add the mushrooms, salt and pepper and continue cooking 5 minutes longer or until the mushrooms release their liquid. Turn up the heat and cook, stirring constantly, until the moisture in the mushrooms evaporates. Add the rice and stir it for a few minutes or until the grains are transparent. Pour in the stock or stock mixed with water and bring to a boil. Lower the heat, cover the pan and cook the rice for 20 minutes or until all the liquid is absorbed. Transfer half the rice to a plastic container. Serve remaining rice at once. ; name: spinach and feta pasta with olives ; ingredients: fusilli, spinach, garlic cloves, olive oil, reduced-fat feta cheese, pine nuts, nutmeg, black olives, salt and pepper ; preparation:Boil the pasta according to pack instructions. Meanwhile, boil a kettle of water, then slowly pour over the spinach in a colander until it wilts. Shake off the excess water, then put the spinach into a food processor. Add the garlic, oil, half of the cheese and most of the pine nuts to the processor with the spinach, then pulse to a pesto-like sauce. Season with the nutmeg and salt and pepper. Stir through the hot, drained pasta and serve topped with the olives and the remaining crumbled cheese and pine nuts. ; name: creamy cauliflower soup ww friendly ; ingredients: olive oil, leeks, celery, chicken broth, cauliflower, half-and-half, nutmeg, salt, pepper, cheddar cheese ; preparation:Clean and chop the leeks and celery. Heat oil in a large nonstick sauce pan, over medium heat. Add the leeks and celery, stir frequently, cook until softened, not browned, about 4 minutes. Add the broth and cauliflower, bring to boil. Cover and simmer until the cauliflower is tender, about 10-15 minutes. Remove from heat. In batches or with a blender stick, puree to desired texture. You may want to spoon out and reserve some cauliflower pieces for added texture. Stir in half & half and nutmeg and blend. Top with grated cheddar cheese. ; name: herb zucchini and lemon pasta ; ingredients: rotini pasta, light butter, red onion, zucchini, parmesan cheese, tomatoes, lemon juice, dried basil leaves, salt, pepper ; preparation:

name: artichoke tomato bruschetta ; ingredients: roma tomato, garlic, marinated artichoke hearts, parmesan cheese, red onion, mayonnaise, salt, fresh ground black pepper, french baguette, mozzarella cheese ; preparation:Set oven to broiler heat. In a bowl mix together chopped tomatoes with garlic, chopped artichokes, parmesan cheese, chopped onion and mayonnaise. Mix well to combine. Season with salt and black pepper to taste. Top each slice of bread with equal amounts of the tomato mixture. Place the slices onto a large baking sheet. Broil for about 2 minutes or until bubbly and lightly browned. Sprinkle lightly with finely shredded mozzarealla cheese if desired. ; name: meemaw s sweet cornbread ; ingredients: self-rising cornmeal, sour cream, cream-style corn, eggs, oil ; preparation:Put oil in large cast iron skillet. Place in oven, and turn oven on to 400 degrees. Allow skillet and oil to preheat to 400 degrees along with the oven. While skillet heats in oven, mix together corn meal, sour cream, cream-style corn, and eggs. When oven is preheated, remove hot skillet and carefully pour mix into sizzling oil. Shake handle to level out the batter. Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until golden brown. Cut and serve. ; name: ww southwestern frittata ; ingredients: olive oil, eggs, egg whites, salt, pepper, onion, red bell pepper, green bell pepper, reduced-fat cheddar cheese, salsa ; preparation:Heat the olive oil in a medium sized skillet. In a small bowl, beat the eggs and whites, salt, and pepper. Saute the onion and bell peppers about 5 minutes. Slowly pour the mixture from the bowl into the skillet and sprinkle with cheese. Gently stir until the mixture becomes slightly firm. Then turn over the frittata and cook the other side about 2 minutes longer. After taking the frittata from the skillet, cut it in half, and roll it like a burrito. Serve with salsa. ; name: greens and apples ; ingredients: soy margarine, granny smith apples, frozen apple juice concentrate, greens, salt and pepper ; preparation:In large saucepan, melt margarine over medium heat. Add apples and cook, stirring, until lightly browned. Add remaining ingredients. Cover and cook, stirring occasionally, until greens are tender. Serve immediately. ; name: virginia peanut soup ; ingredients: condensed cream of chicken soup, water, milk, crunchy peanut butter ; preparation:Empty soup into medium saucepan. Slowly whisk in water and milk until mixture is smooth. Add peanut butter. Cook and stir over low heat until warm and well blended. Do not bring to a boil, mixture will curdle. ; name: healthy banana cookies ; ingredients: bananas, dates, rolled oats, oil, vanilla extract ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In large bowl, mash the bananas, stir in oats, dates, oil and vanilla. Mix well and allow to sit for 15 minutes. Drop by tspfuls onto ungreased cookie sheet. Bake for 15-20 minutes. In combining the ingredients, i personally use my food processor. I just toss everything in and let it mix. ; name: praline grahams ; ingredients: graham crackers, butter, sugar, pecans ; preparation:Seperate each cracker into four sections. Arrange in a jellyroll pan with edges touching. Melt butter in a saucepan. Stir in sugar and pecans. Bring to a boil. Cook 3 minutes, stirring frequently. Spread mixture evenly over graham crackers. Bake at 300 for 12 minutes. Remove from pan and cool on wax paper. ; name: mum s monday macaroni ; ingredients: butter, onion, elbow macaroni, tomatoes, water, salt, pepper, breadcrumbs ; preparation:

name: grandma s potato puffs ; ingredients: mashed potatoes, flour, baking powder, salt, eggs, oil, maple syrup ; preparation:Beat egg yolks until creamy. Add mashed potatoes and mix well. Sift flour, salt and baking powder. Add flour mixture to potatoes. Beat egg whites until stiff. Fold egg whites into mixture. Drop by teaspoonfuls into hot grease or oil. Serve with syrup while hot. ; name: georgia hash ; ingredients: vegetable oil, onion, green bell pepper, red bell pepper, corned beef, frozen hash browns, cajun seasoning ; preparation:In electric frying pan or large skillet saute onions and peppers until onions soften. Add corned beef. Continue to cook until cubes fall apart. Add frozen hash browns. Add seasoning if desired. Cook, stirring often until potatoes are done and start to brown. ; name: ultimate great northern beans ; ingredients: great northern beans, chicken broth, diced tomatoes with green chilies, white onion, cooking oil, pork jowl, salt, black pepper, water ; preparation:Soak the beans in cold water overnight. Make sure that there is twice as much water as beans because they will swell up. In a large cooking pot, pour in the cooking oil and toss in the smoked jowl pieces. Stir and allow them to sizzle over medium heat for 5 or 6 minutes. After they brown a bit, deglaze the pot with about 4 ounces of the chicken broth. Add the onion and allow to simmer until the onion is tender, stirring often. Rinse the beans in fresh water a final time and, after draining, add them, plus all the remaining ingredients into the pot. This should include the 48 ounces of water listed in the ingredients. Boil, covered, over low heat until beans are tender, stirring occasionally. Serve with cornbread, fried potatoes, eggs and biscuits. If you wish, you can use chunks of ham or bacon instead of pork jowl. ; name: coffee almond macaroons ; ingredients: sweetened condensed milk, coffee, vanilla, flaked coconut, slivered almonds ; preparation:In a big bowl, mix condensed milk with coffee and vanilla. Stir in coconut and almonds. Mix well. Drop spoonfuls onto wax paper-lined cookie sheets. Bake on middle rack of preheated 325 degree oven, 10-12 minutes or until browned around the edges. Remove immediately to wire racks. Cool completely. ; name: brown sugar grilled salmon ; ingredients: salmon fillets, lemon pepper, salt, garlic powder, soy sauce, brown sugar, water, vegetable oil ; preparation:Sprinkle fillets with salt, lemon pepper and garlic powder to taste. Combine soy sauce, brown sugar, water and oil. Marinate fish in soy mixture for 2 hours or more. Remove from marinade. Grill for 7 minutes per side. ; name: vanilla almond rice krispies treats ; ingredients: margarine, mini marshmallows, crispy rice cereal, real vanilla extract, almond extract ; preparation:Melt margarine in large non-stick pan over medium-low heat. Add marshmallows and stir until melted and smooth. Turn off flame. Stir in extracts. Fold in cereal and continue folding until well coated. Spray 13 x 9 pan with cooking spray and press mixture into pan. Cool and cut into squares. ; name: fourth of july blueberry softbakes ; ingredients: all-purpose flour, baking powder, ground cinnamon, unsalted butter, raw sugar, sour cream, fresh blueberries, dried cranberries ; preparation:Preheat the oven to 375. Line two baking sheets with baking parchment. Sift together the flour, baking powder and cinnamon into a large mixing bowl. Add the diced butter and rub in with your fingers until the mixture resembles fine breadcrumbs. Stir in the raw sugar. Add the sour cream, blueberries and cranberries and stir just until combined. Spoon ten mounds of the mixture onto the prepared baking sheets. Sprinkle with the extra raw sugar and bake for about 20 minutes, or until golden and firm in the center. Serve warm. ; name: no egg no dairy pierogie dough ; ingredients: all-purpose flour, salt, oil, water ; preparation:

name: chilled peach soup with riesling ; ingredients: riesling wine, whole cloves, cinnamon stick, bay leaves, brown sugar, peaches, orange, lemon, heavy cream, fresh lemon juice ; preparation:In a large saucepan, combine the riesling, cloves, cinnamon stick, bay leaves, and brown sugar. Bring to a boil. Add the peaches, reduce heat and let simmer for 20 minutes. Add the orange and lemon slices. Continue cooking for 5 minutes. Remove the cloves, cinnamon stick, bay leaves, orange and lemon slices from the soup. Puree the soup in a blender or food processor. Strain. Chill in the refrigerator. When the soup is chilled, add the cream and lemon juice. ; name: frosty fruity smoothie ; ingredients: blueberries, unsweetened sliced peaches, milk, vanilla yogurt, honey, ground cinnamon, ground nutmeg ; preparation:Combine blueberries or huckleberries, peaches and milk in a blender. Cover and process on high until smooth. Add yogurt, honey, cinnamon and nutmeg. Process until well blended. Serve immediately. ; name: jolean s baked spam loaf ; ingredients: spam, cloves, brown sugar, apple cider vinegar, prepared yellow mustard, unsalted butter, water ; preparation:Lay both spam loaves side by side in glass 8 x 4 inch loaf pan. Insert 5 cloves into each spam loaf, spaced evenly. Mix remaining ingredients well, and spread this glaze on top of both spam loaves. Bake in a preheated 350 degree oven for 20-25 minutes. Let cool for 5 minutes, slice and remove cloves before serving. ; name: pumpkin tomato cream soup ; ingredients: tomatoes, butter, onion, cooked pumpkin, chicken broth, dry sherry, salt, pepper, dried tarragon, heavy cream ; preparation:In a large pot filled with boiling water, blanch tomatoes for 10 seconds. With a slotted spoon, transfer tomatoes to colander to cool. Peel, seed and quarter tomatoes. In a medium frying pan, melt butter over medium heat. Add onion and cook, stirring occasionally, until golden, 4-5 minutes. In a blender or food processor, puree tomatoes, onion, pumpkin and broth until smooth. Transfer to a large saucepan. Add sherry, salt, pepper and tarragon. Cover and simmer, stirring occasionally, 5 minutes. Add cream and heat through, about 3 minutes. Serve hot. ; name: slow cooked bbq meat oven or slow cooker ; ingredients: country-style boneless pork ribs, barbecue sauce, white onion, garlic cloves, honey, salt and pepper ; preparation:Preheat oven to 280f. In large baking dish place down 2 long pieces aluminum foil, criss cross. Put meat on foil pour bbq sauce on top drizzle honey over it. Sprinkle with garlic. Place onions all over. Salt and pepper it. Wrap up foil and seal it well. Cook for about 6 hours. ; name: chive mashed potatoes ; ingredients: potatoes, cream cheese, milk, fresh chives, salt, ground black pepper ; preparation:Boil potatoes for 10-12 minutes or until fork-tender. Drain. Return potatoes to pan. Mash potatoes, adding cream cheese until it is blended. Stir in milk, chives, and seasonings. Heat on medium heat until just warmed through, then serve at once. ; name: banana maple flip ; ingredients: banana, plain yogurt, egg, maple syrup ; preparation:Put the peeled and halved banana, thick yogurt, egg and maple syrup in a food processor or blender. Add 2 tbs chilled water. Process the ingredients constantly for about 2 minutes or until the mix turns a really pale creamy color and has a nice frothy texture. Pour the banana and maple flip into a tall, chilled glass and serve immediately. Decorate the glasses with an orange or lime slice, if desired. ; name: cream cheese scrambled eggs 309cals per serve ; ingredients: eggs, low-fat cream cheese, chives, milk, salt and pepper, vegetable oil ; preparation:

name: glazed chicken wings ; ingredients: chicken wings, sugar-free honey, splenda granular, soy sauce, oil, garlic cloves, no-sugar-added ketchup ; preparation:Cut the chicken wings into drummettes. Season them with salt and pepper and put them in your slow cooker. In a bowl, stir together the honey, splenda, soy sauce, oil, garlic, and ketchup. Drizzle the mixture over the wings and stir them to coat. Cover the slow cooker, set it to low, and let it cook for 6-8 hours. ; name: smoky sweet pepper shrimp ; ingredients: butter, large shrimp, sweet pepper flakes, white wine ; preparation:Melt butter in large nonstick skillet on low heat. Add shrimp. Cook and stir on medium heat 5 minutes or just until shrimp turn pink. Stir in seasoning blend and wine until shrimp are well coated. Serve over cooked rice, if desired. ; name: mashed potato and turkey soup ; ingredients: butter, yellow onion, button mushrooms, carrot, dried thyme, low sodium chicken broth, mashed potatoes, cooked turkey, salt & freshly ground black pepper ; preparation:In a large saucepan over medium-high heat, melt butter. Add the onion, mushrooms, carrot, and thyme, and saute until the onion is just translucent, about 4-5 minutes. Add the broth and mashed potatoes. Stir until potatoes are mostly dissolved and broth is smooth. Add the turkey and bring to a simmer. Reduce heat to medium-low and cook, stirring occasionally, until heated through, about 10 minutes. Season to taste with salt and pepper. ; name: shredded brussels sprouts with bacon and onions ; ingredients: bacon, yellow onion, salt, water, dijon mustard, brussels sprout, cider vinegar ; preparation:Cook bacon in a large skillet over medium heat until crisp. Drain on paper towels, then crumble. Add onion and salt to the drippings in the pan and cook over medium heat, stirring often, until tender and browned. Add water and mustard, scraping up any browned bits, then add brussels sprouts and cook, stirring often, until tender. Stir in vinegar and top with the crumbled bacon. ; name: baked chicken with yogurt crust peaches ; ingredients: herb-seasoned stuffing cubes, skinless chicken breasts, plain yogurt, peaches, cinnamon sugar ; preparation:Preheat oven to 375 degrees. In a food processor or blender, reduce the stuffing mix to coarse crumbs. Pour them onto a sheet of wax paper. Coat one piece of chicken breast with yogurt as thickly as possible, then dip it into the crumbs to coat. Lay the chicken in an oiled baking dish large enough to hold chicken and peaches in one layer. Repeat with the remaining chicken. Surround the chicken with the peach halves, cut side down. Sprinkle the peaches with cinnamon sugar. Bake for 20 minutes, or until the breasts are just cooked through but not dry. ; name: ham and peas casserole ; ingredients: milk, breadcrumbs, cheese, butter, onion, parsley, eggs, ham, peas ; preparation:Put peas and ham in a buttered casserole. In a saucepan, heat milk, add crumbs. Add cheese, butter, onion and parsley. Add beaten eggs. Pour sauce over peas and ham. Bake for 45 minutes at 325 degrees. ; name: barbecued pork quesadillas ; ingredients: barbecued pork, barbecue sauce, fresh cilantro, green onions, flour tortillas, four-cheese mexican blend cheese, butter, sour cream, green onion ; preparation:Stir together first 4 ingredients. Spoon pork mixture evenly on 1 side of each tortilla. Sprinkle with cheese. Fold tortillas in half, pressing gently to seal. Spread butter on both sides of quesadillas. Heat a large nonstick or cast-iron skillet over medium heat, and cook quesadillas 2 to 3 minutes on each side or until browned. Cut each quesadilla in half for main-dish servings or in quarters for appetizer servings. Serve with desired toppings. Garnish, if desired. ; name: creamy baked apples ; ingredients: granny smith apples, butter, cinnamon sugar, flour, sugar, milk, vanilla, cinnamon, nutmeg ; preparation:

name: peanut butter and banana oat cookies ; ingredients: bananas, peanut butter, rolled oats, oat flour, raisins, butter, salt, vanilla extract ; preparation:Combine all ingredients in a large bowl. Let sit for 30 minutes. Preheat oven to 350. Drop by spoonfuls onto parchment lined or lightly greased baking sheet. Bake for 15-20 minutes until lightly golden. ; name: cinnamon chip applesauce cake ; ingredients: butter, sugar, eggs, vanilla, applesauce, all-purpose flour, baking soda, cinnamon baking chips, powdered sugar, water ; preparation:Heat oven to 350. Beat butter and sugar in a large bowl on until well blended. Beat in eggs, vanilla, and applesauce. Combine flour, baking soda and salt and add to butter mixture, beating until well blended stir in cinnamon chips. Pour into two loaf pans. Bake for 60 minutes or until wooden pick inserted in center comes out clean cool completely in pan. Drizzle with glaze or wait until the cake is sliced and then drizzle with glaze to maximize the glazed area. ; name: extra creamy fluffy white frosting ; ingredients: crisco shortening, salt, vanilla, icing sugar, heavy whipping cream ; preparation:In a bowl using an electric mixer, beat together the shortening, salt, vanilla and half of the icing sugar. Beat until very smooth. Add in whipping cream. Beat well. Add in remaining icing sugar to desired texture. Beat until fluffy and creamy. ; name: seasoned yukon gold wedges ; ingredients: yukon gold potatoes, olive oil, dry breadcrumbs, paprika, salt, dried oregano, dried thyme, ground cumin, pepper, cayenne pepper ; preparation:In a large bowl, toss potatoes with oil. Combine the remaining ingredients. Sprinkle over potatoes and toss to coat. Arrange potatoes in a single layer pan coated with non-stick cooking spray. Bake, uncovered, at 425 for 40-45 min or until tender, stirring once. ; name: blackberry muffins ; ingredients: all-purpose flour, baking powder, salt, egg, brown sugar, sugar, fat free sour cream, buttermilk, butter, blackberries ; preparation:Preheat the oven to 350 degrees f and spray a muffin tin with nonstick spray or use paper liners. Rinse the frozen berries and let them drain in a sieve. In a mixing bowl, whisk the flour, baking powder, and salt to evenly distribute. In another bowl, beat the egg, then whisk in the sugar, and sour cream. Whisk until the mixture is throughly combined then add in the buttermilk and melted butter. Scatter the blackberries in the dry ingredients and then add the wet ingredients. Gently fold to combine, there should not be large pockets of flour but streaks of flour are okay. Do not overmix the batter. Divide the batter into your muffin tin with a large spoon or ice cream scoop and bake until a toothpick or skewer inserted into the center of the muffins comes out clean, about 20 - 25 minutes. Remove them from the pan and cool on a rack. ; name: bananacran bread ; ingredients: bananas, frozen cranberries, butter, sugar, eggs, flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt, cinnamon ; preparation:Beat together butter, sugar and eggs until creamy. Add bananas and cranberries. Combine the remaining dry ingredients in a separate bowl. Add to the wet ingredients and stir until well mixed. Pour into a large greased loaf pan and bake in a 350 oven for an hour. Remove and cool for 20 minutes in the pan before removing. ; name: healthy berry blue muffins ; ingredients: bisquick baking mix, skim milk, sugar, applesauce, liquid egg substitute, frozen blueberries ; preparation:Heat oven to 400 degrees. Grease 12 muffin cups or use muffin papers. Stir all ingredients except blueberries together in large bowl til moistened. Stir in blueberries. Divide evenly among cups. Bake 13-18 minutes or until golden brown. ; name: vegan lemon curd ; ingredients: lemon juice, water, granulated sugar, cornstarch, salt, soymilk, margarine ; preparation:

name: caramel coffee cake ; ingredients: refrigerated buttermilk biscuits, margarine, brown sugar, almonds ; preparation:Preheat oven to 375f. Split each biscuit in two, rolling into small balls. Layer rolled biscuit pieces in a bundt pan. Combine margarine and brown sugar in small sauce pan. Bring to a boil and allow to boil for 2 minutes. Pour caramel mixture over biscuits and bake for approximately 40-45 minutes, or until golden brown. Carefully invert bundt pan onto a serving dish. Sprinkle nuts on top and serve immediately. ; name: peach sauce for the microwave fat free ; ingredients: water, white sugar, molasses, lemon juice, vanilla, fresh peaches ; preparation:Peel, pit, and slice the peaches. In a microwave safe dish with a lid, mix all the ingredients but the peaches. Microwave on high for 6 minutes or until boiling. Add the peaches and let it sit. Serve cold. ; name: sausage meatloaf oamc ; ingredients: lean ground beef, ground sausage, celery, onion, saltines, eggs, tomato sauce, brown sugar, prepared mustard, worcestershire sauce ; preparation:Combine ground beef, sausage, celery, onion, saltines, and eggs together and form into 2 loaves. Bake covered at 350 degress fahrenheit in stoneware for 45 to 75 minutes. Drain grease. For the sauce, combine tomato sauce, brown sugar, mustard, and worcestershire sauce. Pour sauce over loaves. Cover meatloaf and cook 15 minutes. Remove cover and cook 10 to 15 minutes. To freeze, just freeze the meat mixture in meal size portions. Thaw it in the refrigerator for a day before cooking. You could make and freeze the sauce too, but i usually mix it up when i cook the meat. ; name: pina colada italian soda ; ingredients: club soda, ice, canned pineapple juice, coconut syrup, cream, maraschino cherry ; preparation:Put ice into a cup. Pour club soda into cup with ice. Next, pour pineapple juice into cup, and stir. Then, pour coconut syrup and cream into cup then stir. Finally, put maraschino cherries on top, and enjoy. ; name: peanut butter breakfast banana split ; ingredients: banana, reduced-fat peanut butter, low-fat banana cream yogurt, grape-nuts cereal ; preparation:Place bana halves in small banana split dish or shallow bowl, with cut sides facing inward. Spread peanut butter evenly over open banana. Spoon yogurt in the middle. Top with cereal. Serve immediatley. ; name: smashed sweet potatoes with dried cranberries ; ingredients: sweet potatoes, apple juice, light brown sugar, salt, fresh ground black pepper, dried sweetened cranberries ; preparation:Add the sweet potato slices to a lightly oiled 4-quart slow cooker. In a small bowl, mix together the apple juice and brown sugar. Pour mixture over the potatoes. Season with salt and pepper. Cover and cook on low for 6 hours, until the potatoes are tender. Right before servings, smash the potatoes with a potato masher until smooth. Fold in the cranberries. Serve hot. ; name: aunt ginny s thanksgiving stuffing ; ingredients: long grain and wild rice blend, onion, celery, butter, cornbread, bread, salt, dried sage, dried thyme, ground black pepper ; preparation:Prepare rice mix according to package directions. Set aside to cool. Cook onion and celery in butter in a large skillet until tender, stirring occasionally. Combine breads, salt, sage, thyme and pepper in a large bowl. Add butter mixture to bowl and mix lightly but thoroughly. Add about two-thirds of the prepared rice mixture to the bowl and toss lightly to combine. Stuff turkey just prior to roasting. Or place stuffing in a greased casserole, cover and bake at 325f for 45 minutes or until heated through. Do not use a sweet-type cornbread. ; name: seared sea scallops with tropical salsa ; ingredients: pineapple, mango, cucumber, red bell pepper, cilantro, fresh lime juice, jalapeno, salt, pepper, sea scallops ; preparation:

name: auntie em s easy chicken pot pie ; ingredients: deep dish pie shells, chunk chicken, mixed vegetables, french fried onion rings, condensed cream of chicken soup, salt ; preparation:Prick bottom of pie shell all over with fork. Bake, uncovered, at 375 for 10 minutes. Combine chicken, vegetables, onion rings, soup, and salt. Fill bottom pie shell with mixture. Place second pie shell on top. Prick with fork in 6 places. Set on a foil-covered oven rack to catch spills. Bake uncovered at 375 for 40 minutes. ; name: rosemary vermouth pork chops ; ingredients: pork loin chops, shallots, dry vermouth, fresh rosemary, salt and pepper ; preparation:Trim fat from edges of pork chops and reserve. In a large skillet over medium heat, rub fat over bottom of skillet to grease well. Discard fat and brown pork chops on both sides. Season with salt and pepper. Add shallots, vermouth and rosemary if using the dried. Bring to a simmer over high heat. Reduce heat to low, add in fresh rosemary if using, cover, and simmer gently for 10-15 minutes, until pork is tender. Skim any fat from juices and pour over pork chops to serve. ; name: pork chops sliven style ; ingredients: pork chops, carrots, salt and black pepper, onion, white wine, garlic cloves, mushrooms, tomatoes, celery ribs ; preparation:Season the chops with salt and pepper and brown in a frying pan. Remove from pan and set aside. In the same pan, cook the rest of the ingredients for 5-10 minutes. Arrange the chops in an oven dish, cover with the vegetable mixture and cook in an preheated oven for about 20 minutes. Serve with boiled or mashed potatoes. ; name: parmesan garlic damper rolls ; ingredients: self-raising flour, butter, parmesan cheese, chives, garlic cloves, water, milk ; preparation:Sift flour into a bowl, rub in butter with finger. Make a well in the centre of the mixture, add combined water & milk all at once reserving about 2 teaspoons. Mix quickly to a soft dough, turn onto a lightly floured surface, knead gently & form into 6 rounds. Arrange on a baking paper lined tray. Cut a cross in the top of each roll & brush with remaining milk mixture, sprinkle with extra cheese. Bake at 220. C for 15-20 mins or until hollow when tapped. ; name: grammy s anise cookies ; ingredients: flour, sugar, ground aniseed, butter ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350. Dump ingredients into a large mixing bowl and mix until well blended. Form walnut sized ball of dough and place 3 inches apart on an ungreased cookie sheet. Use a small glass to flatten the cookie dough. Bake 12 to 15 minutes or until golden. ; name: leah s made up blueberry scones ; ingredients: flour, baking powder, salt, sugar, butter, blueberries, sour cream ; preparation:Mix dry ingredients. Crumble in butter. Add blueberries. Add sourcream. Form into ball, flatten out, cut into ten-twelve pie shape slices, bake at 425 for 15 or so minutes. ; name: kang kong stir fry ; ingredients: kangkong, sesame oil, onion, garlic, ginger, chili pepper, water, soy sauce, sesame seeds, basil leaves ; preparation:Wash, trim and dry kangkong. In a wok or skillet, heat oon sesame oil over medium-high heat. Add chopped onion, chopped garlic cloves and a peeled and minced ginger. Stir-fry for a minute or so until the onion begins to turn translucent. Add the kangkong, finely chopped bird chili pepper, water and soy sauce. Continue to stir-fry just until the kangkong wilts, about another minute. Plate with a garnish of toasted sesame seeds or ripped thai basil leaves. ; name: dawn s special brownies ; ingredients: butter, cocoa, eggs, sugar, flour ; preparation:

name: beet salad with goat cheese and walnuts ; ingredients: beets, fresh basil, ground black pepper, vinaigrette dressing, mixed baby greens, walnuts, semi-soft goat cheese ; preparation:Drain and cut up beets. In a medium bowl, combine cut-up beets, basil, and pepper. Drizzle with 2 tablespoons of the salad dressing. Toss to coat. Arrange greens on 2 salad plates. Sprinkle with remaining dressing. Top with beet mixture, walnuts, and goat cheese. ; name: south of the border chicken ; ingredients: green pepper, boneless skinless chicken breasts, butter, cooked rice, sour cream, salsa, colby ; preparation:Saut green pepper and chicken in butter or oil until lightly browned. Spread the rice in a greased 9x9 pan. Top with peppers and chicken. Mix sour cream and salsa and spoon over chicken. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake 350 degrees for 25-30 minute. ; name: meatloaf quesadillas ; ingredients: tortillas, salsa, meatloaf, mexican cheese, oil ; preparation:Heat oil in a medium sized non-stick skillet over medium high heat. Prepare tortillas in this order, lay tortillas on flat surface, spread 1 tablespoon of salsa on half of tortilla, place half of meatloaf over salsa, top with half of cheese. Fold other half of tortilla over cheese. Repeat with rest of the ingredients for other tortilla. Place both in skillet and lightly brown on both sides, about 10 minutes total, or until desired brownness is reached. Cut each in half. Eat and enjoy. ; name: easy chicken parmesan ; ingredients: pasta sauce, parmesan cheese, boneless skinless chicken breasts, mozzarella cheese ; preparation:Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Pour sauce into 13 by 9 inch baking dish. Stir in 4 tbsp of parmesan cheese. Place the chicken breasts in the sauce, turning to coat them well. Cover with foil and bake for 30 minutes. Remove from oven and uncover. Sprinkle remaining parmesan cheese, and the mozzarella over the chicken breasts, and and continue baking for 5 minutes, or until chicken is cooked through and cheese is melted. Serve with pasta. ; name: black and white turkey chili ; ingredients: vegetable oil, turkey breast tenderloins, onion, anaheim chili, garlic clove, chicken broth, chili powder, tomatoes, black beans, cannellini beans ; preparation:Heat oil in 3-quart saucepan over medium-high heat. Cook turkey, onion, chilies and garlic in oil, stirring occasionally, until turkey is no longer pink in center and onion is tender. Stir in remaining ingredients. Heat to boiling. Reduce heat. Cover and simmer 30 minutes, stirring occasionally. ; name: grilled beer salmon packets ; ingredients: salmon fillets, garlic salt, brown sugar, butter, red onion, beer ; preparation:Preheat grill to medium high heat. Create a large aluminum foil packet for each fish fillet. Place salmon in center of foil. Season with garlic salt and brown sugar. Add pieces of butter, then onions. Carefully, pour some beer into foil packet and seal tightly. Grill for 8-10 minutes. ; name: green bean chicken casserole packets ; ingredients: aluminum foil, boneless skinless chicken breasts, cream of mushroom soup, paprika, frozen green beans, potatoes, margarine ; preparation:Place one chicken breast half on each double layer of foil sheet. Spoon soup over chicken. Sprinkle with paprika. Top with vegetables. Dot with margarine or butter. Fold up foil to form 4 separate packets. Place on cookie sheet and cook at 450 f for 18 to 22 minutes. ; name: bbq pork steak ; ingredients: pork steaks, olive oil, salt, hot paprika, sage, garlic ; preparation:

name: diabetic best ever low fat baked chicken ; ingredients: boneless skinless chicken breasts, breadcrumbs, fat-free parmesan cheese, rosemary, basil, oregano, black pepper, parsley flakes, fat-free margarine ; preparation:Pre-heat oven to 375. Mix bread crumbs, cheese and seasoning in shallow bowl. Dip each chicken breast in melted margarine, then in bread crumb mixture. Place each breast on baking sheet sprayed with nonstick cooking spray. Bake for approximately 20-30 minutes or until golden brown and cooked through. ; name: microwave risotto ; ingredients: onions, extra virgin olive oil, arborio rice, chicken stock, parmigiano-reggiano cheese, salt & freshly ground black pepper, fresh herbs ; preparation:In a microwave safe bowl, combine the chopped onion and shortening. Microwave on high for 4 minutes, stirring once after 2 minutes. Add the rice and stir to coat the grains with the oil. Microwave on high for 4 more minutes. Add the chicken broth and return bowl to microwave. Cook the rice on high for 18 minutes, stirring once half way through. Stir again before the last 2 minutes and check to see that the liquid is almost all absorbed. Take the bowl from the microwave and let the rice absorb the last of the liquid, stirring 2 or 3 times. Add the cheese. Add salt and pepper to taste. Before serving, you may add whatever mined herbs you like, swirl in a pat or butter, or some milk or cream if you like a creamier risotto. ; name: mrs markovitz s sweet noodle kugel ; ingredients: medium noodles, eggs, pineapple tidbits, lemon juice, sugar, vanilla, margarine, salt, corn flake crumbs, dark brown sugar ; preparation:Boil and drain noodles. In a large bowl, mix all ingredients except the topping. Pour into greased rectangular pan. Mix topping and spread in an even layer over kugel. Bake at 350 for 1 hour. ; name: brown sugar grilled salmon ; ingredients: salmon fillets, lemon pepper, salt, garlic powder, soy sauce, brown sugar, water, vegetable oil ; preparation:Sprinkle fillets with salt, lemon pepper and garlic powder to taste. Combine soy sauce, brown sugar, water and oil. Marinate fish in soy mixture for 2 hours or more. Remove from marinade. Grill for 7 minutes per side. ; name: flank steak with teriyaki marinade ; ingredients: flank steaks, garlic, fresh lemon juice, soy sauce, honey, olive oil ; preparation:Make inch slits in one side of the steak with a sharp paring knife. Fill slits with garlic and put steak in a shallow dish large enough to hold it. Whisk together remaining ingredients until emulsified. Pour over steak, turning steak to coat well, let marinate, covered, turning occasionally, for 1 hour at room temperature and up to 10 hours, chilled. Let steak come to room temperature and discard garlic. Broil 4 inches from heat, turning once, 10-12 minutes for medium-rare meat and reserve pan juices. Alternatively, remove steak from marinade and grill over hot coals, brushing occasionally with marinade for the same amount of time as the broiler. Transfer to a platter and let stand 10 minutes. Slice thin across the grain and serve with reserved pan juices. ; name: taco chex mix microwave ; ingredients: butter, taco seasoning, salt, chex cereal, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Melt butter in 11-by-7-inch microwaveable pan for 60-70 seconds. Add taco seasoning and salt. Add chex and microwave for a minute to a minute and a half. Stir and sprinkle parmesan cheese on top and microwave for a minute. Stir and microwave for another minute. Cool. ; name: curried turkey strips ; ingredients: turkey breast, flour, curry powder, turmeric, chili powder, salt, black pepper, egg, olive oil ; preparation:Slice turkey breast into strips. In a medium bowl combine all dry ingredients. In a separate bowl beat egg. Using one hand for the wet and the other for the dry, dredge the turkey in the egg followed by the flour mixture. Repeat until all strips are coated. Drizzle about a tablespoon of olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Place turkey strips in skillet, cook for 3-4 minutes. Flip strips, cook an additional 3-4 minutes until cooked through, taking care to not overcook or the turkey will become incredibly dry. ; name: ramen noodle egg drop soup ; ingredients: water, eggs, onion, celery, green bell pepper, chicken-flavored ramen noodles ; preparation:

name: squidgy date cake ; ingredients: dates, butter, brown sugar, eggs, fresh ginger, self raising flour ; preparation:Heat oven 160 c. Grease and line 20 cm round tin. Put dates in bowl and cover with boiling water. Melt butter in pot, stir in sugar, allow to cool. Add eggs and ginger to pot. Drain dates and add to pot. Stir in flour, then spoon mixture into cake tin. Bake 50 - 60 minutess - a skewer stuck into cake should come out with a few moist crumbs sticking to it. Leave to cool in tin. ; name: caramelized onion brie smoked ham croissants ; ingredients: margarine, red onion, canadian bacon, plain croissants, brie cheese ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350f. Melt margarine in a skillet, cook onion over medium-high heat, stirring occasionally, 10 minutes or until onion is golden brown. Remove onion and set aside. In same skillet, heat bacon, turning once. On baking sheet, arrange 2 croissant halves. Evenly top with bacon, then onions, then cheese. Bake 2 minutes or until cheese is slightly melted. Top with remaining croissant halves and serve hot. ; name: cranberries in the sun ; ingredients: mandarin orange sections, whipping cream, cooked rice, orange peel, jellied cranberry sauce, sugar, cornstarch, lemon juice, orange, lettuce leaves ; preparation:Drain mandarin oranges, reserving 1 tablespoon liquid. Whip cream. Fold in rice, orange peel, and mandarin oranges. Chill. In small saucepan, break up cranberry sauce. Stir in sugar, cornstarch, lemon juice, and reserved mandarin orange syrup. Cook and stir until mixture is thickened and bubbly. Cool sauce to room temperature. Spoon mounds of rice mixture on lettuce leaves. Halve orange slices and arrange around mounds. Spoon cranberry sauce on top. ; name: walnut glazed brie ; ingredients: walnuts, coffee liqueur, brown sugar, vanilla essence, brie cheese, cracker, pear ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350f. Spread the chopped walnuts in an 8 inch square baking pan and bake for 10-12 minutes or until roasted, stirring occasionally. Stir in the coffee liqueur, brown sugar, and vanilla. Set aside. Reduce oven to 325f. Remove the top rind off the brie. Place the brie in a shallow baking dish. Top with the walnut mixture. Bake for about 8-10 minutes or until soft and heated through. Serve immediately with assorted crackers and pear slices. ; name: angel hair with tomatoes basil garlic ; ingredients: garlic, black pepper, diced tomatoes, angel hair pasta, salt, chicken broth, basil, low-fat parmesan cheese ; preparation:In a large saucepan, cook garlic until tender. Add tomatoes, salt, basil, and black pepper. Cook three minutes. Add cooked spaghetti. Toss well. Add chicken broth and stir. Toss with parmesan cheese. ; name: tarragon carrots and peas ; ingredients: sugar snap pea, water, carrot, butter, fresh tarragon, dijon mustard, cider vinegar, salt ; preparation:Place sugar snap peas and water in a saucepan. Bring to a boil. Cover and cook for 2 minutes. Add carrot and butter. Cover and cook 2 minutes. Stir in tarragon, dijon mustard, cider vinegar, and salt. Enjoy. ; name: smoking ruby gold baby potatoes ; ingredients: baby potatoes, garlic cloves, olive oil, chipotle chili sauce, salt, pepper, butter ; preparation:In micro wave dish mix potatoes oil and garlic. Microwave on high for 3 minutes toss and cook 3 more minutes. Toss in chipotle sauce and spread in a single layer on a sheet pan season with salt and pepper and broil to crisp and tender about 3-5 minutes. Place on a serving platter and dot with butter. Season with more salt and pepper if needed. ; name: breakfast enchilada eggs ; ingredients: corn muffin mix, diced green chilies, egg, water, cheddar cheese, red enchilada sauce, refried beans, eggs, cilantro, four-cheese mexican blend cheese ; preparation:

name: drunken sloppy joes ; ingredients: extra virgin olive oil, onion, extra lean ground beef, ketchup, southern comfort, light brown sugar, dijon mustard ; preparation:Heat the olive oil in a large and deep pan. Add the onions and fry gently until they have started to go tender. This takes about 5 minutes, stirring often. Crumble in the ground beef and cook, stirring when needed, until all of the meat is browned. This took me about 8 minutes. Add the ketchup, southern comfort and brown sugar and stir until everything is combined with the meat. Bring to a boil and then reduce to a simmer and continue to simmer for about 15 minutes, stirring now and then. Stir in the dijon mustard and then let simmer for another 15 minutes or until the sauce is the thickness you like with a sloppy joe. Serve on buns. ; name: cornbread heaven vegan gluten free ; ingredients: cornmeal, almonds, sugar, double-acting baking powder, cornstarch, water ; preparation:Finely chop the almonds, the add them to a blender. Blend until a fine meal consistency. Add the water and blend until smooth. Do not strain. In a glass baking bowl or cassarole dish, combine all dry ingredients. Blend well. Add the heavy almond milk mixture from the blender to the bowl of dry ingredients. Blend well. Bake at 400 deg f, 12-15 minutes, until golden on top. ; name: zucchini in a pot ; ingredients: zucchini, salt, olive oil, onion, button mushrooms, crushed tomatoes, garlic powder, cumin ; preparation:I dont like watery zucchine so grate the zucchini and place in a colander. Sprinkle with the salt, mix it around. Place colander over a bowl and let sit at least 15 minutes. In a medium sauce pan over medium heat, cook oil, onions and mushrooms about 10 minutes until onions are translucent and mushrooms have cooked down. Stir in tomatoes, garlic and cumin. Cover, cook 5 minutes. While cooking, grab the zucchini by small handfuls and squeeze it to remove excess moisture. Add this to the pot, sprinkling and breaking it up as you do so. Stir this together and cook 5 more minutes. Serve hot. ; name: shirley s stuffed celery with nuts ; ingredients: cream cheese, walnuts, milk, celery ; preparation:Put cream cheese in a bowl in the microwave for 45 secs. To soften. Add milk, and mix well. Add walnuts, and mix well. Cut stalks of celery into thirds, and wash and dry well,. Stuff celery with cream cheese mixture, and refrigerate. ; name: french green beans sauted with mushrooms and almonds ; ingredients: olive oil, garlic cloves, button mushrooms, whole almond, frozen french-cut green beans, soy sauce ; preparation:Heat oil over medium heat. Saut garlic until soft, being careful not to let it burn. Add sliced mushrooms and saut until they look fairly cooked and shiny. Add almonds and saut for a couple more minutes. Finally, add frozen green beans and splash of soy sauce. Stir frequently until beans are just cooked and, of course, no longer frozen. If not on the south beach diet or watching sugar intake, you could add oyster sauce or other asian condiment to the mixture. ; name: morris family s cheese ball ; ingredients: sour cream, french onion soup mix, cream cheese, cheese, cracker crumb, walnuts ; preparation:Mix french onion soup mix with container of sour cream. Mix 1 cup of dip, and cream cheese. Use beaters to make smooth. Add old cheese and cracker crumbs. Mix well. Seperate into balls. Roll each ball in chopped nuts. Wrap in tin foil. Chill in fridge or freezer. Makes 2 large balls or 4 small balls. ; name: lemon oatmeal cookies diabetic ; ingredients: vegetable oil, brown sugar, egg white, lemon juice, lemon rind, all-purpose flour, rolled oats, baking powder, baking soda, crispy rice cereal ; preparation:Place oil and brown sugar in a mixer bowl in a mixer bowl and mix at medium speed until creamy. Add egg whites, lemon juice, rind and flavoring, and mix at medium speed until well blended. Stir flour, oatmeal, baking powder, and baking soda together to blend well. Add to creamy mixture while beating at medium speed. Stir in cereal. Drop by the tablespoonful onto cookie sheets left ungreased, or lined with aluminum foil. Bake at 350f for 8 to 10 minutes, or until cookies are lightly browned. Remove cookies to a wire rack and cool. ; name: oil poached garlic puree and roasted garlic oil ; ingredients: heads of garlic, water, canola oil, extra virgin olive oil ; preparation:

name: raspberry watermelon sorbet ; ingredients: watermelon, raspberries, granulated sugar, orange juice ; preparation:In a blender, blend watermelon, raspberries, sugar and orange juice until smooth. Press through fine sieve, discarding seeds. Freeze in 13 x 9 inch metal cake pan until solid, about 2 hours. Break up and puree. Freeze in airtight container until firm, about 1 hour. ; name: raspberry balsamic mushroom saute ; ingredients: extra virgin olive oil, raspberry vinegar, dijon mustard, unsalted butter, fresh portabella mushroom, fresh chives ; preparation:Combine the first three ingredients in a jar and shake well to mix. Saute mushrooms in a little oil until cooked and set aside. Pour the dressing into a sauce pan and heat on medium. Add the butter 1 tablespoon at a time, whisking until each one has been incorporated completely before adding the next tablespoon. When all the butter is incorporated pour over mushrooms stir to coat and garnish with chives. ; name: ham and swiss double pinwheels pillsbury ; ingredients: lean ham, neufchatel cheese, refrigerated crescent dinner rolls, reduced-fat parmesan cheese, reduced-fat swiss cheese, green onions ; preparation:Heat oven to 350f spray cookie sheet with cooking spray. In food processor bowl with metal blade, process ham and cream cheese until smooth and well blended. Unroll dough into 1 large rectangle. Press into 13x8-inch rectangle, firmly pressing perforations to seal. Spread ham mixture over rectangle. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese, swiss cheese and onions. Starting with both short sides of rectangle, roll up both towards center. With serrated knife, cut into 16 slices. Place cut side down on cookie sheet. Bake 13 to 17 minutes or until edges are golden brown. Immediately remove from cookie sheet. Serve warm. ; name: coconut balls ; ingredients: butter, miniature marshmallows, crisp rice cereal, coconut ; preparation:Melt butter. Add marshmallows, cook and stir until melted. Remove from heat. Add cereal, stir until well coated. With buttered hands, shape into 1 inch balls. Roll in coconut, press gently to coat. ; name: lemon dijon green beans ; ingredients: green beans, butter, fresh lemon juice, dijon mustard, dill weed, slivered almonds, salt and pepper ; preparation:I usually steam the green beans for 5-7 minutes to get them a bit tender. Melt butter or margarine in large frying pan. Add green beans and cook on medium hight heat until coated with butter. Add lemon juice, mustard and dill. Toss with beans until coated well and heated through. Check taste, add salt or pepper if desired.
