Grease or place cups in tin for 12 muffins. Mash bananas in a bowl. Add oil, sugar or maple syrup, salt, cinnamon and cardamon and mix. Add flours, baking powder and baking soda and mix. Spoon into muffin tins and bake for 20-25 minutes until muffins are done and slightly browned on top. ; name: curried garbanzo rice ; ingredients: low sodium chicken broth, jasmine rice, vegetable oil, garbanzo beans, curry powder, fresh cilantro, salt ; preparation:Boil broth in a small saucepan over medium-high heat. Add rice, cover, and reduce heat to low. Simmer until rice is cooked, 1520 minutes. Heat oil in a skillet over medium. Add beans and curry powder. Saut until heated through, stirring often. Combine rice, beans, and cilantro. Season with salt. ; name: mung bean stew ; ingredients: mung beans, onion, turmeric powder, cumin, gluten-free vegetable bouillon cubes, carrots, butternut squash, celery, tamari soy sauce, coriander leaves ; preparation:Method. Rinse the mung beans thoroughly and drain. Place the onion, mung beans, turmeric, cumin and vegetable stock cube in a saucepan with 750ml water and bring to the boil. Simmer for 30 minutes. Add the carrot, celery, squash and tamari and simmer for 10 minutes. Serve with brown rice and sprinkled with coriander leaves. To turn this into a soup for the next day, add more water, extra fresh herbs of your choice, some more stock and blend until smooth. Fabulous. ; name: spicy swiss chard beans ; ingredients: swiss chard, olive oil, butter beans, hot pepper sauce, salt ; preparation:Remove stems from swiss chard. Coarsely chop swiss chard leaves. Heat oil in 5-quart dutch oven over medium-high heat until hot. Add swiss chard. Cook until wilted, but still bright green, stirring frequently. Stir in beans, green pepper sauce and salt. Cook over medium heat until mixture is heated through. ; name: hamburger helper soup ; ingredients: ground beef, onion, hamburger helper mix for beef pasta, water, dried basil, salt, pepper, diced tomatoes, veg-all, fresh parsley ; preparation:Brown ground beef and onion in dutch oven until beef is no longer pink- drain. Stir in cheese sauce mix from hamburger helper package. Stir in water, basil, salt, pepper& tomatoes, and heat to boiling, stirring constantly. Reduce heat, cover& simmer 10 minutes. Stir in macaroni from the hamburger helper package, add veg-all, cover& simmer until pasta is tender, about 15 minutes. Stir in parsely& serve. ; name: honey and orange glazed chicken ; ingredients: boneless chicken breasts, vegetable oil, green onions, garlic clove, honey, orange juice, orange, soy sauce ; preparation:Preheat the oven to 375. Place the chicken, with the skins on, in a single layer in a shallow roasting dish and set aside. Heat the oil in a small saucepan and gently fry the green onions and garlic for about 2 minutes, until softened, but not browned. Add the honey, orange juice, orange segments and soy sauce to the pan, stirring well and cook until the honey has completely dissolved. Pour the sauce over the chicken and bake, uncovered, for about 45 minutes, basting once or twice until the chicken is cooked. ; name: paula deen sweet potato balls ; ingredients: sweet potatoes, brown sugar, orange juice, orange zest, nutmeg, shredded coconut, granulated sugar, ground cinnamon, marshmallows ; preparation:

name: tossed greens with pineapple apple and feta cheese ; ingredients: apples, pineapple, red onions, feta cheese, salad greens, water, balsamic vinegar, sweet-hot mustard, garlic, salt and pepper ; preparation:Whisk together water, vinegar, mustard, garlic, salt, and pepper in a small bowl. Set aside. In a large bowl, combine greens, apples, pineapple, onion, and cheese. Pour dressing over the fruit and vegetables and toss gently to coat. Serve immediately. ; name: strawberry daiquiri jello shot ; ingredients: wild strawberry gelatin, boiling water, white rum, prepared sweet-and-sour mix ; preparation:Bring water to a rolling boil, then remove from heat. Stir together boiling water and powdered gelatin in a mixing bowl. Stir constantly until gelatin is completely dissolved. Stir in cold water and alcohol. Pour mixture into, individual shot-size plastic or paper cups. To make the jello easier to consume, buy plastic cups that also have lids. Pour the mix into the cup, add the lid, then turn it upside down prior to refrigeration. Place shots on a tray in refrigerator. Chill until firm. Refrigerate until served. ; name: spiced skewered chicken chicken sosaties ; ingredients: boneless skinless chicken breasts, vegetable oil, onions, madras curry powder, garlic cloves, coriander seed, light brown sugar, fresh lemon juice ; preparation:Place chicken in a large deep nonreactive bowl. Heat oil in a nonreactive saucepan and fry the onions until they are lightly browned. Add the remaining ingredients and cook for 2 minutes over low heat, stirring constantly to make sure that the sugar has dissolved. Allow the marinade to cool and pour it over the chicken. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and refrigerate it for 24 hours. When ready to grill the chicken pieces, remove them from the marinade, drain them, place them on skewers, and grill over hot coals or under the broiler for 10 minutes, turning once, or until the chicken is cooked through. Serve hot with apricot chutney. ; name: swedish spritz ; ingredients: butter, sugar, egg, vanilla, almond extract, all-purpose flour, baking powder ; preparation:Thoroughly cream the butter and sugar. Add the egg the vanilla and almond extract. Beat well. Sift the flour and baking powder together. Add to the creamed mixture, mix until smooth. Do not chill. Do not double. Force cookies through a cookie press onto an ungreased cookie sheet. Decorate the cookies with redhots, sprinkles or whatever you like. Bake in a 400 oven for 8-10 minutes. Cool on newspaper. These freeze well but shouldnt be left out for more than a week or so. ; name: spicy sweet barbecued beans vegan ; ingredients: dried kidney beans, water, onion, garlic cloves, tomato sauce, dark brown sugar, smoked paprika, ground cinnamon, chipotle chiles in adobo, soy sauce ; preparation:I soaked the beans the day before in a crock pot. Later in the day i drained the soaking water and replaced with fresh water then cooked the beans overnight on low in the crock pot. The next day i drained the beans and proceeded with the recipe. Preheat oven to 300 degrees. Dump everything in a lightly oiled casserole dish, cover and bake in a low oven for about 2-3 hours, stirring about once an hour. If the beans look like they may be drying out, you can stir in a small amount of leftover bean liquid or some broth. ; name: aidan s banana nut bread ; ingredients: salt, self raising flour, nutmeg, cinnamon, butter, sugar, eggs, bananas, nuts ; preparation:Sift together salt, flour and spices. Cream butter and sugar, then add the eggs one at a time, beating well. Beat mixture until light and fluffy. Add sifted flour and spices and bananas to creamed mixture, combining lightly. Fold in nuts. Turn the mixture into a well greased loaf tin bake in a moderate oven for 50 to 60 minutes. Cool in the tin. Can be iced with a cream cheese frosting or lemon icing. ; name: danish aebleskiver ; ingredients: egg whites, all-purpose flour, baking powder, white sugar, baking soda, salt, butter, buttermilk, vegetable oil ; preparation:Beat the egg whites until stiff. In a separate bowl, mix together the flour, baking powder, salt, baking soda, sugar, melted butter and buttermilk at one time and beat until smooth. Gently fold in the egg whites last. Put about 1 tablespoon of vegetable oil in the bottom of each aebleskiver pan cup and heat until hot. Pour in about 2 tablespoons of the batter into each cup. As soon as they get bubbly around the edge, turn them quickly. Continue cooking, turning the ball to keep it from burning. ; name: good eats broccoli noodle casserole ; ingredients: sour cream, mayonnaise, cheddar cheese, eggs, salt, black pepper, broccoli, mushrooms, chicken-flavored ramen noodles ; preparation:

name: cranberry and vanila sorbet ; ingredients: cranberries, water, sugar, kosher salt, vanilla bean, lemon juice ; preparation:In a saucepan combine first 4 ingredients, scrape seeds from vanilla bean and add bean to mixture and bring to a boil over medium heat, stirring until sugar dissolves. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 10 more minutes or until cranberries pop. Cool to room temperature. Remove vanilla bean. Working in batches puree mixture in a blender and then strain into a large bowl discarding solids. Stir in lemon juice. Refrigerate for 4 hours or overnight or until chilled. Transfer mixture to ice cream maker and process according to directions. Transfer to a container, cover and freeze. ; name: soda bread ; ingredients: flour, baking soda, salt, butter, sour milk ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400. Stir flour, baking soda and salt together. Cut in butter, until mixture resembles crumbs. Pour in sour milk. Knead dough, cut cross at center and bake for 40 minutes. ; name: ekuri spicy scrambled eggs ; ingredients: butter, onion, green chilies, fresh ginger, eggs, heavy cream, salt, fresh cilantro ; preparation:Mix the heavy cream, salt, and cilantro in with the eggs in a bowl. Melt the butter in a skillet and add the onions and cook until golden. Add the chiles and ginger and cook until aromatic. Pour the egg mixture into the skillet and cook, stirring until the eggs are set and done to your liking. Serve with warm breads. ; name: baked seasoned beet crisps ; ingredients: beets, balsamic vinegar, sugar, allspice, parsley, garlic powder, onion powder ; preparation:Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Peel beets and slice into very thin slices. Mix the remaining ingredients together in a small bowl. In a large ziploc bag place the beets and contents of bowl. Shake well to make sure beets are completely coated with liquid. Place beets on a baking sheet coated with nonstick cooking spray and bake for 45 minutes to an hour turning beets halfway through. Keep an eye on them to make sure they dont burn. ; name: quinoa corn and tomato salad with chive infused oil ; ingredients: water, quinoa, fresh corn kernels, cherry tomatoes, fresh flat-leaf parsley, oil, fresh lime juice, white wine vinegar, salt, garlic clove ; preparation:Combine water and quinoa in a medium saucepan. Bring to a boil. Cover, reduce heat, and simmer 10 minutes or until liquid is absorbed. Remove from heat. Let stand 10 minutes. Fluff with a fork to separate and let cool a bit if time. While quinoa is cooking, combine corn, tomatoes, and parsley in a medium bowl. In a small bowl, whisk together oil and remaining ingredients. After quinoa has stood for 10 min., add to vegetable mixture, toss to combine, then drizzle dressing over it. Toss well to coat. Let stand 10 minutes before serving. ; name: quick bacon tomato quiche ; ingredients: cooked bacon, mayonnaise, milk, eggs, cornstarch, cheddar cheese, green onion, plum tomato, black pepper, unbaked pie shell ; preparation:Beat eggs and combine with all other ingredients. Mix well and pour into pie shell. Bake in a 350 degree oven for 35 minutes. Cut while warm and serve. Any leftovers may be refrigerated and microwaved at a later date. ; name: egg muffin sandwich ; ingredients: english muffin, egg, light cheese, bacon, salt and pepper ; preparation:Toast the english muffin. In a microwaveable cup roughly the same diameter of the muffin, add the egg, a tablespoon of water. Beat the egg, add the bacon. Microwave on high for 1 to 2 minutes while muffin is toasting. Assemble the muffin and let stand for a few minutes to melt the cheese. ; name: blue cheese and pear salad ; ingredients: fresh pears, maytag blue cheese, walnut halves, lettuce, oil, raspberry vinegar, sugar, salt, fresh ground pepper, tabasco sauce ; preparation:

name: chicken almond casserole ; ingredients: chicken, mayonnaise, cream of chicken soup, celery, sliced almonds, cracker crumb, onion, eggs, potato chips ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 deg. Mix all ingredients together well except for the corn flakes. Lightly grease a casserole dish and add mixture. Top with corn flakes. May drizzle a little melted butter over corn flakes if desired. Bake at 350 for 35 minutes. ; name: chicken and rice chili ; ingredients: spanish rice mix, water, cooked chicken, kidney beans, tomatoes, green bell pepper, chili powder, ground cumin ; preparation:In a 3-quart saucepan, combine rice mix, special seasonings, water, chicken, beans, tomatoes, green pepper, chili powder and cumin. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low. Simmer uncovered, about 20 minutes or until rice is tender, stirring occasionally. Top with cheese, sour cream and cilantro if desired. ; name: quesadilla ; ingredients: vegetable oil, flour tortillas, cooked chicken, cheddar cheese, fresh mushrooms, monterey jack cheese, salsa, sour cream ; preparation:Heat oil in a nonstick skillet, add one tortilla. Layer with half the cheddar cheese, all of the chicken and mushrooms and half the monterey jack cheese. Top with the second tortilla. Cover and heat until cheese melts and bottom tortilla is crisp and golden brown. Turn over. Sprinkle remaining cheese on top. Cook until bottom tortilla is crisp and golden brown and cheese is melted. Cut into wedges and serve with sour cream and salsa if desired. ; name: boston creams cookies ; ingredients: butter, granulated sugar, eggs, vanilla extract, all-purpose flour, salt, baking powder, baking soda, sour cream ; preparation:Cream butter and sugar to the consistency of mayonnaise, adding sugar gradually. Add eggs one at a time, beating after each addition. Add dry ingredients alternately with sour cream. Drop by heaping teaspoons onto a cookie sheet and flatten slightly. Bake at 400 degrees f for about 10 to 12 minutes. ; name: spinach fried rice ; ingredients: spinach, garlic, dark sesame oil, white wine, celery, mushroom, long grain brown rice, scallion, low sodium soy sauce ; preparation:In a wok or large frying pan over medium high heat, saute the spinach and garlic in the oil for 2 minutes, stirring constantly. Transfer to a platter in the same pan, heat the wine and saute the celery or bok choy and mushrooms, stirring constantly, for 3 minutes. Add the rice, scallions and spinach. Heat through. Season with soy sauce or tamari. ; name: ritzy cookies ; ingredients: smooth peanut butter, semisweet chocolate morsel, butterscotch chips, ritz cracker ; preparation:Spread peanut butter on crackers and top with another cracker. Prepare several. Slowly melt morsels on low heat. Dip cookies in melted morsels, place on wax paper. Cool. Place in container and refridge. ; name: four cheese macaroni ; ingredients: elbow macaroni, milk, butter, white pepper, salt, american cheese, sharp cheddar cheese, mozzarella cheese, ricotta cheese, crackers ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degree f. In a large pot cook macaroni according to package directions. Drain. Return to pot. Add milk, melted butter, pepper, and salt. Stir in cheeses. Transfer to a greased 2-quart casserole. Bake, uncovered, for 15 minutes. Carefully stir mixture. Sprinkle with crushed crackers. Bake 5 minutes more or until crackers are browned and mixture is just heated through. Let stand 10 minutes before serving. ; name: spinach and penne ; ingredients: olive oil, onion, tomatoes, kalamata olive, fresh spinach, fresh parsley, penne ; preparation:

name: chicken quesadillas low fat ; ingredients: boneless skinless chicken breast, chicken broth, bell pepper, onion, garlic clove, salsa, taco seasoning, fat-free refried beans, light cheese, whole wheat tortillas ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Saute chicken in broth for 2 minutes. Add peppers, onions, garlic, salsa and taco seasoning. Cook until veggies are soft. Place tortillas on a baking sheet and spread refried beans onto half of each trotilla., top with chicken and veggie mixture and shredded cheese. Fold each tortilla over and bake at 350 degrees for 10-15 minutes. Serve with fat free sour cream and salsa. ; name: boulevard gourmet s shrimp mojito ceviche ; ingredients: red onion, garlic cloves, of fresh mint, fresh lime juice, salt & freshly ground black pepper, shrimp, french baguettes, extra virgin olive oil ; preparation:Combine the onions, 1 clove minced garlic, chopped mint, lime juice, salt and pepper in a nonreactive container. Add the shrimp, toss, cover and refrigerate 12 hours, tossing periodically to coat shrimp. Meanwhile, cut 1 garlic clove in half and rub the bread slices with the garlic. Place bread on a baking sheet and bake in a 350f oven 15 minutes or until toasted. Serve each shrimp, tail up, on a bread round. Drizzle with olive oil and garnish with a fresh mint leaf. ; name: greek lemon pilaf ; ingredients: butter, onion, long grain rice, orzo pasta, chicken broth, lemon juice, parsley ; preparation:In a heavy saucepan, saute onion in butter until tender. Add rice and orzo and cook, stirring, for 2 minutes. Add chicken broth and lemon juice and bring to a boil. Reduce heat, cover, and simmer for 20 minutes or until rice is tender and liquid has been absorbed. Fluff pilaf up with fork and stir in chopped parsley. ; name: coconut or pina colada cake ; ingredients: white cake mix, egg whites, oil, water, coconut, cream of coconut, cool whip ; preparation:Prepare cake mix according to package directions adding coconut to the batter. Bake in a greased, floured 13x9x2 inch pan. When done, remove from oven and punch deep holes in cake with a fork. Pour the cream of coconut into holes. Let sit until cool before icing. For icing, mix cool whip, coconut, and liquer if desired. Spread icing on cake and store refrigerated. ; name: the best bbq beef slow cooker ; ingredients: beef tip roast, beef broth, liquid smoke, worcestershire sauce, apple cider vinegar, barbecue sauce ; preparation:Place roast into slow cooker and pour beef broth over the top. Add the liquid smoke, worcestershire and vinegar, cover and cook on low for 24 hours. Trim any fat from the roast and place back in the slow cooker. With two large meat forks shred the beef into the broth and let it cook for another hour. You can drain the broth off now and pour in your favorite bbq sauce. ; name: cheesy twice stuffed baked potatoes ; ingredients: baking potatoes, sour cream, roquefort cheese, green onions with tops, paprika, salt and pepper ; preparation:Preheat oven to 425f. Wash, dry potatoes, bake until soft. About 45-60 minutes. Cut a slice from the top of each potato being careful not to break skin. Scoop out insides. Mash well. Beat in sour cream, cheese, salt and pepper. If necessary, add more sour cream to make light and fluffy. Stir in onions. Spoon mixture back into shells. Place potatoes on a baking sheet. Dust tops with paprika and return to oven until lightly browned. ; name: potato muffins ; ingredients: mashed potatoes, milk, eggs, yoghurt, spring onion, ham, self-raising flour, salt ; preparation:Preheat the oven and thoroughly grease the muffin pans. Blend the potato, milk, eggs and yoghurt or sour cream together. Stir in the chopped spring onion and ham or bacon. Fold the flour and salt into the wet mixture until all ingredients are just incorporated. Place in the prepared muffin pans and bake at 200 degrees c for 20 to 25 minutes. ; name: mushroom toast ; ingredients: mushroom, butter, garlic cloves, salt, white pepper, nutmeg, lemon juice, whipping cream, bread, parsley ; preparation:

name: grandma chin s sponge cake ; ingredients: eggs, sugar, salt, vanilla, butter, milk, flour, baking powder ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350. Beat eggs until light. Beat in sugar, salt and vanilla. Beat in milk and butter. Add dry ingredients very quickly and pour into a greased 9x13 pan. Bake 25 to 35 minutes or until toothpick placed in middle comes out clean. Serve with strawberries and whipped cream. ; name: gurkensalat cucumber salad ; ingredients: cucumbers, sweet onion, cider vinegar, sugar, salt, pepper, garlic clove, sour cream, fresh dill ; preparation:Peel cucumbers and cut into very thin slices. Mix together vinegar, sugar, garlic, salt, and pepper and pour over cucumbers and onions. Marinate about 20 minutes. Mix dill or parsley with sour cream. Add sour cream to cucumber mixture and toss. Top with chopped onion, sprig of fresh dill or parsley and serve. ; name: cranberry pear clafouti ; ingredients: eggs, sugar, flour, half-and-half, butter, pears, cranberries, cinnamon ; preparation:Preheat oven to 375. Butter a 9 inch glass pie plate. In a medium bowl, whisk together eggs and sugar till lightly colored. Whisk in the flour and half and half. Stir in the melted butter. Pour the mixture into the prepared pie plate. Arrange the pears in the batter and surround with cranberries. If desired, dust top with sugar and cinnamon. Bake for 25 to 30 minutes, or till the pears are tender and the custard is lightly browned. Cool slightly and serve. ; name: southern style braised thai chicken ; ingredients: oil, butter, chicken thighs, red curry paste, turmeric, coconut milk, fish sauce, lime juice, brown sugar ; preparation:Preheat oven to 375 degree f. In a large skillet, heat oil and butter over a medium heat. Lightly sprinkle chicken with salt and pepper. Brown well on all sides and remove to baking dish. Add red curry and turmeric to skillet. Cook until fragrant and dissolved. Add coconut milk, fish sauce, lime juice and sugar. Stirring, bring sauce to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 5 minutes. Pour curry sauce over chicken and bake 40-45 minutes or until chicken is cooked through. Serve with jasmine rice or rice noodles with sauce spooned over top. ; name: beef fajita marinade super easy ; ingredients: skirt steak, garlic clove, cumin, fresh cilantro, worcestershire sauce, soy sauce, liquid smoke ; preparation:Trim fat from steak. Pound steak lightly to tenderize. Combine ingredients in gallon-size zipper baggie. Zip closed and shake well to combine. Add meat to baggie. Refrigerate overnight. Grill until desired doneness. ; name: low fat ice cream cassata slice ; ingredients: low-fat chocolate ice cream, pine nuts, low-fat vanilla ice cream, dried apricots, dried figs, dried peaches, glace green cherries, glace red cherries ; preparation:Line a 20 cm x 10 cm bar tin with enough plastic wrap to hang down the sides of the tin. Put the chocolate ice cream and pine nuts in a bowl and mix to combine. Spoon the mixture into the base and up the sides of the tin, leaving the centre hollow. Freeze until firm. Mix the vanilla icecream with the dried fruit and spoon into the bar tin over the chocolate ice cream. Smooth the surface and cover with overhanging plastic wrap. Freeze overnight until firm. Remove from the tin, discard the plastic and slice with a knife heated in hot water. ; name: cavatappi with prosciutto and parmesan ; ingredients: cavatappi pasta, cooking spray, garlic clove, fresh parsley, extra virgin olive oil, salt, fresh ground black pepper, italian seasoning, prosciutto, parmigiano-reggiano cheese ; preparation:Cook pasta according to the package directions, omitting salt and fat. Drain in a colander over a bowl, reserving 3 tablespoons cooking liquid. Heat pan over medium heat. Coat pan with cooking spray. Add garlic to pan, and saut 1 minute. Remove from heat. Add reserved 3 tablespoons cooking liquid and pasta to pan. Let stand 2 minutes. Stir in parsley, oil, salt, pepper, italian seasoning and prosciutto. Sprinkle with cheese. Serve immediately. ; name: copeland s southern fried chicken ; ingredients: vegetable oil, chicken piece, salt, black pepper, all-purpose flour, milk, egg ; preparation:

name: oven toasted rice ; ingredients: long grain rice, butter, rich chicken broth, white wine, shallots, soy sauce, salt & pepper ; preparation:Scatter rice into a baking dish and place into a moderate oven to toast lightly, add butter, mix until melted and return to oven for 2-3 minutes. Carefully pour in heated stock and wine, stir through. Cover & cook in the oven for 25 minutes. Loosen the rice with a fork, add shallots and soy sauce and toss through. Season well. Return to oven to partially soften the shallots and evaporate any remaining liquid before serving. ; name: best potluck pasta salad ; ingredients: wagon wheel macaroni, summer squash, frozen peas, red pepper, cheddar cheese, pitted ripe olives, cherry tomatoes, red onion, fresh oregano, balsamic vinaigrette ; preparation:Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain. Rince with cold water. Drain again. In a large bowl combine, pasta, squash, peas, sweet pepper, cheese, olives tomatoes, onion, and oregano. Add dressing to pasta mixture. Toss gently to coat. Cover and chill for 2 to 24 hours. ; name: easy creamy parmesan rigatoni rigatoni alla panna ; ingredients: rigatoni pasta, whipping cream, butter, parmigiano-reggiano cheese, salt and pepper ; preparation:Cook the pasta in a large pot of boiling salted water until al dente. Drain and return to the pot add in the butter, toss to combine. Meanwhile warm the cream in a small saucepan over low heat. Then add to the cooked pasta along with the grated cheese. Toss to combine. Season with salt and pepper. Transfer to a bowl and serve. ; name: savory vegetable rice casserole ; ingredients: basmati rice, cauliflower, chili pepper, eggs, fresh mushrooms, onion, tomatoes, olive oil, paprika, salt and pepper ; preparation:Cook the rice according to the method that you prefer. Steam the cauliflower until tender. Heat the oil in a saucepan, add the mushrooms and onions and saute until soft. Add the chile pepper and tomatoes, continue sauteing until completely cooked through. Mix the rice with the sauteed vegetables. Add the eggs and mix well. Add the paprika, and the salt and pepper to taste. Pour into a greased baking dish. Bake in a 350 degree oven for 40 minutes. ; name: baked sesame chicken with soy dip ; ingredients: breadcrumbs, sesame seeds, chinese five spice powder, boneless skinless chicken breasts, egg, soy sauce, lemon, juice of, lime, juice of, caster sugar ; preparation:Heat oven to 400 degrees and line a baking tray with baking paper. Mix the breadcrumbs, sesame seeds, five-spice and a little seasoning on a plate. Pat dry the chicken, dip into egg, then roll in the breadcumb mix. Arrange on the baking tray, then bake for 25 to 30 minutes until crips and cooked through. Mix the soy sauce with the citrus juices and sogar to make a dipping sauce. Serve the chicken with little dishes of the sauce for dipping, plus lime wedges for squeezing over. ; name: gluten free fairy cakes ; ingredients: margarine, caster sugar, eggs, vanilla essence, gluten-free flour, milk, baking powder ; preparation:Make sure you have 12 paper cases handy. Preheat oven to 200 degrees. Cream together margarine and sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in eggs and vanilla, followed by the sifted baking powder, sifted flour and milk. Half fill paper cases standing on baking tray. Bake for 10-12 minutes. When cold, decorate the top with jam or icing or just icing sugar, if desired. ; name: upside down caramel rolls ; ingredients: refrigerated biscuits, brown sugar, pecans, cinnamon, butter, cooking spray ; preparation:Spray a muffin pan generoulsy with cooking spray. Combine sugar, butter, nuts and cinnamon. Divide sugar mixture evenly among 8 muffin cups. Place a biscuit in each cup over the sugar. Bake at 425 for about 10 minutes. Invert onto a platter immediately upon pulling these out of the oven. ; name: roasted apricot sorbet ; ingredients: sugar, water, dried apricot, apricots, lemon juice, almond extract ; preparation:

name: not your mama s grilled cheese ; ingredients: tomato paste, canned chipotle chiles, molasses, sourdough bread, sharp cheddar cheese, plum tomatoes, red onion, fresh cilantro leaves, butter ; preparation:Blend tomato paste, chilies and molasses in processor until smooth. Spread 1 tablespoon chipotle mixture over 1 side of each bread slice. Arrange 6 slices of bread, chipotle side up, on work surface. Divide half of cheese among bread slices. Top with tomatoes, then onion, cilantro, and remaining cheese. Top sandwiches with remaining bread, chipotle side down. Spread butter on outside of sandwich tops and bottoms. Heat a large griddle over medium heat. Place sandwiches on griddle, cook until bread is golden and cheese is melted, about 5 minutes on each side. Keep your heat on medium to low or the bread will burn. Eat the sandwiches warm from the griddle. ; name: olive and cheese wonton bites ; ingredients: margarine, onions, garlic, colby-monterey jack cheese, pitted ripe olives, wonton wrappers, oil, seasoning salt, salsa ; preparation:In a large skillet, saut onion in margarine for 5 minutes. Stir in garlic and continue to cook 1 minute more. Reduce heat to low and stir in cheese just until melted. Remove from heat and stir in olives. Cool to room temperature. Place one teaspoon of filling on each wonton wrapper. Dampen all corners of wrapper and pinch diagonal corners together to form a square, being careful to seal. Deep fry a few at a time for 1-2 minutes until golden, turning once. Remove from oil and drain on paper towels. Immediately sprinkle lightly with seasoned salt. Serve with salsa. ; name: hot slaw cabbage in mustard pecan butter ; ingredients: chicken broth, cabbage and carrot coleslaw mix, green onion, salt, black pepper, pecans, butter, dijon mustard ; preparation:Heat the chicken broth in a large saucepan over med-low heat. When broth is hot, add the cole-slaw mix, the green onions, and the salt & pepper. Cover and cook over med-low heat, stirring occasionally, for 5 minutes. Mix together the melted butter and the dijon mustard, and stir in the chopped pecans. Pour the mustard-pecan butter over the cabbage, and toss well to coat. ; name: dorito casserole with chicken ; ingredients: chicken breasts, creamy chicken verde soup, rotel tomatoes, frozen corn, monterey jack pepper cheese, milk, green onions, nacho cheese flavor doritos ; preparation:Put the cooked chicken on the bottom of a large, greased casserole dish. Put crushed doritos on top of chicken. Put the chopped green onion next and the corn. Mix the soup with the milk and tomatoes. Pour over the corn. Top with cheese. Bake at 375 degrees for 30-45 minutes. ; name: portabella mushroom pastries ; ingredients: refrigerated crescent dinner roll, portabella mushroom, garlic, butter, brie cheese ; preparation:Saute garlic and portabella mushrooms in butter. Separate crescent rolls into 4 rectangles. Cut each rectangle into fourths. Put crescent roll in greased mini muffin tins forming a cup. Spoon sauted mushroom and garlic into each. Stuff each with pieces of brie cheese. Bake at 375 for 12-15 minutes or until slightly browned. ; name: salad sandwich ; ingredients: white bread, russian salad dressing, tomatoes, lettuce, watercress ; preparation:Spread the dressing on one slice of bread. Place a lettuce leaf on the bread. Top with two slices of tomato. Top with the watercress. Add the remaining tomato and the other slice of bread. ; name: savoury chicken ; ingredients: chicken breast halves, dry red wine, olive oil, soy sauce, brown sugar, ground ginger, garlic, oregano ; preparation:Arrange chicken in large shallow baking dish. Mix remaining ingredients in large bowl. Pour marinade over chicken. Cover and refrigerate 2-4 hours. Preheat oven to 360f. Bake chicken in marinade until just springy to touch, basting 2-3 times with marinade, about 40 minutes. Transfer chicken to platter. Tent with foil to keep warm. Strain marinade into saucepan. Boil until reduced to 2 cups, about 20 minutes. Serve sauce with chicken. ; name: ww core gi normously big breakfast cookie ; ingredients: oatmeal, raisins, flour, non-fat powdered milk, unsweetened applesauce, cinnamon, baking powder, splenda granular ; preparation:

name: sour cream coconut quick bread ; ingredients: butter, sugar, eggs, coconut extract, sour cream, coconut, flour, baking powder, baking soda ; preparation:Cream together butter and sugar. Beat in eggs and coconut extract. Mix in sour cream, then add coconut and mix well. Stir flour, baking powder and baking soda together and add to batter and mix well. Place batter into greased loaf pan and bake at 350 for 45 to 50 minutes or until done. ; name: mrs margaret s chocolate fudge ; ingredients: sugar, evaporated milk, butter, salt, milk chocolate candy bar, chocolate chips, marshmallow whip, walnuts, vanilla extract ; preparation:Butter a 9 x 13 glass pan. Set aside. Boil sugar, milk, butter and salt in a medium pan over medium heat 6 minutes, stirring constantly. Remove from heat. In a large glass or metal bowl, break up hershey bar. Add chocolate chips and marshmallow whip. Pour bowling sugar mixture into the bowl and mix until the chocolate is melted. Mix in chopped nuts and vanilla. Pour mixture into the 9 x 13 glass pan. Let cool. Invert cooled mixture onto waxed paper and cut into squares. ; name: chicken ala chou ; ingredients: chicken thighs, chicken legs, potatoes, butter, salt, pepper, garlic powder, chili powder, paprika ; preparation:In a 5 qt dutch oven add butter and melt. After chicken has been washed add to pan. Sprinkle garlic powder over chicken. Do the same thing with remaining seasonings making sure with even coat, cover pan for 1 half hour. Uncover and flip chicken and season again the same way with all ingredients evenly coating. Cover for 15 minute. Add small quartered potatoes, and season again the same way. Cover pan until potatoes are tender. If bottom starts to stick add a little water. ; name: pan roasted asparagus ; ingredients: olive oil, unsalted butter, asparagus spears, kosher salt, ground black pepper, lemon ; preparation:Heat oil and butter in a 12-inch skillet over medium-high heat. When butter has melted, add half of the asparagus to the skillet with. Using tongs, distribute spears in an even layer. Cover skillet. Cook until asparagus is bright green and still crisp, about 5 minutes. Uncover, increase heat to high and season asparagus with salt and pepper to taste. Cook until spears are tender and well-browned along one side, 5 - 7 minutes, using tongs to occasionally move spears from the center of the pan to the edge of the pan to ensure all are browned. Transfer to serving dish, adjust seasonings as needed and, if desired, squeeze lemon over spears. Serve immediately. ; name: spinach with chickpeas ; ingredients: olive oil, garlic, onion, cumin, cayenne pepper, turmeric, canned chick-peas, baby spinach, pimientos, salt and pepper ; preparation:Heat the oil in a large, lidded skillet over medium-high heat. Add the garlic and cook for 2 minutes, or until golden, but not brown. Remove with a slotted spoon and discard. Add the onion and cumin, turmeric and cayenne and cook, stirring for about 5 minutes or until soft. Add the chickpeas and stir until coated with the oil and spices. Stir in the spinach with just the water clinging to it, cover and cook for 4-5 minutes until wilted. Uncover, stir in the pimientos and continue cooking, stirring gently until the liquid evaporates. Season to taste and serve. ; name: sunny scalloped eggs ; ingredients: margarine, celery, onions, flour, salt, milk, parsley, hard-boiled eggs, breadcrumbs ; preparation:In a saucepan, saute celery and onion in margarine. Blend in flour. Cook and stir until bubbly. Add salt and milk and cook until thick. Stir in chopped parsley. In a greased casserole, place hard boiled eggs, cut in half and round side up. Pour sauce over eggs. Toss mixture of melted margarine and bread crumbs over top. Bake at 400 degrees for 15 minutes. ; name: beefy barbecue macaroni ; ingredients: lean ground beef, onion, garlic cloves, elbow macaroni, barbecue sauce, pepper, milk, butter, cheddar cheese, cheese ; preparation:In a skillet brown beef with onions and garlic until no longer pink. Drain. Add macaroni, bbq sauce and pepper. Mix well. In a saucepan, heat milk and butter until butter is melted. Stir in cheese until melted. Pour over the macaroni mixture and mix gently. Sprinkle with additional cheese. ; name: texas style barbecued beef brisket ; ingredients: sweet onion, garlic cloves, chili powder, beef base, worcestershire sauce, cumin, hickory liquid smoke, beef brisket, beer, bottled chili sauce ; preparation:

name: macadamia pineapple muffins ; ingredients: self-raising flour, raw sugar, macadamia nuts, unsalted butter, honey, buttermilk, crushed pineapple in juice, egg, low-fat yogurt ; preparation:Preheat oven to 190c. Line a 12-hole muffin pan with paper cases. Place flour and sugar in a large bowl with half the macadamias, then set aside. Melt butter with honey in a small saucepan over low heat. When melted, remove from heat and add the buttermilk and pineapple. Stir to combine, then add egg. Make a well in centre of dry ingredients and pour in buttermilk mixture. Fold in to just combine, then pour mixture into muffin pan. Combine remaining nuts with extra tablespoon of raw sugar and sprinkle over the muffins. Bake for 20-25 minutes, until golden and cooked through. Remove from the oven and allow to cool for 5 minutes. Serve warm with extra honey and yoghurt, or dust with icing sugar if desired. ; name: caramelized brownies ; ingredients: brownie mix, butter, pecans, light brown sugar ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350f. Prepare the brownie mix according to package directions. Pour batter into a greased 9x13 pan. Melt butter ina small saucepan, add sugar and pecans then cook over medium heat, stirring frequently until all the sugar dissolves. Drizzle the carmel mixture over brownie batter and bake until a toothpick can be inserted and withdrawn cleanly, about 25-30 minutes. ; name: macaroni tuna casserole ; ingredients: macaroni and cheese mix, milk, butter, condensed cream of celery soup, canned tuna, cheddar cheese ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350f. Prepare macaroni and cheese according to package directions. Stir in soup, tuna and milk. Pour into a greased 2-qt. Baking dish. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake, uncovered, for 20 minutes or until cheese is melted. ; name: perked up pasta ; ingredients: penne pasta, garlic, olive oil, roasted red peppers, baby spinach, fat free feta cheese ; preparation:Cook 8 oz penne pasta until al dente. In a pan over medium heat, soften 2 tsp minced garlic in 2 tbsp olive oil. Add 4 oz sliced roasted red peppers and 6 oz baby spinach. Cook until spinach wilts. Add pasta to skillet, sprinkle with 4 oz fat-free feta, and toss. ; name: swedish spritz ; ingredients: butter, sugar, egg, vanilla, almond extract, all-purpose flour, baking powder ; preparation:Thoroughly cream the butter and sugar. Add the egg the vanilla and almond extract. Beat well. Sift the flour and baking powder together. Add to the creamed mixture, mix until smooth. Do not chill. Do not double. Force cookies through a cookie press onto an ungreased cookie sheet. Decorate the cookies with redhots, sprinkles or whatever you like. Bake in a 400 oven for 8-10 minutes. Cool on newspaper. These freeze well but shouldnt be left out for more than a week or so. ; name: grilled ham egg and cheese sandwich ; ingredients: honey-roasted ham, swiss cheese, cheddar cheese, egg, sourdough bread, butter ; preparation:Melt 1 tablespoon of butter in frying pan over medium heat. Add egg and fry until cooked to your preference. In a nonstick pan, fry ham until warm and lightly brown. Remove from pan and keep warm. On one slice of sourdough bread, layer slice of cheddar cheese, ham, slice of swiss cheese and fried egg. Top with other slice of bread. Brush melted butter on sandwich and place buttered side down in skillet used to fry ham. Brush melted butter on top. After a few minutes, flip sandwich over and fry until golden brown and cheese is melted. ; name: eggnog snickerdoodles ; ingredients: flour, sugar, butter, eggs, cream of tartar, baking soda, salt, brandy extract, rum extract, nutmeg ; preparation:Heat oven to 400. In large mixer bowl, combine all cookie ingredients. Beat at low speed, scraping bowl often until well mixed. In a small bowl, stir together sugar mixture ingredients. Shape rounded teaspoonfuls of dough into 1 inch balls. Roll in sugar mixture. Place 2 inches apart on lightly greased cookie sheet. Bake 8 to 10 minutes or until edges are lightly brown. ; name: mel boller danish soup dumplings ; ingredients: butter, water, flour, eggs, salt ; preparation:

name: spice of life flank steak ; ingredients: garlic clove, vegetable oil, vinegar, salt, pepper, dry mustard, worcestershire sauce, cayenne, tabasco sauce ; preparation:Whisk all ingredients together. Marinate flank steak in the marinade for at least 3 hours and if possible, overnight. Turn the meat a few times during marination. Remove meat from marinade and discard. Grill or broil to your liking. ; name: basket case deli s sweet potato sald ; ingredients: sweet potatoes, red onion, celery, mayonnaise, honey, dijon mustard, pecans ; preparation:Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add diced sweet potatoes and cook until tender but still firm, about 10 minutes. Drain and let cool. In a large bowl, combine sweet potatoes, onion and celery. In another bowl, stir together mayonnaise, honey and mustard. Stir into sweet potato mixture. Refrigerate until cold. Just before serving, top salad with chopped pecans. ; name: fusilli with tuna and tomato sauce ; ingredients: fusilli, tomato sauce, albacore tuna, capers, lemon peel, salt & freshly ground black pepper, fresh italian parsley ; preparation:Cook the pasta in a large pot of boiling salted water until tender but still firm to the bite, about 8 minutes. Meanwhile, combine the tomato sauce, tuna, capers, and lemon peel in a heavy large skillet. Using a fork, break the tuna into chunks. Simmer to blend the flavors, about 5 minutes. Season with salt and pepper, to taste. Drain the pasta, reserving 1 cup of the cooking liquid. Add the pasta to the sauce and toss to coat. Toss the pasta with enough reserved cooking liquid to moisten. Stir in the parsley and serve. ; name: tomato and spinach frittata ; ingredients: baby spinach, onion, garlic cloves, chili flakes, fresh basil, cottage cheese, eggs, roma tomatoes, havarti cheese ; preparation:Pre heat oven to 375f. Lightly spray a baking dish with pam or other no oil spray. Place the cottage cheese in a strainer and drain for 5 minutes. Pack the spinach on the bottom of the dish. Add the sliced onion. Sprinkle on the adobe spice. Combine the eggs and cottage cheese in a food processor and puree until the mixture is very smooth. Pour over the spinach. Arrange the tomato slices on top. Sprinkle on the grated cheese. Bake in 375 oven until golden and the eggs are cooked apprx 25 minutes. ; name: lemon whippersnappers since we are all young at heart ; ingredients: lemon cake mix, egg, whipped topping, powdered sugar ; preparation:Mix cake mix, egg and whipped topping. Roll into balls. Dip in powdered sugar and place on greased baking sheet. Bake at 350 for 10-12 minutes. You may also try other flavors-- orange or even white cake mix are very good. ; name: beer battered fish ; ingredients: vegetable oil, cod fish fillets, salt and pepper, all-purpose flour, garlic powder, paprika, salt, ground black pepper, egg, beer ; preparation:Heat oil in a deep fryer to 365 degrees f. Rinse fish, pat dry, and season with salt and pepper. Combine flour, garlic powder, paprika, 2 teaspoons salt, and 2 teaspoons pepper. Stir egg into dry ingredients. Gradually mix in one beer until a thin batter is formed. You should be able to see the fish through the batter after it has been dipped. Dip fish fillets into the batter, then drop one at a time into hot oil. Fry fish, turning once, until both sides are golden brown. Drain on paper towels, and serve warm. ; name: super easy green tea smoothie ; ingredients: green tea bag, boiling water, mashed banana, ice, orange juice concentrate, fresh ginger, honey ; preparation:Brew green tea in water. Steep to desired strength, and discard tea bag. Refridgerate 30 minutes, or until cool. Puree tea, banana, ice, orange juice concentrate, and ginger in blender until smooth. Add sweetener. Drink immediately, or place in freezer for up to two hours, or until ready to serve. ; name: twangy potato salad ; ingredients: red potatoes, green onion top, vegetable oil, vinegar, onions, salt, pepper, mayonnaise, plain yogurt, celery ; preparation:

name: corned beef and cabbage bake ; ingredients: butter, cabbage, onion, caraway seed, deli corned beef, swiss cheese, thousand island dressing, refrigerated buttermilk biscuits ; preparation:In a large skillet, melt the butter. Stir in the cabbage, onion, and caraway seeds. Cover and cook over medium heat for 8-10 minutes or until the cabbage is crisp tender, stirring occasionally. Set aside. Meanwhile, in a large bowl, combine the corned beef, swiss cheese, and salad dressing. Seperate the biscuits. Place 10 biscuits in each of two ungreased 9-inch round baking pans. Press the biscuits onto the bottom and halfway up the sides of the pans. Add cabbage mixture. Top with the corned beef mixture. Bake, uncovered, at 350 f for 20-25 minutes or until heated through and biscuits are golden brown. Cut into wedges. ; name: chicken in sour cream ; ingredients: chicken pieces, flour, salt, pepper, butter, sour cream, chicken broth, fresh mushrooms, paprika ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a plastic bag, combine flour, salt and pepper. Shake to coat chicken with flour mixture. Melt butter in casserole dish or skillet. Brown chicken on all sides. Mix in sour cream, broth, mushrooms and paprika. If skillet is not oven proof, transfer to a casserole dish. Cover and bake 45 minutes or until chicken is tender. ; name: green bean casserole ii ; ingredients: adzuki beans, shoe peg corn, sour cream, sharp cheddar cheese, onion, cream of celery soup, ritz cracker, margarine ; preparation:Drain beans, put in 9 x 13-inch baking dish. Drain corn, pour over beans. Mix onions, celery soup, sour cream and cheese. Pour over beans and corn. Crush crackers, melt butter and mix with crackers. Spread over top and bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes. ; name: bacon and cream cheese stuffed mushrooms ; ingredients: cream cheese, bacon, onion, mushrooms, mushroom stems ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350f. Saute onion and mushroom stems in bacon fat until tender. Drain off excess fat. Mix crumbled bacon, onion and stems with softened cream cheese until the mixture is workable. Stuff each mushroom and bake for 10-15 minutes. Finish under the broiler just until tops are golden. ; name: hawaiian omelette ; ingredients: eggs, pineapple chunk, ham, monterey jack cheese, cheddar cheese, water, salt, fresh ground black pepper ; preparation:Beat together eggs, water, salt and pepper. Thinly coat your skillet with vegetable oil spray. Heat over medium high. Pour egg mixture into pan. When eggs are almost set, sprinkle half of the omelette with remaining ingredients. Fold other half of omelette over filling. Continue cooking until cheese melts, about 2 minutes. Cut omelette into 3 wedges and serve. ; name: honey mustard glazed parsnips ; ingredients: parsnip, olive oil, honey, coarse grain mustard, salt and pepper ; preparation:Preheat the oven to 400f. Peel parsnips and halve lengthways. Place in a roasting dish with the olive oil and stir well to coat. Season and roast for 40-45 mins or until the parsnips are soft and golden. Mix honey with wholegrain mustard and pour over parsnips for the last 5 mins of cooking time. ; name: roast pork italian style ; ingredients: olive oil, garlic cloves, salt, dried oregano, dried marjoram, dried basil, pepper, boneless pork roast ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Make a paste with olive oil, garlic, salt and seasonings. Trim visible fat from the exterior of the roast. Place in shallow roasting pan on a rack. Rub seasoned garlic paste over the pork. Bake for 45 minute and check temp with meat thermometer. Continue roasting until the internal temp is 155-160 degrees. Remove from oven and allow to rest about 10 min before slicing. ; name: bacon sausage and cheese breakfast casserole ; ingredients: pie crust, bacon, breakfast sausage, swiss cheese, eggs, sour cream, fresh parsley ; preparation:

name: fancy but easy breakfast custard omelets ; ingredients: butter, eggs, parsley, onions, fresh ground black pepper, salt, half-and-half, tomatoes ; preparation:Place an oven rack in the middle position and preheat oven to 325 degrees. Butter or spray 6 ramekins. In medium bowl, whisk eggs until slightly thickened. Add parsley, onion, pepper, salt and half-and-half. Whisk until combined. Place prepared ramekins in a baking pan about 2 inches deep lined with a dish towel. Ladle egg mixture into ramekins. Place baking pan on oven rack and carefully add enough hot water to come halfway up sides of ramekins. Cover ramekins with a sheet of foil and bake 30 minutes, or until set and a knife inserted near the edge of one custard comes out clean. Carefully remove ramekins from water bath with a dish towel. Serve omelets in ramekins, or remove and place on individual plates. Serve at once, garnished with diced tomato and parsley. ; name: chocolate dipped kettle chips rachael ray ; ingredients: dark chocolate, vegetable oil, potato chips, pistachios, salt, cayenne pepper ; preparation:Line 2 cookie sheets with wax paper. In a small bowl, break up chocolate, microwave chocolate and oil on high power, stirring every 30 seconds until smooth. Set a rack over the cookie sheets lined with wax paper. Working with one chip at a time, dip the chips into the hot chocolate and set on the rack. Sprinkle chopped pistachios over one-third of chips. Sprinkle coarse salt over one third. Sprinkle cayenne pepper over one third. Refrigerate for 30 minutes before serving. ; name: orange roughy dijon ; ingredients: orange roughy fillets, salt, pepper, butter, dijon mustard, lemon juice, worcestershire sauce, garlic cloves, fine dry breadcrumb ; preparation:Sprinkle fish fillets with salt and pepper. Place fillets in a greased 13x9 inch baking dish. Mix together the butter and next 4 ingredients. Spread on fish fillets. Top with breadcrumbs. Bake in a 450 degree oven for 10 minutes or until fish flakes easily. ; name: zesty polynesian scallops ; ingredients: sea scallops, olive oil, red onion, button mushrooms, bell pepper, tomatoes, avocado, mango salsa, sour cream, green onions ; preparation:Broil the scallops for 4 minutes, then turn and broil 2 more minutes. In a large saucepan, saut the chopped onion in the olive oil until tender. Add the sliced mushrooms, bell pepper strips, and chopped tomato. Cook until all the vegetables are heated through. Arranged the sauted vegetables on a platter. Top with the broiled scallops. Layer the avacado slices on top of the scallops, then spread mango salsa over the the avacado slices. Top with sour cream, and garnish with green onion slices. ; name: roasted tomato salad with herbs and feta ; ingredients: tomatoes, olive oil flavored cooking spray, sea salt, red wine vinegar, olive oil, whole grain mustard, fresh flat-leaf parsley, fresh basil leaf, feta, fresh ground black pepper ; preparation:Pre heat oven to 180c. Spray a medium baking dish with the olive oil spray to coat. Place the halved tomatoes, cut side up, in a single layer in the prepared dish. Sprinkle with the sea salt and lightly spray with more olive oil spray. Bake for 40 minutes or until tomatoes are lightly browned and tender. Meanwhile, combine the vinegar, oil and mustard in a small bowl and set aside. Mix the herbs and feta together and set aside. Remove tomatoes from oven when cooked and place them on a serving platter and sprinkle with the combined herbs and feta. Drizzle with the dressing and freshly ground black pepper. Serve. ; name: habanero jerk chicken ; ingredients: onion, dried thyme leaves, sugar, salt, ground nutmeg, tabasco sauce, boneless skinless chicken breasts, butter, vegetable oil ; preparation:Mix onion, thyme, sugar, salt, nutmeg and tabasco sauce in a small bowl. Remove fat from chicken and stab a couple of times with a fork. Spoon or rub seasoning mixture over both sides of each breast half and let it marinate for 20 minutes. Heat butter and oil in large skillet over medium heat. When bubbling, add chicken and cook for 5 to 10 minutes on each side until brown and cooked through. ; name: provencal rosemary almonds ; ingredients: butter, dried rosemary, salt, cayenne pepper, almonds ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Using a baking sheet with a lip, melt butter. Mix seasoning into the butter, and then toss in almonds. Bake seasoned nuts for about 10-12 minutes, stirring once, until toasted and fragrant. Remove from heat and serve warm or at room temperature. ; name: pie crust pizza pockets ; ingredients: pie crusts, spaghetti sauce, mozzarella cheese, mushrooms, cooked chicken ; preparation:

name: easy meatball grinder ; ingredients: italian rolls, meatballs, pizza sauce, mozzarella cheese ; preparation:Slice roll as if making a sandwich but slice all the way through. Place each half of the roll in the toaster. While roll is toasting, heat up meatballs in sauce in the microwave. When roll is toasted to your liking, place both halves on a micro safe plate, cut side up. Spoon meatballs and sauce equally over each side and sprinkle with cheese. Heat in microwave for about 10 seconds or until cheese starts to melt. As neatly as possible put the sandwich together and press down slightly. Allow to cool for a couple minutes and enjoy. ; name: no time to cook main dish ; ingredients: cube steaks, seasoning salt, fresh ground black pepper, onion, sliced mushrooms, condensed golden mushroom soup, water ; preparation:Preheat oven to 375f. Season cube steaks with seasoned salt and pepper. Place in a 9x13 baking dish. Layer sliced onions and mushrooms over the steaks. Combine soup and water. Pour over steak, onions and mushrooms in baking dish. Cover with foil and bake at 375f for 45 minutes, uncover and bake 15 more minutes. ; name: chickpea garbanzo bean and mint soup ; ingredients: olive oil, garlic, onion, celery, chickpeas, mint, vegetable broth, tahini, black pepper ; preparation:Heat the olive oil in a large saucepan and fry the garlic, onion and celery for 4-5 minutes. Add the chickpeas to the pan and cook for a further 10 minutes. Now add the finely chopped mint, stirring well, and then pour over the vegetable broth and tahini. Bring to the boil, reduce heat to low and simmer for at least 30 minutes. Season to taste with salt and freshly ground black pepper. ; name: chicken tortellini salad ; ingredients: cheese tortellini, reduced-fat sour cream, light mayonnaise, dry ranch dressing mix, cooked chicken, roasted red peppers, scallions, fresh basil ; preparation:Cook the tortellini according to the package directions. Drain, rinse with cold water, drain again. In a large bowl, combine the sour cream, mayonnaise, and ranch dressing mix. Mix well. Add the tortellini, chicken, roasted peppers, scallions, and basil. Toss until well combined. Cover and chill until ready to serve. ; name: simple shrimp stir fry ; ingredients: angel hair pasta, cornstarch, oil, frozen shrimp, stir fry vegetables, gingerroot, italian dressing, hoisin sauce ; preparation:Cook pasta as directed on packaging & do not rinse. Meanwhile toss shrimp with cornstarch in large bowl & let stand 10mins. Place veggies in strainer. Rinse under hot water 30 sec. Or until thawed. Drain. Heat oil in large nonstick skillet & add shrimp and ginger. Stir fry 8 mins or until shrimp turns pink. Add vegetables, dressing & hoisin sauce. Cook 2 mins to heat through, stirring frequently. Add drained pasta and shrimp mixture to mixing bowl & mix lightly. ; name: cheesy bacon and vegetable slice ; ingredients: vegetable oil, bacon, onion, garlic, zucchini, carrots, self-raising flour, eggs, cheese, chili sauce ; preparation:Grease a 19cm square cake pan, line base with baking paper. Heat oil in large pan, add bacon, onion and garlic, cook, stirring until onion is soft. Add vegetables and cook, stirring, about 5 mins or until any liquid is evaporated. Cool. Combine vegetable mixture with sifted flour and remaining ingredients in a medium bowl. Mix well. Spread mixture into prepared pan. Bake in moderate oven for about 30 mins or until firm. ; name: pork chops italiano ; ingredients: pork loin chops with bone, pepper, butter, tomato sauce, water, italian seasoning, dried basil, mozzarella cheese ; preparation:Sprinkle pork chops with pepper. In a large skillet, brown chops in butter on both sides. Drain. Combine the tomato sauce, water, italian seasoning and basil. Pour over chops. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Cover and simmer for 6-8 minutes or until meat juices run clear. Top each pork chop with cheese. Cover and cook 3-5 minutes longer or until cheese is melted. ; name: lemon cookies ; ingredients: butter, sugar, lemons, zest of, lemon juice, egg, flour, baking soda, salt ; preparation:

name: japenese style crispy pork ; ingredients: boneless pork chop, chinese rice wine, ginger, eggs, panko breadcrumbs, cornstarch, tonkatsu sauce ; preparation:Season the pork with salt. Mix the rice wine and 1 tsp ginger and spread on the pork. Set aside. Beat the eggs with cup water in a shallow bowl. Put the panko and cornstarch in 2 separate shallow bowls. Dredge each piece of pork in cornstarch, dip in egg, then coat with panko. Heat inch of oil in large skillet over high heat. Fry the pork in batches until golden, 3-4 minutes per side. Drain on paper towel lined plate. Mix the tonkatsu sauce and the remaining tsp ginger in a bowl. Serve with pork. ; name: cheese scalloped baby carrots ; ingredients: baby carrots, onion, butter, velveeta cheese, ritz crackers ; preparation:Boil carrots til done, drain. Saute onion in butter til softened. In small baking dish, layer half of carrots, then half of cheese, repeat. Pour onions and butter over top. Sprinkle with crushed ritz crackers. Bake at 350, uncovered, for 30-40 minutes or til carrots are tender. ; name: skippy quick cookies ; ingredients: skippy creamy peanut butter, sugar, egg, vanilla extract ; preparation:Preheat oven to 325f. In medium bowl, combine all the ingredients. Shape dough into 1-inch balls and place on ungreased baking sheets, arrange cookies 2- inches apart. With fork, gently flatten cookie and press criss-cross pattern into top. Bake 8-10 minutes or until lightly browned and slightly puffed. Immediately top, if desired with sprinkles, chocolate chips or chocolate candies. Cool completely before removing from baking sheets. ; name: cool peppermint pie ; ingredients: peppermint candies, cool whip, milk, prepared graham cracker crusts ; preparation:Place the chocolate and milk in a microwave-safe bowl and place in microwave on high for 45 seconds. Mix the chocolate with the whipped cream. Pour the mixture into the ready-crust. Decorate with chocolate pieces. Place in freezer for 4-5 hours or until frozen. ; name: chicken fonda ; ingredients: chicken, milk, butter, prepared mustard, honey, curry powder, salt ; preparation:Mix milk, melted butter, mustard, honey, curry powder and salt in bowl until you get a thorough blend. Roll chicken parts in this mixture, making sure each piece is well coated. Place coated pieces in roasting pan and put in preheated 350 degrees oven. During cooking, baste chicken several times with mixture from roasting pan. Bake for 1 hour and 15 minutes, until pieces are golden brown and juices run clear. ; name: low fat mini meatloaves ; ingredients: ground turkey, carrot, zucchini, onion, bell pepper, italian seasoning, worcestershire sauce, whole wheat bread, egg substitute, tomato ketchup ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Spray a non-stick muffin tin or silicone muffin pan with nonstick cooking spray. Crumble the ground meat into a large bowl. Add the shredded carrots, zucchini, onion and green pepper. Add the italian seasoning and worcestershire sauce. Mix ingredients lightly with a fork. Place the bread in a blender and process until fine crumbs. Add the crumbs to the meat mixture along with the egg substitute or egg. Mix ingredients with a fork until well blended. Separate mixture into 6 equal portions and place in prepared pan, top with ketchup and bake in oven for 25 to 30 minutes or until done. Serve immediately with creole sauce or allow the meatloaves to cool completely and place in a plastic bag, label, date and seal. When ready to prepare the frozen meatloaves, remove what you need from plastic bag, place in refrigerator overnight and reheat in oven or microwave until warm. ; name: pan de yuca colombian cheese bread ; ingredients: cheese, tapioca starch, butter, eggs, salt ; preparation:Using your hands, combine all ingredients in a large bowl. Knead until very thick and firm, about 5 minutes. Turn out onto a dry surface and divide into 4 pieces. Shape each piece into a ball and flatten slightly. Divide each disc into six pieces. Roll each piece between palms to form a 4 inch long cylinder. Repeat with remaining discs. Rolls can be covered and refrigerated at this point up to 2 weeks. Preheat oven to 550f and arrange rolls on baking sheets. Bake until brown and crisp about 6-8 minutes. Serve warm. ; name: mozzarella tuna melts ; ingredients: tuna in water, celery, onion, mayonnaise, hamburger buns, mozzarella cheese, tomatoes, lettuce leaves ; preparation:

name: brussels sprouts with pancetta ; ingredients: fresh brussels sprout, olive oil, pancetta, garlic, salt & freshly ground black pepper, low sodium chicken broth ; preparation:Partially cook the brussels sprouts in a large pot of boiling salted water, about 4 minutes. Drain. Meanwhile, heat the oil in a heavy large skillet over medium heat. Add the pancetta and saute until beginning to crisp, about 3 minutes. Add the garlic and saute until pale golden, about 2 minutes. Add the brussels sprouts to the same skillet and saute until heated through and beginning to brown, about 5 minutes. Season with salt and pepper, to taste. Add the broth and simmer until the broth reduces just enough to coat the brussels sprouts, about 3 minutes. Serve. ; name: portabellas with leeks and spinach ; ingredients: portabella mushroom caps, olive oil, balsamic vinegar, leeks, fresh spinach, goat cheese, salt, pepper ; preparation:Preheat oven to 450. Place mushroom caps, gill sides up, on a rimmed baking sheet. Drizzle with oil and vinegar, then season with salt and pepper. Bake until caps are just tender, approximately 15 minutes. Top with leeks, spinach and cheese. Bake until spinach begins to wilt and cheese starts to brown. ; name: swedish thin bread ; ingredients: flour, sugar, baking powder, salt, whipping cream, milk ; preparation:Mix dry ingredients together. Add cream and milk to form soft dough. Divide into 7 balls. Roll each ball out on floured surface using poky rolling pin. Fry at 400 degrees on greased griddle until browned. Makes approximately 28 pieces, depending upon how thinly you roll it and how you cut it after its cooked. ; name: chicken breasts with broccoli cheese ; ingredients: unsalted butter, boneless skinless chicken breast halves, broccoli cheese soup, water, ground pepper, broccoli florets ; preparation:In a skillet, over medium heat, melt the butter, then add the chicken breasts & cook 10 minutes, browning the meat on both sides. Spoon off any fat. In a medium bowl, combine the soup, water & pepper & pour this soup mixture into the skillet with the breasts. Heat to boiling, then add the broccoli & reduce the heat to low. Cover & simmer, stirring occasionally, for 10 minutes or until chicken is fork-tender & the broccoli is done. ; name: tomato and artichoke pizza ; ingredients: cooking spray, pizza dough, olive oil, garlic, fresh basil, tomatoes, artichoke hearts, fresh mushrooms, feta cheese, red bell pepper ; preparation:Preheat oven to 425 degrees. Lightly grease 13-by-9-inch baking pan with cooking spray. Unroll pizza dough and press evenly over bottom and about 1 inch up sides of prepared pan. Brush dough lightly with olive oil. Sprinkle with garlic and basil. Cover with drained tomatoes, artichoke hearts, and mushrooms. Sprinkle with feta cheese and sliced bell pepper. Bake pizza for about 20 minutes until crust is golden brown. ; name: egg free no bake pineapple cheese cake ; ingredients: graham cracker crust, cream cheese, cool whip, crushed pineapple, sugar ; preparation:Drain the pineapple squeeze the excess juice off and let it drain. Cream the cream cheese in a mixing bowl,. Then mix in the coolwhip, pineapple and sugar. When well mixed pour into the grahm cracker crust. Put in the refrigerator to chill. Total time to mix is 10 miniute and chill varies depending on how cold your fridge is, 30 minute. ; name: spiral cheese slices ; ingredients: refrigerated crescent dinner rolls, green onion, garlic powder, cheddar cheese ; preparation:Remove crescent dough from tube. Do not unroll. Cut into 8 slices. Place on an ungreased baking sheet. Top with green onions. Sprinkle with garlic powder and cheese. Lightly press cheese into slices. Bake at 375 degrees for 14-16 minutes or until golden brown. Serve warm. ; name: traditional bahraini cardamom coffee ; ingredients: water, coffee, ground cardamom, saffron, rose water ; preparation:

name: pear cardamom bread ; ingredients: flour, sugar, baking powder, salt, ground cardamom, pears, vegetable oil, milk, eggs, cardamom ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350f. Grease bottom of loaf pan. Mix all ingredients, except topping, in a large bowl. Pour into loaf pan. Mix topping ingredients and sprinkle on top. Bake 55-65 minutes, until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean cool 10 minutes. Remove to wire rack to cool completely, 1 hour. ; name: old fashion peanut butter roll ; ingredients: sugar, water, corn syrup, vanilla, egg whites ; preparation:First beat 3 egg whites until stiff. Prepare the surface to roll out the candy. Cover the surface with wax paper and spread a thick layer of powdered sugar. Next mix all ingredients except vanilla in a large pot and boil. Stirring continously, until ball forms. The ball should be hard and have a soft crack. Add vanilla. Slowly pour the mixture over the egg whites while mixing with a blender the whole time. Continue to mix until the candy has cooled and resembles the texture of marshmallow cream. Pour onto powdered sugar and roll thin. Spread a thin layer of peanut butter. Roll up and cut. ; name: cheese burgers ; ingredients: vegetable oil, onion, lean ground beef, egg, parsley, roquefort cheese, worcestershire sauce, tabasco sauce, salt, pepper ; preparation:In small frying pan, heat 1 tablespoon of the oil. Add onion, cover, and cook over low heat for 4 minutes. Combine beef and egg, mixing well. To beef mixture, add cooked onion, parsley, worcestershire and tabasco sauces and mix well. Shape mixture into 4 large patties, scoring each with a knife. Heat remaining tablespoon of oil in large frying pan. When hot, add meat patties and cook 10 to 12 minutes over medium heat. Turn 4 times during cooking, and once seared, season well. When burgers are done, transfer to ovenproof dish. Cover each burger with a slice of cheese and broil 2 to 3 minutes. ; name: fried pie crust ; ingredients: flour, crisco, egg, cold water, vinegar ; preparation:Cut crisco into flour. Add everything else and mix until dough rolls up into a ball. Pinch off pieces and roll into 1-inch balls. Roll out and add 2 tablespoons of your favorite filling. Fold dough over filling. Seal with water and fry in hot oil. Make sure dough is sealed or filling will ooze out during cooking. ; name: dynamite chili dip ; ingredients: chili, sour cream, sharp cheddar cheese, chopped tomato, green onion, black olives ; preparation:Place chili in a medium saucepan and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and slowly stir in sour cream and cheese. When cheese is melted, stir in tomatoes and onion. Place in a serving dish and garnish with black olive slices, if desired. Serve warm with tortilla chips. ; name: garlic compound butter ; ingredients: unsalted butter, garlic, summer savory, kosher salt, ground black pepper ; preparation:Put all ingredients in a stand mixer with a wire whip attachment and whip until butter is lighter in color and the volume has increased. Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator. Or, dish it out on parchment paper and roll into a log. Wrap in plastic wrap and foil and it can be frozen for months. Best part is you can just unwrap and slice off what you need and rewrap it and stick it back in the freezer. ; name: baked parmesan trout fillets ; ingredients: trout fillet, sour cream, parmesan cheese, lemon juice, onion, salt, paprika ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Place trout fillets in a greased shallow baking dish. In a small bowl, combine sour cream, parmesan cheese, lemon juice, onion, and salt. Spread over fillets. Sprinkle with paprika. Bake 20-25 minutes or until fillets flake easily with a fork. ; name: i m broke mac and cheese ; ingredients: macaroni and cheese mix, milk, butter, broccoli cheese soup, meat ; preparation:

name: quick caramel rolls ; ingredients: butter, pecans, caramel ice cream topping, crescent roll dough ; preparation:Put melted butter in an 8-inch round cake pan. Sprinkle with chopped pecans. Add ice cream topping and mix well. Arrange crescent rounds in pan. Bake for 20 minutes at 375f. Invert onto a plate and serve warm. ; name: b l t salad ; ingredients: fat-free buttermilk, fat-free mayonnaise, fat free sour cream, dried basil, dried oregano, fresh parsley, garlic powder, lettuce, bacon, tomatoes ; preparation:Blend together buttermilk, mayonnaise, sour cream, and spices. Refrigerate for 1-2 hours. Stir occasionally. Fry bacon crisp, drain and crumble in small pieces. Tear lettuce into bite size pieces. Combine lettuce, tomato and bacon. Toss with dressing about 1 hour before serving. Refrigerate leftovers promptly. ; name: ambrosia sweet potatoes ; ingredients: sweet potatoes, orange, lemon, crushed pineapple, brown sugar, butter, shredded coconut, maraschino cherry ; preparation:Place sweet potatoes in a baking dish. Slice orange and lemon into thin slices. Alternate layering slices on top of sweet potatoes. Combine drained pineapple, brown sugar and melted butter. Pour mixture over sweet potatoes. Sprinkle with shredded coconut. Decorate with cherries. Bake in a 350f oven for 30 minutes. ; name: santa maria style pinquito beans ; ingredients: beans, bacon, ham, onion, garlic cloves, tomato puree, red chili sauce, sugar, salt, dry mustard ; preparation:Pick over beans to remove dirt and small stones. Cover with water and let soak overnight in a large container. Drain, cover with fresh water and simmer 2 hours, or until tender. Saut bacon and ham until lightly browned. Add to beans. Saut onions in bacon fat until lightly browned. Add garlic and saut a minute or two longer. Add tomato puree, chili sauce, sugar, mustard, and salt. Drain most of liquid off beans and stir in sauce. Keep warm on low heat until ready to serve. ; name: double delicious cookie bars ; ingredients: butter, graham cracker crumbs, sweetened condensed milk, semi-sweet chocolate chips, peanut butter chips ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350f. In 13x9-inch baking pan, melt butter in oven. Sprinkle crumbs evenly over butter. Pour milk evenly over crumbs. Top with remaining ingredients. Press down firmly. Bake 25-30 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool completely, chill if desired, and cut into bars. ; name: make perfect ice tea ; ingredients: tea bags, baking soda, boiling water, cold water, sugar, lemon ; preparation:Place tea bags and baking soda in a large heat resistant glass measuring cup. Add 2 cups of boiling water. Cover and steep for 15 minutes. Remove tea bags and pour tea into a 2 quart pitcher. Add 6 cups of cold water. If you have hard water, use filtered water or bottled water. For sweetened tea, put approximately 1 cup of sugar in 2 quart pitcher. Then pour tea concentrate from step 2, and after sugar has dissolved, add 6 cups of cold water. To avoid cloudiness, cool to room temperature before refrigerating. Garnish with lemon or mint and serve over ice. Store in refrigerator for up to 2 days. ; name: apple pecan tart ; ingredients: unbaked pie shell, sugar, corn syrup, eggs, butter, pecans, vanilla, apples, lemon juice ; preparation:Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Place pie crust in a 9-inch tart pan and leave the sides long and free-form. Combine sugar and corn syrup. Add eggs and beat until smooth. Add pecans and vanilla, and teaspoon of melted butter and mix well. Set aside. Toss apples with lemon juice. Spread apples on bottom of pie crust and pour pecan mixture over apples. Fold edges of pie crust over filling. Bake pie until set, about 45 to 50 minutes. ; name: grilled shrimp ; ingredients: shrimp, fresh parsley, olive oil, oregano, lemon juice, garlic, hot sauce, salt, tomato paste, pepper ; preparation:

name: savoury noodle goulash ; ingredients: fat, ground beef, onions, celery, noodles, tomatoes, cheddar cheese, salt, pepper ; preparation:Brown meat in fat. Add onions and celery and cook 10 minutes. Gently mix in remaining ingredients. Simmer or place in a buttered 2 qt casserole. Simmer 30 minutes, or bake at 350f for 45. ; name: quick blender hollandaise ; ingredients: butter, egg yolks, fresh lemon juice, salt, pepper ; preparation:Heat butter til bubbly. Meanwhile place egg yolks, fresh lemon juice, salt and pepper in electric blender. Turn the blender on and off quickly. Then turn to hi speed and slowly add the bubbly butter in a very thin but steady stream. Serve immediately. Refrigerate leftover sauce. To serve again, bring to room temperature or place container of sauce in a dish with hot water and continue to stir the sauce. You might have to keep replacing the water as it cools with more hot water til the sauce gets warm enough to serve. ; name: eggless chocolate souffle ; ingredients: nestle sweetened condensed milk, cocoa powder, vochelle cocoa cooking chocolate, walnuts, gelatin, milk, nestle cream, hot water, cream, chocolate ; preparation:Dissolve gelatine in hot water. Add cocoa powder to one cup of milk and heat for 5-7 minutes. To make a smooth paste. Add the gelatine, walnuts, chocolate, the other cup of milk and the condensed milk. Mix very nicely and keep aside. Whisk cream in another bowl and fold in the chocolate mixture. Serve chilled with cream and grated chocolate. ; name: teviotdale pie ; ingredients: lean ground beef, onion, beef stock, worcestershire sauce, self-raising flour, cornflour, suet, milk ; preparation:Pre-heat oven to 350 f degrees. Put the meat in a large saucepan and cook over a medium heat in its own fat until it starts to brown. Add the onion and cook for a further 5 minutes until softened. Add the stock and worcestershire sauce. Simmer for 15-20 minutes. Put the flour, cornflour and suet in a bowl, and then gradually stir in the milk to form a thick batter. Put the meat in a 20-ounce pie dish. Cover with the batter mixture. Bake for 30-35 minutes until risen and browned. ; name: speedy scallops with corn and sweet peppers ; ingredients: butter, garlic cloves, onion, orange bell pepper, sweet corn, red wine, chicken broth, salt, ground black pepper, sea scallops ; preparation:Pre-heat skillet with 1 tbs butter over medium-high heat. Add garlic and onion. Saute about 2 minutes. Add bell pepper and saute about 5 minutes. Add corn and saute about 3 minutes. Add wine, broth, salt and pepper and simmer until most of the liquid is evaporated, about 4 minutes. Remove vegetable mixture from pan and place on serving plates. Cover to keep warm. Add remaining butter to pan. When butter is melted add scallops. Saute until slightly golden and cooked thoroughly. Serve scallops on top of corn mixture. ; name: mulberry strawberry freezer jam ; ingredients: mulberries, strawberry, sugar, strawberry jell-o gelatin dessert ; preparation:Cook any combination of berrys and sugar together for 10-15 minutes with a little water. Add strawberry jell-o gelatin. Label containers or bags with item & date. Pour into containers or freezer bags and freeze. Or use jelly jars and process for canning. ; name: penne pasta with tomatoes and cheese ; ingredients: olive oil, onion, garlic, plum tomatoes, dried basil, ground red pepper, chicken broth, penne pasta, havarti cheese, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Heat 3 tbsp oil in pan. Saute onion and garlic. Mix in tomatoes, basil and ground red pepper. Bring to a boil, breaking up tomatoes. Add broth and boil. Reduce heat and simmer about 1 hour. Cook pasta and drain. Toss with 3 tbsp oil. Mix pasta with sauce and then mix in havarti cheese. Put into 9x13 baking dish and sprinkle top with parmesan cheese. Bake in 375 oven about 30 minutes. Of this recipe will easily serve 4. ; name: rice pudding gonzo ; ingredients: whole milk, long-grain white rice, sugar, unsalted butter, vanilla, salt, eggs, heavy cream, cinnamon ; preparation:

name: perfect choice caramelized onions ; ingredients: butter, oil, white onions, brown sugar, worcestershire sauce, food coloring, salt, pepper ; preparation:Over medium heat, heat skillet before placing in butter and oil. Add onion, salt, pepper, worcestershire sauce, and sugar. Cook uncovered over medium heat, moving the onions around, until onions begin to get browned. Approx. 8-10 minutes. Cover and reduce heat to medium-low and cook for an additional 13-15 minutes. The onions will sweat down and be glossy and soft. To give it a rich brown color. Can be made in advance. Freezes very well for the next sunday roastbeef dinner. Serve with hamburgers, roasts or steaks. ; name: bbq cheddar chicken roll ups ; ingredients: green bell pepper, red bell pepper, sweet onion, boneless skinless chicken breast, barbecue sauce, whole wheat tortillas, cheddar cheese ; preparation:Cook and stir vegetables in large nonstick skillet on medium-high heat for 3 minutes. Add chicken, cook and stir 3-4 minutes or until no longer pink. Stir in barbecue sauce. Cook on medium heat 3 minutes or until chicken is done, stirring occasionally. Spoon chicken mixture down centers of tortillas. Top with cheese. Roll up. Cut in half. ; name: mussels in wine sauce ; ingredients: mussels, dry white wine, shallot, garlic clove, fresh flat-leaf parsley, whole wheat baguette, mixed greens, white wine vinegar, extra virgin olive oil ; preparation:Scrub and de-beard mussels, discard any that do not close to the touch. In large pot, add wine, shallots, garlic and mussels, bring to a boil. Reduce heat, cover and cook stirring occasionaly until mussels are opened. Meanwhile, pre-heat broiler, and broil whole grain baguette 3 minutes each side. Remove and wrap in aluminum foil to keep warm, set aside. Remove mussels with sloted spoon into indivikdual bowls, discard unopened mussels. Bring remaining liquid to boil, boil 2-3 minutes. Pour hot liquid over mussels. Arrange mixed greens on salad plate, drizzle with white wine vinegar and olive oil. Serve with crusty whole grain baguette. ; name: chipotle lime chicken wings ; ingredients: chicken wings, chipotle barbecue sauce, honey, lime, zest of, lime juice, flour, cornstarch, seasoning salt ; preparation:Combine barbecue sauce, honey, lime juice and zest and set aside. Combine flour, corn starch and seasoning salt in a bowl. Dust each wing with flour mixture and set aside on wax or parchment paper. Heat deep fryer or potted oil to 325 - 350f.
