Place pan under the broiler for 7-10 minutes, sliding out and stirring vegetables once or twice. ; name: chuckwagon carrots ; ingredients: carrots, bacon, butter, brown sugar, green onions, salt, black pepper ; preparation:In 2-qt saucepan place carrots. Add enough water to cover. Bring to a full boil. Cook over medium heat until carrots are crisply tender. Drain and return to pan. Add remaining ingredients. Cover and cook over medium heat, stirring occasionally, until heated through. ; name: thai green chicken curry with spaghetti ; ingredients: chicken breast, coconut milk, sweet basil, eggplants, green curry paste, fish sauce, sugar, thai chile, kaffir lime leaf, spaghetti ; preparation:

name: sweet bread bread pudding ; ingredients: sweet bread, raisins, butter, milk, sugar, eggs, apple pie filling, cinnamon, vanilla ; preparation:Grease a 9x12 pan. Scald milk. Add sugar and butter. Mix until butter is melted. Cool. Break sweet bread into pieces. Spread apple pie filling on top of the sweet bread. Sprinkle raisins over the filling. Combine cooled milk mixture with beaten eggs. Pour liquid over the bread. Sprinkle with cinnamon. Bake at 350 degrees for 25 to 30 minutes. ; name: hot white chocolate ; ingredients: half-and-half, white chocolate chips, salt, vanilla extract, whipped cream ; preparation:In a saucepan, combine the half-and-half, white chocolate, and salt. Cook over medium-low heat, stirring constantly, until mixture is smooth. Remove from heat and add in vanilla. Whisk until frothy. Pour into warmed mugs. Garnish with whipped cream. ; name: snickerdoodle bars ; ingredients: flour, baking powder, cinnamon, kosher salt, brown sugar, butter, eggs, vanilla extract, granulated sugar ; preparation:Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Grease a 9x13 inch pan. Mix together first 4 ingredients in a small bowl. In a large mixing bowl, beat brown sugar and butter til fluffy. Add eggs and beat til well blended then beat in vanilla. Stir in flour mixture til well combined. Spead mixture in pan. Combine granulated sugar and cinnamon and sprinkle over the dough. Bake for 20-23 minutes. Do not overcook. The center surface of the bars should stay very slightly depressed when done. ; name: baked chicken and rice with honey mustard sauce ; ingredients: long-grain white rice, whole chickens, hot chicken broth, plain nonfat yogurt, honey, dijon mustard, soy sauce, ground ginger, salt, fresh ground pepper ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350. Spread rice in a lightly sprayed or oiled 13x9 inch glass baking dish. Arrange chicken on top. Pour broth over. Cover tightly with foil. Bake 45 minutes. In a bowl, whisk together the yogurt, honey, mustard, soy sauce, ginger, salt, and pepper. Uncover baking dish. Spread yogurt mixture over chicken. Bake, uncovered, until rice is tender and chicken is no longer pink in the center, about 15 minutes longer. ; name: mushroom alfredo ; ingredients: cream of mushroom soup, milk, red pepper, parmesan cheese, garlic, parsley, linguine ; preparation:In saucepan, combine soup, milk, red pepper, cheese, garlic and parsley. Bring to boil at medium heat, stirring often. Reduce heat and simmer for 5 mins. Pour sauce over noodles and sprinkle with pepper and additional cheese if desired. I usually increase the garlic to 2 plus cloves. ; name: cran apple pie ; ingredients: 9-inch double-crust pie shells, brown sugar, all-purpose flour, tart apples, butter, sugar, cinnamon, fresh cranberries ; preparation:Preheat oven to 425 degrees. Combine sugars, flour and cinnamon in large bowl. Add fruit. Mix well. Turn into pastry-lined pan. Dot with butter. Cover and cut slits in top crust. Seal edges. Bake 40 minutes or until golden brown. ; name: easy carrot souffle ; ingredients: carrots, eggs, breadcrumbs, instant minced onion, salt, ground black pepper, ground cumin ; preparation:Place carrots in large pot, cover with water, and bring to a boil. Simmer 30 minutes, or until tender. Drain. Preheat oven to 375 and coat 6 creme brulee dishes or 1 one-quart gratin dish with cooking spray. Puree carrots in food processor until smooth. Add eggs, breadcrumbs, onions, salt, pepper and cumin, and pulse until combined. Spread mixture in prepared dishes and bake 35 to 40 minutes for brulee dishes or approximately 1 hour for 1-quart dish, or until tops are brown and crispy. Serve hot. ; name: smashed loaded potatoes low fat ; ingredients: new potatoes, smart balance light butter spread, nonfat milk, nonfat sour cream, bacon bits, fresh chives, salt and pepper ; preparation:

name: deep dish pizza quiche ; ingredients: cream cheese, eggs, heavy cream, parmesan cheese, italian seasoning, pizza cheese, garlic powder, pizza sauce, mozzarella cheese ; preparation:Beat together cream cheese and eggs till smooth. Add cream, parmesan cheese and spices. Spray a 9-inch or larger glass baking dish with oil. Put the cups pizza cheese in dish and pour egg mixture over it. Bake at 375 degrees for 30 minutes or until eggs are set. Spread on pizza sauce, mozzarella cheese and favorite toppings. Bake until bubbly and browning. Let stand 10 minutes. Serve. ; name: golden cinnamon biscuits ; ingredients: butter, golden syrup, brown sugar, caster sugar, self-raising flour, ground cinnamon ; preparation:Combine butter, golden syrup and sugars in medium heavy-based pan, stir over low heat until butter is melted. Cool for 5 minutes. Stir in flour and cinnamon. Roll rounded teaspoons of mixture into balls, pleace about 2cm apart on greased oven trays, flatten with a floured fork until 1cm thick. Bake in hot oven for about 12 minutes or until browned. Stand 1 minute before lifting onto wire racks to cool. ; name: chocolate chunk buckwheat cookies ; ingredients: unsalted butter, brown sugar, egg, vanilla extract, almond extract, whole wheat pastry flour, baking soda, salt, buckwheat groats, semisweet chocolate ; preparation:Preheat over to 375f. In a stand mixer or bowl, cream the butter and brown sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in the egg, vanilla, and almond extract until well mixed. In a small bowl, mix the flour, baking soda, salt and buckwheat, and add to the butter mixture, beating to incorporate. When the flour is mixed in, add the chocolate and stir until combined. Drop 2-tablespoon-size balls of dough onto ungreased sheet pans, leaving 3 inches of space between the balls. The cookies will spread while baking. Bake for 6 minutes, reverse the position of the pans in the oven, then bake for 4 to 6 minutes more. A pale, soft center surrounded by golden brown cookie is the desired result. Let the cookie cool on the pans for 5 minutes, then transfer to cooling racks with a spatula. Let cool completely before storing in an airtight container for up to a week. ; name: chicken stuffed with smoked salmon ; ingredients: chicken breasts, oil, onion, red pepper, chicken soup, smoked salmon, sweetcorn, water, salt, pepper ; preparation:Pre heat oven to gas 4, 350f, 180c. Make a pocket in the chicken breasts and stuff with smoked salmon leaving a little of the salmon left over for the sauce. Place in a ovenproof dish. Fry onions in oil until golden, then add red pepper and cook for a further minute. Add soup, water, remainding salmon and sweetcorn and mix well. Pour over the chicken. After 20 mins cooking in oven give the sauce a stir and baste chicken breasts with the sauce, cook for further 20 mins and serve. ; name: patent leather icing glossy chocolate ; ingredients: chocolate, egg, evaporated milk, water, sugar, vanilla ; preparation:Melt the chocolate in the top of a double boiler. Combine the egg, milk, water and sugar and stir into the chocolate. Cook the icing over hot water for 20 minutes, stirring often. Remove it from the steam. Beat it with a rotary beater for 1 minute or until well blended. Stir in the vanilla. Cool the icing before spreading it. Tightly covered and stored in the refrigerator it will keep for several days. ; name: cranberry pear clafouti ; ingredients: eggs, sugar, flour, half-and-half, butter, pears, cranberries, cinnamon ; preparation:Preheat oven to 375. Butter a 9 inch glass pie plate. In a medium bowl, whisk together eggs and sugar till lightly colored. Whisk in the flour and half and half. Stir in the melted butter. Pour the mixture into the prepared pie plate. Arrange the pears in the batter and surround with cranberries. If desired, dust top with sugar and cinnamon. Bake for 25 to 30 minutes, or till the pears are tender and the custard is lightly browned. Cool slightly and serve. ; name: minted carrots with pineapple ; ingredients: pineapple, unsweetened pineapple juice, honey, salt, of fresh mint, carrots ; preparation:Combine pineapple juice, honey, salt and fresh mint in a medium saucepan. Bring to a boil. Add carrots. Cover reduce heat, simmer 8-10 minutes. Stir in pineapple cubes and cook an additional 5 minutes or until carrots are tender. ; name: campfire spaghetti ; ingredients: hamburger, whole mushrooms, onion, dried basil, dried italian seasoning, garlic powder, chicken broth, tomato paste, water, spaghetti noodles ; preparation:

name: sausage quiche ; ingredients: sausage, 9-inch deep dish pie crust, eggs, heavy cream, cheddar cheese ; preparation:Brown sausage in skillet, drain well. Spoon into pie shell. Mix the eggs and cream in a bowl. Spoon over sausage. Top with cheese. Bake ar 350. For partially bake pie crust i bake it about 10 minutes to set the crust. ; name: apple pecan tart ; ingredients: unbaked pie shell, sugar, corn syrup, eggs, butter, pecans, vanilla, apples, lemon juice ; preparation:Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Place pie crust in a 9-inch tart pan and leave the sides long and free-form. Combine sugar and corn syrup. Add eggs and beat until smooth. Add pecans and vanilla, and teaspoon of melted butter and mix well. Set aside. Toss apples with lemon juice. Spread apples on bottom of pie crust and pour pecan mixture over apples. Fold edges of pie crust over filling. Bake pie until set, about 45 to 50 minutes. ; name: peanut butter chocolate chunk cookies ; ingredients: unsalted butter, chunky peanut butter, sugar, dark brown sugar, egg, vanilla, all-purpose flour, baking soda, bittersweet chocolate chips ; preparation:Cream the butter and peanut butter together until fully incorporated. Add the sugars and cream on medium speed. Add the egg and vanilla and mix until completely incorporated. Add the flour and baking soda, mix until no white remains, then add the chocolate and mix on low just until everything comes together. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto parchment-lined baking sheets. Bake at 350 for 9 minutes or until golden brown. ; name: german creamed cucumbers ; ingredients: cucumbers, onion, sour cream, half-and-half, vinegar, salt ; preparation:Salt the cucumbers and onions throughout and place in large bowl. Place a plate that will fit inside the bowl on top of them. Let stand in refrigerator for 2 or more hours. When the time is up, drain the water from the cucumbers and onions. Add the sour cream, half and half, vinegar and a tablespoon more of salt, if desired. If you do not like it to be too soupy, you can decrease the amounts of the half and half and sour cream by half or more, depending on your taste. Mix thoroughly. Place in refrigerator for another half hour to a hour to chill the ingredients and serve. Makes about 10 servings. ; name: everyday banana cake ; ingredients: sugar, all-purpose flour, baking soda, water, banana, mayonnaise, cinnamon, salt, walnuts ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Lightly grease cupcake, 9 x 13, or 2 layer pans. Dump all ingredients into large bowl. Mix by hand using a wire whisk or wooden spoon just until the dry ingredients are combined. Do not overmix. If using walnuts, mix with a teaspoon of flour and then fold into batter. Bake 350 degrees about 30 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean. Cool on wire rack and frost with favorite frosting, if desired. ; name: broccoli and bell peppers ; ingredients: soy sauce, lemon juice, toasted sesame oil, broccoli florets, red sweet peppers ; preparation:For sauce, in a small bowl stir together soy sauce, lemon juice and sesame oil. Set aside. Place a steamer basket in a 12 inch skillet. Add enough water to come just below bottom of basket and bring to a boil. Place broccoli in steamer basket and reduce heat to medium low. Cover and steam for 4 minutes. Add sweet peppers. Cover and steam for 3 to 4 minutes more or until vegetables are crisp-tender. Transfer vegetables to a serving bowl. Drizzle sauce over vegetables and toss gently to coat. ; name: buckingham palace scones ; ingredients: flour, sugar, baking powder, salt, butter, egg, milk ; preparation:Preheat oven to 425f. Sift together flour, sugar, baking powder and salt. Chop in the butter until the particles of butter are the size of coarse cornmeal. Add the egg and milk. Stir quickly and lightly, only until no flour shows. Add more milk if needed to make dough soft. Turn the dough out on a floured surface and knead gently about 15 times. Cut the dough in half. Shape each half into a ball, press each down into a round and cut into 8 wedges like a pie. Place the wedges on a greased cookie sheet without allowing the sides to touch. Bake until golden brown about 12 minutes. ; name: olive bread ; ingredients: flour, baking powder, sugar, salt, egg, milk, walnuts, stuffed green olive, chopped pimiento ; preparation:

name: chili authentic texas red ; ingredients: beef stew meat, garlic cloves, chili powder, ground cumin, all-purpose flour, beef broth, salt, ground black pepper ; preparation:Heat oil in a large skillet over medium high heat. Sear the stew meat in the oil for 2 minutes. Pour meat into bowl and combine chili powder, cumin and flour. Mix with the meat until evenly coated. Pour in broth. Add the salt and ground black pepper pour into crock pot, add garlic put on high for an hour then reduce to low for six to seven hours stirring occasionally. ; name: raspberry lime pie ; ingredients: sweetened condensed milk, lime juice, cool whip, red food coloring, fresh raspberry, graham cracker pie crust ; preparation:In a bowl, combine milk and lime juice. Mix well. Mixture should thicken. Add cool whip and food coloring if desired. Fold in raspberries. Spoon mixture into pie crust. Refrigerate at least 2 hours before serving. ; name: black bean soup with sausage crock pot ; ingredients: olive oil, onion, garlic cloves, black beans, salsa, low sodium chicken broth, hot italian sausage links, cilantro, salt, pepper ; preparation:Warm oil in a medium skillet over medium heat. Add onion and garlic and cook, stirring frequently, until onion is softened and translucent, about 5 minutes. Combine onion mixture, beans, salsa and chicken broth in a slow cooker. Stir well and cook on low for 5 hours. Stir sausages into bean mixture in slow cooker and cook for 1 hour longer. Using tongs, remove sausages to a cutting board, cut into bite size pieces and then return to slow cooker. Stir in cilantro and season with salt and pepper. Serve soup hot in bowls, with chopped avocado and a dollop of sour cream on top, if desired. ; name: jamaican pumpkin soup ; ingredients: onion, pumpkin, chicken stock, scotch bonnet pepper, scallions, garlic cloves, bay leaf, fresh thyme, salt and pepper, butter ; preparation:Saut onions in butter in a large pot until transparent. Add pumpkin and fill with stock. Add the remaining ingredients and bring to boil. Simmer for about half an hour or to desired consistency. Remove scotch bonnet pepper and serve hot. ; name: minted applesauce with a hint of redcurrant ; ingredients: apples, water, mint leaf, boiling water, caster sugar, white wine vinegar, red currant jelly, salt and pepper ; preparation:Place apples and water in saucepan over medium heat. Cover and cook stirring occasionally for 15 minutes or until apples are tender. Roughly mash apples, remove from heat and set aside. Place mint into a small heatproof jug. Pour boiling water over mint and stir to combine. Add mint mixture, sugar, vinegar, redcurrant jelly and salt and pepper to apple, stir to combine. Simmer, stirring occasionally over medium-low heat for 3-4 minutes or until redcurrant jelly dissolves. Serve with roast lamb or pork. ; name: black forest cake mix ; ingredients: chocolate cake mix, eggs, almond extract, cherry pie filling, semi-sweet chocolate chips ; preparation:Combine all ingredients in a large bowl. Pour cake batter into a well greased bundt pan. Bake in a preheated 350 oven for 45 minutes or until a tester comes out clean. Cool for 25 minutes in the pan before turning out onto a rack to cool completely. Wonderful served with vanilla icecream or whipped cream. ; name: bundt cake breakfast ; ingredients: ham, frozen tater tots, egg, biscuit, shredded cheddar cheese ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Butter bundt pan and set aside. Toss all ingredients together in large mixing bowl. Spoon mixture into prepared bundt pan. Bake for 45 minutes. When done baking, flip onto platter, cut, and serve. ; name: oreo pudding ; ingredients: cream cheese, powdered sugar, milk, vanilla, cool whip, oreo cookies, butter, instant vanilla pudding ; preparation:

name: moong sabzi lentil vegetable mix ; ingredients: dried lentils, onion, tomatoes, coriander, green chili pepper, cumin seed, vegetable oil, salt ; preparation:Heat oil in a pan. Add cumin seeds. Wait until they crackle before adding the chili. Now add onion, a pinch of salt, and saute on a low flame till the onion turns translucent. Add the tomato and a bit of salt and let it fry on a low flame until the water starts separating from the tomato. Add the moong dal and mix it well into the onion-tomato paste, add salt, let it fry for a few minutes. Add enough water to just about submerge the moong, cover the pan with a lid and leave it to cook on a low flame. Stir the mixture occasionally to make sure that the water does not evaporate leaving the moong stuck to the bottom of the pan. When all the water has disappeared, check to see that the moong is soft enough to be eaten. The mix should be dry and not liquid like indian dal normally is. Sprinkle the chopped corriander and serve hot with chappati or roti. ; name: asparagus parmesan pita rounds ; ingredients: asparagus, olive oil, garlic cloves, pita bread, plum tomatoes, dried basil, crushed red pepper flakes, salt, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Preheat oven to 450f. Steam asparagus, covered, 2 minutes or until crisp tender. Rinse with cold water. Drain. Combine oil and garlic. Brush over pitas. Arrange tomato slices and asparagus on pitas. Sprinkle with basil, pepper, and salt. Top evenly with parmesan cheese. Bake for 7 to 8 minutes or until edges are golden. ; name: baked chicken with garlic and rosemary ; ingredients: chicken portions, olive oil, lemon, juice of, chicken stock powder, salt, pepper, lemon, garlic, fresh rosemary ; preparation:Wipe chicken with damp cloth and place in casserole dish. Mix oil, lemon juice, stock powder and seasoning together and drizzle over chicken. Add lemon slices, garlic cloves and rosemary. Roast in a preheated 200c oven for about 35 minutes. You will need to shake the pan from time to time during the cooking process to prevent sticking. ; name: prairie dog pinto beans ; ingredients: pinto beans, water, salt pork, onion, minced garlic clove, tomato paste, salt, sugar, cumin seed, marjoram ; preparation:Wash beans. Place beans in large pot cover with cold water and soak overnight. When ready to cook bring beans to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer 1 hour. Stir in remaining ingredients cover and simmer 3 hours or till beans are tender. Add more water if necessary. ; name: vincent price pickled oysters ; ingredients: oysters, peppercorns, salt, ground mace, white wine, cider vinegar, sherry wine, tabasco sauce ; preparation:Shuck the oysters and put them, along with their liquor, into a saut pan. Simmer over medium heat until they begin to curl around the edges. Remove cooked oysters, leaving the liquor in the pan. Set oysters aside. To the pan add the peppercorns, salt, mace, wine, vinegar, sherry, and tabasco, and simmer over low for 10 minutes. Remove pickling sauce from heat and let cool. Put the cooked oysters into a quart container with a lid, then pour the cooled pickling sauce over. Cover tightly and chill in refrigerator for 1 day. ; name: simple chocolate chess pie ; ingredients: eggs, sugar, milk, bittersweet chocolate, butter, vanilla, pie crust ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350. Prick pie crust and par- bake for 5 minutes. Beat eggs well. Add sugar and beat again. Add milk, vanilla, chocolate and butter. Pour into pie crust. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes or until pie begins to crack on top. ; name: cornbread heaven vegan gluten free ; ingredients: cornmeal, almonds, sugar, double-acting baking powder, cornstarch, water ; preparation:Finely chop the almonds, the add them to a blender. Blend until a fine meal consistency. Add the water and blend until smooth. Do not strain. In a glass baking bowl or cassarole dish, combine all dry ingredients. Blend well. Add the heavy almond milk mixture from the blender to the bowl of dry ingredients. Blend well. Bake at 400 deg f, 12-15 minutes, until golden on top. ; name: choc chip bread butter pudding ; ingredients: butter, bread, eggs, caster sugar, vanilla essence, chocolate chips, cinnamon, nutmeg ; preparation:

name: lightened up bechamel sauce 2 ww pts ; ingredients: low-fat milk, all-purpose flour, sea salt, white pepper, nutmeg, paprika, parmesan cheese ; preparation:In a small saucepan, add milk. While whisking, slowly add in flour. When blended, add salt, pepper, nutmeg and cayenne. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat, whisking constantly. Reduce heat to low and simmer, stirring for about 5 minutes. Remove from heat and and stir in parmesan. ; name: feta artichoke dip ; ingredients: artichoke hearts, feta, reduced-fat mayonnaise, parmesan cheese, pimientos, garlic cloves, tomatoes, green onions ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350f. Lightly grease 9x9 inch baking dish. Combine the artichoke hearts, feta, mayonnaise, parmesan cheese, pimientos, and garlic in a bowl. Blend thoroughly. Spoon into prepared baking dish. Bake in preheated oven until top is bubbly and lightly browned, 20 to 25 minutes. Remove and garnish with tomatoes and green onions. ; name: prawn avocado cous cous ; ingredients: couscous, shallots, fresh coriander, tomatoes, prawns, avocado, limes, juice and zest of, honey, extra virgin olive oil, salt & freshly ground black pepper ; preparation:Place cous cous in a heatproof bowl. Add 2 cups warm water and set aside for 15 minutes or until the liquid is absorbed. Use a fork to separate the grains. Cut prawns lengthwise. Stir in the shallots, tomatoes, coriander, prawns and avocado. To make the lime dressing, combine the lime rind and juice, honey, oil and season with salt and pepper to taste. Pour over the cous cous mixture and toss well to serve. Once avocados are cut, squeeze some lemon juice over the flesh. This helps prevent the flesh from darkening when exposed to the air. ; name: quinoa salad with sun dried tomatoes ; ingredients: quinoa, sun-dried tomatoes, black olives, fat free feta cheese, pine nuts, fresh basil leaves, fresh garlic cloves ; preparation:Thoroughly rinse quinoa in cold water. Drain well in fine sieve. Dry roast in a large fry pan over med-high heat 10 minute or until golden brown. Stirring constantly. Add 4 cups hot water. Bring to boil. Reduce heat, cover and simmer 10 min or until liquid is absorbed. Let cool completely. In large salad bowl, add cooked quinoa and remaining ingredients. Toss and refrigerate till serving time. ; name: oven crusty fish ; ingredients: egg, water, tabasco sauce, salt, fish fillets, corn flake crumbs, butter ; preparation:Combine egg, water, tabasco, and salt, beat until well blended. Dip fish fillets in egg mixture. Coat generously with corn flake crumbs. Place on foil-lined baking sheet. Drizzle with melted butter. Bake at 375 degrees for 20-30 minutes. ; name: the black eyed peas baked squash ; ingredients: yellow squash, eggs, whole wheat rolls, butter, sugar, salt, pepper, onion ; preparation:Cut squash and onion in pieces, boil together, then reduce heat until tender. Drain & mash squash some. Combine squash, onion, eggs, bread bits, butter, sugar, salt. Put into a 3 quart dish that has been oiled. Bake at 350 until lightly browned. Sometimes i toss in some velveeta - when the kids were small they liked it with the cheese. ; name: roasted pear salad ; ingredients: pears, fig jam, goat cheese, olive oil, lemon juice, dijon mustard, watercress, red onion, walnuts ; preparation:Preheat oven to 325f place pear halves cut-side up in 2 large baking dishes. Spoon 1 teaspoons jam in center of each pear half. Top with goat cheese rounds, and lightly drizzle with oil. Bake pears 30 minutes, or until cheese begins to brown. Whisk together remaining 2 tbs. Fig jam, lemon juice, and mustard in bowl. Whisk in 1 tbs. Olive oil. Divide watercress among 8 serving plates. Sprinkle with onion and walnuts. Top each with pear half, and drizzle with dressing. ; name: bacon and sun dried tomato alfredo pasta ww recipe ; ingredients: multi-grain penne, low-fat alfredo sauce, sun-dried tomato, bacon, fresh basil, black pepper ; preparation:

name: easy key lime pie ; ingredients: cream cheese, sugar, key lime juice, cool whip, graham cracker pie crust ; preparation:Beat cream cheese, sugar and lime juice until fluffy. Fold in 6 oz of the thawed cool whip. Pour into prepared graham cracker crust. Top with remaining cool whip. Cover and refrigerate at least 1 hour before serving. ; name: fat free alfredo sauce ; ingredients: nonfat milk, garlic salt, molly mcbutter, arrowroot, water, fat free mozzarella cheese, salt, white pepper ; preparation:Combine all ingredients except for the starch, cheese and water. Put into a sauce pan and bring to a boil. Blend together the arrowroot and cold water. Add slowly to the sauce, stirring constantly. Let sauce simmer for 2 minutes. Remove from heat. Slowly add and blend in the cheese. Season to taste. ; name: cherry orange cobbler ; ingredients: cherry pie filling, mandarin orange sections, all-purpose flour, granulated sugar, baking powder, salt, unsalted butter, egg, whole milk, cinnamon ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. In medium saucepan, combine cherry pie filling & oranges, & bring to boil, then reduce heat to simmer & keep hot. Whisk together flour, sugar, baking powder & salt, then cut in butter until coarse. Whisk together the egg & milk, then add to flour mixture, stirring just to moisten. Pour hot filling into a 1. 5 or 2 quart baking dish. Immediately spoon on the biscuit topping in 6 mounds. Combine the 2 tablespoons of sugar & cinnamon, & sprinkle over the biscuits. Bake 20 minutes, until browned. Serve warm. ; name: greek pasta with shrimp ; ingredients: plum tomatoes, olive oil, garlic, fresh dill, kalamata olive, shrimp, pasta, feta cheese ; preparation:Combine tomatoes, 2 tbs. Of the olive oil, garlic, dill, and olives in large glass bowl. Let sit for an hour. Boil pasta according to package directions. While pasta is boiling saute shrimp in 2 tbs of olive oil until pink and opaque. Toss drained pasta with sauce, shrimp, and feta cheese. ; name: sauce for a stir fry ; ingredients: water, chicken bouillon cube, soya sauce, cornstarch, ginger, garlic powder ; preparation:Empty all ingredients in a mason jar and shake. If making just a veggie stirfry add sauce approximately 2 minutes before ready to serve. If adding meat or seafood, stir fry it first and then remove and set aside. When veggies are tender crisp, add sauce and meat or seafood and stir. Serve over rice. ; name: pumpkin pie bread ; ingredients: all-purpose flour, baking soda, baking powder, pumpkin pie spice, salt, white sugar, vegetable oil, eggs, pumpkin puree, water ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Grease two 9x5 inch loaf pans. Sift together the flour, baking soda, baking powder, salt, and pumpkin pie spice. Set aside. In a large bowl, beat together sugar, oil, eggs, and pumpkin. Stir in flour mixture alternately with water. Divide batter evenly between the prepared pans. Bake in the preheated oven for 60 to 70 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. For best flavor, store wrapped in plastic wrap at room temperature for a full day before serving. ; name: mushroom brochettes ; ingredients: mushrooms, salt, white pepper, thyme, rosemary, summer savory ; preparation:Clean the mushrooms well. You can scuff up the skin a little, so that the mushroom juices combine with the herbs. Mix the herbs together and crush them with a mortar and pestle, or just crush them together. Put 6 mushrooms on each of 4 bamboo skewers. Salt and pepper them, and sprinkle the herb mix over them. Put them under a hot grill and turn them frequently. Sprinkle more herbs and salt and pepper once or twice. The mushrooms should be hot, and cooked but still crisp when they are done. ; name: cherry ripe crackles ; ingredients: desiccated coconut, rice bubbles, glace cherries, dark chocolate chips, margarine, golden syrup, coconut essence ; preparation:

name: chicken chardonnay ; ingredients: boneless chicken breasts, salt, pepper, flour, butter, garlic cloves, thyme, sage, white wine, swanson chicken broth ; preparation:Cut up all chicken breasts into bite sized cubes. Melt 3 tablespoons of the butter in a large skillet. Mix together the flour and the salt and pepper meant for the batter. Carefully coat all chicken cubes and brown in skillet. Remove and place in a shallow dish and cover. Melt down the rest of the butter. Mix in garlic, and all spices. Add chicken back into the mix and coat throughly. Add in white wine, allow to come to a boil for 5-7 minute. After the wine has cooked down, add in chicken broth, bring to a boil and then simmer for an additional 5-7 minute. I reccomend serving this over pasta. Very tasty. ; name: golden cheese bread ; ingredients: butter, cheddar cheese, dijon mustard, italian bread ; preparation:Combine butter, cheese and mustard. Spread on cut surfaces of bread. Place on foil covered baking sheet. Bake at 425 for 7 to 10 minutes or until spread has melted and is a light golden brown. To serve, slice diagonally. ; name: mock wonton soup ; ingredients: ready-to-serve chicken broth, tortellini, chinese vegetables, green onion, sesame oil, fresh gingerroot ; preparation:In a large saucepan, place the chicken broth and, over high heat, bring it to a boil. Add frozen tortellini and veggies, let return to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 8 to 10 minutes, or until tortellini is tender. Stir occasionally. Remove from heat, stir in onion, sesame oil, and ginger. Serve. ; name: french peasant bread ; ingredients: yeast, warm water, sugar, salt, flour, olive oil, cornmeal, butter ; preparation:Dissolve yeast, sugar and salt in water. Add flour and stir with a wooden spoon until blended. Do not knead -- it will be lumpy. Cover and let rise until doubled, about 1 hours. Oil a cookie sheet with olive oil. Oil hands and remove dough from bowl and divide into 2 rounds and place on cookie sheet. Sprinkle dough with cornmeal. Let rise 1 hour. Preheat oven to 425 degrees and brush dough with melted butter. Bake for 10 min then reduce heat to 375 degrees and bake an additional 15 minutes. When finished baking, brush again with melted butter. ; name: gordon ramsay s farfalle with bacon peas and sage ; ingredients: farfalle pasta, olive oil, streaky bacon, garlic clove, heavy cream, peas, parmesan cheese, sage leaf ; preparation:Bring a pot of salted water to the boil. Heat the oil in another pan and add the bacon. Fry over high heat for 3 - 4 minutes until the bacon is golden brown. Add the garlic and fry for a minute. Pour in the cream and bring to the boil. Let simmer for 5 minutes until reduced and thickened slightly. Stir the grated parmesan into the sauce, then taste and adjust the seasoning. When the pasta is ready, drain it in a colander and immediately. Add the herbs, then toss the pasta until well coated with the creamy sauce. Divide among warm plates and sprinkle over a little more parmesan to serve. ; name: awesome au gratin potatoes ; ingredients: condensed cheddar cheese soup, cheddar cheese, milk, ground black pepper, garlic clove, baking potatoes, fresh parmesan cheese, paprika ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Lightly spray baking dish with cooking spray. In large bowl, combine soup, cheddar cheese, milk and black pepper. Add garlic and potatoes to soup mixture. Mix well. Spoon potatoes into baking dish. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese and paprika. Cover with foil. Bake 1 hour. Remove foil. Bake and additional 15-20 minutes or until potatoes are tender. ; name: emeril s crunchy pralines ; ingredients: light brown sugar, butter, water, pecan pieces ; preparation:Combine the sugar, butter, and water in a heavy saucepan over medium heat. Stir to dissolve the sugar. Continue to stir for 3 to 4 minutes. The mixture will begin to boil. Add the pecans and continue to stir for about 5 minutes. Remove from the heat. Drop by the spoonful onto wax paper. Let cool. Remove from the paper with a thin knife. ; name: ma s gnocchi ; ingredients: ricotta cheese, flour, eggs, tomato sauce, parmigiano-reggiano cheese ; preparation:

name: d liteful salad or dessert ; ingredients: small curd cottage cheese, sugar-free jello, fat-free cool whip, crushed pineapple, mandarin orange segments, nuts, maraschino cherry ; preparation:Place cottage cheese in a bowl. Place dry gelatin on cottage cheese, along with the coolwhip, crushed pineapple, and mandarin orange segments. Mix well. Garnish with crushed nuts and cherries. Refrigerate 3 hours. Serve. ; name: chicken rotel dip ; ingredients: rotel tomatoes, velveeta cheese, cooked chicken breasts, cumin ; preparation:Melt cheese and ro-tel together. Then add chicken and cumin. Mix together until hot and serve with tortilla chips. You can also buy southwest seasoned cooked chicken in the meat department that is easy but just a little more expensive. You can also make this in a crock pot and simmer all ingredients until it is hot. ; name: popcorn drops ; ingredients: popped popcorn, egg whites, baking powder, salt, cream of tartar, sugar substitute ; preparation:Place popped corn in food processor or food grinder. Grind into kernel-size pieces. Beat egg whites until frothy and add baking powder, salt and cream of tartar. Beat into stiff peaks. Add sugar replacement, beating until well blended. Fold popcorn pieces into stiffly beaten egg whites. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto lightly greased cookie sheets. Bake at 350 f for 12 to 14 minutes or until lightly browned. Yield 36 cookies. ; name: ham and manchego panini with dipping sauce ; ingredients: country bread, ham, manchego cheese, olive oil, apricot jam, dijon mustard ; preparation:Divide ham and cheese evenly between two pieces of bread and top with remaining bread. Brush tops of sandwiches with 2 teaspoons oil. In a large nonstick skillet, heat remaining oil over medium-low heat. Place panini in skillet, oiled side up. Cover and cook until golden and cheese has melted, 5-8 minutes per side, pressing down with spatula occasionally. For sauce, mix together jam and dijon. ; name: ritz mock apple pie ; ingredients: water, sugar, cream of tartar, ritz crackers, pie shells, lemon juice, cinnamon, cracker crumb, brown sugar, margarine ; preparation:Combine water, sugar and cream of tartar. Bring to a boil. Drop in whole crackers and simmer for 5 minute. Pour mixture into pie shell. Sprinkle with lemon juice and cinnamon. Combine all ingredients for topping and sprinkle over pie. Bake at 400 degrees for 15 minute then reduce heat to 350 degrees and continue baking 15 to 20 minutes. Serve warm. ; name: french style peas mint ; ingredients: cos lettuce, butter, plain flour, chicken stock, frozen peas, of fresh mint ; preparation:Melt butter in pot over medium heat. Stir in flour till smooth and cook 1 minute. Slowly whisk in chicken stock. Stir till thick. Stir in peas and shredded lettuce. Cook 3 minutes till lettuce wilts. Add mint and serve. ; name: country yellow squash bake ; ingredients: yellow squash, onion, sour cream, salt, dried basil, ground red pepper, soft breadcrumbs, cheddar cheese, butter, paprika ; preparation:Cook squash and onion in boiling water 10 or 15 minutes or until tender. Drain well, and mash. Combine squash mixture, sour cream, salt, dried basil and red pepper, stirring well. Spoon mixture into a greased 2 quart casserole. Combine breadcrumbs, cheddar cheese, margarine and paprika and toss well. Sprinkle over squash mixture. Bake, uncovered, at 300 degrees for 30 minutes or until thoroughly heated. ; name: amish cream pie ; ingredients: sugar, cornstarch, salt, half-and-half, butter, brown sugar, vanilla, 9-inch baked pie crust, ground cinnamon ; preparation:

name: three cheese cheese ball ; ingredients: cream cheese, cheddar cheese, milk, black pepper, worcestershire sauce, blue cheese, garlic, nuts ; preparation:Mix all ingredients thoroughly. Divide mixture in half and place each half on a sheet of plastic wrap. Draw up the sides of the plastic wrap tightly around each ball and firmly secure. Refrigerate 6-8 hours or until firm. Remove plastic wrap and roll in nuts before serving. ; name: lemony sugar snap pea stir fry ; ingredients: olive oil, lemon, sugar snap peas, leek, fresh dill, salt & fresh ground pepper ; preparation:In a large skillet heat oil over medium-high heat add lemon slices. Cook 4 minutes, turning once. Remove lemons. Set aside. Add pea pods and leek to skillet. Stir-fry 3 to 4 minutes or until pea pods are crisp tender. Stir in dill and reserved lemon slices. Season to taste with salt and pepper. ; name: maple walnut brownies ; ingredients: brown sugar, butter, maple flavoring, eggs, flour, baking powder, walnuts ; preparation:In bowl, combine brown sugar, butter and maple flavoring. Beat in the eggs one at a time. Combine flour and baking powder and add to egg mixture. Stir in walnuts. Pour into greased 9 inch square baking pan. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes or until brownies test done. Cool. ; name: mushroom and celery salad ; ingredients: fresh mushrooms, celery, olive oil, lemon juice, salt, sugar, white pepper, onion salt, garlic powder ; preparation:Combine mushrooms and celery in a salad bowl. Mix oil, lemon juice, salt, sugar, white pepper, onion salt, and garlic powder. Mix well. Pour over mushrooms and celery. Serve. ; name: fast and easy kfc cole slaw ; ingredients: miracle whip, sugar, cabbage, carrot, onions ; preparation:Combine miracle whip with sugar in a large bowl. Mix well with electric beater until sugar is dissolved. Add cabbage, carrot and onion mixture and toss well. Cover and chill at least 2 hours, preferably over night, before serving. To make things even easier i usually just buy the pre packaged cole slaw bags in the produce dept. They have the carrots and cabbage already chopped. I just chop them up smaller and use that instead of cutting up my own fresh ingredients. ; name: chvre with pistachios and honey ; ingredients: fresh goat cheese, half-and-half, orange blossom honey, roasted pistachios, crackers ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350. In a bowl, whisk goat cheese and half-and-half until smooth. Spoon into a small, shallow gratin dish, spreading level. Bake until cheese is hot in center and beginning to firm up at edges, about 15 minutes. Drizzle cheese with honey and sprinkle with pistachios. Serve with crackers. ; name: simmered sirloin with gravy ; ingredients: boneless beef top sirloin steaks, onion, sliced mushrooms, garlic, butter, beef stock, worcestershire sauce, all-purpose flour, cold water ; preparation:In large nonstick skillet, cook beef, onions, mushrooms and garlic in butter over medium heat for 5-7 minutes or until meat is brown and no longer pink. Add the beef broth, worcestershire sauce and bring to boil. Reduce heat. Cover and simmer for one hour. Combine flour and water until smooth. Add to beef mixture. Bring to a boil. Cook and stir for 2 minutes or until thickened. ; name: creamy peach freeze ; ingredients: vanilla ice cream, fresh peaches, brown sugar, salt ; preparation:

name: festival sausage crock pot ; ingredients: kielbasa, pineapple chunks in juice, pineapple juice, lemon juice, cornstarch, brown sugar, salt, green pepper, onion, maraschino cherry ; preparation:Combine juices, brown sugar and cornstarch. Boil until thick. Stir in salt. Spray the crock pot with non-stick cooking spray. Put sausage, fruit and veggies in the crock pot, add the juice mixture. Cook on low 4 hours. ; name: lamb and sweet potato slow cooker casserole aust ww 4 pnts ; ingredients: olive oil, lean lamb, onions, garlic cloves, coriander powder, whole cardamom pods, sweet potato, hot water ; preparation:Place lamb, onions, garlic, coriander, cardamom, sweet potato and stock in a 5-litre capacity slow cooker. Season well with salt and pepper. Cover and cook on a low setting for 7 hours. Make sure to split cardamom pods down centre with a large sharp knife. This will help cardamom flavour to infuse in casserole. Unfortunately some of the black seeds may come out during the cooking process, so be careful not to eat them. They arent at all harmful to your health, just a little full-on in flavour. Serve with steamed green beans or broccoli. ; name: mop smoothies ; ingredients: mango, orange, fresh pineapple, vanilla yogurt, honey ; preparation:In blender add yogurt first. Then add orange. Blend until smooth. Add pineapple and honey. Blend. Add mango last and blend until smooth. ; name: 7 up chocolate chip pound cake ; ingredients: butter, sugar, vanilla, eggs, all-purpose flour, cocoa, 7-up soda, semi-sweet chocolate chips ; preparation:Cream butter with an electric mixer. Add sugar and vanilla. Beat until light and fluffy. Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition. Stir in flour and cocoa, blending thoroughly. Stir in 7up. Fold in chocolate chips. Spoon into a well greased 10-inch tube pan. Bake at 350 for 1 hour. Cool in pan on a wire rack for 10 minutes. Remove from pan, cool completely. ; name: cinnamon anise tea ; ingredients: water, anise seeds, cinnamon sticks, sugar, lemon juice, honey, black tea bags ; preparation:In a small saucepan, combine all ingredients, except tea bags, and bring to a boil. Allow to simmer for three minutes. Strain. Pour liquid into serving cups with one tea bag and allow to steep for three minutes or to desired strength. Serve hot. ; name: poor man s pie ; ingredients: 9 inch pie shell, brown sugar, flour, salt, light cream, butter ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400f. Line a large 9-inch pie plate with rolled out pastry dough, prick with a fork and bake for 10 minutes. Remove from oven and reduce heat to 350f. In a small bowl, combine sugar, flour and salt. Mix well and spread evenly over the bottom of the crust. Warm cream in the microwave, and then carefully pour the warmed cream over the sugar mixture, completely covering it. In bits, dab butter over the cream. Bake at 350f for 45 minutes to an hour, or until golden spots form on the top. The filling will seem liquid but will become firmer as it cools. ; name: grilled tuscan chicken ; ingredients: shallot, tomato paste, molasses, garlic, fresh rosemary, fresh oregano, lemon, juice and zest of, dry red wine, chicken ; preparation:In blender or food processor, combine all ingredients except chicken. Process until herbs are finely minced. Place chickens in large shallow dish and pour marinade over them. Cover and refrigerate several hours or overnight, turning several times. Grill chicken over medium-hot coals, turning several times and basting with marinade, until crisp and browned, about 40 minutes. ; name: easy braunschweiger party spread ; ingredients: braunschweiger sausage, cream cheese, green onions, milk, worcestershire sauce, garlic powder ; preparation:

name: caramelized brownies ; ingredients: brownie mix, butter, pecans, light brown sugar ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350f. Prepare the brownie mix according to package directions. Pour batter into a greased 9x13 pan. Melt butter ina small saucepan, add sugar and pecans then cook over medium heat, stirring frequently until all the sugar dissolves. Drizzle the carmel mixture over brownie batter and bake until a toothpick can be inserted and withdrawn cleanly, about 25-30 minutes. ; name: spiced iced coffee ; ingredients: hot coffee, sugar, cinnamon sticks, cloves, allspice, black peppercorns, half-and-half ; preparation:Combine first 6 ingredients. Stir well. Let stand at room temperature 1 hour. Strain and serve over cracked ice. Serve with half-and-half and sugar. ; name: coconut truffles with macadamia nuts ; ingredients: white chocolate, salted macadamia nut, heavy cream, dark rum, unsweetened coconut ; preparation:Finely chop white chocolate until fine and place in a bowl. Pulse nuts in food processor until finely ground bring cream to a simmer in a medium skillet. Remove from heat and stir in rum. Whisk in white chocolate until melted and smooth. Stir in nuts. Pour into a 8-inch square baking pan that has been lined with plastic wrap and chill, uncovered, for about 4 hours. Invert onto a work surface and remove plastic wrap. Cut into 64 squares and roll each piece between your palms to form a ball. When all balls are formed, roll in coconut to cover completely. Store truffles covered and in the fridge until ready to serve. ; name: salmon with sweet potatoes ; ingredients: sweet potatoes, yellow onion, gingerroot, pineapple juice, olive oil, salt, salmon fillets, fresh ground black pepper, slivered almonds, fresh parsley ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Combine sweet potatoes, onion, ginger, juice, oil and salt. Place in a 9-by-13-inch casserole dish, sprayed with cooking spray. Bake, covered, for 40 minutes. Remove from oven. Top with salmon. Grind on pepper. Return to oven uncovered and bake 10 to 12 minutes, until fish is done to your liking. Garnish with almonds and parsley. ; name: cheesy onion soup ; ingredients: shortening, onions, flour, milk, american cheese, salt, pepper, paprika ; preparation:Melt shortening in a pot and add the onions. Cook till browned. Add flour, stirring constantly. Add milk, stirring constantly. When soup gets hot and thick, add the cheese and stir till cheese is melted and soup is smooth. Season with salt and pepper. Shake paprika on top of soup in bowl and serve. ; name: cheese and sour cream potatoes ; ingredients: potatoes, sour cream, cream of chicken soup, cheddar cheese, butter, onions, salt, ground black pepper, corn flakes ; preparation:In a 4-quart dutch oven cook potatoes in enough boiling water to cover for 20 to 25 minues or until just tender. Drain. Cool slightly. Peel and coarsely shred or finely chop potatoes. Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In large bowl stir together sour cream, soup, cheese, melted butter, onion, salt and pepper. Gently stir in potatoes. Transfer to greased 3-quart rectangular baking dish. Sprinkle with cornflakes. Bake, covered, for 40 minutes. Uncover, bake about 15 minutes more until golden. ; name: mango rum cake ; ingredients: mango, butter recipe cake mix, eggs, butter, light rum, water ; preparation:Spray the bottom of a 10 inch tube pan or bundt pan with a non-stick vegetable spray and dust with flour. Arrange mango cubes in the bottom of the pan. Blend together rum, water, eggs, butter, and pureed mango. Add cake mix and beat at medium speed for 4 minutes. Pour batter into prepared pan and bake at 375f for 45 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the cake comes out clean. Cool cake 20 minutes in the pan. Loosen and remove from pan onto serving plate. ; name: tortilla campesina potato pudding ; ingredients: olive oil, onions, smoked bacon, garlic powder, potato, cream, paprika, salt and black pepper, eggs ; preparation:

name: best of all macaroni cheese ; ingredients: macaroni, egg, small curd cottage cheese, sour cream, cheese, salt and pepper, basil ; preparation:Combine egg, cottage cheese, sour cream, cheese, salt, and pepper in a large bowl. Add cooked pasta and mix together. Place in any casserole dish. Cook at 350 degrees for a half an hour. Sprinkle with basil for extra flavor. ; name: sizzling sherry shrimp with garlic ; ingredients: olive oil, garlic cloves, crushed red pepper flakes, paprika, medium shrimp, dry sherry, salt & freshly ground black pepper, parsley ; preparation:Heat olive oil, garlic, red pepper flakes, and paprika in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Once the oil is hot and the garlic has turned golden brown, increase heat to high and add the shrimp. Cook until the shrimp turn pink and opaque, about 3 minutes. Deglaze the pan with sherry or lemon juice and season to taste with salt and pepper. Serve garnished with chopped parsley. ; name: fresh tomato and roasted garlic salad dressing ; ingredients: garlic, olive oil, tomatoes, lemon juice, scallions, vinegar, basil ; preparation:Heat oven to 350 degrees. Brush the garlic cloves with 1 teaspoon of the oil, reserving the remaining oil. Roast the oiled garlic cloves in a pan until golden and soft, about 10 to 15 minutes. Watch carefully so garlic does not get over-brown or burn. Carefully remove pan from oven and cool. When cool enough to handle, squeeze out the garlic pulp. Combine the pulp with the reserved olive oil and rest of the ingredients in a blender. Blend until smooth and use the dressing on any mixed garden salad. Refrigerate leftover. ; name: wine thyme potatoes ; ingredients: potatoes, extra virgin olive oil, sea salt, fresh ground pepper, dry white wine, fresh thyme leaves ; preparation:Pre-heat oven to 200c. Peel potatoes, and slice them cross-wise as thinly as possible by hand using a knife. Put the potato slices in a large bowl and pour the olive oil over. Mix well, insuring all slices are separated and coated with the oil. Salt and pepper the potatoes to taste, and again mix well. Add the thyme and mix well. Place the potatoes in a baking dish. Pour the white wine in the dish and place uncovered in the oven. Bake for 30 to 40 minutes, until the wine has nearly all evaporated and the potatoes become golden and tender. Keep an eye on them the last few minutes because they can crisp quickly at the end. Serve warm from the oven. ; name: low fat pumpkin scones ; ingredients: self-raising flour, sugar, butter, pumpkin, egg, salt, milk, cooking spray ; preparation:Preheat oven to 220c. Cream butter and sugar together. In a large bowl, place flour and salt. Add the egg, pumpkin, creamed butter and sugar and milk to dry mixture and mix with a wooden spoon until just combined. Depending on the wetness of the mixture, you may need to add a little more milk. Lightly grease muffin tray with canola spray and spoon mixture into tray. Bake at 220c for 10-15 mins, or until tops of muffins spring back when lightly touched. ; name: easy scrumptious peach crisp ; ingredients: peaches in light syrup, ground cinnamon, nutmeg, sugar, flour, old fashioned oats, brown sugar, butter, cool whip ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Lightly grease 9 x 13 glass pan. Drain and mix peaches, cinnamon, nutmeg, sugar and 3 tablespoons flour. Add to pan. Mix rest of flour, oats and brown sugar. Cut in butter. Sprinkle butter mixture over peaches. Bake uncovered for 45 minutes. Best served warm with whipped or ice cream. ; name: tomato consomm jamie oliver ; ingredients: tomatoes, vodka, horseradish, salt, black pepper, vinegar, fresh basil, garlic cloves, beetroot ; preparation:Put everything except the beetroot into a food processor and run until slushy. Place 4 layers of clean muslin cheesecloth in a deep bowl. Pour the tomato mixture into the cloth. Tie up the corners of the fabric. Add the slice of beetroot to the bowl to color the liquid. Hang the bag from a shelf in the refrigerator with the bowl underneath for 6-8 hours. Discard the beetroot. Serve in a pretty clear bowl with an ice cube to keep it very cold, a nice basil leaf, and a few drops of very good extra-virgin olive oil. ; name: easy bisquick bread ; ingredients: bisquick, granulated sugar, egg, milk, walnuts ; preparation:

name: baked tilapia w fondue sauce and crab ; ingredients: light butter, flour, salt and pepper, nutmeg, skim milk, fat free sharp cheddar cheese, canned crabmeat, sherry wine, tilapia fillet, paprika ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400. For the sauce, melt the butter in a pan. Stir in the flour and nutmeg until smooth. Gradually stir in the milk. Cook until smooth and thickens a little. Add the cheese, and stir until melted. Add in the sherry and crab meat, mixing well to coat the crab. Season tilapia with salt and pepper. Place the tilapia in an 8x8 pan. Pour the fondue-crab sauce over the tilapia. Sprinkle with the paprika. Bake at 400 for 25-30 minutes. ; name: eggplant aubergine pesto recipe ; ingredients: eggplants, basil, dijon mustard, lemon, balsamic vinegar, salt, black pepper, garlic clove, virgin olive oil ; preparation:Lay eggplant on open flames and char until the skin is toasted. Remove any burned skin, but leave a small amount of charred skin on as it gives a smokey flavor. Take off stem of eggplant and discard. Place eggplant in food processor with the remaining ingredients and blend until smooth. Great on fish, bread and vegetables. ; name: prawns large shrimp topped with crabmeat ; ingredients: tiger shrimp, crabmeat, green onions, butter, garlic cloves, lemon juice, panko breadcrumbs ; preparation:Remove entire shell & tail from the prawns. Butterfly the prawns by cutting down the back almost, but not all the way through, and set aside. Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. In a small skillet, saut the green onion in the butter, and stir in the lemon juice. Add the torn apart crabmeat and panko breadcrumbs. In a large baking dish, sprayed with non-stick spray, spread the prawns open to lay flat. Top the prawns equally with the crab mixture. Bake 12 to 15 minutes, or until the prawns are done. ; name: tomato hamburger macaroni goulash ; ingredients: lean ground beef, italian stewed tomatoes, onion, minced garlic clove, parmesan cheese, macaroni ; preparation:Fry ground beef in large size frying pan until almost all red is gone. Add chopped onion and garlic and continue frying until beef is completely cooked. Add the tomatoes and parmesan cheese and stir completely. Lower heat and simmer while you cook the macaroni. When macaroni is done, just mix it all together and serve. Have your spouse clean up the mess cuz really, who needs the grief. ; name: cracker cookies ; ingredients: dates, nuts, eagle brand condensed milk, cracker, butter, vanilla, powdered sugar, milk ; preparation:Mix first 3 ingredients together. Put in double boiler, cook till thick. Cool. Spread on townhouse crackers. Place on greased cookie sheet. Bake at 300 degrees for 10 minutes. Cool, then ice. ; name: copycat rainforest cafe volcano ; ingredients: brownies, vanilla ice cream, whipped cream, caramel sauce, hot fudge ; preparation:On a chilled large round plate or platter arrange the scoops of ice cream so that they make a pile in the center of the plate. You may use more ice cream or less, up to you. Next, arrange the brownies along the sides of the ice cream so that it looks like a volcano shape. Next, drizzle the top and down the sides with the 2 sauces. Finally, add the whipped cream directly down the center of the volcano and then all over the sides. Drizzle with more sauce and stick a sparkler or streamer in the middle. Make sure you yell volcano when you serve it. ; name: curry yogurt dip ; ingredients: plain yogurt, green onions, mayonnaise, ketchup, curry powder ; preparation:Drain yogurt for 4 hours, or overnight. Combine drained yogurt, 1 tablespoon green onion, mayonnaise, ketchup and curry powder. Stir well. Garnish with remaining green onions. Refrigerate for at least 1 hour to blend flavours. ; name: a quinoa pilaf that you ll love ; ingredients: vegetable oil, onion, carrot, dried oregano, quinoa, chicken broth, salt, frozen peas, lemon juice, black pepper ; preparation:

name: sauted kale red onions with garlic and lemon ; ingredients: kale, boiling water, olive oil, garlic cloves, red onion, soy sauce, lemon juice ; preparation:Tear the leaves off the kale into bite-size pieces. Slice the stems into 1 inch long pieces. Blanch the stems for 2 to 3 minutes. Remove, place in a strainer, quickly rinse under cold water to halt cooking. Blanch the kale leaves for 1 to 2 minutes, and rinse in a strainer under cold water. Drain. Heat the oil in a medium skillet and saut the garlic for 1 minute. Saute the onions for 2 to 3 minutes. Add the kale leaves, stems and shoyu soy sauce. Saut for 2 to 3 minutes, stirring constantly. Sprinkle the lemon juice over and toss to mix. Serve immediately after adding the lemon juice or the leaves may loose their bright green color. ; name: reba mcentire s broccoli casserole ; ingredients: fresh broccoli, cream of mushroom soup, water chestnut, cheez whiz, minute rice, cracker crumb ; preparation:Preheat oven to 375f degrees. Steam broccoli just until crisp. Drain. Mix broccoli, soup, water chestnuts, cheez whiz and rice and place in greased 2-quart casserole. Top with cracker crumbs. Bake 20-30 minutes, or until bubbling. ; name: kabocha spinach soup ; ingredients: kabocha squash, onion, garlic, water, baby spinach leaves, sea salt, pepper, sour cream, crusty bread ; preparation:Bring kabocha squash, onion, and garlic to a boil in 4 cups of water or stock. Simmer at a low boil until squash is completely soft, about 15 minutes. Mash the squash, onion, and garlic with a potato masher in the soup pot. Add the spinach and cook for just a couple more minutes. Season to taste with sea salt and pepper. Garnish with organic sour cream, mozzarella cheese, or crumbled feta. Serve with a thick slice of crusty bread for a warm, satisfying meal. ; name: stilton penne with zest ; ingredients: stilton cheese, cooked chicken breast, butter, heavy cream, milk, liquid smoke, salt, white pepper, orange, zest of, pasta ; preparation:Melt the butter in a large saucepan over low heat. Add the stilton, cream, milk, chicken, and a couple pinches of orange zest. Stir continuously until smooth and velvety in consistency. Add dash of liquid smoke. Meanwhile cook pasta until al dente and drain. Toss sauce with hot pasta and season to taste. ; name: grilled flank steak with rosemary ; ingredients: soy sauce, olive oil, honey, garlic cloves, fresh rosemary, fresh coarse ground black pepper, salt, flank steaks ; preparation:Mix all ingredients except steak in a 13x9x2 inch glass baking dish. Add steak and turn to coat. Cover and refrigerate at least two hours, turning occasionally. Preheat grill or broiler to medium high heat. Remove meat from marinade and discard marinade. Grill steak to desired doneness, about 4 minutes per side for medium rare. Transfer steak to work surface and let stand 5 minutes. Cut across grain into thin strips. Arrange on a platter and serve. ; name: zesty cheerios diet snack ; ingredients: egg white, chili powder, cumin, garlic powder, salt, ground pepper, cheerios toasted oat cereal, nonstick cooking spray ; preparation:Pre-heat oven to 325f. Whisk egg white until foamy. Mix in spices. Stir in cheerios or chex. Coat a large cookie sheet with vegetable spray, and spread mixture on it. Spray the cereal with a light coating of more vegetable spray. Place in oven and stir every 5 minutes, for a total of 15-20 minutes. Cool completely enjoy. ; name: tender flank steak ; ingredients: soy sauce, water, garlic cloves, brown sugar, vegetable oil, ground ginger, black pepper, flank steak ; preparation:In large, resealable plastic bag, or shallow glass container, combine the first seven ingredients and mix well. Add steak, turn to coat. Seal bag, or cover container, and refrigerate for 8 hours or overnight, turning occasionally. Drain and discard marinade. Grill, covered, over medium-hot coals for 6-8 minutes on each side, or until meat reaches desired doneness. ; name: beef patties in gravy ; ingredients: ground beef, dry breadcrumbs, cheddar cheese, garlic powder, egg, mushroom soup, mushrooms, salt ; preparation:

name: mesir wat ethiopian red lentils ; ingredients: onions, garlic cloves, gingerroot, olive oil, turmeric, paprika, cayenne pepper, red lentil, water, salt & pepper ; preparation:Puree onion, garlic, and ginger in a food processor or blender. Heat oil, butter or niter kibbeh in a large, heavy-bottomed saucepan. Add turmeric, paprika and cayenne pepper and stir rapidly to color oil and cook spices through, about 30 seconds. Add onion puree and saut on medium heat until excess moisture evaporates and onion loses its raw aroma, about 5-10 minutes. Do not burn. Add lentils and water. Bring to a boil and simmer till lentils are cooked through and fall apart, about 30-40 minutes. Add water if necessary to keep from drying out. This should be the consistency of a thick paste so that it can be scooped up with injera. Stir in salt and pepper to taste and serve. ; name: spinach basil pesto ; ingredients: spinach leaves, basil leaves, pine nuts, garlic clove, olive oil, parmesan cheese, salt, fresh ground black pepper ; preparation:Combine spinach, basil, pine nuts and garlic in a food processor. Pulse for a few seconds. With the machine running, add olive oil. Process until mixture is creamy. This may need to be done in batches. Transfer to a glass bowl. Stir in cheese, salt, and pepper. ; name: easy risotto with bacon peas ; ingredients: onion, olive oil, butter, streaky bacon, risotto rice, vegetable stock, frozen peas, salt and pepper ; preparation:Finely chop the onion. Heat the olive oil and butter in a pan, add the onions and fry until lightly browned. Add the bacon and fry for a further 5 minutes, until it starts to crisp. Add the rice and stock, and bring to the boil. Stir well, then reduce the heat and cook, covered, for 15-20 minutes until the rice is almost tender. Stir in the peas, add a little salt and pepper and cook for a further 3 minutes, until the peas are cooked. Serve sprinkled with freshly grated parmesan and freshly ground black pepper. ; name: herb crusted chicken bites ; ingredients: dried herbs, fresh whole wheat breadcrumbs, salt and black pepper, flour, eggs, chicken breasts, lemon wedge ; preparation:Preheat oven to 210c place the mixed herbs, breadcrumbs, salt and pepper in a large bowl and mix until combined, then set aside. Place the flour in another bowl and the eggs in a third bowl. Toss the chicken cubes in the flour, dusting off any excess. Working in batches, dip the chicken pieces into the egg, then the breadcrumbs, pressing to coat well. Once all the chicken is crumbed, heat a little oil in a large non-stick frying pan. Cook the chicken in batches until golden. Remove and transfer to a baking tray lined with baking paper. Place in oven for 4-5 minutes or until chicken is cooked through. Serve chicken with lemon wedges and a little whole egg mayonnaise for dipping, if desired. ; name: simple deviled eggs ; ingredients: hard-boiled eggs, miracle whip, paprika, salt, pepper ; preparation:Boil eggs and peel while still warm. Cut eggs lengthwise, remove yolks to a separate bowl. Mash yolks and add miracle whip to your favorite consistency. Add paprika, salt and pepper to taste. Stuff egg whites, and sprinkle more paprika on top. Chill. ; name: fresh corn pie ; ingredients: deep dish pie shells, eggs, whipping cream, salt, yellow onion, fresh corn kernels, extra-sharp cheddar cheese, paprika, fresh parsley ; preparation:Preheat oven to 425. Prick crust well on bottom and sides with fork, par-bake pastry crust with parchment paper and pie weight beans for 5-7 minutes until firm but not brown. Stir together rest of ingredients except paprika and parsley. Pour carefully into pie shell. Sprinkle with a little paprika. Bake 10 minutes, reduce heat to 350 and bake 30 minutes longer or until center is almost firm. Cool about 10 minutes. Garnish with fresh chopped parsley if desired. ; name: flank steak sandwiches with onions and blue cheese ; ingredients: flank steaks, italian dressing, olive oil, onions, salt, fresh ground pepper, sandwich buns, blue cheese ; preparation:Place the steak in a large baking dish. Pour dressing over, marinate 20 minutes. Heat a broiler or grill, broil or grill steak, turning once, until browned on the outside but still pink in the middle, about 10 minutes. Let rest on a cutting board 5 minutes. Meanwhile, heat oil in a skillet over medium-low heat. Add onions, cook, stirring occasionally, until very browned and soft, about 15 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Cut steak across the grain into very thin slices. Place on roll bottoms. Top with cooked onions, blue cheese and roll tops. ; name: jug jug barbados ; ingredients: water, pigeon peas, meat, pork, seasoning, fresh thyme, fresh marjoram, cornflour, salt and pepper, butter ; preparation:

name: freezer coleslaw ; ingredients: cabbage, carrot, green pepper, salt, wine vinegar, sugar, celery seed, mustard seeds ; preparation:Mix veggies with salt. Let stand one hour. Squeeze out juice. Set aside. Boil vinegar, sugar and seeds. Cool. Mix with veggies. Put into small freezer proof containers. ; name: lettuce and egg salad ; ingredients: red leaf lettuce, hard-boiled eggs, olive oil, fresh lemon juice, onions, dill, salt, pepper ; preparation:Clean any yellow leaves from the lettuce. Wash the lettuce very well and cut in pieces. Drain well. Chop the onion and dill. Peel the eggs and cut in medium size pieces, cutting 1 egg in round slices. Mix the lettuce, eggs, onion and dill in a glass bowl. Lay the egg slices on top. Whisk together oil and lemon juice. Drizzle over salad. Salt and pepper to taste. ; name: salmon pate ala villani ; ingredients: canned salmon, cream cheese, liquid smoke, fresh lemon juice, tabasco sauce, onion, salt, fresh parsley ; preparation:In a mixing bowl, mix together salmon, cream cheese, liquid smoke, fresh lemon juice, tabasco sauce, onion and salt. Mix well. Adjust seasonings to taste. Transfer to a smaller bowl, cover and refrigerate to chill, about 1 hour or longer. When chilled, roll mixture into a ball. Roll the ball in finely chopped parsley until coated. Transfer ball to a serving plate. Serve with an assortment of crackers or potato chips. Refrigerate any unused portion. Freshly cooked salmon can also be used. If desired, use 6 green onions finely chopped instead of the regular onion. ; name: cubano marinade ; ingredients: white onion, garlic cloves, orange juice, lime juice, lemon juice, water, dried oregano, cumin seed, salt ; preparation:Put onion, garlic, orange juice, lime juice, lemon juice and water in a blender. Set blender on liquify setting and process until smooth. Add remaining ingredients to blender. Process for one minute more. Marinate meat for at least one hour in mixture. It is better to marinate meats overnight. Marinate fish for no longer than 20 minutes, or it will toughen. Brush meat frequently with the sauce while cooking. ; name: pollo en mojo well sort of ; ingredients: fryer chickens, garlic, sea salt, dried cayenne peppers, cumin seed, paprika, olive oil, red wine vinegar, oil ; preparation:Using a mortar and pestle, mash garlic and salt until creamy. Add cayenne peppers and cumin seeds and continue to mash. Add paprika and mix. Add oil and mix, then add vinegar and mix again. Marinate chicken for 2-3 hours in the refrigerator. Heat a small amount of oil over medium high heat. Fry chicken pieces until cooked through-- for bone-in, about 20 minutes or so, for boneless skinless breasts, about 15 minutes. May also be done on the grill. ; name: honey glazed pea pods carrots ; ingredients: water, carrots, pea pods, butter, cornstarch, honey ; preparation:In 2-qt saucepan bring water to a full boil. Add carrots, cover. Cook over medium heat until carrots are crisply tender. Add pea pods. Continue cooking until pea pods are crisply tender. Drain. Set aside. In same pan melt butter. Stir in cornstarch. Add carrots, pea pods and honey. Cook over medium heat, stirring occasionally, until heated through. ; name: easy indian tacos ; ingredients: frozen bread dough, hamburger, pinto beans, taco seasoning ; preparation:Thaw bread dough until workable. Combine hamburger, taco seasoning and pinto beans and cook until meat is done. Remove meat and beans from heat and let cool. Shape bread dough into the shape of a silver dollar pancake. Place dough in fryer and cook on each side until golden brown. Remove bread from grease and place on paper towel. Top bread with taco meat and beans, shredded lettuce, diced tomatoes, shredded cheese, sour cream, olives, guacamole, hot sauces whatever you like. ; name: south african curried eggs ; ingredients: butter, onions, curry powder, cake flour, salt, fresh ground black pepper, sugar, apple cider vinegar, water, hard-boiled eggs ; preparation:

name: crisp sage and parmesan pork ; ingredients: pork loin steaks, white bread, sage leaf, parmesan cheese, black pepper, egg, oil ; preparation:Lay the pork steaks between two sheets of cling film and bash them with a rolling pin until approximately 1 cm thick. Whiz the bread in a food processor to make bread crumbs. Add the sage leaves. Pulse a few times to roughly chop the leaves. Mix in the grated parmesan. Pour onto a large plate. Season with black pepper. One by one, dip the steaks into the beaten egg, allowing the excess to drip off. Press steaks into the bread crumb mixture on both sides. Heat the oil in a large non stick frying pan. Fry the steaks for 3 to 4 minutes on each side until cooked through. ; name: sinful cookies ; ingredients: saltine crackers, butter, sugar, milk chocolate chips ; preparation:Line a 9 x 13 pan with aluminum foil. Preheat oven to 400. Place saltine crackers in pan in rows. I usually can fit about 24 in the pan. In a saucepan, bring the butter and sugar to a boil. After it begins boiling, boil for 3 minutes. Immediately pour the butter-sugar mixture on the crackers. Bake in the oven for 7 minutes. Take out of the oven, pour chocolate chips over crackers, and smooth them out after they melt. Cool in the fridge until the chocolate has hardened. Cut into squares. ; name: black coffee chocolate cake ; ingredients: flour, sugar, cocoa, baking soda, baking powder, eggs, strong black coffee, buttermilk, grapeseed oil, vanilla ; preparation:Beat it all together in one big bowl. The batter will be very thin. Pour into a greased and floured 13 x 9 inch pan or two 9-inch layer pans. Bake 350f for 35-40 minutes. This is great when filled with creamy peanut butter and frosted with dark chocolate frosting. ; name: prosciutto spinach and egg pies ; ingredients: prosciutto, eggs, spinach, cheddar cheese, cherry tomatoes, sea salt, black pepper ; preparation:Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. Lightly spray a 6 cup muffin tin. Line the muffin cups with the prosciutto slices, pressing the prosciutto into the bottom and sides of each cup. Crack 1 egg into each cup. Sprinkle the spinach over the eggs, then the cheddar cheese, dividing them evenly. Top each serving with 4 tomato halves and season with salt and pepper. Bake the pies for 18 to 20 minutes, until the egg whites are firm and the yolks are starting to set but are still soft in the center. Timing might vary due to oven differences and preferences. Set them aside to cool for about 5 minutes. Run a knife around the edges of each cup to loosen, then lift the pies out of the tin. Serve warm or at room temperature. ; name: sweet sour glaze chicken wings ; ingredients: chicken wings, ketchup, brown sugar, rice vinegar, soy sauce, sesame oil, garlic ; preparation:Rinse and drain chicken wings. Combine remaining ingredients to make glaze. Add chicken wings and stir gently to coat. Cover bowl and refrigerate for at least 1 hour. Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Line a baking pan with aluminum foil and arrange wings on pan. Bake for 25 minutes, turn wings and bake for another 25 minutes until golden brown. Serve immediately. ; name: angel hair with lemon and pine nuts ; ingredients: angel hair pasta, garlic, olive oil, pine nuts, fresh lemon juice, lemons, zest of, flat leaf parsley ; preparation:Bring a large saucepan of salted water to a boil for pasta. In a small saucepan cook garlic in oil over moderately low heat, stirring, until softened and transfer mixture to a large bowl. Add pine nuts, crushing them lightly with the back of a fork, lemon juice, zest, parsley, and salt and pepper to taste. Cook pasta in boiling water until al dente and, reserving 2 tablespoons of the cooking water, drain well. Add pasta with the reserved cooking water to bowl and toss with lemon mixture until it is absorbed. Serve pasta warm or at room temperature. ; name: rich banana pudding ; ingredients: condensed milk, instant vanilla pudding, vanilla wafer, cool whip, banana, water ; preparation:In a mixing bowl, put condensed milk and water. Add pudding and mix with mixer until blended. Put in refrigerator for 5 minutes. Add 1 cup cool whip to mixture and mix with mixer. Put vanilla wafers in dish, pudding next, sliced bananas and repeat. Top with cool whip. ; name: low fat bay shrimp and swiss omelet ; ingredients: egg whites, egg, skim milk, bay shrimp, scallions, extra virgin olive oil, low-fat swiss cheese ; preparation:

name: chilled cucumber and red bell soup with a kick ; ingredients: cucumbers, red bell pepper, rice wine vinegar, fat free sour cream, chicken broth, salt, cayenne pepper, ground oregano, ground coriander, ice cubes ; preparation:Chop the cucumber and bell pepper. Add all ingredients to the blender and puree. Add more liquid if needed. Adjust taste to your liking. Store in the fridge until ready to serve or serve right away. ; name: gold medal chocolate chippers ; ingredients: butter, sugar, brown sugar, eggs, vanilla, baking soda, salt, flour, chocolate chips ; preparation:Heat oven to 350f. Cream softened butter with sugars. Add eggs and vanilla and mix well. Add soda, salt and half of flour and mix until well incorporated. Add remaining flour gradually and mix until well incorporated. Stir in chocolate chips. Drop by rounded tablespoon full onto ungreased cookie sheet. Bake 12-15 minutes until edges are done and centers are still a little chewy. Cool on cookie sheet about 2 minutes. Remove to wire rack to cool completely. ; name: two tone grilled cheese ; ingredients: butter, whole wheat bread, mayonnaise, white bread, process american cheese, swiss cheese ; preparation:Spread desired amount of butter over one side of each slice of whole wheat bread. Spread mayonnaise over one side of each slice of white bread. Place whole wheat bread, buttered side down, on a hot griddle. Layer with american cheese and swiss cheese. Top with white bread, mayonnaise side up. Cook until golden brown on both sides. ; name: almond crunch ; ingredients: almonds, butter, sugar, light corn syrup ; preparation:Line bottom and sides of an 8 or 9-inch pan with aluminum foil. Spray lightly with non stick spray. Set aside. Combine all ingredients in a 10-inch skillet. Over medium heat, bring to a boil, stirring constantly. Boil until mixture turn golden brown, 5-6 minutes. Quickly spread in prepared pan. Cool 15 minutes and break into bite sized pieces. ; name: orange honey sweet potatoes ; ingredients: sweet potatoes, half-and-half, orange juice, golden brown sugar, unsalted butter, orange zest, ground coriander, salt, ground ginger, honey ; preparation:Roast the sweet potatoes at 400 degrees f for about one hour depending on the size of the potatoes. Place the rest of the ingredients in a saucepan, stirring to blend and heat thoroughly. Spoon out the sweet potato from the skins into a large bowl. Add the hot liquid to the potatoes and whip together. Serve immediately, or place in a casserole to be reheated and served later. ; name: easy whole wheat pie crust ; ingredients: whole wheat flour, light brown sugar, shortening, cold water, sea salt ; preparation:Place flour, sugar, salt, sugar, and shortening in large tupperware or other plastic container with lid. Seal tightly. Shake 3 minutes. Open & make sure mixture is uniform. Add water. Shake 3 more minutes & open to see if mixture is large dough ball of uniform consistency. Roll out on floured surface. Can be frozen for later use. ; name: tomatoe rice ; ingredients: olive oil, butter, onion, garlic cloves, tomatoes, vegetable stock, long grain rice, salt and pepper ; preparation:Heat olive oil and butter in saucepan until butter melets in a medium saucepan add the onion and garlic and saut for about 5 minutes or until onion is softened. Add the tomatoes, mix well, cover and simmer for 5 minutes. Add the stock, rice, salt and pepper, mix well and bring to the boil. Cover and simmer very gently for about 20 minutes. Serve hot or cold. ; name: homemade butternut squash soup ; ingredients: butternut squash, vegetable broth, onion, carrots, baking soda, salt, cinnamon, ground black pepper, half-and-half ; preparation:

name: nobody will guess peach cobbler ; ingredients: fresh peaches, sugar, flour, egg, butter, white bread ; preparation:Place the fruit in a buttered 8 x 8 inch baking dish. Cut each slice of bread into five stripe. Place the strips onto the fruit. In a separate bowl, mix the sugar, flour, egg, and melted butter. Pour this mixture evenly over the bread and fruit. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 to 35 minutes or until golden brown. ; name: pickled cabbage and peppers ; ingredients: cabbage, bell peppers, pickling salt, sugar, white wine vinegar, hot pepper flakes, mustard seeds, garlic cloves ; preparation:In a large bowl or cork, toss the cabbage and peppers with the salt. Cover and let stand in a cool place for 8-12 hours. In a non-reactive saucepan, combine the sugar and vinegar. Bring to a boil, then let it cool. Rinse the cabbage, and drain it well. Toss with the pepper flakes, mustard seeds and garlic. Pack the vegetable mixture firmly into pint mason jars. Pour the vinegar mixture over the vegetables. Close the jars with hot two-piece caps. Process the jars for 20 minutes in a boiling water bath. Store the cooled jars in a cool, dry, dark place for at least 3 weeks before eating the cabbage. ; name: diabetic best ever low fat baked chicken ; ingredients: boneless skinless chicken breasts, breadcrumbs, fat-free parmesan cheese, rosemary, basil, oregano, black pepper, parsley flakes, fat-free margarine ; preparation:Pre-heat oven to 375. Mix bread crumbs, cheese and seasoning in shallow bowl. Dip each chicken breast in melted margarine, then in bread crumb mixture. Place each breast on baking sheet sprayed with nonstick cooking spray. Bake for approximately 20-30 minutes or until golden brown and cooked through. ; name: thai flavoured fish packets ; ingredients: sesame oil, leek, bok choy, plaice fillets, lime juice, chili pepper, light soy sauce, sugar, coriander ; preparation:Preheat oven to 200 degrees celsius heat oil in a small frying pan and stir fry leek and bok choy until just starting to wilt. Cut 4 large squares of kitchen foi. Divide veg between them, and lay 2 pieces of fish on top of each square. In small bowl, mix together fish sauce, lime juice, chilli, soy sauce, and sugar. Pour over fish. Seal foil together and place on baking tray. Place tray in oven and cook 10 minutes. Let packets sit for a couple of minutes before opening to prevent steam burns.
