Open and scatter fish with coriander. Serve with noodles. ; name: best ever shrimp dip ; ingredients: gelatin, warm water, cream cheese, tomato soup, green pepper, onion, mayonnaise, baby shrimp ; preparation:Mix onions, green peppers& mayo in bowl and set aside. Over medium heat in medium size pot mix until creamy and well blended cream cheese& tomatoe soup. Rinse both cans of shrimp well under water, set aside to allow water to drip off. In small bowl mix warm water and gelaton until dissolved. Once tomatoe soup and cream cheese is well blended add all ingredients to the pot, mix well. Put shrimp dip into a nice serving bowl that can be refrigerated. Refrigerate until the dip is completely chilled. When the dip is done it will be hard as jello. Serve with a hard cracker, seasame crackers, trisciuts, etc. A cracker that wont break when you dip into it. ; name: crock pot spicy buffalo chicken sandwiches ; ingredients: boneless skinless chicken breasts, buffalo wing sauce, dry ranch dressing mix, butter, sandwich buns ; preparation:Place chicken breasts in the bottom of the crock pot. Pour wing sauce and ranch mix over chicken. Cover and cook on low for 6-7 hours. Once chicken has cooked, uncover, add the butter, and shred chicken with 2 forks until mixed well. Serve on buns. ; name: gluten free dairy free egg free pancakes ; ingredients: tapioca flour, cinnamon, nutmeg, cooking oil, baking powder, water, brown sugar, rice flour ; preparation:Mix all dry ingredients first. Add oil and water, mix well. Use ladle to measure desired mixture into desired non-stick skillet. Cook as desired, flip and cook opposite side. Remove from heat. Use cooking spray to grease skillet with before cooking pancakes, or use 1 teaspoon butter to grease skillet, if desired for added flavor. ; name: barbecued chilean sea bass with orange ; ingredients: sea bass fillet, orange juice, tomato paste, vegetable oil, vinegar, brown sugar, garlic cloves, orange zest, ground ginger, hot red pepper flakes ; preparation:

name: magnificent meatballs ; ingredients: ground beef, tomatoes with juice, fine breadcrumbs, eggs, salt, ground black pepper, oregano, onion, bacon, sour cream ; preparation:Mix together the beef and 2 cups of tomatoes, bread crumbs, eggs, salt, pepper, oregano, and onion. Form into 24 good size meatballs. Wrap each meatball with a bacon slice overlapping bacon carefully. Place the meatballs in a large flat baking dish so that the over lapping bacon is on bottom. Bake at 350f for 45 minutes, or until the bacon is crisp. Remove from oven and pour off the fat. Combine the sour cream and the remaining 2 cups of tomatoes. Pour over the meatballs and return to the oven. Turn off the heat. Serve with rice once the sauce is hot. ; name: apple cinnamon butter crunch ; ingredients: butter, brown sugar, flour, cinnamon, walnuts, apples, nutmeg ; preparation:Set oven to 375 degrees. Butter a 9 x 9-inch or an 11 x 7-inch baking pan. In a mixing bowl combine all the butter crunch. Mix well to combine with a wooden spoon. Sprinkle half of the mixture onto the bottom of the pan and press down light with back of a spoon. Bake for 15 minutes, or until lightly browned. In a mixing bowl combine the apple slices, brown sugar, flour, cinnamon, nutmeg and melted butter. Toss to combine. Spoon the mixture into the baked crust. Bake for about 30 minutes, or until apples are tender. Remove from oven and sprinkle the remaining butter crunch over the apples, then return to oven for about 10 minutes. Cool to room temperature. ; name: blackberry summer dream ; ingredients: frozen blackberries, extra finely granulated sugar, water, brewed coffee, half-and-half, sweetened whipped cream, blackberries ; preparation:Put frozen blackberries in a blender with the sugar and water and puree. Strain mixture into a large mixing bowl. Add the 9 cups of coffee and the pint of half-and-half. Blend well. Pour or spoon into 12-ounce glasses partially filled with crushed ice. Top with whipped cream and whole blackberries. ; name: southern spiced tea ; ingredients: boiling water, tea leaves, lemon, juice of, whole cloves, oranges, juice of, sugar, water ; preparation:Add boiling water to tea, steep 5 minutes. Strain. Make a syrup by boiling the sugar, cloves and water. Add this syrup and fruit juices to the tea. Serve hot or cold. ; name: sweet and tangy chicken ; ingredients: roasting chicken, mayonnaise, dry onion soup mix, russian salad dressing, apricot-pineapple preserves, cooked rice ; preparation:In a 12x8x2 inch dish, arrange chicken pieces with the thickest, meaty pieces to the outside edges of the dish. In a small bowl, stir together the mayonnaise, soup mix, dressing and preserves. Spread this mixture over the chicken, coating each piece well. Cover with wax paper. Microwave on high for 18-22 minutes. Let stand 5-10 minutes before you serve it so the chicken absorbs the flavor of the sauce. Serve over rice. ; name: strawberry cheesecake oatmeal ; ingredients: oat bran, light cream cheese, strawberries, vanilla extract, graham cracker squares, sugar substitute ; preparation:Pour oat bran in a large bowl and add enough water to cover, stir. Microwave for about 2 minutes. Add light cream cheese and stir until smooth. Add vanilla extract. Add sugar substitute. Stir in strawberries. Crush graham crackers in your hands and sprinkle over the oatmeal. ; name: refrigerator cucumber slices ; ingredients: cucumbers, onions, sugar, cider vinegar, pickling salt, mustard seeds, alum ; preparation:In a large container, combine cucumbers and onions. In a large bowl, combine the remaining ingredients, stirring, until sugar is dissolved. Pour over cucumber mixture. Mix well. Cover and chill overnight. May be refrigerated for up to 2 weeks. ; name: grilled red potatoes ; ingredients: red potatoes, olive oil, garlic, salt ; preparation:

name: english muffin panini with goat cheese and tomato ; ingredients: english muffins, pesto sauce, goat cheese, tomatoes, radicchio ; preparation:Spread toasted side of each english muffin half with pesto. Spread cheese over 4 english muffin halves. Top with tomato slices, radicchio, and remaining english muffin halves. Spray panini with cooking spray. Coat skillet or grill pan with cooking spray and heat over medium heat. Place panini in pan. Weight with smaller-diameter saucepan weighted with 2 cans. Cook 2 minutes. Flip, replace weight, and cook 2 minutes more. ; name: chicken ragu ; ingredients: olive oil, boneless skinless chicken thighs, pepper, salt, garlic cloves, shallot, white wine, rosemary, marinara sauce ; preparation:Heat the oil in a large pan then add the chicken seasoning with salt and pepper. Cook until the chicken is golden and the juices evaporate approximately 10 minutes. Add the garlic and shallots sauteing until tender. Add the wine and scrape up all the brown bits at the bottom of the pan. Add the marinara sauce and rosemary mixing well. Reduce heat to medium low and simmer gently for 10 minutes. ; name: garlic cheese biscuits ; ingredients: bisquick, milk, cheddar cheese, butter, garlic salt ; preparation:Mix bisquick, milk and cheddar cheese until a soft ball forms. Beat vigorously for 30 seconds. Drob by balls onto ungreased baking sheet. Bake at 450 degrees for 8-10 munutes. Melt butter. Mix butter and garlic salt. Brush garlic butter on rolls while still hot on the pan. ; name: rice cooker polenta ; ingredients: cornmeal, water, parmesan cheese, green onions, olive oil, oregano, basil, thyme, marjoram, sage ; preparation:Place all ingredients in rice cooker. Start cooking cycle. After cycle is complete, wait an additional 10 minutes to allow the polenta to absorb all the liquid. Stir well before serving. If you like firmer polenta, let it stand for 5 minutes prior to serving. ; name: yakitori chicken on skewers ; ingredients: chicken thigh fillet, sake, soy sauce, mirin, sugar, spring onions ; preparation:Soak 25 wooden skewers in water for 20 minutes. Cut chicken into bit size pieces. Combine sake, soy, mirin, and sugar in small pan, bring to boil, set aside. Thread chicken on skewers, alternatively with the scallions. Place skewers on foil lined tray and cook under preheated grill, turning and brusshing frequently with sauce for 7 - 8 mins, or til chicken is cooked. ; name: honey nut acorn squash ; ingredients: acorn squash, butter, honey, pecans, raisins, worcestershire sauce ; preparation:Heat the oven to 400f. Place squash, seeds still in, cut side up on a cookie sheet and bake for 45 minutes or until soft. Remove from oven and scoop out the seeds and fibers. Mix remaining ingredients and distribute evenly into the cavity of each squash. Return to oven for apprx 10 minutes. Serve. ; name: diet pineapple muffins ; ingredients: flour, baking powder, artificial sweetener, salt, margarine, crushed pineapple, egg ; preparation:Combine flour, baking powder, sweetner and salt. Add melted butter. Add beaten egg and 19 oz tin of crushed pineapple. Ingredients will be very thick in texture. Line your muffin pan cups with cupcake papers. Bake 18 minutes at 400f. ; name: emeril s salmon ; ingredients: basil leaves, butter, garlic cloves, hot sauce, tomatoes, lemon, bay leaf, salt, pepper, salmon fillets ; preparation:

name: club sandwich ; ingredients: bread, mayonnaise, american cheese, ham, tomatoes, lettuce, crisp bacon, monterey jack cheese, deli turkey ; preparation:Spread mayonnaise on one side of a piece of toast. Add layer of american cheese, ham, two slices of tomato, two leaves of lettuce, and two pieces of bacon. Spread mayonnaise on second piece of toast and place on top, mayo side down. Spread mayonnaise on top of that second piece of toast. Layer monterey jack cheese, the rest of the tomatoes, lettuce, turkey and bacon on top. Spread mayonnaise on third piece of toast and place on the stack mayo side down. Slice the sandwich in quarters diagonally. Skewers or long toothpicks may be used to hold all the layers together. ; name: greek cocktail meatballs keftethes ; ingredients: ground beef, soft breadcrumbs, salt, cinnamon, garlic clove, onion, parsley, dried spearmint, egg ; preparation:Combine all ingredients -- you will have to mix this with your hands. Roll into balls. Refrigerate 1 hour, or overnight. Heat equal amounts of olive oil and butter. Flour and brown until dark golden brown. ; name: smoked shrimp with poblano tomatillo sauce ; ingredients: tomatillo, poblano chiles, whipping cream, shallot, butter, salt, charcoal, hickory wood chunks, jumbo shrimp ; preparation:Using a blender puree tomatillos and chilies. Transfer pureed mixture to a skillet and add cream and shallot, cooking over medium high heat, stirring until thickened. Strain sauce. Over low heat whisk in butter 1 tablespoon at a time and season with salt. Keep warm. In a barbecue, heat the mesquite charcoal and hickory chunks until coals are white. Add more hickory chunks. As soon as smoke rises, push coals and chunks to one side of barbecue. Oil grill well. Arrange shrimp on side of grill not over heat source. Cover and smoke for 6-8 minutes or until shrimp is opaque. Serve shrimp with sauce. ; name: shake a pie crust ; ingredients: flour, sugar, crisco shortening, cold water, salt ; preparation:Put flour, sugar, salt and crisco shortening in a plastic bowl with a lid. Seal and wink. Shake until it sounds like sand. Add water. Seal and wink. Shake until it sounds like a rock. Roll out for your favorite pie or pastries. ; name: fried scallops chinese style ; ingredients: scallops, rice wine vinegar, salt and pepper, cornstarch, salt, egg, fine breadcrumbs, oil ; preparation:Wash scallops pat dry with paper towel. Mix together marinade and let scallops stand in marinade for 15 minutes. Combine cornstarch and salt in a plastic bag. Shake several scallops in bag dip in egg then in bread crumbs. Heat oil in wok to 350. Lower heat some and lower scallops into oil and fry until brown about 2 minutes. Drain on paper towels. ; name: mimi s cornmeal scones ; ingredients: flour, cornmeal, baking powder, baking soda, salt, firm butter, buttermilk ; preparation:Mix first 5 ingredients in a medium bowl. Cut in the butter using pastry blended till it looks like fine crumbs. Stir in buttermilk so dough leaves sides of bowl and forms a ball. Turn dough onto lightly floured surface and knead lightly about 10 times. Pat or roll into a 7-inch circle on ungreased cookie sheet that has been sprinkled with cornmeal. Score into 8 wedges, cutting down halfway to the bottom. Bake in 400 degree oven for 20-25 minutes or till light brown. Immediately remove from sheet and carefully separate wedges. Serve warm. ; name: herbed beef tenderloin with sour cream mustard sauce ; ingredients: fresh parsley, dijon mustard, rosemary, thyme, garlic cloves, extra virgin olive oil, black pepper, beef tenderloin, light sour cream ; preparation:Preheat oven to 325f. In a small bowl mix together parsley, rosemary, thyme, garlic, oil, pepper, and 2 tbsp of dijon mustard. Rub mixture all over tenderloin and place in a shallow roasting pan. Insert meat thermometer into center of meat, if desired. Roast uncovered for 30-45 minutes or until thermometer reads 140f for medium rare-medium doneness. Remember meat will continue to cook while standing. Remove meat, cover with foil, and let stand 15 minutes to let juices redistribute. While meat is standing, in another small bowl, stir together the sour cream and 2 tsp dijon mustard. Slice tenderloin. Serve warm with sour cream mustard sauce drizzled atop. Also great thinly sliced over a hearty salad. ; name: cinnamon sugared pecans ; ingredients: pecans, egg white, water, brown sugar, white sugar, salt, cinnamon ; preparation:

name: rice with chayote fritanga ; ingredients: vegetable oil, chayote, onion, garlic cloves, cooked rice, tomatoes, salt, pepper, chives ; preparation:Heat 2 tablespoons vegetable oil in 12 inch skillet until hot. Cook and stir chayote over medium heat until crisp-tender, about 5 minutes. Remove from heat. Cook and stir onion and garlic in 1 tablespoon oil until onion is tender, about 5 minutes. Stir in rice, cook and stir until hot, about 8 minutes. Stir in chayote, tomato, salt and pepper. Cook and stir until tomato is hot, 3 to 5 minutes. Sprinkle with chives. ; name: season s crock pot chicken rice soup ; ingredients: cooked chicken, onion, healthy request cream of mushroom soup, healthy request cream of chicken soup, green chilies, garlic salt, pepper, seasoning salt, rice ; preparation:Pour two soup cans into crock pot, fill the soup cans each with water and pour into the crock pot. Mix together well. Add spices, onion, chicken and chilis, mix again. During the last hour of cooking add the rice. Cook on low for 6-8 hours or high for 3-4 hours. You can also let this thicken up and serve in tortillas. ; name: roasted garlic mashed sweet potatoes ; ingredients: garlic, olive oil, sweet potatoes, butter, whipping cream, white pepper ; preparation:Cut the top off unpeeled garlic head. Drizzle with olive oil, place in baking pan & bake & 250 degrees for 30 - 40 minutes. Bake the potatoes at 400 degrees for 1 hour or until tender. Cut potatoes in half, scoop into saucepan and mash. Squeeze roasted garlic into the mashed potatoes. Add butter, mash while adding cream a little at a time. Add salt & pepper to taste. ; name: grandma martha s cole slaw ; ingredients: head of cabbage, carrots, green onions, salt and pepper, vinegar, sugar, miracle whip ; preparation:Chop together cabbage, carrots, and green onion. Add salt and pepper. Add vinegar, and sugar. Add miracle whip. Mix together and chill before serving. ; name: chocolate marvel pie ; ingredients: pie crusts, semi-sweet chocolate chips, sugar, milk, eggs, vanilla, whipped cream, almonds ; preparation:Melt chocolate pieces with sugar and milk in double boiler, stirring occasionally. Cool. Beat in egg yolks, one at a time. Stir in vanilla. In separate bowl, beat egg whites until stiff. Fold into chocolate mixture. Pour into cooled pie shell. Refrigerate several hours or overnight. If desired, garnish with whipped cream and sprinkle with roasted chopped almonds. ; name: cinnamon biscuit blossoms ; ingredients: pillsbury grands refrigerated buttermilk biscuits, sugar, cinnamon, sugar-free raspberry jam ; preparation:Heat oven to 375f. Separate dough into 8 biscuits. Make 5 cuts evenly around outside edge of each biscuit to resemble flower petals. Place each biscuit flower on ungreased large cookie sheet. In small bowl, combine sugar and cinnamon. Mix well. Sprinkle sugar mixture over biscuits. With thumb, make deep indentation in center of each biscuit. Fill each with scant teaspoon jelly. Bake at 375f for 11 to 17 minutes or until golden brown. Serve warm. ; name: baked fennel with saffron ; ingredients: fennel, onion, garlic cloves, butter, olive oil, hot chicken stock, white wine, saffron, salt & freshly ground black pepper ; preparation:Preheat the oven to 425 degrees f. Place fennel, onion and garlic into an oiled baking dish using the 2 tablespoons oil. Combine saffron, chicken broth and white wine and pour over fennel season with salt and pepper. Dot with butter. Cover and bake for 25 - 30 minutes. If desired, uncover the baking dish toward the end of the cooking time, to allow any excess liquid to evaporate. Garnish with the fennel fronds. ; name: caramel almond fudge ; ingredients: brown sugar, heavy cream, salt, almonds ; preparation:

name: potato egg bake ; ingredients: butter, onion, frozen hash browns, eggs, milk, salt, pepper, cheddar cheese, bacon ; preparation:Cook, drain and crumble bacon. Melt butter or margarine in a skillet. Add onions and hash browns. Cook and stir until potatoes are lightly browned. Grease a 9x13 inch pan and place hash browns in the bottom of the pan. Beat eggs, milk and salt and pepper 1- 2 minutes. Stir in grated cheese and bacon. Pour over potatoes. Bake at 350 degrees 45-50 minutes, until a knife inserted comes out clean. ; name: paul linda mccartney zucchini with apples ; ingredients: zucchini, onion, fresh tomatoes, fresh parsley, fresh ground black pepper, butter, apples, salt ; preparation:Set a small pan of water to boil. Drop the zucchini slices into the water for 30 seconds. Remove immediately and drain. Melt the butter in a large pot and saute the onion until it is transparent. Add the apples and stir well. Add the tomatoes and the blanched zucchini. Stir well, then add the parsley. Season the mixture with salt and pepper and cook, covered, over a gentle heat for 5 to 10 minutes, until the zucchini is soft. Serve hot. ; name: pork sauteed with sauerkraut ; ingredients: bacon, boneless pork chop, yellow onion, garlic, sauerkraut, paprika, sugar, lager beer, salt and pepper ; preparation:Render the fat out of the bacon, then cook until crisp. Removed the bacon from the pan, without draining oil. Saute the onion in the bacon fat until nicely caramelized. Add the pork strips and brown on all sides. Add salt and pepper to taste. Add garlic about 1 minute before the pork is done. Add the sauerkraut and saute about 10 minutes, until the sauerkraut starts to brown and wilt a bit. Sprinkle the sugar over the sauerkraut and mix in. Mix the paprika into the beer, and add to the pan. Cook until most of the beer has evaporated. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve with reserved bacon crumbled on top. ; name: mojito limeade ; ingredients: fresh mint leaves, limes, ice, white rum, fresh lime juice, club soda, sugar, water, limes, zest of ; preparation:To make the lime-mint syrup, bring the sugar and water to a boil cook until completely dissolved, only about 1 minute. Remove from heat, stir in the lime zest and mint, and let sit for about 30 minutes. Strain, cover and refrigerate until chilled. Muddle mint and lime with the crushed ice in the bottom of a large pitcher. Add chilled lime-mint syrup, rum, lime juice, and more ice. Top off with chilled club soda, to taste. Pour into glasses over crushed ice and serve. Garnish each cocktail glass with a lime slice and mint sprigs. ; name: pineapple chutney ; ingredients: wine vinegar, sugar, fresh pineapple, jalapeno chile, fresh gingerroot, ground cumin, ground cardamom, ground cinnamon, white pepper ; preparation:Combine vinegar and sugar in large saucepan. Simmer and stir until sugar dissolves. Add pineapple and simmer until soft. Strain pineapple and set aside, return juices to pan. Add chile, ginger and spices to pan. Simmer and reduce au nape. Mix spiced syrup with pineapple. Refrigerate immediately. ; name: oatmeal buttermilk muffins ; ingredients: butter, brown sugar, egg, quick-cooking oatmeal, buttermilk, flour, salt, baking powder, baking soda, cinnamon ; preparation:Cream butter and sugar. Add egg. Add oatmeal. Add buttermilk. Then add flour. Salt baking powder and baking soda. Mix well. Bake in greased muffin tin 350 for 20 to 25 minutes. ; name: grilled steak ; ingredients: crushed pineapple, crystallized ginger, teriyaki sauce, garlic, onions, brown sugar, black pepper, steak, port wine ; preparation:Place all ingredients except for steak in storage bag and give a shake to mix marinade. Add steak and marinade 6-8 hours or even overnight. Remove steak from marinade. Bring steak to room temperature. Place marinade in a small saucepan add 2 tablespoons port and simmer 5-10 minutes. Grill steak on a medium high heat for 4-6 minutes each side. Let steak sit for 10 minutes before slicing and serve along with the hot sauce. ; name: quick provencal mushroom and white bean stew ; ingredients: olive oil, fresh white mushroom, onion, garlic, herbes de provence, vegetable broth, diced tomatoes, dry white wine, cannellini beans ; preparation:

name: oklahoma dirt cake ; ingredients: oreo cookies, cream cheese, butter, powdered sugar, french vanilla instant pudding, cool whip, milk, vanilla ; preparation:Crush half the oreo cookies in bottom of pan. Mix margarine, sugar, cream cheese together. In separate bowl, mix pudding, vanilla and milk. Fold in cool whip. Mix both bowls together. Spread over cookies. Crush remaining cookies and sprinkle on top. ; name: glorified hash ; ingredients: corn beef hash, cheese, flour, salt, pepper, nutmeg, dry mustard, eggs, milk ; preparation:Crumble hash in casserole or 9x9-inch pan and sprinkle with cheese. Combine the flour, salt, nutmeg, pepper, mustard, egg, and milk. Pour over the corned beef mixture. Bake at 350f for 35 minutes or until the custard is set. Partially cool. ; name: walt s favorite chocolate soda ; ingredients: chocolate syrup, vanilla ice cream, cola, maraschino cherry ; preparation:Pour chocolate syrup in the bottom of an 8-ounce milk shake glass. Smoosh in one scoop of ice cream. Slowly pour in soda water almost to top of glass. Perch another scoop of ice cream on top. Add a cherry and a colorful straw or two. ; name: crunchy banana pops ; ingredients: bananas, honey, rice krispies, wooden popsicle sticks, chocolate ; preparation:Peel bananas and cut them in half. Insert popsicle sticks into cut ends of the bananas. Place on wax paper and freeze until firm, at least 1 hour. Coat frozen bananas with honey and roll in rice krispies. Eat immediately, or freeze until ready to serve. Finish with chocolate drizzle, if desired. ; name: low fat ice cream cassata slice ; ingredients: low-fat chocolate ice cream, pine nuts, low-fat vanilla ice cream, dried apricots, dried figs, dried peaches, glace green cherries, glace red cherries ; preparation:Line a 20 cm x 10 cm bar tin with enough plastic wrap to hang down the sides of the tin. Put the chocolate ice cream and pine nuts in a bowl and mix to combine. Spoon the mixture into the base and up the sides of the tin, leaving the centre hollow. Freeze until firm. Mix the vanilla icecream with the dried fruit and spoon into the bar tin over the chocolate ice cream. Smooth the surface and cover with overhanging plastic wrap. Freeze overnight until firm. Remove from the tin, discard the plastic and slice with a knife heated in hot water. ; name: broccoli tofu and peppers in orange sauce ; ingredients: broccoli, red bell pepper, onions, garlic clove, firm tofu, vegetable oil, cornstarch, orange juice, dijon mustard ; preparation:Saut onion, broccoli, tofu and bell pepper in oil. In a bowl, combine the sauce ingredients. Add to the veggies. Cook until thickened and bubbly. Serve with rice. ; name: marinated cucumber salad on salad greens ; ingredients: olive oil, white wine vinegar, frozen orange juice concentrate, honey, red pepper flakes, kosher salt, cucumbers, grape tomatoes, green onions, mixed salad greens ; preparation:In a bowl combine first 5 ingredients, mixing well. Add salt to your taste. Add cucumber mix to bowl, tossing to coat. Set aside at room temperature to marinate 30 minutes. Arrange chilled prepared salad mix on plates. Spoon cucumber mixture on top. ; name: pepper jack spinach pizza pie ; ingredients: bacon, frozen chopped spinach, monterey jack pepper cheese, fresh ground black pepper, prepared pizza crust, olive oil, parmesan cheese ; preparation:

name: fresh cranberry muffins ; ingredients: sugar, eggs, butter, almond extract, flour, fresh cranberries, pecans ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Spray muffin pan with cooking spray. Beat sugar and eggs together until thickened. Add melted butter and almond extract. Beat well. Add flour. Beat well. Stir in cranberries and pecans. Fill muffin pan. Since these do not raise much fill the cups to the top. Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes or until browned on top and done in center. Cool on wire rack. ; name: zesty appetizer wheels ; ingredients: hard salami, crescent rolls, parmesan cheese, italian seasoning ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350f. Open the dough to 2 rectangles. Press the perforation to seal. Sprinkle each rectangle with 3 tbsp parmesan and 1 tsp italin seasoning. Lay 6 slices salami along the side of the rectangle. Roll the dough up and pinch the ends. Cut each roll into 8 slices. Place on cookie sheet and bake for 13 min or until golden brown. You can substitute 24 pepperoni for 12 salami slices. ; name: princesses bulgarian ground meat sandwiches ; ingredients: ground beef, egg, onion, dried thyme, salt, ground black pepper, ground cumin, ground coriander, ground ginger, bread ; preparation:Combine ground beef, egg, onion, thyme, black pepper, cumin, coriander, and ginger in a bowl. Knead well. Mixture should be soft enough to spread. If it is not, add an extra egg. In this recipe too soft is better than too thick. Spread the mixture over the bread slices. Place in an oven at medium to high heat. Bake for 5 to 10 minutes or until meat is golden and cooked through. ; name: cranberry and lime sparkler ; ingredients: cranberry juice, lemon lime and bitters soft drink, limes, sugar cubes, sparkling white wine ; preparation:Combine cranberry juice, soft drink and limes in a large jug. Place 1 sugar cube into each chilled champagne glass. Pour in 100ml sparkling white wine. Top with cranberry and lime mixture. Serve immediately. ; name: metric jester s famous homemade bread ; ingredients: warm water, sugar, salt, fast rising yeast, extra virgin olive oil, flour ; preparation:Dissolve sugar and salt in warm water, then stir in yeast. Allow yeast mixture to sit for 5 to 10 min. Place flour into mixing bowl, making a hole in the centre. Drizzle oil over flour, and then combine yeast and flour mixes. Knead on a floured surface until it creates a ball. Place in bread pan and allow to rise 2 hours. If dough is double in size, preheat oven to 350f. Bake until golden. If using a breadmaker, be sure to follow the proper directions for your bread maker, however i suggest you dissolve the sugar and salt in the water first. ; name: garlic pork cutlets with buttered cabbage ; ingredients: olive oil, pork loin chops, potatoes, garlic, salt & freshly ground black pepper, white wine, butter, cabbage ; preparation:Preheat oven to 200 degree celsius. Heat oil in a frypan that will take the cutlets in a single layer and which will go into a preheated oven. Over a moderately high heat, brown the chops on both sides until they are golden, remove to a plate. Add the potatoes and cook them until they are a golden colour, remove to a plate. Add the bruised garlic and cook for a minute of so longer. Add the chops back into the pan, and top with the potatoes and some of the bruised garlic. Season with salt and pepper and pour over the wine and boil for a few minutes. Put pan into the oven and cook for 15 minutes. Meanwhile melt the butter in a medium pot and add the cabbage and season with pepper and salt, cover and cook over a low heat for 3 to 5 minutes. To serve place a bed of cabbage on the plates and top with a chop and a portion of the garlic and potatoe wedges. ; name: candy carrot coins ; ingredients: carrot, butter, brown sugar, water ; preparation:Peel the carrots, then slice each one into rounds. Place the carrot coins in a microwave-safe bowl, cover them with water, and cover the bowl with plastic wrap. Microwave for 6 to 7 minutes or until the carrots are tender but not mushy. Drain the water and set the carrots aside. In a small frying pan, melt the butter, stir in the brown sugar and water, and cook for 1 minute. Add the carrot coins and toss to coat with the brown sugar mixture. Cook on low for 3 to 4 minutes or until the carrots are thoroughly glazed. ; name: sprinkle nut cake ; ingredients: yellow cake mix, vanilla instant pudding mix, vegetable oil, water, eggs, walnuts, chocolate sprinkles ; preparation:

name: lime mousse ; ingredients: whipping cream, sugar, lime juice, lime zest, vanilla extract, lime slice, of fresh mint ; preparation:In a mixing bowl, combine the cream, sugar, lime juice, peel and vanilla. Beat on high speed until soft peaks form, about 4 minutes. Spoon into dessert dishes. Garnish with lime and mint, if desired. Refrigerate until ready to serve. ; name: quick sticky buns ; ingredients: unsalted butter, banana, pecans, brown sugar, refrigerated buttermilk biscuits ; preparation:Heat oven to 375 drgrees. Drop a piece of butter in the bottom of each of 10 compartments of a muffin tin. Arrange the banana slices on top. Sprinkle the pecans and brown sugar over the bananas. Top each compartment with a biscuit. Bake until golden, about 8-10 minutes. Remove from oven. Place a baking sheet on top of the buns in the muffin tin while they are atill hot. Carefully flip the tin over, tapping the bottom to release the buns. Transfer to a platter, serve warm. ; name: scotch butterscotch sauce ; ingredients: light brown sugar, heavy cream, unsalted butter, dark corn syrup, scotch whisky, vanilla ; preparation:In a medium saucepan, bring the sugar, cream, butter and corn syrup to a boil over medium heat stirring constantly. Lower heat and boil gently, stirring often, until sauce thickens and coats the back of a wooden spoon. Remove from heat and stir in whiskey and vanilla. Allow to cool slightly before serving. Can be refrigerated up to one week. Warm gently before serving. ; name: leftover turkey casserole ; ingredients: prepared stuffing, sour cream, condensed cream of mushroom soup, condensed cream of celery soup, dry onion soup mix, french style green beans, sliced mushrooms, turkey meat ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Stir together sour cream, condensed soups, and dry onion soup mix in a mixing bowl. Spread the turkey in the bottom of a buttered 9x13-inch casserole dish. Top with green beans and mushrooms. Spread the soup over the meat and vegetable mixture. Crumble the stuffing and spread evenly over the top. Bake at 350f for 25-30 minutes or until heated through and bubbly. ; name: cajun fried cucumbers ; ingredients: cucumbers, salt and pepper, cajun seasoning, eggs, breadcrumbs, bacon drippings ; preparation:Season cucumbers with salt, pepper and cajun seasoning. Dip the slices in the beaten eggs. Coat the slices with breadcrumbs. Heat the bacon drippings and fry the cucumbers until brown on both sides. Drain and serve hot. ; name: sole with light lemon sauce ; ingredients: low sodium chicken broth, garlic cloves, carrots, asparagus, sole fillet, flour, butter, dry white wine, lemon peel ; preparation:In large deep skillet, add broth, garlic, carrots and asparagus and bring to boil. Reduce heat to medium low, add fish and cook for about 3 minutes until fish is done. Carefully remove fish and veggies with a slotted spoon to serving plate. Cover and keep warm. Mix together flour and butter. Bring the broth to a boil and gradually whisk in the butter mixture until sauce begins to thicken. Remove from heat and whisk in wine, lemon rind and juice. Season with pepper is desired. Pour sauce over fish and veggies. Serve with potatoes, brown rice or a multigrain roll. ; name: stevia chocolate chip cookies ; ingredients: flour, salt, baking soda, fat free greek yogurt, stevia powder, pumpkin puree, vanilla, eggs, unsweetened baking chocolate, chocolate chips ; preparation:In a bowl mix together flour, salt, and baking soda. Set aside. In the bowl of a mixer cream yogurt, pumpkin or banana, vanilla and stevia powder until creamy, scraping the sides down at least one time. Add in eggs one at a time. Slowly add the flour mixture. Chop the unsweetened chocolate into very small peices. Add in all the chocolate and mix. Drop by tb size onto a cookie sheet. Then with lightly wet fingers pat down the top of the cookie until flat. Bake at 350 for 15-18 minutes or until golden brown. ; name: afghani inspired spinach dish ; ingredients: frozen spinach, diced onion, ginger, garlic, cayenne pepper, curry powder, garam masala, salt, yogurt, grapeseed oil ; preparation:

name: two potato mash ; ingredients: potatoes, sweet potatoes, milk, cheddar cheese, sour cream, green onions, salt, nutmeg ; preparation:Peel and quarter regular potatoes. Peel and cut sweet potatoes into eighths. In a large saucepan, cover regular potatoes with cold water. Bring to a boil and cook 5 minutes. Add sweet potatoes and cook another 15 minutes or until fork tender. Drain potatoes, and return to low heat for 3 minutes to dry, shaking occasionally. Mash potatoes until smooth. Continue mashing while gradually adding milk. Stir in remaining ingredients. ; name: pat s baked beef ; ingredients: steaks, cream of mushroom soup, barbecue sauce, water, onion ; preparation:Pre-heat oven to 350 put beef in bottom of 13x9 in baking pan. Mix bbq sauce, mushroom soup and water together. Pour over beef. Place sliced onion on top. Cover and bake for 90 minutes. The gravy is very good on mashed potatoes. ; name: crummy mushrooms ; ingredients: ritz crackers, butter, fresh mushrooms, whipping cream, paprika ; preparation:Toss half the crumbs with the butter. Set aside. Place mushrooms in casserole dish. Sprinkle with dry crumbs. Pour cream over. Sprinkle with buttered crumbs and papkika. Bake uncovered at 350 for 30 minutes. ; name: light pancakes ; ingredients: low-fat biscuit mix, skim milk, splenda sugar substitute, lemon juice, baking powder ; preparation:Stir all ingredients together until well blended. Let stand 10 minutes. Using ladle, spoon on to hot griddle until edges are dry and middle is bubbly. Turn. Cook until golden. ; name: michael symon s sloppy mikes ; ingredients: ground beef, bacon, american cheese, potato dinner rolls, chopped tomatoes, onion, salt, smoked paprika, olive oil, chicken stock ; preparation:Heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add ground beef with a pinch of salt and paprika. In a second pan add remaining 2 tablespoons olive oil and bacon. Cook for 1-2 minutes. Add onion to pan and continue cooking. Add tomatoes and simmer for another minute. Transfer onion, tomato and bacon mixture to the browning meat. Stir to combine ingredients. Add cheese and stir to combine and melt. Serve sloppy mikes on potato rolls. ; name: caesar orzo with asparagus ; ingredients: reduced-sodium chicken broth, water, orzo pasta, fresh asparagus, parmesan cheese, caesar salad dressing ; preparation:In a large saucepan, bring broth and water to boil. Add orzo. Cook and stir for 5 minutes. Add asparagus. Cook, uncovered, over medium heat 4-6 minutes or until pasta and asparagus are tender, stirring frequently. Drain. Stir in parmesan cheese and caesar dressing. ; name: eggs baked in potatoes ; ingredients: potatoes, butter, milk, salt, pepper, eggs, cheese ; preparation:Bake the potatoes. Scoop out the pulp, after cutting a thin slice from the length of the potato. Mash pulp to a creamy fluff with butter, hot milk, salt and pepper. Fill potato shells, leaving a dent in the middle of each to hold a raw egg. Break 1 or 2 eggs into each potato. Cover with cheese. Bake at 400f for 10 minutes until the egg is firm and cheese is browned. ; name: old sussex potato cheese cakes ; ingredients: potato, flour, cheese, egg, butter, salt ; preparation:

name: mussels in white wine and garlic ; ingredients: mussels, dry white wine, shallots, garlic cloves, salt, mixed fresh herbs, butter ; preparation:Rinse and scrub mussels under cold water. Using your fingers or paring knife, remove beards, and discard. In a large stockpot set over medium heat, combine wine, shallots, garlic, and salt. Simmer 5 minutes. Add mussels, cover, and increase heat to high. Cook until all mussels are open, about 5 minutes. Stir in herbs and butter. Remove from heat. Divide mussels and broth among four bowls. Serve immediately. ; name: radonsky for the new millennium by alton brown ; ingredients: littleneck clams, flour, seasoned bread crumbs, parmesan cheese, kosher salt, fresh pepper, bacon fat, fresh parsley, malt vinegar ; preparation:Half shell the clams and set them aside. Mix the flour, bread crumbs, parmesan, salt, and pepper. In a large pan over high heat, render the bacon fat. Sprinkle a generous coating of the flour mixture over all the clams and carefully place them flesh side down, using a spoon, into the fat. Cook for about two minutes and remove to serving plates flesh side up. Top them with fresh parsley and malt vinegar. ; name: lemon spice infused oil ; ingredients: lemon zest, whole cloves, bay leaf, cinnamon, whole allspice, whole black peppercorn, fresh lemon juice, peanut oil ; preparation:Heat oven to 300 degrees f. With a mortar and pestle or a spice grinder, coarsely grind the lemon zest, cloves, bay leaf, cinnamon, allspice and peppercorns with the lemon juice to form a paste. In a 1-cup metal measure or very small metal bowl, stir together paste and oil. Set the measuring cup or bowl on a baking sheet and cook in lower third of oven for one hour. Cool on a rack for 30 minutes. Line a small strainer with several layers of cheesecloth and strain oil into a glass jar. Covered loosely and refrigerated at all times, flavored oil keeps for one month. ; name: anyday holiday coffee ; ingredients: brewed coffee, cinnamon sticks, peppermint extract, splenda sugar substitute, fat-free evaporated milk ; preparation:Brew the coffee. Drop the cinnamon stick into the cup. Add coffee, peppermint extract and splenda. Add milk if using. Stir and enjoy. ; name: sausage meatloaf oamc ; ingredients: lean ground beef, ground sausage, celery, onion, saltines, eggs, tomato sauce, brown sugar, prepared mustard, worcestershire sauce ; preparation:Combine ground beef, sausage, celery, onion, saltines, and eggs together and form into 2 loaves. Bake covered at 350 degress fahrenheit in stoneware for 45 to 75 minutes. Drain grease. For the sauce, combine tomato sauce, brown sugar, mustard, and worcestershire sauce. Pour sauce over loaves. Cover meatloaf and cook 15 minutes. Remove cover and cook 10 to 15 minutes. To freeze, just freeze the meat mixture in meal size portions. Thaw it in the refrigerator for a day before cooking. You could make and freeze the sauce too, but i usually mix it up when i cook the meat. ; name: molly s coconut cookies ; ingredients: oleo, brown sugar, egg, oatmeal, flour, baking soda, cream of tartar, salt, pure vanilla extract, coconut ; preparation:Preheat oven 375f. Roll in 1-inch balls. Place on greased cookie sheet. Press with fork. Bake 10-12 minutes. ; name: fijian pork pineapple curry ; ingredients: pork, red curry paste, coconut milk, fresh pineapple, red capsicum, cashew nuts ; preparation:Stir fry the curry paste in a saucepan for 1-2 minutes, until fragrant. Add pork and stir until well coated in the spice paste. Add coconut milk and stir well to combine. Add diced pineapple and capsicum, cover and simmer for 20-30 minutes until pork is tender. Served on mashed kumara or steamed rice and top with a few roast cashew nuts. Serves 2. ; name: veal in wine sauce ; ingredients: veal, butter, scallions, mushrooms, paprika, flour, white wine, whipping cream, salt and pepper, rice ; preparation:

name: smoked sausage fried cabbage ; ingredients: bacon, green cabbage, butter, water, smoked sausage, salt & pepper ; preparation:In a large frying pan, fry bacon until crisp. Remove bacon and drain. Add cabbage, butter and water to bacon grease and cook until tender. Stop cooking when the cabbage is still a bit crunchy. Add salt and pepper to taste maybe a little more butter, not much. Slice sausage and lay on top of cabbage. Continue to cook a little longer to warm the sausage. Crumble bacon over all. Yummmy -- great with black eyed-peas and cornbread. ; name: weight watchers ww strawberry mousse ; ingredients: strawberries, low-fat cream cheese, sugar-free strawberry jell-o gelatin dessert, egg whites ; preparation:Mix the strawberries with the cream cheese until the berries are slightly broken up and the cheese in pinky in hue. Make up the jello according to the packet and pour over the strawberry mix. Stir well and leave until just starting to set. Whisk the egg whites until stiff peaks and fold into the strawberry mix. Spoon the mix into glasses and chill for one hour. ; name: orange scented couscous ; ingredients: couscous, orange juice, slivered almonds, chickpeas, raisins ; preparation:Make couscous according to package directions, replacing water with orange juice and set aside. Toast almonds until fragrant and lightly browned and set aside. Heat chickpeas in a nonstick saucepan until warmed through and combine with couscous. Add almonds and raisins and stir to combine. If desired, pack couscous mixture into lightly oiled individual ramikins and unmold onto dinner plates before serving. ; name: cream of asparagus soup vegan ; ingredients: asparagus, onion, garlic, vegetable broth, unbleached flour, soymilk, soy sauce, dried basil, salt and pepper ; preparation:Chop the asparagus, reserving the. Put the asparagus, onion, garlic and broth in a large saucepan. Bring to a boil, then reduce to medium heat and cook until the vegetables are tender, about 15 minutes. Put contents of saucepan into blender. Add the flour, soy milk, soy sauce and basil. Process until smooth. Return the soup to the saucepan and add the asparagus. Cook over medium heat until the soup thickens and is heated through. Season to taste with salt and fresh cracked pepper and serve. ; name: pork with apple butter sauce ; ingredients: olive oil flavored cooking spray, boneless butterfly pork loin chop, dried rosemary, salt & freshly ground black pepper, apple butter, prepared horseradish, apple cider vinegar ; preparation:Heat a nonstick skillet on medium high and spray with olive oil spray. Remove fat from pork and sprinkle with rosemary. Press rosemary into chops on both sides. Add to skillet and brown 2 minutes. Turn and brown second side 2 minutes. Sprinkle cooked side with salt and pepper to taste. Lower heat to medium low, cover and cook 2 minutes. A meat thermometer should read 160 degrees. Meanwhile mix apple butter, horseradish and cider vinegar together. Place pork chips on dinner plates and pour pan juices on top. Served seasoned apple butter on the side. ; name: celery with almond butter and dates ; ingredients: celery ribs, almond butter, salt, dates ; preparation:Choose celery ribs that are fresh and bright green. Cut the celery ribs into 2-inch lengths. Stir the almond butter well, and pour some into a small bowl. If desired, add a light sprinkling of salt to the almond butter and stir to combine. Spread a layer of almond butter into the cavity of each piece of celery. Top each celery piece with date pieces. Arrange on a serving plate. ; name: red pepper steak tostadas ; ingredients: salsa, low-fat ranch dressing, olive oil, sirloin steaks, red bell peppers, tostadas, iceberg lettuce, low-fat cheddar cheese ; preparation:Heat oven to 375 degrees. Mix the ranch dressing and salsa in a small bowl, cover and refrigerate. Spray a cookie sheet with nonstick cooking spray. Place tostada shells on sprayed cookie sheet and bake for 5 to 6 minutes turning once, or until hot and crisp. Meanwhile, heat oil in a skillet over medium heat. When oil is hot, saute the steak strips until they are well browned. Add bell pepper strips and saute over medium-high heat until peppers are soft and meat starts to char. Divide lettuce evenly among prepared tostada shells, and top each with the meat-pepper mixture. Drizzle the chilled dressing over tostadas, sprinkle with cheese and serve. ; name: nut cake gluten free ; ingredients: pecans, eggs, brown sugar, maple syrup, cinnamon, flour, salt ; preparation:

name: spinach and cheese casserole ; ingredients: frozen spinach, onion, garlic cloves, butter, eggs, cottage cheese, flour, sharp cheddar cheese, salt, pepper ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Lightly grease a 13 x 9 inch baking dish. Drain spinach well. Saute onion and garlic in 2 tbsp of the melted butter until onion is translucent. Mix spinach with the eggs, cottage cheese, cheddar cheese, flour, and the remaining butter. Add the sauteed onions and garlic. Season with salt and pepper. Pour into prepared dish and bake for 1 hour. ; name: fideos a la mexicana ; ingredients: onion, garlic cloves, olive oil, vermicelli, chicken broth, diced tomatoes, pepper, muenster cheese ; preparation:In a dutch oven cook the onion and garlic in 1 tablespoon olive oil until tender. Remove onion and garlic and set aside. Add remaining oil to pan. Cook vermicelli half at a time until golden. Add onions and garlic to vermicelli in pan. Stir in broth, undrained tomatoes and pepper. Heat to boiling, reduce heat, cover and simmer 15 to 20 minutes or until pasta is tender. Transfer to serving dish and top with cheese. ; name: mom s banana bread ; ingredients: sugar, eggs, flour, bananas, butter, baking soda, vanilla, walnuts ; preparation:Cream sugar and butter. Add eggs, beat well. Add rest of ingredients. Pour into loaf pan. Sprinkle walnuts over top. Bake at 325 degrees for 1 hour 20 minutes. Or until toothpick comes out clean. Keep in pan 10 minutes then put on wire rack until completely cooled. Muffins- 325 degrees for 25 minutes. Mini muffins- 325 degrees for 15 minutes. ; name: old fashioned blackberry pie ; ingredients: pastry for double-crust pie, blackberries, sugar, cornstarch, fresh lemon rind, butter ; preparation:Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. Wash the blackberries and place on paper towels to drain. Line the bottom of a pie pan with half of the pastry. Place the blackberries on top of the pastry. Sprinkle the sugar, cornstarch and lemon rind on top of the berries. Dot butter on top of the sugar, cornstarch and lemon rind. Cut the remaining pastry in strips. Place the strips in a lattice pattern on top of the pie. Bake in the preheated oven for 30-45 minutes or until the top of the pie is golden brown. ; name: creamy stone ground grits ; ingredients: butter, onions, chicken stock, half-and-half cream, grits, cream cheese, salt, white pepper, parmesan cheese, green onion ; preparation:Saut onion in butter. Add chicken stock and half and half. Bring to a boil. Whisk in the grits. Reduce heat and simmer for 15 minutes. Stir in cream cheese, salt, and pepper. Continue to simmer 1-2 minutes longer until grits are creamy. Stir in parmesan cheese and green onions. Serve immediately or cover and keep warm. ; name: simple apple crisp ; ingredients: apples, cinnamon, nutmeg, water, lemon juice, butter, sugar, flour ; preparation:Pre-heat oven to 350. Placed sliced apples in buttered 8x8 pan. Add spices, lemon juice and water. In separate bowl, mix butter, sugar and flour until crumbly. Sprinkle on top of apples. Bake for 1 hour or until top is golden brown and apples are tender. ; name: copy cat mrs fields chocolate chip cookie with toasted pecans ; ingredients: all-purpose flour, baking soda, salt, unsalted butter, sugar, eggs, vanilla extract, pecans, semi-sweet chocolate chips ; preparation:Preheat oven to 300f. In a medium bowl mix the flour, baking soda, and salt together. In a large bowl cream the butter and sugar together with a mixer set at medium speed. Beat in the eggs and vanilla until just mixed together. Add the flour mixture, chocolate chips, and pecans. Mix in at low speed until just mixed together. Drop the dough by rounded tablespoons 2 inch apart onto an ungreased cookie sheet. Bake for 15 to 20 minutes depending on your oven. Bake until the cookie is golden. Wait 1 minute and transfer the cookies to a wire rack to cool. ; name: lemony potato broccoli and goat cheese salad ; ingredients: new potatoes, extra virgin olive oil, lemon, broccoli, green beans, dill, salt & freshly ground black pepper, goat cheese, pine nuts ; preparation:

name: sweet lemon and spice pork chops or ribs ; ingredients: boneless pork chops, honey mustard, tomato ketchup, lemon & herb seasoning, garlic, onion, black pepper ; preparation:Pre-heat oven to 350 degrees f. Spread chops or full rack of ribs in roasting pan. Mix honey mustard, ketchup, lemon and herb spice, and dices garlic. Spread mixture over meat. Place cut onion over meat and sauce. Spinkle black pepper over entire dish. Bake for 30-40 minutes, until tender. Serve with your choice of vegetables for a little sweeter sauce add granulated sugar to taste. ; name: gingered ambrosia ; ingredients: navel oranges, pineapple chunks, sweetened flaked coconut, fresh mint leaves, fresh lime juice, fresh ginger, mint sprig ; preparation:Peel and section oranges over a bowl, reserving juice. Combine orange sections, juice and remaining ingredients. Gently toss. Cover and chill until ready to serve. Garnish, if desired. ; name: coffee chiller ; ingredients: ground coffee, water, sugar, half-and-half, milk, vanilla extract ; preparation:Brew coffee using 12 cups of water. Stir in sugar until dissolved. Stir in half-and-half, milk, and vanilla. Chill. Serve over ice. ; name: hootenanny pancakes ; ingredients: butter, eggs, milk, salt, flour ; preparation:Preheat oven to 425 degree f. Put entire stick butter into a 9 x 13 inch pan. Put pan with butter into the oven until butter is melted. Beat the eggs, milk, and salt until frothy. Add flour. Beat until mixed. Pour over melted butter. Bake for 25 to 30 minutes. Serve with syrup or jelly. ; name: cream cheese and nutella filled pound cake ; ingredients: butter pound cake, cream cheese, powdered sugar, toffee pieces, nutella ; preparation:Cut pound cake in half horizontally. Using an electric mixer, beat cream cheese and powdered sugar together until light and fluffy. Spread cream cheese on bottom piece of cake. Sprinkle with toffee bits and gently press the pieces into the cream cheese. Spread the other half of the pound cake with nutella. Place nutella cake over top of cream cheese side. Immidiately wrap cake tightly in foil, place back into loaf pan, and refrigerate 2 hrs or overnight. When ready to serve, cut into 6 wide slices then cut the slices in half. ; name: mom s easy creamed chipped beef on toast ; ingredients: flour, buddig beef, salt, pepper, toast, milk ; preparation:Slice beef into thin strips. In a large bowl whisk together milk and flour salt and pepper. Melt butter in large pot over medium heat. Add milk and flour mixture constantly whisking until it reaches a thick consistency. Add beef and stir with a wooden spoon until heated through. Serve immediately over toast. ; name: easy christmas candies ; ingredients: baking cocoa, sweetened condensed milk, butter, nuts ; preparation:In a small heavy saucepan, combine cocoa, sweetened condensed milk and butter to a boil, stirring constantly. Reduce heat to low. Continue to cook and stir until thickened. Transfer to a small bowl. Cover and refrigerate until chilled. Roll into 1-inch balls. Then roll in nuts or sprinkles to coat. Store candies in refrigerator. ; name: tomatillo hash with sausage ; ingredients: italian turkey sausage, olive oil, onion, red bell pepper, poblano chile, salt, tomatillos, white wine, cooked brown rice ; preparation:

name: maple syrup salad ; ingredients: maple syrup, cream cheese, crushed pineapple, pecans, cool whip ; preparation:Soften cream cheese in microwave for 30 seconds. Mix maple syrup to softened cream cheese, cool. Stir in pinapple and pecans. Fold in cool whip. Chill or freeze if desired. ; name: birthday cookie ; ingredients: butter, brown sugar, sugar, egg, vanilla extract, all-purpose flour, baking soda, salt, chocolate chips ; preparation:Cream butter and sugars. Add egg and vanilla. Mix on low speed, add dry ingredients. Mix well. Stir in chocolate chips or m&ms. Spray a 12 inch round pizza pan with pam and spread cookie dough evenly to the edges. Bake at 325 degrees f for 15 to 20 minutes, or until light golden brown. When cool, decorate as desired. ; name: jarlsberg quiche ; ingredients: deep dish pie shell, eggs, half-and-half cream, chives, salt, black pepper, jarlsberg cheese, bacon ; preparation:Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Combine eggs, cream, chives, salt and pepper in bowl and blend well. Sprinkle shredded cheese into bottom of baked pie shell. Pour egg mixture over top of cheese and sprinkle with the bacon. Bake at 375 for 30 minutes. Serve immediately. ; name: hot chocolate with pink peppermint whipped cream ; ingredients: heavy cream, peppermint candies, powdered sugar, peppermint candy, whole milk, salt, semisweet chocolate, creme de cacao, instant coffee granules, vanilla extract ; preparation:This recipe can also be made with white chocolate. Simply substitute white chocolate and leave out the coffee. Beat the cream, pulverized peppermints and sugar untill stiff peaks form. Pipe or spoon onto a parchment paper lined baking sheet, sprinkle with the crushed peppermints, and freeze until firm, about 20 minutes. Heat the milk and salt for the hot chocolate in a saucepan over medium heat until steam begins to rise. Whisk in the remaining ingredients until smooth. Ladle into mugs and top with a rosette of frozen whipped cream. Doubling the whipped cream will give you quite a few rosettes to keep in the freezer until needed. Store them in an airtight container and try to use them within 2 or 3 weeks. ; name: baked eggs in maple toast cups ; ingredients: butter, pure maple syrup, bread, bacon, eggs, fresh ground black pepper ; preparation:Preheat the oven to 400 degrees f. Butter six muffin cups. In a small saucepan, melt the butter and add the syrup. Remove the crusts from the bread. Flatten each slice with a rolling pin. Brush both sides of each slice with the syrup mixture. Put one slice into each muffin cup and sprinkle the bacon pieces in the cups. Break an egg into each cup and bake until the eggs are set. Start checking after about 5 minutes. Lift the toast cups from the pan and serve immediately, drizzled with additional syrup, if desired. ; name: bagno di poppea ; ingredients: absolut vodka, banana liqueur, cream, triple sec, maraschino cherry ; preparation:Chill a champagne glass with ice or in the freezer. Pour absolut vodka, banana liqueur, cream and triple sec into a shaker. Fill the shaker with ice cubes and shake it until the shaker is very cold. Empty the champagne glass from ice and water. Strain the drink into the champagne glass. Garnish with a maraschino cherry. ; name: cauliflower with scallions ; ingredients: cauliflower florets, butter, scallions, salt and pepper ; preparation:In a large pot of boiling salted water, cook cauliflower until tender, 3-5 minutes. Drain and transfer to a serving dish. In a small skillet, melt butter over medium low heat. Add scallions and cook 2 minutes. Pour over cauliflower and toss. Season with salt and pepper. Serve hot. ; name: the black eyed pea s baked squash ; ingredients: yellow squash, eggs, breadcrumbs, butter, sugar, salt, onions, pepper ; preparation:

name: german french toast ; ingredients: eggs, white bread, muenster cheese, milk, butter, salt ; preparation:Melt butter in a skillet on medium heat. In a small bowl, beat together eggs, milk and salt. Dip bread slices one at a time in egg mixture, and fry in butter until bolden brown. After turning once, top each slice of bread with a slice of muenster cheese. Cover skillet until the cheese is melted. Serve and enjoy. ; name: oven barbque country pork not ribs ; ingredients: country pork strips, brown sugar, garlic, apple juice concentrate, dried chipotle powder, black pepper, kosher salt ; preparation:Mix everything and coat both sides of pork. Lay the coated strips on a parchment covered sheet pan with sides. This worked for me and avoided that messy cleanup. Let marinade room at temp for half an hour. Bake in a 275 oven for about 90 min, turning once. Remove the meat, pour off any grease, put a flat rack on the pan, return meat laying now on the rack. Run the oven up to 450f bake for about 10 minutes more to crisp. ; name: moroccan spiced roasted vegetables ; ingredients: shallots, olive oil, butternut squash, red bell peppers, sweet potatoes, coarse salt, ground cumin, ground coriander, ground cinnamon, unsalted butter ; preparation:Preheat 375. Mix shallots with 1 tablespoon oil and roast in a shallow baking pan in lower third of oven 25 minutes. Mix together squash, bell peppers, sweet potatoes, salt, cumin, coriander, cinnamon, and remaining 3 tablespoons oil. Add roasted shallots and divide between 2 large shallow baking pans. Dot vegetables in each pan with half of butter and roast in upper and lower thirds of oven, stirring occasionally and switching position of pans halfway through roasting, until vegetables are tender, about 45 minutes total. ; name: mary s rice a roni salad ; ingredients: rice-a-roni, marinated artichokes, green onions, green pepper, mayonnaise ; preparation:Cook rice-a-roni according to package directions except leave out the butter step. Let the rice mixture cool and add green pepper, and onion. Slightly chop up artichokes and stir in rice mixture. Mix mayo and reserved artichoke juice together. Mix into salad mixture. Chill for 4 hours before serving. ; name: christmas morning sausage ring ; ingredients: sausage, crackers, eggs, milk, onion, apple ; preparation:Preheat oven to 325f and grease a ring mold. In a bowl, combine sausage, crushed crackers, 2 eggs, milk, finely chopped onion and finely chopped apple. Mix well. Place into a greased ring mold and unmold onto a baking sheet. Bake for 1 hour. Move to a warm serving plate. Scramble remaining 6 eggs in a skillet and spoon into the center of cooked sausage ring. Serve immediately. ; name: alamo tamale supper crock pot ; ingredients: beef tamales, onion, corn, tomato sauce, chili powder, cheddar cheese, olive ; preparation:Slice tamales in half crosswise and arrange in bottom of greased crock-pot. Sprinkle chopped onion over tamales. Add corn. Mix tomato sauce and chili powder. Pour into crock-pot. Top with shredded cheese and sprinkle with sliced ripe olives. Cover and cook on low setting for 5 to 7 hours or on high setting for 2 hours. Double recipe for 5-quart crock-pot. ; name: white chocolate macadamia caramel bars ; ingredients: yellow cake mix, vegetable oil, water, eggs, caramel ice cream topping, refrigerated white chocolate chip macadamia nut cookie dough ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 f. Combine cake mix, oil, water and eggs with electric mixer on low speed until smooth. Spread into ungreased 13x9-inch pan. Bake 18-22 minutes until top is golden brown. Remove partially baked crust from oven. In 1-cup measuring cup, microwave caramel topping about 15 seconds or until warm and pourable, and drizzle over crust. Crumble cookies over crust. Bake 18-22 minutes longer or until golden brown. Cool completely and cut into bars. ; name: halibut zucchini saute ; ingredients: halibut steaks, salt & pepper, zucchini, onion, garlic, oil, tomatoes, parsley, lemon juice ; preparation:

name: pesto focaccia sandwiches ; ingredients: low-fat mayonnaise, pesto sauce, fresh mozzarella cheese, tomatoes ; preparation:Slice bread lengthwise into 2 halves. Combine mayo and pesto, spread on each side of bread. Add cheese and tomato. Put top piece of bread back to form sandwich. Cut into 4 wedges. ; name: smoky grilled asparagus ; ingredients: mayonnaise, extra virgin olive oil, fresh lemon juice, garlic clove, sweet smoked paprika, kosher salt, cumin seed, asparagus ; preparation:Light a grill. In a shallow dish, whisk the mayo with the oil, lemon juice, garlic, paprika, salt and cumin. Add the asparagus and toss. Let stand for 30 minutes. Grill the asparagus over moderately high heat, turning, until tender and blistered in spots, about 6 minutes. Serve warm. ; name: roasted pork shoulder pernil al horno ; ingredients: pork shoulder, head of garlic, black pepper, adobo seasoning, sazon goya, sofrito sauce, sugar, vinegar, salt, oil ; preparation:Wash meat with vinegar and lemon juice. Place all ingredients in blender. Pat dry the meat. Season the meat with the marinade. Add the salt to the skin. Let marinate 1 day before. Place in oven at 350 cover with foil. After 4 hours uncover and let the skin get crispy raising the temperature to 450. ; name: asparagus with blsamic and bacon glaze ; ingredients: asparagus, smoked bacon, balsamic vinegar, sugar ; preparation:Pre-cook bacon in skillet until crisp. Drain fat from pan but leave enough in bottom to coat pan. Cut off tough ends of the asparagus and place in pan over med-high heat. Sprinkle sugar on asparagus and pour the balsamic over asparagus. Constantly turn and toss the asparagus until desired doneness. Remove the asparagus and turn the heat to high until sauce thickens to the consistence of syrup. Place asparagus on plate and spoon glaze over top. Top with the crumbled bacon. ; name: roasted asparagus with lemon ; ingredients: asparagus, extra virgin olive oil, garlic cloves, lemon, zest of, salt & freshly ground black pepper, lemon ; preparation:Position a rack in the upper third of an oven and preheat to 450f. Snap off the tough stem ends from the asparagus spears and arrange the spears on a baking sheet. In a small bowl, whisk together the olive oil, garlic and lemon zest. Brush the asparagus evenly with the oil, turning the spears to coat well, and season generously with salt and pepper. Arrange the lemon wedges around the asparagus. Bake until the asparagus is tender and just turning golden, 6 to 8 minutes. Transfer the asparagus to a warmed serving platter and drizzle with the pan juices. ; name: dried apricot marmalade ; ingredients: dried apricots, orange, grapefruit, lemon juice, crushed pineapple, sugar, pine nuts ; preparation:Soak apricots in water overnight. Drain and cut into pieces. Peel citrus fruit and remove white pith. Shred colored peel and chop fruit finely. Add lemon juice and apricots. Add pineapple. Measure fruit and add an equal volume of sugar. Cook until thick, stirring carefully to prevent scorching. Add pine nuts, if desired. Fill sterilized jars, cover and process in a boiling water bath for ten minutes to seal. ; name: savory cheddar spread ; ingredients: cream cheese, miracle whip, cheddar cheese, scallion, bacon, ritz cracker ; preparation:Combine cream cheese, miracle whip, shredded cheese and scallion. Add half the amount of bacon. Spoon into a glass pie dish. Crumble the remaining bacon and one sleeve of ritz crackers. Sprinkle on top of cheese mixture. Bake at 400f for 20 minutes. Serve warm with the remaining ritz crackers. ; name: individual pecan tartlets ; ingredients: butter, sugar, egg yolks, almond extract, all-purpose flour, dark corn syrup, powdered sugar, pecans, pecan halves ; preparation:

name: spiced pear jam with pineapple ; ingredients: bartlett pears, orange, lemon, crushed pineapple, sugar, cloves, cinnamon sticks, gingerroot ; preparation:Peel and core pears. Peel and seed lemon and orange. Put fruit though a grinder or food processor. Save juices. In a kettle or large saucepan, combine pulp and juice with sugar and pineapple. Tie cloves, cinnamon, and ginger in cheesecloth. Add to pot. Stir the mixture while heating. Simmer about 30 minutes. Remove spice bag and ladle into hot sterilized jars. Process pints in a water bath for 15 minutes. ; name: squash delight ; ingredients: squash, maple syrup, onion, oil, carrot, sour cream, cream of chicken soup, chicken flavor stuffing mix ; preparation:Prepare squash, either by peeling and boiling or bake in oven until tender. Cool and mash. Yield for cooked squash is about 2 cups of puree. Saute onion and carrot in frying pan with tsp oil. Cool. In small bowl combine cooled onion, carrot, sour cream, maple syrup and soup. Fold in squash. Prepare stuffing according to package directions. Spread half of stuffing in bottom of prepared 8x8 baking dish. Spoon squash mixture on top, sprinkle with remaining stuffing. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes. ; name: lamb ribs ; ingredients: lamb rib chops, apricot jam, ketchup, garlic powder, worcestershire sauce ; preparation:Add jam, ketchup, worcester sauce in a bowl and pur over riblets. Drain riblets during cooking time. 350 degrees for approximately 1 hours and 15 minutes. Drain and cut ribs. This is so simple, but yet really delicious. Serve on a hot tray a rose wine goes very well with this or a sparkling rose. ; name: crock pot chicken with mushroom soup ; ingredients: chicken breasts, mushroom soup, onion, garlic, celery, pepper, rice, water ; preparation:Place one can of mushroom soup into crock pot, add the chicken breasts, garlic, onion, celery and pepper. Add second can of mushroom soup, place on low setting. Cook all day. Steam 2 cups of rice in 3 cups of water. Place chicken and sauce on top of rice and serve. ; name: baked pears in caramel sauce ; ingredients: pears, sugar, butter, whipping cream ; preparation:Cut pears in half lengthwise. Arrange, cut side down on lightly greased baking dish. Sprinkle with sugar and dot with butter. Bake at 400 for 35 minutes or until tender. Pour whipping cream over pears. Bake 10 more minutes, basting frequently. ; name: strawberry angel delight ; ingredients: strawberry gelatin, boiling water, angel food cake, vanilla ice cream, strawberries ; preparation:Dissolve gelatin in boiling water. Stir in ice cream until melted. Add strawberries and cake broken into small pieces. Chill until set. Slice in squares. Top with whipped cream. ; name: dijon glazed halibut ; ingredients: dijon mustard, garlic cloves, fresh parsley, salt, fresh ground pepper, halibut fillets ; preparation:Preheat grill to medium. Coat the grill rack with nonstick cooking spray. Combine all ingredients but fish and optional parsley. Brush over fish. Grill fish, covered with grill lid, 6 to 8 minutes on each side or until fish flakes with a fork. Garnish with additional parsley, if used. ; name: roasted skinless duck breast ; ingredients: skinless duck breasts, lemon pepper, garlic heads, olive oil, fresh lemon juice ; preparation:

name: new england scalloped oysters and scallops ; ingredients: butter, breadcrumbs, oyster, celery seed, salt and pepper, cream, scallops ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400f. Mix the melted butter and bread crumbs together and put one third of them in a thin layer in the bottom of a buttered baking dish. Cover with half of the oysters and seasonings. Add some of the cream. Layer half of the scallops next, seasonings, and another third of buttered crumbs. Add the remaining oysters and cream. Top with the final half of scallops and top with remaining buttered crumbs. Bake for 30 minutes. Serve hot. ; name: best ever fresh sweetcorn salad ; ingredients: corn, red onion, roasted red pepper, apple cider vinegar, olive oil, salt, black pepper, fresh basil leaf ; preparation:Fill a large pot with salted water and bring to a boil. Break each ear of corn in half so it will fit in the pot, and cook until tender and the starchiness is just gone. Drain and immediately immerse the ears of corn in a bowl of ice water to stop the cooking and to set the color. When the corn is cool, cut the kernels off the cob, cutting close to the cob. Toss the kernels in a large bowl with the red onions, roasted red peppers, vinegar, olive oil, salt, and pepper. Just before serving, toss in the fresh basil. If you add the basil too early and let the salad sit for a long period of time before serving, it will wilt and darken. Taste for seasonings and serve cold or at room temperature. ; name: st urho s day fish stew ; ingredients: potatoes, onion, salt, allspice berries, water, fish, cream, milk, unsalted butter, fresh dill ; preparation:In a large kettle, place potatoes, onion, salt, allspice and water. Cover and bring to a boil then reduce heat and simmer for 15 minutes or until potatoes are tender. Cut fish into bite-size chunks and add to potato mixture. Simmer covered for another 15 to 20 minutes or just until fish flakes easily. Do not boil the soup. Stir in cream, milk, butter and dill. Heat through and serve. ; name: spiced skewered chicken chicken sosaties ; ingredients: boneless skinless chicken breasts, vegetable oil, onions, madras curry powder, garlic cloves, coriander seed, light brown sugar, fresh lemon juice ; preparation:Place chicken in a large deep nonreactive bowl. Heat oil in a nonreactive saucepan and fry the onions until they are lightly browned. Add the remaining ingredients and cook for 2 minutes over low heat, stirring constantly to make sure that the sugar has dissolved. Allow the marinade to cool and pour it over the chicken. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and refrigerate it for 24 hours. When ready to grill the chicken pieces, remove them from the marinade, drain them, place them on skewers, and grill over hot coals or under the broiler for 10 minutes, turning once, or until the chicken is cooked through. Serve hot with apricot chutney. ; name: egg free french toast ; ingredients: whole grain bread, milk, cornstarch, sugar, vanilla extract, butter, salt ; preparation:Preheat griddle to just above medium heat. In a medium bowl, combine all ingredients except bread and butter. Mix until the cornstach is disolved. Transfer mixture to a shallow bowl or pan. Dip both sides of each bread slice into the mixture. Melt butter on the griddle or skillet. Place bread on heated surface and cook each side to a light golden brown. Serve immediately. ; name: almond celery ; ingredients: butter, blanched almond, celery, salt, pepper, sherry wine ; preparation:In lg skillet, melt butter. Add almonds and saute for 1 minute. Remove almonds with slotted spoon. Add all other ingredients to skillet. Cover and cook till crisp-tender, about 5-6 minutes. Return almonds and mix well. ; name: fashoulakia greek green bean side dish ; ingredients: olive oil, onion, fresh parsley, of fresh mint, fresh dill, garlic cloves, green beans, salt, black pepper, stewed tomatoes ; preparation:Heat oil in a stockpot over medium-high heat. Add onion. Saut 3 minutes. Add herbs and garlic. Saut 4 minutes. Add beans and remaining ingredients. Bring to a boil. Cover, reduce heat, and simmer 30 minutes or until beans are tender. ; name: el charro cafe green enchilada sauce ; ingredients: vegetable oil, white onion, flour, anaheim chilies, garlic cloves, chicken stock, salt ; preparation:

name: herb cheese pizza ; ingredients: cornmeal, pizza crusts, olive oil, garlic clove, mozzarella cheese, parmesan cheese, dried oregano leaves, dried basil leaves ; preparation:Heat oven to 425. Grease 12-inch pizza pan. Sprinkle with cornmeal. Unroll dough and press in pan. In small bowl, combine oil and garlic. Drizzle over dough. In small bowl, combine cheese, oregano and basil. Sprinkle over oil. Bake at 425 for 13 to 16 minutes or until crust is deep golden brown. Serve immediately. ; name: swiss tobleronemousse ; ingredients: chocolate, eggs, icing sugar, whipping cream ; preparation:Chop the chocolate up coarsely and put into a bowl or double boiler. Set bowl over boiling water to melt the chocolate. Stir in the sugar and eggs until the until the sugar has desolved and chocolate is melted and is lighter in color. Remove from heat. Whip the cream and fold into the chocolate mixture. Pour into 4 individual serving dishes or leave in bowl. Refrigerate for at least 3 hours before serving. ; name: simple shrimp stir fry ; ingredients: angel hair pasta, cornstarch, oil, frozen shrimp, stir fry vegetables, gingerroot, italian dressing, hoisin sauce ; preparation:Cook pasta as directed on packaging & do not rinse. Meanwhile toss shrimp with cornstarch in large bowl & let stand 10mins. Place veggies in strainer. Rinse under hot water 30 sec. Or until thawed. Drain. Heat oil in large nonstick skillet & add shrimp and ginger. Stir fry 8 mins or until shrimp turns pink. Add vegetables, dressing & hoisin sauce. Cook 2 mins to heat through, stirring frequently. Add drained pasta and shrimp mixture to mixing bowl & mix lightly. ; name: farro apple and pecan salad ; ingredients: cracked farro, olive oil, red onion, apple, fresh thyme, apple cider vinegar, pecans, salt, pepper ; preparation:Soak farro in cold water for 20 minutes. Drain well. Bring 2 quarts salted water to a boil in a medium pot. Add farro and simmer, uncovered, until tender, 30 to 35 minutes. Drain well then rinse under cold water for 30 seconds. Drain again, then transfer to a large bowl, cover and refrigerate. Heat 2 tablespoons of the oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onions and cook until softened and translucent, about 5 minutes. Add apples, stir well and cook until slightly softened, 2 to 3 minutes more. Transfer apple mixture to bowl with farro. Add thyme, vinegar, remaining 2 tablespoons oil, pecans, salt and pepper and toss gently to combine. Serve immediately. ; name: greek baked potatoes with eggs avga mesa se patates ; ingredients: baking potatoes, eggs, unsalted butter, salt, white pepper ; preparation:Bake potatoes until done. Cut potatoes in half to make boats and place on baking sheet. Remove about half of potato from skins and mix with butter, salt and pepper. Return potato filling to skins, leaving a shallow well in the middle of each. Break one egg over each potato half. Bake at 350f for 10 minutes. ; name: parmesan chicken broccoli pasta ; ingredients: whole wheat spaghetti, italian dressing, garlic cloves, boneless skinless chicken breast, broccoli florets, tomatoes, reduced-fat mozzarella cheese, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Cook spaghetti as directed on package. Meanwhile, heat dressing and garlic in large nonstick skillet on medium heat. Add chicken and broccoli. Cook and stir 5-7 minutes or until chicken is cooked through. Stir in tomatoes and half of the mozzarella cheese. Cook 1-2 minutes or until heated through, stirring occasionally. Drain spaghetti. Place on serving plate. Top with chicken mixture, remaining mozzarella cheese, and the parmesan cheese. ; name: crab stuffed red snapper ; ingredients: onion, butter, crabmeat, fresh breadcrumb, fresh parsley, heavy cream, lemon thyme, red snapper, salt and pepper, dry white wine ; preparation:Saute onion in butter until golden. Remove from heat and mix in the crab meat, bread crumbs, parsley, heavy cream, and lemon thyme. Sprinkle cavity of fish lightly with salt and pepper. Stuff the fish and skewer edges securely. Mix wine and butter together. Place fish in a greased baking pan, pour wine-butter mixture over fish. Bake in 400f oven, uncovered for 30 minutes or just until the flesh is opaque, basting frequently with wine sauce. ; name: fried apples and bread slices ; ingredients: margarine, apples, brown sugar, white bread ; preparation:

name: herb roasted summer squash ; ingredients: zucchini, summer squash, grape tomatoes, dried rosemary, parsley, salt, pepper, olive oil ; preparation:Combine first 7 ingredients in large bowl. Add a bit of onion if you like. Drizzle with olive oil and toss. Place vegetables in a single layer in a greased baking pan. Baked, uncovered at 450 for 10-15 minutes or until lightly brown and tender. ; name: raspberries romanoff ; ingredients: fresh raspberry, whipping cream, powdered sugar, kirsch ; preparation:Choose the ripest red raspberries. Beat cream until stiff. Gradually add sugar and kirsch. Lightly fold in the berries. Spoon into tall stemmed glasses and chill. ; name: hot mulled crock pot punch ; ingredients: cranberry juice, apple juice, brown sugar, salt, cinnamon sticks, whole cloves ; preparation:Pour cranberry and apple juices into crock pot. Add brown sugar and salt. Stir until dissolved. Tie cinnamon sticks and cloves in cheesecloth or put them in a tea ball and add to crock pot. Heat on low for 2 hours. Remove cinnamon and cloves. Serve hot. ; name: kale almond pesto ; ingredients: kale, toasted almond, shallots, garlic clove, parmigiano-reggiano cheese, salt & pepper, olive oil ; preparation:Steam the kale for 10 minutes and let cool. Place kale, almonds, shallots, garlic, cheese. Salt and pepper in a food processor. Pulse several times to combine then drizzle in the oil as you continue to mix. Adjust seasoning as needed. ; name: pumpkin cookies gluten free ; ingredients: sugar, shortening, eggs, pumpkin, flour, cinnamon, baking powder, salt, vanilla, vanilla icing ; preparation:Mix together the sugar and shortening. Add the remaining ingredients and blend until smooth. Spoon onto a nonstick baking sheet. Bake at 375 degrees f for 10-12 minutes. Cool completely before icing. ; name: almond flour german pancakes ; ingredients: butter, salt, baking soda, ascorbic acid, almond flour, eggs, almond milk, vanilla extract, stevia powder, lemon rind ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400f melt butter or oil in a 9-inch pie dish in the oven while it preheats. In a medium bowl, mix the dry ingredients. Use 2 of the tiny scoops of kal brand stevia extract powder or another sweetener in the equivalent of 2 teaspoons of sugar. Only use salt if you are using unsalted butter or coconut oil. Salted butter will give enough saltiness, so do not add additional salt. In a small-medium bowl, wisk the eggs and mix in the milk substitute, and other flavorings. Remove the pie plate from the oven and. Quickly pour the liquid into the dry mix and wisk thoroughly but quickly. Immediately pour into the hot greased pie dish and put into the hot oven. Bake about 12 minutes or until set in the middle. You might test with a dry knife similar to checking a pumpkin pie, when the knife removed comes out a little wet but no batter sticking to it. ; name: colombian frijoles ; ingredients: red beans, pork knuckle, vegetable oil, lard, tomatoes, green onion, cumin, cilantro, salt ; preparation:Cut the pork knuckle into little pieces, the size of your thumbnail. In a non stick pan, fry the pork until the pieces are crisp, and golden brown in colour. Remove from pan, and drain. Rinse the beans and run them through your hands to make sure that there are no small stones or bits of earth among them.
