Put the beans, pork fritters and lard into the pot and add enough water to cover the beans. Boil for about 2 hours stirring occasionally every 20 minutes, covered until they are tender, but not soft. In a separate pan, saut the green onions and tomatoes for about 8- 10 minutes, until you get a nice thick sauce and all the tomatoes are dissolved. Remove from fire and add the tomato sauce to the bean stew. Add the salt, cumin and cilantro, and simmer for another 30 minutes, adding water if necessary. Serve with rice. ; name: virginia s cinnamon sauce bread pudding ice cream crepes etc ; ingredients: sugar, cornstarch, salt, cinnamon, vanilla ; preparation:

name: great brats when you can t grill ; ingredients: bratwurst, beer, onion, hot dog buns, mustard ; preparation:Slice onion and place in 9 to 10 inch skillet. Pour in bottle of beer. Add brats and simmer until onion is tender and brats are firm and cooked through. When beer has evaporated, allow brats and onions to brown while turning frequently, adding a little oil if the pan needs it. When the onions turn golden, remove. When the brats are browned on all sides, plate them. Wrap the buns in paper towels and microwave on high for about 30 seconds until soft and warm. Serve with baked beans and or chips. ; name: clamato caldo verde ; ingredients: onion, garlic clove, potatoes, clamato juice, chicken broth, chorizo sausage, collard greens, large shrimp ; preparation:Heat a large saucepanon medium-high. Saute the onion and garlic in a little oil for about 3 minutes. Add the potatoes and saute for another 2-3 minutes. Add clamato and broth, cover and let simmer for 20 minutes. While the potatoes simmer, hear a skillet over medium-high heat and saute chorizo for about 10 minutes. Drain fat and reserve. When potatoes are soft, mash them in the pan, then add chorizo and greens. Season with salt and pepper and let simmer for another 10 minutes. Add shrimp and let heat through. ; name: pineapple banana muffins ; ingredients: all-purpose flour, granulated sugar, nuts, baking soda, salt, cinnamon, eggs, mashed bananas, pineapple, vegetable oil ; preparation:In large bowl, stir together flour, sugar, nuts, baking soda, salt and cinnamon. In separate bowl, beat eggs. Stir in bananas, pineapple and oil until blended, add all at once to dry ingredients. Stir just until moistened. Spoon into large greased muffin cups filling two-thirds full. Bake at 375 f over for 20-30 minutes or until tops are firm to the touch. ; name: bread pudding for 2 ; ingredients: challah, golden raisins, eggs, nonfat milk, brown sugar, vanilla, ground cinnamon, salt, butter ; preparation:Spray two 6 to 7 oz ramekins with non-stick cooking spray. Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Cube bread and measure out 1 cup of cubes, place cubes in prepared ramekins and divided the raisins or blueberries between the two. In a small dish, beat together the milk, egg or egg substitute, stir in brown sugar, cinnamon and vanilla. Mixing well. Pour the mixture evenly over the bread cubes and drizzle with melted butter. Place on a cookie sheet, just in case it cooks over, and bake for 25 to 30 minutes or until a knife inserted near center comes our clean. Serve warm. ; name: light scalloped potatoes with cream cheese ; ingredients: red potatoes, onion, butter, flour, fat-free half-and-half, fat free cream cheese, salt, pepper ; preparation:Wash potatoes well and slice very thin. Melt butter in saucepan. Whisk in flour, salt and pepper. Mix in half and half and stir until hot and well blended. Mix in cream chesse, stir till melted. Stir in onions. Spray casserole with cooking spray. Layer potatoes and sauce in casserole, finishing with sauce. Bake at 350 for 1 hour 15 minutes. ; name: apple bacon chutney ; ingredients: apple cider vinegar, brown sugar, smoked bacon, apple cider, tart green apples, fresh orange juice ; preparation:In a large saucepan, combine the vinegar, cider and brown sugar. Cook over high heat until bubbly, stir the first 30 seconds to dissolve sugar. Turn down heat to medium and continue to cook for 15 minutes. In a small skillet, cook the diced bacon over medium heat until crisp. Drain bacon. Add bacon, apples and orange juice to the vinegar mixture. Bring back to a boil and cook for 30 minutes more. Serve warm over waffles or pancakes, or scones. ; name: spanakorizo spinach with rice ; ingredients: spinach, spring onions, dill, rice, oil, water, salt and pepper, lemon ; preparation:Wash the spinach well and cut as finely as possible. Clean onions and cut into fine strips. Put onions into a saucepan with the oil and cook til softened. Add dill and cook a bit longer. Add the spinach, salt and pepper, add 3 c water and allow to boil. Just before spinach is fully cooked, add in 3 more cups water and the rice. Cover the saucepan and allow the ingredients to cook, stirring occassionally. When the water is absorbed, serve with freshly ground pepper and lemon juice. Enjoy. ; name: brie pancake ; ingredients: eggs, milk, all-purpose flour, brie cheese, salt, butter, chives, cayenne pepper ; preparation:

name: sauced crab ball ; ingredients: cream cheese, crabmeat, lemon juice, onion powder, hot pepper sauce, seafood cocktail sauce, fresh chives ; preparation:Put first 5 ingredients into small bowl. Beat until well combined. Shape into ball. Cover and chill at least 2 hours. Just before serving, place on serving plate. Pour cocktail sauce over crab ball. Garnish with chives. Add more cocktail sauce as needed. ; name: bird s lemonade stand parfaits ; ingredients: graham cracker crumbs, granola cereal, country time lemonade mix, water, vanilla ice cream, cool whip, lemon ; preparation:Place graham cracker crumbs and granola into food processor. Pulse until well mixed and crumbly. Set aside. Stir drink mix and water until dissolved. Beat lemonade mixture and ice cream in large bowl with electric mixer on low speed until blended. Gently fold in whipped topping until smooth. Place half the crumbs evenly into bottom of 4 parfait glasses. Spoon half of the lemon mixture onto crumb mixture. Repeat with a layer of crumble mixture, then top lemon mixture. Freeze 2 hours until firm. Garnish with lemon slices. ; name: layered mexican chicken salad ; ingredients: ranch salad dressing, taco seasoning mix, lettuce, black beans, deli chicken, tortilla chips, cheddar cheese, cherry tomatoes ; preparation:In a small bowl, mix dressing and taco mix. On a large serving platter or individual serving pates, layer remaining ingredients except tomatoes. Drizzle with dressing. Sprinkle with cherry tomatoes that have been sliced in half. You can also top with olives and add a bit of canned corn if you like. I only use a portion of the can of black beans. Use as much as you prefer. ; name: sweet pickled grapes ; ingredients: seedless grapes, wine vinegar, water, oranges, juice of, cinnamon stick, cloves, sugar ; preparation:Put the wine vinegar, water, orange juice, cinnamon, cloves and sugar into a sauce pan, bring to the boil then set aside to cool. Wash the grapes, take them off their stalks and make sure you remove any remaining bits of stalk from the grapes. When the vinegar mixture is cool, remove the cinnamon stick. Take a clean jar and pack in the grapes. Pour the vinegar mixture into the jar to cover the grapes, then seal the jar tightly. Leave the jar in a cool dark place for 2 days before eating - i keep mine in the fridge, because i am not sure how well they keep if not chilled. Eat within 2 weeks of making. ; name: cran fizzy iced tea ; ingredients: green tea bags, frozen cranberry juice concentrate, water, club soda ; preparation:Steep 4 tea bags in 2 cups boiling water according to package directions. Discard tea bags. Stir in can of frozen cranberry juice concentrate. Cover and chill. To serve, fill a glass of ice one-quarter full with tea mixture. Top off with chilled club soda. You may also add fresh berries as a garnish. ; name: easy crock pot baked steak and mushroom gravy ; ingredients: boneless beef round steak, beef broth, salt, pepper, garlic powder, sweet onion, cream of mushroom soup, brown gravy mix, mushrooms ; preparation:Place frozen or thawed beef in a crock pot sprinkle with salt and pepper. Place chopped onions on top. Pour beef broth over beef and onion. Cook on low for 5 to 6 hours. Add soup, mushrooms, and gravy mix. Stir well. Cook on low an additional hour or on high for 30 minutes. Serve with mashed potatoes. ; name: skillet macaroni beef ; ingredients: ground beef, macaroni, onion, green pepper, tomato sauce, water, salt, pepper, worcestershire sauce, sliced mushrooms ; preparation:Cook beef in a large skillet until no longer red. Remove from skillet, using a slotted spoon so as to save liquid in the skillet. Cook macaroni, onion and green pepper in drippings until macaroni is yellow. Return meat to skillet along with tomato sauce, water, salt, pepper and worcestershire sauce. Cover and simmer 25 minutes. ; name: pork chops and potato scallop ; ingredients: cream of mushroom soup, sour cream, water, dried dill weed, potatoes, pork chops, salt and pepper, vegetable oil, parsley ; preparation:

name: easy baked custard ; ingredients: sugar, all-purpose flour, vanilla extract, salt, milk, eggs, margarine ; preparation:Preheat oven 350 f. Combine all ingredients in a blender. Blend until smooth. Pour into a buttered 9-in. Deep-dish pie or cake pan. Bake at for 50 minutes or until a knife inserted near the center comes out clean. Cool on a wire rack until room temperature. Refrigerate until serving. ; name: hot tuna and cheddar sammies sandwiches ; ingredients: tuna, celery, onion, cheddar cheese, green olives, mayonnaise, pepper, hamburger buns ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350. In a large bowl, combine tuna, celery, onion, cheese, olives, mayo and pepper. Divide tuna mixture evenly among 4 buns. Wrap sandwiches loosely in aluminum foil. Place on baking sheet. Bake 15-20 minutes or until heated through. ; name: prize nut cookies ice box cookies ; ingredients: brown sugar, eggs, white sugar, cinnamon, crisco, salt, flour, walnuts ; preparation:Cream shortening and sugars. Add eggs and beat well. Add flour, salt, cinnamon and nuts. Mix well. Make two rolls and refrigerate over night. Cut thin and bake in 350 degree oven until lightly browned. ; name: cucumber and avocado salad ; ingredients: english seedless cucumber, sweet red pepper, salt, lettuce, chili pepper, avocado, fresh lime juice, fresh parsley, onion ; preparation:Peel and slice the cucumber paper-thin. Season with salt, chili pepper and lime juice. Sprinkle with onion and red pepper slices. Arrange lettuce on 6 serving plates. Pile cucumber mixture in center of each plate. Add avocado slices and parsley. 6 servings. ; name: taco dip ; ingredients: hamburger, taco seasoning, sour cream, dry ranch dressing mix, cheddar cheese, lettuce, onion, tomatoes ; preparation:Brown ground beef with taco seasoning according to pkg. Drain, let cool. Mix sour cream and ranch dressing mix together. Spread in 11 x 9 pan. Spread cooled hamburger mix on top of the sour cream. Add cheese lettuce onion and tomatoes. Serve with tortilla chips. ; name: onion chicken stuffing bake ; ingredients: seasoned stuffing mix, cooked chicken, condensed cream of chicken soup, sour cream, dry onion soup mix, mushroom stems and pieces, sliced water chestnuts, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Prepare stuffing mix according to package directions. Set aside. Place chicken in a greased 2-qt. Baking dish. Combine the soup, sour cream and dry soup mix. Spread over chicken. Sprinkle with mushrooms and water chestnuts. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Bake uncovered at 350 degrees for 30 to 35 minutes or until bubbly. ; name: spiced peaches ; ingredients: peaches in heavy syrup, whole cloves, cinnamon sticks, sugar, vinegar ; preparation:Drain peaches, reserve syrup. Combine syrup, cloves, cinnamon stick, sugar and vinegar in a medium saucepan. Bring to a boil. Cover and simmer 5 minutes. Remove from heat, add peach halves and cool completely. Refridgerate in airtight container overnight. ; name: spaghetti with italian tuna capers ; ingredients: olive oil, onion, garlic cloves, crushed red pepper flakes, anchovy fillet, crushed tomatoes, capers, tuna in olive oil, spaghetti, fresh parsley ; preparation:

name: sweet hawaiian crock pot chicken ; ingredients: boneless chicken, pineapple juice, brown sugar, soy sauce ; preparation:Combine pineapple juice, brown sugar and soy sauce. Mix well. Stir in chicken pieces, coating well. Pour into crock pot and cook on low for 6-8 hours. Serve over rice. If desired, you may also add chunks of pineapple, bell pepper, sliced carrots, onion --. ; name: glorified rice dessert salad ; ingredients: cooked white rice, crushed pineapple, sugar, miniature marshmallow, whipping cream, vanilla, maraschino cherry ; preparation:Mix rice, pineapple, sugar and marshmallows in a bowl. Whip cream with additional sugar and vanilla until stiff. Fold into rice mixture. Chill. Decorate with maraschino cherries or slices of fresh pineapple or strawberries. Serves 6-8. ; name: rich butter pecan cookies ; ingredients: butter, sugar, egg, water, vanilla, all-purpose flour, salt, pecans ; preparation:Separate white of egg from yolk and set aside. Cream butter and sugar. Beat egg yolk with water and add to creamed butter mixture. Add vanilla, flour and salt. Lightly grease a cookie sheet. Patting dough with hands, thinly spread onto cookie sheet, covering only a three-fourth area of the sheet. Cut white of egg to keep it from being too stringy and smear over top of batter by hand. Sprinkle finely chopped pecans on top and press inches. Bake in a 350 degree oven for approximately 15 to 20 minutes until lightly browned on edges. Do not overcook. When cool, cut into squares. ; name: chicken in peanut curry ; ingredients: coconut milk, red curry paste, creamy peanut butter, sugar, fish sauce, chicken breasts, garlic, onion, cornstarch, salt ; preparation:In a medium sauce pan heat coconut milk, curry paste, peanut butter, sugar, and fish sauce until they come to a very small boil. Set aside and cool adding cornstarch to thicken. While the sauce is cooling, stir fry 1 chopped onion and 1 t minced garlic. Cut up chicken into small pieces and stir fry with the onion and garlic until chicken is cooked through. Combine the garlic, onion and chicken with the sauce and heat. Spoon the chicken peanut curry over rice and enjoy. ; name: smashed sweet potatoes with dried cranberries ; ingredients: sweet potatoes, apple juice, light brown sugar, salt, fresh ground black pepper, dried sweetened cranberries ; preparation:Add the sweet potato slices to a lightly oiled 4-quart slow cooker. In a small bowl, mix together the apple juice and brown sugar. Pour mixture over the potatoes. Season with salt and pepper. Cover and cook on low for 6 hours, until the potatoes are tender. Right before servings, smash the potatoes with a potato masher until smooth. Fold in the cranberries. Serve hot. ; name: king prawns with thai dipping sauce ; ingredients: thai fish sauce, rice vinegar, caster sugar, lime juice, sunflower oil, king prawns, mint leaf ; preparation:Place fish sauce, vinegar and caster sugar in a saucepan with 4. 5 fl oz water and bring gently to boiling point. Allow to cool and stir in lime juice. Heat a frying pan and add the oil. When hot, add prawns and toss gently for 2-3 minutes, until they are completely pink. Dish on to a large plate and scatter with mint leaves and some sea salt. Serve with the dipping sauce. ; name: cowboy casserole ; ingredients: ground beef, baked beans, barbecue sauce, bisquick baking mix, milk, butter, cheddar cheese ; preparation:Brown ground beef and drain, preheat oven to 425f. Stir baked beans and barbecue sauce into beans heat to boiling while stirring, pour into sprayed 2 quart casserole dish. Stir bisquick mix, milk, and butter until dough forms. Drop by spoonfuls onto beef mixture. Bake uncovered 20 minutes until topping is golden brown. Sprinkle with cheese and cook about 3 minutes more or until cheese is melted. ; name: meat and potatoes quiche a k a the man s quiche ; ingredients: frozen pie crusts, ground beef, hash brown potatoes, sharp cheddar cheese, heavy cream, eggs, salt, black pepper, onion salt ; preparation:

name: crock pot short ribs n noodles ; ingredients: short rib of beef, onion, butter, ketchup, soy sauce, apple cider vinegar, brown sugar, egg noodles ; preparation:Put short ribs on a broiler pan and broil until well browned to remove excess fat. Put ribs in crock pot. In a medium skillet, melt butter and saute onion until golden, pour in ketchup, soy sauce, vinegar and brown sugar. Heat until blended. Pour over ribs. Cover, cook on low 8 hours. Cook noodles per package directions. Serve ribs over noodles. ; name: pasta e fagioli ii ; ingredients: cannellini beans, rigatoni pasta, garlic, unsmoked bacon, sage, rosemary, hot red pepper, olive oil ; preparation:Cook the beans over gentle heat for 45 minutes or an hour at the most. In either case, do not add salt which tends to harden the skins. Puree by putting through a vegetable mill, carefully eliminating the husks. Put the garlic, rosemary, sage and cubed bacon to saute briefly in a saucepan with 4 tablespoons of oil. Pour on the bean puree. Season lightly with salt and the red hot pepper to taste. Stir to blend the flavours and bring slowly to the boil. Throw the pasta into the puree and cook until firm, diluting with a little of the bean cooking water, but only if necessary - the soup must be thick and rather solid. It is excellent hot, but is absolutely delicious if heated up with the addition of a drop of first-rate olive oil. If you prefer, leave a few beans whole and add them to the saucepan with the puree. Some cooks hold that a carrot is not out of place in the mirepoix, or that the soup loses nothing if you add a little tomato, even tomato concentrate. ; name: spicy wings ; ingredients: chicken wings, corn syrup, catsup, cider vinegar, worcestershire sauce, dijon mustard, onion, garlic, chili powder ; preparation:Cut wings into 3 sections, discard. Place sections on well greased baking pan. Bake at 375 for 45 minutes, or until done. In large pan, mix all remaining ingredients. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat, simmer for 20 minutes. When wings are done, add to the sauce and mix well to coat all the wings. ; name: minted baby carrots ; ingredients: baby carrots, water, apple juice, cornstarch, fresh mint leaves, ground cinnamon ; preparation:Put 6 cups of water into a large pan. Boil carrots until tender crisp. About 10 minutes. Drain. In a small pan, stir cornstarch into apple juice. Over moderate heat, cook, stirring, until sauce consistency. Stir in mint and cinnamon. Pour sauce over carrots and toss to coat. ; name: outback steakhouse outback special ; ingredients: sirloin steaks, old bay seasoning, light brown sugar, garlic powder, onion powder, ground cumin ; preparation:Heat an outdoor grill, stovetop grill pan, or broiler. Mix spice rub ingredients. Rub on both sides of steak. Grill or broil 5 minutes on each side for medium-rare. Remove to plates. Let rest 5 minutes before serving. ; name: marinated baby marrow courgette zucchini ; ingredients: baby marrows, lemon juice, olive oil, salt, garlic cloves ; preparation:Mix lemon juice. Olive oil. Salt and garlic together and place in an airtight container. Slice baby marrow in half lengthwise. Boil for 4 minutes and remove from water promptly and dunk into marinade. Seal container and refrigerate until cold. ; name: peanut butter rice krispies bars no bake ; ingredients: sugar, light brown sugar, light corn syrup, creamy peanut butter, vanilla, rice krispies, salted peanuts ; preparation:In a large microwave-safe bowl combine the white sugar, brown sugar, corn syrup and peanut putter. Microwave on high for 3-4 minutes or until melted, stirring once. Stir in vanilla. Fold in rice cereal and the chopped peanuts until well combined. Spread into a lightly buttered 13 x 9-inch glass baking dish. Cover and chill for 1 hour or until set. Cut into squares. ; name: chocolate cherry dump it cake ; ingredients: crushed pineapple, cherry pie filling, chocolate cake mix, margarine, flaked coconut ; preparation:

name: super easy peanut noodles ; ingredients: ramen noodles, creamy peanut butter, garlic clove, soy sauce, lime, juice of, red pepper flakes, carrots, red peppers, scallion ; preparation:Break up noodles in the package into smaller pieces. Throw away flavor packets. Cook in boiling water for two minutes or until al dente and then drain. Combine the peanut butter, garlic, soy sauce and lime juice. Add red pepper flakes to your preference. Stir or whisk until smooth. Add the carrots, red pepper and scallions. Pour over the noodles. You can substitute whatever vegetables you have on hand, if you have a can of water chestnuts or a bag of bean sprouts or some celery that works too. ; name: spinach rice casserole ; ingredients: onion, spinach, brown rice, low-sodium tamari, cumin, tomatoes ; preparation:Saute onion in a small amount of water until translucent. Add spinach and steam until barely tender. Remove from heat. Mix the rice with the onions, spinach and tamari. Press into non-stick baking dish. Layer sliced tomatoes over the top. Bake 30 minutes at 350 degrees. ; name: quick crustless quiche ; ingredients: cheese, bacon, broccoli, onion, eggs, flour, butter, salt, milk ; preparation:If using frozen, thaw and drain thoroughly. Preheat oven to 175c. Layer 1st 4 ingredients in 10 buttered pie plate. Blend remaining ingredients and pour over layers. Bake for 35-40 minutes. ; name: skillet pork chops and rice ; ingredients: pork chops, long grain and wild rice blend, water, whole tomatoes, scallions, golden raisin ; preparation:In a large skillet, cook pork chops over medium high heat, turning once until browned on both sides, about 5 minutes. Remove to a plate. Add rice and seasonings from mix to skillet, along with water, tomatoes and their liquids, scallions and raisins. Mix well. Heat to boiling. Reduce heat and place pork chops on top of the rice. Cover and simmer for 45 minutes or until rice is cooked. ; name: cherry cream cheese dessert ; ingredients: cream cheese, sweetened condensed milk, lemon juice, vanilla extract, cherry pie filling, slivered almonds ; preparation:In a large bowl, beat cream cheese until fluffy. Beat in sweetened condensed milk, lemon juice, and vanilla. Lightly swirl pie filling into cream cheese mixture. Spoon into serving dishes. Cover and chill. Garnish with almonds. Prep time includes refrigeration time. ; name: pineapple fudge ; ingredients: sugar, brown sugar, crushed pineapple in juice, sweetened condensed milk, corn syrup, salt, butter, marshmallows, vanilla, pecans ; preparation:In 2-quart saucepan, combine sugars, pineapple, condensed milk, corn syrup, salt and butter. Cook to 238 degrees on a candy thermometer, stirring occasionally. Remove from heat. Add marshmallows and vanilla. Stir together to melt marshmallows. Beat until mixture is heavy and creamy. Add pecans. Spread in buttered 8 x 8 x 2-inch pan. Cool until firm. Cut into squares. ; name: coriander honey lemon prawns ; ingredients: large shrimp, olive oil, gingerroot, fresh coriander, oyster sauce, ground black pepper, honey, lemon juice ; preparation:Wash prawns, remove shells, leaving heads and tails intact. Season prawns with ginger, coriander, oyster sauce, pepper for at least 30 minute. Add olive oil to honey and lemon juice. Brush prawns with this mixture. Grill at 200c for 10-15 minute. Baste once with leftover marinade with honey glaze. Serve grilled prawns with lemon slices. ; name: chicken and rice cheesy casserole ; ingredients: healthy request cream of chicken soup, water, white rice, onion powder, vegetables, boneless skinless chicken breast halves, reduced-fat cheddar cheese ; preparation:

name: little meat rolls ; ingredients: ground round, sweet onion, teriyaki sauce, parmesan cheese, egg, bread, salt and pepper, pie crust ; preparation:Mix the meat with the onion, egg, bread, cheese, sauce, salt and pepper. Mix very well. Roll out the crust and cut into a 3-inch square. Take a walnut or egg size bunch of meat mixture in your hand, and roll into an oblong shape, put on the center of the crust and pinch the top together. Bake at 350f for 35 minutes or until browned. Makes about 20. ; name: herb and garlic goat cheese truffles ; ingredients: cream cheese, goat cheese, fresh lemon juice, fresh chives, fresh basil, garlic, black pepper, pecans, fruit ; preparation:Beat the cream cheese, goat cheese and lemon juice with an electric mixer until smooth. Stir in chives, basil, garlic, and black pepper. Cover and chill for 2 hours or until firm. Shape cheese mixture into 24 balls. Roll each ball in the pecans. Cover and chill for at least 1 hour. Serve with fruit. ; name: okra walnut salad ; ingredients: frozen breaded okra, salad greens, red onion, walnuts, salad dressing ; preparation:Preheat oven to 425 degrees. Bake okra in a single layer on a lightly greased baking sheet for 20 minutes or until golden brown. You may also fry the okra following the package directions if you wish to do so. Toss okra, salad greens, onion& walnuts in a large serving bowl. Heat the salad dressing and serve warm with the salad. ; name: apples in wine and cinnamon sauce ; ingredients: margarine, dry white wine, sliced apples, ground cinnamon, sugar, lemon juice, vanilla ; preparation:Over medium heat in a heavy saucepan, melt the margarine, then add the wine and stir in the apples. Sprinkle the cinnamon and sugar over the mixture and stir. Continue cooking for about 10 minutes, then stir in the lemon juice and vanilla. Lower the heat to a simmer and cover. Continue cooking for 2 hours, stirring occasionally until the apples break up. ; name: asian green beans ; ingredients: fresh green beans, soy sauce, vegetable oil, vinegar, sesame oil, garlic clove ; preparation:Wash the beans and snap the ends off. Blanche them in boiling water for 3-4 minutes. Drain immediately and put into an ice cold water bath to retain crispness. Mix remaining ingredients in a small bowl. Pour over cooled green beans and refrigerate for at least half an hour, then serve. The longer they marinate the more intensely the flavors will develop. ; name: pecan praline bars ; ingredients: graham crackers, butter, brown sugar, pecans ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350f. Arrange graham crackers in ungreased 15x10x1-inch pan. Place butter and sugar in sauce pan. Heat to boiling point. Boil 2 minutes. Stir in pecans and spread evenly over crackers. Bake about 10 minutes. Cut each graham cracker in half while warm. ; name: blueberry crunch cobbler ; ingredients: all-purpose flour, quick-cooking oats, brown sugar, sweet creamy butter, fresh blueberries, sugar, water, cornstarch, salt, vanilla ; preparation:Heat oven to 350 degrees. In a large mixing bowl combine all the crust ingredients. Beat at medium speed on mixer, scraping bowl often, until crumbly. Press 2 cups of the crumb mixture on bottom of ungreased 13x9 inch baking pan. Place blueberries over the crumb crust. In 2-qt saucepan combine remaining filling ingredients except vanilla. Cook over medium heat, stirring the mixture occasionally, until it thickens and comes to a full boil. Continue boiling for 1 minute. Mix in vanilla. Pour over blueberries. Sprinkle with the remaining crumb mixture. Bake for 50 to 60 minutes or until lightly browned. ; name: quick domino slice ; ingredients: butter, brown sugar, egg, cocoa, plain flour, coconut, icing sugar, boiling water ; preparation:

name: four cheese stuffed chicken breasts ; ingredients: ricotta cheese, mozzarella cheese, provolone cheese, parmesan cheese, parsley, fine dry breadcrumbs, chicken breasts, butter ; preparation:In a medium bowl, combine cheeses, parsley and crumbs. Rinse and pat chicken breasts dry. Bone breasts without removing skins. Halve breasts carefully. Separate skin from flesh of each breast, leaving one side attached. Spoon cheese mixture between skin and flesh of each breast. Tuck skin edges under the breast. Secure with wooden picks. Place breasts, skin side up, in a shallow baking dish, brush with melted butter. Bake uncovered in a 350f. Oven 40 to 45 minutes, basting occasionally with juices. ; name: melt in your mouth cookies ; ingredients: butter, icing sugar, water, vanilla extract, all-purpose flour, nuts ; preparation:Cream butter and sugar together. Add water and vanilla to the mixture. Gradually add flour, fold in nuts. Roll dough into 1 inch balls. Place on ungreased baking sheets and flatten with fingers. Bake at 300 f for 20-25 minutes. Cool on a wire rack. ; name: ww sliced baked potatoes 4 points ; ingredients: baking potatoes, parmesan cheese, cheddar cheese, butter, fresh herbs, salt ; preparation:Preheat the oven to 425 degrees f. Peel the potatoes if the skin is too tough, otherwise just scrub and rinse them. Cut the potatoes into thin slices. Put the potatoes in a baking dish. Slightly fan out the slices. Drizzle the potatoes with melted butter and sprinkle with herbs and salt. Bake the potatoes for about 50 minutes. Remove the potatoes from the oven, sprinkle with parmesan and cheddar cheese. Bake the potatoes for another 10-15 minutes. ; name: cheddarburger loaf ; ingredients: lean ground beef, cheddar cheese, plain breadcrumbs, egg, onion, heinz 57 steak sauce, milk, salt, pepper ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350f. Combine all ingredients in a large bowl. Make into loaf. Bake in oven for 1 hour. Serve. ; name: zesty lemon pesto ; ingredients: basil leaves, garlic cloves, lemon zest, fresh lemon juice, pine nuts, asiago cheese, olive oil, salt & freshly ground black pepper ; preparation:Combine basil, garlic, lemon zest, lemon juice, pine nuts and cheese in a food processor or blender. Process to mix. With the machine running, slowly add the oil. Season to taste with salt and pepper and process to the desired consistency. Let stand for at least 5 minutes before serving. ; name: quick supper frit ; ingredients: potato, green onions, olive oil, eggs, milk, cheddar cheese, sausage ; preparation:In a medium sized non-stick skillet heat the olive oil. Saute the onion and potatoes until browned and tender. Pour eggs over the top and cook until almost set. Sprinkle cheese over top and cover until eggs are completely set and cheese has melted. Serve while hot. ; name: easy creamy corn casserole ; ingredients: whole kernel corn, cream-style corn, wide egg noodles, onion, carrot, velveeta cheese, salt and pepper, saltine crackers, butter, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Grease a 1-quart baking dish. Set oven to 350 degrees. In a bowl, combine the first seven ingredients. Transfer to a baking dish. Mix cracker crumbs and parmesan cheese together, then add in the butter and butter. Mix to combine, then sprinkle over top. Bake uncovered for 45-50 minutes or until heated through. ; name: blond brownies ; ingredients: light brown sugar, self rising flour, eggs, vegetable oil, vanilla extract, semisweet chocolate morsel, pecans ; preparation:

name: chicken jerusalem ; ingredients: chicken thighs, butter, green onions, white wine, water, mushroom, salt, artichoke hearts, parmesan cheese ; preparation:In a large skillet, melt butter. Brown chicken pieces. Add green onions, water and wine. Simmer for 45 minutes. Add the mushrooms, salt, and artichoke hearts. Simmer for an additional 15 minutes. Before serving top with grated parmesan cheese. ; name: blueberry orange muffins ; ingredients: oranges, margarine, eggs, milk, flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, wild blueberries ; preparation:Preheat oven to 375f. Lightly grease muffin cups or spray with cooking spray. Place orange pieces in blender and blend until finely chopped. Add margarine, eggs, and milk and blend until well mixed. Combine flour, sugar, baking powder, and baking soda in a large bowl. Make a well in center and add orange mixture, stirring just until moistened. Fold in blueberries. Fill muffin cups and bake for 22-25 minutes or until golden. Cool 10 minutes in pan before removing. ; name: eggless moist chocolate cake ; ingredients: cake flour, granulated sugar, cocoa powder, baking soda, salt, vanilla extract, white vinegar, vegetable oil, cold water ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Combine flour, sugar, cocoa powder, baking soda and salt in a bowl and mix well. Make three holes in mixture for next three liquid ingredients. Pour vanilla into 1st hole, vinegar into 2nd and oil into 3rd. Pour cold water over all. Mix with fork or wire wisk just until well blended. Pour into two 9 inch pans coated with cooking spray. Bake for 25 - 30 minutes. Cool completely in pans on a wire rack. ; name: fennel provencal ; ingredients: fennel bulb, onion, tomatoes, garlic cloves, olive oil, lemon, juice of, dry white wine, fresh sage, fresh basil, fresh thyme ; preparation:Fry the onions and garlic gently in the olive oil in a large saucepan. Add the chopped fennel and cook for approximately five minutes. Add the white wine, simmer for ten minutes. Add the chopped tomatoes and the herbs. Cover the pot and simmer for fifteen minutes. Remove lid and simmer further uncovered to thicken sauce if preferred. Just prior to serving add the lemon juice and salt and pepper to taste. May be served cold. ; name: spinach and shrimp ; ingredients: shrimp, garlic, butter, fresh parmesan cheese, baby spinach, lemon juice ; preparation:Boil shrimp till pink. Drain and set aside. Saute garlic in butter till barely brown. Add shrimp back into pan, along with parmesan. Turn off heat but leave pan on burner. For gas turn lowest. Add spinach and stir, till barely barely limp. If desired, add lemon juice. Serve with dressing. ; name: crab meat tacos ; ingredients: olive oil, sweet onion, fresh tomato, cabbage, crab delights imitation crab, eggs, milk, salt, corn tortillas, ranch dressing ; preparation:Heat large non-stick skillet over medium heat. Add olive oil. Add the chopped sweet onion. Cook until light brown. Add the diced tomato, shredded cabbage and crab meat. Stir. Meanwhile, beat the eggs together with the milk and salt. Add the beaten egg mixture to the skillet. Stir and cook until the eggs are done, cooked and seasoned with 1 tablespoon ranch dressing. Heat the tortillas in a skillet. Fill with the cooked crab meat. Pour the remaining ranch dressing on top. ; name: banana chocolate chip muffins ; ingredients: bananas, egg, low-fat buttermilk, granulated sugar, brown sugar, flour, baking soda, salt, chocolate chips, walnuts ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Lightly coat 12 muffin tin liners with cooking spray and place in muffin tin. In large bowl, mash bananas with fork. Whisk in egg, milk, granulated sugar, and brown sugar. In separate bowl, combine flour, baking soda, and salt. Add flour mixture to banana mixture and combine well. Fold in chocolate chips and walnuts. Spoon equal amounts of batter into 12 muffin cups. Bake 20 minutes or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Allow to cool slightly in pan, then remove to wire rack. ; name: low salt savoury rice ; ingredients: white rice, olive oil, margarine, chopped tomatoes, garlic clove, onion, green capsicum, pepper, boiling water ; preparation:

name: penne with zucchini and ricotta cheese ; ingredients: zucchini, olive oil, garlic, penne, fresh basil, ricotta cheese, salt and pepper, fresh parmesan cheese ; preparation:Boil the water, and add salt. Boil the zucchini for about 2 min, let it cool off. Cut it in pices of 1 cm. Heat the oil in a pan. Frie the garlic until soft, add the zucchini and let it fry on lowheat. Boil the pasta. When the pasta is ready drain it from water and add the zucchini, and basil. Mix it with the ricotta cheese. Serve with parmesan. ; name: magic french fudge ; ingredients: semi-sweet chocolate chips, sweetened condensed milk, vanilla, salt, nuts ; preparation:In a double-boiler melt chocolate. Remove from heat and add the sweetened condensed milk, vanilla, salt, and nuts. Stir until smooth. Turn into wax paper lined 8 inch square pan and chill in fridge. Store in cool place in an airtight container. ; name: heavenly raspberry pie ; ingredients: 9-inch pie shell, fresh raspberries, sugar, cold water, cornstarch, lemon juice ; preparation:Prepare pie crust as directed and bake. Set aside. In medium saucepan mix 2 cups raspberries, sugar, cold water, lemon juice and cornstarch. Cook and stir over medium heat until it is thick and bubbles. Then cook it 2 more minutes. Remove from heat and cool slightly. Cover and refrigerate until thoroughly chilled. Gently fold in 2 more cups of raspberries. Spoon into the cooled pie shell. Cover and chill for at least 2 more hours or until firm. Serve with remaining cup of berries and whipped cream. ; name: caramelized onion brie smoked ham croissants ; ingredients: margarine, red onion, canadian bacon, plain croissants, brie cheese ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350f. Melt margarine in a skillet, cook onion over medium-high heat, stirring occasionally, 10 minutes or until onion is golden brown. Remove onion and set aside. In same skillet, heat bacon, turning once. On baking sheet, arrange 2 croissant halves. Evenly top with bacon, then onions, then cheese. Bake 2 minutes or until cheese is slightly melted. Top with remaining croissant halves and serve hot. ; name: my mom s famous white rice ; ingredients: white rice, water, butter, olive oil, garlic clove, small onion, salt ; preparation:Pour water and white rice in a rice cooker. Add butter and olive oil. Slice the garlic clove in half and add both halves. Slice a small onion in half and add the onion half to the rice cooker. Add salt. Cook in covered rice cooker. ; name: portobello pizza ; ingredients: extra virgin olive oil, garlic clove, portabella mushroom caps, salt, black pepper, mozzarella cheese, fresh basil leaves, tomatoes, oregano leaves ; preparation:Combine oil and garlic in a small bowl and rub the mushroom caps on all sides with the mixture. Place caps, top side down, in a circle on an oiled baking sheet. Season with salt and pepper. Arrange the cheese, basil, and tomato slices alternately in a circle on top of the mushrooms. Sprinkle with oregano, if using. Bake at 450 until the cheese melts, about 3 minutes. ; name: bringing home baby carrots ; ingredients: baby carrots, apple juice, water, honey ; preparation:In a large saucepan, combine all ingredients. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Cover and simmer for 10-14 minutes or until carrots are tender. Serve with a slotted spoon. ; name: sizzlin southwest guacamole ; ingredients: hass avocadoes, limes, juice of, cilantro leaf, corn kernel, red bell pepper, red onion, jalapeno jack cheese, hot sauce, salt ; preparation:

name: ham and cheese bars ; ingredients: bisquick, ham, cheddar cheese, onion, parmesan cheese, sour cream, salt, garlic powder, whole milk, egg ; preparation:In a bowl, combine all the ingredients in a mixing bowl, and mix by hand. Spread in a greased 9x13 inch baking pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes or until lightly brown. Cut in rectangles, about 2 inches by 1 inch. Serve hot or at room temperature. ; name: basted eggs ; ingredients: butter, eggs, salt, pepper, water ; preparation:Heat butter until melted. Add eggs. Fry until white is starting to set. Salt and pepper to taste. Add water and cover immediately. Some people add less water but i like a little more. The steam will cook the top of eggs. It takes just a minute or so, depending on how well done you like your eggs. Hard will be just like hard boiled eggs, that yellow color. I serve these with toast and fried potatoes, just like over easy eggs. ; name: mellow yellow jello salad ; ingredients: crushed pineapple, lemon jell-o gelatin, 7-up soda, pineapple juice, flour, butter, eggs, whipped topping ; preparation:Mix the pineapple, jello, and 7up. Pour into a 9x13 dish. Put into refrigerator to set. In saucepan, mix juice, flour, butter and eggs. Cook and stir, on med, bring to a boil. Boil for 1 minute. Allow to cool, while jello sets. Mix the cooled cooked mixture with the whipped topping. Spread over the jello. ; name: braised straw mushrooms in soy sauce ; ingredients: straw mushrooms, garlic cloves, vegetable oil, salt and pepper, sugar, soy sauce, cilantro ; preparation:Rinse mushrooms, pat dry with paper towel. Heat oil in a medium pan, saute garlic until fragrant. Add mushrooms, stir quickly then season with salt, pepper, sugar ans soy sauce. Saute until some liquid starts to evaporate. Remove from heat, spoon into serving dish and garnish with cilantro. ; name: baked cod with cheese ; ingredients: cod fish fillets, sage, salt, pepper, swiss cheese, sour cream ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Wash and dry fish. Sprinkle both sides with sage, salt, and pepper. Place in greased shallow baking dish. Sprinkle cheese on top and cover with sour cream. Bake 25 minutes. Adjust sour cream, sage, salt, pepper to taste as desired. ; name: white chocolate and strawberry trifle ; ingredients: vanilla pudding mix, milk, white chocolate baking squares, cool whip, frozen pound cake, orange liqueur, fresh strawberries, strawberries, white chocolate baking square ; preparation:Prepare pudding with milk according to package directions. Remove from heat. Stir in 6 squares of chocolate until melted and smooth. Cover with plastic wrap and chill. Fold in 1 cup of whipped topping. Cut cake into small cubes and drizzle with liqueur. In the bottom of a deep glass bowl, layer half of the cake cubes, half the berries, half the pudding, and half the grated chocolate. Repeat layers, ending with chocolate. Top with remaining whipped topping. Garnish with berries. Drizzle melted chocolate over top. ; name: sweet potatoes from the carolinas ; ingredients: olive oil, shallots, sweet potatoes, fresh parsley, salt and black pepper ; preparation:Heat oil in saucepan over medium heat. Add shallots and sweet potatoes. Season well. Cover and cook for 18 to 30 minutes, stirring 3 to 4 times. When vegetables are cooked sprinkle with parsley. Serve. ; name: easy cheesy corn bake casserole ; ingredients: cream cheese, milk, eggs, whole kernel corn, cream-style corn, corn muffin mix, cheddar cheese ; preparation:

name: crispy baked basa ; ingredients: almonds, cornmeal, parmesan cheese, parsley, flour, lemon pepper, basa fillets, lemon juice ; preparation:Combine the first six ingredients in mixing bowl. Dip fillets first in lemon juice, then in almond mixture to coat throughly. Place on baking sheet. Bake at 400 degrees, 15-20 minutes, or until fish is cooked through. Garnish with parsley, serve with lemon wedges and your favorite tarter sauce. ; name: italian pizzaiola beefsteak pizza style ; ingredients: round steaks, italian stewed tomatoes, dried oregano, dried parsley, onion salt, black pepper, crushed red pepper flakes, garlic cloves, olive oil, mozzarella cheese ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350f. Place steaks, in one layer, in a 9x13-inch baking pan. Mash up tomatoes and pour on top of steaks, spreading to cover steaks. Sprinkle with oregano, parsley, onion salt, black pepper, crushed red pepper, and minced garlic. Drizzle olive oil on top and bake, uncovered for 1 hour and 15 minutes. Take steaks out of oven. Sprinkle tops with shredded mozzarella cheese. Return to oven and bake until cheese is melted. ; name: warm artichoke and salsa dip ; ingredients: marinated artichoke hearts, green onion, green chili salsa, monterey jack cheese, sour cream, fresh cilantro ; preparation:Drain and discard marinade from artichokes. Coarsely chop artichokes, and combine with green onion and green salsa in saucepan. Stir frequently over medium heat until mixture is warmed throughout. Remove from heat before stirring in cheese, sour cream, and cilantro. Serve warm. ; name: yakisoba ; ingredients: boneless steak, birds eye frozen japanese-style vegetables, ramen noodles, soy sauce, salt and pepper, oil ; preparation:Cut semi-frozen steak into thin bite size pieces and stir-fry over medium heat until thoroughly browned, heat 2 quarts water to rapid boil while stir-frying meat. Add 1 to 2 seasoning packets of seasoning mix from noodles to steak. Add ramen noodles to water and boil 3 minutes. While cooking noodles, add vegetables and soy sauce to taste to steak and heat thoroughly. When noodles are done, drain and add to steak and vegetable mixture. Salt and pepper to taste. ; name: mexican chicken tortilla skillet ; ingredients: olive oil, boneless skinless chicken breast, campbells condensed creamy verde soup, water, mexicorn, 8-inch flour tortillas, cheese ; preparation:Heat oil in a skillet over medium high heat. Cook chicken until browned stirring often. When done cut into strips. Place back into skillet and add soup, water, corn& tortillas. Bring to a boil. Cover, cook over low heat for 5 minutes or until hot. Top with cheese and serve. ; name: mimi s lasagne chili soup ; ingredients: zucchini, onion, sweet italian turkey sausage, garlic cloves, spaghetti sauce, beef broth, water, pasta, basil ; preparation:Coarsely chop zucchini and set aside. Coarsely chop onion and put into pot with turkey sausage which has been crumbled up as best you can. Heat pan to medium and cook till sausage is done continuing to break up sausage, adding the garlic while it is cooking. Drain. Add spaghetti sauce, broth, and water. Bring to a boil. Stir in pasta. Reduce heat cook covered for about 7 minutes. Stir in zucchini and cook for 2-4 more minutes or till zucchini is done. Stir in basil. Ladle soup into bowls and enjoy. ; name: applesauce on a stick ; ingredients: unsweetened pineapple juice, apples, cinnamon, raisins, sugar, wooden popsicle sticks ; preparation:Process apples, juice, cinnamon and raisins in blender or food processor until smooth. Add sugar to taste. It will taste less sweet when frozen. Spoon into 3-4 ounce paper or plastic cups or frozen sucker molds. Place in freezer. When partially frozen, insert a stick in each cup and finish freezing. ; name: whole grain energy bar ; ingredients: honey, mini chocolate chip, millet, wheat germ, puffed kashi, oatmeal, natural-style peanut butter, raisins ; preparation:

name: cure all ginger tea ; ingredients: water, fresh ginger, cayenne pepper, artificial sweetener ; preparation:In a medium saucepan on high heat, bring the water to a boil. Add the ginger and cayenne and reduce heat. Simmer for 20 minutes and strain. Add sweetener to taste. Drink and be healthy. ; name: broiled steelhead trout with rosemary lemon and garlic ; ingredients: steelhead fillet, garlic, fresh rosemary, lemon, zest of, lemon, juice of, salt, fresh ground pepper, olive oil, oil ; preparation:Prepare a baking or roasting pan by lining it with foil and brushing it with olive oil. Preheat broiler. Mix together all remaining ingredients except fish into a well-blended paste. Place fish skin-side down on baking sheet, then spread seasoning over flesh. Broil fish at second rack away from heat for 5 minutes or less, just enough to sear flesh but not burn herbs. Lower fish to 3rd or 4th rack and lower oven heat to 325f bake for 10 additional minutes, or until fish is cooked through in the thickest portion. Serve with steamed vegetables, salad, orzo salad, whatever. ; name: my real pumpkin pie ; ingredients: pie crusts, eggs, pumpkin, sugar, salt, cinnamon, ginger, ground cloves, sweetened condensed milk, evaporated milk ; preparation:Combine the eggs, pumpkin, sugar, salt, cinnamon, ginger, cloves and milk. Mix well and pour into prepared pie crusts. Bake in a 425f oven for 15 minutes. Reduce temperature to 350f and bake an additional 50-60 minutes or until the center of the pie is no longer wobbly or liquid. Cool and serve with whipped topping or vanilla ice cream. ; name: crustless apple butter pumpkin pie 2 ww points ; ingredients: canned pumpkin, egg beaters egg substitute, skim milk, salt, pumpkin pie spice, all-purpose flour, apple butter, cool whip free ; preparation:Beat all together until smooth. Pour into a pam sprayed pie pan. Bake at 400 for 15 minutes, then at 375 for 45 minutes, or until a knife inserted comes out clean. Top each slice with 1 t. Cool whip. ; name: spanish style potato salad ; ingredients: russet potato, mayonnaise, smoked paprika, yellow onion, salt-free garlic powder, salt, white pepper ; preparation:Wash and peel potatoes. Cut up into chunks. Bring a large pot of water to boiling and cook potatoes until fork tender. Drain. Set aside to cool briefly. Transfer potatoes to a large serving bowl. Combine the mayonnaise and smoked paprika. Add to the potatoes. Add the remaining ingredients and stir to combine. Cover and chill. Before serving, adjust seasonings if necessary and garnish with fresh parsley if desired. Tastes better the second day. ; name: a healthier apple nut snack cake ; ingredients: egg beaters egg substitute, vanilla, splenda brown sugar blend, cinnamon, whole wheat flour, baking powder, salt, apples, walnuts ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350f and grease 8-inch square pan. In large mixing bow, beat egg beaters and vanilla until frothy. Gradually add splenda brown sugar, continuing to beat after each addition. Add cinnamon, baking powder and salt. Gradually add flour continuing to beat after each addition. Stir in apples and nuts. Pour into greased pan. Bake 30 to 45 minutes or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Serve warm or cool. Can be topped with whipped cream. ; name: potato salad with cumin tourchi batata tunisia ; ingredients: potato, olive oil, harissa, salt, cumin, lemon, fresh cilantro ; preparation:Cook potatoes in boiling water for 15 minutes or until tender but not too soft or mushy. Cool and peel, cut into cubes. Heat oil in a small skillet and add harissa, salt, cumin and lemon juice. Bring to a boil and boil for a few seconds. Pour over potatoes and toss. Refrigerate for 1 hour or overnight. Add the chopped cilantro or parsley just before serving. Stir it in or sprinkle on top as you wish. ; name: easy low fat curried zucchini soup ; ingredients: extra virgin olive oil, onion, garlic cloves, curry powder, zucchini, baking potato, broth, salt ; preparation:

name: skillet hamburger stroganoff ; ingredients: lean ground turkey, onion, low-fat cream of mushroom soup, sliced mushrooms, black pepper, noodles, nonfat sour cream, parsley ; preparation:In a large skillet sprayed with butter-flavored cooking spray, brown meat and onion. Add mushroom soup, mushrooms, black pepper and noodles. Mix well to combine. Simmer 10 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir in sour cream and parsley. Serve at once. ; name: cauliflower fromage ; ingredients: cauliflower, butter, garlic, dry breadcrumbs, pepper, nutmeg, swiss cheese ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400. Butter a shallow baking dish. Break cauliflower into bite size pieces and cook for about 10 minutes or til still slightly firm. Drain and rinse under cold water. Prepare the sauce by melting butter in a small saucepan. Add garlic& cook over med-low heat, stirring often, for 2 minutes. Stir in breadcrumbs, pepper and nutmeg. Stir constantly until mixture thickens, about 3 minutes. Spoon over cauliflower. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake in preheated oven for 15 minutes or til cheese is melted and bubbly. ; name: carrot bites a raw gluten free treat ; ingredients: carrots, walnuts, raw cashews, dates, fresh ginger, cinnamon, orange, zest of, sesame seeds, unsweetened dried shredded coconut ; preparation:In a food processor fitted with the s-blade, process carrots untill finely ground. Remove and set aside. Process the walnuts and cashews in the food processor until finely ground. Add the dates and process until finely chopped and incorporated into the nuts. Add the reserved carrots, ginger, cinnamon, orange zest and process until dough forms. Shape the mixture into 15-18 small balls. Roll in sesame seeds or shredded coconut to coat. Refrigerate until ready to enjoy. Can be refrigerated for up to 5 days. ; name: hoagie ; ingredients: italian bread, mozzarella cheese, cheddar cheese, mayonnaise, prepared mustard, roast beef, tomatoes, romaine lettuce ; preparation:Slice bread in half lengthwise and spread one side with mayo, the other side with mustard. Sprinkle cheddar on mayo side and mozz on mustard side. Spread meat on bread. Bake at 300 until cheese is melted. Add tomato and lettuce right before serving. Also good with avocado. ; name: bbq grilled apricot ginger chicken breasts ; ingredients: onions, olive oil, apricot preserves, ketchup, red wine vinegar, ground ginger, boneless skinless chicken breast halves ; preparation:For the sauce, in a small saucepan, cook the onion in hot oil until tender. Stir in the preserves, ketchup, vinegar and ginger and bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Cover and simmer for 3 minutes. Remove from heat. Preheat grill to medium. Grill chicken, uncovered, until chicken is tender and no longer pink, turning once and brushing with sauce only during the last 5 minutes of grilling. Reheat remaining sauce and pass along with chicken. ; name: espresso bark ; ingredients: semi-sweet chocolate chips, margarine, coffee beans, white chocolate ; preparation:Cover a cookie sheet with waxed paper. Combine the chocolate chips and margarine in a microwave-safe bowl. Heat in the microwave at 30 second intervals, stirring between each, until melted and smooth. Mix in the coffee beans until evenly distributed. Pour the chocolate out onto the waxed paper and spread into an even layer. Sprinkle the pieces of white chocolate evenly over the top and press in lightly to make sure they stick. Place in the freezer until set, about 5 minutes. Break into pieces and store in an airtight container. ; name: kleftiko ; ingredients: lemon, fresh oregano, salt, ground black pepper, lamb leg steaks, olive oil, onions, bay leaves, dry white wine, plain flour ; preparation:Mix together the lemon juice, oregano and salt and pepper and brush over both sides of the lamb. Leave to marinate for at least 4 hours or overnight. Preheat oven to 325 f. Drain the lamb, reserving marinade, and dry lamb with paper towel. Heat olive oil in frying pan and cook lamb over high heat just until browned on both sides. Transfer the lamb to a shallow pie dish. Scatter the sliced onions and bay leaves around the lamb, then pour the white wine and the reserved marinade on top. Mix the flour with sufficient water to make a firm dough. Moisten the rim of the pie dish. Roll out the dough on a floured surface and use to cover the dish so that it is tightly sealed. Bake for 2 hours, then break away the crust and serve the lamb hot. Potatoes make a great accompaniment. ; name: horseradish topped cod ww ; ingredients: horseradish, lemon, garlic cloves, fennel seed, panko breadcrumbs, parsley, pepper, salt, cod fish fillets, dijon mustard ; preparation:

name: deep dish pizza quiche ; ingredients: cream cheese, eggs, heavy cream, parmesan cheese, italian seasoning, pizza cheese, garlic powder, pizza sauce, mozzarella cheese ; preparation:Beat together cream cheese and eggs till smooth. Add cream, parmesan cheese and spices. Spray a 9-inch or larger glass baking dish with oil. Put the cups pizza cheese in dish and pour egg mixture over it. Bake at 375 degrees for 30 minutes or until eggs are set. Spread on pizza sauce, mozzarella cheese and favorite toppings. Bake until bubbly and browning. Let stand 10 minutes. Serve. ; name: spinach ricotta pizza with fresh tomato puree ; ingredients: pizza dough, tomatoes, garlic cloves, olive oil, fresh spinach, ricotta cheese, mozzarella cheese, fresh basil ; preparation:Divide dough into two and roll out into two thin crusts. Lightly brush olive oil to taste on top and bake the dough for 5 minutes in a 425 degree oven on a greased and floured pan. Meanwhile grate the four tomatoes into a medium bowl. If your tomatoes are really ripe, you can drain the excess liquid slighlty. Add the pressed garlic and olive oil. Add the spinach to a medium pan over medium heat and saute with salt and pepper to taste until half-wilted. Spread the tomato mixture on both crusts. Return to the oven for another 5 minutes. This should get rid of any excess liquid in the sauce. Top the pizzas with spinach, basil, and a light sprinkling of mozzarella. Finish by placing small dallops of ricotta around the pizza, using a small spoon. Bake for an additional 10 minutes or until cheese bubbles and begins to brown. ; name: peas n peppers ; ingredients: red peppers, water, frozen peas, butter, orange rind, dried rosemary, salt and pepper ; preparation:Cut the peppers in half lengthwise, remove stems, seeds and white membrane. Bring the water to a boil, add peas, return to boil cook 5 minutes until peas are tender, drain, reserve the cooking water. Puree the peas in your food processor add 5 tbsp of the reserved water and the butter return to saucepan and stir in the orange peel& rosemary heat through. Meanwhile immerse the peppers in boiling water and blanch for apprx 5 minutes or until the peppers are hot but still crisp fill the peppers with the pureed peas. Serve hot. ; name: pudding fruit salad ; ingredients: prepared vanilla pudding, frozen whipped topping, seedless grapes, mini marshmallows, mandarin orange segments, pineapple chunks in juice, fresh strawberries ; preparation:In a medium bowl, mix pudding and whipped topping. Gently stir in grapes, marshmallows, oranges, and pineapple. Add strawberries. Toss gently to coat. Serve immediately or store in refrigerator up to 8 hours. ; name: marinara marcaroni salad ; ingredients: salad macaroni, mayonnaise, chili powder, marinara sauce, sweet pickle relish, celery, onion, olive, salt and pepper ; preparation:Boil macaroni to al dente. Rinse with cold water and set aside to dry. Combine mayo, marinara, relish, celery, onion and olives. Add macaroni to mixture. Add salt and pepper to taste. Refrigerate 3-4 hours. ; name: not hot chili ; ingredients: ground beef, chili beans, crushed tomatoes in puree, green pepper, onions, celery, garlic cloves, chili powder, cumin ; preparation:Brown beef in skillet. In another skillet, saute peppers, onion, celery and garlic. Mix veggies with beef, put into crockpot. Add beans, tomatoes, chili powder and cumin. Cook on low 6 hrs or high 4 hours. ; name: mexican prune chipotle pork ; ingredients: pork, prunes, fresh tomato, chipotle chile, cooking oil ; preparation:Prehat oven to 150c. Sear the meat on all sides on a pan in the hot oil. Place on a baking dish in the oven for one hour. Process rest of the ingredients in the blender, strain, and pour over the meat. Continue cooking in oven until meat isdone and sauce is bubbly. ; name: sweet carrots ; ingredients: baby carrots, water, brown sugar, butter, white wine vinegar, salt ; preparation:

name: easy chicken luau ; ingredients: vegetable oil, chicken breasts, cream of chicken soup, coconut milk, frozen spinach ; preparation:Saute the chicken in the oil until just cooked through. Add the cream of chicken soup and the coconut milk. Heat until simmering. Add the spinach. Serve over steamed white rice. ; name: filipino shrimps sauteed ; ingredients: shrimp, onions, garlic cloves, soy sauce, mountain dew soda, sugar, cornstarch, water, tomatoes, oil ; preparation:Put oil in skillet. Add crushed cloves garlic and finely diced onion. Peel and devein shrimp leaving tails on. Add to pan fry. Add tomato diced fine. Add sugar. Add mountain dew or sprite. Cook 5 minutes. Add cornstarch and water. Cook until thick. ; name: vanilla wafer almond pie crust ; ingredients: vanilla wafer cookies, unsalted butter, salt, pure vanilla extract, almonds ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350-degrees. Process cookies in food processor until finely ground. Combine crumbs, butter, salt, vanilla and almonds, stirring until crumbs are moistened. Press mixture evenly across 9-inch pie plate. Bake crust until crisp, about 7 minutes. Let cool completely before filling. Crust may also be wrapped tightly in plastic and frozen up to one month. ; name: yams with lemon ; ingredients: yams, fresh lemon juice, italian parsley, salt, fresh ground pepper ; preparation:Preheat oven to 375f. Place the yams in a covered baking dish with just enough water to coat the bottom of the pan. Bake for 45-50 minutes or until tender. Sprinkle the lemon juice and parsley over yams. Salt and pepper to taste. Serve. ; name: moo shu vegetables ; ingredients: toasted sesame oil, eggs, fresh ginger, garlic cloves, mixed vegetables, mung bean sprouts, scallion, reduced sodium soy sauce, rice vinegar, hoisin sauce ; preparation:Heat 1 teaspoon oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add eggs. Cook, stirring gently, until set, 2 to 3 minutes. Remove to a plate. Wipe out the pan and heat the remaining 2 teaspoons oil over medium heat. Add ginger and garlic and cook, stirring, until softened and fragrant, 1 minute. Add shredded vegetables, bean sprouts, half the sliced scallions, soy sauce and vinegar. Stir to combine. Cover and cook, stirring once or twice, until the vegetables are just tender, about 3 minutes. Add the reserved eggs and hoisin. Cook, uncovered, stirring and breaking up the scrambled eggs, until heated through, 1 to 2 minutes. Stir in the remaining scallions and remove from the heat. ; name: ginger pear martini ; ingredients: vodka, simple syrup, pear liqueur, ice, limes, juice of, pear, superfine sugar ; preparation:Chill four martini glasses. Peel, core and slice the pear. Combine the vodka, syrup, liquer, ice and lime juice in a cocktail shaker and shake vigorously. Dip the rims of the chilled glasses in the sugar. Pour the cocktails and garnish the glasses with pear slices. ; name: flogeres sweet cheese phyllo rolls ; ingredients: cream cheese, fresh ricotta, cottage cheese, caster sugar, phyllo pastry, unsalted butter, ground cinnamon ; preparation:Using an electric mixer, beat cream cheese until light and fluffy, then add ricotta, cottage cheese and sugar and beat until well combined. Working with 4 sheets of filo at a time, place a sheet of filo on a work surface, brush lightly with melted butter, then top with another pastry sheet. Continue brushing and layering until there are 4 layers. Cut layered filo into four 12x18cm rectangles, then place one rectangle, with the shortest side facing you, on a work surface and spoon 1 tbsp cheese mixture along the shortest side, leaving a 1cm border. Roll pastry into a cylinder, folding in the sides as you roll. Brush with melted butter and place on a baking paper-lined oven tray. Repeat with remaining filo, filling and butter to form 24 rolls. Bake filo rolls at 190c for 12 minutes or until crisp and golden. Dust with ground cinnamon, then serve immediately. Flogeres are best made on the day of serving. ; name: marvelous mushrooms ; ingredients: button mushrooms, olive oil, water, balsamic vinegar, dijon mustard, lemon juice ; preparation:

name: artichoke chowder ; ingredients: artichoke hearts, garlic cloves, shallot, vegetable stock, butter, milk, salt and pepper, basil, crouton ; preparation:In a skillet, saute the artichoke hearts garlic, and shallots in the stock. Set aside half the hearts and puree the rest in blender. Add the butter and milk and whip till smooth. Place in a saucepan and simmer over low heat for 20 mins. Season with salt and pepper. Fold in rest of the hearts and heat thoroughly. Garnish with basil and croutons. ; name: chocolate mousse ; ingredients: evaporated milk, vanilla extract, sugar, chocolate chips, salt, heavy whipping cream, chocolate curls, fresh strawberries ; preparation:In blender, combine the milk, vanilla, sugar, chocolate and salt. Cover and process until smooth, about 1 minute. Transfer to a large bowl. In small mixing bowl, beat cream until soft peaks form. Fold into chocolate mixture. Spoon into dessert dishes. Refrigerate until serving. Garnish with chocolate curls and strawberries, if desired. ; name: kickn quesadillas ; ingredients: cheese, vegetables, hot sauce, chicken, garlic, jalapeno, tortillas ; preparation:Take your tortillas and drop in all of your ingredients on top of it. Cheese will normally go first. If you would like to add your hot sauce, drop a tsp. Of it on top of every thing. Put into a hot pan and let cook until cheese starts to melt. Next add your second tortilla on top and flip. Let cook for about 3-8 minutes until serving. ; name: rainbow popcorn balls ; ingredients: butter, marshmallows, popped popcorn, jello gelatin ; preparation:Melt butter and marshmallows over low heat. Add jello and stir well to combine. Put popcorn in a large bowl and pour this mixture over, mixing well to be sure to coat all popcorn. When cool enough to handle, butter your hands and form into balls. Wrap balls in plastic wrap to show off the color. ; name: duchess potatoes ; ingredients: mashed potatoes, butter, salt, eggs ; preparation:Preheat oven to 450f and butter a baking dish. Combine the mashed potatoes, butter and salt with the beaten egg yolks. Pipe into balls, hearts, or other shapes using a pastry bag. Place in dish and brush with slightly beaten egg whites. Brown in oven. ; name: never fail fudge ; ingredients: sugar, evaporated milk, butter, marshmallow cream, salt, vanilla extract, walnuts, chocolate chips ; preparation:Butter one 13x9-inch pan or 2 9x9-inch pans. Combine sugar, evaporated milk, butter, marshmallow creme and salt in a 6-quart saucepan. Cook over medium heat. Boil slowly for 5 minutes, stirring constantly. Remove from heat and stir in vanilla extract, walnuts and chocolate chips. Pour into buttered pan. Makes about 5 pounds. ; name: easiest peanut butter cookies with variations ; ingredients: smooth peanut butter, sugar, egg, maple extract, semi-sweet chocolate chips, chocolate-covered toffee bits, peanuts, semi-sweet chocolate baking squares ; preparation:In a large bowl stir together peanut butter with sugar, egg and vanilla until well combined. Shape into 1-inch balls and place 1 inch apart on ungreased baking sheets, then gently flatten with the tines of the fork. Bake 325 for 15 minutes or until golden brown. Remove to wire racks to cool. For variations. Press 1 cup of either chocolate chips, toffee bits or chopped peanuts on top of the prepared cookie dough, then bake as directed. Or another variation for chocolate peanut butter cookies is. Divide the peanut butter cookie dough in half. Stir in half of the the melted baking squares into each half of the peanut butter cookie dough, then mix until combined, bake as directed. ; name: peanut butter n banana cookies sugar free ; ingredients: peanut butter, fat-free margarine, banana, egg, vanilla, all-purpose flour, splenda granular, baking soda, salt ; preparation:

name: mustard rub for pork ; ingredients: brown mustard seeds, fennel seed, coriander seeds, cumin seed, whole black peppercorn, dried thyme, dry mustard, ground ginger, coarse salt, sugar ; preparation:Place the first 5 ingrediants in a dry skillant. Place over medium heat, moving the skillet to keep seeds from burning, until aromatic, about 2 minutes. Mustard seeds will begin to pop. Transfer seeds to a spice grinder, cool slightly, and pulse until finely chopped but not powdery. Transfer to a small bowl and stir in rest of the ingrediants. ; name: peach jalapeo chutney ; ingredients: peaches, jalapenos, ginger, sugar, ground cinnamon, lemon juice ; preparation:Peel and pit all peaches. Medium dice 3 peaches and place in bowl and set aside. Pure the remaining peaches in a blender. Pour mixture into a medium saucepan with jalapeos, ginger, sugar, cinnamon, and lemon juice. Bring pan to medium heat and reduce mixture, stirring occasionally, until thick for about 5 to 6 minutes. Pour diced peaches into saucepan and cook, stirring occasionally, for 3 minutes or until mixture is hot. Remove and set aside. ; name: bruschetta with tomatoes and basil ; ingredients: italian bread, garlic cloves, extra virgin olive oil, tomatoes, fresh basil leaf, salt, fresh ground black pepper ; preparation:Prepare a medium-hot charcoal fire or preheat the broiler. Place on grill or under the broiler the slices of bread. Grill or broil, turning once, until golden brown, about 3 minutes each side. Remove from the heat and rub the surface with 2 large cloves of garlic. Brush with 3-4 t of the olive oil. Combine the tomatoes, basil leaves, salt and pepper in bowl. Divide the tomato among the brushetta and serve immediately. ; name: portabella burgers with aioli ; ingredients: portabella mushrooms, gouda cheese, olive oil, garlic cloves, hamburger buns, light mayonnaise, italian seasoning, dijon mustard, dill weed ; preparation:First make the aioli sauce. Just add all the aioli ingredients and whisk together. Chill for approximately 20 minutes. Then lightly clean the portobello mushrooms and remove the stems. Mix the olive oil and garlic and brush all over mushrooms. Broil mushrooms for 3-5 minutes with rib side down. Turn over and top with cheese. Broil an additional 3 minutes. Place on hamburger bun and top with aloe or anything you would prefer. Put on a bib as these burgers are extremely juicy. And enjoy. ; name: roasted butternut squash ; ingredients: butternut squash, butter, maple syrup, nutmeg, fresh ground black pepper ; preparation:Preheat the oven to 400f. Place butternut squash halves on a large baking sheet with the cut side up. Divide the butter pieces among all 6 halves, smearing it all over the cut side of the squash. Drizzle each half with maple syrup and season with freshly grated nutmeg and ground black pepper. Roast the squash for 40-60 minutes or, until the flesh is tender when poked with a fork. You can serve each person a whole half each or you can scoop out the flesh into a serving bowl, whatever makes you and yours happy. ; name: edith gump s french onion soup ; ingredients: butter, white onions, beef broth, salt, garlic powder, parmesan cheese, french bread, swiss cheese, mozzarella cheese ; preparation:Saut onions in melted butter in a large soup pot or saucepan for 15 to 20 minutes or until onions begin to brown and turn transparent. Add beef broth, salt and garlic powder to onions. Bring mixture to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer uncovered for 1 hour. Add the grated parmesan cheese in the last 10 minutes of cooking the soup. When soup is done, preheat oven to 350 degrees and toast the french bread slices for about 10 to 12 minutes or until they begin to brown. When bread is done, set oven to broil. Build each serving of soup by spooning about 1 cup of soup into an oven-safe bowl. Float a toasted slice or two of bread on top of the soup, then add a slice of swiss cheese on top of that. Place a slice of mozzarella on next and sprinkle 1 tablespoon of shredded parmesan cheese over the top of the other cheeses. Place the soup bowl on a baking sheet and broil for 5 to 6 minutes or until the cheese begins to brown. ; name: chicken fettuccine with spinach ; ingredients: boneless skinless chicken breast, frozen spinach, cooked fettuccine, butter, onion, basil, minced garlic cloves, red pepper flakes, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Melt butter in skillet over medium heat. Add onion, basil, garlic and pepper flakes. Cook until onion is tender about 7 minutes. Add chicken and saute, stirring often. Mix in uncooked spinach. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Heat until spinach is heated through. Place fettucini in bowl and toss with some of pan dripping. Add chicken and toss with parmesan cheese. ; name: lebanese tomato salsa banadurah harrah ; ingredients: tomatoes, extra virgin olive oil, garlic cloves, cayenne pepper, dried mint ; preparation:

name: chicken with lime and capers ; ingredients: boneless skinless chicken breasts, butter, olive oil, salt, garlic cloves, chicken bouillon cube, hot water, fresh lime juice, capers, cooked rice ; preparation:Heat butter and oil in a skillet. Add chicken. Sprinkle salt over chicken as it cooks. When the chicken is almost completely cooked, add the garlic. While the chicken is cooking, dissolve the bouillon cube in water. Add the lime juice, capers and caper juice to the chicken. Stir in the chicken bouillon. Cover and simmer while you cook the rice. Serve hot over the rice. ; name: coffee brined chicken breasts ; ingredients: kosher salt, brown sugar, water, lemons, black peppercorns, mustard seeds, coriander seed, strong coffee, boneless skinless chicken breasts, butter ; preparation:Combine the brine ingredients, except coffee in a saucepan, heat until sugar and salt dissolve pour into a large bowl, stir in coffee, refrigerate until cool. Add chicken and use a small plate to keep it submerged 2-3 hours. Heat grill to high. Remove chicken from brine, blot with paper towels, and brush with oil or butter on both sides grill 4-8 minutes, moving halfway to create grill marks. Turn over and grill 4-6 minutes more until done. ; name: mr foods crunchy chicken ; ingredients: pecans, parmesan cheese, garlic salt, dried basil, lemon juice, whole chicken breasts, olive oil ; preparation:In a large shallow dish combine pecans, cheese, garlic salt and basil. Place lemon juice in another shallow dish. Dip chicken in juice, then coat with pecan mix. In a large nonstick skillet, heat oil over medium high heat. Add chicken. Cook 3-5 minutes on each side or until golden and cooked through. ; name: wine marinade for poultry and pork ; ingredients: dry white wine, olive oil, rosemary, thyme, marjoram, parsley, salt, pepper, pork ; preparation:Combine the marinade ingredients in a large non-reactive bowl or one gallon food storage bag. Add the meat or poultry. Turn to coat all sides. Cover or seal tightly. Marinate for at least 6 hours or overnight, turning occasionally. Cooked in preferred method. ; name: bucatini with pancetta and tomatoes ; ingredients: bucatini pasta, olive oil, onions, pancetta, canned tomatoes, bocconcini, green onion ; preparation:Add pasta to large pot of boiling water. Boil uncovered until tender. Drain. Heat oil in pan, add onions and pancetta. Cook, stirring until onions are soft. Add tomatoes, stir over heat for 2 minutes then add cheese and pasta. Stir until heated through. Top with chopped green onion. ; name: stove top cream cheese and velveeta mac and cheese ; ingredients: macaroni noodles, velveeta cheese, cream cheese, butter, flour, milk, sharp cheddar cheese, salt, white pepper ; preparation:Boil noodles and drain. While boiling, melt butter in saucepan on low -medium slowly add the flour well continuously stirring. Slowly add the milk will continuously stirring. Add the cheeses, salt and white pepper, increase heat to medium while continuously stirring until all cheese is melted. Remove from heat and let cool 10 minutes. Poor over noodles and mix well. ; name: grandma s pecan pie ; ingredients: eggs, light corn syrup, vanilla, white sugar, butter, pecans, 9 inch pie shell ; preparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Mix all ingredients, except pecans and pie crust, together. Pour into unbaked pie crust. Top with pecan halves. Bake until done. ; name: kahlua chocolate pecan pie ; ingredients: sugar, eggs, kahlua, pecan pieces, flour, butter, semi-sweet chocolate chips, deep dish pie shell ; preparation:

name: african beans and potatoes ; ingredients: dried pinto beans, potatoes, celery, salt, sweet onion ; preparation:Cook beans until tender. Add potatoes and celery to beans and cook until potatoes are tender. I cut mine into large cubes and it took about 4 minutes. Salt to taste. Saute onion until browned. Mix in with beans and potatoes. ; name: baked cheese sandwiches ; ingredients: bread, butter, mustard, velveeta cheese, eggs, milk, salt, pepper ; preparation:Butter both sides of bread. Lay 8 slices in a 9x13 inch pan. Spread mustard on top. Cover each slice with velveeta cheese. Cover with remaining bread slices. In seperate bowl mix together eggs, milk, salt and pepper. Mix well. Pour over bread and place in refrigerator overnight, or for at least 6 hours. Bake at 325 degrees for 1 hour. Cut into serving size pieces and serve hot. ; name: beef noodle bake ; ingredients: ground beef, onion, green pepper, tomato sauce, seasoning salt, pepper, cream-style cottage cheese, cream cheese, medium noodles ; preparation:Cook beef, onion and pepper in skillet until meat is browned and vegetables are tender. Drain. Stir in tomato sauce, seasoned salt, and pepper. Blend cottage cheese and cream cheese together until fluffy. Spoon noodles into grease 10x6x2 inch baking dish. Spread cheese mixture over noodles. Pour meat sauce on top. Bake uncovered at 350 for 30 to 40 minutes or until heated through. ; name: garlicky french fries ; ingredients: frozen french fries, vegetable oil, salt, cooking spray, butter, garlic cloves, fresh parsley, parmesan cheese ; preparation:Preheat oven to 400. Combine first 3 ingredients in a large zip-top plastic bag, tossing to coat. Arrange potatoes in a single layer on a baking sheet coated with cooking spray. Bake at 400 for 20 minutes or until potatoes are tender and golden brown, turning after 10 minutes. Place butter and garlic in a large nonstick skillet. Cook over low heat 2 minutes, stirring constantly. Add potatoes, parsley, and cheese to pan. Toss to coat. Serve immediately. ; name: shredded brussels sprouts with bacon and onions ; ingredients: bacon, yellow onion, salt, water, dijon mustard, brussels sprout, cider vinegar ; preparation:Cook bacon in a large skillet over medium heat until crisp. Drain on paper towels, then crumble. Add onion and salt to the drippings in the pan and cook over medium heat, stirring often, until tender and browned. Add water and mustard, scraping up any browned bits, then add brussels sprouts and cook, stirring often, until tender. Stir in vinegar and top with the crumbled bacon. ; name: raisin and bran muffins ; ingredients: wheat bran, milk, egg substitute, canola oil, unbleached white flour, sugar, baking powder, salt, raisins ; preparation:Preheat the oven to 400f. Combine the wheat bran and milk in a mixing bowl. Let stand 2 minutes or until most of the moisture is absorbed. Add the egg and oil. Beat until well blended. Sift together the flour, sugar, baking powder and salt. Add the dry ingredients to the bran mixture and stir just until all are moistened. Fold in raisins, but do not over mix. Spoon the batter into oiled muffin cups and bake 25 minutes or until lightly browned. Serve hot. ; name: cod with fennel mushrooms tomato dill ; ingredients: vegetable oil cooking spray, red onion, mushroom, fennel bulb, cod, tomatoes, lemon, salt, pepper, dried dill ; preparation:Season cod with salt and pepper and squeese 2 lemon wedges over. Set aside. Spray nonstick frypan with veggie spray, heat over high heat, add mushrooms, fennel and onion, reserving 4 onion slices. Cook stirring until onions are soft, about 5 minutes. Reduce heat to medium. Place the 4 pieces of cod on top of the veggies. Place one slice of tomato on top each piece of cod and one slice of reserved onion slices on top of tomato. Sprinkle with dill and squeese 2 more wedges of lemon over all. Cover and simmer until cod is cooked through and flakes easily with a fork, about 15 minutes. Garnish with remaining lemon wedges and sprigs of fennel leaves. ; name: portuguese apple cake ; ingredients: flour, sugar, oil, milk, eggs, baking powder, vanilla, apples, cinnamon ; preparation:
